2:37:19/Each branch had three almond-shaped bowls, each with a bud and a flower, matching the pattern across all six branches extending from the lampstand.
2:37:20/The lampstand itself had four almond-shaped bowls, complete with buds and flowers.
2:37:21/There was a bud under each pair of branches, consistent for all six branches extending from the lampstand.
2:37:22/The buds and branches were all of one piece with the lampstand, all hammered from pure gold.
2:37:23/He crafted its seven lamps, as well as its wick trimmers and trays, out of pure gold.
2:37:24/He used a talent of pure gold for the lampstand and all its accessories.
2:37:25/He constructed the altar of incense from acacia wood; it was a cubit long, a cubit wide, square, and two cubits high, with horns of the same piece.
2:37:26/He covered it with pure gold, its top, sides all around, and its horns, and made a gold crown around it.
2:37:27/He made two gold rings for it below its crown on two opposite sides as holders for the poles to carry it.
2:37:28/He made the poles from acacia wood and covered them with gold.
2:37:29/He prepared the holy anointing oil and the pure, fragrant incense, following the recipe of a perfumer.
2:38:1/He constructed the altar of burnt offering from acacia wood: it was five cubits long and five cubits wide, forming a square, and it stood three cubits high.
2:38:2/He added horns at each of the four corners, made from the same material, and covered the whole thing in bronze.
2:38:3/He crafted all the altar's equipment, including pots, shovels, basins, meat hooks, and firepans, all out of bronze.
2:38:4/For the altar, he made a bronze grate as a network underneath, extending halfway up.
2:38:5/He cast four rings at the four corners of the bronze grate to hold the poles.
2:38:6/The poles were made of acacia wood and covered in bronze.
2:38:7/He inserted the poles through the rings on the sides of the altar to carry it; the altar was hollow, made with boards.
2:38:8/He constructed the basin and its stand from bronze, using the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
2:38:9/He built the courtyard: on the south side, the curtains were made of finely twisted linen, 100 cubits long.
2:38:10/There were twenty pillars with twenty bronze bases; the hooks of the pillars and their bands were made of silver.
2:38:11/On the north side, the curtains were 100 cubits long, with twenty pillars and twenty bronze bases; the hooks of the pillars and their bands were silver.
2:38:12/On the west side, the curtains were fifty cubits long, with ten pillars and ten bases; the hooks of the pillars and their bands were silver.
2:38:13/And for the east side, the curtains were fifty cubits long.
2:38:14/The curtains for one side of the gate were fifteen cubits long, with three pillars and three bases.
2:38:15/On the other side, the curtains were also fifteen cubits long, with three pillars and three bases.
2:38:16/All the curtains surrounding the courtyard were made of finely twisted linen.
2:38:17/The bases for the pillars were bronze; the hooks of the pillars and their bands were silver; the tops of the pillars were covered with silver; and all the pillars of the courtyard were banded with silver.
2:38:18/The curtain for the courtyard gate was made of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely twisted linen, crafted in embroidery. It was twenty cubits long and five cubits high, matching the curtains of the courtyard.
2:38:19/Its four pillars had four bronze bases; their hooks were silver, and the tops of the pillars and their bands were covered with silver.
2:38:20/All the pegs for the tabernacle and for the surrounding courtyard were made of bronze.
2:38:21/This is the inventory of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the covenant law, as recorded at Moses' command. It was the responsibility of the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest.
2:38:22/Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything the LORD commanded Moses.
2:38:23/And with him was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, a skilled craftsman, and a weaver in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen.
2:38:24/The total amount of gold used for the work in all the holy place was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred and thirty shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
2:38:25/The silver from those of the community who were counted was one hundred talents and one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels, by the sanctuary shekel.
2:38:26/A beka per person, that is, half a shekel, according to the sanctuary shekel, from everyone who had passed through the counting, from twenty years old and up, totaling six hundred three thousand five hundred and fifty men.
2:38:27/From the hundred talents of silver, the bases for the sanctuary and for the curtain were cast—hundred bases from the hundred talents, a talent for each base.
2:38:28/And from the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, he made hooks for the pillars, covered their tops, and banded them.
2:38:29/The bronze from the offering was seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels.
2:38:30/With it, he made the bases for the entrance to the tent of meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grate for it, and all the utensils for the altar,
2:38:31/As well as the bases around the courtyard, the bases for the courtyard gate, and all the pegs for the tabernacle and for the courtyard surrounding it.
2:39:1/They crafted cloths of service from blue, purple, and scarlet materials, creating the sacred garments for Aaron to serve in the holy place, following the LORD's instructions to Moses.
2:39:2/He crafted the ephod using gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and finely twisted linen.
2:39:3/They hammered the gold into thin sheets and cut it into wires to incorporate it into the blue, purple, scarlet, and fine linen with skilled craftsmanship.
2:39:4/They made shoulder pieces for it, connecting them together at the two edges.
2:39:5/The intricately designed belt of the ephod, which was part of it, was made from the same materials: gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and finely twisted linen, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:39:6/They crafted onyx stones set in gold settings, engraved like seals with the names of the sons of Israel.
2:39:7/He placed them on the ephod's shoulders as memorial stones for the sons of Israel, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:39:8/He created the breastplate with skilled craftsmanship, matching the ephod's design, using gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and finely twisted linen.
2:39:9/It was square and folded double; a span in length and a span in width when doubled.
2:39:10/They set four rows of stones in it: the first row had a ruby, a topaz, and a beryl; this was the first row.
2:39:11/The second row had an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
2:39:12/The third row had a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst.
2:39:13/The fourth row had a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper; they were set in gold filigree settings.
2:39:14/The stones corresponded to the names of the sons of Israel, twelve according to their names, engraved like seals, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.
2:39:15/They made chains for the breastplate, twisted like cords, out of pure gold.
2:39:16/They crafted two gold settings and two gold rings, attaching the rings to the two ends of the breastplate.
2:39:17/They attached the two gold chains to the rings at the corners of the breastplate.
2:39:18/They fastened the other ends of the two chains to the two settings, attaching them to the ephod's shoulder pieces at the front.
2:39:19/They made two gold rings and attached them to the two ends of the breastplate, on its inner edge, next to the ephod.
2:39:20/They made two more gold rings and attached them to the ephod's lower part, near the seam above the ephod's intricately woven belt.
2:39:21/They tied the breastplate to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord, so it would lie above the ephod's intricately woven belt and not swing out from the ephod, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
2:39:22/He made the robe of the ephod entirely of blue woven fabric.
2:39:23/There was an opening in the center of the robe, like the neck of a body armor, with a band around the opening so it wouldn't tear.
2:39:24/They added pomegranates made of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and finely twisted linen around the hem of the robe.
2:39:25/They made bells of pure gold and placed the bells between the pomegranates around the hem of the robe, all around between the pomegranates;
2:39:26/A bell and a pomegranate alternated around the hem of the robe for ministering, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
2:39:27/They made tunics of finely woven linen for Aaron and his sons,
2:39:28/And a turban of fine linen, elegant headbands of fine linen, and undergarments of finely twisted linen,
2:39:29/And a sash of finely twisted linen, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, done in embroidery, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
2:39:30/They made the plate of the sacred diadem of pure gold and inscribed it with the inscription, "Holy to the LORD."
2:39:31/They attached a blue cord to it to fasten it on the turban, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
2:39:32/So all the work on the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, was completed. The Israelites did everything just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
2:39:33/They brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent and all its furnishings, its clasps, frames, crossbars, posts, and bases;
2:39:34/The coverings of ram skins dyed red, the coverings of another material, and the protective curtain,
2:39:35/The ark of the covenant law with its poles and the atonement cover,
2:39:36/The table with all its articles and the bread of the Presence,
2:39:37/The pure gold lampstand with its array of lamps and all its accessories, and the oil for lighting,
2:39:38/The gold altar, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the curtain for the entrance to the tent,
2:39:39/The bronze altar with its bronze grating, its poles, and all its utensils, the basin with its stand,
2:39:40/The curtains of the courtyard with its posts and bases, and the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard, its ropes, and tent pegs, and all the equipment for the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting,
2:39:41/The woven garments for ministering in the sanctuary, both the sacred garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons to serve as priests.
2:39:42/In accordance with all that the LORD had commanded Moses, so the Israelites had done all the work.
2:39:43/When Moses saw that they had done all the work exactly as the LORD had commanded, he blessed them.
2:40:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
2:40:2/On the first day of the first month, you shall set up the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
2:40:3/You shall place the ark of the covenant inside, and cover the ark with the curtain.
2:40:4/You shall bring in the table and arrange the items that are to be placed on it; you shall also bring in the lampstand and light its lamps.
2:40:5/You shall place the gold altar for incense before the ark of the covenant, and set up the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
2:40:6/You shall place the altar of burnt offering in front of the entrance to the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
2:40:7/You shall place the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar, and fill it with water.
2:40:8/You shall set up the courtyard around it, and hang the curtain at the courtyard entrance.
2:40:9/You shall take the anointing oil, anoint the tabernacle and everything in it, and consecrate it and all its furnishings; it will be holy.
2:40:10/You shall anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and consecrate the altar; it will be most holy.
2:40:11/You shall anoint the basin and its stand, and consecrate them.
2:40:12/You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
2:40:13/You shall put the sacred garments on Aaron, anoint him, and consecrate him, so he may serve me as a priest.
2:40:14/You shall bring his sons and dress them in tunics.
2:40:15/You shall anoint them as you anointed their father, so they may serve me as priests; their anointing will indeed establish a priesthood that will continue throughout their generations.
2:40:16/Thus Moses did everything as the LORD commanded him, so he did.
2:40:17/And it happened in the first month of the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was erected.
2:40:18/Moses erected the tabernacle, secured its bases, set up its frames, inserted its bars, and raised its pillars.
2:40:19/He spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent on top of it, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:40:20/He took the covenant law and placed it in the ark, attached the poles to the ark, and put the atonement cover on top of the ark.
2:40:21/He brought the ark into the tabernacle, set up the curtain shield, and shielded the ark of the covenant, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:40:22/He placed the table in the tent of meeting on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the curtain.
2:40:23/He arranged the bread on it before the LORD, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:40:24/He placed the lampstand in the tent of meeting opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle.
2:40:25/He lit the lamps before the LORD, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:40:26/He placed the gold altar in the tent of meeting in front of the curtain.
2:40:27/He burned fragrant incense on it, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:40:28/He set up the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
2:40:29/He placed the altar of burnt offering near the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting and offered on it the burnt offering and the grain offering, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:40:30/He placed the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it for washing.
2:40:31/Moses, Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and feet there.
2:40:32/Whenever they entered the tent of meeting or approached the altar, they washed, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
2:40:33/He erected the courtyard around the tabernacle and the altar and set up the curtain at the courtyard entrance. Thus Moses completed the work.
2:40:34/Then a cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
2:40:35/Moses could not enter the tent of meeting because the cloud had settled on it, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
2:40:36/Whenever the cloud lifted from above the tabernacle, the Israelites set out on all their journeys.
2:40:37/But if the cloud did not lift, they did not set out until the day it lifted.
2:40:38/For the cloud of the LORD was over the tabernacle by day, and fire was in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the Israelites during all their travels.
3:1:1/The LORD called to Moses and spoke to him from the tabernacle of meeting, saying,
3:1:2/Tell the Israelites, if anyone wants to present an offering to the LORD, you must bring your offering from the cattle, including the herd and the flock.
3:1:3/If the offering is a burnt sacrifice from the herd, it must be a flawless male. It should be offered willingly at the entrance of the tabernacle of meeting before the LORD.
3:1:4/He must place his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted on his behalf to make atonement for him.
3:1:5/He must slaughter the bull before the LORD, and Aaron's sons, the priests, will present the blood and sprinkle it around the altar at the entrance of the tabernacle of meeting.
3:1:6/He must skin the burnt offering and cut it into pieces.
3:1:7/Aaron's sons, the priests, will put fire on the altar and arrange the wood on the fire.
3:1:8/The priests, Aaron's sons, will arrange the pieces, including the head and the fat, on the wood that is burning on the altar.
3:1:9/He must wash the internal organs and the legs with water, and the priest will burn everything on the altar as a burnt offering, a fire offering of a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
3:1:10/If the offering is from the flock, either sheep or goats, for a burnt sacrifice, it must be a flawless male.
3:1:11/He must slaughter it at the north side of the altar before the LORD, and Aaron's sons, the priests, will sprinkle its blood around the altar.
3:1:12/He must cut it into pieces, along with its head and fat, and the priest will arrange them on the wood that is burning on the altar.
3:1:13/He must wash the internal organs and the legs with water, and the priest will offer it all and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt offering, a fire offering of a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
3:1:14/If the burnt offering to the LORD is of birds, then he must bring his offering of turtledoves or young pigeons.
3:1:15/The priest will bring it to the altar, wring off its head, and burn it on the altar; its blood must be drained out at the side of the altar.
3:1:16/He must remove its crop with its feathers and throw it beside the altar on the east side, at the place for ashes.
3:1:17/He must split it open at the wings but not sever it completely, and the priest will burn it on the altar, on the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt offering, a fire offering of a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
3:2:1/When someone wants to present a grain offering to the LORD, it should consist of fine flour. They must pour oil on it and add frankincense.
3:2:2/They must bring it to Aaron's sons, the priests. The priest will take a handful of the flour and oil, along with all the frankincense, and burn it on the altar as a memorial offering. It's a fire offering, pleasing to the LORD.
3:2:3/The rest of the grain offering belongs to Aaron and his sons. It is most sacred among the LORD's fire offerings.
3:2:4/If you present a grain offering that's baked in an oven, it should be unleavened loaves made of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers spread with oil.
3:2:5/If your offering is a grain offering prepared on a griddle, it should be made of fine flour, unleavened and mixed with oil.
3:2:6/Break it into pieces and pour oil on it. It's a grain offering.
3:2:7/If your offering is a grain offering cooked in a pan, it should be made of fine flour and oil.
3:2:8/You must bring the grain offering made in these ways to the LORD. When it's presented to the priest, he'll take it to the altar.
3:2:9/The priest will take a portion of the grain offering as a memorial and burn it on the altar. It's a fire offering, pleasing to the LORD.
3:2:10/What's left of the grain offering belongs to Aaron and his sons. It is most sacred among the LORD's fire offerings.
3:2:11/Any grain offering you bring to the LORD must not contain yeast. You must not burn any yeast or honey in any of the LORD's fire offerings.
3:2:12/When you offer the first fruits as an offering to the LORD, they should not be burned on the altar for a pleasing aroma.
3:2:13/Season every grain offering with salt. Do not let the salt of the covenant with your God be missing from your grain offering. With all your offerings, you must offer salt.
3:2:14/If you offer a grain offering of your first fruits to the LORD, present crushed new grain roasted by fire, fine grains from fresh ears.
3:2:15/Pour oil on it and place frankincense on it. It's a grain offering.
3:2:16/The priest will burn part of the crushed grain and some of the oil, along with all the frankincense, as a memorial. It's a fire offering to the LORD.
3:3:1/If someone's offering is a peace offering from the herd, whether a male or female, they must present it without any defects before the LORD.
3:3:2/They must place their hand on the head of the offering and slaughter it at the entrance of the tent of meeting. Then Aaron's sons, the priests, will sprinkle its blood all around the altar.
3:3:3/They must present a portion of the peace offering as a fire offering to the LORD; this includes the fat covering the internal organs and all the fat on the internal organs,
3:3:4/As well as the two kidneys and the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which they must remove along with the kidneys.
3:3:5/Aaron's sons will burn it on the altar on top of the burnt offering, which is on the wood on the fire. It is a fire offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
3:3:6/If someone's offering for a peace offering to the LORD is from the flock, whether male or female, they must present it without any defects.
3:3:7/If they offer a lamb for their offering, they must present it before the LORD.
3:3:8/They must place their hand on the head of their offering and slaughter it in front of the tent of meeting. Aaron's sons will then sprinkle its blood around the altar.
3:3:9/They must offer a portion of the peace offering as a fire offering to the LORD; this includes its fat and the entire tail, which they must remove close to the backbone, as well as the fat covering the internal organs and all the fat on the internal organs,
3:3:10/And the two kidneys and the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which they must remove along with the kidneys.
3:3:11/The priest will burn it on the altar as food for the fire offering to the LORD.
3:3:12/If their offering is a goat, they must present it before the LORD.
3:3:13/They must place their hand on its head and slaughter it in front of the tent of meeting. Aaron's sons will then sprinkle its blood around the altar.
3:3:14/They must offer a portion of it as a fire offering to the LORD; this includes the fat covering the internal organs and all the fat on the internal organs,
3:3:15/And the two kidneys and the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which they must remove along with the kidneys.
3:3:16/The priest will burn them on the altar as food for the fire offering, a pleasing aroma. All the fat belongs to the LORD.
3:3:17/This is to be a lasting ordinance for your generations wherever you live: you must not eat any fat or any blood.
3:4:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:4:2/Tell the Israelites, if anyone unintentionally sins by breaking any of the LORD's commands about things they shouldn't do, and they do it anyway:
3:4:3/If the anointed priest sins, bringing guilt on the people, then he must bring a young, flawless bull to the LORD as a sin offering for the sin he committed.
3:4:4/He must bring the bull to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting before the LORD, lay his hand on the bull's head, and slaughter it in the LORD's presence.
3:4:5/Then the anointed priest must take some of the bull's blood into the Tent of Meeting.
3:4:6/The priest must dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle it seven times before the LORD, in front of the curtain of the sanctuary.
3:4:7/The priest must put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of fragrant incense before the LORD, which is in the Tent of Meeting, and pour out the rest of the bull's blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
3:4:8/He must remove all the fat from the bull of the sin offering; the fat that covers the internal organs, and all the fat that is attached to them,
3:4:9/And the two kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which he will remove with the kidneys,
3:4:10/Just as these are removed from the bull of the fellowship offering, and the priest must burn them on the altar of burnt offering.
3:4:11/And the bull's skin, all its meat, its head, legs, internal organs, and waste,
3:4:12/Must be carried outside the camp to a clean place where the ashes are poured out, and burned on a wood fire; it must be burned where the ashes are poured out.
3:4:13/If the entire Israelite community sins unintentionally and the matter escapes the notice of the assembly, and they do something against any of the LORD's commands that should not be done, they are guilty.
3:4:14/When the sin they have committed becomes known, the assembly must bring a young bull as a sin offering and present it before the Tent of Meeting.
3:4:15/The elders of the community must lay their hands on the bull's head before the LORD, and the bull must be slaughtered before the LORD.
3:4:16/The anointed priest must bring some of the bull's blood into the Tent of Meeting,
3:4:17/And the priest must dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle it seven times before the LORD, in front of the curtain.
3:4:18/He must put some of the blood on the horns of the altar that is before the LORD in the Tent of Meeting, and pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
3:4:19/He must remove all its fat and burn it on the altar.
3:4:20/He must do with this bull just as he did with the bull for the sin offering; in this way the priest will make atonement for them, and they will be forgiven.
3:4:21/Then he must take the bull outside the camp and burn it as he burned the first bull; it is a sin offering for the community.
3:4:22/When a leader sins unintentionally and does something against any of the commands of the LORD his God that should not be done, and is guilty,
3:4:23/Or if his sin that he has committed is made known to him, he must bring as his offering a male goat without any defects.
3:4:24/He must lay his hand on the goat's head and slaughter it at the place where they slaughter the burnt offering before the LORD; it is a sin offering.
3:4:25/The priest must take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out the rest of its blood at the base of the altar.
3:4:26/He must burn all its fat on the altar, like the fat of the fellowship offerings. Thus the priest will make atonement for him for his sin, and he will be forgiven.
3:4:27/If any member of the community sins unintentionally and does something against any of the LORD's commands that should not be done, and is guilty,
3:4:28/Or if his sin that he has committed is made known to him, he must bring as his offering a female goat without any defects for the sin he has committed.
3:4:29/He must lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter the sin offering at the place of the burnt offering.
3:4:30/The priest must take some of its blood with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out all the rest of its blood at the base of the altar.
3:4:31/He must remove all its fat, just as the fat is removed from the fellowship offering, and the priest must burn it on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the LORD. In this way, the priest will make atonement for him, and he will be forgiven.
3:4:32/If he brings a lamb as his sin offering, he must bring a female without any defects.
3:4:33/He must lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter it for a sin offering at the place where they slaughter the burnt offering.
3:4:34/The priest must take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out all the rest of its blood at the base of the altar.
3:4:35/He must remove all its fat, just as the fat of the lamb is removed from the fellowship offering, and the priest must burn them on the altar, on top of the offerings made by fire to the LORD. In this way, the priest will make atonement for the sin he has committed, and he will be forgiven.
3:5:1/If someone sins by hearing a call to testify about something they've seen or know about and they fail to report it, they will be held responsible for their sin.
3:5:2/Or if someone touches anything unclean, whether it's the dead body of an unclean animal, livestock, or a small creature, and they are unaware of it at the time; they too will be unclean and guilty.
3:5:3/Or if they touch any human impurity, whatever the source of impurity that a person can become contaminated with, and it is unknown to them at the time; when they become aware, they will be guilty.
3:5:4/Or if someone makes a rash promise, whether to do something bad or good, any kind of oath people might swear, and they are unaware of it at the time; when they realize it, they will be guilty of one of these offenses.
3:5:5/When someone is guilty of any of these things, they must confess the sin they have committed.
3:5:6/They must bring a guilt offering to the LORD for the sin they have committed, a female lamb or goat from the flock as a sin offering; and the priest will make atonement for them for their sin.
3:5:7/If they cannot afford a lamb, they must bring two doves or two young pigeons to the LORD as a penalty for their sin—one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering.
3:5:8/They are to bring them to the priest, who will first offer the one for the sin offering. He is to wring its head from its neck without severing it completely.
3:5:9/He is to sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar; the rest of the blood must be drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering.
3:5:10/Then he is to offer the second bird as a burnt offering according to the prescribed manner. The priest will make atonement for them for the sin they have committed, and they will be forgiven.
3:5:11/But if they cannot afford two doves or two young pigeons, they must bring as their offering for the sin they have committed a tenth of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering. They must not put oil or incense on it, because it is a sin offering.
3:5:12/They are to bring it to the priest, who will take a handful of it as a memorial portion and burn it on the altar on top of the offerings made by fire to the LORD. It is a sin offering.
3:5:13/The priest will make atonement for them for the sin they have committed in any of these ways, and they will be forgiven. The rest of the offering will belong to the priest, as with the grain offering.
3:5:14/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:5:15/If someone commits a sin by unintentionally defiling the LORD's holy things, they must bring a ram without defect from the flock, valued in silver shekels, as a guilt offering to the LORD.
3:5:16/They must make restitution for what they have done wrong in regard to the holy thing, and add a fifth of its value to it and give it to the priest. The priest will make atonement for them with the ram of the guilt offering, and they will be forgiven.
3:5:17/If someone sins by doing something prohibited by the LORD's commands, even if they are unaware of it, they are guilty and will be held responsible.
3:5:18/They must bring to the priest a ram without defect from the flock, valued according to the prescribed amount, as a guilt offering. The priest will make atonement for them for the unintentional sin they committed without knowing it, and they will be forgiven.
3:5:19/It is a guilt offering; they have indeed been guilty of wrongdoing against the LORD.
3:6:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:6:2/If someone sins by betraying the LORD and lies to their neighbor about something entrusted to them, or about a partnership, or about something taken by force, or if they have cheated their neighbor;
3:6:3/Or if they find something lost and lie about it, or swear falsely about any of these things that someone might do, thereby sinning in the process;
3:6:4/Then, because they have sinned and are guilty, they must return what they took by force, or what they obtained by deceit, or what was entrusted to them, or the lost item they found,
3:6:5/Or anything about which they have sworn falsely. They must fully repay the value, add a fifth more to it, and give it to the rightful owner on the day they present their guilt offering.
3:6:6/They must bring their guilt offering to the LORD: a ram without defect from the flock, valued according to your assessment, as a guilt offering to the priest.
3:6:7/And the priest shall make atonement for them before the LORD, and they will be forgiven for any of the things they might have done to become guilty.
3:6:8/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:6:9/Instruct Aaron and his sons, saying, 'This is the law of the burnt offering: The burnt offering shall remain on the altar hearth throughout the night until morning, while the fire of the altar is kept burning on it.
3:6:10/The priest shall wear his linen robe, and he shall wear linen undergarments next to his body. He shall remove the ashes of the burnt offering that the fire has consumed on the altar and place them beside the altar.
3:6:11/Then he shall remove his garments, put on others, and take the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.
3:6:12/The fire on the altar must be kept burning; it must not go out. Every morning the priest shall add wood to it, arrange the burnt offering on it, and burn the fat of the peace offerings on it.
3:6:13/The fire must always be burning on the altar; it must never go out.
3:6:14/This is the law of the grain offering: Aaron's sons shall present it before the LORD, in front of the altar.
3:6:15/He shall take a handful of the fine flour of the grain offering, together with its oil and all the incense on the grain offering, and burn this as a memorial portion on the altar, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
3:6:16/The rest of it Aaron and his sons shall eat. It must be eaten without yeast in a holy place; they shall eat it in the courtyard of the tent of meeting.
3:6:17/It must not be baked with yeast. I have assigned it as their share of my offerings made by fire; it is most holy, like the sin offering and the guilt offering.
3:6:18/All the males among the descendants of Aaron may eat it. It is a perpetual statute throughout your generations from the LORD's offerings made by fire. Anyone who touches them will become holy.
3:6:19/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:6:20/This is the offering Aaron and his sons are to bring to the LORD on the day he is anointed: a tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a regular grain offering, half in the morning and half in the evening.
3:6:21/It shall be prepared with oil on a griddle; bring it well-mixed and present the grain offering broken in pieces as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
3:6:22/The priest from among Aaron's sons, who is anointed to succeed him, shall offer it. It is a perpetual statute: it shall be wholly burned to the LORD.
3:6:23/Every grain offering of a priest shall be wholly burned; it shall not be eaten.
3:6:24/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:6:25/Speak to Aaron and his sons, saying, 'This is the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is killed, the sin offering shall be killed before the LORD; it is most holy.
3:6:26/The priest who offers it for sin shall eat it. It shall be eaten in a holy place, in the courtyard of the tent of meeting.
3:6:27/Anything that touches its flesh shall become holy; and when any of its blood is splashed on a garment, you shall wash that on which it was splashed in a holy place.
3:6:28/But the earthen vessel in which it is cooked shall be broken; and if it is cooked in a bronze pot, it shall be scoured and rinsed in water.
3:6:29/All the males among the priests may eat it; it is most holy.
3:6:30/No sin offering, from which any of the blood is brought into the tent of meeting to make atonement in the holy place, shall be eaten; it shall be burned in the fire.
3:7:1/This is the rule for the guilt offering: it is very sacred.
3:7:2/In the same place where they kill the burnt offering, they should kill the guilt offering. The priest must then sprinkle its blood all around on the altar.
3:7:3/He must present all its fat: the tail, and the fat covering the internal organs,
3:7:4/Both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the covering over the liver, which he must remove with the kidneys.
3:7:5/The priest will burn these parts on the altar as a fire offering to the LORD. This is a guilt offering.
3:7:6/Every male priest may eat it, but it must be eaten in a sacred place; it is very sacred.
3:7:7/The guilt offering is like the sin offering; there is one law for both. The priest who makes atonement with it gets to keep it.
3:7:8/And the priest who offers someone's burnt offering gets to keep the skin of the burnt offering he has presented.
3:7:9/Any grain offering baked in an oven, prepared on a griddle, or cooked in a pan belongs to the priest who offers it.
3:7:10/All grain offerings, whether mixed with oil or dry, belong equally to all of Aaron's sons.
3:7:11/This is the rule for the fellowship offering presented to the LORD.
3:7:12/If someone offers it to express thankfulness, then along with the thank offering of unleavened cakes mixed with oil, unleavened wafers spread with oil, and cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, and fried,
3:7:13/They must also offer loaves of leavened bread with their thanksgiving fellowship offering.
3:7:14/From each offering, they must present one of each kind as a contribution to the LORD; it will belong to the priest who sprinkles the blood of the fellowship offerings.
3:7:15/The meat of their thanksgiving fellowship offering must be eaten on the day it is offered; they must not leave any of it until morning.
3:7:16/But if the offering is a vow or a voluntary offering, it must be eaten on the day the offering is made, and any leftovers may be eaten the next day.
3:7:17/Any of the meat left until the third day must be burned up.
3:7:18/If any of the meat of the fellowship offering is eaten on the third day, it will not be accepted. It will not count for the one who offered it; it will be considered tainted, and the person who eats any of it will be held responsible.
3:7:19/Meat that touches anything unclean must not be eaten; it must be burned up. As for other meat, anyone ceremonially clean may eat it.
3:7:20/But if anyone who is unclean eats any meat of the fellowship offering belonging to the LORD, that person must be cut off from their people.
3:7:21/If anyone touches something unclean—whether human uncleanness or an unclean animal or any unclean detestable thing—and then eats any of the meat of the fellowship offering belonging to the LORD, that person must be cut off from their people.
3:7:22/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:7:23/Tell the Israelites: You must not eat any fat from an ox, sheep, or goat.
3:7:24/The fat of an animal that dies naturally or is torn by wild animals can be used for any other purpose, but you must not eat it.
3:7:25/Anyone who eats the fat of an animal from which an offering by fire is made to the LORD must be cut off from their people.
3:7:26/You must not eat any blood, whether from birds or animals, in any of your homes.
3:7:27/Anyone who eats any blood must be cut off from their people.
3:7:28/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:7:29/Tell the Israelites: Anyone who offers a fellowship offering to the LORD must bring part of it as their sacrifice to the LORD.
3:7:30/With their own hands they must bring the offerings made by fire to the LORD; they must bring the fat together with the breast, and the breast must be waved as a wave offering before the LORD.
3:7:31/The priest shall burn the fat on the altar, but the breast belongs to Aaron and his sons.
3:7:32/You must give the right thigh of your fellowship offerings to the priest as a contribution.
3:7:33/The son of Aaron who offers the blood and the fat of the fellowship offering shall have the right thigh as his portion.
3:7:34/For the wave breast and the contribution thigh, I have taken from the Israelites out of their fellowship offerings and given them to Aaron the priest and his sons as their due forever from the Israelites.
3:7:35/This is the portion from the fire offerings to the LORD for Aaron and his sons since the day they were presented to serve the LORD as priests;
3:7:36/Which the LORD commanded to be given to them by the Israelites on the day he anointed them—a lasting ordinance for their generations.
3:7:37/This is the rule for the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the ordination offering, and the fellowship offering,
3:7:38/Which the LORD commanded Moses on Mount Sinai on the day he ordered the Israelites to present their offerings to the LORD in the Desert of Sinai.
3:8:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:8:2/Bring Aaron and his sons, their garments, the anointing oil, a bull for the sin offering, two rams, and a basket of unleavened bread;
3:8:3/Gather the entire community at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
3:8:4/Moses did as the LORD instructed; the community was gathered at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
3:8:5/Moses told the community, "This is what the LORD has ordered to be done."
3:8:6/Moses brought Aaron and his sons forward and washed them with water.
3:8:7/He dressed him in the tunic, tied the sash around him, put on the robe, placed the ephod on him, and fastened the intricately woven band of the ephod around him, securing it to him.
3:8:8/He placed the breastpiece on him and put the Urim and Thummim in the breastpiece.
3:8:9/He placed the turban on his head and on the turban, right on the front, he placed the gold plate, the sacred emblem, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
3:8:10/Moses took the anointing oil and consecrated the tabernacle and everything in it, making them holy.
3:8:11/He sprinkled some on the altar seven times, anointing the altar and all its utensils, as well as the basin and its stand, to consecrate them.
3:8:12/He poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron's head and anointed him to consecrate him.
3:8:13/Moses brought Aaron's sons forward, dressed them in tunics, tied sashes around them, and put headbands on them, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
3:8:14/He presented the bull for the sin offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
3:8:15/He slaughtered it; Moses took the blood and applied it to the horns of the altar all around with his finger, purifying the altar. He poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar, consecrating it to make atonement for it.
3:8:16/He took all the fat on the internal organs, the covering of the liver, both kidneys and their fat, and Moses burned them on the altar.
3:8:17/But the bull, its hide, flesh, and waste, he burned outside the camp, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
3:8:18/He presented the ram for the burnt offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
3:8:19/He slaughtered it; Moses splashed the blood against the sides of the altar.
3:8:20/He cut the ram into pieces; Moses burned the head, the pieces, and the fat.
3:8:21/After washing the internal organs and the legs with water, Moses burned the entire ram on the altar. It was a burnt offering for a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
3:8:22/He presented the other ram, the ram of ordination, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
3:8:23/He slaughtered it; Moses took some of its blood and put it on the lobe of Aaron's right ear, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
3:8:24/He brought Aaron's sons forward and put some of the blood on the lobes of their right ears, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet. Moses then splashed the blood against the sides of the altar.
3:8:25/He took the fat, the fat tail, all the fat around the internal organs, the covering of the liver, both kidneys and their fat, and the right thigh.
3:8:26/From the basket of unleavened bread before the LORD, he took one unleavened loaf, one loaf made with oil, and one wafer, and placed them on the portions of fat and on the right thigh.
3:8:27/He put all these in Aaron's hands and in his sons' hands and waved them as a wave offering before the LORD.
3:8:28/Moses then took them from their hands and burned them on the altar on top of the burnt offering. They were an ordination offering for a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
3:8:29/Moses took the breast and waved it as a wave offering before the LORD; it was Moses' share of the ordination ram, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
3:8:30/Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood from the altar and sprinkled it on Aaron and his garments and on his sons and their garments. Thus, he consecrated Aaron, his garments, his sons, and their garments.
3:8:31/Moses said to Aaron and his sons, "Cook the meat at the entrance to the tent of meeting and eat it there with the bread from the basket of ordination offerings, as I was commanded: 'Aaron and his sons are to eat it.'"
3:8:32/And whatever remains of the meat and bread, you must burn with fire.
3:8:33/You must not leave the entrance to the tent of meeting for seven days, until the days of your ordination are completed, for your ordination will last seven days.
3:8:34/What has been done today was commanded by the LORD to make atonement for you.
3:8:35/You must stay at the entrance to the tent of meeting day and night for seven days and keep the LORD's charge so that you do not die; for this is what I have been commanded."
3:8:36/So Aaron and his sons did everything the LORD commanded through Moses.
3:9:1/On the eighth day, Moses called Aaron, his sons, and the elders of Israel.
3:9:2/He told Aaron, "Take a young calf for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, both without any defects, and present them before the LORD."
3:9:3/Tell the Israelites, "Take a goat for a sin offering and a calf and a lamb, both one year old and without any defects, for a burnt offering."
3:9:4/"Also take a bull and a ram for peace offerings to sacrifice before the LORD, along with a grain offering mixed with oil, because today the LORD will appear to you."
3:9:5/They brought what Moses had commanded to the front of the tent of meeting, and the entire community came forward and stood before the LORD.
3:9:6/Moses said, "This is what the LORD has instructed you to do so that the glory of the LORD may appear to you."
3:9:7/Then Moses told Aaron, "Go to the altar, present your sin offering and your burnt offering, and make atonement for yourself and the people. Present the offering of the people and make atonement for them as the LORD has directed."
3:9:8/Aaron went to the altar and slaughtered the calf for his own sin offering.
3:9:9/Aaron's sons brought the blood to him, and he dipped his finger in the blood, put it on the horns of the altar, and poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
3:9:10/He burned the fat, the kidneys, and the covering of the liver from the sin offering on the altar, as the LORD had instructed Moses.
3:9:11/He burned the meat and the skin outside the camp.
3:9:12/He slaughtered the burnt offering, and Aaron's sons handed him the blood, which he sprinkled all around the altar.
3:9:13/They handed him the burnt offering piece by piece, including the head, and he burned them on the altar.
3:9:14/He washed the internal organs and the legs and burned them on top of the burnt offering on the altar.
3:9:15/He then presented the people's offering, took the goat for the people's sin offering, slaughtered it, and offered it for sin, just like the first one.
3:9:16/He presented the burnt offering and offered it according to the regulations.
3:9:17/He also presented the grain offering, took a handful of it, and burned it on the altar, in addition to the morning's burnt offering.
3:9:18/He slaughtered the bull and the ram as a peace offering for the people. Aaron's sons handed him the blood, and he sprinkled it on all sides of the altar.
3:9:19/They handed him the fat from the bull and the ram, including the fat tail, the fat that covers the internal organs, the kidneys, and the lobe of the liver.
3:9:20/They placed the fat on the breasts, and he burned the fat on the altar.
3:9:21/But the breasts and the right thigh Aaron waved as a wave offering before the LORD, as Moses had instructed.
3:9:22/Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them. After presenting the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, he stepped down.
3:9:23/Moses and Aaron then went into the tent of meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people, and the glory of the LORD appeared to all the people.
3:9:24/Fire came out from the presence of the LORD and consumed the burnt offering and the fat on the altar. When all the people saw it, they shouted for joy and fell facedown.
3:10:1/And Nadab and Abihu, Aaron's sons, each took his censer, filled it with fire, added incense, and presented unauthorized fire before the LORD, which He had not instructed them to do.
3:10:2/Fire came out from the presence of the LORD and consumed them, and they died before the LORD.
3:10:3/Then Moses said to Aaron, "This is what the LORD meant when He said, 'I will show my holiness through those who are near me, and before all the people I will be glorified.'" And Aaron remained silent.
3:10:4/Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Uzziel Aaron's uncle, and said to them, "Come here, carry your relatives away from the front of the sanctuary to outside the camp."
3:10:5/So they came forward and carried them by their tunics out of the camp, just as Moses had instructed.
3:10:6/Moses then said to Aaron and to his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, "Do not let your hair be unkempt, and do not tear your clothes, or you will die and the LORD's wrath will strike the entire community. But let your relatives, the whole house of Israel, mourn the fire the LORD has ignited.
3:10:7/Do not leave the entrance to the tent of meeting, or you will die, because the LORD's anointing oil is on you." And they did as Moses said.
3:10:8/And the LORD spoke to Aaron, saying,
3:10:9/"Do not consume wine or strong drink, you or your sons with you, when you enter the tent of meeting, or you will die. This is to be a lasting ordinance for the generations to come,
3:10:10/so that you can distinguish between the sacred and the profane, and between the unclean and the clean;
3:10:11/and so you can teach the Israelites all the decrees the LORD has spoken to them through Moses."
3:10:12/Moses spoke to Aaron, and to his surviving sons Eleazar and Ithamar, "Take the grain offering left over from the LORD's offerings made by fire and eat it without yeast beside the altar because it is most holy.
3:10:13/Eat it in a sacred place, because it is your right and your sons' right, from the LORD's offerings made by fire; for this is what I have been commanded.
3:10:14/Also, the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented you are to eat in a clean place, you, your sons, and your daughters with you, for they are given as your due and your sons' due from the peace offerings of the Israelites.
3:10:15/The thigh that is presented and the breast that is waved must be brought with the fat portions of the offerings made by fire, to wave as a wave offering before the LORD; this will be your due and your sons' due forever, as the LORD has commanded."
3:10:16/And Moses carefully looked for the goat of the sin offering, and found it had been burned up. He was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron's surviving sons, and asked,
3:10:17/"Why didn't you eat the sin offering in the sacred area? It is most holy, and God gave it to you to take away the guilt of the community by making atonement for them before the LORD.
3:10:18/See, its blood was not taken inside the holy place; you should have certainly eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded."
3:10:19/Aaron replied to Moses, "Today they offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD, but such things as these have happened to me. If I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been acceptable in the eyes of the LORD?"
3:10:20/When Moses heard this, he agreed.
3:11:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
3:11:2/Tell the Israelites: These are the animals you can eat from all the animals on the earth.
3:11:3/You may eat any animal that has a split hoof, is cloven-footed, and chews the cud.
3:11:4/However, you must not eat these animals that chew the cud or have split hooves: the camel, because it chews the cud but does not have a split hoof; it is unclean for you.
3:11:5/And the rock badger, because it chews the cud but does not have a split hoof; it is unclean for you.
3:11:6/And the hare, because it chews the cud but does not have a split hoof; it is unclean for you.
3:11:7/And the pig, though it has a split hoof and is cloven-footed, it does not chew the cud; it is unclean to you.
3:11:8/You must not eat their meat or touch their carcasses; they are unclean to you.
3:11:9/You may eat any of these from the water: anything with fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, you may eat.
3:11:10/But anything in the seas or rivers that does not have fins and scales, all that move in the waters, and any living thing in the waters, is detestable to you.
3:11:11/They are to be detestable to you; you must not eat their meat, and you must regard their carcasses as detestable.
3:11:12/Anything in the waters without fins or scales is detestable to you.
3:11:13/These are the birds you are to regard as detestable and not eat because they are detestable: the eagle, the vulture, the osprey,
3:11:14/And the kite and the falcon of any kind;
3:11:15/Every kind of raven;
3:11:16/And the owl, the night hawk, the cuckoo, and the hawk of any kind,
3:11:17/And the little owl, the cormorant, and the great owl,
3:11:18/And the white owl, the pelican, and the carrion vulture,
3:11:19/And the stork, the heron of any kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.
3:11:20/All flying insects that walk on all fours are detestable to you.
3:11:21/Yet you may eat flying insects that walk on all fours, with legs above their feet to leap on the earth.
3:11:22/These you may eat: any kind of locust, any kind of katydid, any kind of cricket, and any kind of grasshopper.
3:11:23/But all other flying insects that have four legs are detestable to you.
3:11:24/By these you will become unclean: whoever touches their carcass will be unclean until the evening.
3:11:25/And whoever carries any part of their carcass must wash his clothes and will be unclean until the evening.
3:11:26/The carcasses of any animals that have split hooves but are not cloven-footed or do not chew the cud are unclean to you; anyone who touches them will be unclean.
3:11:27/And any animals that walk on their paws, among all animals that walk on all fours, are unclean to you; anyone who touches their carcass will be unclean until the evening.
3:11:28/And anyone who carries their carcass must wash his clothes and will be unclean until the evening; they are unclean to you.
3:11:29/These also are unclean to you among the creatures that crawl on the earth: the weasel, the mouse, and the tortoise of any kind,
3:11:30/And the ferret, the chameleon, the lizard, the snail, and the mole.
3:11:31/These are unclean to you among all that crawl; whoever touches them when they are dead will be unclean until the evening.
3:11:32/And anything on which any of them falls when they are dead will be unclean; whether it is any item of wood, or clothing, or skin, or sack, any item that is used for work, it must be put into water, and it will be unclean until the evening; then it will be clean.
3:11:33/And any clay pot into which any of them falls, everything in it will be unclean, and you must break it.
3:11:34/Any food that could be eaten but has water on it from such a pot is unclean, and any liquid that could be drunk in any such pot is unclean.
3:11:35/And anything on which part of their carcass falls will be unclean; whether oven or cooking stoves, they must be broken down; they are unclean and will be unclean to you.
3:11:36/Nevertheless, a spring or a cistern holding water will be clean, but anyone who touches their carcass will be unclean.
3:11:37/If part of their carcass falls on any seed for sowing that is to be sown, it is clean.
3:11:38/But if water is put on the seed and part of their carcass falls on it, it is unclean to you.
3:11:39/If any animal that you are allowed to eat dies, anyone who touches its carcass will be unclean until the evening.
3:11:40/And anyone who eats some of its carcass must wash his clothes and will be unclean until the evening; anyone who carries the carcass must wash his clothes and will be unclean until the evening.
3:11:41/And every creature that crawls on the ground is detestable; it must not be eaten.
3:11:42/Anything that crawls on its belly, anything that walks on all fours, or anything that has many feet among all creatures that crawl on the ground, you must not eat; for they are detestable.
3:11:43/Do not make yourselves detestable with any crawling creature that crawls, and do not make yourselves unclean with them, so that you become unclean.
3:11:44/For I am the LORD your God; you must therefore consecrate yourselves, and you shall be holy, for I am holy. Do not make yourselves unclean with any creature that crawls on the ground.
3:11:45/For I am the LORD who brought you up out of the land of Egypt to be your God; you shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
3:11:46/This is the law concerning animals, birds, every living creature that moves in the waters, and every creature that crawls on the earth,
3:11:47/To distinguish between the unclean and the clean, and between the animals that may be eaten and the animals that may not be eaten.
3:12:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:12:2/Tell the Israelites, if a woman gives birth to a boy, she will be ceremonially unclean for seven days, just as she is unclean during her menstrual period.
3:12:3/On the eighth day, the boy's foreskin must be circumcised.
3:12:4/Then she must wait thirty-three days to be purified from her bleeding. She must not touch anything sacred or go to the sanctuary until the days of her purification are over.
3:12:5/But if she gives birth to a girl, she will be unclean for two weeks, as during her period, and she must wait sixty-six days to be purified from her bleeding.
3:12:6/When the days of her purification for a son or daughter are over, she is to bring to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting a year-old lamb for a burnt offering and a young pigeon or a dove for a sin offering.
3:12:7/The priest shall offer them before the LORD to make atonement for her, and then she will be ceremonially clean from her flow of blood. This is the law for a woman who gives birth to either a boy or a girl.
3:12:8/If she cannot afford a lamb, she is to bring two doves or two young pigeons, one for a burnt offering and the other for a sin offering. In this way the priest will make atonement for her, and she will be clean.
3:13:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
3:13:2/When someone has a swelling, a rash, or a bright spot on their skin, and it looks like the skin disease leprosy, they must be brought to Aaron the priest or one of his sons who are priests.
3:13:3/The priest will examine the sore on the skin, and if the hair in the sore has turned white and the appearance of the sore is deeper than the skin, it is a case of leprosy. The priest will examine him and declare him unclean.
3:13:4/If the bright spot is white on the skin and does not appear to be deeper than the skin, and the hair has not turned white, then the priest will isolate the affected person for seven days.
3:13:5/On the seventh day, the priest will examine him again. If the sore appears unchanged and has not spread in the skin, the priest will isolate him for another seven days.
3:13:6/On the seventh day, the priest will examine him again. If the sore has faded and has not spread in the skin, the priest will declare him clean; it is only a rash. He must wash his clothes and he will be clean.
3:13:7/But if the rash spreads widely in the skin after he has been seen by the priest and declared clean, he must be seen by the priest again.
3:13:8/If the priest sees that the rash has spread in the skin, he will declare him unclean; it is indeed leprosy.
3:13:9/When someone has leprosy, they must be brought to the priest.
3:13:10/And the priest will examine him. If there is a white swelling in the skin that has turned the hair white, and there is raw flesh in the swelling,
3:13:11/It is a chronic case of leprosy in the skin. The priest will declare him unclean without isolating him, for he is clearly unclean.
3:13:12/If leprosy breaks out all over the skin and covers all the skin from head to foot,
3:13:13/The priest will examine him. If the leprosy has covered all his body, the priest will declare the affected person clean; it has all turned white, and he is clean.
3:13:14/But as soon as raw flesh appears, he will be unclean.
3:13:15/The priest will examine the raw flesh and declare him unclean. The raw flesh is unclean; it is leprosy.
3:13:16/If the raw flesh turns white again, he must go to the priest.
3:13:17/The priest will examine him, and if the sore has turned white, the priest will declare the affected person clean; he is clean.
3:13:18/Also, if there is a boil on the skin that has healed,
3:13:19/And in the place of the boil there is a white swelling or a reddish-white spot, it must be shown to the priest.
3:13:20/If the priest sees that it appears to be lower than the skin and the hair has turned white, he will declare him unclean; it is a case of leprosy that has broken out in the boil.
3:13:21/But if the priest examines it and there are no white hairs in it, and it is not lower than the skin but has faded, the priest will isolate him for seven days.
3:13:22/If it spreads widely in the skin, the priest will declare him unclean; it is a case of leprosy.
3:13:23/But if the bright spot stays in its place and does not spread, it is the scar of the boil, and the priest will declare him clean.
3:13:24/Or if there is any flesh with a burn from fire, and the healed burn has a white or reddish-white bright spot,
3:13:25/The priest will examine it. If the hair in the bright spot has turned white and it appears to be deeper than the skin, it is leprosy that has broken out in the burn. The priest will declare him unclean; it is a case of leprosy.
3:13:26/But if the priest examines it and there is no white hair in the bright spot, and it is not lower than the skin but has faded, the priest will isolate him for seven days.
3:13:27/On the seventh day, the priest will examine him. If it has spread widely in the skin, the priest will declare him unclean; it is a case of leprosy.
3:13:28/But if the bright spot stays in its place and does not spread in the skin and has faded, it is a swelling from the burn, and the priest will declare him clean; it is the scar of the burn.
3:13:29/If a man or woman has a sore on the head or the beard,
3:13:30/The priest will examine the sore. If it appears to be deeper than the skin and there is thin yellow hair in it, the priest will declare him unclean; it is a fungal infection, a case of leprosy on the head or beard.
3:13:31/But if the priest examines the sore of the fungal infection and it does not appear to be deeper than the skin and there is no black hair in it, the priest will isolate the person with the fungal infection for seven days.
3:13:32/On the seventh day, the priest will examine the sore. If the fungal infection has not spread, there is no yellow hair in it, and the fungal infection does not appear to be deeper than the skin,
3:13:33/The person must shave themselves, except for the fungal infection. The priest will isolate the person with the fungal infection for another seven days.
3:13:34/On the seventh day, the priest will examine the fungal infection. If it has not spread in the skin and does not appear to be deeper than the skin, then the priest will declare him clean. He must wash his clothes and he will be clean.
3:13:35/But if the fungal infection spreads widely in the skin after his cleansing,
3:13:36/The priest will examine him. If the fungal infection has spread in the skin, the priest does not need to look for yellow hair; he is unclean.
3:13:37/But if the fungal infection is stable and black hair has grown in it, the fungal infection is healed; he is clean. The priest will declare him clean.
3:13:38/If a man or a woman has bright spots on the skin of their flesh, white bright spots,
3:13:39/The priest will examine them. If the bright spots on the skin of their flesh are dull white, it is a harmless rash that has broken out in the skin; he is clean.
3:13:40/And if a man's hair falls out from his head, he is bald; but he is clean.
3:13:41/And if his hair falls out from the front part of his head, he is forehead bald; but he is clean.
3:13:42/But if there is a white reddish sore on the bald head or forehead, it is leprosy breaking out on his bald head or forehead.
3:13:43/The priest will examine it, and if the swelling of the sore is white reddish on his bald head or forehead, similar to leprosy on the skin of the body,
3:13:44/He is a leprous man, he is unclean. The priest must declare him utterly unclean; his infection is on his head.
3:13:45/The person with leprosy must wear torn clothes, leave his hair uncombed, cover his upper lip, and cry out, 'Unclean, unclean.'
3:13:46/As long as the disease lasts, he will be unclean. He must live alone; he must live outside the camp.
3:13:47/Any clothing that has the leprosy disease, whether woolen or linen,
3:13:48/Whether in the warp or woof of linen or wool, or in leather or anything made of leather,
3:13:49/If the disease is greenish or reddish in the clothing, or in the leather, or in the warp or woof, or in any leather article, it is a leprous disease and must be shown to the priest.
3:13:50/The priest will examine the disease and isolate the affected article for seven days.
3:13:51/He will examine the disease on the seventh day. If the disease has spread in the clothing, whether in the warp, woof, leather, or anything made of leather, the disease is a persistent leprosy; it is unclean.
3:13:52/He must therefore burn the clothing, whether warp or woof, woolen or linen, or any leather article that has the disease, for it is a persistent leprous disease; it must be burned in the fire.
3:13:53/But if the priest examines it and the disease has not spread in the clothing, whether in the warp or woof or in any leather article,
3:13:54/Then the priest will order that the affected article be washed and isolated for another seven days.
3:13:55/After the article with the disease has been washed, the priest will examine it again. If the disease has not changed its appearance, even though the disease has not spread, it is unclean; you must burn it in the fire. It is a deep infection, whether the bare spot is inside or outside.
3:13:56/And if the priest examines it and the disease has faded after it has been washed, he is to tear the diseased part out of the clothing, or the leather, or the warp, or the woof.
3:13:57/But if it appears again in the clothing, whether in the warp or woof, or in any leather article, it is spreading; you must burn the affected article with fire.
3:13:58/The clothing, whether warp or woof, or any leather article, which has been washed and from which the disease has departed, must be washed again and it will be clean.
3:13:59/This is the law concerning a leprous disease in a garment of wool or linen, either in the warp or woof, or in any leather article, to declare it clean or unclean.
3:14:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:14:2/This is the procedure for a leper on the day of their cleansing: They must be brought to the priest.
3:14:3/The priest shall go outside the camp; the priest shall examine the person, and if the leprosy has healed,
3:14:4/Then the priest shall order that two live, clean birds, cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop be brought for the person to be cleansed.
3:14:5/The priest shall command that one of the birds be killed over fresh water in a clay pot.
3:14:6/As for the live bird, he shall take it, along with the cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop, and dip them and the live bird in the blood of the bird that was killed over the fresh water.
3:14:7/He shall sprinkle the person to be cleansed from leprosy seven times, declare them clean, and then release the live bird into the open field.
3:14:8/The person being cleansed must wash their clothes, shave off all their hair, and bathe in water to be clean. After that, they may enter the camp but must stay outside their tent for seven days.
3:14:9/On the seventh day, they must shave off all their hair: their head, beard, eyebrows—every bit of hair. They must wash their clothes and bathe in water, and they will be clean.
3:14:10/On the eighth day, they must bring two male lambs without defect, one year-old female lamb without defect, three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering, and one log of oil.
3:14:11/The priest who performs the cleansing will present the person to be cleansed, along with these offerings, before the LORD at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
3:14:12/The priest shall take one of the male lambs and offer it as a guilt offering, along with the log of oil, and wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
3:14:13/He shall slaughter the lamb in the sacred place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered. Like the sin offering, the guilt offering belongs to the priest; it is most holy.
3:14:14/The priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering, and put it on the lobe of the right ear of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot.
3:14:15/The priest shall take some of the log of oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.
3:14:16/The priest shall dip his right finger in the oil in his left hand and sprinkle some of the oil seven times before the LORD.
3:14:17/With the rest of the oil in his hand, the priest shall put some on the lobe of the right ear of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot, on top of the blood of the guilt offering.
3:14:18/The remaining oil in the priest's hand he shall put on the head of the one to be cleansed, to make atonement for them before the LORD.
3:14:19/The priest shall then offer the sin offering to make atonement for the one to be cleansed from their impurity. Afterward, he shall slaughter the burnt offering.
3:14:20/The priest shall offer the burnt offering and the grain offering on the altar. Thus, the priest makes atonement for them, and they will be clean.
3:14:21/If they are poor and cannot afford so much, they shall take one male lamb as a guilt offering to be waved to make atonement for them, one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, a log of oil,
3:14:22/And two turtledoves or two young pigeons, whatever they can afford. One will be a sin offering and the other a burnt offering.
3:14:23/On the eighth day, they shall bring them for their cleansing to the priest, at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, before the LORD.
3:14:24/The priest shall take the lamb of the guilt offering and the log of oil, and wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
3:14:25/He shall slaughter the lamb of the guilt offering. The priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the lobe of the right ear of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot.
3:14:26/The priest shall pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand.
3:14:27/The priest shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil from his left hand seven times before the LORD.
3:14:28/The priest shall put some of the oil that is in his hand on the lobe of the right ear of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot, on the places where he put the blood of the guilt offering.
3:14:29/The rest of the oil in the priest's hand he shall put on the head of the one to be cleansed, to make atonement for them before the LORD.
3:14:30/He shall then offer one of the turtledoves or young pigeons, whichever they can afford.
3:14:31/Whatever they can afford, one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, along with the grain offering. The priest shall make atonement before the LORD for the one to be cleansed.
3:14:32/This is the law for anyone with a leprous disease who cannot afford the offerings for their cleansing.
3:14:33/And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
3:14:34/When you enter the land of Canaan, which I am giving you as a possession, and I put a leprous disease in a house in the land of your possession,
3:14:35/And the owner of the house comes and tells the priest, 'It seems to me there is something like a disease in the house,'
3:14:36/The priest shall order that they empty the house before the priest goes in to examine the disease, so that everything in the house will not become unclean. After that, the priest shall go in to see the house.
3:14:37/He shall examine the disease, and if the disease is in the walls of the house with greenish or reddish depressions that appear to be deeper than the surface,
3:14:38/The priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house and shut up the house for seven days.
3:14:39/The priest shall return on the seventh day and inspect the house. If the disease has spread in the walls of the house,
3:14:40/The priest shall order that they remove the stones in which the disease appears and throw them into an unclean place outside the city.
3:14:41/He shall have the house scraped all around inside, and they shall dump the plaster that they scrape off outside the city in an unclean place.
3:14:42/Then they shall take other stones and replace those stones, and he shall take other plaster and replaster the house.
3:14:43/If the disease breaks out again in the house, after he has removed the stones and scraped and replastered the house,
3:14:44/The priest shall come and inspect it. If the disease has spread in the house, it is a persistent leprous disease in the house; it is unclean.
3:14:45/He shall tear down the house, its stones, its timber, and all the plaster of the house, and carry them out of the city to an unclean place.
3:14:46/Moreover, anyone who enters the house while it is shut up shall be unclean until the evening.
3:14:47/And whoever sleeps in the house shall wash their clothes, and whoever eats in the house shall wash their clothes.
3:14:48/But if the priest comes in and examines it and the disease has not spread in the house after the house was replastered, then the priest shall declare the house clean, because the disease is healed.
3:14:49/To cleanse the house, he shall take two birds, cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop.
3:14:50/He shall kill one of the birds over fresh water in a clay pot.
3:14:51/Then he shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the scarlet yarn, and the live bird, and dip them in the blood of the bird that was killed and in the fresh water, and sprinkle the house seven times.
3:14:52/He shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, the fresh water, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the scarlet yarn.
3:14:53/Then he shall release the live bird outside the city into the open fields. Thus he shall make atonement for the house, and it shall be clean.
3:14:54/This is the law for any kind of leprous disease and scale,
3:14:55/For the leprosy of a garment and of a house,
3:14:56/For a swelling, a rash, or a bright spot,
3:14:57/To determine when it is unclean and when it is clean. This is the law of leprosy.
3:15:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
3:15:2/Tell the Israelites, when any man has a bodily discharge, he is unclean because of it.
3:15:3/This is how his uncleanliness from his discharge will be determined: whether his body allows the discharge to flow or blocks it, he is unclean.
3:15:4/Any bed the person with the discharge lies on is unclean, and anything he sits on is unclean.
3:15:5/Anyone who touches his bed must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:6/Anyone who sits on anything the person with the discharge has sat on must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:7/Anyone who touches the body of the person with the discharge must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:8/If the person with the discharge spits on someone who is clean, they must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:9/Any saddle the person with the discharge rides on will be unclean.
3:15:10/Anyone who touches anything that was under the person with the discharge will be unclean until evening; anyone who carries those things must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:11/Anyone the person with the discharge touches without having rinsed their hands in water must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:12/Any clay pot the person with the discharge touches must be broken, and any wooden article must be rinsed in water.
3:15:13/When the person with the discharge is cleansed of it, they must count off seven days for their cleansing, wash their clothes, and bathe their body in fresh water; then they will be clean.
3:15:14/On the eighth day, they must take two doves or two young pigeons and present them before the LORD at the entrance to the tent of meeting and give them to the priest.
3:15:15/The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; and the priest shall make atonement for them before the LORD for their discharge.
3:15:16/If a man's semen goes out from him, he must wash all his body in water, and be unclean until evening.
3:15:17/Any clothing or leather that has semen on it must be washed with water, and be unclean until evening.
3:15:18/If a man lies with a woman and there is an emission of semen, they both must bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
3:15:19/If a woman has a discharge and it is blood from her body, she will be in her menstrual period for seven days; anyone who touches her will be unclean until evening.
3:15:20/Anything she lies on during her period will be unclean; anything she sits on will be unclean.
3:15:21/Anyone who touches her bed must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:22/Anyone who touches anything she sat on must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:23/If it's on her bed or anything she sits on when he touches it, he will be unclean until evening.
3:15:24/If a man lies with her and her menstrual flow touches him, he will be unclean for seven days; every bed he lies on will be unclean.
3:15:25/If a woman has a discharge of blood for many days outside her menstrual period, or if it continues beyond her period, she will be unclean as during her period.
3:15:26/Every bed she lies on all the days of her discharge will be to her as the bed of her period; and whatever she sits on will be unclean, as during her period.
3:15:27/Anyone who touches those things will be unclean; they must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and will be unclean until evening.
3:15:28/But if she is cleansed of her discharge, she must count off seven days, and after that she will be clean.
3:15:29/On the eighth day she must take two doves or two young pigeons and bring them to the priest at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
3:15:30/The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; and the priest shall make atonement for her before the LORD for the uncleanness of her discharge.
3:15:31/This is how you will separate the Israelites from their uncleanness, so they do not die in their uncleanness by defiling my dwelling place, which is among them.
3:15:32/This is the law for a person with a discharge, for anyone whose semen goes out from him and becomes unclean because of it,
