3:15:33/For a woman in her menstrual period, for anyone with a discharge, whether male or female, and for a man who lies with a woman who is unclean.
3:16:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses after Aaron's two sons died because they offered unauthorized fire before the LORD.
3:16:2/And the LORD said to Moses, "Tell your brother Aaron not to enter the sanctuary inside the curtain in front of the atonement cover on the ark anytime he wants, so he won't die. I will appear in a cloud over the atonement cover.
3:16:3/This is how Aaron is to enter the sanctuary area: with a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.
3:16:4/He must wear a sacred linen tunic and linen undergarments next to his body; he is to tie a linen sash around him and put on a linen turban. These are sacred garments, so he must bathe himself with water before he puts them on.
3:16:5/He is to take from the Israelite community two male goats for a sin offering and one ram for a burnt offering.
3:16:6/Aaron is to offer the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household.
3:16:7/Then he is to take the two goats and present them before the LORD at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
3:16:8/Aaron is to cast lots for the two goats—one lot for the LORD and the other for the scapegoat.
3:16:9/Aaron shall bring the goat whose lot falls to the LORD and sacrifice it for a sin offering.
3:16:10/But the goat chosen by lot as the scapegoat shall be presented alive before the LORD to be used for making atonement by sending it into the wilderness as a scapegoat.
3:16:11/Then Aaron shall bring the bull for his own sin offering to make atonement for himself and his household, and he shall slaughter the bull for his own sin offering.
3:16:12/He is to take a censer full of burning coals from the altar before the LORD and two handfuls of finely ground fragrant incense and take them behind the curtain.
3:16:13/He is to put the incense on the fire before the LORD, and the smoke of the incense will conceal the atonement cover above the Testimony, so he will not die.
3:16:14/He is to take some of the bull's blood and with his finger sprinkle it on the front of the atonement cover; then he shall sprinkle some of it with his finger seven times before the atonement cover.
3:16:15/He shall then slaughter the goat for the sin offering for the people and take its blood behind the curtain and do with it as he did with the bull's blood: He shall sprinkle it on the atonement cover and in front of it.
3:16:16/In this way he will make atonement for the Most Holy Place because of the uncleanness and rebellion of the Israelites, whatever their sins have been. He is to do the same for the tent of meeting, which is among them in the midst of their uncleanness.
3:16:17/No one is to be in the tent of meeting from the time Aaron goes in to make atonement in the Most Holy Place until he comes out, having made atonement for himself, his household and the whole community of Israel.
3:16:18/Then he shall come out to the altar that is before the LORD and make atonement for it. He shall take some of the bull's blood and some of the goat's blood and put it on the horns of the altar all around.
3:16:19/He shall sprinkle some of the blood on it with his finger seven times to cleanse it and to consecrate it from the uncleanness of the Israelites.
3:16:20/When Aaron has finished making atonement for the Most Holy Place, the tent of meeting and the altar, he shall bring forward the live goat.
3:16:21/He is to lay both hands on the head of the live goat and confess over it all the wickedness and rebellion of the Israelites—all their sins—and put them on the goat's head. He shall send the goat away into the wilderness in the care of someone appointed for the task.
3:16:22/The goat will carry on itself all their sins to a remote place; and the man shall release it in the wilderness.
3:16:23/Then Aaron is to go into the tent of meeting and take off the linen garments he put on before he entered the Most Holy Place, and he is to leave them there.
3:16:24/He shall bathe himself with water in the sanctuary area and put on his regular garments. Then he shall come out and offer his burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, making atonement for himself and for the people.
3:16:25/The fat of the sin offering he shall burn on the altar.
3:16:26/The man who releases the goat as the scapegoat must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water; afterward he may come back into the camp.
3:16:27/The bull and the goat for the sin offerings, whose blood was brought into the sanctuary to make atonement, must be taken outside the camp; their hides, flesh, and intestines are to be burned up.
3:16:28/The man who burns them must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water; afterward he may come back into the camp.
3:16:29/This is to be a lasting ordinance for you: On the tenth day of the seventh month you must deny yourselves and not do any work—whether native-born or a foreigner residing among you—
3:16:30/because on this day atonement will be made for you, to cleanse you. Then, before the LORD, you will be clean from all your sins.
3:16:31/It is a day of sabbath rest, and you must deny yourselves; it is a lasting ordinance.
3:16:32/The priest who is anointed and ordained to succeed his father as high priest is to make atonement. He is to put on the sacred linen garments
3:16:33/and make atonement for the Most Holy Place, for the tent of meeting and the altar, and for the priests and all the members of the community.
3:16:34/This is to be a lasting ordinance for you: Atonement is to be made once a year for all the sins of the Israelites." And it was done as the LORD commanded Moses.
3:17:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:17:2/Tell Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelites, 'This is what the LORD has commanded:
3:17:3/Any Israelite who slaughters an ox, lamb, or goat, whether inside or outside the camp,
3:17:4/And does not bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to present it as an offering to the LORD in front of the LORD's dwelling; that person will be considered guilty of bloodshed; they have shed blood and will be cut off from their people.
3:17:5/This is so the Israelites will bring the sacrifices they used to offer in the open fields to the LORD, at the entrance of the tent of meeting, to the priest, and offer them as peace offerings to the LORD.
3:17:6/The priest shall then sprinkle the blood on the LORD's altar at the entrance of the tent of meeting and burn the fat as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
3:17:7/They must no longer offer any sacrifices to goat idols, which they have been unfaithfully following. This is a permanent law for them throughout their generations.
3:17:8/Tell them, 'Any Israelite or any foreigner residing among you who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice
3:17:9/And does not bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to present it to the LORD, that person will be cut off from their people.
3:17:10/And any Israelite or any foreigner residing among you who consumes any kind of blood; I will set my face against that person who eats blood and will cut them off from their people.
3:17:11/For the life of a creature is in the blood, and I have given it to you to make atonement for yourselves on the altar; it is the blood that makes atonement for one's life.
3:17:12/That is why I have told the Israelites, 'None of you may eat blood, nor may any foreigner residing among you eat blood.'
3:17:13/Any Israelite or any foreigner residing among you who hunts any animal or bird that may be eaten must drain out the blood and cover it with earth.
3:17:14/Because the life of every creature is its blood. That is why I have told the Israelites, 'You must not eat the blood of any creature, because the life of every creature is its blood; anyone who eats it must be cut off.'
3:17:15/Anyone who eats what has died naturally or has been killed by another animal, whether they are a native or a foreigner, must wash their clothes and bathe with water, and they will be unclean until evening; then they will be clean.
3:17:16/But if they do not wash their clothes and bathe themselves, they will be held responsible.
3:18:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:18:2/Tell the children of Israel, and say to them, I am the LORD your God.
3:18:3/Do not follow the practices of the land of Egypt, where you lived, nor of the land of Canaan, where I am taking you. Do not follow their customs.
3:18:4/You must follow my laws and be careful to obey my decrees. I am the LORD your God.
3:18:5/Therefore, you must keep my statutes and my laws, which if a person follows, they will live by them. I am the LORD.
3:18:6/None of you shall approach any close relative to have sexual relations. I am the LORD.
3:18:7/Do not have sexual relations with your father or your mother. She is your mother; do not have sexual relations with her.
3:18:8/Do not have sexual relations with your father’s wife; that would dishonor your father.
3:18:9/Do not have sexual relations with your sister, either your father's daughter or your mother's daughter, whether she was born in the same home or elsewhere.
3:18:10/Do not have sexual relations with your granddaughter, whether your son's daughter or your daughter's daughter; that would dishonor you.
3:18:11/Do not have sexual relations with your step-sister, the daughter of your father's wife, born to your father; she is your sister.
3:18:12/Do not have sexual relations with your father’s sister; she is your father’s close relative.
3:18:13/Do not have sexual relations with your mother’s sister, because she is your mother’s close relative.
3:18:14/Do not have sexual relations with your father’s brother, nor approach his wife; she is your aunt.
3:18:15/Do not have sexual relations with your daughter-in-law. She is your son’s wife; do not have sexual relations with her.
3:18:16/Do not have sexual relations with your brother’s wife; that would dishonor your brother.
3:18:17/Do not have sexual relations with both a woman and her daughter. Do not take her granddaughter, whether her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter, to have sexual relations. They are close relatives; that is wickedness.
3:18:18/Do not take your wife's sister as a rival wife to have sexual relations with her while your wife is living.
3:18:19/Do not approach a woman to have sexual relations during the uncleanness of her menstrual period.
3:18:20/Do not have sexual relations with your neighbor’s wife, defiling yourself with her.
3:18:21/Do not give any of your children to be sacrificed to Molech, for you must not profane the name of your God. I am the LORD.
3:18:22/Do not have sexual relations with a man as one does with a woman; that is detestable.
3:18:23/Do not have sexual relations with an animal and defile yourself with it. A woman must not present herself to an animal to have sexual relations with it; that is a perversion.
3:18:24/Do not defile yourselves in any of these ways, because this is how the nations that I am going to drive out before you became defiled.
3:18:25/And the land became defiled, so I punished it for its sin, and the land vomited out its inhabitants.
3:18:26/But you must keep my decrees and my laws. The native-born and the foreigners residing among you must not do any of these detestable things,
3:18:27/for all these things were done by the people who lived in the land before you, and the land became defiled.
3:18:28/If you defile the land, it will vomit you out as it vomited out the nations that were before you.
3:18:29/Everyone who does any of these detestable things—such persons must be cut off from their people.
3:18:30/So you must keep my charge not to do any of these abominable customs that were done before you, and not defile yourselves with them. I am the LORD your God.
3:19:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:19:2/Tell the entire community of the children of Israel, 'You must be holy because I, the LORD your God, am holy.'
3:19:3/Everyone must respect his mother and father, and keep my Sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.
3:19:4/Do not turn to idols or make for yourselves any gods of cast metal: I am the LORD your God.
3:19:5/If you present a peace offering to the LORD, you must do it willingly.
3:19:6/It must be eaten on the day you offer it or on the next day; anything left until the third day must be burned.
3:19:7/If any of it is eaten on the third day, it is contaminated and will not be accepted.
3:19:8/Therefore, anyone who eats it will be responsible for his sin, for he has desecrated what is holy to the LORD: that person will be cut off from his people.
3:19:9/When you harvest your land's crop, do not harvest all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the leftovers of your harvest.
3:19:10/Do not pick your vineyard clean or gather every grape; leave them for the poor and the foreigner: I am the LORD your God.
3:19:11/Do not steal, do not deceive, and do not lie to one another.
3:19:12/Do not swear falsely by my name, thereby profaning the name of your God: I am the LORD.
3:19:13/Do not cheat your neighbor or rob him. The wages of a hired worker must not remain with you all night until morning.
3:19:14/Do not curse the deaf or put a stumbling block in front of the blind, but fear your God: I am the LORD.
3:19:15/Do not do injustice in court: do not be biased toward the poor or favor the great, but judge your neighbor fairly.
3:19:16/Do not go about spreading slander among your people. Do not do anything that endangers your neighbor's life: I am the LORD.
3:19:17/Do not harbor hatred against your brother. Rebuke your neighbor frankly so you will not share in his guilt.
3:19:18/Do not seek revenge or bear a grudge against anyone among your people, but love your neighbor as yourself: I am the LORD.
3:19:19/Follow my decrees. Do not mate different kinds of animals. Do not plant your field with two kinds of seed. Do not wear clothing woven of two kinds of material.
3:19:20/If a man sleeps with a female slave who is promised to another man but has not been redeemed or given her freedom, there must be due punishment. They are not to be put to death, because she had not been freed.
3:19:21/He must bring a ram to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting for a guilt offering to the LORD.
3:19:22/The priest will make atonement for him with the ram of the guilt offering before the LORD for his sin he has committed, and his sin will be forgiven.
3:19:23/When you enter the land and plant any kind of fruit tree, regard its fruit as forbidden. For three years you are to consider it forbidden; it must not be eaten.
3:19:24/In the fourth year all its fruit will be holy, an offering of praise to the LORD.
3:19:25/But in the fifth year you may eat its fruit. In this way your harvest will be increased: I am the LORD your God.
3:19:26/Do not eat any meat with the blood still in it. Do not practice divination or seek omens.
3:19:27/Do not cut the hair at the sides of your head or clip off the edges of your beard.
3:19:28/Do not cut your bodies for the dead or put tattoo marks on yourselves: I am the LORD.
3:19:29/Do not degrade your daughter by making her a prostitute, or the land will turn to prostitution and be filled with wickedness.
3:19:30/Observe my Sabbaths and have reverence for my sanctuary: I am the LORD.
3:19:31/Do not turn to mediums or seek out spiritists, for you will be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.
3:19:32/Stand up in the presence of the aged, show respect for the elderly and revere your God: I am the LORD.
3:19:33/If a foreigner resides with you in your land, do not mistreat them.
3:19:34/The foreigner residing among you must be treated as your native-born. Love them as yourself, for you were foreigners in Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
3:19:35/Do not do anything that is unfair in court, in measuring length, weight, or quantity.
3:19:36/Use honest scales, honest weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt.
3:19:37/Therefore, keep all my decrees and all my laws and follow them: I am the LORD.
3:20:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:20:2/Tell the Israelites and the foreigners living in Israel that anyone who sacrifices any of their children to Molech must be put to death. The local community must stone them.
3:20:3/I will oppose that person and cut them off from their community because they have sacrificed their children to Molech, defiling my sanctuary and dishonoring my holy name.
3:20:4/If the local community turns a blind eye to someone sacrificing their children to Molech and does not put them to death,
3:20:5/then I will set my face against that person and their family, cutting them off along with everyone who follows them in prostituting themselves to Molech.
3:20:6/Anyone who turns to mediums and spiritists to prostitute themselves with them, I will set my face against them and cut them off from their people.
3:20:7/So set yourselves apart and be holy, because I am the LORD your God.
3:20:8/Keep my decrees and follow them. I am the LORD who makes you holy.
3:20:9/Anyone who curses their father or mother must be put to death. They have cursed their parent; their blood will be on their own head.
3:20:10/If a man commits adultery with another man's wife, both the adulterer and the adulteress must be put to death.
3:20:11/If a man sleeps with his father's wife, he has dishonored his father. Both of them must be put to death; their blood will be on their own heads.
3:20:12/If a man sleeps with his daughter-in-law, both of them must be put to death. They have committed a perversion; their blood will be on their own heads.
3:20:13/If a man has sexual relations with another man as one does with a woman, both of them have done what is detestable. They must be put to death; their blood will be on their own heads.
3:20:14/If a man marries both a woman and her mother, it is wickedness. They must be burned in the fire, both he and they, so that no wickedness will be among you.
3:20:15/If a man has sexual relations with an animal, he must be put to death, and you must kill the animal.
3:20:16/If a woman approaches an animal to have sexual relations with it, kill both the woman and the animal. They must be put to death; their blood will be on their own heads.
3:20:17/If a man takes his sister, his father's daughter or his mother's daughter, and sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness, it is a disgrace. They must be cut off in the sight of their people. He has uncovered his sister's nakedness; he will bear the consequences of his guilt.
3:20:18/If a man lies with a woman during her menstrual period and uncovers her nakedness, he has exposed her flow, and she has uncovered the flow of her blood. Both of them must be cut off from their people.
3:20:19/You must not have sexual relations with your aunt, whether your mother's sister or your father's sister. This would dishonor a close relative; both of you would bear the consequences of your guilt.
3:20:20/If a man sleeps with his uncle's wife, he has dishonored his uncle. They will bear the consequences of their sin; they will die childless.
3:20:21/If a man takes his brother's wife, it is impurity. He has uncovered his brother's nakedness; they will be childless.
3:20:22/Therefore, keep all my statutes and all my judgments and do them, so that the land where I am bringing you to live will not vomit you out.
3:20:23/Do not follow the practices of the nation I am driving out before you. Because they did all these things, I abhorred them.
3:20:24/But I have said to you, 'You will inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey.' I am the LORD your God, who has set you apart from the nations.
3:20:25/You must therefore distinguish between clean and unclean animals and birds. Do not defile yourselves by animals or birds or anything else that moves along the ground—those which I have set apart as unclean for you.
3:20:26/You are to be holy to me because I, the LORD, am holy, and I have set you apart from the nations to be my own.
3:20:27/A man or woman who is a medium or spiritist among you must be put to death. You are to stone them; their blood will be on their own heads.
3:21:1/And the LORD said to Moses, "Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and tell them: No one shall become ceremonially unclean for a dead person among his people,
3:21:2/Except for his closest relatives: his mother, father, son, daughter, and brother,
3:21:3/And for his unmarried sister who is close to him because she has no husband; for her, he may become unclean.
3:21:4/But as a leader among his people, he must not make himself unclean in a way that dishonors him.
3:21:5/They must not shave their heads or trim the edges of their beards or cut their bodies.
3:21:6/They must be holy to their God and not dishonor the name of their God. Since they present offerings made by fire to the LORD, the food of their God, they must be holy.
3:21:7/They must not marry a woman who has been defiled by prostitution or divorced from her husband, because they are holy to their God.
3:21:8/Treat him as holy because he offers the food of your God. He must be holy to you because I, the LORD who makes you holy, am holy.
3:21:9/If a priest's daughter defiles herself by becoming a prostitute, she dishonors her father; she must be burned in the fire.
3:21:10/The high priest, who has had the anointing oil poured on his head and who has been dedicated to wear the sacred garments, must not let his hair become unkempt or tear his clothes.
3:21:11/He must not enter a place where there is a dead body. He must not make himself unclean, even for his father or mother.
3:21:12/He must not leave the sanctuary or desecrate the sanctuary of his God, for the dedication of the anointing oil of his God is on him. I am the LORD.
3:21:13/He must marry a woman in her virginity.
3:21:14/He must not marry a widow, a divorced woman, a woman defiled by prostitution, or a woman who is not a virgin. He may only marry a virgin from his own people.
3:21:15/He must not defile his offspring among his people, for I am the LORD who makes him holy."
3:21:16/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:21:17/"Tell Aaron: 'Anyone from your descendants throughout their generations who has a physical defect must not approach to offer the food of his God.
3:21:18/No man who has a defect may come near: no man who is blind, lame, disfigured, deformed,
3:21:19/Or a man who has a broken foot or hand,
3:21:20/Or is hunchbacked, dwarfed, has a defect in his eye, skin diseases, or scabs, or who has damaged testicles.
3:21:21/No descendant of Aaron the priest who has any defect is to come near to present the LORD's offerings made by fire. He has a defect; he must not come near to offer the food of his God.
3:21:22/He may eat the food of his God, both the most holy and the holy.
3:21:23/However, he must not enter the curtain area or approach the altar because he has a defect, so that he does not desecrate my sanctuaries, for I am the LORD who makes them holy.'"
3:21:24/And Moses told this to Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelites.
3:22:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:22:2/Tell Aaron and his sons to keep away from the sacred offerings of the Israelites, so they do not dishonor my holy name by treating as common the offerings they dedicate to me: I am the LORD.
3:22:3/Tell them that anyone from their descendants, throughout their generations, who approaches the sacred offerings that the Israelites dedicate to the LORD while they are in a state of impurity, that person shall be cut off from my presence: I am the LORD.
3:22:4/Any descendant of Aaron who has leprosy or a discharge must not eat the sacred offerings until they are clean. And anyone who touches anything made unclean by contact with the dead, or a man who has an emission of semen,
3:22:5/Or anyone who touches any crawling creature that might make them unclean, or a person who could make them unclean in any way whatsoever,
3:22:6/Anyone who has touched any such thing will be unclean until evening and must not eat the sacred offerings unless they bathe their body in water.
3:22:7/After the sun has set, they will be clean and may then eat the sacred offerings, for these are their food.
3:22:8/They must not eat anything found dead or torn by wild animals, which would make them unclean: I am the LORD.
3:22:9/Therefore, they must observe my instructions, lest they bear sin for it and die as a result if they profane it: I the LORD sanctify them.
3:22:10/No outsider may eat the sacred offering; neither a visitor of the priest nor a hired worker may eat the sacred offering.
3:22:11/But if a priest buys a person, that person may eat of it, and those born in his household may also eat his food.
3:22:12/If a priest's daughter is married to an outsider, she may not eat of the sacred offerings.
3:22:13/However, if a priest's daughter is a widow or divorced, without children, and returns to her father's house, as in her youth, she may eat of her father's food. But no outsider may eat of it.
3:22:14/If anyone eats the sacred offering by mistake, they must add a fifth of its value to it and give it to the priest with the sacred offering.
3:22:15/They must not desecrate the sacred offerings of the Israelites, which they present to the LORD,
3:22:16/Or allow them to bear the guilt of trespass when they eat their sacred offerings: for I the LORD sanctify them.
3:22:17/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:22:18/Tell Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelites, that anyone from the house of Israel or from the foreigners in Israel who presents their offering, whether they are fulfilling a vow or making a freewill offering that they present to the LORD as a burnt offering,
3:22:19/Must offer a male without defect from the cattle, sheep, or goats to be accepted.
3:22:20/You must not offer anything that has a defect, because it will not be accepted on your behalf.
3:22:21/Anyone who offers a sacrifice of peace offerings to the LORD to fulfill a vow, or as a freewill offering from the cattle or sheep, it must be perfect to be accepted; there must be no defect in it.
3:22:22/You must not offer to the LORD any animal that is blind, injured, mutilated, or has a wart, skin disease, or scabs. You must not place any of these on the altar as an offering made by fire to the LORD.
3:22:23/You may present a bull or a lamb that has a part too long or too short as a freewill offering, but for a vow it will not be accepted.
3:22:24/You must not offer to the LORD any animal that is bruised, crushed, torn, or cut; you must not make any such offering in your land.
3:22:25/And you must not accept such offerings from the hand of a foreigner to offer as the food of your God. Because their corruption is in them, they have defects; they will not be accepted on your behalf.
3:22:26/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:22:27/When a calf, lamb, or goat is born, it must stay seven days with its mother; from the eighth day on, it will be acceptable as an offering made by fire to the LORD.
3:22:28/Whether it is a cow or ewe, do not kill both it and its young on the same day.
3:22:29/When you offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the LORD, offer it so that it may be accepted.
3:22:30/It must be eaten on the same day; leave none of it until morning: I am the LORD.
3:22:31/Therefore, you must keep my commands and carry them out: I am the LORD.
3:22:32/You must not desecrate my holy name, but I will be recognized as holy among the Israelites: I am the LORD who makes you holy,
3:22:33/Who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God: I am the LORD.
3:23:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:23:2/Tell the Israelites about the festivals of the LORD, which you are to declare as sacred gatherings; these are my appointed festivals.
3:23:3/You may work for six days, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of complete rest, a sacred assembly. You must not do any work on it; it is a Sabbath to the LORD wherever you live.
3:23:4/These are the LORD's appointed festivals, the sacred assemblies you are to proclaim at their appointed times.
3:23:5/On the fourteenth day of the first month, at twilight, is the LORD's Passover.
3:23:6/And on the fifteenth day of the same month is the Festival of Unleavened Bread to the LORD; for seven days you must eat bread made without yeast.
3:23:7/On the first day hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work.
3:23:8/For seven days present a food offering to the LORD. On the seventh day hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work.
3:23:9/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:23:10/Tell the Israelites, when you enter the land I am giving you and harvest its crops, bring the first sheaf of your harvest to the priest.
3:23:11/He is to wave the sheaf before the LORD so it will be accepted on your behalf; the priest is to wave it on the day after the Sabbath.
3:23:12/On the day you wave the sheaf, you must sacrifice as a burnt offering to the LORD a lamb a year old without defect.
3:23:13/Its grain offering shall be two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil, an offering made by fire to the LORD for a pleasing aroma; and its drink offering shall be of wine, a fourth of a hin.
3:23:14/You must not eat any bread, or roasted or new grain, until the very day you bring this offering to your God. This is to be a lasting ordinance for the generations to come, wherever you live.
3:23:15/From the day after the Sabbath, the day you brought the sheaf of the wave offering, count off seven full weeks.
3:23:16/Count off fifty days up to the day after the seventh Sabbath, and then present an offering of new grain to the LORD.
3:23:17/From wherever you live, bring two loaves made of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour, baked with yeast, as a wave offering of firstfruits to the LORD.
3:23:18/Along with the bread, present seven year-old lambs without defect, one young bull, and two rams. They will be a burnt offering to the LORD, together with their grain offerings and drink offerings—a food offering, an aroma pleasing to the LORD.
3:23:19/Then sacrifice one male goat for a sin offering and two lambs, each a year old, for a fellowship offering.
3:23:20/The priest is to wave them, together with the bread of the firstfruits, as a wave offering before the LORD; they are sacred to the LORD for the priest.
3:23:21/On that same day you are to proclaim a sacred assembly and do no regular work. This is to be a lasting ordinance for the generations to come, wherever you live.
3:23:22/When you reap the harvest of your land, do not reap to the very edges of your field or gather the gleanings of your harvest. Leave them for the poor and for the foreigner residing among you. I am the LORD your God.
3:23:23/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:23:24/Tell the Israelites, on the first day of the seventh month you are to have a day of Sabbath rest, a memorial with trumpet blasts, a sacred assembly.
3:23:25/Do no regular work, but present a food offering to the LORD.
3:23:26/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:23:27/Also on the tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. It shall be a sacred assembly for you; you must deny yourselves and present a food offering to the LORD.
3:23:28/Do no work on that day, because it is the Day of Atonement, when atonement is made for you before the LORD your God.
3:23:29/Anyone who does not deny themselves on that day must be cut off from their people.
3:23:30/And anyone who does any work on that day, I will destroy from among their people.
3:23:31/Do no work at all. This is to be a lasting ordinance for the generations to come, wherever you live.
3:23:32/It is a day of Sabbath rest for you, and you must deny yourselves. From the evening of the ninth day of the month until the following evening, you are to observe your Sabbath.
3:23:33/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:23:34/Tell the Israelites, 'The fifteenth day of this seventh month is the Festival of Tabernacles for seven days to the LORD.
3:23:35/On the first day is a sacred assembly; do no regular work.
3:23:36/For seven days present food offerings to the LORD, and on the eighth day hold a sacred assembly and present a food offering to the LORD. It is a solemn gathering; do no regular work.
3:23:37/These are the LORD's appointed festivals, which you are to proclaim as sacred assemblies for presenting food offerings to the LORD—the burnt offerings, grain offerings, sacrifices and drink offerings required for each day.
3:23:38/These offerings are in addition to the LORD's Sabbaths and in addition to your gifts and whatever you have vowed and all the freewill offerings you give to the LORD.
3:23:39/So beginning with the fifteenth day of the seventh month, after you have gathered the crops of the land, celebrate the festival to the LORD for seven days; the first day is a day of Sabbath rest, and the eighth day also is a day of Sabbath rest.
3:23:40/On the first day you are to take branches from luxuriant trees—from palms, willows and other leafy trees—and rejoice before the LORD your God for seven days.
3:23:41/Celebrate this as a festival to the LORD for seven days each year. This is to be a lasting ordinance for the generations to come; celebrate it in the seventh month.
3:23:42/Live in temporary shelters for seven days: All native-born Israelites are to live in such shelters
3:23:43/so your descendants will know that I had the Israelites live in temporary shelters when I brought them out of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.
3:23:44/And Moses announced to the Israelites the appointed festivals of the LORD.
3:24:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:24:2/Tell the children of Israel to bring you pure, beaten olive oil for the light, to keep the lamps burning continuously.
3:24:3/Outside the curtain of the testimony, in the meeting tent, Aaron must arrange it from evening until morning before the LORD continuously: it is to be a perpetual ordinance for all your generations.
3:24:4/He must keep the lamps on the pure lampstand before the LORD continuously.
3:24:5/You must take fine flour and bake twelve loaves from it: each loaf should contain two-tenths of an ephah.
3:24:6/You must place them in two rows, six in each row, on the pure table before the LORD.
3:24:7/And you must place pure frankincense on each row, to serve as a reminder, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
3:24:8/Every Sabbath he must arrange them before the LORD continuously, taken from the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant.
3:24:9/It will belong to Aaron and his sons, and they are to eat it in a holy place: for it is most holy to him from the LORD's offerings made by fire, a perpetual statute.
3:24:10/And the son of an Israelite woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel: and this son of the Israelite woman and a man of Israel fought in the camp;
3:24:11/And the Israelite woman's son blasphemed the Name of the Lord, and cursed. And they brought him to Moses: (his mother's name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan:)
3:24:12/And they detained him, so that the will of the LORD could be made clear to them.
3:24:13/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:24:14/Take the one who cursed outside the camp; and let everyone who heard him lay their hands on his head, and let the entire community stone him.
3:24:15/And you must tell the children of Israel, 'Anyone who curses their God will bear their sin.'
3:24:16/And anyone who blasphemes the name of the LORD must surely be put to death, and the whole community must certainly stone them: both the foreigner and the native-born, when they blaspheme the Name, must be put to death.
3:24:17/Anyone who kills a person must surely be put to death.
3:24:18/Anyone who kills an animal must make restitution for it, life for life.
3:24:19/If anyone injures their neighbor, whatever they have done must be done to them:
3:24:20/Fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; whatever injury they have caused another person must be inflicted on them.
3:24:21/And anyone who kills an animal must make restitution for it, but anyone who kills a person must be put to death.
3:24:22/You are to have the same law for the foreigner and the native-born. I am the LORD your God.
3:24:23/And Moses told the children of Israel to take the one who had cursed outside the camp and stone him with stones. And the children of Israel did as the LORD commanded Moses.
3:25:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying,
3:25:2/Tell the Israelites, when you enter the land I am giving you, the land must observe a Sabbath to the LORD.
3:25:3/For six years you may sow your fields, and for six years you may prune your vineyard and gather its fruits.
3:25:4/But the seventh year will be a Sabbath of rest for the land, a Sabbath to the LORD: you must not sow your fields or prune your vineyard.
3:25:5/You must not harvest what grows of its own accord or gather the grapes from your unpruned vines, because it is a year of rest for the land.
3:25:6/The produce of the land during its Sabbath will provide food for you, your male and female servants, your hired workers, and the temporary residents who live with you.
3:25:7/This produce will also feed your livestock and the wild animals in your land.
3:25:8/You must count off seven Sabbaths of years, seven times seven years, so that the seven Sabbaths of years amount to forty-nine years.
3:25:9/Then you must sound the trumpet loudly on the tenth day of the seventh month, on the Day of Atonement, you will sound the trumpet throughout your entire land.
3:25:10/You must consecrate the fiftieth year and proclaim freedom throughout the land for all its inhabitants. It will be a Jubilee for you; each of you is to return to your property and your family.
3:25:11/That fiftieth year will be a Jubilee for you; do not sow, do not reap what grows of itself, nor gather the grapes from the unpruned vines.
3:25:12/For it is a Jubilee and is to be holy for you; eat only what is taken directly from the fields.
3:25:13/In this Year of Jubilee everyone is to return to their own property.
3:25:14/If you sell something to your neighbor or buy from your neighbor, you must not take advantage of each other.
3:25:15/When you buy from your neighbor, you should do so based on the number of years since the Jubilee. And when you sell to your neighbor, you should base your price on the number of remaining crop years.
3:25:16/If the years are many, you should increase the price, and if the years are few, you should decrease the price, because what is being sold to you is the number of crops.
3:25:17/Do not take advantage of each other, but fear your God; for I am the LORD your God.
3:25:18/Follow my decrees and be careful to obey my laws, and you will live safely in the land.
3:25:19/Then the land will yield its fruit, and you will eat your fill and live there in safety.
3:25:20/If you wonder, 'What will we eat in the seventh year if we do not plant or harvest our crops?'
3:25:21/I will send such a blessing in the sixth year that the land will yield enough for three years.
3:25:22/While you plant in the eighth year, you will eat from the old crop until the ninth year; until its crops come in, you will eat the old food.
3:25:23/The land must not be sold permanently, because the land is mine and you reside in my land as foreigners and strangers.
3:25:24/Throughout the land that you hold as a possession, you must provide for the redemption of the land.
3:25:25/If one of your fellow Israelites becomes poor and sells some of their property, their nearest relative is to come and redeem what their fellow Israelite has sold.
3:25:26/If, however, there is no one to redeem it for them but later they prosper and acquire sufficient means to redeem it themselves,
3:25:27/they are to determine the value for the years since they sold it and refund the balance to the one to whom they sold it; they can then go back to their own property.
3:25:28/But if they do not acquire the means to repay what was sold, what was sold will remain in the possession of the buyer until the Year of Jubilee. It will be returned in the Jubilee, and they can then return to their property.
3:25:29/If anyone sells a residential house in a walled city, they have a year to redeem it; within a full year they may redeem it.
3:25:30/If it is not redeemed before a full year has passed, the house in the walled city shall belong permanently to the buyer and the buyer's descendants; it is not to be returned in the Jubilee.
3:25:31/However, houses in villages without walls around them are to be considered as open country. They can be redeemed, and they are to be returned in the Jubilee.
3:25:32/As for the Levites, they may redeem at any time the houses in the cities of their possession.
3:25:33/If a Levite redeems a house in the city of their possession, then the house that was sold in the city of their possession will be returned in the Jubilee, for the houses in the cities of the Levites are their possession among the Israelites.
3:25:34/But the pastureland belonging to their cities must not be sold; it is their permanent possession.
3:25:35/If your fellow Israelite becomes poor and is unable to support themselves among you, help them as you would a foreigner or a temporary resident, so they can continue to live among you.
3:25:36/Do not take interest or any profit from them, but fear your God, so that your fellow Israelite may continue to live among you.
3:25:37/You must not lend them money at interest or sell them food at a profit.
3:25:38/I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
3:25:39/If any of your fellow Israelites become poor and sell themselves to you, do not make them work as slaves.
3:25:40/They are to be treated as hired workers or temporary residents among you; they are to work for you until the Year of Jubilee.
3:25:41/Then they and their children are to be released, and they will go back to their own clans and to the property of their ancestors.
3:25:42/Because the Israelites are my servants, whom I brought out of Egypt, they must not be sold as slaves.
3:25:43/Do not rule over them ruthlessly, but fear your God.
3:25:44/Your male and female slaves are to come from the nations around you; from them you may buy slaves.
3:25:45/You may also buy some of the temporary residents living among you and members of their clans born in your country, and they will become your property.
3:25:46/You can bequeath them to your children as inherited property and can make them slaves for life, but you must not rule over your fellow Israelites ruthlessly.
3:25:47/If a foreigner or temporary resident among you becomes rich and your fellow Israelite becomes poor and sells themselves to the foreigner living among you or to a member of the foreigner's clan,
3:25:48/after they sell themselves, they may be redeemed. One of their relatives may redeem them:
3:25:49/An uncle or a cousin or any blood relative in their clan may redeem them. Or if they prosper, they may redeem themselves.
3:25:50/They and their buyer are to count the time from the year they sold themselves up to the Year of Jubilee. The price of their release is to be based on the rate for hired workers for that number of years.
3:25:51/If many years remain, they must pay for their redemption a larger share of the price paid for them.
3:25:52/If only a few years remain until the Year of Jubilee, they are to compute that and pay for their redemption accordingly.
3:25:53/They are to be treated as workers hired from year to year; you must see to it that those who buy them do not rule over them ruthlessly.
3:25:54/Even if someone is not redeemed in these years, they and their children are to be released in the Year of Jubilee,
3:25:55/for the Israelites belong to me as servants. They are my servants, whom I brought out of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.
3:26:1/Do not make any idols or carved images for yourselves, nor set up any sculpted stone in your land to worship it: for I am the LORD your God.
3:26:2/Observe my Sabbaths and show deep respect for my sanctuary: I am the LORD.
3:26:3/If you follow my decrees, obey my commands, and put them into action;
3:26:4/Then I will send you rain at the right time, and the land will produce its crops, and the trees of the field will bear fruit.
3:26:5/Your harvesting will continue until grape picking, and grape picking will continue until planting time; you will have plenty of bread to eat and will live securely in your land.
3:26:6/I will grant peace in the land, and you will rest without fear; I will eliminate dangerous animals and prevent war from entering your land.
3:26:7/You will pursue your enemies, and they will fall by the sword before you.
3:26:8/Just five of you will chase a hundred, and a hundred of you will chase ten thousand, and your enemies will fall by the sword before you.
3:26:9/I will look favorably upon you, make you fruitful, increase your numbers, and uphold my covenant with you.
3:26:10/You will eat from the surplus of your previous harvest and need to clear out the old to make room for the new.
3:26:11/I will place my dwelling among you, and I will not reject you.
3:26:12/I will walk among you and be your God, and you will be my people.
3:26:13/I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt so you would no longer be their slaves; I broke the bars of your yoke and enabled you to walk with heads held high.
3:26:14/But if you do not listen to me and do not carry out all these commands;
3:26:15/And if you reject my decrees, and if your soul despises my laws, failing to carry out all my commands and breaking my covenant;
3:26:16/Then I will do this to you: I will bring terror, wasting diseases, and fever that will blind your eyes and sap your strength. You will plant your seed in vain, because your enemies will eat it.
3:26:17/I will set my face against you, and you will be defeated by your enemies; those who hate you will rule over you, and you will flee even when no one is pursuing you.
3:26:18/And if after all this you do not listen to me, I will punish you for your sins seven times over.
3:26:19/I will break the pride of your power; I will make your sky like iron and your ground like bronze.
3:26:20/Your strength will be spent in vain, because your land will not yield its crops, nor will the trees of the land produce their fruit.
3:26:21/If you continue to oppose me and refuse to listen to me, I will increase the plague on you seven times according to your sins.
3:26:22/I will send wild animals to rob you of your children, destroy your livestock, and reduce your numbers until your roads are deserted.
3:26:23/And if you do not reform your ways in response to these things but continue to oppose me;
3:26:24/Then I too will oppose you, and I will punish you again seven times for your sins.
3:26:25/I will bring a sword against you to enforce the terms of my covenant. When you gather in your cities, I will send a plague among you, and you will be handed over to the enemy.
3:26:26/When I cut off your supply of bread, ten women will bake your bread in one oven, and they will ration your bread by weight; you will eat but not be satisfied.
3:26:27/And if in spite of this you do not listen to me but continue to oppose me;
3:26:28/Then I will act against you in wrathful opposition; I myself will punish you seven times for your sins.
3:26:29/You will eat the flesh of your sons and daughters.
3:26:30/I will destroy your high places, cut down your incense altars, and pile your remains on the remains of your idols, and my soul will detest you.
3:26:31/I will lay waste to your cities and make your sanctuaries desolate, and I will not savor the fragrance of your sweet aromas.
3:26:32/I will turn the land into a desolation; your enemies who settle in it will be appalled by it.
3:26:33/I will scatter you among the nations, and I will draw out a sword after you; your land will become desolate and your cities will be in ruins.
3:26:34/Then the land will enjoy its sabbaths as long as it lies desolate and you are in your enemies' land; then the land will rest and enjoy its sabbaths.
3:26:35/As long as it lies desolate, it will have the rest it did not have during your sabbaths when you lived on it.
3:26:36/As for those of you who are left, I will make their hearts so fearful in the lands of their enemies that the sound of a windblown leaf will put them to flight; they will run as though fleeing from the sword and fall, even though no one is pursuing them.
3:26:37/They will stumble over one another as though fleeing from the sword, even though no one is pursuing them. So you will not be able to stand before your enemies.
3:26:38/You will perish among the nations; the land of your enemies will consume you.
3:26:39/Those of you who are left will waste away in your enemies' lands because of their sins; also because of their ancestors' sins, they will waste away with them.
3:26:40/But if they confess their sins and the sins of their ancestors—their unfaithfulness and their opposition to me,
3:26:41/Which made me oppose them and send them into the land of their enemies—then when their uncircumcised hearts are humbled and they pay for their sin,
3:26:42/I will remember my covenant with Jacob and my covenant with Isaac and my covenant with Abraham, and I will remember the land.
3:26:43/The land will be abandoned by them and will enjoy its sabbaths while it lies desolate without them; they will pay for their sins because they rejected my decrees and abhorred my laws.
3:26:44/Yet in spite of this, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them or abhor them so as to destroy them completely, breaking my covenant with them. I am the LORD their God.
3:26:45/But for their sake, I will remember the covenant with their ancestors whom I brought out of Egypt in the sight of the nations to be their God. I am the LORD.
3:26:46/These are the decrees, laws, and regulations that the LORD established between himself and the Israelites at Mount Sinai through Moses.
3:27:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
3:27:2/Tell the Israelites, when someone makes a special vow, the people shall belong to the LORD, valued as you determine.
3:27:3/Your valuation for a male between twenty and sixty years old shall be fifty shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel.
3:27:4/If it's a female, then your valuation shall be thirty shekels.
3:27:5/For someone five to twenty years old, your valuation shall be twenty shekels for a male and ten shekels for a female.
3:27:6/For a child one month to five years old, your valuation shall be five shekels of silver for a male and three shekels for a female.
3:27:7/For anyone sixty years old or older, your valuation shall be fifteen shekels for a male and ten shekels for a female.
3:27:8/But if someone is too poor for your valuation, they shall present themselves to the priest, who will set a value according to what the person can afford.
3:27:9/If it's an animal that can be offered to the LORD, anything given to the LORD becomes holy.
3:27:10/It must not be exchanged or replaced, whether good for bad or bad for good. If anyone does exchange one animal for another, both the original and the replacement become holy.
3:27:11/If it's an unclean animal that cannot be offered to the LORD, it must be presented to the priest.
3:27:12/The priest will set its value, whether high or low. As the priest values it, so it will be.
3:27:13/If the owner wishes to buy it back, they must add a fifth to your valuation.
3:27:14/When someone dedicates their house as holy to the LORD, the priest will determine its value, whether high or low. As the priest values it, so it will stand.
3:27:15/If the person dedicating it wants to buy it back, they must add a fifth to your valuation, and it will be theirs again.
3:27:16/If someone dedicates part of their land to the LORD, your valuation will be based on its seed requirement: fifty shekels of silver for an homer of barley seed.
3:27:17/If they dedicate their field from the Year of Jubilee, it will be valued as you determine.
3:27:18/But if they dedicate their field after the Jubilee, the priest will calculate the price based on the years remaining until the next Jubilee, and it will be reduced from your valuation.
3:27:19/If the one who dedicated the field decides to buy it back, they must add a fifth to your valuation, and it will be confirmed to them.
3:27:20/If they do not redeem the field, or if they have sold the field to someone else, it cannot be redeemed anymore.
3:27:21/But when the field is released in the Jubilee, it will become holy to the LORD, like a field devoted; it will belong to the priest.
3:27:22/If someone dedicates to the LORD a field they have bought, which is not part of their ancestral property,
3:27:23/The priest will calculate its value up to the Year of Jubilee, and on that day, they will pay the valuation as something holy to the LORD.
3:27:24/In the Year of Jubilee, the field will return to the person from whom it was bought, the original owner of the land.
3:27:25/All your valuations shall be according to the sanctuary shekel: twenty gerahs to the shekel.
3:27:26/Only the firstborn of animals, which are already the LORD's as firstborn, no one may dedicate; whether an ox or a sheep, it belongs to the LORD.
3:27:27/If it's an unclean animal, then it can be redeemed at your valuation plus a fifth. If it is not redeemed, then it shall be sold at your valuation.
3:27:28/However, no devoted thing that someone devotes to the LORD, whether human, animal, or field of their possession, can be sold or redeemed; every devoted thing is most holy to the LORD.
3:27:29/No person devoted to destruction can be ransomed; they must be put to death.
3:27:30/All the tithe of the land, whether from the seeds of the land or the fruit of the trees, belongs to the LORD; it is holy to the LORD.
3:27:31/If anyone wishes to redeem any of their tithe, they must add a fifth to it.
3:27:32/Regarding the tithe of the herd or flock, every tenth animal that passes under the shepherd's rod will be holy to the LORD.
3:27:33/They must not inspect whether it is good or bad, nor can they substitute it. If they do substitute it, both the original and the substitute become holy and cannot be redeemed.
3:27:34/These are the commandments the LORD gave Moses for the Israelites on Mount Sinai.
4:1:1/The LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the meeting tent, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had left Egypt, saying,
4:1:2/"Count all the members of the entire community of Israel by their families and ancestral houses, listing every man by name, one by one.
4:1:3/From the age of twenty years and older, all who are fit for military service in Israel: you and Aaron are to register them by their divisions.
4:1:4/You must have one representative from each tribe, each one the head of his family.
4:1:5/These are the names of the men who will assist you: from Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur.
4:1:6/From Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
4:1:7/From Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab.
4:1:8/From Issachar, Nethaneel son of Zuar.
4:1:9/From Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.
4:1:10/From the descendants of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
4:1:11/From Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.
4:1:12/From Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
4:1:13/From Asher, Pagiel son of Ocran.
4:1:14/From Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.
4:1:15/From Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.
4:1:16/These were the leaders of the community, chiefs of the ancestral tribes, heads of the clans of Israel.
4:1:17/Moses and Aaron took these men who had been named,
4:1:18/And they gathered the entire assembly together on the first day of the second month. They registered the people by their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, individually.
4:1:19/As the LORD had commanded Moses, so he counted them in the wilderness of Sinai.
4:1:20/The descendants of Reuben, Israel's firstborn, by their generations, by their families, by their ancestral houses, counting every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to serve in the army;
4:1:21/The count of the tribe of Reuben was forty-six thousand five hundred.
4:1:22/From the descendants of Simeon, by their generations, by their families, by their ancestral houses, those who were counted, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, every male able to serve in the army;
4:1:23/The count of the tribe of Simeon was fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
4:1:24/From the descendants of Gad, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:25/The count of the tribe of Gad was forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
4:1:26/From the descendants of Judah, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:27/The count of the tribe of Judah was seventy-four thousand six hundred.
4:1:28/From the descendants of Issachar, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:29/The count of the tribe of Issachar was fifty-four thousand four hundred.
4:1:30/From the descendants of Zebulun, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:31/The count of the tribe of Zebulun was fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
4:1:32/From the descendants of Joseph, namely, from the descendants of Ephraim, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:33/The count of the tribe of Ephraim was forty thousand five hundred.
4:1:34/From the descendants of Manasseh, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:35/The count of the tribe of Manasseh was thirty-two thousand two hundred.
4:1:36/From the descendants of Benjamin, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:37/The count of the tribe of Benjamin was thirty-five thousand four hundred.
4:1:38/From the descendants of Dan, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:39/The count of the tribe of Dan was sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
4:1:40/From the descendants of Asher, by their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:41/The count of the tribe of Asher was forty-one thousand five hundred.
4:1:42/From the descendants of Naphtali, throughout their generations, after their families, by their ancestral houses, according to the number of names from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army;
4:1:43/The count of the tribe of Naphtali was fifty-three thousand four hundred.
4:1:44/These are the ones who were counted, whom Moses and Aaron numbered, along with the twelve leaders of Israel, each one representing his family.
4:1:45/So all those counted of the children of Israel, by their ancestral houses, from twenty years old and upward, all able to serve in the army in Israel;
4:1:46/The total number counted was six hundred three thousand five hundred and fifty.
4:1:47/But the Levites, according to the tribe of their fathers, were not counted among them.
4:1:48/For the LORD had spoken to Moses, saying,
4:1:49/"Do not count the tribe of Levi, nor take a census of them among the children of Israel.
4:1:50/But you shall appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the covenant, all its furnishings, and everything that belongs to it. They are to carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings, serve in it, and encamp around it.
4:1:51/When the tabernacle is to move, the Levites are to take it down, and when it is to be set up, the Levites shall erect it. Any unauthorized person who comes near it must be put to death.
4:1:52/The Israelites will camp each by his own standard, with the banners of their families, around the tent of meeting at a distance.
4:1:53/But the Levites shall camp around the tabernacle of the covenant, so that there will be no wrath on the congregation of the children of Israel. The Levites are to maintain the guardianship of the tabernacle of the covenant.
4:1:54/The children of Israel did everything just as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:2:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
4:2:2/Every Israelite must camp under their own flag, with the symbols of their ancestors' families: they must camp some distance around the Tent of Meeting.
4:2:3/On the east side, towards the sunrise, the camp of Judah shall set up under their standard, with Nahshon son of Amminadab as the leader of the people of Judah.
4:2:4/Their army, with those counted, totaled seventy-four thousand six hundred.
4:2:5/Next to them, the tribe of Issachar will camp: Nethaneel son of Zuar will lead the people of Issachar.
4:2:6/Their army, with those counted, totaled fifty-four thousand four hundred.
4:2:7/Next, the tribe of Zebulun: Eliab son of Helon will lead the people of Zebulun.
4:2:8/Their army, with those counted, totaled fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
4:2:9/The total number in the camp of Judah was one hundred eighty-six thousand four hundred, arranged in their armies. They will move out first.
4:2:10/On the south side will be the camp of Reuben under their standard, with Elizur son of Shedeur as the leader of the people of Reuben.
4:2:11/Their army, with those counted, totaled forty-six thousand five hundred.
4:2:12/Next to them will camp the tribe of Simeon: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai will lead the people of Simeon.
4:2:13/Their army, with those counted, totaled fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
4:2:14/Next, the tribe of Gad: Eliasaph son of Reuel will lead the people of Gad.
4:2:15/Their army, with those counted, totaled forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
4:2:16/The total number in the camp of Reuben was one hundred fifty-one thousand four hundred fifty, arranged in their armies. They will move out second.
4:2:17/Then the Tent of Meeting, with the camp of the Levites, will move out in the middle of the camps. Each group will move out in the same order they camp, by their flags.
4:2:18/On the west side will be the camp of Ephraim under their standard, with Elishama son of Ammihud as the leader of the people of Ephraim.
4:2:19/Their army, with those counted, totaled forty thousand five hundred.
4:2:20/Next to them will be the tribe of Manasseh: Gamaliel son of Pedahzur will lead the people of Manasseh.
4:2:21/Their army, with those counted, totaled thirty-two thousand two hundred.
4:2:22/Next, the tribe of Benjamin: Abidan son of Gideoni will lead the people of Benjamin.
4:2:23/Their army, with those counted, totaled thirty-five thousand four hundred.
4:2:24/The total number in the camp of Ephraim was one hundred eight thousand one hundred, arranged in their armies. They will move out third.
4:2:25/The camp of Dan will be on the north side under their standard, with Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai as the leader of the people of Dan.
4:2:26/Their army, with those counted, totaled sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
4:2:27/Next to them will camp the tribe of Asher: Pagiel son of Ocran will lead the people of Asher.
4:2:28/Their army, with those counted, totaled forty-one thousand five hundred.
4:2:29/Next, the tribe of Naphtali: Ahira son of Enan will lead the people of Naphtali.
4:2:30/Their army, with those counted, totaled fifty-three thousand four hundred.
4:2:31/The total number in the camp of Dan was one hundred fifty-seven thousand six hundred. They will move out last, under their flags.
4:2:32/These are the counts of the Israelites by their ancestral houses: the total number in the camps, by their armies, was six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.
4:2:33/But the Levites were not counted among the Israelites, as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:2:34/The Israelites did everything the LORD commanded Moses: they camped by their flags and moved out each according to their families, by their ancestral houses.
4:3:1/These are the family records of Aaron and Moses at the time the LORD spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
4:3:2/Here are the names of Aaron's sons: Nadab the firstborn, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
4:3:3/These are the names of Aaron's sons, the priests who were anointed and set apart to serve as priests.
4:3:4/Nadab and Abihu died before the LORD when they offered unauthorized fire before the LORD in the wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children. Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests under the supervision of Aaron their father.
4:3:5/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:3:6/Bring the tribe of Levi close and present them before Aaron the priest so they can assist him.
4:3:7/They are to take care of his responsibilities and the responsibilities of the whole community before the Tent of Meeting by performing the duties of the tabernacle.
4:3:8/They are to take care of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting, fulfilling the obligations of the Israelites by performing the duties of the tabernacle.
4:3:9/You are to assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons; they are entirely given to him from among the Israelites.
4:3:10/You shall appoint Aaron and his sons to serve as priests. Anyone else who approaches the sanctuary must be put to death.
4:3:11/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:3:12/I have taken the Levites from among the Israelites in place of every firstborn who opens the womb among the Israelites. Therefore, the Levites are mine;
4:3:13/Because every firstborn is mine. On the day I struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, I set apart for myself every firstborn in Israel, both man and animal. They are to be mine. I am the LORD.
4:3:14/And the LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,
4:3:15/Count the Levites by their ancestral houses and by families. Every male a month old or more you must count.
4:3:16/And Moses counted them according to the word of the LORD, as he was commanded.
4:3:17/These were the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
4:3:18/These are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei.
4:3:19/And the sons of Kohath by their families: Amram, Izehar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
4:3:20/And the sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their ancestral houses.
4:3:21/From Gershon came the Libnite and Shimeite families; these were the Gershonite families.
4:3:22/Those counted of them, according to the number of all the males a month old or more, were seven thousand five hundred.
4:3:23/The Gershonite families are to camp behind the tabernacle to the west.
4:3:24/And the leader of the ancestral house of the Gershonites shall be Eliasaph son of Lael.
4:3:25/The responsibilities of the Gershonite sons in the Tent of Meeting include the tabernacle, the tent, its covering, the curtain for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,
4:3:26/And the curtains of the courtyard, the curtain for the entrance of the courtyard surrounding the tabernacle and altar, and their ropes—all the work related to these.
4:3:27/From Kohath came the Amramite, Izeharite, Hebronite, and Uzzielite families; these were the Kohathite families.
4:3:28/Counting all the males a month old or more, there were eight thousand six hundred responsible for the care of the sanctuary.
4:3:29/The families of the sons of Kohath are to camp on the south side of the tabernacle.
4:3:30/And the leader of the ancestral house of the Kohathite families shall be Elizaphan son of Uzziel.
4:3:31/Their duties include the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the sacred vessels they use to minister, the curtain, and all the service related to these.
4:3:32/Eleazar son of Aaron the priest is to be chief over the leaders of the Levites, with oversight of those who keep the charge of the sanctuary.
4:3:33/From Merari came the Mahlite and Mushite families; these were the Merarite families.
4:3:34/Those counted of them, according to the number of all the males a month old or more, were six thousand two hundred.
4:3:35/And the leader of the ancestral house of the families of Merari was Zuriel son of Abihail. They are to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
4:3:36/Under the care and responsibility of the sons of Merari shall be the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, posts, bases, all its equipment, and everything related to their use,
4:3:37/As well as the posts of the surrounding courtyard, their bases, pegs, and ropes.
4:3:38/But those who camp in front of the tabernacle on the east, in front of the Tent of Meeting toward the sunrise, are Moses, Aaron, and his sons, maintaining the sanctuary on behalf of the Israelites. Anyone else who approaches must be put to death.
4:3:39/All the Levites whom Moses and Aaron counted at the command of the LORD, by their families, all the males a month old or more, were twenty-two thousand.
4:3:40/And the LORD said to Moses, "Count all the firstborn males of the Israelites from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.
4:3:41/You are to take the Levites for me—I am the LORD—in place of all the firstborn among the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites in place of all the firstborn among the livestock of the Israelites."
4:3:42/And Moses counted, as the LORD commanded him, all the firstborn among the Israelites.
4:3:43/And all the firstborn males by the number of names from a month old and upward, of those counted, were twenty-two thousand two hundred and seventy-three.
4:3:44/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:3:45/"Take the Levites in place of all the firstborn among the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites in place of their livestock. The Levites shall be mine. I am the LORD.
4:3:46/And for the redemption of the two hundred and seventy-three of the firstborn of the Israelites, who exceed the number of the Levites,
4:3:47/You shall take five shekels per head; you shall take them according to the sanctuary shekel (twenty gerahs to the shekel).
4:3:48/And you shall give the money with which the excess number of them is redeemed to Aaron and his sons."
4:3:49/And Moses took the redemption money from those who were over and above those redeemed by the Levites.
4:3:50/From the firstborn of the Israelites he took the money, one thousand three hundred and sixty-five shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
4:3:51/And Moses gave the money from those redeemed to Aaron and his sons, as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:4:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
4:4:2/Count the descendants of Kohath from among the Levites, by their families and ancestral houses,
4:4:3/From thirty years old up to fifty years old, all who are fit to serve in the work at the tent of meeting.
4:4:4/This is the duty of the Kohathites in the tent of meeting, concerning the most sacred objects:
4:4:5/When the camp is to move, Aaron and his sons must come and take down the curtain of the sanctuary and cover the ark of the covenant with it.
4:4:6/Then they must place on it a covering of fine leather and spread a cloth of pure blue over that, and insert its carrying poles.
4:4:7/On the table of the Presence, they must spread a blue cloth and place on it the plates, ladles, bowls, and jars for pouring; and the bread of the Presence must remain on it.
4:4:8/They must spread a scarlet cloth over them and cover that with a fine leather covering, and insert its carrying poles.
4:4:9/They must take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for lighting, its lamps, lamp snuffers, trays, and all the oil vessels used with it.
4:4:10/They must place it and all its accessories inside a covering of fine leather and put it on a carrying frame.
4:4:11/On the gold altar, they must spread a blue cloth and cover it with a fine leather covering, and insert its carrying poles.
4:4:12/They must take all the utensils used in the sanctuary service, wrap them in a blue cloth, cover that with a fine leather covering, and place them on a carrying frame.
4:4:13/They must remove the ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it.
4:4:14/They must place on it all the utensils used for tending the altar, including the firepans, meat forks, shovels, and basins, and cover them with a fine leather covering, and insert its carrying poles.
4:4:15/After Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the sacred furnishings as the camp is about to move, the Kohathites are to come to carry them, but they must not touch the sacred objects or they will die. These are the responsibilities of the Kohathites with regard to the tent of meeting.
4:4:16/Eleazar son of Aaron the priest is to oversee the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the regular grain offering, the anointing oil, the oversight of the entire tabernacle and everything in it, including the sanctuary and its furnishings.
4:4:17/And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
4:4:18/Do not cut off the tribe of the Kohathites from among the Levites.
4:4:19/But deal with them in such a way that they may live and not die when they approach the most sacred objects. Aaron and his sons are to go in and assign each man his task and his carrying load.
4:4:20/But they must not go in to look at the sacred objects even for a moment, or they will die.
4:4:21/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:4:22/Also count the descendants of Gershon, by their families and ancestral houses;
4:4:23/From thirty years old up to fifty years old, count them; all who enter to perform the service, to do the work in the tent of meeting.
4:4:24/This is the service of the Gershonite clans in serving and carrying burdens:
4:4:25/They are to carry the curtains of the tabernacle, the tent of meeting, its covering, and the fine leather covering that is over it, the curtains for the entrance of the tent of meeting,
4:4:26/The hangings of the courtyard, the curtain for the entrance of the gate of the courtyard that surrounds the tabernacle and the altar, their ropes, and all the equipment related to their use. They are to perform all these services.
4:4:27/Everything that is to be done with these items, Aaron and his sons are to direct the Gershonites in all their tasks and responsibilities.
4:4:28/This is the service of the Gershonite clans at the tent of meeting, and their duties are to be under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
4:4:29/As for the sons of Merari, you are to record them by their clans and families;
4:4:30/Count them from thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who enters the service to work at the tent of meeting.
4:4:31/This is their duty in their service at the tent of meeting: to carry the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, posts, bases,
4:4:32/And the posts of the surrounding courtyard with their bases, pegs, ropes, and all their equipment and service. You are to list by name the items they are responsible for carrying.
4:4:33/This is the service of the Merarite clans in their duties at the tent of meeting, under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
4:4:34/Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of the community counted the Kohathites by their clans and families,
4:4:35/From thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tent of meeting.
4:4:36/And those counted by their clans were two thousand seven hundred and fifty.
4:4:37/These were the ones counted from the Kohathite clans, all who served in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the LORD's command through Moses.
4:4:38/The Gershonites were counted by their clans and families,
4:4:39/From thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tent of meeting,
4:4:40/And those counted by their clans and families were two thousand six hundred and thirty.
4:4:41/These were the ones counted from the Gershonite clans, all who served in the tent of meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the LORD's command.
4:4:42/The families of the sons of Merari were counted by their clans and families,
4:4:43/From thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who entered the service for work in the tent of meeting,
4:4:44/And those counted by their clans were three thousand and two hundred.
4:4:45/These were the ones counted from the Merarite clans, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the LORD's command through Moses.
4:4:46/All the Levites whom Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of Israel counted by their clans and families,
4:4:47/From thirty years old up to fifty years old, everyone who came to do the service of ministry and the service of carrying in the tent of meeting,
4:4:48/Were eight thousand five hundred and eighty,
4:4:49/According to the LORD's command, they were counted by Moses, each according to his service and his burden. Thus, they were counted by him, as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:5:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:5:2/Tell the Israelites to send out of the camp anyone with leprosy, anyone who has a discharge, and anyone who is unclean because of a dead body.
4:5:3/Both men and women must be sent out; send them outside the camp so they will not defile their camp, where I dwell among them.
4:5:4/And the Israelites did so, sending them outside the camp. Just as the LORD had instructed Moses, so the Israelites did.
4:5:5/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:5:6/Tell the Israelites, when a man or woman commits any sin that people commit, by breaking faith with the LORD, and that person is guilty,
4:5:7/They must confess the sin they have committed. They must make full restitution for their wrong, add one-fifth to it, and give it to the one they have wronged.
4:5:8/But if the person has no relative to whom restitution can be made for the wrong, the restitution for the wrong must go to the LORD for the priest, in addition to the ram of atonement by which atonement is made for the person.
4:5:9/Every contribution from all the holy things of the Israelites, which they bring to the priest, shall belong to him.
4:5:10/And each person's sacred donations shall be theirs. Whatever anyone gives to the priest shall belong to him.
4:5:11/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:5:12/Tell the Israelites, if any man's wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,
4:5:13/And another man has sexual relations with her, and it is hidden from her husband's eyes, and she is undetected, although she has defiled herself, and there is no witness against her, nor was she caught in the act,
4:5:14/And if feelings of jealousy come over her husband and he suspects his wife, whether she is defiled or not,
4:5:15/Then the man must bring his wife to the priest. He must also bring an offering for her, one-tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He must not pour oil on it or put incense on it, because it is a grain offering of jealousy, a grain offering of remembrance, bringing sin to mind.
4:5:16/And the priest shall bring her forward and have her stand before the LORD.
