4:5:17/And the priest shall take holy water in a clay jar; and taking dust from the floor of the tabernacle, the priest shall put it into the water.
4:5:18/Then the priest shall have the woman stand before the LORD, uncover the woman's head, and place in her hands the grain offering of remembrance, which is the jealousy offering. The priest shall hold in his hand the bitter water that brings a curse.
4:5:19/And the priest shall put her under oath and say to the woman, "If no man has slept with you and if you have not gone astray and become unclean while married to your husband, be immune to this bitter water that brings a curse.
4:5:20/But if you have gone astray while married to your husband and you have become unclean because a man other than your husband has had sexual relations with you,"
4:5:21/Then the priest shall put the woman under the curse of the oath, and the priest shall say to the woman, "May the LORD make you a curse and an oath among your people when the LORD causes your thigh to waste away and your abdomen to swell.
4:5:22/And this water that brings a curse shall go into your stomach, making your abdomen swell and your thigh waste away." And the woman shall say, "Amen, amen."
4:5:23/And the priest shall write these curses in a document and then wash them off into the bitter water.
4:5:24/He shall make the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and the water that brings a curse shall enter her to become bitter.
4:5:25/Then the priest shall take the grain offering of jealousy from the woman's hand, wave the offering before the LORD, and bring it to the altar.
4:5:26/And the priest shall take a handful of the grain offering as its memorial portion and burn it on the altar. Afterward, he shall make the woman drink the water.
4:5:27/When he has made her drink the water, if she has defiled herself and been unfaithful to her husband, the water that brings a curse will enter her and cause bitter suffering; her abdomen will swell, and her thigh will waste away, and the woman will become a curse among her people.
4:5:28/But if the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, she will be free and able to conceive children.
4:5:29/This is the law of jealousy when a wife, while under her husband's authority, goes astray and defiles herself,
4:5:30/Or when feelings of jealousy come over a man because he suspects his wife. The man is to have the woman stand before the LORD, and the priest is to carry out all this law on her.
4:5:31/The man will be free from guilt, but the woman will bear the consequences of her sin.
4:6:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:6:2/Tell the Israelites, when any man or woman decides to make a special vow as a Nazarite, dedicating themselves to the LORD,
4:6:3/They must abstain from wine and other alcoholic drinks. They must not drink vinegar made from wine or from other alcoholic drinks, nor drink grape juice, nor eat fresh or dried grapes.
4:6:4/Throughout the period of their vow, they must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, not even the seeds or skins.
4:6:5/For the entire time of their vow, no razor may be used on their head. They must remain holy until the period of their dedication to the LORD is over; they must let their hair grow long.
4:6:6/Throughout the period of dedication to the LORD, they must not go near a dead body.
4:6:7/They must not make themselves ceremonially unclean for their father, mother, brother, or sister when they die, because the symbol of their dedication to God is on their head.
4:6:8/For the whole period of their vow, they are holy to the LORD.
4:6:9/If someone dies suddenly in their presence, thus defiling their dedicated head, they must shave their head on the day of their cleansing—the seventh day.
4:6:10/On the eighth day, they must bring two doves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
4:6:11/The priest is to offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to make atonement for them because they sinned by being in the presence of the dead body. That same day they are to reconsecrate their head,
4:6:12/They must rededicate themselves to the LORD for the same period of dedication and bring a year-old male lamb as a guilt offering. The previous period of dedication will not count because they became defiled.
4:6:13/This is the law of the Nazarite when the period of their dedication is over: They are to be brought to the entrance of the tent of meeting.
4:6:14/There they are to present their offerings to the LORD: a year-old male lamb without defect for a burnt offering, a year-old ewe lamb without defect for a sin offering, a ram without defect for a fellowship offering,
4:6:15/along with a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil, together with their grain and drink offerings.
4:6:16/The priest is to present them before the LORD and make the sin offering and the burnt offering.
4:6:17/He is to present the ram as a fellowship offering to the LORD, together with the basket of unleavened bread; the priest shall also make the grain offering and the drink offering.
4:6:18/Then the Nazarite is to shave their dedicated head at the entrance to the tent of meeting, take the hair, and put it in the fire that is under the sacrifice of the fellowship offering.
4:6:19/After the Nazarite has shaved off the hair of their dedication, the priest is to place in their hands a boiled shoulder of the ram, and one unleavened cake and one unleavened wafer from the basket.
4:6:20/The priest shall then wave them as a wave offering before the LORD. This is holy for the priest, together with the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented. After that, the Nazarite may drink wine.
4:6:21/This is the law of the Nazarite who vows their offering to the LORD in accordance with their dedication, in addition to whatever else they can afford. They must fulfill the vow they have made, according to the law of the Nazarite.
4:6:22/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:6:23/Tell Aaron and his sons, 'This is how you are to bless the Israelites. Say to them,
4:6:24/May the LORD bless you and protect you.
4:6:25/May the LORD make his face shine on you and be gracious to you.
4:6:26/May the LORD look upon you with favor and give you peace.'
4:6:27/So they will put my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them.
4:7:1/On the day Moses finished setting up the tabernacle, anointing and consecrating it, along with all its furnishings, the altar, and all its vessels, anointing and consecrating them as well;
