4:7:89/When Moses entered the Tent of Meeting to speak with the LORD, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the Ark of the Covenant, between the two cherubim; and it spoke to him.
4:8:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:8:2/Tell Aaron that when he lights the lamps, the seven lamps should illuminate the area in front of the lampstand.
4:8:3/And Aaron did exactly that; he lit the lamps so they shone in front of the lampstand, just as the LORD had instructed Moses.
4:8:4/The lampstand was made of hammered gold, from its base to its flowers, it was all crafted from hammered work: according to the design that the LORD had shown Moses, that's how he made the lampstand.
4:8:5/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:8:6/Select the Levites from among the Israelites, and purify them.
4:8:7/To purify them, do this: Sprinkle purifying water on them, have them shave all their body hair, and wash their clothes. Then they will be clean.
4:8:8/Next, they should take a young bull with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, and you must take another young bull for a sin offering.
4:8:9/Bring the Levites in front of the Tent of Meeting and gather the entire Israelite community.
4:8:10/Bring the Levites before the LORD, and the Israelites shall lay their hands on the Levites.
4:8:11/Aaron will present the Levites before the LORD as an offering from the Israelites, so they may perform the service of the LORD.
4:8:12/The Levites shall lay their hands on the heads of the bulls: you are to offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to the LORD, to make atonement for the Levites.
4:8:13/Place the Levites before Aaron and his sons and present them as an offering to the LORD.
4:8:14/In this way, you will set apart the Levites from among the Israelites, and the Levites will be mine.
4:8:15/Afterward, the Levites may enter to serve at the Tent of Meeting. You must purify them and present them as an offering.
4:8:16/For they are wholly given to me from among the Israelites; in place of all who open the womb, the firstborn of all the Israelites, I have taken them for myself.
4:8:17/For all the firstborn among the Israelites are mine, both human and animal. On the day I struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, I set them apart for myself.
4:8:18/And I have chosen the Levites in place of all the firstborn among the Israelites.
4:8:19/I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons from among the Israelites, to perform the service for the Israelites in the Tent of Meeting and to make atonement for the Israelites, so that no plague will strike the Israelites when they come near the sanctuary.
4:8:20/And Moses, Aaron, and the entire Israelite community did with the Levites just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
4:8:21/The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes; and Aaron presented them as an offering before the LORD and made atonement for them to purify them.
4:8:22/After that, the Levites went in to perform their service in the Tent of Meeting under Aaron and his sons' supervision, just as the LORD had instructed Moses regarding the Levites.
4:8:23/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:8:24/This applies to the Levites: from twenty-five years old and upward they shall enter to serve in the Tent of Meeting.
4:8:25/But at the age of fifty, they must retire from their service and not serve anymore.
4:8:26/However, they may assist their brothers in the Tent of Meeting by keeping watch, but they shall not perform the service. This is how you are to assign duties to the Levites.
4:9:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had left Egypt, saying,
4:9:2/Instruct the children of Israel to observe the Passover at its scheduled time.
4:9:3/On the fourteenth day of this month, at dusk, you shall celebrate it at its scheduled time: you must follow all its rituals and ceremonies.
4:9:4/And Moses told the children of Israel that they should observe the Passover.
4:9:5/So they observed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month at dusk in the wilderness of Sinai: just as the LORD had commanded Moses, so did the children of Israel.
4:9:6/However, there were some men who were impure because of a human corpse, so they could not observe the Passover on that day; and they presented themselves before Moses and Aaron on that day.
4:9:7/And these men said to him, "We are impure because of a human corpse. Why should we be excluded from presenting the LORD's offering at its appointed time among the children of Israel?"
4:9:8/And Moses replied to them, "Wait here, and I will find out what the LORD commands concerning you."
4:9:9/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:9:10/Tell the children of Israel, 'If anyone among you or your descendants is unclean because of a corpse, or is on a distant journey, he must still observe the Passover for the LORD.
4:9:11/They must observe it on the fourteenth day of the second month at dusk, eating it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
4:9:12/They must not leave any of it until morning, nor break any of its bones; they must follow all the regulations for the Passover.
4:9:13/But if a person is clean and not on a journey, yet fails to observe the Passover, that individual will be cut off from his people because he did not present the LORD's offering at the appointed time; that person will bear the consequences of his sin.
4:9:14/And if a foreigner resides among you and wants to observe the Passover to the LORD, he must do so according to the Passover's regulations and customs. You shall have the same law for both the foreigner and the native-born.
4:9:15/On the day the tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered it, the tent of the covenant; and in the evening it looked like fire over the tabernacle until morning.
4:9:16/This was always the case: the cloud covered it by day, and it appeared like fire by night.
4:9:17/Whenever the cloud lifted from above the tent, the Israelites would set out; wherever the cloud settled, the Israelites would encamp.
4:9:18/At the LORD's command the Israelites set out, and at his command they encamped. As long as the cloud stayed over the tabernacle, they remained in camp.
4:9:19/When the cloud remained over the tabernacle for a long time, the Israelites obeyed the LORD's order and did not set out.
4:9:20/Sometimes the cloud was over the tabernacle for only a few days; at the LORD's command they would encamp, and then at his command they would set out.
4:9:21/Sometimes the cloud stayed from evening until morning; when the cloud lifted in the morning, they set out. Whether by day or by night, whenever the cloud lifted, they set out.
4:9:22/Whether the cloud stayed over the tabernacle for two days or a month or a year, the Israelites would remain in camp and not set out; but when it lifted, they would set out.
4:9:23/At the LORD's command they encamped, and at the LORD's command they set out. They followed the LORD's orders, according to his command through Moses.
4:10:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:10:2/Make two trumpets out of silver; you shall make them from a single piece: so you can use them to call the assembly together and to signal the moving of the camps.
4:10:3/When they are blown, the entire assembly shall gather to you at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
4:10:4/If only one trumpet is blown, then the leaders, who are the heads of the thousands of Israel, shall gather to you.
4:10:5/When you sound a blast, the camps on the east side shall set out.
4:10:6/When you sound a blast for the second time, the camps on the south side shall begin their journey: sound a blast for their departure.
4:10:7/But when the assembly is to be gathered, you shall blow the trumpets without sounding an alarm.
4:10:8/The sons of Aaron, the priests, are to blow the trumpets; this shall be a perpetual ordinance for you and your descendants.
4:10:9/If you go to war in your land against an aggressor, you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets; then you will be remembered before the LORD your God and saved from your enemies.
4:10:10/Also on your days of celebration, during your festivals, and at the start of your months, you shall blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings and your peace offerings; they shall serve as a reminder of you before your God: I am the LORD your God.
4:10:11/On the twentieth day of the second month, in the second year, the cloud lifted from above the tabernacle of the covenant.
4:10:12/The Israelites set out from the Sinai wilderness, and the cloud settled in the Paran wilderness.
4:10:13/They began their journey at the LORD's command through Moses.
4:10:14/The division of the camp of Judah set out first, according to their ranks, with Nahshon son of Amminadab in command.
4:10:15/Over the division of the tribe of Issachar was Nethanel son of Zuar.
4:10:16/And over the division of the tribe of Zebulun was Eliab son of Helon.
4:10:17/The tabernacle was dismantled, and the Gershonites and Merarites, who were carrying the tabernacle, set out.
4:10:18/The division of the camp of Reuben set out according to their ranks, with Elizur son of Shedeur in command.
4:10:19/Over the division of the tribe of Simeon was Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
4:10:20/And over the division of the tribe of Gad was Eliasaph son of Deuel.
4:10:21/The Kohathites set out, carrying the holy objects; the tabernacle was to be set up before they arrived.
4:10:22/The division of the camp of Ephraim set out according to their ranks, with Elishama son of Ammihud in command.
4:10:23/Over the division of the tribe of Manasseh was Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
4:10:24/And over the division of the tribe of Benjamin was Abidan son of Gideoni.
4:10:25/The division of the camp of Dan, acting as the rear guard for all the camps, set out according to their ranks, with Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai in command.
4:10:26/Over the division of the tribe of Asher was Pagiel son of Ocran.
4:10:27/And over the division of the tribe of Naphtali was Ahira son of Enan.
4:10:28/This is how the Israelites traveled by their divisions when they set out.
4:10:29/Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses' father-in-law, "We are setting out for the place about which the LORD said, 'I will give it to you.' Come with us and we will treat you well, for the LORD has promised good things for Israel."
4:10:30/But he replied, "I will not go; I am going back to my own land and my family."
4:10:31/Then Moses said, "Please do not leave us. You know where we should camp in the wilderness, and you can be our guide.
4:10:32/If you come with us, we will share with you whatever good things the LORD gives us."
4:10:33/They set out from the mountain of the LORD and traveled for three days. The ark of the covenant of the LORD went before them during those three days to find them a place to rest.
4:10:34/The cloud of the LORD was over them by day when they set out from the camp.
4:10:35/Whenever the ark set out, Moses said, "Rise up, LORD! May your enemies be scattered; may those who hate you flee before you."
4:10:36/And when it came to rest, he said, "Return, O LORD, to the countless thousands of Israel."
4:11:1/When the people complained, it displeased the LORD: and the LORD heard it; his anger flared up, and the fire of the LORD burned among them, consuming those at the outskirts of the camp.
4:11:2/The people cried out to Moses; and when Moses prayed to the LORD, the fire was extinguished.
4:11:3/He named the place Taberah because the fire of the LORD had burned among them.
4:11:4/The mixed crowd among them craved other food, and the Israelites also began to cry again, asking, "Who will give us meat to eat?"
4:11:5/We remember the fish we ate in Egypt at no cost; also the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions, and garlic.
4:11:6/But now we've lost our appetite; we never see anything but this manna!
4:11:7/The manna was like coriander seed and looked like resin.
4:11:8/The people went around gathering it, and then ground it in handmills or crushed it in mortars. They cooked it in pots or made cakes with it. It tasted like something made with olive oil.
4:11:9/When the dew settled on the camp at night, the manna also came down.
4:11:10/Moses heard the people of every family wailing at the entrance to their tents. The LORD became exceedingly angry, and Moses was troubled.
4:11:11/He asked the LORD, "Why have you brought this trouble on your servant? What have I done to displease you that you put the burden of all these people on me?
4:11:12/Did I conceive all these people? Did I give them birth, that you should tell me to carry them in my arms, as a nurse carries an infant, to the land you promised on oath to their ancestors?
4:11:13/Where can I get meat for all these people? They keep wailing to me, 'Give us meat to eat!'
4:11:14/I cannot carry all these people by myself; the burden is too heavy for me.
4:11:15/If this is how you are going to treat me, please go ahead and kill me—if I have found favor in your eyes—and do not let me face my own ruin."
4:11:16/The LORD said to Moses, "Bring me seventy of Israel's elders who are known to you as leaders and officials among the people. Have them come to the tent of meeting, that they may stand there with you.
4:11:17/I will come down and speak with you there, and I will take some of the power of the Spirit that is on you and put it on them. They will share the burden of the people with you so that you will not have to carry it alone.
4:11:18/Tell the people: 'Consecrate yourselves in preparation for tomorrow, when you will eat meat. The LORD heard you when you wailed, "If only we had meat to eat! We were better off in Egypt!" Now the LORD will give you meat, and you will eat it.
4:11:19/You will not eat it for just one day, or two days, or five, ten or twenty days,
4:11:20/but for a whole month—until it comes out of your nostrils and you loathe it—because you have rejected the LORD, who is among you, and have wailed before him, saying, "Why did we ever leave Egypt?"'
4:11:21/But Moses said, "Here I am among six hundred thousand men on foot, and you say, 'I will give them meat to eat for a whole month!'
4:11:22/Would they have enough if flocks and herds were slaughtered for them? Would they have enough if all the fish in the sea were caught for them?"
4:11:23/The LORD answered Moses, "Is the LORD's arm too short? Now you will see whether or not what I say will come true for you."
4:11:24/So Moses went out and told the people what the LORD had said. He brought together seventy of their elders and had them stand around the tent.
4:11:25/Then the LORD came down in the cloud and spoke with him, and he took some of the power of the Spirit that was on him and put it on the seventy elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied—but did not do so again.
4:11:26/However, two men, whose names were Eldad and Medad, had remained in the camp. They were listed among the elders, but did not go out to the tent. Yet the Spirit also rested on them, and they prophesied in the camp.
4:11:27/A young man ran and told Moses, "Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp."
4:11:28/Joshua son of Nun, who had been Moses' aide since youth, spoke up and said, "Moses, my lord, stop them."
4:11:29/But Moses replied, "Are you jealous for my sake? I wish that all the LORD's people were prophets and that the LORD would put his Spirit on them!"
4:11:30/Then Moses and the elders of Israel returned to the camp.
4:11:31/Now a wind went out from the LORD and drove quail in from the sea. It scattered them up to two cubits deep all around the camp, as far as a day's walk in any direction.
4:11:32/All that day and night and all the next day the people went out and gathered quail. No one gathered less than ten homers. Then they spread them out all around the camp.
4:11:33/But while the meat was still between their teeth and before it could be consumed, the anger of the LORD burned against the people, and he struck them with a severe plague.
4:11:34/He named that place Kibroth Hattaavah because there they buried the people who had craved other food.
4:11:35/From Kibroth Hattaavah the people traveled to Hazeroth and stayed there.
4:12:1/And Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Ethiopian woman he had married, for he had indeed married an Ethiopian woman.
4:12:2/And they questioned, "Has the LORD truly spoken only through Moses? Hasn't He also spoken through us?" And the LORD heard this.
4:12:3/(Moses was the most humble man on the face of the earth.)
4:12:4/Then the LORD suddenly said to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, "Come out, you three, to the tent of meeting." And they did so.
4:12:5/And the LORD descended in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance of the tent, calling Aaron and Miriam, who both came forward.
4:12:6/He said, "Listen to my words: If there is a prophet among you, I, the LORD, will reveal myself to him in a vision and speak to him in a dream.
4:12:7/But my servant Moses is not like that; he is faithful in all my house.
4:12:8/With him, I speak directly, clearly, and not in riddles; he sees the form of the LORD. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?"
4:12:9/And the LORD's anger burned against them, and He left.
4:12:10/And when the cloud lifted from above the tent, there was Miriam—leprous, as white as snow. Aaron turned toward her and saw that she had leprosy.
4:12:11/And Aaron said to Moses, "Please, my lord, do not hold against us the sin we have foolishly committed.
4:12:12/Do not let her be like a stillborn infant coming from its mother's womb with its flesh half eaten away."
4:12:13/So Moses cried out to the LORD, "Please, God, heal her!"
4:12:14/But the LORD said to Moses, "If her father had simply spit in her face, would she not be shamed for seven days? Let her be isolated outside the camp for seven days; after that, she can be brought back."
4:12:15/So Miriam was isolated outside the camp for seven days, and the people did not move on until she was brought back.
4:12:16/Afterward, the people left Hazeroth and encamped in the wilderness of Paran.
4:13:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:13:2/Send out men to explore the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites: from each ancestral tribe send one of its leaders.
4:13:3/So Moses, following the LORD's command, sent them from the wilderness of Paran: all those men were leaders of the Israelites.
4:13:4/And these were their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur.
4:13:5/From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori.
4:13:6/From the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh.
4:13:7/From the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph.
4:13:8/From the tribe of Ephraim, Oshea son of Nun.
4:13:9/From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu.
4:13:10/From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi.
4:13:11/From the tribe of Joseph, specifically from the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi.
4:13:12/From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli.
4:13:13/From the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael.
4:13:14/From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi.
4:13:15/From the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.
4:13:16/These are the names of the men Moses sent to scout out the land. And Moses renamed Oshea son of Nun to Joshua.
4:13:17/And Moses sent them to scout out the land of Canaan and told them, "Go up through the Negev and into the hill country.
4:13:18/And see what the land is like and the people who live there, whether they are strong or weak, few or many;
4:13:19/And what the land they live in is like, whether it is good or bad; and what kind of cities they live in, whether in camps or fortresses;
4:13:20/And what the land is like, whether it is fertile or poor, whether there are forests there or not. Be courageous, and bring back some of the fruit of the land." It was the season for the first ripe grapes.
4:13:21/So they went up and explored the land from the Desert of Zin to Rehob, towards Lebo Hamath.
4:13:22/They went up through the Negev and came to Hebron; Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, were there. (Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
4:13:23/They reached the Valley of Eshcol and cut off a branch bearing a single cluster of grapes, which they carried on a pole between two of them, along with some pomegranates and figs.
4:13:24/That place was called the Valley of Eshcol because of the cluster of grapes the Israelites cut down from there.
4:13:25/And they returned from exploring the land after forty days.
4:13:26/They came back to Moses, Aaron, and the whole Israelite community at Kadesh in the Desert of Paran. They reported to them and the whole assembly and showed them the fruit of the land.
4:13:27/They reported to him, "We went to the land where you sent us. It truly flows with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
4:13:28/However, the people who live in the land are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large. We also saw descendants of Anak there.
4:13:29/The Amalekites live in the Negev; the Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites live in the hill country; and the Canaanites live near the sea and along the Jordan."
4:13:30/But Caleb quieted the people before Moses and said, "We should go up and take possession of the land, for we can certainly do it."
4:13:31/However, the men who had gone up with him said, "We can't attack those people; they are stronger than we are."
4:13:32/And they spread a negative report about the land they had explored to the Israelites, saying, "The land we explored devours those living in it. All the people we saw there are of great size.
4:13:33/There we saw the giants, the descendants of Anak, who come from the giants. We felt like grasshoppers in our own eyes, and we looked the same to them."
4:14:1/And the entire congregation raised their voices, weeping loudly throughout the night.
4:14:2/And all the Israelites complained against Moses and Aaron, saying to them, "If only we had died in Egypt, or even here in the wilderness!
4:14:3/And why has the LORD brought us to this land, only for us to die by the sword, our wives and children to be taken as plunder? Wouldn't it have been better for us to go back to Egypt?"
4:14:4/So they said to each other, "Let's choose a leader and go back to Egypt."
4:14:5/Then Moses and Aaron fell face down in front of the whole Israelite assembly gathered there.
4:14:6/Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who had explored the land, tore their clothes
4:14:7/and said to the entire Israelite assembly, "The land we passed through and explored is extremely fertile.
4:14:8/If the LORD is pleased with us, he will lead us into that land, a land flowing with milk and honey, and will give it to us.
4:14:9/Just do not rebel against the LORD. And do not be afraid of the people of the land, because we will devour them. Their protection is gone, but the LORD is with us. Do not fear them."
4:14:10/But the whole assembly talked about stoning them. Then the glory of the LORD appeared at the tent of meeting to all the Israelites.
4:14:11/And the LORD said to Moses, "How long will these people treat me with contempt? How long will they refuse to believe in me, in spite of all the signs I have performed among them?
4:14:12/I will strike them with a plague and disinherit them, and I will make you into a nation greater and stronger than they."
4:14:13/But Moses said to the LORD, "Then the Egyptians will hear about it! By your power you brought these people up from among them.
4:14:14/And they will tell the residents of this land about it. They have already heard that you, LORD, are with these people and that you, LORD, have been seen face to face, that your cloud stays over them, and that you go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night.
4:14:15/If you kill all these people as one man, then the nations who have heard this report about you will say,
4:14:16/'The LORD was not able to bring these people into the land he promised them on oath, so he slaughtered them in the wilderness.'
4:14:17/Now may the LORD's strength be displayed, just as you have declared:
4:14:18/'The LORD is slow to anger, abounding in love and forgiving sin and rebellion. Yet he does not leave the guilty unpunished; he punishes the children for the sin of the parents to the third and fourth generation.'
4:14:19/Please forgive the sin of this people, in accordance with the greatness of your mercy, just as you have forgiven this people, from Egypt until now."
4:14:20/Then the LORD said, "I have forgiven them, as you asked.
4:14:21/Nevertheless, as surely as I live and as surely as the glory of the LORD fills the whole earth,
4:14:22/because all those men who have seen my glory and the signs I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness yet have tested me these ten times and have not obeyed my voice,
4:14:23/they will certainly not see the land I swore to their ancestors, nor will any of those who rejected me see it.
4:14:24/But because my servant Caleb has a different spirit and follows me wholeheartedly, I will bring him into the land he went to, and his descendants will inherit it.
4:14:25/(Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites live in the valleys.) Tomorrow turn and set out toward the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea."
4:14:26/Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
4:14:27/"How long will this wicked community grumble against me? I have heard the complaints of these grumbling Israelites.
4:14:28/So tell them, 'As surely as I live, declares the LORD, I will do to you the very thing I heard you say:
4:14:29/In this wilderness your bodies will fall—every one of you twenty years old or more who was counted in the census and who has grumbled against me.
4:14:30/Not one of you will enter the land I swore with uplifted hand to make your home, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
4:14:31/As for your children that you said would be taken as plunder, I will bring them in to enjoy the land you have rejected.
4:14:32/But as for you, your bodies will fall in this wilderness.
4:14:33/Your children will be shepherds here for forty years, suffering for your unfaithfulness, until the last of your bodies lies in the wilderness.
4:14:34/For forty years—one year for each of the forty days you explored the land—you will suffer for your sins and know what it means to have me against you.'
4:14:35/I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will surely do these things to this whole wicked community, which has banded together against me. They will meet their end in this wilderness; here they will die."
4:14:36/So the men Moses had sent to explore the land, who returned and made the whole community grumble against him by spreading a bad report about it,
4:14:37/these men who were responsible for spreading the bad report about the land died of a plague before the LORD.
4:14:38/But Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, among those who had explored the land, remained alive.
4:14:39/When Moses reported this to all the Israelites, they mourned bitterly.
4:14:40/Early the next morning they went up toward the highlands, saying, "Here we are. We’ll go up to the place the LORD promised, for we have sinned."
4:14:41/But Moses said, "Why are you disobeying the LORD’s command? This will not succeed.
4:14:42/Do not go up, because the LORD is not with you. You will be defeated by your enemies.
4:14:43/For the Amalekites and the Canaanites will face you there. Because you have turned away from the LORD, he will not be with you and you will fall by the sword."
4:14:44/Yet they defiantly went up toward the highlands, even though neither the ark of the LORD’s covenant nor Moses left the camp.
4:14:45/Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down, attacked them, and beat them down all the way to Hormah.
4:15:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:15:2/Tell the Israelites, when you enter the land you will live in, which I am giving to you,
4:15:3/And you present an offering by fire to the LORD, whether a burnt offering, a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, a voluntary offering, or during your sacred festivals, to create a pleasing aroma to the LORD from the cattle or the sheep:
4:15:4/Then the person offering their gift to the LORD must also bring a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of oil.
4:15:5/And you must prepare a quarter of a hin of wine as a drink offering with the burnt offering or sacrifice, for each lamb.
4:15:6/For a ram, you must prepare a grain offering of two tenths of an ephah of flour mixed with a third of a hin of oil.
4:15:7/And as a drink offering, you must offer a third of a hin of wine, as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
4:15:8/When you prepare a bull as a burnt offering, or as a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or as a fellowship offering to the LORD,
4:15:9/You must accompany the bull with a grain offering of three tenths of an ephah of flour mixed with half a hin of oil.
4:15:10/And you must offer half a hin of wine as a drink offering, as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
4:15:11/This is what you must do for each bull, ram, lamb, or goat.
4:15:12/Depending on the number you prepare, you must do the same for each one according to their number.
4:15:13/Everyone native to the country must do these things in this way when presenting an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
4:15:14/And if a foreigner stays with you, or whoever is among you throughout your generations, and presents an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD, they must do as you do.
4:15:15/The same rules apply to both you and the foreigner residing among you. This is a permanent ordinance for your generations: you and the foreigner shall be the same before the LORD.
4:15:16/The same laws and regulations will apply to both you and the foreigner residing among you.
4:15:17/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:15:18/Tell the Israelites, when you enter the land I am bringing you to,
4:15:19/Then, when you eat from the bread of the land, you must present a contribution to the LORD.
4:15:20/You must offer up a loaf from the first of your dough as a contribution; just as you do with a contribution from the threshing floor, so shall you present it.
4:15:21/From the first of your dough, you must give to the LORD a contribution throughout your generations.
4:15:22/And if you fail to keep all these commandments, which the LORD has spoken to Moses,
4:15:23/Everything that the LORD has commanded you through Moses, from the day the LORD gave the commandments and onward through your generations,
4:15:24/Then, if something is done unintentionally without the knowledge of the community, the whole community must offer a young bull for a burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to the LORD, along with its grain offering and drink offering according to the regulations, and a male goat for a sin offering.
4:15:25/The priest will make atonement for the whole community of the Israelites, and they will be forgiven because it was unintentional. They must bring their offering, an offering made by fire to the LORD, and their sin offering before the LORD for their unintentional sin.
4:15:26/And the whole community of the Israelites and the foreigner residing among them will be forgiven, since all the people were involved in the unintentional sin.
4:15:27/If any individual sins unintentionally, they must bring a female goat in its first year as a sin offering.
4:15:28/The priest will make atonement before the LORD for the person who errs unintentionally, making atonement for them so they will be forgiven.
4:15:29/There will be one law for anyone who sins unintentionally, whether they are native-born among the Israelites or a foreigner residing among them.
4:15:30/But anyone who sins defiantly, whether native-born or a foreigner, blasphemes the LORD, and that person must be cut off from their people.
4:15:31/Because they have despised the LORD's word and broken His command, that person must be completely cut off; their guilt remains on them.
4:15:32/While the Israelites were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering wood on the Sabbath day.
4:15:33/Those who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses and Aaron and the whole assembly.
4:15:34/They kept him in custody because it was not clear what should be done to him.
4:15:35/Then the LORD said to Moses, "The man must be put to death; the whole assembly must stone him outside the camp."
4:15:36/So the whole assembly took him outside the camp and stoned him to death, as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:15:37/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:15:38/Tell the Israelites to make tassels on the corners of their garments throughout their generations, and to put a blue cord on the tassel of each corner.
4:15:39/These tassels will serve as a reminder for you to look at and remember all the LORD's commandments and to follow them, instead of following your own heart and eyes, which you are inclined to prostitute yourselves after.
4:15:40/So you will remember and follow all my commandments and be holy to your God.
4:15:41/I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt to be your God: I am the LORD your God.
4:16:1/Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, along with Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, descendants of Reuben, gathered men:
4:16:2/And they stood up against Moses, joined by some of the Israelites, two hundred and fifty leaders of the community, well-known figures:
4:16:3/They united against Moses and Aaron and said to them, "You're taking on too much power. The entire community is holy, every one of us, and the LORD is with us. So why do you elevate yourselves above the LORD's assembly?"
4:16:4/When Moses heard this, he fell face down:
4:16:5/Then he said to Korah and all his followers, "Tomorrow, the LORD will show who belongs to him and who is holy; he will bring that person close to him. The one he chooses, he will bring close to him.
4:16:6/Do this: Take censers, Korah and all your followers;
4:16:7/Put fire and incense in them before the LORD tomorrow. The one the LORD chooses will be the holy one. You've gone too far, sons of Levi."
4:16:8/Then Moses said to Korah, "Listen now, you Levites:
4:16:9/Isn't it enough for you that the God of Israel has separated you from the rest of the Israelite community and brought you near himself to do the work at the LORD's tabernacle and to stand before the community and minister to them?
4:16:10/He has brought you and all your fellow Levites near himself, but now you are trying to get the priesthood too.
4:16:11/It is against the LORD that you and all your followers have banded together. Who is Aaron that you should grumble against him?"
4:16:12/Moses sent for Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab. But they said, "We will not come!
4:16:13/Is it a small thing that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey to kill us in the desert? And now you also want to lord it over us?
4:16:14/Moreover, you haven't brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey or given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you gouge out the eyes of these men? No, we will not come!"
4:16:15/Moses became very angry and said to the LORD, "Do not accept their offering. I have not taken so much as a donkey from them, nor have I wronged any of them."
4:16:16/And Moses said to Korah, "You and all your followers are to appear before the LORD tomorrow—you, they, and Aaron.
4:16:17/Each man is to take his censer and put incense in it—250 censers in all—and present it before the LORD. You and Aaron are to present your censers also."
4:16:18/So every man took his censer, put fire and incense in it, and stood with Moses and Aaron at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
4:16:19/Then Korah gathered the whole community against them at the entrance to the tent of meeting. And the glory of the LORD appeared to the entire assembly.
4:16:20/The LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
4:16:21/"Separate yourselves from this assembly so I can put an end to them at once."
4:16:22/But they fell facedown and cried out, "O God, the God who gives breath to all living things, will you be angry with the entire assembly when only one man sins?"
4:16:23/Then the LORD said to Moses,
4:16:24/"Tell the assembly to move away from the tents of Korah, Dathan and Abiram."
4:16:25/Moses got up and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.
4:16:26/He warned the assembly, "Move back from the tents of these wicked men! Do not touch anything belonging to them, or you will be swept away because of all their sins."
4:16:27/So they moved away from the tents of Korah, Dathan and Abiram. Dathan and Abiram had come out and were standing with their wives, children and little ones at the entrances to their tents.
4:16:28/Then Moses said, "This is how you will know that the LORD has sent me to do all these things and that it was not my idea:
4:16:29/If these men die a natural death and experience only what usually happens to men, then the LORD has not sent me.
4:16:30/But if the LORD does something new and the ground opens its mouth and swallows them, with everything that belongs to them, and they go down alive into the grave, then you will know that these men have treated the LORD with contempt."
4:16:31/As soon as he finished saying all this, the ground under them split apart
4:16:32/and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them and their households, and all those associated with Korah, together with their possessions.
4:16:33/They, and everything that belonged to them, went down alive into the grave; the earth closed over them, and they perished and were gone from the community.
4:16:34/At their cries, all the Israelites around them fled, shouting, "The earth is going to swallow us too!"
4:16:35/And fire came out from the LORD and consumed the 250 men who were offering the incense.
4:16:36/Then the LORD said to Moses,
4:16:37/"Tell Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest, to remove the censers from the charred remains and scatter the coals some distance away, for the censers are holy—
4:16:38/the censers of the men who sinned at the cost of their lives. Hammer the censers into sheets to overlay the altar, for they were presented before the LORD and have become holy. Let them be a sign to the Israelites."
4:16:39/So Eleazar the priest collected the bronze censers brought by those who had been burned to death, and he had them hammered out to overlay the altar,
4:16:40/as a reminder to the Israelites that no one except a descendant of Aaron should come to burn incense before the LORD, or he might become like Korah and his followers, as the LORD said to him through Moses.
4:16:41/But the next day the whole Israelite community grumbled against Moses and Aaron. "You have killed the LORD's people," they said.
4:16:42/When the assembly gathered in opposition to Moses and Aaron and turned toward the tent of meeting, suddenly the cloud covered it and the glory of the LORD appeared.
4:16:43/Then Moses and Aaron went to the front of the tent of meeting.
4:16:44/And the LORD said to Moses,
4:16:45/"Get away from this assembly so I can put an end to them at once." And they fell facedown.
4:16:46/Then Moses said to Aaron, "Take your censer, put fire from the altar in it, add incense, and hurry to the assembly to make atonement for them. Wrath has come out from the LORD; the plague has started."
4:16:47/So Aaron did as Moses said, and ran into the midst of the assembly. The plague had already started among the people, but Aaron offered the incense and made atonement for them.
4:16:48/He stood between the living and the dead, and the plague stopped.
4:16:49/But 14,700 people died from the plague, in addition to those who had died because of Korah.
4:16:50/Then Aaron returned to Moses at the entrance to the tent of meeting, for the plague had stopped.
4:17:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:17:2/Tell the Israelites to bring a staff from each of their ancestral tribes, twelve staffs in total. Write each man's name on his staff.
4:17:3/And you must write Aaron's name on the staff of Levi, because there should be one staff for the leader of each ancestral house.
4:17:4/Then place them in the tent of meeting in front of the covenant law where I meet with you.
4:17:5/The staff belonging to the man I choose will sprout. This will put an end to the grumbling against you from the Israelites.
4:17:6/So Moses spoke to the Israelites, and their leaders gave him twelve staffs, one for the leader of each tribe, and Aaron's staff was among them.
4:17:7/Moses then placed the staffs before the LORD in the tent of the testimony.
4:17:8/The next day Moses entered the tent of the testimony and saw that Aaron's staff, which represented the tribe of Levi, had sprouted, budded, blossomed, and produced almonds.
4:17:9/Moses brought out all the staffs from the LORD's presence to all the Israelites. They looked at them, and each man took his own staff.
4:17:10/Then the LORD said to Moses, "Put Aaron's staff back in front of the testimony to be kept as a sign to the rebellious. This will end their grumbling against me, so they will not die."
4:17:11/And Moses did as the LORD commanded him.
4:17:12/The Israelites said to Moses, "Look, we're going to die, we're all going to die!"
4:17:13/Anyone who even comes close to the LORD's tabernacle will die. Are we all going to die?"
4:18:1/The LORD said to Aaron, "You, your sons, and your family will be responsible for any wrongdoing connected to the sanctuary, and you and your sons alone will be responsible for any wrongdoing connected to your priesthood.
4:18:2/Also, bring your fellow Levites from your ancestral tribe to join you and assist you and your sons in front of the tent of the covenant law.
4:18:3/They are to fulfill their duties to you and the whole tent. However, they must not touch the sacred objects or the altar, or they, and you, will die.
4:18:4/They are to join you and take care of the tent of meeting—doing all the work at the tent—but no outsider may come near you.
4:18:5/You are to be responsible for the care of the sanctuary and the altar, so that my wrath will not fall on the Israelites again.
4:18:6/I myself have selected your fellow Levites from among the Israelites as a gift to you, dedicated to the LORD to do the work at the tent of meeting.
4:18:7/But only you and your sons may serve as priests in connection with everything at the altar and inside the curtain. I am giving you the service of the priesthood as a gift. Anyone else who comes near the sanctuary must be put to death."
4:18:8/Then the LORD said to Aaron, "I myself have put you in charge of the offerings presented to me; all the holy offerings the Israelites give me I give to you and your sons as your portion, your perpetual share.
4:18:9/You are to have the part of the most holy offerings that is kept from the fire: every offering of theirs—every grain offering, sin offering, and guilt offering that they bring to me—will be most holy for you and your sons.
4:18:10/Eat it as something most holy; every male shall eat it. You must regard it as holy.
4:18:11/This also is yours: the offering of their gifts, all the wave offerings of the Israelites. I have given them to you, and to your sons and daughters with you, as a perpetual share. Everyone in your household who is ceremonially clean may eat it.
4:18:12/I give you all the finest olive oil and all the finest new wine and grain they give the LORD as the firstfruits of their harvest.
4:18:13/All the land's firstfruits that they bring to the LORD will be yours. Everyone in your household who is ceremonially clean may eat it.
4:18:14/Everything in Israel that is devoted to the LORD is yours.
4:18:15/The first offspring of every womb, both human and animal, that is offered to the LORD is yours. But you must redeem every firstborn son and every firstborn male of unclean animals.
4:18:16/When they are a month old, you must redeem them at the redemption price set at five shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel, which weighs twenty gerahs.
4:18:17/But you must not redeem the firstborn of a cow, sheep, or goat; they are holy. Splash their blood against the altar and burn their fat as an offering made by fire, for a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
4:18:18/Their meat belongs to you, just as the breast of the wave offering and the right thigh are yours.
4:18:19/Whatever is set aside from the holy offerings the Israelites present to the LORD, I give to you and your sons and daughters with you as a perpetual share. It is an everlasting covenant of salt before the LORD for both you and your offspring."
4:18:20/And the LORD said to Aaron, "You will have no inheritance in their land, nor will you have any share among them; I am your share and your inheritance among the Israelites.
4:18:21/"I give to the Levites all the tithes in Israel as their inheritance in return for the work they do while serving at the tent of meeting.
4:18:22/From now on, the Israelites must not come near the tent of meeting, or they will bear the consequences of their sin and die.
4:18:23/It is the Levites who are to do the work at the tent of meeting and bear the responsibility for any offenses they commit. This is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come. They will receive no inheritance among the Israelites.
4:18:24/Instead, I give to the Levites as their inheritance the tithes that the Israelites present as an offering to the LORD. That is why I said concerning them: 'They will have no inheritance among the Israelites.'"
4:18:25/And the LORD said to Moses,
4:18:26/"Tell the Levites: 'When you receive from the Israelites the tithe I give you as your inheritance, you must present a tenth of that tithe as the LORD's offering.
4:18:27/Your offering will be reckoned to you as grain from the threshing floor or juice from the winepress.
4:18:28/In this way, you also will present an offering to the LORD from all the tithes you receive from the Israelites. From these tithes, you must give the LORD's portion to Aaron the priest.
4:18:29/From everything you receive, you must present the best and holiest part as the LORD's portion.
4:18:30/"Therefore, tell them: 'After you have set aside the best part, it will be reckoned to the Levites as the produce of the threshing floor or the produce of the winepress.
4:18:31/You and your households may eat it anywhere, for it is your compensation for your work at the tent of meeting.
4:18:32/By presenting the best part, you will not be guilty in this matter; then you will not defile the holy offerings of the Israelites, and you will not die.'"
4:19:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
4:19:2/This is the regulation of the law which the LORD has commanded, saying, Tell the Israelites to bring you a red cow without any defects, which has never been put under a yoke:
4:19:3/You must give it to Eleazar the priest, so he can take it outside the camp and have it slaughtered in his presence:
4:19:4/Then Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood on his finger and sprinkle it seven times in front of the tent of meeting:
4:19:5/The cow shall be burned in his sight; its skin, flesh, blood, and dung are to be burned:
4:19:6/And the priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and scarlet wool and throw them into the fire burning the cow.
4:19:7/After that, the priest must wash his clothes and bathe his body in water. Then he can come back into the camp, but he will be unclean until evening.
4:19:8/The person who burns it must also wash his clothes in water and bathe his body in water, and he will be unclean until evening.
4:19:9/A man who is clean shall collect the ashes of the cow and store them outside the camp in a clean place. They will be kept for the community of the Israelites for the water of cleansing; it is for purification from sin.
4:19:10/Anyone who collects the cow's ashes must wash his clothes and will be unclean until evening. This will be a lasting ordinance for the Israelites and for the foreigners residing among them.
4:19:11/Anyone who touches a dead body will be unclean for seven days.
4:19:12/He must purify himself with the water on the third day and on the seventh day, then he will be clean. But if he does not purify himself on the third day, then on the seventh day he will not be clean.
4:19:13/Anyone who touches a dead body and does not purify himself defiles the LORD's tabernacle. That person must be cut off from Israel. Because the water of cleansing has not been sprinkled on him, he remains unclean; his uncleanness is still on him.
4:19:14/This is the law when someone dies in a tent: everyone who comes into the tent and everything in the tent will be unclean for seven days.
4:19:15/And every open container without a lid fastened on it will be unclean.
4:19:16/Anyone who touches someone who has been killed with a sword in the open fields, or a dead body, or a human bone, or a grave, will be unclean for seven days.
4:19:17/For an unclean person, they shall take some of the ashes of the burned purification offering and fresh water shall be added in a vessel.
4:19:18/A clean person shall take hyssop, dip it in the water, and sprinkle it on the tent, all the furnishings, and the people who were there, and on anyone who touched a bone, the slain, the dead, or a grave.
4:19:19/The clean person shall sprinkle the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day. On the seventh day, he must purify himself, wash his clothes, and bathe in water, and at evening he will be clean.
4:19:20/But the person who remains unclean and does not purify himself, that person shall be cut off from the community because he has defiled the sanctuary of the LORD. The water of cleansing has not been sprinkled on him; he is unclean.
4:19:21/It shall be a lasting statute for them. The one who sprinkles the water of cleansing must wash his clothes, and anyone who touches the water of cleansing will be unclean until evening.
4:19:22/Whatever the unclean person touches becomes unclean, and anyone who touches it will be unclean until evening.
4:20:1/Then the children of Israel, the entire community, arrived in the Desert of Zin in the first month, and they stayed in Kadesh. There, Miriam passed away and was buried.
4:20:2/And there was no water for the community, so they united in opposition to Moses and Aaron.
4:20:3/The people argued with Moses, saying, "If only we had perished when our brothers died before the Lord!
4:20:4/Why did you bring the Lord's community into this wilderness for us and our livestock to die here?
4:20:5/Why did you lead us out of Egypt to bring us to this terrible place? It's not a place for crops, figs, vines, or pomegranates, and there's no water to drink."
4:20:6/Moses and Aaron left the assembly and went to the entrance of the tent of meeting, where they fell facedown. Then the glory of the Lord appeared to them.
4:20:7/And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
4:20:8/"Take the staff, and you and your brother Aaron gather the assembly. Speak to the rock in their presence, and it will pour out its water. You will bring water out of the rock for them, providing drink for the community and their animals."
4:20:9/Moses took the staff from before the Lord, as he had been commanded.
4:20:10/Then Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly in front of the rock, and Moses said to them, "Listen, you rebels, must we bring you water out of this rock?"
4:20:11/Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his staff. Water gushed out, and the community and their animals drank.
4:20:12/But the Lord said to Moses and Aaron, "Because you did not trust in me enough to honor me as holy in the sight of the Israelites, you will not lead this community into the land I have given them."
4:20:13/This place was called the waters of Meribah, because the Israelites quarreled with the Lord, and he showed himself holy among them.
4:20:14/Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom, saying, "Your brother Israel says, 'You know all the hardships that have come upon us.
4:20:15/Our ancestors went down into Egypt, and we lived there a long time. The Egyptians mistreated us and our ancestors,
4:20:16/but when we cried out to the Lord, he heard our plea and sent an angel to bring us out of Egypt. Now we are here at Kadesh, a town on the edge of your territory.
4:20:17/Please let us pass through your country. We will not go through any fields or vineyards, or drink water from any wells. We will travel along the King's Highway and not turn aside to the right or to the left until we have passed through your territory.'"
4:20:18/But Edom answered, "You may not pass through my land, or I will come out to meet you with the sword."
4:20:19/The Israelites replied, "We will stick to the main road, and if we or our livestock drink any of your water, we will pay for it. We only want to pass through on foot—nothing else."
4:20:20/Yet he said, "You may not pass through." And Edom came out against them with a large and powerful army.
4:20:21/So Edom refused to allow Israel to pass through his territory, and Israel turned away from him.
4:20:22/Then the entire Israelite community left Kadesh and came to Mount Hor.
4:20:23/And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron at Mount Hor, on the border of the land of Edom, saying,
4:20:24/"Aaron will be gathered to his people. He will not enter the land I have given to the Israelites because you both rebelled against my command at the waters of Meribah.
4:20:25/Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up Mount Hor.
4:20:26/Remove Aaron's garments and put them on his son Eleazar. Aaron will be gathered to his people and will die there."
4:20:27/So Moses did as the Lord commanded. They went up Mount Hor in the sight of the whole community.
4:20:28/Moses removed Aaron's garments and dressed Eleazar his son in them. Aaron died there at the top of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
4:20:29/When the entire community realized that Aaron had died, all the Israelites mourned for Aaron for thirty days.
4:21:1/When King Arad the Canaanite, who lived in the south, heard that Israel was coming by the way of the spies, he fought against Israel and captured some of them.
4:21:2/And Israel made a promise to the LORD, saying, "If you truly give this people into our hands, then we will completely destroy their cities."
4:21:3/The LORD listened to Israel's plea and handed over the Canaanites; they completely destroyed them and their cities. The place was then named Hormah.
4:21:4/They traveled from Mount Hor by the route of the Red Sea to go around the land of Edom, and the people became very discouraged because of the journey.
4:21:5/The people complained against God and Moses, asking, "Why did you bring us out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? There's no bread or water, and we can't stand this worthless food."
4:21:6/Then the LORD sent venomous snakes among the people, and they bit the people, causing many Israelites to die.
4:21:7/So the people came to Moses and admitted, "We have sinned by speaking against the LORD and against you. Pray to the LORD to take the snakes away from us." Moses prayed for the people.
4:21:8/And the LORD told Moses, "Make a snake and put it on a pole; anyone who is bitten can look at it and live."
4:21:9/Moses made a bronze snake and put it on a pole. Then, whenever someone was bitten and they looked at the bronze snake, they lived.
4:21:10/The Israelites moved on and camped at Oboth.
4:21:11/They traveled from Oboth and camped at Ije Abarim, in the wilderness facing Moab toward the sunrise.
4:21:12/From there they moved and camped in the Zered Valley.
4:21:13/From there they moved and camped on the other side of the Arnon, which is in the wilderness extending from Amorite territory. For Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
4:21:14/This is why it is mentioned in the Book of the Wars of the LORD, "What He did at the Red Sea, and at the streams of Arnon,"
4:21:15/And at the stream that flows to the settlement of Ar, lying at the border of Moab.
4:21:16/From there they went to Beer, which is the well where the LORD said to Moses, "Gather the people together, and I will give them water."
4:21:17/Then Israel sang this song, "Spring up, O well; let us sing to it."
4:21:18/The leaders dug the well, the nobles of the people dug it, under the direction of the lawgiver, with their staffs. And from the wilderness they went to Mattanah,
4:21:19/And from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
4:21:20/And from Bamoth in the valley, in the territory of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which overlooks the wasteland.
4:21:21/Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
4:21:22/"Let us pass through your land. We won't turn into the fields or vineyards; we won't drink water from the wells. We will travel along the king's highway until we have passed through your territory."
4:21:23/But Sihon wouldn't allow Israel to pass through his territory. He gathered all his people and went out against Israel into the wilderness, coming to Jahaz to fight against Israel.
4:21:24/Israel defeated him with the sword and took over his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, up to the Ammonite border, which was fortified.
4:21:25/Israel captured all these cities and settled in all the cities of the Amorites, in Heshbon and all its villages.
4:21:26/For Heshbon was the city of Sihon, king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and taken all his land up to the Arnon.
4:21:27/That's why those who tell stories say, "Come to Heshbon, let it be rebuilt; let the city of Sihon be established."
4:21:28/A fire went out from Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon; it consumed Ar of Moab, the rulers of the high places of the Arnon.
4:21:29/Woe to you, Moab! You are destroyed, people of Chemosh! He has given his sons as fugitives, and his daughters into captivity to Sihon, king of the Amorites.
4:21:30/We have shot them down; Heshbon is destroyed all the way to Dibon. We have laid waste as far as Nophah, which extends to Medeba.
4:21:31/Thus Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
4:21:32/Moses sent to explore Jaazer, and they captured its villages and drove out the Amorites who were there.
4:21:33/Then they turned and went up by the way of Bashan. Og, the king of Bashan, came out against them, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei.
4:21:34/But the LORD said to Moses, "Do not fear him, for I have handed him over to you, along with all his people and his land. You will do to him as you did to Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon."
4:21:35/So they defeated him, his sons, and all his people, until no one was left alive, and they took possession of his land.
4:22:1/The Israelites moved on and camped in the plains of Moab, across the Jordan River from Jericho.
4:22:2/Balak, son of Zippor, saw everything Israel had done to the Amorites.
4:22:3/Moab was terrified because there were so many Israelites; Moab was overwhelmed with dread because of them.
4:22:4/Moab said to the elders of Midian, "This horde will devour everything around us, just as an ox eats up the grass of the field." Balak, son of Zippor, was the king of Moab at that time.
4:22:5/So he sent messengers to Balaam, son of Beor, at Pethor, near the Euphrates River, in his native land, with a message: "A people has come out of Egypt; they cover the land and are settling across from me.
4:22:6/Come now and curse these people for me; they are too powerful for me. Perhaps then I'll be able to defeat them and drive them out of the land. I know that whoever you bless is blessed, and whoever you curse is cursed."
4:22:7/The elders of Moab and Midian left, taking with them the fee for divination. When they came to Balaam, they told him what Balak had said.
4:22:8/Balaam said to them, "Stay here for the night, and I'll bring back the answer the Lord gives me." So the Moabite officials stayed with him.
4:22:9/God came to Balaam and asked, "Who are these men with you?"
4:22:10/Balaam said to God, "Balak, son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:
4:22:11/'A people that has come out of Egypt covers the land. Now come and curse them for me. Perhaps then I'll be able to fight them and drive them away.'"
4:22:12/But God said to Balaam, "Do not go with them. You must not curse the people, for they are blessed."
4:22:13/The next morning, Balaam got up and said to Balak's officials, "Go back to your own country, for the Lord has refused to let me go with you."
4:22:14/So the Moabite officials returned to Balak and said, "Balaam refused to come with us."
4:22:15/Then Balak sent other officials, more numerous and more distinguished than the first.
4:22:16/They came to Balaam and said, "This is what Balak, son of Zippor, says: 'Do not let anything keep you from coming to me,
4:22:17/for I will reward you handsomely and do whatever you say. Come and curse this people for me.'"
4:22:18/But Balaam answered them, "Even if Balak gave me his palace filled with silver and gold, I could not do anything, small or great, that goes beyond the command of the Lord my God.
4:22:19/Now please stay here tonight, as the others did, so I can find out what else the Lord will tell me."
4:22:20/That night God came to Balaam and said, "If these men have come to summon you, go with them, but only do what I tell you."
4:22:21/So Balaam got up in the morning, saddled his donkey, and went with the Moabite officials.
4:22:22/But God was very angry when he went, and the angel of the Lord stood in the road to oppose him. Balaam was riding on his donkey, accompanied by his two servants.
4:22:23/The donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road with a drawn sword in his hand, so the donkey turned off the road into a field. Balaam beat the donkey to get it back on the road.
4:22:24/Then the angel of the Lord stood in a narrow path between two vineyards, with walls on both sides.
4:22:25/When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, it pressed close to the wall, crushing Balaam's foot against it. So he beat the donkey again.
4:22:26/The angel of the Lord moved on ahead and stood in a narrow place where there was no room to turn, either to the right or to the left.
4:22:27/When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, it lay down under Balaam, and he was angry and beat it with his staff.
4:22:28/Then the Lord opened the donkey's mouth, and it said to Balaam, "What have I done to you to make you beat me these three times?"
4:22:29/Balaam answered the donkey, "You have made a fool of me! If only I had a sword in my hand, I would kill you right now."
4:22:30/The donkey said to Balaam, "Am I not your own donkey, which you have always ridden, to this day? Have I been in the habit of doing this to you?" "No," he said.
4:22:31/Then the Lord opened Balaam's eyes, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road with his sword drawn. So he bowed low and fell facedown.
4:22:32/The angel of the Lord asked him, "Why have you beaten your donkey these three times? I have come here to oppose you because your path is reckless before me.
4:22:33/The donkey saw me and turned away from me these three times. If it had not turned away, I would certainly have killed you by now, but I would have spared it."
4:22:34/Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, "I have sinned. I did not realize you were standing in the road to oppose me. Now if you are displeased, I will go back."
4:22:35/The angel of the Lord said to Balaam, "Go with the men, but speak only what I tell you." So Balaam went with Balak's officials.
4:22:36/When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the Moabite town on the Arnon border, at the edge of his territory.
4:22:37/Balak said to Balaam, "Didn't I send you an urgent summons? Why didn't you come to me? Am I not able to reward you?"
4:22:38/Balaam said to Balak, "Look, I've come to you now, but I can't say just anything. I will speak only what God puts in my mouth."
4:22:39/Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath Huzoth.
4:22:40/Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep and sent some to Balaam and the officials who were with him.
4:22:41/The next day, Balak took Balaam and brought him up to the high places of Baal, so he could see a portion of the people.
4:23:1/Balaam told Balak, "Set up seven altars for me here, and get ready seven oxen and seven rams for me."
4:23:2/And Balak did as Balaam had instructed; they both offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
4:23:3/Balaam then said to Balak, "Stay by your burnt offering, and I'll go see if the LORD comes to meet me. Whatever he shows me, I'll tell you." And he went to a high place.
4:23:4/And God met Balaam and he told Him, "I've set up seven altars and have offered a bull and a ram on each one."
4:23:5/The LORD gave Balaam a message and said, "Go back to Balak and say this."
4:23:6/He went back to him, and there he was, standing by his burnt offering, along with all the Moabite leaders.
4:23:7/Then he began his message, saying, "King Balak of Moab brought me from Aram, from the eastern mountains, saying, 'Come, curse Jacob for me; come, denounce Israel.'"
4:23:8/"How can I curse those whom God has not cursed? How can I denounce those whom the LORD has not denounced?
4:23:9/From the mountaintops, I see them, from the hills, I view them; there lies a people living apart, not considered among the nations.
4:23:10/"Who can count the dust of Jacob or number the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the upright, and let my end be like theirs!"
4:23:11/And Balak said to Balaam, "What have you done to me? I brought you to curse my enemies, but you've blessed them completely."
4:23:12/He replied, "Must I not be careful to speak what the LORD puts in my mouth?"
4:23:13/Then Balak said to him, "Please come with me to another place where you can see them; you will only see a part of them and not all. Curse them for me from there."
4:23:14/So he took him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, offering a bull and a ram on each altar.
4:23:15/Then he said to Balak, "Stay here by your burnt offering while I go to meet the LORD over there."
4:23:16/And the LORD met Balaam and put a message in his mouth, saying, "Go back to Balak and say this."
4:23:17/When he returned, there was Balak, standing by his burnt offering, with the Moabite leaders. And Balak asked him, "What did the LORD say?"
4:23:18/He delivered his message, saying, "Get up, Balak, and listen; hear me out, son of Zippor:
4:23:19/God is not a human that He should lie, nor a mortal that He should change His mind. Does He speak and then not act? Does He promise and not fulfill?
4:23:20/See, I've received a command to bless; He has blessed, and I cannot change it.
4:23:21/He has not seen wrongdoing in Jacob, nor has He seen trouble in Israel. The LORD their God is with them, and the shout of a king is among them.
4:23:22/God brought them out of Egypt; they have the strength of a wild ox.
4:23:23/No magic spell can bind Jacob, no sorcery can hold Israel. At this time it will be said of Jacob and of Israel, 'See what God has done!'
4:23:24/Look, a people rising like a lioness, and rousing itself like a lion, not resting until it devours its prey and drinks the blood of its victims."
4:23:25/Then Balak said to Balaam, "Do not curse them at all, nor bless them at all."
4:23:26/But Balaam answered Balak, "Didn't I tell you, 'Whatever the LORD says, that I must do'?"
4:23:27/And Balak said to Balaam, "Come, please, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there."
4:23:28/So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, overlooking the desert.
4:23:29/And Balaam said to Balak, "Build seven altars for me here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me here."
4:23:30/And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
4:24:1/When Balaam realized that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, he didn't seek enchantments as before, but instead, he looked toward the wilderness.
4:24:2/Balaam looked up and saw Israel living in their tents by tribes; and the spirit of God came upon him.
4:24:3/He began his prophetic speech, saying, "Balaam, the son of Beor, declares, the man with clear vision states:
4:24:4/"He speaks, who listened to God's words, who saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, yet with eyes wide open:
4:24:5/"How beautiful are your tents, O Jacob, your dwellings, O Israel!
4:24:6/"They spread out like valleys, like gardens by the river, like aloes planted by the LORD, like cedars beside the waters.
4:24:7/"He will pour water from his buckets, and his offspring will thrive in abundant waters, his king will be greater than Agag, and his kingdom will be lifted high.
4:24:8/"God brought him out of Egypt; he has the strength of a wild ox: he will consume the nations opposing him, crush their bones, and pierce them with his arrows.
4:24:9/"He crouches, lies down like a lion, like a mighty lion: who dares to rouse him? Blessed are those who bless you, and cursed are those who curse you."
4:24:10/Balak's anger flared against Balaam, and he clapped his hands in frustration: Balak said to Balaam, "I summoned you to curse my enemies, and yet, you've blessed them three times over.
4:24:11/"Now, run back to your place! I intended to honor you greatly, but the LORD has kept you from honor."
4:24:12/Balaam replied to Balak, "Didn't I also tell your messengers you sent to me,
4:24:13/'Even if Balak gave me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the LORD's command to do good or bad on my own; I will say only what the LORD tells me'?
4:24:14/"And now, I'm returning to my people. Let me tell you what this people will do to your people in the days to come."
4:24:15/He continued his prophetic speech, saying, "Balaam, the son of Beor, declares, the man with clear vision states:
4:24:16/"He speaks, who listened to God's words, who understood the knowledge of the Most High, who saw the vision of the Almighty, falling into a trance, yet with eyes wide open:
4:24:17/"I see him, but not now; I behold him, but not near: a Star will come out of Jacob, a Scepter will rise out of Israel, and will crush the borders of Moab, and destroy all the sons of Sheth.
4:24:18/"Edom will become a possession, Seir also will be conquered by their enemies; and Israel will act valiantly.
4:24:19/"A ruler will come out of Jacob, who will destroy the survivors of the city.
4:24:20/When he saw Amalek, he began his prophetic speech, saying, "Amalek was the foremost of nations, but its end is to perish forever."
4:24:21/He looked at the Kenites, and began his prophetic speech, saying, "Your dwelling place is strong, and you put your nest in a rock.
4:24:22/"Yet the Kenite will be destroyed, until Asshur takes you away captive."
4:24:23/He continued his prophetic speech, saying, "Alas, who can survive when God does this!
4:24:24/"Ships will come from the coast of Kittim, they will subdue Asshur and Eber, and they too will come to ruin forever."
4:24:25/Balaam got up, went back to his place, and Balak also went on his way.
4:25:1/Israel stayed in Shittim, and the people began to engage in sexual immorality with the women of Moab.
4:25:2/They invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
4:25:3/Israel aligned himself with Baalpeor, and the LORD's anger burned against Israel.
4:25:4/The LORD told Moses, "Take all the leaders of the people, and execute them in broad daylight before the LORD, so that my fierce anger may turn away from Israel."
4:25:5/Moses said to the judges of Israel, "Each of you must kill those of your men who have aligned themselves with Baalpeor."
4:25:6/Then, one of the Israelites brought a Midianite woman to his brothers right in front of Moses and the whole Israelite community, who were mourning at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
4:25:7/When Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw this, he stood up from among the assembly, took a spear in his hand,
4:25:8/and followed the Israelite man into the tent, and drove the spear through both the Israelite man and the woman's abdomen. Thus, the plague against the Israelites was stopped.
4:25:9/But those who died in the plague numbered 24,000.
4:25:10/The LORD said to Moses,
4:25:11/"Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned my wrath away from the Israelites by being zealous with my zeal among them, so that I did not consume the Israelites in my jealousy."
4:25:12/Therefore, say, 'I grant him my covenant of peace:
4:25:13/And it shall be to him and his descendants after him, a covenant of a perpetual priesthood, because he was zealous for his God, and made atonement for the Israelites.'"
4:25:14/The name of the slain Israelite man, who was killed with the Midianite woman, was Zimri, son of Salu, a leader of a Simeonite family.
4:25:15/And the name of the slain Midianite woman was Cozbi, daughter of Zur; he was a leader of a people, a family head in Midian.
4:25:16/The LORD said to Moses,
4:25:17/"Treat the Midianites as enemies and strike them down,
4:25:18/because they treated you as enemies by their deceit in the affair of Peor and in the matter of Cozbi, the daughter of a Midianite leader, their sister, who was killed on the day of the plague because of Peor."
4:26:1/After the plague ended, the LORD spoke to Moses and Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
4:26:2/Count all the members of the Israelite community who are twenty years old or older and able to serve in the army, including everyone by their ancestral families.

4:26:52/The LORD said to Moses,
4:26:53/The land will be divided as an inheritance based on the number of names.

4:26:56/The division of the land will be by lot, whether for many or for few.
4:26:57/These are the Levites by their families: Gershon, from whom the Gershonite family comes; Kohath, from whom the Kohathite family comes; Merari, from whom the Merarite family comes.

4:26:61/Nadab and Abihu died when they offered unauthorized fire before the LORD.

4:27:1/Then the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, from the families of Manasseh the son of Joseph, approached. Their names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
4:27:2/They presented themselves before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the leaders, and the entire community at the entrance of the meeting tent, saying,
4:27:3/"Our father passed away in the wilderness. He wasn't part of Korah's rebellion against the LORD; he died because of his own sin and left no sons.
4:27:4/Why should our father's name disappear from his family just because he had no son? Give us property among our father's brothers."
4:27:5/Moses brought their case before the LORD.
4:27:6/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:27:7/"The daughters of Zelophehad are correct. You must indeed give them property as an inheritance among their father's brothers and transfer their father's inheritance to them.
4:27:8/Also, tell the Israelites, 'If a man dies and has no son, then you must transfer his inheritance to his daughter.
4:27:9/If he has no daughter, then you should give his inheritance to his brothers.
4:27:10/If he has no brothers, then you should give his inheritance to his father's brothers.
4:27:11/If his father has no brothers, then you should give his inheritance to the closest relative in his family, and he will own it. This will be a legal requirement for the Israelites, as the LORD commanded Moses."

4:27:13/After you have seen it, you too will be gathered to your people, just as Aaron your brother was.
4:27:14/Because you both disobeyed my command in the Desert of Zin during the dispute of the community, failing to uphold my holiness in their presence at the waters." These are the waters of Meribah at Kadesh in the Desert of Zin.

4:27:17/who will go out and come in before them, who will lead them out and bring them in, so the LORD's people will not be like sheep without a shepherd."
