4:27:23/laying his hands on him and giving him his charge, just as the LORD had instructed through Moses.
4:28:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:28:2/Tell the children of Israel, and say to them, My offering, and my food for my sacrifices made by fire, for a pleasing aroma to me, you must make sure to offer to me at the right times.
4:28:3/And you shall tell them, This is the fire offering you are to present to the LORD; two unblemished lambs of the first year, every day, as a regular burnt offering.
4:28:4/You must offer one lamb in the morning, and the other lamb you must offer in the evening.
4:28:5/And a tenth of an ephah of flour for a grain offering, mixed with a quarter of a hin of pressed oil.
4:28:6/It is a regular burnt offering, established at Mount Sinai as a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
4:28:7/And the drink offering with it shall be a quarter of a hin for each lamb; in the sacred place you must pour out strong wine to the LORD as a drink offering.
4:28:8/And the other lamb you must offer in the evening: like the grain offering of the morning, and its drink offering, you must offer it as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
4:28:9/And on the sabbath day two unblemished lambs of the first year, and two tenths of an ephah of flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, and its drink offering.
4:28:10/This is the burnt offering for every sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering, and its drink offering.
4:28:11/And at the start of your months you must present a burnt offering to the LORD; two young bulls, and one ram, seven unblemished lambs of the first year.
4:28:12/And three tenths of an ephah of flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, for one bull; and two tenths of an ephah of flour for a grain offering, mixed with oil, for one ram;
4:28:13/And a tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with oil as a grain offering for one lamb; as a burnt offering of a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
4:28:14/And their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull, a third of a hin for a ram, and a quarter of a hin for a lamb: this is the burnt offering for each month throughout the months of the year.
4:28:15/And one goat for a sin offering to the LORD shall be offered, in addition to the regular burnt offering, and its drink offering.
4:28:16/And on the fourteenth day of the first month is the LORD's Passover.
4:28:17/And on the fifteenth day of this month is the feast; for seven days unleavened bread shall be eaten.
4:28:18/On the first day there shall be a sacred assembly; you must not do any ordinary work on it.
4:28:19/But you must offer a fire offering, a burnt offering to the LORD; two young bulls, one ram, and seven unblemished lambs of the first year: they must be without defect for you.
4:28:20/And their grain offering shall be of flour mixed with oil: three tenths for a bull, and two tenths for a ram;
4:28:21/A tenth for each lamb, for all seven lambs;
4:28:22/And one goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you.
4:28:23/You must offer these in addition to the morning burnt offering, which is for a regular burnt offering.
4:28:24/In this way you must offer daily, for seven days, the food of the fire offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD; it must be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering, and its drink offering.
4:28:25/And on the seventh day you shall have a sacred assembly; you must not do any ordinary work.
4:28:26/Also on the day of the firstfruits, when you bring a new grain offering to the LORD, after your weeks are out, you shall have a sacred assembly; you must not do any ordinary work.
4:28:27/But you must offer the burnt offering for a pleasing aroma to the LORD; two young bulls, one ram, seven lambs of the first year.
4:28:28/And their grain offering of flour mixed with oil, three tenths for one bull, two tenths for one ram,
4:28:29/A tenth for each lamb, for all seven lambs;
4:28:30/And one goat, to make atonement for you.
4:28:31/You must offer them in addition to the regular burnt offering, and its grain offering, (they must be without defect for you) and their drink offerings.
4:29:1/On the first day of the seventh month, you must have a sacred gathering; you are not to do any regular work: it is a day for blowing trumpets for you.
4:29:2/You must present a burnt offering as a pleasing aroma to the LORD; one young bull, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year without any defects: 
4:29:3/Their grain offering must be flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, and two-tenths for the ram, 
4:29:4/And one-tenth for each lamb, for all seven lambs: 
4:29:5/And one goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you: 
4:29:6/In addition to the monthly burnt offering, its grain offering, the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and their drink offerings, according to the prescribed rules, as a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
4:29:7/On the tenth day of this seventh month you must have a sacred gathering; you must humble yourselves: you are not to do any work on that day: 
4:29:8/But you must present a burnt offering to the LORD as a pleasing aroma; one young bull, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year; they must be without any defects for you: 
4:29:9/Their grain offering must be flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah for the bull, and two-tenths for the ram, 
4:29:10/One-tenth for each lamb, for all seven lambs: 
4:29:11/One goat for a sin offering; in addition to the sin offering for atonement, the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
4:29:12/On the fifteenth day of the seventh month you must have a sacred gathering; you are not to do any regular work, and you must celebrate a festival to the LORD for seven days: 
4:29:13/You must present a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, as a pleasing aroma to the LORD; thirteen young bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year; they must be without any defects: 
4:29:14/Their grain offering must be flour mixed with oil, three-tenths of an ephah for each of the thirteen bulls, two-tenths for each ram, 
4:29:15/And one-tenth for each of the fourteen lambs: 
4:29:16/And one goat for a sin offering; in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
4:29:17/On the second day you must offer twelve young bulls, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without any defects: 
4:29:18/Their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, must be according to their number, as prescribed: 
4:29:19/And one goat for a sin offering; in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and their drink offerings.
4:29:20/On the third day eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without any defects; 
4:29:21/Their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, must be according to their number, as prescribed: 
4:29:22/And one goat for a sin offering; in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
4:29:23/On the fourth day ten bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without any defects: 
4:29:24/Their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, must be according to their number, as prescribed: 
4:29:25/And one goat for a sin offering; in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
4:29:26/On the fifth day nine bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without any defects: 
4:29:27/Their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, must be according to their number, as prescribed: 
4:29:28/And one goat for a sin offering; in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
4:29:29/On the sixth day eight bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without any defects: 
4:29:30/Their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, must be according to their number, as prescribed: 
4:29:31/And one goat for a sin offering; in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
4:29:32/On the seventh day seven bulls, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without any defects: 
4:29:33/Their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, must be according to their number, as prescribed: 
4:29:34/And one goat for a sin offering; in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
4:29:35/On the eighth day you must have a solemn assembly: you are not to do any regular work on that day: 
4:29:36/But you must present a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, as a pleasing aroma to the LORD: one bull, one ram, seven lambs of the first year without any defects: 
4:29:37/Their grain offering and their drink offerings for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs, must be according to their number, as prescribed: 
4:29:38/And one goat for a sin offering; in addition to the regular burnt offering, its grain offering, and its drink offering.
4:29:39/These things you must do for the LORD at your appointed festivals, in addition to your vows, and your freewill offerings, for your burnt offerings, for your grain offerings, for your drink offerings, and for your peace offerings.
4:29:40/And Moses told the children of Israel everything just as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:30:1/Moses spoke to the leaders of the tribes about the Israelites, saying, "This is what the LORD has commanded.
4:30:2/If a man makes a promise to the LORD, or swears an oath to commit himself with a pledge; he must not break his promise, he must do everything he said he would.
4:30:3/If a woman makes a promise to the LORD, and commits herself with a pledge, while she is living in her father's house during her youth;
4:30:4/And her father hears her promise, and the pledge by which she has committed herself, and her father does not object; then all her promises shall be upheld, and every pledge by which she has committed herself shall be upheld.
4:30:5/But if her father objects on the day he hears about it; none of her promises, or the pledges by which she has committed herself, shall be upheld: and the LORD will forgive her, because her father objected.
4:30:6/And if she is married, when she makes a promise, or says anything that commits herself;
4:30:7/And her husband hears it, and does not object on the day he hears it: then her promises shall be upheld, and the pledges by which she has committed herself shall be upheld.
4:30:8/But if her husband objects on the day he hears it; then he can nullify the promise she made, and what she said that committed herself, making it not valid: and the LORD will forgive her.
4:30:9/But every promise made by a widow, or by a divorced woman, by which they have committed themselves, shall be binding on her.
4:30:10/And if she made a promise in her husband's house, or committed herself with a pledge by an oath;
4:30:11/And her husband hears it, and does not object, and does not nullify it: then all her promises shall be upheld, and every pledge by which she has committed herself shall be upheld.
4:30:12/But if her husband nullifies them on the day he hears them; then whatever she said concerning her promises, or concerning the pledge of her commitment, shall not be upheld: her husband has nullified them; and the LORD will forgive her.
4:30:13/Every promise, and every binding oath to commit oneself, her husband can uphold it, or her husband can nullify it.
4:30:14/But if her husband says nothing to her from day to day; then he upholds all her promises, or all her pledges, which are upon her: he confirms them, because he said nothing to her on the day he heard them.
4:30:15/But if he nullifies them after he has heard them; then he shall bear the consequences of her actions.
4:30:16/These are the regulations, which the LORD commanded Moses, for a husband and his wife, and for a father and his daughter, while she is still young and living in her father's house.
4:31:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:31:2/Get revenge for the Israelites on the Midianites; afterward, you will join your ancestors in death.
4:31:3/And Moses told the people, "Prepare some of you for battle, and attack the Midianites to avenge the LORD.
4:31:4/From each tribe of Israel, send a thousand men to fight.
4:31:5/So from the thousands of Israel, a thousand from each tribe, twelve thousand prepared for battle were provided.
4:31:6/And Moses sent them to battle, a thousand from each tribe, along with Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, with the sacred objects and the trumpets for signaling in his hand.
4:31:7/And they fought against the Midianites, as the LORD had commanded Moses; and they killed all the men.
4:31:8/They also killed the kings of Midian, along with others killed; namely, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam the son of Beor with the sword.
4:31:9/The Israelites captured all the Midianite women and children, and took all their cattle, flocks, and goods as loot.
4:31:10/They burned all the places where the Midianites had lived and all their encampments.
4:31:11/They took all the loot and all the captives, both people and animals.
4:31:12/And they brought the captives, the loot, and the spoils to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the Israelite community, at the camp on the plains of Moab, by the Jordan across from Jericho.
4:31:13/Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the community went outside the camp to meet them.
4:31:14/Moses was angry with the commanders of the army, the leaders of thousands and hundreds, who returned from the battle.
4:31:15/And Moses asked them, "Have you let all the women live?
4:31:16/These women caused the Israelites, through Balaam's advice, to be unfaithful to the LORD in the Peor incident, so a plague struck the LORD's community.
4:31:17/Now, kill every male among the children, and kill every woman who has slept with a man.
4:31:18/But save for yourselves every girl who has never slept with a man.
4:31:19/Anyone who has killed someone or touched someone who was killed must stay outside the camp for seven days. On the third and seventh days, purify yourselves and your captives.
4:31:20/Also purify every garment, everything made of leather, goat hair, and wood."
4:31:21/And Eleazar the priest said to the soldiers who had gone into battle, "This is the statute of the law that the LORD has commanded Moses:
4:31:22/Only the gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, and lead,
4:31:23/Everything that can withstand fire, you must put through the fire to purify it, but it must also be purified with the water of cleansing. Everything that cannot withstand fire, you must put through water.
4:31:24/On the seventh day, wash your clothes and you will be clean. After that, you may enter the camp."
4:31:25/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:31:26/Count the loot that was taken, both of people and animals, you, Eleazar the priest, and the heads of the fathers' houses of the community.
4:31:27/Divide the loot between the soldiers who took part in the battle and the rest of the community.
4:31:28/Set aside a portion for the LORD from the soldiers who fought in the battle: one out of every five hundred, whether people, cattle, donkeys, or sheep.
4:31:29/Take this portion from their half and give it to Eleazar the priest as an offering to the LORD.
4:31:30/From the Israelites' half, take one out of every fifty, from the people, cattle, donkeys, sheep, or any other animals, and give them to the Levites, who are responsible for the care of the LORD's Tabernacle.
4:31:31/And Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:31:32/The loot, aside from what the soldiers took, was 675,000 sheep,
4:31:33/72,000 cattle,
4:31:34/61,000 donkeys,
4:31:35/And 32,000 women who had never slept with a man.
4:31:36/The half share of those who went to war was 337,500 sheep,
4:31:37/And the LORD's tribute from the sheep was 675.
4:31:38/The cattle numbered 36,000, of which the LORD's tribute was 72.
4:31:39/The donkeys were 30,500, of which the LORD's tribute was 61.
4:31:40/The people numbered 16,000, of which the LORD's tribute was 32 people.
4:31:41/And Moses gave the tribute, which was the LORD's offering, to Eleazar the priest, as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:31:42/And from the Israelites' half, which Moses separated from the men who fought
4:31:43/(Now the community's half was 337,500 sheep,
4:31:44/36,000 cattle,
4:31:45/30,500 donkeys,
4:31:46/And 16,000 people;)
4:31:47/From the Israelites' half, Moses took one out of every fifty, both of people and animals, and gave them to the Levites, who were responsible for the care of the LORD's Tabernacle, as the LORD commanded Moses.
4:31:48/The commanders of thousands and hundreds approached Moses
4:31:49/And said to him, "Your servants have counted the soldiers under our command, and not one is missing.
4:31:50/Therefore, we have brought an offering for the LORD, what each of us found - gold jewelry, armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and pendants - to make atonement for ourselves before the LORD."
4:31:51/And Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from them, all crafted items.
4:31:52/All the gold given as an offering to the LORD, from the commanders of thousands and hundreds, was 16,750 shekels.
4:31:53/(The soldiers had taken loot for themselves.)
4:31:54/And Moses and Eleazar the priest brought the gold from the commanders of thousands and hundreds into the Tent of Meeting as a memorial for the Israelites before the LORD.
4:32:1/The descendants of Reuben and Gad had a vast number of livestock. When they saw the lands of Jazer and Gilead, they realized these places were perfect for raising cattle.
4:32:2/The descendants of Gad and Reuben approached Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the community, saying,
4:32:3/Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Shebam, Nebo, and Beon,
4:32:4/These regions, which the LORD conquered before the Israelite community, are ideal for livestock, and we have livestock.
4:32:5/Therefore, they proposed, if we have found favor in your eyes, let this land be given to us as our property. Do not make us cross the Jordan River.
4:32:6/Moses responded to the descendants of Gad and Reuben, "Are your brothers to go to war while you stay here?
4:32:7/Why would you discourage the Israelites from crossing into the land the LORD has given them?
4:32:8/This is what your ancestors did when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to explore the land.
4:32:9/After they went up to the Valley of Eshcol and viewed the land, they discouraged the Israelites from entering the land the LORD had given them.
4:32:10/And the LORD became very angry at that time and swore an oath,
4:32:11/Saying, 'Certainly, none of the men aged twenty and above who came from Egypt will see the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, because they have not fully followed me,
4:32:12/Except for Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua son of Nun, for they have wholeheartedly followed the LORD.'
4:32:13/The LORD's anger burned against Israel, and he made them wander in the wilderness for forty years, until the entire generation that had done evil in his sight was gone.
4:32:14/And now, you, a brood of sinners, stand in your ancestors' place, adding more to the LORD's fierce anger against Israel.
4:32:15/If you turn away from following him, he will again leave them in the wilderness, and you will be responsible for their destruction."
4:32:16/They approached him and said, "We would like to build pens here for our livestock and cities for our children.
4:32:17/But we are ready to arm ourselves and lead the Israelites until we have brought them to their place. Meanwhile, our children will stay in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
4:32:18/We will not return to our homes until each Israelite has received their inheritance.
4:32:19/We will not claim any inheritance with them on the other side of the Jordan River or beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on the east side of the Jordan."
4:32:20/Moses said to them, "If you do this, if you arm yourselves before the LORD for battle,
4:32:21/And all of you armed men cross the Jordan before the LORD until he has driven out his enemies from before him,
4:32:22/And the land is subdued before the LORD, then afterward you may return guiltless before the LORD and Israel, and this land will be your possession before the LORD.
4:32:23/But if you do not do this, you will be sinning against the LORD, and be sure your sin will catch up with you.
4:32:24/Build cities for your children and pens for your sheep, and do what you have promised."
4:32:25/The descendants of Gad and Reuben said to Moses, "Your servants will do as my lord commands.
4:32:26/Our children, wives, flocks, and all our livestock will stay in the cities of Gilead,
4:32:27/But your servants, every man armed for battle, will cross over before the LORD to fight, just as my lord says."
4:32:28/So Moses gave orders about them to Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders of the Israelite tribes.
4:32:29/Moses said to them, "If the descendants of Gad and Reuben cross the Jordan with you, every man equipped for battle before the LORD, and the land is subdued before you, then give them the land of Gilead as a possession.
4:32:30/However, if they do not cross over armed, they must accept their possessions among you in Canaan."
4:32:31/The descendants of Gad and Reuben replied, "As the LORD has said to your servants, so we will do.
4:32:32/We will cross over armed before the LORD into Canaan, so the possession of our inheritance on this side of the Jordan may be ours."
4:32:33/And Moses gave to them, to the descendants of Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan—the land along with its cities and territories, the cities of the surrounding country.

4:32:35/And Atroth, Shophan, Jaazer, and Jogbehah,

4:32:38/And Nebo and Baalmeon (their names being changed) and Sibmah. They renamed the cities they rebuilt.

4:33:4/For the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom the LORD had struck down among them. On their gods, the LORD also executed judgments.
4:33:5/The Israelites moved from Rameses and camped in Succoth.

4:33:7/They left Etham, turned back to Pihahiroth, east of Baalzephon, and camped near Migdol.
4:33:8/They left from before Pihahiroth, passed through the sea into the wilderness, traveled for three days in the wilderness of Etham, and camped in Marah.

4:33:10/They moved from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.

4:33:13/They left Dophkah and camped in Alush.
4:33:14/They moved from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.

4:33:20/They left Rimmonparez and camped in Libnah.
4:33:21/They moved from Libnah and camped at Rissah.

4:33:26/They moved from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
4:33:27/They left Tahath and camped at Tarah.
4:33:28/They moved from Tarah and camped in Mithcah.

4:33:30/They left Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.

4:33:32/They moved from Benejaakan and camped at Horhagidgad.
4:33:33/They went from Horhagidgad and camped in Jotbathah.

4:33:35/They left Ebronah and camped at Eziongaber.
4:33:36/They moved from Eziongaber and camped in the wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.
4:33:37/They moved from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the edge of the land of Edom.

4:33:39/Aaron was one hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.

4:33:50/And the LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan near Jericho, saying,
4:33:51/Tell the Israelites, when you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
4:33:52/you must drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you, destroy all their carved images and molten idols, and demolish all their high places.
4:33:53/You will take over the land and live in it, for I have given you the land to possess.
4:33:54/You shall divide the land by lot as an inheritance among your families. To the larger groups you shall give a larger inheritance, and to the smaller groups a smaller one. Each group's inheritance will be where their lot falls. According to the tribes of your ancestors, you will inherit.
4:33:55/But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then those you let remain will become irritants in your eyes and thorns in your sides, and they will trouble you in the land where you live.
4:33:56/And it will happen that I will do to you as I planned to do to them.
4:34:1/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:34:2/Tell the Israelites, when you enter the land of Canaan, this is the land that will be your inheritance, the land of Canaan with its boundaries.
4:34:3/Your southern boundary will start from the Zin Desert along the border of Edom. Your southern border will be the easternmost part of the Salt Sea.
4:34:4/Your border will turn from the south up to the Scorpion Pass, continue to Zin, and from the south to Kadesh Barnea. Then it will go to Hazar Addar and over to Azmon.
4:34:5/From Azmon, the border will turn toward the Brook of Egypt, and its end will be at the Mediterranean Sea.
4:34:6/For your western boundary, you will have the Mediterranean Sea. This will be your western border.
4:34:7/Your northern boundary will start from the Mediterranean Sea to Mount Hor.
4:34:8/From Mount Hor, you will mark out your border to the entrance of Hamath, and the end of the border will be at Zedad.
4:34:9/Then the border will extend to Ziphron, and its end will be at Hazar Enan. This will be your northern border.
4:34:10/You will mark out your eastern border from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
4:34:11/The border will go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain, then descend and rest on the eastern shore of the Sea of Galilee.
4:34:12/Then the border will go down along the Jordan and end at the Dead Sea. This will be your land with its surrounding boundaries.

4:34:14/For the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance. These two and a half tribes have received their inheritance on the east side of the Jordan near Jericho, toward the sunrise.
4:34:15/The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side of the Jordan near Jericho, to the east, toward the sunrise.

4:35:1/The LORD spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan near Jericho, saying,
4:35:2/Tell the Israelites to give the Levites cities to live in from their own possessions; and you must also give the Levites the surrounding lands of those cities.
4:35:3/The cities will be their homes, and the surrounding lands will be for their livestock, their possessions, and all their animals.
4:35:4/The lands around the cities that you give to the Levites should extend outward a thousand cubits from the city walls all around.
4:35:5/You must measure 2000 cubits from the city edge in every direction—east, south, west, and north—with the city in the center. These areas will be the Levites' surrounding lands.
4:35:6/Among the cities you give to the Levites, six must be designated as cities of refuge for anyone who accidentally kills someone, so they can flee there. In addition, give them forty-two other cities.
4:35:7/So, in total, you will give the Levites forty-eight cities with their surrounding lands.
4:35:8/The cities you give will come from the possessions of the Israelites. From those with more, you will give more; from those with less, you will give less. Each tribe will give some of its cities to the Levites, proportional to its inheritance.
4:35:9/And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
4:35:10/Tell the Israelites that when they cross the Jordan into Canaan,
4:35:11/they must designate cities as cities of refuge for anyone who accidentally kills someone, so they can flee there.
4:35:12/These cities will be your refuge from the avenger, ensuring that the person who killed someone accidentally does not die before they stand trial before the community.
4:35:13/You must designate six of these cities as cities of refuge.
4:35:14/You will designate three cities on the east side of the Jordan and three cities in Canaan as cities of refuge.
4:35:15/These six cities will serve as a refuge for both the Israelites and any foreigners living among them, so anyone who kills a person accidentally can flee there.
4:35:16/If someone kills another with an iron object, causing death, that person is a murderer and must be put to death.
4:35:17/If someone kills another by throwing a stone that could cause death, and it does, that person is a murderer and must be put to death.
4:35:18/Or if someone kills another with a wooden object that could cause death, and it does, that person is a murderer and must be put to death.
4:35:19/The avenger of blood can kill the murderer upon encountering them.
4:35:20/But if someone pushes another out of hatred, or throws something at them lying in wait, causing death,
4:35:21/Or in hostility hits them with their hand, causing death, the person who struck the blow must be put to death; they are a murderer. The avenger of blood can kill the murderer upon encountering them.
4:35:22/But if someone pushes another suddenly without hostility, or throws anything at them without lying in wait,
4:35:23/Or uses any stone that could cause death without seeing the person, causing their death without being their enemy or intending harm,
4:35:24/Then the community must judge between the killer and the avenger of blood according to these rules.
4:35:25/The community must protect the killer from the avenger of blood and send them back to the city of refuge where they had fled, and they must stay there until the high priest, who was anointed with holy oil, dies.
4:35:26/But if the killer ever leaves the area of their city of refuge,
4:35:27/And the avenger of blood finds them outside the city of refuge and kills them, the avenger will not be guilty of murder.
4:35:28/The killer must stay within the bounds of their city of refuge until the high priest dies. After that, they can return to their own property.
4:35:29/These instructions will serve as a legal standard for you throughout your generations wherever you live.
4:35:30/Anyone who kills a person must be put to death as a murderer only on the testimony of witnesses. But no one can be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
4:35:31/You must not accept any ransom for the life of a murderer who deserves death; they must surely be put to death.
4:35:32/You must not accept a ransom for someone who has fled to their city of refuge, allowing them to return home before the death of the high priest.
4:35:33/Do not defile the land where you live, for bloodshed defiles the land, and no atonement can be made for the land on which blood has been shed, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
4:35:34/Therefore, do not pollute the land in which you live, where I myself dwell, for I, the LORD, dwell among the Israelites.
4:36:1/The leading heads of the families of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh, from the descendants of Joseph, approached and spoke before Moses and the leaders, the heads of the families of Israel:
4:36:2/They said, "The LORD instructed you to distribute the land as an inheritance by lot among the Israelites: and you were told by the LORD to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
4:36:3/If they marry men from any other tribes of Israel, their inheritance will be taken from our ancestors' inheritance and added to the inheritance of the tribe they marry into: thus, it will be removed from our allotted inheritance.
4:36:4/And when the Jubilee for the Israelites comes, their inheritance will be added to that of the tribe they have married into: thus, their inheritance will be taken from our fathers' tribe.
4:36:5/Moses instructed the Israelites according to the LORD's command, saying, "The tribe of Joseph's descendants has spoken correctly.
4:36:6/This is what the LORD commands regarding Zelophehad's daughters: They may marry whoever they wish; but they must marry within the family of their father's tribe.
4:36:7/This way, the inheritance among the Israelites will not shift from one tribe to another: for each Israelite must maintain the inheritance of his ancestors' tribe.
4:36:8/And any daughter who inherits land in any Israelite tribe must marry someone from her father's tribal family, so that each Israelite can keep the inheritance of his ancestors.
4:36:9/The inheritance must not transfer from one tribe to another; instead, each of the Israelite tribes must keep to its own inheritance.
4:36:10/Just as the LORD commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad:
4:36:11/Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, married their cousins on their father's side:
4:36:12/They married into the families of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in their father's family tribe.
4:36:13/These are the commands and laws the LORD gave through Moses to the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan near Jericho.
5:1:1/These are the words Moses spoke to all Israel on the east side of the Jordan River in the wilderness, in the plain opposite the Red Sea, between Paran, Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
5:1:2/It takes eleven days to travel from Horeb to Kadeshbarnea by the Mount Seir route.
5:1:3/In the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses addressed the Israelites, following all the instructions the LORD had given him for them.
5:1:4/This was after he had defeated Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and Og, king of Bashan, who lived in Ashtaroth and Edrei.
5:1:5/While in the land of Moab, Moses began to explain this law, saying,
5:1:6/The LORD our God said to us at Horeb, 'You have stayed long enough at this mountain.
5:1:7/Turn and set out on your journey. Go to the Amorite hills and to all the neighboring regions—the Jordan Valley, the hill country, the western foothills, the Negev, and the coastal plain. Go to the land of the Canaanites and to Lebanon, as far as the great river, the Euphrates.
5:1:8/Look, I have given you this land. Go in and take possession of the land the LORD swore he would give to your ancestors—Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—and to their descendants after them.'
5:1:9/At that time, I said to you, 'I can't manage you by myself.
5:1:10/The LORD your God has increased your numbers so that today you are as numerous as the stars in the sky.
5:1:11/May the LORD, the God of your ancestors, increase you a thousand times and bless you as he has promised!
5:1:12/But how can I bear your problems, your burdens, and your disputes all by myself?
5:1:13/Choose some wise, understanding, and respected men from each of your tribes, and I will set them over you.'
5:1:14/You agreed to my suggestion and said, 'It's a good idea to do this.'
5:1:15/So I took the leading men of your tribes, wise and respected individuals, and appointed them to have authority over you—as commanders of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties, of tens, and as tribal officials.
5:1:16/And I instructed your judges at that time, 'Hear the disputes between your people and judge fairly, whether the case is between two Israelites or between an Israelite and a foreigner residing among you.
5:1:17/Do not show partiality in judgment; hear both small and great alike. Do not be afraid of anyone, for judgment belongs to God. Bring me any case too hard for you, and I will hear it.'
5:1:18/At that time, I told you everything you were to do.
5:1:19/Then, as the LORD our God commanded us, we set out from Horeb and went through all that vast and dreadful wilderness that you saw on the way to the hill country of the Amorites, and we reached Kadesh Barnea.
5:1:20/Then I said to you, 'You have reached the hill country of the Amorites, which the LORD our God is giving us.
5:1:21/See, the LORD your God has given you the land. Go up and take possession of it as the LORD, the God of your ancestors, told you. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged.'
5:1:22/Then all of you came to me and said, 'Let's send men ahead to spy out the land for us and bring back a report about the route we are to take and the cities we will come to.'
5:1:23/The idea seemed good to me; so I selected twelve of you, one man from each tribe.
5:1:24/They left and went up into the hills, came to the Valley of Eshcol, and explored it.
5:1:25/Taking with them some of the fruit of the land, they brought it down to us and reported, 'It is a good land that the LORD our God is giving us.'
5:1:26/But you were unwilling to go up; you rebelled against the command of the LORD your God.
5:1:27/You grumbled in your tents and said, 'The LORD must hate us; that's why he brought us out of Egypt to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites to destroy us.
5:1:28/Where can we go? Our brothers have made our hearts melt in fear. They say, "The people are stronger and taller than we are; the cities are large, with walls up to the sky. We even saw the Anakites there."'
5:1:29/Then I said to you, 'Do not be terrified; do not be afraid of them.
5:1:30/The LORD your God, who is going before you, will fight for you, as he did for you in Egypt, before your very eyes,
5:1:31/and in the wilderness. There you saw how the LORD your God carried you, as a father carries his son, all the way you went until you reached this place.'
5:1:32/In spite of this, you did not trust in the LORD your God,
5:1:33/who went ahead of you on your journey, in fire by night and in a cloud by day, to search out places for you to camp and to show you the way you should go.
5:1:34/When the LORD heard what you said, he was angry and solemnly swore:
5:1:35/'No one from this evil generation shall see the good land I swore to give your ancestors,
5:1:36/except Caleb son of Jephunneh. He will see it, and I will give him and his descendants the land he set his feet on, because he followed the LORD completely.'
5:1:37/Because of you, the LORD became angry with me also and said, 'You shall not enter it, either.
5:1:38/But Joshua son of Nun, who stands before you, will enter it. Encourage him, because he will lead Israel to inherit it.
5:1:39/And the little ones that you said would be taken captive, your children who do not yet know good from bad—they will enter the land. I will give it to them and they will take possession of it.
5:1:40/But as for you, turn back and take your journey into the wilderness toward the Red Sea.'
5:1:41/Then you replied, 'We have sinned against the LORD. We will go up and fight, as the LORD our God commanded us.' So every one of you put on his weapons, thinking it easy to go up into the hill country.
5:1:42/But the LORD said to me, 'Tell them, "Do not go up and fight, because I will not be with you. You will be defeated by your enemies."'
5:1:43/So I told you, but you would not listen. You rebelled against the LORD's command and in your arrogance went up into the hill country.
5:1:44/The Amorites who lived in those hills came out against you; they chased you like a swarm of bees and beat you down from Seir all the way to Hormah.
5:1:45/You came back and wept before the LORD, but he paid no attention to your weeping and turned a deaf ear to you.
5:1:46/And so you stayed in Kadesh many days—all the time you spent there.
5:2:1/Then we turned and began our journey into the wilderness, heading towards the Red Sea as the LORD instructed me. We traveled around Mount Seir for many days.
5:2:2/And the LORD spoke to me, saying,
5:2:3/"You have traveled around this mountain long enough. Now head north."
5:2:4/Tell the people, 'You will pass through the territory of your relatives, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. They will be afraid of you, so be very careful.
5:2:5/Do not provoke them, for I will not give you any of their land, not even enough to set your foot on. I have given Mount Seir to Esau as his inheritance.'
5:2:6/You must buy food from them with money so you can eat, and also buy water from them with money so you can drink.
5:2:7/For the LORD your God has blessed you in everything you have done. He has watched over your journey through this vast wilderness. For forty years, the LORD your God has been with you, and you have lacked nothing.'
5:2:8/So we bypassed our relatives, the descendants of Esau who live in Seir. We traveled along the road from Elath and Eziongaber, then we turned and traveled through the wilderness of Moab.
5:2:9/Then the LORD said to me, 'Do not harass the Moabites or provoke them to war, for I will not give you any of their land as an inheritance. I have given Ar to the descendants of Lot as their possession.'
5:2:10/Long ago, the Emim lived there, a people great, numerous, and tall as the Anakim.
5:2:11/They were also considered giants like the Anakim, but the Moabites called them Emim.
5:2:12/Before that, the Horites lived in Seir, but the descendants of Esau drove them out, destroyed them, and settled in their place, just as Israel did in the land of their possession, which the LORD gave them.
5:2:13/'Now get up and cross the Zered Valley.' So we crossed the Zered Valley.
5:2:14/The time from when we left Kadesh Barnea until we crossed the Zered Valley was thirty-eight years, until the entire generation of fighting men had perished from the camp, as the LORD had sworn to them.
5:2:15/Indeed, the LORD's hand was against them, to eliminate them from the camp until they were all gone.
5:2:16/So when all the men of fighting age had died,
5:2:17/the LORD said to me,
5:2:18/'Today you are to pass by the region of Moab at Ar.
5:2:19/When you approach the Ammonites, do not harass them or provoke them, for I will not give you any of the land of the Ammonites as a possession; I have given it to the descendants of Lot as a possession.'
5:2:20/(That was also considered a land of giants; giants formerly lived there, but the Ammonites call them Zamzummim,
5:2:21/a people great, numerous, and tall as the Anakim. But the LORD destroyed them before the Ammonites, who then settled in their place,
5:2:22/just as he did for the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir, when he destroyed the Horites before them. They drove them out and have lived in their place to this day.
5:2:23/And the Avvites, who lived in villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, who came from Caphtor, destroyed them and lived in their place.)
5:2:24/'Get up, take your journey, and cross the Arnon Gorge. See, I have given into your hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin to take possession of it and engage him in battle.
5:2:25/Today I will start to put the fear and dread of you on all the nations under heaven. They will hear reports of you and tremble and be in anguish because of you.'
5:2:26/I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon with a peaceful proposal, saying,
5:2:27/'Let me pass through your land. I will stick to the main road; I will not turn aside to the right or to the left.
5:2:28/Sell me food for money so that I may eat, and give me water for money so that I may drink. I only want to pass through on foot,
5:2:29/as the descendants of Esau who live in Seir and the Moabites who live in Ar did for me, until I cross the Jordan into the land the LORD our God is giving us.'
5:2:30/But Sihon king of Heshbon refused to let us pass through. For the LORD your God made his spirit stubborn and his heart obstinate in order to give him into your hands, as he has now done.
5:2:31/And the LORD said to me, 'See, I have begun to deliver Sihon and his land over to you. Start to take possession of his land.'
5:2:32/Then Sihon and all his people came out to meet us in battle at Jahaz.
5:2:33/And the LORD our God delivered him over to us, and we defeated him, his sons, and all his people.
5:2:34/At that time we captured all his cities and completely destroyed the men, women, and children of every city. We left no survivors.
5:2:35/We took only the livestock as plunder for ourselves, along with the spoils of the cities we had captured.
5:2:36/From Aroer, which is on the edge of the Arnon Gorge, and from the city in the gorge, even to Gilead, there was not one city too strong for us. The LORD our God gave all of them into our hands.
5:2:37/But you did not approach the land of the Ammonites, any area along the Jabbok River, or the cities in the hills, or any place the LORD our God had forbidden us.
5:3:1/Then we turned and headed towards Bashan. Og, the king of Bashan, came out to fight us with all his people at Edrei.
5:3:2/And the LORD told me, "Don't be afraid of him: for I will hand him over to you, along with all his people and his land; and you shall deal with him as you did with Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon."
5:3:3/So the LORD our God handed Og, the king of Bashan, and all his people over to us. We defeated him until no one was left.
5:3:4/We captured all his cities at that time, not leaving a single one. We took sixty cities, the entire region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
5:3:5/All these cities had high walls, gates, and bars, in addition to a great number of towns without walls.
5:3:6/We completely destroyed them, just as we did with Sihon, king of Heshbon, annihilating every man, woman, and child in every city.
5:3:7/But we took all the livestock and the spoils of the cities for ourselves.
5:3:8/And at that time, we took the land from the two Amorite kings that was on this side of the Jordan, from the Arnon River to Mount Hermon;
5:3:9/(Mount Hermon is called Sirion by the Sidonians and Shenir by the Amorites.)
5:3:10/We took all the cities of the plateau, all of Gilead, and all of Bashan, up to Salcah and Edrei, cities of Og's kingdom in Bashan.
5:3:11/Og, king of Bashan, was the last of the giant kings. His iron bed was nine cubits long and four cubits wide, by the standard cubit.
5:3:12/And the land we took at that time, from Aroer by the Arnon River, half of Mount Gilead, and its cities, I gave to the Reubenites and Gadites.
5:3:13/The rest of Gilead and all of Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh. This included all the region of Argob in Bashan, which was known as the land of the giants.
5:3:14/Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, took the whole region of Argob as far as the borders of the Geshurites and Maacathites, and named the villages after himself, Havvoth Jair, as they are called to this day.
5:3:15/And I gave Gilead to Machir.
5:3:16/To the Reubenites and Gadites, I gave the territory from Gilead down to the Arnon River, with the middle of the valley as a border, and as far as the Jabbok River, the border of the Ammonites.
5:3:17/The plains also, along with the Jordan and the surrounding area, from Kinnereth to the Sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, below the slopes of Pisgah to the east.
5:3:18/And I commanded you at that time, saying, "The LORD your God has given you this land to take possession of it. You must cross over armed ahead of your fellow Israelites, all the warriors.
5:3:19/But your wives, your little ones, and your livestock (I know you have a lot of livestock) should stay in the cities I've given you,
5:3:20/until the LORD gives rest to your fellow Israelites as he has to you, and they too have taken possession of the land the LORD your God is giving them across the Jordan. After that, each of you may return to the possession I have given you."
5:3:21/And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, "You have seen with your own eyes all that the LORD your God has done to these two kings. The LORD will do the same to all the kingdoms you are about to enter.
5:3:22/Do not be afraid of them, for the LORD your God himself will fight for you."
5:3:23/And I pleaded with the LORD at that time, saying,
5:3:24/"O Sovereign LORD, you have begun to show your servant your greatness and your strong hand. For what god is there in heaven or on earth who can do the deeds and mighty works you do?
5:3:25/Please let me cross over and see the good land beyond the Jordan, that beautiful hill country, and Lebanon."
5:3:26/But the LORD was angry with me because of you and would not listen to me. The LORD said to me, "Enough from you; do not speak to me about this matter again.
5:3:27/Go up to the top of Pisgah and look west, north, south, and east. View the land with your own eyes, since you will not cross this Jordan.
5:3:28/But commission Joshua, encourage and strengthen him, for he will cross over ahead of the people and will enable them to inherit the land you will see."
5:3:29/So we stayed in the valley near Beth Peor.
5:4:1/So now, listen up, Israel, to the laws and rules I'm teaching you. Follow them so you can live, and enter and take over the land the LORD, the God of your ancestors, is giving you.
5:4:2/Don't add anything to what I command you, and don't take anything away from it. Stick to the commands of the LORD your God that I'm giving you.
5:4:3/You've seen for yourselves what the LORD did about Baalpeor: the LORD your God wiped out everyone who followed Baalpeor from among you.
5:4:4/But those of you who stayed loyal to the LORD your God are all still alive today.
5:4:5/Look, I've taught you laws and rules, just as the LORD my God commanded me. You should follow them in the land you're about to enter and take over.
5:4:6/So keep them and follow them, because that will show your wisdom and understanding to the nations. They'll hear about all these laws and say, 'This great nation is surely wise and understanding.'
5:4:7/What great nation is there that has a god as close to them as the LORD our God is to us whenever we call on him?
5:4:8/And what great nation has laws and rules as righteous as this entire law I'm setting before you today?
5:4:9/Just be careful and watch yourselves closely so that you don't forget the things your eyes have seen, and so they don't slip from your heart as long as you live. Teach them to your children and to their children after them.
5:4:10/Remember the day you stood before the LORD your God at Horeb, when the LORD said to me, 'Gather the people to me, and I will let them hear my words, so they may learn to revere me all the days they live on the earth, and may teach their children.'
5:4:11/You came near and stood at the foot of the mountain while it blazed with fire up to the very heavens, with black clouds and deep darkness.
5:4:12/Then the LORD spoke to you out of the fire. You heard the sound of words but saw no form; there was only a voice.
5:4:13/He announced his covenant to you, which he commanded you to follow, the Ten Commandments, and he wrote them on two stone tablets.
5:4:14/At that time, the LORD commanded me to teach you laws and rules for you to follow in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.
5:4:15/So watch yourselves carefully, since you did not see any form on the day the LORD spoke to you at Horeb out of the fire.
5:4:16/Be careful not to corrupt yourselves by making an idol in the form of any figure, not male or female,
5:4:17/not any animal on the earth, any bird that flies in the air,
5:4:18/not any creature that moves along the ground, or any fish in the waters below.
5:4:19/And be careful not to look up to the sky and see the sun, the moon, the stars—all the heavenly array—and be drawn away to worship and serve them, which the LORD your God has allotted to all the nations under heaven.
5:4:20/But you, the LORD has taken and brought out of the iron-smelting furnace, out of Egypt, to be his people, an inheritance, as you are today.
5:4:21/The LORD was angry with me because of you, and he swore that I would not cross the Jordan and enter the good land the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
5:4:22/I will die in this land; I will not cross the Jordan, but you are about to cross over and take possession of that good land.
5:4:23/Be careful not to forget the covenant of the LORD your God that he made with you; do not make for yourselves an idol in the form of anything the LORD your God has forbidden.
5:4:24/For the LORD your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
5:4:25/When you have children and grandchildren and have lived in the land a long time, if you then become corrupt and make any kind of idol, doing evil in the eyes of the LORD your God and arousing his anger,
5:4:26/I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today that you will quickly perish from the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess. You will not live there long but will be totally destroyed.
5:4:27/The LORD will scatter you among the peoples, and only a few of you will survive among the nations to which the LORD will drive you.
5:4:28/There you will worship man-made gods of wood and stone, which cannot see or hear or eat or smell.
5:4:29/But if from there you seek the LORD your God, you will find him if you seek him with all your heart and with all your soul.
5:4:30/When you are in distress and all these things have happened to you, then in later days you will return to the LORD your God and obey him.
5:4:31/For the LORD your God is a merciful God; he will not abandon or destroy you or forget the covenant with your ancestors, which he confirmed to them by oath.
5:4:32/Ask now about the former days, long before your time, from the day God created human beings on the earth; ask from one end of the heavens to the other. Has anything so great as this ever happened, or has anything like it ever been heard of?
5:4:33/Has any other people heard the voice of God speaking out of fire, as you have, and lived?
5:4:34/Has any god ever tried to take for himself one nation out of another nation, by tests, by signs and wonders, by war, by a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, or by great and awesome deeds, like all the things the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your very eyes?
5:4:35/You were shown these things so that you might know that the LORD is God; besides him there is no other.
5:4:36/From heaven he made you hear his voice to discipline you. On earth he showed you his great fire, and you heard his words from out of the fire.
5:4:37/Because he loved your ancestors and chose their descendants after them, he brought you out of Egypt by his Presence and his great strength,
5:4:38/to drive out before you nations greater and stronger than you and to bring you into their land to give it to you for your inheritance, as it is today.
5:4:39/Acknowledge and take to heart this day that the LORD is God in heaven above and on the earth below. There is no other.
5:4:40/Keep his decrees and commands, which I am giving you today, so that it may go well with you and your children after you and that you may live long in the land the LORD your God gives you for all time.
5:4:41/Then Moses set aside three cities east of the Jordan,
5:4:42/to which anyone who had killed a person could flee if they had unintentionally killed their neighbor without malice aforethought. They could flee to one of these cities and save their life.
5:4:43/The cities were Bezer in the wilderness plateau, for the Reubenites; Ramoth in Gilead, for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, for the Manassites.
5:4:44/This is the law Moses set before the Israelites.
5:4:45/These are the stipulations, decrees, and laws Moses gave them when they came out of Egypt
5:4:46/and were in the valley near Beth Peor east of the Jordan, in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon and was defeated by Moses and the Israelites as they came out of Egypt.
5:4:47/They took possession of his land and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two Amorite kings east of the Jordan.
5:4:48/This land extended from Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Gorge to Mount Siyon (that is, Hermon),
5:4:49/and included all the Arabah east of the Jordan, as far as the Sea of the Arabah, below the slopes of Pisgah.
5:5:1/Moses gathered all of Israel and said, "Listen, Israel, to the laws and rules I'm telling you today. Learn them, follow them, and put them into practice.
5:5:2/The LORD our God established a covenant with us at Horeb.
5:5:3/This covenant wasn't made with our ancestors, but with us, all of us who are alive here today.
5:5:4/The LORD spoke to you directly at the mountain from within the fire.
5:5:5/(I stood between the LORD and you at that time, to relay the LORD's words to you because you were afraid of the fire and didn't go up the mountain.) He said,
5:5:6/"I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
5:5:7/You must not have any other gods besides me.
5:5:8/Do not make for yourself any carved image or any representation of anything in heaven above, or on the earth beneath, or in the waters below.
5:5:9/Do not bow down to them or worship them; for I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God, punishing the children for the sin of the parents to the third and fourth generation of those who hate me,
5:5:10/But showing love to a thousand generations of those who love me and keep my commandments.
5:5:11/Do not misuse the name of the LORD your God, for the LORD will not hold anyone guiltless who misuses his name.
5:5:12/Observe the Sabbath day by keeping it holy, as the LORD your God has commanded you.
5:5:13/Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
5:5:14/But the seventh day is a Sabbath to the LORD your God. On it you shall not do any work, neither you, nor your son or daughter, nor your male or female servant, nor your ox, your donkey, or any of your animals, nor any foreigner residing in your towns, so that your male and female servants may rest as you do.
5:5:15/Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and that the LORD your God brought you out of there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm. Therefore the LORD your God has commanded you to observe the Sabbath day.
5:5:16/Respect your father and your mother, as the LORD your God has commanded you, so that you may live long and that it may go well with you in the land the LORD your God is giving you.
5:5:17/Do not murder.
5:5:18/Do not commit adultery.
5:5:19/Do not steal.
5:5:20/Do not give false testimony against your neighbor.
5:5:21/Do not covet your neighbor's wife. Do not set your desire on your neighbor's house or land, his male or female servant, his ox or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.
5:5:22/The LORD spoke these words to your entire assembly at the mountain from the midst of the fire, the cloud, and the deep darkness, with a loud voice, and added no more. He wrote them on two stone tablets and gave them to me.
5:5:23/When you heard the voice from the darkness, while the mountain was ablaze with fire, all the leaders of your tribes and your elders approached me,
5:5:24/And you said, "The LORD our God has shown us his glory and greatness, and we have heard his voice from the fire. Today we have seen that a person can live even if God speaks with them.
5:5:25/But now, why should we die? This great fire will consume us, and we will die if we hear the voice of the LORD our God any longer.
5:5:26/For who among all living beings has heard the voice of the living God speaking from fire, as we have, and survived?
5:5:27/Go near and listen to all that the LORD our God says. Then tell us everything the LORD our God tells you, and we will listen and obey."
5:5:28/The LORD heard your words when you spoke to me, and the LORD said to me, "I have heard the words of this people, which they have spoken to you. They have done well in all they have spoken.
5:5:29/If only they had such a heart in them to fear me and keep all my commandments always, so that it might go well with them and their children forever!
5:5:30/Go, tell them to return to their tents.
5:5:31/But you stay here with me, and I will tell you all the commandments, statutes, and judgments you are to teach them, so they can follow them in the land I am giving them to possess."
5:5:32/Be careful to follow what the LORD your God has commanded you; do not turn aside to the right or to the left.
5:5:33/Walk in all the ways the LORD your God has commanded you, so that you may live and prosper and prolong your days in the land you will possess.
5:6:1/Here are the commandments, laws, and rules that the LORD your God has directed me to teach you, so you can follow them in the land you're about to enter and possess.
5:6:2/So that you, your children, and their children after them may fear the LORD your God and keep all his decrees and commands that I give you, and so that you may enjoy long life.
5:6:3/Listen, Israel, and be careful to obey so that things go well with you and you increase greatly in a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the LORD, the God of your ancestors, promised you.
5:6:4/Listen, Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one.
5:6:5/You must love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with all your strength.
5:6:6/Keep these words I command you today deep within your heart.
5:6:7/Teach them diligently to your children. Talk about them when you're at home or walking along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
5:6:8/Tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.
5:6:9/Write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates.
5:6:10/When the LORD your God brings you into the land he swore to your ancestors, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give you—a land with large, flourishing cities you did not build,
5:6:11/houses filled with all kinds of good things you did not provide, wells you did not dig, and vineyards and olive groves you did not plant—then when you eat and are satisfied,
5:6:12/be careful that you do not forget the LORD, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
5:6:13/Fear the LORD your God, serve him only and take your oaths in his name.
5:6:14/Do not follow other gods, the gods of the peoples around you;
5:6:15/for the LORD your God, who is among you, is a jealous God and his anger may burn against you and destroy you from the face of the land.
5:6:16/Do not test the LORD your God as you did at Massah.
5:6:17/Be sure to keep the commands of the LORD your God and the stipulations and decrees he has given you.
5:6:18/Do what is right and good in the LORD's sight, so that it may go well with you and you may go in and take over the good land the LORD promised on oath to your ancestors,
5:6:19/thrusting out all your enemies before you, as the LORD said.
5:6:20/When your son asks you in the future, 'What is the meaning of the stipulations, decrees and laws the LORD our God has commanded you?'
5:6:21/tell him, 'We were slaves of Pharaoh in Egypt, but the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
5:6:22/Before our eyes, the LORD sent signs and wonders—great and terrible—on Egypt and Pharaoh and his whole household.
5:6:23/He brought us out from there to bring us in and give us the land he promised on oath to our ancestors.
5:6:24/The LORD commanded us to follow all these decrees, to fear the LORD our God, for our lasting good and to keep us alive, as is the case today.
5:6:25/It will be considered righteousness for us if we are careful to obey all these commands before the LORD our God, just as he has commanded us.
5:7:1/When the LORD your God brings you into the land you're going to take over, and has driven out many nations before you—the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, seven nations larger and stronger than you;
5:7:2/And when the LORD your God hands them over to you, you must defeat them completely. Make no treaty with them and show them no mercy.
5:7:3/Do not intermarry with them. Do not give your daughters to their sons or take their daughters for your sons.
5:7:4/Because they will lead your sons away from following me to serve other gods, and the LORD's anger will burn against you and will quickly destroy you.
5:7:5/This is how you are to deal with them: demolish their altars, smash their sacred stones, cut down their Asherah poles, and burn their idols in the fire.
5:7:6/For you are a people holy to the LORD your God. The LORD your God has chosen you out of all the peoples on the face of the earth to be his people, his treasured possession.
5:7:7/The LORD did not set his affection on you and choose you because you were more numerous than other peoples, for you were the fewest of all peoples.
5:7:8/But it was because the LORD loved you and kept the oath he swore to your ancestors that he brought you out with a mighty hand and redeemed you from the land of slavery, from the power of Pharaoh king of Egypt.
5:7:9/Know therefore that the LORD your God is God; he is the faithful God, keeping his covenant of love to a thousand generations of those who love him and keep his commandments.
5:7:10/And he repays those who hate him to their face, by destroying them. He will not be slow to repay to their face those who hate him.
5:7:11/Therefore, keep the commands, decrees, and laws I am giving you today, and follow them.
5:7:12/If you pay attention to these laws and carefully follow them, then the LORD your God will keep his covenant of love with you, as he swore to your ancestors.
5:7:13/He will love you and bless you and increase your numbers. He will bless the fruit of your womb, the crops of your land—your grain, new wine and olive oil—the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks in the land he swore to your ancestors to give you.
5:7:14/You will be blessed more than any other people; none of your men or women will be childless, nor will any of your livestock be without young.
5:7:15/The LORD will keep you free from every disease. He will not inflict on you the horrible diseases you knew in Egypt, but he will inflict them on all who hate you.
5:7:16/You must destroy all the peoples the LORD your God gives over to you. Do not look on them with pity and do not serve their gods, for that will be a trap to you.
5:7:17/If you say to yourself, 'These nations are stronger than I am; how can I drive them out?'
5:7:18/Do not be afraid of them; remember well what the LORD your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt.
5:7:19/Remember the great trials you saw, the signs and wonders, the mighty hand and outstretched arm, with which the LORD your God brought you out. The LORD your God will do the same to all the peoples you now fear.
5:7:20/Moreover, the LORD your God will send the hornet among them until even the survivors who hide from you have perished.
5:7:21/Do not be terrified by them, for the LORD your God, who is among you, is a great and awesome God.
5:7:22/The LORD your God will drive out those nations before you, little by little. You will not be allowed to eliminate them all at once, or the wild animals will multiply around you.
5:7:23/But the LORD your God will deliver them over to you, throwing them into great confusion until they are destroyed.
5:7:24/He will give their kings into your hand, and you will wipe their names from under heaven. No one will be able to stand against you until you have destroyed them.
5:7:25/You must burn the carved images of their gods with fire. Do not covet the silver or gold on them, and do not take it for yourselves, or you will be ensnared by it, for it is detestable to the LORD your God.
5:7:26/Do not bring a detestable thing into your house or you, like it, will be set apart for destruction. Regard it as vile and utterly detest it, for it is set apart for destruction.
5:8:1/All the commands I give you today must be followed so that you may live, increase in number, and enter and take over the land the LORD promised to your ancestors.
5:8:2/Remember the journey the LORD your God has led you on for forty years in the desert, to humble you and test you, to reveal what was in your heart, whether or not you would follow his commands.
5:8:3/He humbled you, allowing you to go hungry, then fed you with manna, which was unknown to you and your ancestors, to teach you that humans do not live on bread alone but on every word that comes from the mouth of the LORD.
5:8:4/Your clothes did not wear out and your feet did not swell during these forty years.
5:8:5/Keep in mind that just as a parent disciplines their child, so the LORD your God disciplines you.
5:8:6/So you must keep the commands of the LORD your God, walking in his ways and revering him.
5:8:7/For the LORD your God is bringing you into a prosperous land, a land with streams, springs, and aquifers flowing in the valleys and hills;
5:8:8/A land with wheat and barley, vines, fig trees, and pomegranates; a land with olive oil and honey;
5:8:9/A land where you will eat bread without scarcity, where you will lack nothing; a land whose rocks are iron and from whose hills you can mine copper.
5:8:10/When you have eaten and are satisfied, praise the LORD your God for the good land he has given you.
5:8:11/Be careful that you do not forget the LORD your God, failing to observe his commands, his laws, and his decrees that I am giving you today.
5:8:12/Otherwise, when you eat and are satisfied, when you build fine houses and settle down,
5:8:13/And when your herds and flocks grow large and your silver and gold increase and all you have is multiplied,
5:8:14/Then your heart will become proud and you will forget the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
5:8:15/He led you through the vast and dreadful wilderness, that thirsty and waterless land, with its venomous snakes and scorpions. He brought you water out of hard rock.
5:8:16/He gave you manna to eat in the wilderness, something your ancestors had never known, to humble and test you so that in the end it might go well with you.
5:8:17/You may say to yourself, "My power and the strength of my hands have produced this wealth for me."
5:8:18/But remember the LORD your God, for it is he who gives you the ability to produce wealth, and so confirms his covenant, which he swore to your ancestors, as it is today.
5:8:19/If you ever forget the LORD your God and follow other gods and worship and bow down to them, I testify against you today that you will surely be destroyed.
5:8:20/Like the nations the LORD destroyed before you, so you will be destroyed for not obeying the LORD your God.
5:9:1/Listen, O Israel: Today you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and take possession of nations larger and stronger than you, with large, fortified cities that reach to the sky,
5:9:2/A people tall and mighty, the descendants of the Anakim, whom you know and have heard about, saying, 'Who can stand against the descendants of Anak?'
5:9:3/So know today that the LORD your God is the one going ahead of you like a devouring fire. He will destroy them and subdue them before you. You will drive them out and annihilate them swiftly, as the LORD has promised you.
5:9:4/Do not think in your heart, after the LORD your God has driven them out before you, 'It is because of my righteousness that the LORD has brought me in to possess this land.' Instead, it is because of the wickedness of these nations that the LORD is driving them out before you.
5:9:5/It is not because of your righteousness or your integrity that you are going in to take possession of their land; but on account of the wickedness of these nations, the LORD your God will drive them out before you, to fulfill the promise the LORD swore to your ancestors, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
5:9:6/Understand, then, that it is not because of your righteousness that the LORD your God is giving you this good land to possess, for you are a stubborn people.
5:9:7/Remember and do not forget how you provoked the LORD your God to anger in the wilderness. From the moment you left Egypt until you arrived here, you have been rebellious against the LORD.
5:9:8/Even at Horeb you provoked the LORD to anger, and the LORD was so angry with you that he was ready to destroy you.
5:9:9/When I went up the mountain to receive the stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant that the LORD made with you, I stayed on the mountain for forty days and forty nights; I ate no bread and drank no water.
5:9:10/And the LORD gave me the two stone tablets written by the finger of God. On them were all the words the LORD spoke to you on the mountain from the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly.
5:9:11/At the end of forty days and forty nights, the LORD gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.
5:9:12/Then the LORD told me, 'Get up and go down quickly from here, for your people whom you brought out of Egypt have acted corruptly. They have quickly turned away from the way I commanded them; they have made themselves an idol cast in the shape of a calf.'
5:9:13/Furthermore, the LORD said to me, 'I have seen this people, and indeed, it is a stubborn people.
5:9:14/Leave me alone so that I may destroy them and erase their name from under heaven. And I will make you into a nation stronger and more numerous than they.'
5:9:15/So I turned and went down from the mountain while it was ablaze with fire, and the two tablets of the covenant were in my hands.
5:9:16/When I looked, I saw that you had sinned against the LORD your God; you had made yourselves an idol cast in the shape of a calf. You had quickly turned aside from the way the LORD had commanded you.
5:9:17/So I took the two tablets and threw them out of my hands, breaking them before your eyes.
5:9:18/Then I fell prostrate before the LORD for forty days and forty nights; I ate no bread and drank no water, because of all the sin you had committed, doing what was evil in the LORD's sight and provoking him to anger.
5:9:19/I was afraid of the anger and fierce wrath the LORD was angry enough with you to destroy you. But the LORD listened to me that time also.
5:9:20/The LORD was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him, but at that time I prayed for Aaron too.
5:9:21/Then I took the sinful thing you had made, the calf, and burned it in the fire. I crushed it, grinding it thoroughly until it was reduced to dust, and I threw its dust into the stream that flowed down from the mountain.
5:9:22/At Taberah, Massah, and Kibroth Hattaavah, you provoked the LORD to wrath.
5:9:23/And when the LORD sent you from Kadesh Barnea, saying, 'Go up and take possession of the land I have given you,' you rebelled against the command of the LORD your God. You did not believe him or listen to his voice.
5:9:24/You have been rebellious against the LORD ever since I have known you.
5:9:25/So I lay prostrate before the LORD for forty days and forty nights because the LORD had said he would destroy you.
5:9:26/I prayed to the LORD and said, 'O Sovereign LORD, do not destroy your people, your own inheritance, whom you redeemed by your great power and brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
5:9:27/Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Do not look upon the stubbornness of this people, their wickedness, or their sin,
5:9:28/Otherwise, the country from which you brought us might say, "Because the LORD was not able to bring them into the land he promised them, and because he hated them, he has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness."
5:9:29/Yet they are your people, your inheritance, whom you brought out by your great power and your outstretched arm.
5:10:1/At that time, the LORD told me, "Carve two stone tablets like the first ones, and come up to me on the mountain. Also, make a wooden ark."
5:10:2/"I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets which you broke, and you shall place them in the ark."
5:10:3/So I made an ark out of acacia wood, carved two stone tablets like the first ones, and went up the mountain with the two tablets in my hands.
5:10:4/And he wrote on the tablets, just like the first time, the ten commandments, which the LORD had spoken to you on the mountain from the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly; and the LORD gave them to me.
5:10:5/Then I turned around, came down from the mountain, and placed the tablets in the ark I had made; and there they remain, as the LORD instructed me.
5:10:6/The Israelites traveled from Beeroth of the Jaakanites to Moserah. There Aaron died and was buried, and his son Eleazar took over as priest.
5:10:7/From there they journeyed to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbath, a land with abundant water streams.
5:10:8/At that time, the LORD set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to stand before the LORD to serve him, and to bless in his name, which continues to this day.
5:10:9/Therefore, Levi has no share or inheritance with his brothers; the LORD is his inheritance, just as the LORD your God promised him.
5:10:10/And I stayed on the mountain, just like the first time, for forty days and forty nights; and the LORD listened to me at that time also, and decided not to destroy you.
5:10:11/Then the LORD told me, 'Get up and lead the people on their way, so that they may enter and possess the land I swore to their ancestors to give them.'
5:10:12/And now, Israel, what does the LORD your God ask of you but to respect the LORD your God, to walk in all his ways, to love him, and to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
5:10:13/To follow the commandments of the LORD and his decrees, which I am giving you today for your own good?
5:10:14/Look, the heavens and the highest heavens belong to the LORD your God, as well as the earth and everything in it.
5:10:15/But the LORD chose your ancestors to love them, and he chose their descendants after them—you above all peoples, as it is today.
5:10:16/So then, soften the hardness of your hearts and stop being stubborn.
5:10:17/For the LORD your God is the God of gods and the Lord of lords, a great, mighty, and awe-inspiring God, who shows no partiality and accepts no bribes.
5:10:18/He ensures justice for the orphan and widow, and loves the foreigner, giving them food and clothing.
5:10:19/Therefore, love the foreigner, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
5:10:20/You must respect the LORD your God, serve him, cling to him, and swear by his name.
5:10:21/He is your praise, and he is your God, who performed for you these great and awe-inspiring deeds that you have seen with your own eyes.
5:10:22/Your ancestors went down to Egypt as seventy people, and now the LORD your God has made you as numerous as the stars in the sky.
5:11:1/So you must love the LORD your God, and always follow his instructions, laws, decisions, and commands.
5:11:2/Understand today: I'm not speaking to your children who haven't experienced, nor have seen, the discipline of the LORD your God, his greatness, his powerful hand, and his outstretched arm,
5:11:3/His miracles, and the deeds he performed in Egypt, against Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and his entire land;
5:11:4/And what he did to the Egyptian army, their horses, and chariots; how he made the waters of the Red Sea engulf them as they chased you, and how the LORD has annihilated them to this day;
5:11:5/And what he did for you in the wilderness, until you arrived at this place;
5:11:6/And what happened to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben: how the earth opened up and swallowed them, their families, their tents, and all their possessions in the presence of all Israel;
5:11:7/But your own eyes have witnessed all the mighty deeds of the LORD that he performed.
5:11:8/Therefore, you must keep all the commands I give you today, so that you may be strong, and enter and take possession of the land you are going to occupy;
5:11:9/And so that you may live long in the land, which the LORD swore to give to your ancestors and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.
