5:11:10/For the land you are entering to take over is not like the land of Egypt from which you came, where you planted your seed and irrigated it by foot like a vegetable garden;
5:11:11/But the land you are crossing over to possess is a land of mountains and valleys that drinks rain from heaven;
5:11:12/A land that the LORD your God cares for; the eyes of the LORD your God are on it from the beginning of the year to its end.
5:11:13/If you carefully listen to my commands that I'm giving you today, to love the LORD your God, and serve him with all your heart and soul,
5:11:14/Then I will send rain for your land at the right time, both autumn and spring rains, so that you can harvest your grain, new wine, and olive oil.
5:11:15/And I will provide grass in the fields for your livestock, and you will eat and be satisfied.
5:11:16/Be careful that your heart is not deceived, and you turn away and serve other gods and worship them;
5:11:17/Otherwise, the LORD's anger will flare up against you, and he will shut the heavens so that it will not rain and the ground will yield no produce, and you will soon perish from the good land the LORD is giving you.
5:11:18/Therefore, keep these words of mine in your heart and soul, and tie them as symbols on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.
5:11:19/Teach them to your children, talking about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
5:11:20/And write them on the doorframes of your houses and on your gates;
5:11:21/So that your days and the days of your children may be many in the land the LORD swore to give your ancestors, as many as the days that the heavens are above the earth.
5:11:22/If you carefully observe all these commands I am giving you to follow—to love the LORD your God, to walk in obedience to him and to hold fast to him—
5:11:23/Then the LORD will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations larger and stronger than you.
5:11:24/Every place where you set foot will be yours: Your territory will extend from the desert to Lebanon, and from the river, the Euphrates River, to the western sea.
5:11:25/No one will be able to stand against you. The LORD your God, as he promised you, will put the fear and dread of you on all the land where you set foot.
5:11:26/See, I am setting before you today a blessing and a curse:
5:11:27/A blessing, if you obey the commands of the LORD your God that I am giving you today;
5:11:28/And a curse, if you do not obey the commands of the LORD your God and turn from the way that I command you today by following other gods, which you have not known.
5:11:29/When the LORD your God brings you into the land you are entering to possess, you are to proclaim the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
5:11:30/Aren't they across the Jordan, westward, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah, near Gilgal beside the oak of Moreh?
5:11:31/For you are to cross the Jordan to enter and possess the land the LORD your God is giving you, and you will take possession of it and live there.
5:11:32/And be sure to follow all the statutes and judgments I am setting before you today.
5:12:1/These are the rules and laws you must follow in the land that the LORD, the God of your ancestors, is giving you to own, for as long as you live on the earth.
5:12:2/You must completely destroy all the places where the nations you're going to displace worshiped their gods—on the high mountains, on the hills, and under every green tree.
5:12:3/You must tear down their altars, smash their sacred stones, burn their Asherah poles in the fire; you must cut down the carved images of their gods and wipe out their names from those places.
5:12:4/You must not treat the LORD your God in the same way.
5:12:5/But you must seek the place the LORD your God will choose from among all your tribes to put his Name there for his dwelling. To that place you must go;
5:12:6/And there you must bring your burnt offerings, your sacrifices, your tithes, the special gifts you have promised to give, your voluntary offerings, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks.
5:12:7/There in the presence of the LORD your God, you and your families shall eat and shall rejoice in everything you have put your hand to, because the LORD your God has blessed you.
5:12:8/You must not do as we are doing here today, where everyone does what seems right in their own eyes.
5:12:9/Because you haven't yet reached the resting place and the inheritance the LORD your God is giving you.
5:12:10/But when you cross the Jordan and settle in the land the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and he gives you rest from all your enemies around you so you live in safety,
5:12:11/then to the place the LORD your God will choose as a dwelling for his Name—there you must bring everything I command you: your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and special gifts, and all the choice possessions you have vowed to the LORD.
5:12:12/And there you shall rejoice before the LORD your God, you, your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, and the Levites from your towns, who have no allotment or inheritance of their own.
5:12:13/Be careful not to sacrifice your burnt offerings anywhere you please.
5:12:14/Only at the place the LORD will choose in one of your tribes, there you shall offer your burnt offerings and do everything I command you.
5:12:15/However, you may slaughter and eat meat within any of your gates, whatever you desire, according to the blessing of the LORD your God which he has given you. Both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it, as if it were gazelle or deer.
5:12:16/But you must not eat the blood; you must pour it out on the ground like water.
5:12:17/Within your gates you may not eat the tithe of your grain or of your wine or of your oil, the firstborn of your herds or flocks, any of your vows you make, your freewill offerings, or special gifts.
5:12:18/Instead, you must eat them in the presence of the LORD your God at the place the LORD your God will choose—you, your son and daughter, your male and female servants, and the Levites from your towns—and you are to rejoice before the LORD your God in everything you put your hand to.
5:12:19/Be careful not to neglect the Levites as long as you live in your land.
5:12:20/When the LORD your God expands your territory as he has promised you, and you crave meat and say, 'I would like some meat,' then you may eat as much meat as your heart desires.
5:12:21/If the place where the LORD your God chooses to put his Name is too far from you, then you may slaughter animals from the herds and flocks the LORD has given you, as I have commanded you, and in your own towns you may eat as much as you want.
5:12:22/Just as the gazelle and the deer are eaten, so you may eat them; both the unclean and the clean may eat.
5:12:23/But be sure you do not eat the blood, because the blood is the life, and you must not eat the life with the meat.
5:12:24/Do not eat it; you must pour it out on the ground like water.
5:12:25/Do not eat it, so that it may go well with you and your children after you, when you do what is right in the eyes of the LORD.
5:12:26/But take your consecrated things and whatever you have vowed to give, and go to the place the LORD will choose.
5:12:27/Perform your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, on the altar of the LORD your God. The blood of your sacrifices must be poured beside the altar of the LORD your God, but you may eat the meat.
5:12:28/Be sure to listen to all these words I command you, so that it may go well with you and your children after you forever, when you do what is good and right in the eyes of the LORD your God.
5:12:29/When the LORD your God cuts off before you the nations you are going in to dispossess, and you displace them and dwell in their land,
5:12:30/be careful that you are not ensnared to follow them, after they have been destroyed before you. Do not inquire about their gods, saying, 'How did these nations serve their gods? I also want to do the same.'
5:12:31/You must not worship the LORD your God in their way, because in worshiping their gods, they do all kinds of detestable things the LORD hates. They even burn their sons and daughters in the fire as sacrifices to their gods.
5:12:32/See that you do all I command you; do not add to it or take away from it.
5:13:1/If a prophet or someone who dreams of the future appears among you and gives you a sign or a miracle,
5:13:2/And if the sign or miracle they told you about happens, and they say, "Let's follow other gods" (gods you don't know) "and let's worship them,"
5:13:3/You must not listen to that prophet's or dreamer's words. For the LORD your God is testing you to find out whether you love Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
5:13:4/You must follow the LORD your God, respect Him, keep His commands, listen to His voice, serve Him, and hold fast to Him.
5:13:5/That prophet or dreamer must be put to death for trying to turn you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt and redeemed you from slavery, to make you leave the path the LORD your God commanded you to follow. In this way, you will purge the evil from among you.
5:13:6/If your very close relative, your child, your spouse, or your dear friend secretly entices you, saying, "Let's go and worship other gods" (gods neither you nor your ancestors have known,
5:13:7/gods of the peoples around you, whether near you or far away from one end of the land to the other),
5:13:8/do not yield to them or listen to them. Show them no pity. Do not spare them or protect them.
5:13:9/Instead, you must surely kill them. Your hand must be the first in putting them to death, and then the hands of all the people.
5:13:10/Stone them to death, because they tried to turn you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of the land of slavery.
5:13:11/Then all Israel will hear and be afraid, and no one among you will do such an evil thing again.
5:13:12/If you hear it said about one of the towns the LORD your God is giving you to live in
5:13:13/that wicked men have arisen among you and have led the people of their town astray, saying, "Let's go and worship other gods" (gods you have not known),
5:13:14/then you must investigate, probe, and thoroughly inquire. If it is true and the matter is established that this detestable thing has been done among you,
5:13:15/you must certainly strike down the inhabitants of that town with the sword. Destroy it completely, along with everything in it, and its livestock with the sword.
5:13:16/Then gather all its plunder into the middle of the public square and completely burn the town and all its plunder as a whole burnt offering to the LORD your God. That town is to remain a ruin forever, never to be rebuilt.
5:13:17/Make sure that nothing devoted to destruction sticks to your hands, so that the LORD may turn from His fierce anger and show you mercy, have compassion on you, and increase your numbers, as He promised on oath to your ancestors,
5:13:18/when you obey the LORD your God by keeping all His commands that I am giving you today and doing what is right in His eyes.
5:14:1/You are the children of the LORD your God: do not cut yourselves or shave the front of your head for the dead.
5:14:2/For you are a holy people to the LORD your God, and the LORD has chosen you to be his special people, distinct from all the nations on the earth.
5:14:3/Do not eat anything detestable.
5:14:4/These are the animals you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,
5:14:5/The deer, the gazelle, the fallow deer, the wild goat, the antelope, the wild ox, and the mountain sheep.
5:14:6/And any animal that has a split hoof divided in two and chews the cud among the animals, you may eat.
5:14:7/However, you must not eat those that only chew the cud or only have a split hoof; such as the camel, the hare, and the rock badger: they chew the cud but do not have a split hoof; they are unclean for you.
5:14:8/And the pig, because it has a split hoof but does not chew the cud, is unclean for you: you must not eat their meat or touch their carcasses.
5:14:9/You may eat all that live in the water: anything with fins and scales you may eat.
5:14:10/But anything in the waters that does not have fins and scales is unclean for you.
5:14:11/You may eat any clean bird.
5:14:12/But these are the ones you cannot eat: the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture,
5:14:13/And the red kite, the falcon, and the kite of any kind,
5:14:14/Every kind of raven,
5:14:15/The owl, the nighthawk, the sea gull, and the hawk of any kind,
5:14:16/The little owl, the great owl, and the white owl,
5:14:17/And the pelican, the carrion vulture, and the cormorant,
5:14:18/And the stork, the heron of any kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.
5:14:19/Every flying insect is unclean for you; they must not be eaten.
5:14:20/But you may eat any clean bird.
5:14:21/Do not eat anything that dies of itself. You may give it to the foreigner residing in your towns so they can eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a holy people to the LORD your God. Do not cook a young goat in its mother's milk.
5:14:22/You must surely tithe all the produce from what you sow, which comes from the field every year.
5:14:23/And you shall eat in the presence of the LORD your God, at the place he will choose as a dwelling for his Name, the tithe of your grain, new wine and oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks, so that you may learn to revere the LORD your God always.
5:14:24/If the place is too far for you, so that you are unable to transport it because the place where the LORD your God chooses to put his name is too far from you, when the LORD your God has blessed you,
5:14:25/Then you shall convert it into money, and bind up the money in your hand, and go to the place that the LORD your God chooses.
5:14:26/And you may spend the money on whatever your heart desires: for oxen, or for sheep, or for wine, or for fermented drink, or for whatever your heart desires; and you shall eat there before the LORD your God, and you shall rejoice, you and your household,
5:14:27/And do not neglect the Levite living in your towns, for he has no portion or inheritance with you.
5:14:28/At the end of every three years, bring all the tithes of that year's produce and store it in your towns,
5:14:29/So that the Levites (who have no portion or inheritance with you), the foreigners, the fatherless, and the widows who live in your towns may come and eat and be satisfied, and so that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
5:15:1/Every seven years, you must cancel debts.
5:15:2/This is how the cancellation is to be done: Every creditor shall cancel the loan they have given to their neighbor. They must not demand payment from their neighbor or brother, because the Lord's time for canceling debts has been proclaimed.
5:15:3/You may require payment from a foreigner, but you must cancel any debt your fellow Israelite owes you.
5:15:4/However, there should be no poor among you, for the Lord will richly bless you in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess as your inheritance,
5:15:5/If only you fully obey the Lord your God and are careful to follow all these commands I am giving you today.
5:15:6/For the Lord your God will bless you as he has promised, and you will lend to many nations but will borrow from none. You will rule over many nations but none will rule over you.
5:15:7/If anyone is poor among your fellow Israelites in any of the towns of the land the Lord your God is giving you, do not be hard-hearted or tight-fisted toward them.
5:15:8/Rather, be openhanded and freely lend them whatever they need.
5:15:9/Be careful not to harbor this wicked thought: 'The seventh year, the year for canceling debts, is near,' so you are mean to the needy among you and give them nothing. They may then appeal to the Lord against you, and you will be found guilty of sin.
5:15:10/You must give to them freely without a grudging heart, and because of this the Lord your God will bless you in all your work and in everything you put your hand to.
5:15:11/There will always be poor people in the land. Therefore I command you to be openhanded toward your fellow Israelites who are poor and needy in your land.
5:15:12/If any of your fellow Israelites sell themselves to you and serve you six years, in the seventh year you must let them go free.
5:15:13/And when you release them, do not send them away empty-handed.
5:15:14/Supply them liberally from your flock, your threshing floor and your winepress. Give to them as the Lord your God has blessed you.
5:15:15/Remember that you were slaves in Egypt and the Lord your God redeemed you. That is why I give you this command today.
5:15:16/But if your servant says to you, 'I do not want to leave you,' because they love you and your family and are well off with you,
5:15:17/then take an awl and push it through their earlobe into the door, and they will become your servant for life. Do the same for your female servant.
5:15:18/Do not consider it a hardship to set your servant free, because their service to you for six years has been worth twice as much as that of a hired worker. And the Lord your God will bless you in everything you do.
5:15:19/Dedicate all the firstborn males of your herds and flocks to the Lord your God. Do not put the firstborn of your cows to work, and do not shear the firstborn of your sheep.
5:15:20/Each year you and your family are to eat them in the presence of the Lord your God at the place he will choose.
5:15:21/If an animal has a defect, is lame or blind, or has any serious flaw, you must not sacrifice it to the Lord your God.
5:15:22/You are to eat it within your own gates; both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it, as if it were gazelle or deer.
5:15:23/But you must not eat the blood; pour it out on the ground like water.
5:16:1/Mark the month of Abib, and celebrate Passover to honor the LORD your God, for it was in the month of Abib that the LORD your God brought you out of Egypt during the night.
5:16:2/So, you must sacrifice the Passover to the LORD your God, from your flocks and herds, at the place the LORD chooses to establish His name.
5:16:3/Do not eat any bread made with yeast during this time; for seven days, you must eat unleavened bread with it, the bread of hardship, because you left Egypt in a hurry. This is so you'll remember the day you left Egypt for as long as you live.
5:16:4/No yeast shall be seen with you in your entire territory for seven days, and none of the meat you sacrifice on the first evening should be left over until morning.
5:16:5/You are not allowed to sacrifice the Passover in any of your towns that the LORD your God is giving you.
5:16:6/But at the place the LORD your God will choose to establish His name, there you shall sacrifice the Passover in the evening, when the sun goes down, on the anniversary of your departure from Egypt.
5:16:7/You shall cook and eat it at the place the LORD your God will choose. Then in the morning, you can go back to your tents.
5:16:8/For six days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a solemn assembly to the LORD your God. You shall do no work on that day.
5:16:9/Count off seven weeks from the time you begin to harvest the grain.
5:16:10/Then celebrate the Festival of Weeks to the LORD your God by giving a freewill offering in proportion to the blessings the LORD your God has given you.
5:16:11/And you shall rejoice before the LORD your God, you, your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, the Levites in your towns, and the strangers, orphans, and widows among you, at the place the LORD your God will choose as a dwelling for His Name.
5:16:12/Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and follow these decrees carefully.
5:16:13/Celebrate the Festival of Tabernacles for seven days after you have gathered the produce from your threshing floor and your winepress.
5:16:14/Rejoice during your festival, you and your sons and daughters, your male and female servants, and the Levites, the foreigners, the orphans, and the widows who live in your towns.
5:16:15/For seven days celebrate the festival to the LORD your God at the place the LORD will choose, for the LORD your God will bless you in all your harvest and in all the work of your hands, and your joy will be complete.
5:16:16/Three times a year all your men must appear before the LORD your God at the place he will choose: at the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the Festival of Weeks, and the Festival of Tabernacles. No one should appear before the LORD empty-handed.
5:16:17/Each of you must bring a gift in proportion to the way the LORD your God has blessed you.
5:16:18/Appoint judges and officials for each of your tribes in every town the LORD your God is giving you, and they shall render just decisions for the people.
5:16:19/Do not distort justice or show partiality. Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the innocent.
5:16:20/Pursue only what is just, so that you may live and take possession of the land the LORD your God is giving you.
5:16:21/Do not plant any kind of tree as a sacred pole beside the altar you build to the LORD your God.
5:16:22/And do not set up any stone image to worship; the LORD your God detests them.
5:17:1/You must not offer to the LORD your God any bull or sheep that has a defect or any kind of flaw, because that would be detestable to the LORD your God.
5:17:2/If anyone, man or woman, within any of your gates that the LORD your God has given you, is found to have done evil in the eyes of the LORD your God by breaking his covenant,
5:17:3/And has gone off to serve other gods and worship them, whether the sun, moon, or any of the heavenly bodies, which I have not authorized;
5:17:4/And you hear about it, investigate thoroughly, and find it to be true and proven that such detestable acts have been committed in Israel,
5:17:5/Then you must take the man or woman who has done this evil deed to your city gates and stone them to death.
5:17:6/A person shall be put to death on the testimony of two or three witnesses; they shall not be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
5:17:7/The witnesses must be the first to put their hands on the person to execute them, followed by the hands of all the people. In this way, you will purge the evil from among you.
5:17:8/If a case is too difficult for you to judge, whether it involves homicide, conflicting claims, or assault, take it to the place the LORD your God will choose.
5:17:9/Go to the Levitical priests and the judge in office at that time; consult them, and they will give you a verdict.
5:17:10/You must act according to the verdict they give you at the place the LORD will choose. Be careful to do exactly as they instruct you.
5:17:11/Follow the verdict they give you and the decision they announce to you, without turning aside to the right or to the left from what they declare to you.
5:17:12/Anyone who acts arrogantly, refusing to listen either to the priest who stands there serving the LORD your God or to the judge, must die. In this way, you will purge the evil from Israel.
5:17:13/Then all the people will hear and be afraid, and will not act arrogantly anymore.
5:17:14/When you enter the land the LORD your God is giving you and have taken possession of it and settled in it, and you say, 'Let's set a king over us like all the nations around us,'
5:17:15/you must certainly set a king over you whom the LORD your God chooses. One of your fellow Israelites you must set as king over yourselves; you cannot set a foreigner over you, who is not your brother.
5:17:16/However, he must not acquire many horses for himself or make the people return to Egypt to get more horses, for the LORD has told you, 'You are never to go back that way again.'
5:17:17/He must not take many wives, or his heart will be led astray. He must not accumulate large amounts of silver and gold.
5:17:18/When he takes the throne of his kingdom, he is to write for himself on a scroll a copy of this law, taken from that of the Levitical priests.
5:17:19/It is to be with him, and he is to read it all the days of his life so that he may learn to revere the LORD his God and follow carefully all the words of this law and these decrees,
5:17:20/so that his heart may not be lifted up above his countrymen and that he may not turn aside from the commandment, to the right or to the left. This will ensure that he and his descendants will reign a long time over his kingdom in Israel.
5:18:1/The Levite priests and the entire tribe of Levi won't have a share or inheritance with Israel: they will live on the offerings made by fire to the LORD, which are his inheritance.
5:18:2/So, they won't have an inheritance among their fellow Israelites: the LORD is their inheritance, just as he promised them.
5:18:3/This is what the priests are entitled to receive from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether it's an ox or sheep; they must give the priest the shoulder, both cheeks, and the stomach.
5:18:4/You must also give him the first fruits of your grain, your wine, and your oil, as well as the first wool from your sheep.
5:18:5/For the LORD your God has chosen him from all your tribes to serve in the LORD's name, him and his sons forever.
5:18:6/And if a Levite leaves any of your towns throughout Israel where he is living and comes with all the desire of his heart to the place the LORD will choose,
5:18:7/Then he may serve in the name of the LORD his God, just like his fellow Levites who stand there before the LORD.
5:18:8/They shall have equal shares to eat, in addition to what they receive from the sale of their family possessions.
5:18:9/When you enter the land the LORD your God is giving you, do not adopt the detestable practices of those nations.
5:18:10/No one among you should sacrifice their son or daughter in the fire, practice divination, tell fortunes, practice sorcery, or cast spells.
5:18:11/Or cast spells, consult with spirits, be a medium, or consult the dead.
5:18:12/Anyone doing these things is detestable to the LORD, and because of these detestable practices the LORD your God will drive them out before you.
5:18:13/You must be blameless before the LORD your God.
5:18:14/The nations you will dispossess listen to those who practice sorcery and divination, but the LORD your God has not allowed you to do so.
5:18:15/The LORD your God will raise up for you a Prophet like me from among you, from your fellow Israelites; you must listen to him.
5:18:16/Just as you desired of the LORD your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly when you said, 'Let us not hear the voice of the LORD our God nor see this great fire anymore, or we will die.'
5:18:17/And the LORD said to me, 'What they say is good.'
5:18:18/I will raise up for them a Prophet like you from among their brothers; I will put my words in his mouth, and he will tell them everything I command him.
5:18:19/If anyone does not listen to my words that the prophet speaks in my name, I myself will call him to account.
5:18:20/But any prophet who falsely claims to speak in my name or speaks in the name of other gods must be put to death.
5:18:21/If you wonder in your heart how we can recognize a message the LORD has not spoken,
5:18:22/If what a prophet proclaims in the name of the LORD does not take place or come true, that is a message the LORD has not spoken. That prophet has spoken presumptuously, so do not be afraid of him.
5:19:1/When the LORD your God has eliminated the nations whose land the LORD your God is giving you, and you take their place and live in their cities and houses;
5:19:2/You must set aside three cities in the middle of your land, which the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
5:19:3/You must prepare roads and divide the territory of your land, which the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, into three parts, so that anyone who accidentally kills someone can flee there.
5:19:4/This applies to someone who accidentally kills their neighbor without having previously hated them;
5:19:5/For example, if someone goes into the forest with their neighbor to cut wood, and as they swing the axe to chop down a tree, the head flies off and hits their neighbor, causing death, that person can flee to one of these cities and live;
5:19:6/This is to prevent the avenger of blood from pursuing the killer in anger, catching up with them because the distance is too great, and killing them, even though they did not deserve to die because there was no prior hatred.
5:19:7/That's why I'm instructing you to set aside three cities.
5:19:8/And if the LORD your God expands your territory, as he swore to your ancestors, and gives you all the land he promised to give to your ancestors;
5:19:9/If you keep all these commands I'm giving you today, to love the LORD your God and to always walk in his ways, then you must add three more cities to these three;
5:19:10/So that innocent blood is not shed in your land, which the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and so you are not guilty of bloodshed.
5:19:11/But if someone hates their neighbor, lies in wait for them, attacks, and fatally wounds them, and then flees to one of these cities;
5:19:12/The elders of their city must send for them, bring them back, and hand them over to the avenger of blood to be put to death.
5:19:13/You must show no pity; you must remove the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, so that it may go well with you.
5:19:14/You must not move your neighbor's boundary marker, set by previous generations, in the inheritance you will receive in the land the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
5:19:15/A single witness shall not stand against someone for any wrongdoing or sin they have committed; a matter must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.
5:19:16/If a malicious witness takes the stand to accuse someone of a crime,
5:19:17/Both parties involved in the dispute must stand in the presence of the LORD, before the priests and the judges who are in office at the time;
5:19:18/The judges must thoroughly investigate, and if the witness is found to be a liar, having falsely accused their brother;
5:19:19/Then you must do to the false witness as they intended to do to their brother. In this way, you will purge the evil from among you.
5:19:20/And the rest will hear and be afraid, and never again will such an evil thing be done among you.
5:19:21/Show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
5:20:1/When you go out to battle against your enemies and see horses, chariots, and a larger army, don't be afraid of them: for the LORD your God is with you, who brought you out of Egypt.
5:20:2/And when you're about to enter the battle, the priest shall come forward and speak to the people,
5:20:3/And say to them, Listen, Israel, you are about to fight your enemies today: don't lose courage, don't be afraid, and don't panic because of them;
5:20:4/For the LORD your God is the one who goes with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.
5:20:5/And the officers shall say to the people, Is there anyone who has built a new house and hasn't dedicated it yet? He should go back home, so he doesn't die in battle and someone else dedicates it.
5:20:6/And is there anyone who has planted a vineyard and hasn't enjoyed its fruit yet? He should also go back home, so he doesn't die in battle and someone else enjoys it.
5:20:7/And is there anyone who has betrothed a wife and hasn't married her? He should go back home, so he doesn't die in battle and someone else marries her.
5:20:8/And the officers shall continue speaking to the people, saying, Is there anyone who is scared and weak-hearted? He should go back home, so he doesn't make his fellow soldiers lose courage as well.
5:20:9/And when the officers have finished speaking to the people, they shall appoint leaders to command the army.
5:20:10/When you approach a city to fight against it, first offer it peace.
5:20:11/And if it accepts your offer of peace and opens its gates to you, then all the people found there shall become your subjects and serve you.
5:20:12/But if it refuses to make peace with you and decides to fight, then you shall lay siege to it:
5:20:13/And when the LORD your God has given it into your hands, you shall kill every male with the sword:
5:20:14/But the women, children, livestock, and everything else in the city, all its spoils, you shall take for yourself; and you shall enjoy the spoils of your enemies, which the LORD your God has given you.
5:20:15/This is how you shall treat all the cities that are far away from you, which are not part of the nations nearby.
5:20:16/But in the cities of these nations that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, you shall leave nothing alive that breathes:
5:20:17/But you shall completely destroy them; the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, as the LORD your God has commanded you:
5:20:18/So that they may not teach you to follow all their detestable practices that they do for their gods, causing you to sin against the LORD your God.
5:20:19/When you besiege a city for a long time, fighting to capture it, do not destroy its trees by swinging an axe against them. You can eat from them, so do not cut them down. The trees of the field are not your enemy to be used in the siege:
5:20:20/Only the trees you know are not fruit-bearing you may destroy and cut down to build siege works against the city that is fighting you, until it falls.
5:21:1/If someone is found murdered in the land the LORD your God is giving you to possess, lying in the field, and it's unknown who killed them:
5:21:2/Then your elders and judges must go out and measure the distance to the towns near the body.
5:21:3/The town closest to the dead body will have its elders take a young cow that has never been worked or worn a yoke.
5:21:4/These elders must take the cow to a valley that has never been plowed or sown and break the cow's neck there.
5:21:5/The priests, the sons of Levi, shall approach because the LORD your God has chosen them to serve Him and to bless in the name of the LORD; and their decision will settle every dispute and assault.
5:21:6/All the elders of the town nearest to the murdered person must wash their hands over the cow whose neck was broken in the valley,
5:21:7/And they shall declare, 'Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it done.
5:21:8/Be merciful, O LORD, to your people Israel, whom you have redeemed, and do not hold the guilt of innocent blood against your people Israel.' And the guilt of the blood will be forgiven.
5:21:9/In this way, you will remove the guilt of innocent blood from among you by doing what is right in the eyes of the LORD.
5:21:10/When you go to war against your enemies, and the LORD your God delivers them into your hands and you take them captive,
5:21:11/And you see among the captives a beautiful woman and are attracted to her, wishing to take her as your wife,
5:21:12/Then you must bring her into your home, where she will shave her head, trim her nails,
5:21:13/And she will remove her captive's attire and stay in your house, mourning her father and mother for a full month. After that, you may go to her and be her husband, and she will be your wife.
5:21:14/If you are not pleased with her, you must let her go wherever she wishes. You must not sell her for money or treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her.
5:21:15/If a man has two wives, one loved and the other unloved, and both the loved and the unloved have borne him children, but the firstborn son belongs to the unloved wife,
5:21:16/Then on the day he wills his possessions to his sons, he cannot favor the son of the loved wife over the firstborn son of the unloved wife.
5:21:17/He must recognize the firstborn son of the unloved wife by giving him a double share of all he has, for that son is the first sign of his father's strength. The right of the firstborn belongs to him.
5:21:18/If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father and mother and does not listen to them even after they discipline him,
5:21:19/His father and mother shall take hold of him and bring him to the elders at the gate of his town.
5:21:20/They shall say to the elders, 'This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he will not obey us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.'
5:21:21/Then all the men of his town are to stone him to death. You must purge the evil from among you. All Israel will hear of it and be afraid.
5:21:22/If a man commits a crime punishable by death and is executed, and you hang his body on a tree,
5:21:23/You must not leave his body on the tree overnight. Be sure to bury him that same day, because anyone who is hung on a tree is under God's curse. You must not defile the land the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
5:22:1/You must not see your brother's ox or sheep stray and ignore them: you must definitely bring them back to your brother.
5:22:2/And if your brother is not nearby, or if you do not know him, then you must take it to your own house, and it shall stay with you until your brother looks for it, and you must return it to him.
5:22:3/Similarly, you must do with his donkey; and so you must do with his clothes; and with any lost item of your brother's, which he has lost and you have found, you must do the same: you cannot ignore it.
5:22:4/You must not see your brother's donkey or his ox fall down on the road and ignore them: you must definitely help him lift them up again.
5:22:5/Women shall not wear men's clothing, nor shall men wear women's clothing: for all who do so are detestable to the LORD your God.
5:22:6/If you come across a bird's nest in your path in any tree, or on the ground, with young ones or eggs, and the mother sitting on the young or on the eggs, you must not take the mother with the young.
5:22:7/But you must definitely let the mother go, and take the young for yourself; so that things may go well with you, and you may have a long life.
5:22:8/When you build a new house, you must make a parapet for your roof, so you do not bring guilt of bloodshed on your house if someone falls from it.
5:22:9/You must not plant your vineyard with two kinds of seeds: otherwise, the produce of the seed you have sown and the fruit of your vineyard will be defiled.
5:22:10/You must not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together.
5:22:11/You must not wear clothes made of wool and linen woven together.
5:22:12/You must make tassels on the four corners of the cloak you wear.
5:22:13/If a man marries a woman, has sexual relations with her, and then dislikes her,
5:22:14/And he makes accusations against her and tarnishes her reputation by saying, "I married this woman, but when I approached her, I did not find her to be a virgin,"
5:22:15/Then the woman's father and mother must bring proof of the woman's virginity to the elders at the city gate.
5:22:16/And the woman's father must say to the elders, "I gave my daughter to this man as wife, but he dislikes her;
5:22:17/And now he has made accusations against her, saying, 'I did not find your daughter to be a virgin.' But here is the proof of my daughter's virginity." And they will display the cloth before the elders of the city.
5:22:18/And the elders of that city shall take the man and punish him;
5:22:19/And they shall fine him one hundred shekels of silver and give them to the father of the woman, because he has brought a bad name upon a virgin of Israel: and she shall remain his wife; he cannot divorce her all his days.
5:22:20/But if the accusation is true, and evidence of the woman's virginity is not found,
5:22:21/Then they shall bring the woman to the entrance of her father's house, and the men of her city shall stone her to death because she has committed an outrageous act in Israel by being promiscuous while living in her father's house. Thus, you shall purge the evil from among you.
5:22:22/If a man is found sleeping with a married woman, then both the man who slept with her and the woman must die. In this way, you shall remove evil from Israel.
5:22:23/If a betrothed virgin is seduced in the city and a man sleeps with her,
5:22:24/Then you must take both of them to the gate of that city and stone them to death; the woman because she did not cry out for help in the city, and the man because he violated his neighbor's fiancée. In this way, you shall remove evil from among you.
5:22:25/But if a man encounters a betrothed woman in the countryside, and he forces her and sleeps with her, then only the man who slept with her shall die.
5:22:26/But you shall do nothing to the woman; she has committed no sin deserving death. This case is like that of someone attacking and murdering a neighbor;
5:22:27/For he found her in the countryside, and the betrothed woman cried out, but there was no one to save her.
5:22:28/If a man finds a virgin who is not betrothed, and he seizes her, lies with her, and they are discovered,
5:22:29/Then the man who lay with her must give the woman's father fifty shekels of silver, and she shall become his wife because he has violated her; he cannot divorce her all his days.
5:22:30/A man must not marry his father's wife, so that he does not dishonor his father's bed.
5:23:1/Anyone who is castrated or has their genitals mutilated cannot join the assembly of the LORD.
5:23:2/A person born out of wedlock shall not join the assembly of the LORD; even up to the tenth generation, they shall not enter the assembly of the LORD.
5:23:3/An Ammonite or Moabite shall not join the assembly of the LORD; even up to their tenth generation, they shall never join the assembly of the LORD.
5:23:4/Because they did not meet you with food and water on your journey out of Egypt; and because they hired Balaam son of Beor from Pethor in Mesopotamia to curse you.
5:23:5/However, the LORD your God refused to listen to Balaam; instead, the LORD your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the LORD your God loves you.
5:23:6/Do not seek their peace or their prosperity for as long as you live.
5:23:7/Do not despise an Edomite, for they are your relative; do not despise an Egyptian, because you were a foreigner in their country.
5:23:8/Children born to them may join the assembly of the LORD in the third generation.
5:23:9/When you go out to battle against your enemies, keep away from anything evil.
5:23:10/If anyone among you becomes unclean because of a nocturnal emission, they must go outside the camp and cannot reenter the camp.
5:23:11/But as evening approaches, they must wash themselves with water, and at sunset, they may reenter the camp.
5:23:12/You must have a designated place outside the camp where you can go to relieve yourself.
5:23:13/Carry a tool with your equipment so that when you relieve yourself outside, you can dig a hole and cover up your excrement.
5:23:14/For the LORD your God moves about in your camp to protect you and to deliver your enemies to you. Your camp must be holy, so he does not see anything indecent among you and turn away from you.
5:23:15/Do not hand over to their master a slave who has escaped from their master to you.
5:23:16/They shall live among you, in any place they choose within one of your towns, wherever they like. Do not mistreat them.
5:23:17/There must be no prostitutes among the daughters of Israel, nor any male prostitutes among the sons of Israel.
5:23:18/Do not bring the earnings of a prostitute or the money from the sale of a dog to the house of the LORD your God for any vow, for both of these are detestable to the LORD your God.
5:23:19/Do not charge your fellow Israelites interest, whether on money, food, or anything else that may earn interest.
5:23:20/You may charge a foreigner interest, but not a fellow Israelite, so that the LORD your God may bless you in everything you put your hand to in the land you are entering to possess.
5:23:21/When you make a vow to the LORD your God, do not delay in fulfilling it. The LORD your God will certainly demand it of you and you will be guilty of sin.
5:23:22/But if you refrain from making a vow, you will not be guilty.
5:23:23/Whatever you have promised with your lips you must surely fulfill, just as you have freely vowed to the LORD your God with your own mouth.
5:23:24/When you enter your neighbor's vineyard, you may eat grapes to your heart's content, but do not put any in your basket.
5:23:25/When you enter your neighbor's standing grain, you may pick kernels with your hands, but you must not put a sickle to their standing grain.
5:24:1/When a man has married a woman, and then finds she does not please him because he has discovered something objectionable about her, he can write her a divorce certificate, hand it to her, and send her away from his house.
5:24:2/After she leaves his house, she is free to become another man's wife.
5:24:3/If her next husband dislikes her and writes her a divorce certificate, gives it to her, and sends her away from his house; or if the next husband dies after marrying her;
5:24:4/Her first husband, who divorced her, cannot marry her again after she has been with another man. This is detestable in the eyes of the LORD. Do not bring sin upon the land the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
5:24:5/When a man has recently married, he must not be sent to war or have any other duty laid on him. For one year, he is to be free to stay at home and bring happiness to the wife he has married.
5:24:6/No one should take a millstone or even an upper millstone as security for a loan, because that would be taking someone's livelihood as security.
5:24:7/If someone is caught kidnapping a fellow Israelite, enslaving them or selling them, the kidnapper must die. You must purge the evil from among you.
5:24:8/Be very careful to follow all instructions regarding the disease of leprosy, exactly as the Levitical priests instruct you. As I have commanded them, so you must follow.
5:24:9/Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the way after you came out of Egypt.
5:24:10/When you lend something to your neighbor, do not go into their house to collect the collateral.
5:24:11/You must wait outside, and the person you are lending to will bring the collateral to you.
5:24:12/If the borrower is poor, do not sleep with their collateral.
5:24:13/You must certainly return the collateral to the borrower at sunset so they can sleep in their own clothes and bless you. It will be considered a righteous act in the eyes of the LORD your God.
5:24:14/Do not take advantage of a hired worker who is poor and needy, whether they are a fellow Israelite or a foreigner residing in one of your towns.
5:24:15/Pay them their wages on the same day, before the sun sets, because they are poor and are counting on it. Otherwise, they may cry to the LORD against you, and you will be guilty of sin.
5:24:16/Parents should not be put to death for their children's sins, nor children for their parents'. Each person should be put to death for their own sin.
5:24:17/Do not deny justice to a foreigner or an orphan, nor take a widow's garment as security for a loan.
5:24:18/But remember that you were a slave in Egypt and the LORD your God redeemed you from there. That is why I command you to do this.
5:24:19/When you harvest your crops and forget a sheaf in the field, do not go back to get it. Leave it for the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow, so that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
5:24:20/When you beat the olives from your trees, do not go over the branches a second time. Leave what remains for the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow.
5:24:21/When you harvest the grapes in your vineyard, do not glean what is left. Leave it for the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow.
5:24:22/And remember that you were a slave in Egypt. That is why I command you to do this.
5:25:1/If there is a dispute between people, and they go to court for a judgment, the judges will decide the case; they will clear the innocent and condemn the guilty.
5:25:2/And if the guilty person deserves to be flogged, the judge will make him lie down and have him whipped in his presence, according to his crime, with a specified number of lashes.
5:25:3/He may be given up to forty lashes but no more, so that if he is flogged more than that, your fellow Israelite would be degraded in your eyes.
5:25:4/Do not prevent the ox from eating as it treads out the grain.
5:25:5/If brothers live together and one of them dies without having a child, the widow should not marry someone outside the family. Her husband's brother should marry her, fulfilling the duty of a brother-in-law.
5:25:6/The first son she bears shall carry on the name of the dead brother so that his name will not be forgotten in Israel.
5:25:7/But if the man does not want to marry his brother's widow, she should go to the elders at the town gate and say, 'My husband's brother refuses to preserve his brother's name in Israel. He will not fulfill the duty of a brother-in-law to me.'
5:25:8/Then the elders of his town shall summon him and talk to him. If he insists, saying, 'I do not want to marry her,'
5:25:9/his brother's widow shall approach him in the presence of the elders, remove one of his sandals, spit in his face, and declare, 'This is what is done to the man who will not build up his brother's family.'
5:25:10/And his name shall be known in Israel as 'The House of the Unshod.'
5:25:11/When men fight each other, and the wife of one intervenes to save her husband from the one attacking him, and she reaches out and grabs him by the genitals,
5:25:12/you must cut off her hand without pity.
5:25:13/You must not have differing weights in your bag—one heavy, one light.
5:25:14/You must not have differing measures in your house—one large, one small.
5:25:15/You must have accurate and honest weights and measures, so that you may live long in the land the LORD your God is giving you.
5:25:16/For anyone who does these wrong things, anyone who acts unjustly, is detestable to the LORD your God.
5:25:17/Remember what Amalek did to you on your journey after you left Egypt,
5:25:18/how he attacked you when you were exhausted and weary, targeting those who were lagging behind and not fearing God.
5:25:19/Therefore, when the LORD your God gives you peace from all your surrounding enemies in the land he is giving you to possess as an inheritance, you must erase the memory of Amalek from under heaven. Do not forget.
5:26:1/When you enter the land the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you take possession of it and live there;
5:26:2/you must take some of the first produce from your soil, which you harvest from your land that the LORD your God is giving you, put it in a basket, and go to the place the LORD your God will choose to establish his name.
5:26:3/You must go to the priest in office at that time and say to him, 'Today I declare to the LORD your God that I have entered the land the LORD swore to our ancestors to give us.'
5:26:4/The priest will then take the basket from your hands and set it down in front of the altar of the LORD your God.
5:26:5/You shall then declare before the LORD your God, 'My ancestor was a wandering Aramean, who went down to Egypt and lived there with a few people, but there he became a great, powerful, and populous nation.
5:26:6/The Egyptians mistreated us, made us suffer, and imposed harsh slavery on us.
5:26:7/But when we cried out to the LORD, the God of our ancestors, the LORD heard our plea and saw our hardship, toil, and oppression.
5:26:8/So the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, with terrifying power, and with signs and wonders.
5:26:9/He has brought us to this place and given us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
5:26:10/And now, here I am, bringing the first fruits of the land you, LORD, have given me.' You shall place it before the LORD your God and bow down before him.
5:26:11/Then you and your household shall rejoice in all the good things the LORD your God has given to you and your household, along with the Levites and the foreigners living among you.
5:26:12/When you have finished setting aside a tenth of all your produce in the third year, the year of the tithe, you shall give it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, so that they may eat in your towns and be satisfied.
5:26:13/Then say before the LORD your God, 'I have removed the sacred portion from my house and have given it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, according to all your commands. I have not violated or forgotten your commands.
5:26:14/I have not eaten any of the sacred portion while in mourning, nor have I removed any of it while I was unclean, nor offered any of it to the dead. I have obeyed the LORD my God; I have done everything you commanded me.
5:26:15/Look down from your holy dwelling, from heaven, and bless your people Israel and the land you have given us, as you swore to our ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey.
5:26:16/Today the LORD your God commands you to follow these decrees and laws; carefully observe them with all your heart and with all your soul.
5:26:17/You have declared today that the LORD is your God and that you will walk in his ways, keep his decrees, commands, and laws, and listen to his voice.
5:26:18/And the LORD has declared today that you are his treasured people, as he promised, and that you are to keep all his commands.
5:26:19/He has promised to set you in praise, fame, and honor high above all the nations he has made and that you will be a people holy to the LORD your God, as he has spoken.
5:27:1/Moses and the elders of Israel instructed the people, saying, "Follow all the commands I give you today."
5:27:2/On the day you cross the Jordan into the land the LORD your God is giving you, you must set up large stones and cover them with plaster.
5:27:3/Write all the words of this law on them after you have crossed over, so that you may enter the land the LORD your God is giving you—a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the LORD, the God of your ancestors, promised you.
5:27:4/So when you have crossed the Jordan, set up these stones, as I command you today, on Mount Ebal, and cover them with plaster.
5:27:5/There you shall build an altar to the LORD your God, an altar of stones. You must not use any iron tool on them.
5:27:6/You shall build the altar of the LORD your God with uncut stones, and you shall offer burnt offerings on it to the LORD your God.
5:27:7/You shall offer peace offerings and shall eat there, rejoicing in the presence of the LORD your God.
5:27:8/Write all the words of this law on the stones clearly and distinctly.
5:27:9/Moses and the Levitical priests said to all Israel, "Be attentive and listen, Israel. Today you have become the people of the LORD your God."
5:27:10/Therefore, listen to the voice of the LORD your God and follow His commandments and statutes that I command you today.
5:27:11/Moses gave the people these instructions on that day, saying,
5:27:12/These tribes shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people when you have crossed the Jordan: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
5:27:13/And these shall stand on Mount Ebal for the curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
5:27:14/The Levites shall proclaim in a loud voice to all the men of Israel,
5:27:15/"Cursed is anyone who makes an idol or a molten image, an abomination to the LORD, the work of a craftsman's hands, and sets it up in secret." And all the people shall respond by saying, "Amen."
5:27:16/"Cursed is anyone who dishonors their father or mother." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:17/"Cursed is anyone who moves their neighbor's boundary stone." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:18/"Cursed is anyone who leads a blind person astray on the road." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:19/"Cursed is anyone who denies justice to foreigners, orphans, and widows." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:20/"Cursed is anyone who sleeps with his father's wife, for he violates his father's marriage." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:21/"Cursed is anyone who has sexual relations with any animal." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:22/"Cursed is anyone who sleeps with his sister, whether she is the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:23/"Cursed is anyone who sleeps with his mother-in-law." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:24/"Cursed is anyone who attacks their neighbor in secret." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:25/"Cursed is anyone who accepts a bribe to kill an innocent person." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:27:26/"Cursed is anyone who does not uphold the words of this law by carrying them out." And all the people shall say, "Amen."
5:28:1/It will happen that if you listen carefully to the voice of the LORD your God, and follow all his commands that I give you today, the LORD your God will elevate you above all nations on earth.
5:28:2/All these blessings will come to you and overtake you, if you listen to the voice of the LORD your God.
5:28:3/You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the field.
5:28:4/Your children, your crops, and your livestock, including the increase of your herds and the flocks of your sheep, will be blessed.
5:28:5/Your basket and your pantry will be blessed.
5:28:6/You will be blessed when you come in and blessed when you go out.
5:28:7/The LORD will defeat your enemies who rise against you; they will attack from one direction but flee from you in seven.
5:28:8/The LORD will bless your storerooms and all the work of your hands, and he will bless you in the land the LORD your God is giving you.
5:28:9/The LORD will establish you as his holy people, as he promised you, if you keep the commands of the LORD your God and walk in his ways.
5:28:10/Then all the peoples on earth will see that you are called by the name of the LORD, and they will fear you.
5:28:11/The LORD will grant you abundant prosperity—in the fruit of your womb, the young of your livestock, and the crops of your ground—in the land he swore to your ancestors to give you.
5:28:12/The LORD will open the heavens, his bountiful storehouse, to send rain on your land in season and to bless all the work of your hands. You will lend to many nations but will borrow from none.
5:28:13/The LORD will make you the head, not the tail. If you pay attention to the commands of the LORD your God that I give you this day and carefully follow them, you will always be at the top, never at the bottom.
5:28:14/Do not turn aside from any of the commands I give you today, to the right or to the left, following other gods and serving them.
5:28:15/However, if you do not listen to the voice of the LORD your God and do not carry out all his commands and decrees I am giving you today, all these curses will come upon you and overtake you:
5:28:16/You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the field.
5:28:17/Your basket and your kneading trough will be cursed.
5:28:18/The fruit of your womb, the crops of your land, the calves of your herds, and the lambs of your flocks will be cursed.
5:28:19/You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.
5:28:20/The LORD will send on you curses, confusion, and rebuke in everything you put your hand to, until you are destroyed and come to sudden ruin because of the evil you have done in forsaking him.
5:28:21/The LORD will plague you with diseases until he has eliminated you from the land you are entering to possess.
5:28:22/The LORD will strike you with wasting disease, with fever and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, with blight and mildew, which will plague you until you perish.
5:28:23/The sky over your head will be bronze, the ground beneath you iron.
5:28:24/The LORD will turn the rain of your country into dust and powder; it will come down from the skies until you are destroyed.
5:28:25/The LORD will cause you to be defeated before your enemies. You will come at them from one direction but flee from them in seven, and you will become a thing of horror to all the kingdoms on earth.
5:28:26/Your carcasses will be food for all the birds of the air and the wild animals, and there will be no one to frighten them away.
5:28:27/The LORD will afflict you with the boils of Egypt and with tumors, festering sores and the itch, from which you cannot be cured.
5:28:28/The LORD will afflict you with madness, blindness and confusion of mind.
5:28:29/At midday you will grope about like a blind person in the dark. You will be unsuccessful in everything you do; day after day you will be oppressed and robbed, with no one to rescue you.
5:28:30/You will be engaged to a woman, but another man will sleep with her. You will build a house, but you won't live in it. You will plant a vineyard, but you won't harvest its grapes.
5:28:31/Your ox will be slaughtered before your eyes, but you will eat none of it. Your donkey will be forcibly taken from you and will not be returned. Your sheep will be given to your enemies, with no one to rescue them.
5:28:32/Your sons and daughters will be given to another nation, and your eyes will wear out watching for them day after day, powerless to lift a hand.
5:28:33/A nation you do not know will eat the fruit of your land and the labor of your hands. You will be only oppressed and crushed continually.
5:28:34/You will be driven mad by the sights you see.
5:28:35/The LORD will afflict your knees and legs with painful boils that cannot be cured, spreading from the soles of your feet to the top of your head.
5:28:36/The LORD will drive you and the king you set over you to a nation unknown to you or your ancestors. There you will worship other gods, gods of wood and stone.
5:28:37/You will become a thing of horror, a byword and an object of ridicule among all the peoples where the LORD will drive you.
5:28:38/You will sow much seed in the field but you will harvest little, because locusts will devour it.
5:28:39/You will plant vineyards and cultivate them but you will not drink the wine or gather the grapes, because worms will eat them.
5:28:40/You will have olive trees throughout your country but you will not use the oil, because the olives will drop off.
5:28:41/You will have sons and daughters but you will not keep them, because they will go into captivity.
5:28:42/Swarms of locusts will take over all your trees and the crops of your land.
5:28:43/The foreigners who reside among you will rise above you higher and higher, but you will sink lower and lower.
5:28:44/They will lend to you, but you will not lend to them. They will be the head, but you will be the tail.
5:28:45/All these curses will come on you. They will pursue you and overtake you until you are destroyed, because you did not obey the LORD your God and keep the commands and decrees he gave you.
5:28:46/They will be a sign and a wonder to you and your descendants forever.
5:28:47/Because you did not serve the LORD your God joyfully and gladly in the time of prosperity,
5:28:48/therefore in hunger and thirst, in nakedness and dire poverty, you will serve the enemies the LORD sends against you. He will put an iron yoke on your neck until he has destroyed you.
5:28:49/The LORD will bring a nation against you from far away, from the ends of the earth, like an eagle swooping down, a nation whose language you will not understand,
5:28:50/a fierce-looking nation without respect for the old or pity for the young.
5:28:51/They will devour the young of your livestock and the crops of your land until you are destroyed. They will leave you no grain, new wine or olive oil, nor any calves of your herds or lambs of your flocks until you are ruined.
5:28:52/They will lay siege to all your cities until your high and fortified walls in which you trusted fall throughout your land. They will besiege all your cities throughout the land the LORD your God has given you.
5:28:53/You will eat the fruit of your own body, the flesh of your sons and daughters the LORD your God has given you, during the siege and distress your enemies inflict on you.
5:28:54/The most gentle and sensitive man among you will have no compassion on his own brother, his beloved wife, and his surviving children,
5:28:55/refusing to share with them any of the flesh of his children that he is eating. It will be all he has left because of the severe distress your enemy will inflict on all your cities.
5:28:56/The most gentle and sensitive woman among you—so sensitive and gentle that she would not venture to touch the ground with the sole of her foot—will begrudge the husband she loves and her own son and daughter,
5:28:57/the afterbirth from her womb and the children she bears. For in her dire need she intends to eat them secretly during the siege and distress your enemy will inflict on you in your cities.
5:28:58/If you do not carefully follow all the words of this law, which are written in this book, and do not revere this glorious and awesome name—the LORD your God—
5:28:59/the LORD will send fearful plagues on you and your descendants, harsh and prolonged disasters, and severe and lingering illnesses.
5:28:60/He will bring upon you all the diseases of Egypt that you dreaded, and they will cling to you.
5:28:61/Also every sickness and every plague not recorded in this Book of the Law, the LORD will bring on you until you are destroyed.
5:28:62/You who were as numerous as the stars in the sky will be left few in number, because you did not obey the LORD your God.
5:28:63/Just as it pleased the LORD to make you prosper and increase in number, so it will please him to ruin and destroy you. You will be uprooted from the land you are entering to possess.
5:28:64/The LORD will scatter you among all nations, from one end of the earth to the other. There you will worship other gods—gods of wood and stone, which neither you nor your ancestors have known.
5:28:65/Among those nations you will find no repose, no resting place for the sole of your foot. There the LORD will give you an anxious mind, eyes weary with longing, and a despairing heart.
5:28:66/You will live in constant suspense, filled with dread both night and day, never sure of your life.
5:28:67/In the morning you will say, "If only it were evening!" and in the evening, "If only it were morning!"—because of the terror that will fill your hearts and the sights that your eyes will see.
5:28:68/The LORD will send you back in ships to Egypt on a journey I said you should never make again. There you will offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.
5:29:1/These are the words of the agreement, which the LORD instructed Moses to establish with the Israelites in the land of Moab, in addition to the agreement he had made with them at Horeb.
5:29:2/And Moses gathered all Israel and said to them, "You have witnessed everything the LORD did in Egypt to Pharaoh, his officials, and his land;
5:29:3/The significant trials you saw with your own eyes, the signs, and those incredible miracles:
5:29:4/Yet, the LORD hasn't given you a mind to understand, eyes to see, or ears to hear, up to this very day.
5:29:5/I have led you for forty years in the wilderness: your clothes have not worn out on you, and your shoe has not worn out on your foot.
5:29:6/You haven't eaten bread, nor have you drunk wine or strong drink: so you might know that I am the LORD your God.
5:29:7/And when you arrived at this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, came out to fight against us, and we defeated them:
5:29:8/And we took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh.
5:29:9/Therefore, keep the words of this agreement and follow them, so you may thrive in everything you do.
5:29:10/Today, all of you stand before the LORD your God; your leaders, your elders, and your officials, along with all the men of Israel,
5:29:11/Your children, your wives, and the foreigner in your camp, from the one who cuts your wood to the one who draws your water:
5:29:12/So that you may enter into an agreement with the LORD your God, and into his oath, which the LORD your God is making with you today:
5:29:13/So that he may establish you today as his people, and that he may be your God, as he has told you, and as he has sworn to your ancestors, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
5:29:14/It's not just with you that I am making this agreement and this oath;
5:29:15/But also with anyone standing here with us today before the LORD our God, and also with anyone who is not here with us today:
5:29:16/(For you know how we lived in the land of Egypt; and how we traveled through the nations you passed by;
5:29:17/And you have seen their detestable practices, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them:)
5:29:18/So that there won't be among you any man, woman, family, or tribe, whose heart turns away today from the LORD our God, to go and serve the gods of these nations; so there won't be among you a root that produces poison and bitterness;
5:29:19/And it happens that when he hears the words of this curse, he blesses himself in his heart, saying, 'I will have peace, even though I follow the stubbornness of my heart,' leading to the addition of drunkenness to thirst:
5:29:20/The LORD will not forgive him, but then the anger of the LORD and his jealousy will burn against that person, and all the curses written in this book will rest on him, and the LORD will erase his name from under heaven.
5:29:21/And the LORD will set him apart for disaster from all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the agreement written in this book of the law:
5:29:22/So that the future generation, your children who rise up after you, and the foreigner who comes from a distant land, will say, when they see the plagues of that land and the diseases with which the LORD has afflicted it;
5:29:23/And that the whole land is sulfur, salt, and burning, that it is not sown, nor does it bear, nor does any grass grow there, like the destruction of Sodom, and Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboim, which the LORD overthrew in his anger and wrath:
5:29:24/Then all nations will ask, 'Why has the LORD done this to this land? What caused the heat of this great anger?'
5:29:25/Then people will say, 'It's because they abandoned the agreement of the LORD, the God of their ancestors, which he made with them when he brought them out of the land of Egypt:
5:29:26/For they went and served other gods and worshiped them, gods they did not know and that he had not allotted to them:
5:29:27/And the anger of the LORD was ignited against this land, to bring upon it all the curses written in this book:
5:29:28/And the LORD uprooted them from their land in anger, wrath, and great indignation, and threw them into another land, as it is today.
5:29:29/The secret things belong to the LORD our God: but the things revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may follow all the words of this law.
5:30:1/When all these things happen to you—the blessings and the curses I've laid out before you—and you remember them in all the nations where the LORD your God has sent you,
5:30:2/And you return to the LORD your God and listen to His voice with all your heart and soul, just as I'm commanding you today, you and your children,
5:30:3/Then the LORD your God will restore your fortunes, show you mercy, and gather you again from all the nations where He has scattered you.
5:30:4/Even if you've been exiled to the farthest horizon, the LORD your God will gather you from there and bring you back.
5:30:5/The LORD your God will bring you into the land your ancestors owned, and you will take possession of it. He will make you more prosperous and numerous than your ancestors.
5:30:6/The LORD your God will soften your heart and the hearts of your descendants, so that you love the LORD your God with all your heart and soul, and so you may live.
5:30:7/The LORD your God will place all these curses on your foes and those who hate and persecute you.
5:30:8/You will return and listen to the voice of the LORD and follow all His commands that I'm giving you today.
5:30:9/The LORD your God will make you successful in all you do—in your children, your livestock, and your crops. The LORD will delight in making you prosperous, just as He delighted in your ancestors,
5:30:10/If you listen to the voice of the LORD your God, keeping His commandments and statutes written in this Book of the Law, and if you turn to the LORD your God with all your heart and soul.
5:30:11/This commandment I give you today is not too mysterious or out of reach.
5:30:12/It's not up in heaven, so you don't have to ask, 'Who will go up to heaven to get it for us and proclaim it to us so we can follow it?'
5:30:13/Nor is it beyond the sea, so you don't have to ask, 'Who will cross the sea to get it for us and proclaim it to us so we can follow it?'
5:30:14/No, the word is very close to you; it's in your mouth and in your heart so you can obey it.
5:30:15/See, today I've set before you life and prosperity, death and destruction.
5:30:16/For I command you today to love the LORD your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commands, decrees, and laws; then you will live and increase, and the LORD your God will bless you in the land you are entering to possess.
5:30:17/But if your heart turns away and you are not obedient, and if you are drawn away to bow down to other gods and worship them,
5:30:18/I declare to you this day that you will certainly be destroyed. You will not live long in the land you are crossing the Jordan to enter and possess.
5:30:19/Today I call the heavens and the earth as witnesses against you that I have set before you life and death, blessings and curses. Now choose life, so that you and your children may live
5:30:20/And that you may love the LORD your God, listen to His voice, and hold fast to Him. For the LORD is your life, and He will give you many years in the land He swore to give to your fathers, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
5:31:1/Moses went and spoke these words to all of Israel.
5:31:2/He told them, "Today I am 120 years old; I can no longer lead you in and out. Besides, the LORD has told me, 'You will not cross the Jordan River.'"
5:31:3/"The LORD your God Himself will cross ahead of you and will destroy these nations before you so that you can take their land. Joshua will also cross ahead of you, as the LORD has said."
5:31:4/"The LORD will deal with them just as He did with Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, and their land, which He destroyed."
5:31:5/"The LORD will deliver them to you, and you must do to them all that I have commanded you."
5:31:6/"Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified of them, for the LORD your God goes with you; He will never leave you nor forsake you."
5:31:7/Moses called Joshua and said to him in front of all Israel, "Be strong and courageous, for you must go with this people into the land the LORD swore to their ancestors to give them, and you must divide it among them as their inheritance."
5:31:8/"The LORD Himself goes before you and will be with you; He will never leave you nor forsake you. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged."
5:31:9/Moses wrote down this law and handed it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and to all the elders of Israel.
5:31:10/Moses instructed them, saying, "At the end of every seven years, during the Festival of Tabernacles,
5:31:11/when all Israel comes to appear before the LORD your God at the place He will choose, you shall read this law before them in their hearing.
5:31:12/Gather the people together—men, women, children, and the foreigners residing in your towns—so they can listen and learn to fear the LORD your God and follow carefully all the words of this law.
5:31:13/And so their children, who do not know this law, can hear and learn to fear the LORD your God as long as you live in the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess."
5:31:14/The LORD said to Moses, "Your time to die is near. Call Joshua and present yourselves in the tent of meeting, so I may commission him." So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the tent of meeting.
5:31:15/The LORD appeared at the tent in a pillar of cloud, and the cloud stood over the entrance to the tent.
5:31:16/The LORD said to Moses, "You are going to rest with your ancestors, and then this people will soon prostitute themselves to the foreign gods of the land they are entering. They will forsake me and break the covenant I made with them.
5:31:17/Then my anger will be kindled against them on that day, and I will abandon them and hide my face from them. They will be devoured, and many disasters and hardships will come upon them. They will say on that day, 'Isn't it because our God is not with us that these disasters have come upon us?'
5:31:18/And I will certainly hide my face on that day because of all the evil they have done by turning to other gods.
5:31:19/Now, write down this song for yourselves and teach it to the Israelites. Put it in their mouths, so this song may be a witness for me against the Israelites.
5:31:20/For when I bring them into the land I swore to their ancestors, a land flowing with milk and honey, and they eat their fill and thrive, they will turn to other gods and worship them, rejecting me and breaking my covenant.
5:31:21/And when many disasters and hardships come upon them, this song will testify against them, because it will not be forgotten by their descendants. I know what they are inclined to do, even before I bring them into the land I promised."
5:31:22/So Moses wrote down this song that day and taught it to the Israelites.
5:31:23/He gave Joshua son of Nun a charge, saying, "Be strong and courageous, for you will bring the Israelites into the land I swore to them, and I will be with you."
5:31:24/When Moses finished writing down the words of this law in a book to the very end,
5:31:25/Moses commanded the Levites, who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD, saying,
5:31:26/"Take this Book of the Law and place it beside the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God. There it will remain as a witness against you.
5:31:27/For I know your rebelliousness and your stiff neck. Even today, while I am still alive with you, you have been rebellious against the LORD; how much more after my death?
5:31:28/Gather to me all the elders of your tribes and your officials, so I can speak these words in their hearing and call heaven and earth to testify against them.
5:31:29/For I know that after my death you will become utterly corrupt and turn from the way I have commanded you. In the days to come, disaster will fall upon you because you will do evil in the sight of the LORD, provoking Him to anger by what your hands have made."
5:31:30/Moses recited the words of this song from beginning to end in the hearing of the whole assembly of Israel.
5:32:1/Listen up, heavens, and I'll speak; earth, hear the words I'm saying.
5:32:2/My teaching will fall like rain, my words will settle like dew, like light rain on new grass, like showers on the green plants.
5:32:3/Because I will proclaim the name of the LORD: give greatness to our God.
5:32:4/He is the Rock, his work is flawless: all his ways are just: a God of truth and without wrongdoing, fair and upright is he.
