5:32:5/They have degraded themselves, their blemish is not the mark of his children: they are a twisted and crooked generation.
5:32:6/Is this how you repay the LORD, O foolish and unwise people? Isn't he your father who acquired you? Didn't he make you and establish you?
5:32:7/Remember the ancient days, think about the years of many generations: ask your father, and he will show you; your elders, and they will tell you.
5:32:8/When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance, when he divided humanity, he set the boundaries of the peoples according to the number of the children of Israel.
5:32:9/For the LORD's portion is his people; Jacob is the plot of land he inherits.
5:32:10/He found him in a desert land, in a howling wilderness wasteland; he encircled him, he cared for him, he guarded him as the pupil of his eye.
5:32:11/Like an eagle that stirs up its nest, hovers over its young, spreads its wings to catch them, carries them on its pinions,
5:32:12/So the LORD alone led him, with no foreign god beside him.
5:32:13/He made him ride on the heights of the land, to eat the produce of the fields; he made him suck honey from the rock, and oil from the flinty crag;
5:32:14/Cream from cows, and milk from sheep, with fat of lambs, and rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats, with the choicest wheat; and you drank wine from the purest grapes.
5:32:15/But Jeshurun grew fat and kicked: you grew fat, you grew thick, you are covered with fat; then he abandoned God who made him, and discounted the Rock of his salvation.
5:32:16/They stirred him to jealousy with strange gods, with detestable practices they provoked him to anger.
5:32:17/They sacrificed to demons, not to God; to gods they had not known, to new gods that had come recently, whom your ancestors had not feared.
5:32:18/You forgot the Rock who fathered you, and forgot God who gave you birth.
5:32:19/And when the LORD saw it, he rejected them, because of the provocation of his sons and daughters.
5:32:20/And he said, 'I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end will be; for they are a perverse generation, children in whom there is no faithfulness.
5:32:21/They have made me jealous with what is not God; they have provoked me to anger with their idols. So I will make them jealous with those who are not a people; I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.
5:32:22/For a fire has been kindled by my anger, and it will burn to the depths of Sheol, consume the earth and its yield, and set the foundations of the mountains on fire.
5:32:23/I will heap disasters on them; I will use up my arrows against them.
5:32:24/They will be wasted with hunger, devoured by plague and poisonous destruction; I will send the fangs of wild beasts against them, with the venom of things that crawl in the dust.
5:32:25/The sword will bring death from outside, and terror from within, destroying both the young man and the virgin, the infant and the gray-haired man.
5:32:26/I said I would scatter them and erase their memory from human existence,
5:32:27/Were it not that I dreaded the taunt of the enemy, lest their adversaries misunderstand and say, 'Our hand is triumphant; it was not the LORD who did all this.''
5:32:28/For they are a nation lacking in counsel, and there is no understanding in them.
5:32:29/If only they were wise and would understand this, and discern what their end will be!
5:32:30/How could one chase a thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, unless their Rock had sold them, and the LORD had surrendered them?
5:32:31/For their rock is not like our Rock, as even our enemies concede.
5:32:32/Their vine comes from the vine of Sodom and from the fields of Gomorrah; their grapes are grapes of poison, their clusters are bitter;
5:32:33/Their wine is the venom of serpents, the deadly poison of cobras.
5:32:34/Isn't this stored up with me, sealed in my treasuries?
5:32:35/Vengeance is mine, and recompense; their foot will slip in due time; for the day of their calamity is near, and the impending things are hastening upon them.
5:32:36/For the LORD will vindicate his people and have compassion on his servants, when he sees that their power is gone, and there is none remaining, bond or free.
5:32:37/And he will say, 'Where are their gods, the rock in which they took refuge,
5:32:38/Who ate the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink offering? Let them rise up and help you; let them be your protection.'
5:32:39/See now that I, even I, am he, and there is no god beside me; I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal; and there is none that can deliver from my hand.
5:32:40/For I raise my hand to heaven and swear, As I live forever,
5:32:41/When I sharpen my flashing sword, and my hand grasps it in judgment; I will take vengeance on my adversaries, and will repay those who hate me.
5:32:42/I will make my arrows drunk with blood, and my sword will devour flesh—the blood of the slain and the captives, from the long-haired heads of the enemy.'
5:32:43/Rejoice, O nations, with his people; for he will avenge the blood of his servants, and will take vengeance on his adversaries, and will make atonement for his land and his people.
5:32:44/And Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the hearing of the people, he and Joshua the son of Nun.
5:32:45/And Moses finished speaking all these words to all Israel,
5:32:46/And he said to them, 'Take to heart all the words I am warning you today, that you may command your children to obey carefully all the words of this law.
5:32:47/For it is not an idle word for you; indeed, it is your life. And by this word, you will prolong your days in the land you are crossing the Jordan to possess.'
5:32:48/And the LORD spoke to Moses that very day, saying,
5:32:49/'Go up this mountain of the Abarim, Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, opposite Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel for a possession;
5:32:50/And die on the mountain which you ascend, and be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people,
5:32:51/Because you broke faith with me in the midst of the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah-Kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin; because you did not treat me as holy in the midst of the children of Israel.
5:32:52/Yet you shall see the land before you, but you shall not go there, into the land which I am giving to the children of Israel.
5:33:1/This is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the children of Israel before his death.
5:33:2/He said, "The LORD came from Sinai and appeared to them from Seir; He shone forth from Mount Paran and came with tens of thousands of holy ones. From His right hand came a fire of law for them.
5:33:3/Indeed, He loves His people; all His holy ones are in His hand. They followed at His feet and accepted His teachings.
5:33:4/Moses gave us a law, a precious inheritance for the assembly of Jacob.
5:33:5/He became king in Jeshurun when the leaders of the people and the tribes of Israel came together.
5:33:6/May Reuben live and not die, and may his people be numerous."
5:33:7/For Judah, he said, "Listen, LORD, to the voice of Judah and bring him to his people. Strengthen his hands and help him against his adversaries."
5:33:8/About Levi, he said, "May your Thummim and Urim be with your faithful one, whom you tested at Massah and contended with at the waters of Meribah.
5:33:9/He who said to his father and mother, 'I do not recognize them,' and did not acknowledge his brothers or know his own children, for they kept Your word and maintained Your covenant.
5:33:10/They will teach Your regulations to Jacob and Your law to Israel. They will place incense before You and whole burnt offerings on Your altar.
5:33:11/Bless his wealth, LORD, and accept the work of his hands. Strike down those who rise against him and his foes so they rise no more."
5:33:12/For Benjamin, he said, "The LORD's beloved will dwell in safety by Him. He shields him all day long, and he rests between His shoulders."
5:33:13/For Joseph, he said, "May his land be blessed by the LORD with the precious gifts of heaven, with dew, and with the deep lying beneath,
5:33:14/With the best fruits brought forth by the sun, and the rich yield of the months,
5:33:15/With the finest produce of ancient mountains and the abundance of everlasting hills,
5:33:16/With the best gifts of the earth and its fullness, and the favor of Him who dwelled in the burning bush. Let these blessings rest on the head of Joseph, on the crown of the prince among his brothers.
5:33:17/His majesty is like a firstborn bull, and his horns are like the horns of a wild ox. With them, he will push the peoples to the ends of the earth. Such are the myriads of Ephraim; such are the thousands of Manasseh."
5:33:18/For Zebulun, he said, "Rejoice, Zebulun, in your journeys, and Issachar, in your tents.
5:33:19/They will summon peoples to the mountain and there offer sacrifices of righteousness; they will feast on the abundance of the seas and on treasures hidden in the sand."
5:33:20/For Gad, he said, "Blessed is the one who enlarges Gad's territory! Gad lives like a lion, tearing arm and head.
5:33:21/He chose the best land for himself; the leader's portion was reserved there. He came with the leaders of the people; he carried out the LORD's justice and His decrees for Israel."
5:33:22/For Dan, he said, "Dan is a lion's cub that leaps from Bashan."
5:33:23/For Naphtali, he said, "Naphtali is satisfied with favor and full of the LORD's blessing; take possession of the west and the south."
5:33:24/For Asher, he said, "May Asher be the most blessed of sons; let him be favored by his brothers, and let him dip his foot in oil.
5:33:25/Your gates will be iron and bronze, and your strength will last as long as you live.
5:33:26/There is no one like the God of Jeshurun, who rides the heavens to help you and in His majesty soars through the skies.
5:33:27/The eternal God is your refuge, and beneath are the everlasting arms. He will drive out your enemies before you, saying, 'Destroy them!'
5:33:28/So Israel will live in safety; Jacob's spring is secure in a land of grain and new wine, where the heavens drop dew.
5:33:29/Blessed are you, Israel! Who is like you, a people saved by the LORD? He is your shield and helper and your glorious sword. Your enemies will cower before you, and you will tread on their heights."
5:34:1/Moses climbed from the plains of Moab to the top of Mount Nebo, to the peak of Pisgah, across from Jericho. And the LORD showed him the entire land of Gilead, as far as Dan,
5:34:2/All of Naphtali, the territories of Ephraim and Manasseh, and the whole region of Judah, reaching to the farthest sea,
5:34:3/The southern lands, and the valley plains of Jericho, the city of palm trees, extending to Zoar.
5:34:4/And the LORD told him, "This is the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, 'I will give it to your descendants.' I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you will not cross into it."
5:34:5/So Moses, the servant of the LORD, died there in the land of Moab, as the LORD had said.
5:34:6/He was buried in a valley in Moab, across from Bethpeor, but to this day, no one knows where his grave is.
5:34:7/Moses was 120 years old when he died. His eyesight was still sharp, and he was as vigorous as ever.
5:34:8/The Israelites mourned for Moses in the plains of Moab for thirty days, until the time of weeping and mourning was over.
5:34:9/Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands on him. The Israelites listened to him and followed the LORD's commands to Moses.
5:34:10/No prophet has risen in Israel like Moses, whom the LORD knew face to face,
5:34:11/Who did all the miraculous signs and wonders the LORD sent him to perform in Egypt—to Pharaoh, to all his officials, and to his entire land.
5:34:12/And for all the mighty deeds and the great awe-inspiring acts that Moses performed in the sight of all Israel.
6:1:1/After Moses, the servant of the LORD, passed away, the LORD spoke to Joshua, the son of Nun, Moses' assistant, saying,
6:1:2/"Moses my servant is no longer alive; now it's time for you to get up, cross the Jordan River, you and all the people, into the land I am giving them, the children of Israel.
6:1:3/Every place you set your foot, I have given to you, just as I promised Moses.
6:1:4/Your territory will extend from the desert and Lebanon to the great river, the Euphrates—all the Hittite country—and to the Great Sea on the west.
6:1:5/No one will be able to stand against you all the days of your life. Just as I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will not leave you nor forsake you.
6:1:6/Be strong and courageous, because you will lead these people to inherit the land I swore to their ancestors to give them.
6:1:7/Only be strong and very courageous, making sure to follow all the law my servant Moses gave you; do not turn from it to the right or to the left, so that you may be successful wherever you go.
6:1:8/Keep this Book of the Law always on your lips; meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do everything written in it. Then you will be prosperous and successful.
6:1:9/Haven't I commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the LORD your God will be with you wherever you go."
6:1:10/Then Joshua ordered the officers of the people,
6:1:11/"Go through the camp and tell the people, 'Get your provisions ready. In three days you will cross the Jordan here to go in and take possession of the land the LORD your God is giving you for your own.'"
6:1:12/To the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joshua said,
6:1:13/"Remember the command that Moses the servant of the LORD gave you: 'The LORD your God is giving you rest and has granted you this land.'
6:1:14/Your wives, your children, and your livestock may stay in the land that Moses gave you east of the Jordan, but all your warriors, fully armed, must lead the other tribes across the Jordan to help them,
6:1:15/until the LORD gives them rest, as he has done for you, and until they too have taken possession of the land the LORD your God is giving them. After that, you may go back and occupy your own land, which Moses the servant of the LORD gave you east of the Jordan toward the sunrise."
6:1:16/They answered Joshua, "Whatever you have commanded us we will do, and wherever you send us we will go.
6:1:17/Just as we fully obeyed Moses, so we will obey you. Only may the LORD your God be with you as he was with Moses.
6:1:18/Whoever rebels against your orders and does not obey your words, whatever you command, will be put to death. Only be strong and courageous."
6:2:1/Joshua, the son of Nun, sent two men from Shittim to secretly scout the land, especially Jericho. They went and stayed at the house of a prostitute named Rahab.
6:2:2/The king of Jericho was informed, "Look, men from the Israelites came here tonight to spy on the land."
6:2:3/So the king of Jericho sent a message to Rahab, "Bring out the men who have come to you, who entered your house, because they have come to spy on the entire land."
6:2:4/Rahab took the two men and hid them, then said, "Yes, men came to me, but I didn't know where they were from."
6:2:5/At dusk, when it was time to close the city gate, the men left. I don't know where they went. Hurry, you might catch up with them."
6:2:6/But she had taken them up to the roof and hidden them under the stalks of flax she had arranged there.
6:2:7/The king's men pursued them towards the Jordan River to the fords. As soon as the pursuers had gone out, the gate was shut.
6:2:8/Before the spies lay down for the night, she went up to them on the roof.
6:2:9/She said to the men, "I know that the LORD has given you this land, and that a great fear of you has fallen on us, so that all who live in this land are melting in fear because of you."
6:2:10/"We have heard how the LORD dried up the water of the Red Sea for you when you came out of Egypt, and what you did to the two Amorite kings east of the Jordan, Sihon and Og, whom you completely destroyed."
6:2:11/"When we heard of it, our hearts melted in fear and everyone's courage failed because of you, for the LORD your God is God in heaven above and on the earth below."
6:2:12/"Now then, please swear to me by the LORD that you will show kindness to my family, because I have shown kindness to you. Give me a sure sign."
6:2:13/"That you will spare the lives of my father and mother, my brothers and sisters, and all who belong to them, and that you will save us from death."
6:2:14/The men assured her, "Our lives for yours! If you don't tell what we are doing, we will treat you kindly and faithfully when the LORD gives us the land."
6:2:15/Then she let them down by a rope through the window, for her house was part of the city wall, so she lived within the wall.
6:2:16/She told them, "Go to the hills so the pursuers will not find you. Hide yourselves there three days until they return, and then go on your way."
6:2:17/The men said to her, "We will be free from this oath you made us swear."
6:2:18/"When we enter the land, tie this scarlet cord in the window through which you let us down, and bring your family into your house."
6:2:19/"If anyone goes outside your house into the street, their blood will be on their own head, and we will be innocent. But if anyone within the house is harmed, their blood will be on our head."
6:2:20/"If you expose our mission, then we will be released from the oath you made us swear."
6:2:21/She agreed, "Let it be as you say." She sent them away, and they departed. Then she tied the scarlet cord in the window.
6:2:22/They left for the hills and stayed there three days until the pursuers had returned. The pursuers searched all along the way but did not find them.
6:2:23/Then the two men came down from the hills, crossed the river, and reported to Joshua son of Nun all that had happened to them.
6:2:24/They told Joshua, "The LORD has indeed given the entire land into our hands; all the people are terrified of us."
6:3:1/Joshua got up early in the morning; they moved from Shittim to the Jordan River, he and all the Israelites, and stayed there before crossing.
6:3:2/After three days, the officers went through the camp;
6:3:3/They instructed the people, saying, "When you see the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, carried by the Levite priests, then you should leave your spot and follow it.
6:3:4/However, keep a distance of about two thousand cubits from it: do not come near it, so you can follow the path you need to take, since you have never traveled this way before.
6:3:5/Joshua told the people, "Prepare yourselves, because tomorrow the LORD will perform miracles among you."
6:3:6/Joshua said to the priests, "Carry the ark of the covenant and lead the way for the people." And they carried the ark of the covenant and went ahead of the people.
6:3:7/The LORD told Joshua, "Today I will begin to make you great in the eyes of all Israel, so they will know that, just as I was with Moses, I will be with you."
6:3:8/You must instruct the priests carrying the ark of the covenant, saying, 'When you reach the edge of the Jordan's waters, stand still in the river.'"
6:3:9/Joshua said to the Israelites, "Come here and listen to the words of the LORD your God."
6:3:10/Joshua said, "This is how you will know that the living God is among you and that He will certainly drive out before you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites.
6:3:11/See, the ark of the covenant of the LORD of all the earth will go ahead of you into the Jordan.
6:3:12/Now, choose twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one from each tribe.
6:3:13/As soon as the priests carrying the ark of the LORD, the Lord of all the earth, set foot in the Jordan's waters, its waters flowing downstream will be cut off and stand up in a heap."
6:3:14/When the people broke camp to cross the Jordan, with the priests carrying the ark of the covenant ahead of them;
6:3:15/And as those carrying the ark reached the Jordan, and the priests carrying the ark dipped their feet in the edge of the water (since the Jordan overflows all its banks during harvest time),
6:3:16/The waters flowing from upstream stopped and piled up far away at a town called Adam, near Zaretan, while the waters flowing down to the Sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, were completely cut off. And the people crossed over opposite Jericho.
6:3:17/The priests carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan, and all the Israelites crossed on dry ground, until the entire nation had finished crossing the Jordan.
6:4:1/When all the people had completely crossed the Jordan, the LORD spoke to Joshua, saying,
6:4:2/Select twelve men from the people, one from each tribe,
6:4:3/And instruct them to take twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan, from the spot where the priests' feet stood firmly, and carry them over with you, leaving them at the place where you stay tonight.
6:4:4/Joshua then called the twelve men he had chosen from the Israelites, one from each tribe:
6:4:5/And Joshua told them, "Cross ahead of the ark of the LORD your God into the middle of the Jordan, and each of you take a stone on his shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the Israelites,
6:4:6/So that this may serve as a sign among you. When your children ask in the future, 'What do these stones mean to you?'
6:4:7/You shall tell them, 'The waters of the Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of the LORD; when it crossed the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off.' And these stones shall serve as a memorial to the Israelites forever."
6:4:8/The Israelites did as Joshua commanded and took twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan, as the LORD had told Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the Israelites, and carried them over with them to their lodging place, where they set them down.
6:4:9/Joshua also set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, in the spot where the feet of the priests carrying the ark of the covenant had stood; and they are there to this day.
6:4:10/The priests carrying the ark stood in the middle of the Jordan until everything was completed that the LORD had commanded Joshua to tell the people, following all that Moses had instructed Joshua. And the people hurried across.
6:4:11/When all the people had finished crossing, the ark of the LORD and the priests came across in full view of the people.
6:4:12/The tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh crossed over ready for battle in front of the Israelites, as Moses had directed them.
6:4:13/About forty thousand armed for battle crossed over before the LORD to the plains of Jericho for war.
6:4:14/On that day, the LORD elevated Joshua in the eyes of all Israel; and they respected him just as they had respected Moses all the days of his life.
6:4:15/And the LORD said to Joshua,
6:4:16/Order the priests carrying the ark of the testimony to come up out of the Jordan.
6:4:17/So Joshua commanded the priests, "Come up out of the Jordan."
6:4:18/And as soon as the priests carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD came up from the middle of the Jordan, and the soles of the priests' feet touched dry ground, the waters of the Jordan returned to their place and flowed over all its banks as before.
6:4:19/The people came up out of the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month and camped in Gilgal on the eastern border of Jericho.
6:4:20/And Joshua set up in Gilgal the twelve stones they had taken out of the Jordan.
6:4:21/He said to the Israelites, "When your children ask their parents in the future, 'What do these stones mean?'
6:4:22/You shall tell your children, 'Israel crossed the Jordan on dry ground.'
6:4:23/For the LORD your God dried up the waters of the Jordan before you until you had crossed over, just as the LORD your God did to the Red Sea, which He dried up before us until we had crossed over,
6:4:24/So that all the peoples of the earth may know the power of the LORD, that it is mighty: that you may always fear the LORD your God."
6:5:1/When all the kings of the Amorites to the west of the Jordan and all the kings of the Canaanites by the sea heard that the LORD had dried up the waters of the Jordan for the Israelites to cross, their courage failed, and they no longer had the will to fight because of the Israelites.
6:5:2/At that time, the LORD instructed Joshua, "Make sharp knives and circumcise the Israelites again."
6:5:3/Joshua made sharp knives and circumcised the Israelites at the hill of the foreskins.
6:5:4/The reason Joshua circumcised them was that all the male warriors who had left Egypt had died in the wilderness on the way, after leaving Egypt.
6:5:5/All the people who had left Egypt were circumcised, but those born in the wilderness during the journey from Egypt had not been circumcised.
6:5:6/The Israelites wandered in the wilderness for forty years until all the warriors who had left Egypt had perished, because they did not obey the LORD. The LORD had sworn not to show them the land flowing with milk and honey that he had promised their ancestors.
6:5:7/Joshua circumcised their children, who had taken their place, because they had not been circumcised during the journey.
6:5:8/After circumcising all the people, they stayed in their places in the camp until they had healed.
6:5:9/The LORD said to Joshua, "Today I have removed the disgrace of Egypt from you." Therefore, the place has been called Gilgal to this day.
6:5:10/The Israelites camped at Gilgal and celebrated Passover on the fourteenth day of the month in the evening on the plains of Jericho.
6:5:11/The day after Passover, they ate from the produce of the land; unleavened bread and roasted grain.
6:5:12/After they ate the produce of the land, the manna stopped. From that year on, the Israelites ate from the crops of Canaan.
6:5:13/While Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing in front of him with a drawn sword. Joshua approached him and asked, "Are you with us or with our enemies?"
6:5:14/The man replied, "No, I am the commander of the LORD's army." Joshua fell facedown in reverence and asked, "What message does my Lord have for his servant?"
6:5:15/The commander of the LORD's army said to Joshua, "Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy." And Joshua did so.
6:6:1/Jericho was tightly sealed off because of the Israelites: no one could enter or leave.
6:6:2/And the LORD said to Joshua, "Look, I have handed over to you Jericho, its king, and its valiant warriors."
6:6:3/"You and all your warriors shall march around the city once a day for six days."
6:6:4/"Seven priests will carry seven ram's horn trumpets in front of the ark. On the seventh day, you shall march around the city seven times, and the priests will blow the trumpets."
6:6:5/"When they sound a long blast on the ram's horn and you hear the trumpet's sound, all the people shall shout loudly; the city's wall will collapse, and the people will storm the city, each going straight ahead."
6:6:6/Joshua, son of Nun, summoned the priests and said to them, "Carry the ark of the covenant, and have seven priests carry seven ram's horn trumpets in front of the LORD's ark."
6:6:7/He told the people, "Move forward and march around the city, with the armed men leading the way in front of the LORD's ark."
6:6:8/When Joshua had given the instructions, the seven priests carrying the seven ram's horn trumpets advanced before the LORD, blowing the trumpets, with the ark of the covenant of the LORD following them.
6:6:9/The armed men marched ahead of the priests who blew the trumpets, and the rear guard followed the ark, with the priests continually blowing the trumpets.
6:6:10/Joshua commanded the people, "Do not shout or make any noise with your voice, nor utter a word, until the day I tell you to shout; then you shall shout."
6:6:11/So the ark of the LORD circled the city, completing one circuit; then they returned to camp and stayed there.
6:6:12/Joshua got up early in the morning, and the priests carried the ark of the LORD.
6:6:13/Seven priests carrying seven ram's horn trumpets before the ark of the LORD walked on, continually blowing the trumpets; the armed men went ahead of them, and the rear guard followed the ark of the LORD, with the priests continually blowing the trumpets.
6:6:14/On the second day, they marched around the city once and returned to the camp. They did this for six days.
6:6:15/On the seventh day, they got up at dawn and circled the city in the same manner seven times; that day they circled the city seven times.
6:6:16/At the seventh time, when the priests blew the trumpets, Joshua said to the people, "Shout, for the LORD has given you the city."
6:6:17/The city and everything in it are to be devoted to the LORD. Only Rahab the prostitute and all who are with her in her house shall be spared, because she hid the spies we sent."
6:6:18/"But keep away from the devoted things, so that you will not bring about your own destruction by taking any of them. Otherwise, you will make the camp of Israel liable to destruction and bring trouble on it."
6:6:19/"All the silver, gold, bronze, and iron are sacred to the LORD and must go into his treasury."
6:6:20/So when the priests blew the trumpets, the people shouted loudly, and the wall collapsed; then the people charged straight into the city and captured it.
6:6:21/They completely destroyed everything in the city with the sword—men and women, young and old, cattle, sheep, and donkeys.
6:6:22/Joshua told the two men who had spied out the land, "Go into the prostitute's house and bring her out, along with all who belong to her, in accordance with your oath to her."
6:6:23/The spies went in and brought out Rahab, her father, mother, brothers, and all who belonged to her. They brought out all her relatives and left them outside the camp of Israel.
6:6:24/They burned the city and everything in it, but they put the silver, gold, bronze, and iron into the treasury of the LORD's house.
6:6:25/Joshua spared Rahab the prostitute, her family, and all who belonged to her. She lives in Israel to this day because she hid the messengers Joshua sent to spy on Jericho.
6:6:26/Joshua pronounced a curse at that time, saying, "Cursed before the LORD is the man who undertakes to rebuild this city, Jericho. At the cost of his firstborn son, he will lay its foundations; at the cost of his youngest, he will set up its gates."
6:6:27/So the LORD was with Joshua, and his reputation spread throughout the land.
6:7:1/But the Israelites violated the ban by taking some of the devoted things. Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah, took some of these things, and the LORD's anger burned against the Israelites.
6:7:2/Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is near Bethaven, east of Bethel, and told them, "Go up and scout the area." So the men went up and scouted Ai.
6:7:3/They returned to Joshua and said, "Not all the people need to go up; send two or three thousand men to take Ai. Don't weary everyone, for they are few."
6:7:4/So about three thousand men went up, but they were routed by the men of Ai.
6:7:5/The men of Ai killed about thirty-six of them, chasing them from the city gate to Shebarim and striking them down on the slopes. At this, the hearts of the people melted in fear.
6:7:6/Joshua tore his clothes and fell facedown to the ground before the ark of the LORD until evening, he and the elders of Israel, and they put dust on their heads.
6:7:7/And Joshua said, "Oh Sovereign LORD, why did you ever bring this people across the Jordan to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites to destroy us? If only we had been content to stay on the other side of the Jordan!
6:7:8/O LORD, what can I say, now that Israel has been routed by its enemies?
6:7:9/The Canaanites and all the other inhabitants of the land will hear about this and will surround us and wipe out our name from the earth. What then will you do for your great name?"
6:7:10/The LORD said to Joshua, "Stand up! Why are you lying down on your face?
6:7:11/Israel has sinned; they have violated my covenant, which I commanded them to keep. They have taken some of the devoted things; they have stolen, they have lied, and they have put them with their own possessions.
6:7:12/That is why the Israelites cannot stand against their enemies; they turn their backs and run because they have been made liable to destruction. I will not be with you anymore unless you destroy whatever among you is devoted to destruction.
6:7:13/Go, consecrate the people. Tell them, 'Consecrate yourselves in preparation for tomorrow; for this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: There are devoted things among you, Israel. You cannot stand against your enemies until you remove them.
6:7:14/In the morning, present yourselves tribe by tribe. The tribe the LORD takes shall come forward clan by clan; the clan the LORD takes shall come forward family by family; and the family the LORD takes shall come forward man by man.
6:7:15/Whoever is caught with the devoted things shall be destroyed by fire, along with all that belongs to him. He has violated the covenant of the LORD and has done an outrageous thing in Israel.'"
6:7:16/Early the next morning Joshua had Israel come forward by tribes, and Judah was taken.
6:7:17/The clans of Judah came forward, and he took the Zerahites. He had the clan of the Zerahites come forward by families, and Zabdi was taken.
6:7:18/Then he had his family come forward man by man, and Achan son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.
6:7:19/Then Joshua said to Achan, "My son, give glory to the LORD, the God of Israel, and honor him. Tell me what you have done; do not hide it from me."
6:7:20/And Achan replied, "It is true! I have sinned against the LORD, the God of Israel. This is what I did:
6:7:21/When I saw in the plunder a beautiful robe from Babylonia, two hundred shekels of silver and a bar of gold weighing fifty shekels, I coveted them and took them. They are hidden in the ground inside my tent, with the silver underneath."
6:7:22/So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent, and there it was, hidden in his tent, with the silver underneath.
6:7:23/They took the things from the tent, brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites and spread them out before the LORD.
6:7:24/Then Joshua, together with all Israel, took Achan son of Zerah, the silver, the robe, the gold bar, his sons and daughters, his cattle, donkeys and sheep, his tent and all that he had, to the Valley of Achor.
6:7:25/Joshua said, "Why have you brought trouble on us? The LORD will bring trouble on you today." Then all Israel stoned him, and after they had stoned the rest, they burned them.
6:7:26/Over Achan they heaped up a large pile of rocks, which remains to this day. Then the LORD turned from his fierce anger. Therefore that place has been called the Valley of Achor ever since.
6:8:1/The LORD said to Joshua, "Do not be afraid or discouraged. Take all your warriors with you and go up to Ai. See, I have given you the king of Ai, his people, his city, and his land.
6:8:2/You shall treat Ai and its king as you did Jericho and its king. However, you may take their possessions and livestock for yourselves. Set up an ambush behind the city."
6:8:3/So Joshua got up, along with all the warriors, to attack Ai. Joshua selected thirty thousand strong and courageous men and sent them out at night.
6:8:4/He instructed them, "Watch the city from behind, but don't go too far. Stay alert and ready."
6:8:5/"I and all the people with me will approach the city. When they come out to fight us as before, we'll run away from them,
6:8:6/They will chase us until we've lured them away from the city, thinking, 'They are running away from us as they did before.' So we will run from them.
6:8:7/Then you will come out of your ambush and capture the city, for the LORD your God will give it into your hands.
6:8:8/Once you've taken the city, set it on fire. Follow the LORD's command exactly. I have instructed you."
6:8:9/Joshua sent them off, and they went to the ambush site and stayed between Bethel and Ai, west of Ai. Joshua spent that night with the people.
6:8:10/Joshua got up early in the morning, mustered the people, and led them, along with the elders of Israel, to Ai.
6:8:11/All the warriors with him advanced and approached the city, setting up camp north of Ai, with a valley between them and the city.
6:8:12/He took about five thousand men and positioned them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, to the west of the city.
6:8:13/After positioning the troops, with the main camp north of the city and the ambush to the west, Joshua went into the valley that night.
6:8:14/When the king of Ai saw the Israelites, he and his men hurried out early in the morning to attack Israel in a prearranged battle location, not knowing there was an ambush behind the city.
6:8:15/Joshua and all Israel pretended to be defeated and fled toward the wilderness.
6:8:16/All the men of Ai were called to chase after them, drawing them away from the city.
6:8:17/Not a single man remained in Ai or Bethel who did not chase after Israel, leaving the city unprotected.
6:8:18/The LORD said to Joshua, "Point the spear in your hand toward Ai, for I will give it into your hand." Joshua pointed the spear toward the city.
6:8:19/The ambush quickly emerged from their position, ran into the city as soon as Joshua extended his hand, captured it, and immediately set it on fire.
6:8:20/When the men of Ai looked back, they saw the smoke of their city rising to the sky, leaving them no chance to escape in any direction. The Israelites who had fled to the wilderness turned back against their pursuers.
6:8:21/Seeing that the ambush had captured the city and that smoke was rising from it, Joshua and all Israel turned back and attacked the men of Ai.
6:8:22/The others came out of the city to confront them, so the Ai men were surrounded by Israelites, some on one side and some on the other. They were defeated, leaving none alive or able to escape.
6:8:23/They captured the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.
6:8:24/After killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the open fields and wilderness where they had chased them, and after all of them had fallen by the sword, all the Israelites returned to Ai and struck it down with the sword.
6:8:25/That day, twelve thousand men and women, the entire population of Ai, were killed.
6:8:26/Joshua did not withdraw his hand, which he had stretched out with the spear, until he had completely destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
6:8:27/Only the livestock and the spoils of the city did the Israelites take for themselves, according to the word of the LORD which He had commanded Joshua.
6:8:28/Joshua burned Ai, turning it into a permanent heap of ruins, desolate to this day.
6:8:29/He hanged the king of Ai on a tree until evening. At sunset, Joshua ordered the body to be taken down from the tree, thrown at the entrance of the city gate, and a large pile of stones was erected over it, which remains to this day.
6:8:30/Then Joshua built an altar to the LORD God of Israel on Mount Ebal,
6:8:31/As Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded the Israelites. He built it of uncut stones on which no iron tool had been used. On it, they offered burnt offerings to the LORD and sacrificed fellowship offerings.
6:8:32/There, in the presence of the Israelites, Joshua wrote on the stones a copy of the law of Moses.
6:8:33/All Israel, including their elders, officers, and judges, stood on both sides of the ark, facing the Levitical priests who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD. Both the foreigners living among them and the native-born were there. Half of the people stood in front of Mount Gerizim and half in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses, the servant of the LORD, had previously instructed to bless the people of Israel.
6:8:34/Afterward, he read all the words of the law—the blessings and the curses—just as it is written in the book of the law.
6:8:35/There wasn't a single word of all that Moses commanded that Joshua did not read aloud to the entire assembly of Israel, including the women, children, and the foreigners living among them.
6:9:1/When all the kings west of the Jordan River—the ones in the hills, valleys, and along the coast of the Mediterranean Sea near Lebanon (the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites)—heard about this,
6:9:2/They joined forces to fight against Joshua and Israel, united in their effort.
6:9:3/When the people of Gibeon heard about what Joshua had done to Jericho and Ai,
6:9:4/They resorted to a trick; they acted as if they were ambassadors, carrying worn-out sacks on their donkeys, and old, patched wine skins,
6:9:5/Wearing old, patched shoes and ragged clothes; all their bread was dry and moldy.
6:9:6/They went to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal and said to him and the Israelites, "We have come from a distant land; please make a treaty with us."
6:9:7/But the Israelites said to the Hivites, "Maybe you live near us. How can we make a treaty with you?"
6:9:8/They said to Joshua, "We are your servants." Joshua asked, "Who are you and where do you come from?"
6:9:9/They answered, "Your servants have come from a very distant country because of the fame of the LORD your God. We have heard reports of him, all that he did in Egypt,
6:9:10/And everything he did to the two Amorite kings east of the Jordan—Sihon king of Heshbon, and Og king of Bashan, who lived in Ashtaroth.
6:9:11/So our elders and all the residents of our country told us, 'Take provisions for the journey and go to meet them. Say to them, "We are your servants; please make a treaty with us."'"
6:9:12/"This bread of ours was warm when we packed it at home on the day we left to come to you. But now, see, it is dry and moldy.
6:9:13/And these wine skins that we filled were new, but see, they are torn; and our clothes and shoes are worn out from the very long journey."
6:9:14/The men sampled their provisions but did not inquire of the LORD.
6:9:15/Joshua made peace with them and made a treaty with them to let them live, and the leaders of the community swore an oath to them.
6:9:16/Three days after they made the treaty with them, they learned that they were neighbors, living among them.
6:9:17/The Israelites set out and reached their cities on the third day. Their cities were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.
6:9:18/But the Israelites did not attack them, because the leaders of the community had sworn an oath to them by the LORD, the God of Israel. The whole community grumbled against the leaders.
6:9:19/But all the leaders answered the whole community, "We have sworn to them by the LORD, the God of Israel, and now we cannot touch them.
6:9:20/This is what we will do to them: we will let them live, so that God's wrath will not fall on us for breaking the oath we swore to them."
6:9:21/They said, "Let them live, but let them be woodcutters and water carriers for the entire community." So the leaders' promise to them was kept.
6:9:22/Joshua called for them and said, "Why did you deceive us by saying, 'We live far away from you,' when actually you live among us?
6:9:23/Now you are cursed, and you will never be freed from service as woodcutters and water carriers for the house of my God."
6:9:24/They answered Joshua, "Your servants were clearly told how the LORD your God commanded his servant Moses to give you the whole land and to wipe out all its inhabitants from before you. So we were very afraid for our lives because of you, and that is why we did this.
6:9:25/Now we are in your hands. Do to us whatever seems good and right to you."
6:9:26/He did this for them; he saved them from the hands of the Israelites and they did not kill them.
6:9:27/That day Joshua made them woodcutters and water carriers for the community and for the altar of the LORD, at the place the LORD would choose, which they are to this day.
6:10:1/When Adonizedec, the king of Jerusalem, heard how Joshua had captured Ai and completely destroyed it, just as he had done to Jericho and its king, and how the people of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and were now among them;
6:10:2/They were very afraid because Gibeon was a significant city, like one of the royal cities, and it was larger than Ai, with all its men being warriors.
6:10:3/So, Adonizedec, the king of Jerusalem, sent messages to Hoham, king of Hebron, Piram, king of Jarmuth, Japhia, king of Lachish, and Debir, king of Eglon, saying,
6:10:4/"Come up to me and help me attack Gibeon, because it has made peace with Joshua and the Israelites."
6:10:5/Therefore, the five Amorite kings - the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon - joined forces, moved out with all their troops, and laid siege to Gibeon, waging war against it.
6:10:6/The people of Gibeon quickly sent a message to Joshua at the camp in Gilgal: "Don't abandon your servants. Come up to us quickly and save us! Help us, because all the Amorite kings from the hill country have joined forces against us."
6:10:7/So Joshua marched up from Gilgal with all his soldiers, including the most valiant warriors.
6:10:8/And the LORD said to Joshua, "Do not be afraid of them, for I have given them into your hands. Not one of them will be able to withstand you."
6:10:9/Joshua therefore attacked them by surprise, marching all night from Gilgal.
6:10:10/And the LORD threw them into confusion before Israel, leading to a great slaughter at Gibeon. Israel pursued them along the road going up to Bethhoron and struck them down all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.
6:10:11/As they fled before Israel on the road down from Bethhoron to Azekah, the LORD hurled large hailstones down on them from the sky, and more of them died from the hail than were killed by the swords of the Israelites.
6:10:12/Then Joshua spoke to the LORD on the day the LORD gave the Amorites over to Israel and said in the presence of Israel: "Sun, stand still over Gibeon, and you, Moon, over the Valley of Aijalon."
6:10:13/And the sun stood still, and the moon stopped, until the nation avenged itself on its enemies. Isn't this recorded in the Book of Jashar? The sun stopped in the middle of the sky and delayed going down about a full day.
6:10:14/There has never been a day like it before or since, a day when the LORD listened to a human being. Surely the LORD was fighting for Israel.
6:10:15/Then Joshua and all Israel with him returned to the camp at Gilgal.
6:10:16/But the five kings fled and hid in a cave at Makkedah.
6:10:17/When Joshua was told that the five kings had been found hiding in a cave at Makkedah,
6:10:18/he said, "Roll large rocks up to the mouth of the cave, and station men there to guard them.
6:10:19/But don't stop; pursue your enemies, attack them from the rear and don't let them reach their cities, for the LORD your God has given them into your hand."
6:10:20/When Joshua and the Israelites had finished striking them down with a great slaughter until they were wiped out, and the survivors had entered their fortified cities,
6:10:21/all the troops returned safely to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah. No one dared to utter a word against the Israelites.
6:10:22/Then Joshua said, "Open the mouth of the cave and bring those five kings out to me."
6:10:23/They did so and brought the five kings out of the cave to him—the kings of Jerusalem, Hebron, Jarmuth, Lachish, and Eglon.
6:10:24/When they had brought these kings to Joshua, he summoned all the men of Israel and said to the commanders of the soldiers who had gone with him, "Come here and put your feet on the necks of these kings." They came forward and placed their feet on their necks.
6:10:25/Joshua then said to them, "Do not be afraid or discouraged. Be strong and courageous. This is what the LORD will do to all the enemies you are going to fight."
6:10:26/Afterward, Joshua struck and killed the kings and hung their bodies on five trees, and they were left hanging on the trees until evening.
6:10:27/At sunset, Joshua gave the order and they took them down from the trees, threw them into the cave where they had been hiding, and placed large rocks at the cave's entrance, which are there to this day.
6:10:28/That day Joshua captured Makkedah, struck it and its king with the sword, and completely destroyed everyone in it. He left no survivors. And he did to the king of Makkedah as he had done to the king of Jericho.
6:10:29/Then Joshua and all Israel with him moved on from Makkedah to Libnah and attacked it.
6:10:30/And the LORD also gave it and its king into Israel's hand. Joshua struck it and everyone in it with the sword, leaving no survivors. He did to its king as he had done to the king of Jericho.
6:10:31/From Libnah, Joshua and all Israel with him moved on to Lachish; they camped against it and attacked it.
6:10:32/The LORD gave Lachish into Israel's hands, and they captured it on the second day, striking it and everyone in it with the sword, just as they had done to Libnah.
6:10:33/Then Horam, king of Gezer, came up to help Lachish, but Joshua defeated him and his people, leaving no survivors.
6:10:34/From Lachish, Joshua moved on to Eglon with all Israel. They camped against it and attacked it.
6:10:35/They captured it that same day and struck it with the sword. He completely destroyed everyone in it that day, just as he had done to Lachish.
6:10:36/Then Joshua and all Israel with him went up from Eglon to Hebron and attacked it.
6:10:37/They captured it and struck it with the sword, along with its king, all its towns, and everyone in it. He left no survivors, just as he had done to Eglon, completely destroying it and everyone in it.
6:10:38/Then Joshua and all Israel with him turned to Debir and attacked it.
6:10:39/He captured it, its king, and all its towns. They struck them with the sword and completely destroyed everyone in them. He left no survivors. As he had done to Hebron, so he did to Debir and its king, as he had also done to Libnah and its king.
6:10:40/So Joshua struck the whole region of the hills, the Negev, the western foothills, and the mountain slopes, together with all their kings. He left no survivors but completely destroyed all that breathed, as the LORD, the God of Israel, had commanded.
6:10:41/Joshua struck them from Kadesh Barnea to Gaza and all the country of Goshen as far as Gibeon.
6:10:42/Joshua captured all these kings and their lands at one time because the LORD, the God of Israel, fought for Israel.
6:10:43/Then Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp at Gilgal.
6:11:1/When Jabin, the king of Hazor, heard about these events, he sent messages to Jobab, king of Madon, and to the kings of Shimron and Achshaph,
6:11:2/As well as to the kings north of the mountains, those in the plains south of Chinneroth, in the valley, and in the territories of Dor to the west,
6:11:3/He also reached out to the Canaanites in the east and west, and to the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites in the mountains, and the Hivites below Mount Hermon in the land of Mizpeh.
6:11:4/They mobilized, bringing a massive force with them, as numerous as the sand on the seashore, equipped with many horses and chariots.
6:11:5/When all these kings joined forces, they gathered and camped together at the waters of Merom to wage war against Israel.
6:11:6/The LORD told Joshua, "Do not be afraid of them. By this time tomorrow, I will hand them all over to Israel, defeated. You are to cripple their horses and burn their chariots."
6:11:7/So Joshua and his warriors took them by surprise near the waters of Merom and attacked them suddenly.
6:11:8/The LORD gave them into Israel's hands. They defeated them and pursued them to Great Sidon, Misrephoth Maim, and the valley of Mizpeh to the east, leaving no survivors.
6:11:9/Joshua did as the LORD instructed: he crippled their horses and burned their chariots.
6:11:10/Then Joshua turned back, captured Hazor, and killed its king with the sword. Hazor had previously been the leader of all those kingdoms.
6:11:11/They killed everyone in it with the sword, completely destroying them. No one was left alive, and he burned Hazor itself.
6:11:12/Joshua captured all the cities of those kings and killed their kings with the sword, utterly destroying them, just as Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded.
6:11:13/However, Israel did not burn any of the cities built on their mounds except Hazor, which Joshua burned.
6:11:14/The Israelites took all the spoils and livestock of these cities for themselves, but they killed all the people with the sword until they had destroyed them, without sparing anyone.
6:11:15/Just as the LORD had commanded Moses his servant, so Moses commanded Joshua, and Joshua did it. He left nothing undone of all that the LORD had commanded Moses.
6:11:16/Thus, Joshua took all this land: the hill country, all the Negev, the whole region of Goshen, the lowlands, the Arabah, the mountains of Israel and their lowlands,
6:11:17/From Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir, to Baal Gad in the Valley of Lebanon below Mount Hermon. He captured all their kings, struck them down, and killed them.
6:11:18/Joshua waged war against all these kings for a long time.
6:11:19/No city made peace with the Israelites except the Hivites living in Gibeon; all others were taken in battle.
6:11:20/For it was the LORD's will to harden their hearts so they would wage war against Israel, enabling him to completely destroy them without mercy, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
6:11:21/At that time, Joshua eliminated the Anakim from the mountains: from Hebron, Debir, Anab, and all the mountains of Judah and Israel. Joshua completely destroyed them and their cities.
6:11:22/No Anakim were left in the land of the Israelites; only in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod did some remain.
6:11:23/So Joshua took the entire land, just as the LORD had told Moses; and he gave it as an inheritance to Israel according to their tribal divisions. And the land had rest from war.
6:12:1/Here are the kings of the land that the Israelites defeated and whose territories they took over east of the Jordan, from the Arnon River to Mount Hermon, and all the eastern plains:
6:12:2/Sihon, king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon and ruled from Aroer, on the edge of the Arnon River, through the middle of the river valley, and as far as the Jabbok River, the boundary of the Ammonites;
6:12:3/And from the plains to the Sea of Galilee in the east, and to the Dead Sea in the east, by the route to Beth Jeshimoth, and from the south below the slopes of Pisgah;
6:12:4/And the territory of Og, king of Bashan, one of the last of the Rephaim, who lived at Ashtaroth and Edrei,
6:12:5/And ruled over Mount Hermon, Salecah, and all Bashan to the border of the Geshurites and Maacathites, and half of Gilead to the border of Sihon, king of Heshbon.
6:12:6/Moses, the servant of the LORD, and the Israelites defeated them. And Moses, the servant of the LORD, gave their land as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
6:12:7/Here are the kings of the land that Joshua and the Israelites defeated on the west side of the Jordan, from Baalgad in the Valley of Lebanon to Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir. Joshua gave their lands as an inheritance to the tribes of Israel according to their tribal divisions,
6:12:8/Including the hill country, the western foothills, the Arabah, the slopes, the desert, and the Negev - the lands of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites:
6:12:9/The king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, near Bethel, one;

6:12:11/The king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;

6:12:20/The king of Shimronmeron, one; the king of Achshaph, one;
6:12:21/The king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;
6:12:22/The king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;
6:12:23/The king of Dor in the region of Dor, one; the king of the nations at Gilgal, one;
6:12:24/The king of Tirzah, one: totaling thirty-one kings.
6:13:1/Now Joshua was old and advanced in years; and the LORD said to him, "You are old and advanced in years, and there is still a great deal of land to be taken.
6:13:2/This is the land that remains: all the territories of the Philistines, and all Geshuri,
6:13:3/From Sihor, which is before Egypt, to the borders of Ekron to the north, considered part of Canaanite territory: the five rulers of the Philistines; the people of Gaza, Ashdod, Ashkelon, Gath, and Ekron; as well as the Avites:
6:13:4/To the south, all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah that is next to the Sidonians up to Aphek, to the borders of the Amorites:
6:13:5/And the land of the Giblites, and all Lebanon, towards the east, from Baalgad below Mount Hermon to the entrance of Hamath.
6:13:6/All the inhabitants of the hill country from Lebanon to Misrephothmaim, and all the Sidonians, I will drive out before the children of Israel: just divide it by lot to the Israelites for an inheritance, as I have instructed you.
6:13:7/Now therefore divide this land for an inheritance to the nine tribes, and the half tribe of Manasseh,
6:13:8/Together with the Reubenites and the Gadites who have received their inheritance, which Moses gave them, east of the Jordan, just as Moses the servant of the LORD gave them;
6:13:9/From Aroer, which is on the bank of the river Arnon, and the city in the middle of the river, and all the plain of Medeba to Dibon;
6:13:10/And all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon, to the border of the children of Ammon;
6:13:11/And Gilead, and the territory of the Geshurites and Maachathites, and all Mount Hermon, and all Bashan to Salcah;
6:13:12/All the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who ruled in Ashtaroth and in Edrei, who was left of the remnant of the giants: for Moses defeated them and drove them out.
6:13:13/However, the children of Israel did not drive out the Geshurites or the Maachathites: but the Geshurites and the Maachathites live among the Israelites to this day.
6:13:14/Only to the tribe of Levi he gave no inheritance; the offerings made by fire to the LORD God of Israel are their inheritance, as he told them.
6:13:15/And Moses gave to the tribe of the children of Reuben their inheritance according to their families.
6:13:16/And their territory was from Aroer, on the bank of the river Arnon, and the city in the middle of the river, and all the plain near Medeba;
6:13:17/Heshbon, and all its cities in the plain; Dibon, Bamothbaal, and Bethbaalmeon,
6:13:18/And Jahaza, Kedemoth, and Mephaath,
6:13:19/And Kirjathaim, Sibmah, and Zarethshahar on the mount of the valley,
6:13:20/And Bethpeor, Ashdothpisgah, and Bethjeshimoth,
6:13:21/And all the cities of the plain, and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, who ruled in Heshbon, whom Moses defeated along with the princes of Midian, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who were leaders of Sihon, living in the land.
6:13:22/Balaam also the son of Beor, the diviner, was killed by the children of Israel with the sword among those who were slain by them.
6:13:23/And the border of the children of Reuben was the Jordan, and its boundary. This was the inheritance of the children of Reuben according to their families, the cities and their villages.
6:13:24/And Moses gave inheritance to the tribe of Gad, to the children of Gad according to their families.
6:13:25/And their territory was Jazer, and all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the children of Ammon, up to Aroer that is before Rabbah;
6:13:26/And from Heshbon to Ramathmizpeh and Betonim; and from Mahanaim to the border of Debir;
6:13:27/And in the valley, Betharam, Bethnimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon, the remainder of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, with the Jordan as its boundary, up to the edge of the Sea of Chinnereth on the other side of the Jordan eastward.
6:13:28/This is the inheritance of the children of Gad according to their families, the cities, and their villages.
6:13:29/And Moses gave inheritance to the half tribe of Manasseh: and this was the possession of the half tribe of the children of Manasseh by their families.
6:13:30/And their territory was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities:
6:13:31/And half Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were assigned to the children of Machir the son of Manasseh, even to one half of the children of Machir by their families.
6:13:32/These are the territories which Moses distributed as inheritance in the plains of Moab, on the other side of the Jordan, by Jericho, eastward.
6:13:33/But to the tribe of Levi Moses gave no inheritance: the LORD God of Israel is their inheritance, as he told them.
6:14:1/Here are the lands that the Israelites received as their inheritance in Canaan, distributed by Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders of the Israelite tribes.
6:14:2/Their inheritance was determined by drawing lots, as the LORD had instructed through Moses, for the nine and a half tribes.
6:14:3/Moses had already granted land to two and a half tribes east of the Jordan River. However, the Levites were not given any land among them.
6:14:4/Since the descendants of Joseph formed two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, the Levites were not given a share of the land but were given cities to live in, along with surrounding pasturelands for their livestock and possessions.
6:14:5/Just as the LORD had commanded Moses, the Israelites followed through and divided the land accordingly.
6:14:6/The tribe of Judah approached Joshua in Gilgal. Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, "You know what the LORD told Moses about you and me in Kadesh Barnea.
6:14:7/I was forty years old when Moses, the LORD's servant, sent me from Kadesh Barnea to scout out the land, and I reported back to him with my honest opinion.
6:14:8/However, my fellow scouts discouraged the people, but I remained completely loyal to the LORD my God.
6:14:9/And Moses swore on that day, saying, 'The land on which your feet have walked will be your inheritance and your children's forever, because you have been completely loyal to the LORD my God.'
6:14:10/And now, look, the LORD has kept me alive, as he promised, for forty-five years since he said this to Moses while Israel wandered in the wilderness. And here I am today, eighty-five years old.
6:14:11/I am still as strong today as I was the day Moses sent me out; I'm just as capable now of going to battle as I was then.
6:14:12/So now, give me this hill country that the LORD promised me that day. You yourself heard back then that the Anakites were there and their cities were large and fortified. But with the LORD helping me, I will drive them out just as he said."
6:14:13/Joshua blessed Caleb son of Jephunneh and gave him Hebron as his inheritance.
6:14:14/Therefore, Hebron has belonged to Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day, because he was completely loyal to the LORD, the God of Israel.
6:14:15/Before, Hebron was called Kiriath Arba, named after Arba, a great hero among the Anakites. And the land had peace from war.
6:15:1/This then was the territory allocated to the tribe of Judah and their clans; the southernmost part of their territory was the wilderness of Zin, extending southward to the border of Edom.
6:15:2/Their southern border started from the edge of the Dead Sea, from the bay that faces southward:
6:15:3/It extended to the southern slope of Maalehacrabbim, continued to Zin, ascended on the south side to Kadeshbarnea, moved toward Hezron, went up to Adar, and curved toward Karkaa:
6:15:4/From there it passed toward Azmon, extended to the Brook of Egypt, and its terminations were at the sea: this will be your southern border.
6:15:5/And the eastern border was the Dead Sea, up to the mouth of the Jordan River. And the northern boundary started from the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan:
6:15:6/And the border went up to Bethhogla, moved north of Betharabah; and the boundary ascended to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben:
6:15:7/Then the border went up toward Debir from the Valley of Achor, turning northward toward Gilgal, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim, south of the river. The border continued toward the waters of Enshemesh and ended at Enrogel:
6:15:8/And the border ascended through the Valley of Ben Hinnom to the southern slope of the Jebusite territory, which is Jerusalem. Then the border climbed to the top of the mountain opposite the Valley of Hinnom to the west, at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim:
6:15:9/From the mountain's summit, the border extended to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah, moved out to the towns of Mount Ephron, and then the border bent toward Baalah, which is Kirjathjearim:
6:15:10/And the border circled westward from Baalah to Mount Seir, ran along the northern slope of Mount Jearim (that is, Chesalon), descended to Bethshemesh, and passed Timnah:
6:15:11/The border then extended to the north side of Ekron, curved to Shicron, passed along to Mount Baalah, and reached Jabneel. The terminations of the border were at the sea.
6:15:12/And the western border was the Mediterranean Sea and its coastline. This is the surrounding boundary of the children of Judah according to their clans.
6:15:13/To Caleb the son of Jephunneh, he gave a portion among the children of Judah, as the LORD commanded Joshua, which was the city of Arba, the father of Anak, that is, Hebron.
6:15:14/And Caleb drove out from there the three sons of Anak: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak.
6:15:15/Then he went up from there to the inhabitants of Debir; previously, Debir was called Kirjathsepher.

6:15:17/And Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's brother, captured it; so he gave him his daughter Achsah as wife.
6:15:18/When she came to him, she persuaded him to ask her father for a field. As she dismounted from her donkey, Caleb asked her, "What do you want?"
6:15:19/She replied, "Please give me a blessing. Since you have given me land in the Negev, give me also springs of water." So he gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.

6:16:1/The territory allocated to Joseph's descendants extended from the Jordan River near Jericho, eastward to the waters of Jericho, through the wilderness, and up to Mount Bethel.
6:16:2/It then proceeded from Bethel to Luz, and continued to the borders of Archi at Ataroth,
6:16:3/Descending westward to the territory of Japhleti, reaching the area of lower Bethhoron, and extending to Gezer; its boundaries ended at the sea.
6:16:4/Thus, the descendants of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, received their inheritance.
6:16:5/The boundary for the Ephraimite clans was as follows: starting from Atarothaddar in the east, it stretched to upper Bethhoron;
6:16:6/Then the boundary extended northward to the sea, reaching Michmethah on the north; it curved eastward to Taanathshiloh, passing it on the east side towards Janohah;
6:16:7/From Janohah, it descended to Ataroth and Naarath, reached Jericho, and ended at the Jordan River.
6:16:8/The boundary extended from Tappuah westward to the Kanah River; its end was at the sea. This defined the inheritance for the Ephraimite clans.
6:16:9/Additionally, Ephraim's descendants had separate cities within the territories of Manasseh, including all the cities with their villages.
6:16:10/However, they did not expel the Canaanites living in Gezer; to this day, the Canaanites live among the Ephraimites but are subjected to forced labor.
6:17:1/The tribe of Manasseh also received a portion because Manasseh was Joseph's firstborn. Specifically, Machir, Manasseh's firstborn and the father of Gilead, a warrior, received Gilead and Bashan.
6:17:2/Additionally, portions were allocated to the other descendants of Manasseh according to their families, including the descendants of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. These were the male descendants of Manasseh, Joseph's son, by their families.
6:17:3/However, Zelophehad, a descendant of Hepher, Gilead, Machir, and Manasseh, had no sons, only daughters. Their names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
6:17:4/They approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders, stating, "The LORD instructed Moses to grant us an inheritance among our brothers." So, following the LORD's command, they received an inheritance among their father's brothers.
6:17:5/Manasseh received ten portions in addition to Gilead and Bashan, which were located on the other side of the Jordan River.
6:17:6/This was because Manasseh's daughters received an inheritance among his sons, and the remaining sons of Manasseh received the land of Gilead.
6:17:7/The territory of Manasseh extended from Asher to Michmethah, near Shechem. The boundary then followed a path to the right towards the residents of Entappuah.
6:17:8/Manasseh owned the land of Tappuah, but the town of Tappuah on Manasseh's border belonged to the Ephraimites.
6:17:9/The boundary went down to the Kanah River, south of the river. These cities of Ephraim were situated among the cities of Manasseh. The boundary of Manasseh was on the north side of the river, ending at the sea.
6:17:10/The land to the south belonged to Ephraim, while the land to the north belonged to Manasseh, with the sea marking its boundary. They bordered Asher to the north and Issachar to the east.
6:17:11/Manasseh had territories within Issachar and Asher, including Bethshean and its surrounding towns, Ibleam and its towns, as well as the towns of Dor, Endor, Taanach, and Megiddo, encompassing three regions.
6:17:12/However, the descendants of Manasseh were unable to drive out the inhabitants of these cities, and the Canaanites persisted in living in that land.
6:17:13/Eventually, as the Israelites grew stronger, they subjected the Canaanites to forced labor but did not completely expel them.
6:17:14/The descendants of Joseph complained to Joshua, "Why have you given us only one portion and one lot as our inheritance? We are a numerous people because the LORD has blessed us abundantly."
6:17:15/Joshua responded, "If you are so numerous, go up to the forest and clear land for yourselves there in the territory of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, if the hill country of Ephraim is too confined for you."
6:17:16/But the descendants of Joseph argued, "The hill country is not enough for us, and all the Canaanites living in the plains have iron chariots, both those in Bethshean and its towns and those in the Valley of Jezreel."
6:17:17/Then Joshua said to the house of Joseph, to both Ephraim and Manasseh, "You are a numerous people with great strength. You will not have just one allotment.
6:17:18/But the forested hill country will be yours. You can clear it, and its farthest limits will be yours. You will drive out the Canaanites, even though they have iron chariots and are strong."
6:18:1/And the entire community of the Israelites gathered at Shiloh and set up the meeting tent there. The land was conquered before them.
6:18:2/And among the Israelites, there were seven tribes that had not yet received their inheritance.
6:18:3/And Joshua asked the Israelites, "How long will you delay in taking possession of the land that the LORD, the God of your ancestors, has given you?"
6:18:4/Select three men from each tribe, and I will send them out. They will survey the land according to its inheritance and then return to me.
6:18:5/They will divide it into seven parts: Judah will stay in their territory to the south, and the descendants of Joseph will stay in their territories to the north.
6:18:6/Therefore, survey the land in seven parts and bring the survey back to me, so I can draw lots for you here before the LORD our God.
6:18:7/But the Levites will not have a share among you because the priesthood of the LORD is their inheritance. Gad, Reuben, and half the tribe of Manasseh have already received their inheritance east of the Jordan, which Moses, the servant of the LORD, gave them.
6:18:8/And the men set out and Joshua instructed those who were to survey the land, "Go, walk through the land, survey it, and return to me. Then I will draw lots for you here before the LORD in Shiloh."
6:18:9/And the men went and passed through the land, surveying it by cities into seven parts in a record, and returned to Joshua at the camp in Shiloh.
6:18:10/And Joshua drew lots for them in Shiloh before the LORD. There, Joshua allocated the land to the Israelites according to their divisions.
6:18:11/The lot for the tribe of Benjamin came up according to their families, and the territory of their lot lay between the descendants of Judah and Joseph.
6:18:12/And their northern border started from the Jordan, went up to the north side of Jericho, up through the mountains westward, and ended at the desert of Bethaven.
6:18:13/From there, the border extended toward Luz, to the southern side of Luz (which is Bethel), and then went down to Atarothadar, near the hill south of lower Beth Horon.
6:18:14/Then the border turned and wrapped around the southern corner, from the hill facing Beth Horon southward; and its end points were at Kirjath Baal (which is Kirjath Jearim), a city of the descendants of Judah. This was the western side.
6:18:15/And the southern side began from the edge of Kirjath Jearim, and the border extended westward and went to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah.
6:18:16/Then the border came down to the edge of the hill facing the Valley of Ben Hinnom, which is in the Valley of the Giants to the north, descended to the Hinnom Valley, along the south side of the Jebusites, and went down to Enrogel.
6:18:17/It was drawn from the north and extended to Enshemesh, then went toward Geliloth, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim, and went down to the Stone of Bohan, the son of Reuben.
6:18:18/It passed along toward the northern side opposite the Arabah and went down into the Arabah.
6:18:19/The border passed along the northern side of Beth Hoglah, and the boundary ended at the northern bay of the Salt Sea, at the south end of the Jordan. This was the southern boundary.
6:18:20/And the Jordan formed its border on the eastern side. This was the inheritance of the descendants of Benjamin, by its boundaries all around, according to their families.
6:18:21/Now the cities of the tribe of Benjamin according to their families were Jericho, Beth Hoglah, and the Valley of Keziz,
6:18:22/And Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, and Bethel,
6:18:23/And Avvim, Parah, and Ophrah,
6:18:24/And Chephar Ammoni, Ophni, and Gaba; twelve cities with their villages,
6:18:25/Gibeon, Ramah, and Beeroth,
6:18:26/And Mizpah, Chephirah, and Mozah,
6:18:27/And Rekem, Irpeel, and Taralah,
6:18:28/And Zelah, Eleph, and the Jebusite city (which is Jerusalem), Gibeath, and Kirjath; fourteen cities with their villages. This is the inheritance of the descendants of Benjamin according to their families.
6:19:1/And the second lot was drawn for Simeon, for the tribe of Simeon's descendants according to their families: their inheritance was within the territory of Judah's descendants.
6:19:2/Their territory included Beersheba, Sheba, and Moladah,
6:19:3/As well as Hazarshual, Balah, and Azem,
6:19:4/And Eltolad, Bethul, and Hormah,
6:19:5/Also Ziklag, Bethmarcaboth, and Hazarsusah,
6:19:6/And Bethlebaoth, and Sharuhen; thirteen cities along with their surrounding villages:
6:19:7/Ain, Remmon, Ether, and Ashan; four cities and their villages:
6:19:8/And all the villages around these cities up to Baalathbeer, Ramath of the south. This is the inheritance of the Simeonite tribe according to their families.
6:19:9/The Simeonites received their inheritance from the portion of Judah's descendants because Judah's portion was too large for them; thus, the Simeonites' inheritance was within Judah's territory.
6:19:10/And the third lot came up for the Zebulunites according to their families: the boundary of their inheritance reached Sarid:
6:19:11/Their boundary extended toward the sea, included Maralah, reached Dabbasheth, and went up to the river near Jokneam;
6:19:12/It turned from Sarid eastward toward the sunrise to the boundary of Chislothtabor, then went to Daberath, and up to Japhia,
6:19:13/From there it continued east to Gittahhepher, to Ittahkazin, and went out to Remmonmethoar to Neah;
6:19:14/The boundary circled north to Hannathon, ending in the valley of Jiphthahel:
6:19:15/Including Kattath, Nahallal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem: twelve cities with their villages.
6:19:16/This is the inheritance of the Zebulunites according to their families, these cities with their villages.
6:19:17/And the fourth lot came out for Issachar, for the Issacharites according to their families.
6:19:18/Their boundary included Jezreel, Chesulloth, and Shunem,
6:19:19/And Haphraim, Shihon, and Anaharath,
6:19:20/And Rabbith, Kishion, and Abez,
6:19:21/And Remeth, Engannim, Enhaddah, and Bethpazzez;
6:19:22/The boundary reached Tabor, Shahazimah, and Bethshemesh; the end of their boundary was at the Jordan: sixteen cities with their villages.
6:19:23/This is the inheritance of the Issacharite tribe according to their families, the cities and their villages.
6:19:24/And the fifth lot came out for the Asherites according to their families.
6:19:25/Their boundary included Helkath, Hali, Beten, and Achshaph,
6:19:26/And Alammelech, Amad, and Misheal; it reached to Carmel westward, and to Shihorlibnath;
6:19:27/It turned toward the sunrise to Bethdagon, reached Zebulun, and the valley of Jiphthahel north of Bethemek and Neiel, and extended to Cabul on the left,
6:19:28/And Hebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, as far as great Zidon;
6:19:29/Then the boundary turned to Ramah, reaching the fortified city of Tyre; the boundary turned to Hosah, ending at the sea by the region of Achzib:
6:19:30/Including Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob: twenty-two cities with their villages.
6:19:31/This is the inheritance of the Asherite tribe according to their families, these cities with their villages.
6:19:32/The sixth lot came out for the Naphtalites, for the Naphtalites according to their families.
6:19:33/Their boundary started from Heleph, from the oak in Zaanannim, included Adami, Nekeb, and Jabneel, up to Lakum; and it ended at the Jordan:
6:19:34/Then the boundary turned westward to Aznothtabor, and from there it went to Hukkok, touching Zebulun on the south, Asher on the west, and Judah at the Jordan toward the sunrise.
6:19:35/The fortified cities included Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth,
6:19:36/And Adamah, Ramah, and Hazor,
6:19:37/And Kedesh, Edrei, and Enhazor,
6:19:38/And Iron, Migdalel, Horem, Bethanath, and Bethshemesh; nineteen cities with their villages.
6:19:39/This is the inheritance of the Naphtalite tribe according to their families, the cities and their villages.
6:19:40/And the seventh lot came out for the Danites according to their families.
6:19:41/The boundary of their inheritance included Zorah, Eshtaol, and Irshemesh,
6:19:42/And Shaalabbin, Ajalon, and Jethlah,
6:19:43/And Elon, Thimnathah, and Ekron,
6:19:44/And Eltekeh, Gibbethon, and Baalath,
6:19:45/And Jehud, Beneberak, and Gathrimmon,
6:19:46/And Mejarkon, and Rakkon, with the territory facing Japho.
