13:1:9/And the sons of Cush; Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.
13:1:10/And Cush fathered Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one on the earth.
13:1:11/And Mizraim fathered Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,
13:1:12/And Pathrusim, Casluhim, (from whom the Philistines came,) and Caphtorim.
13:1:13/And Canaan fathered Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,
13:1:14/The Jebusite also, the Amorite, and the Girgashite,
13:1:15/And the Hivite, the Arkite, and the Sinite,
13:1:16/And the Arvadite, the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.
13:1:17/The sons of Shem; Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
13:1:18/And Arphaxad fathered Shelah, and Shelah fathered Eber.
13:1:19/And to Eber were born two sons: the name of one was Peleg; because in his days the earth was divided: and his brother’s name was Joktan.
13:1:20/And Joktan fathered Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
13:1:21/Hadoram also, Uzal, Diklah,
13:1:22/And Ebal, Abimael, and Sheba,
13:1:23/And Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
13:1:24/Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
13:1:25/Eber, Peleg, Reu,
13:1:26/Serug, Nahor, Terah,
13:1:27/Abram; the same is Abraham.
13:1:28/The sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.
13:1:29/These are their generations: The firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, Adbeel, and Mibsam,
13:1:30/Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,
13:1:31/Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
13:1:32/Now the sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bore Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan; Sheba, and Dedan.
13:1:33/And the sons of Midian; Ephah, Epher, Henoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these are the sons of Keturah.
13:1:34/And Abraham fathered Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.
13:1:35/The sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jaalam, and Korah.
13:1:36/The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.
13:1:37/The sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
13:1:38/And the sons of Seir; Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezar, and Dishan.
13:1:39/And the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna was Lotan’s sister.
13:1:40/The sons of Shobal; Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. and the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah.
13:1:41/The sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
13:1:42/The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, Zavan, and Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.
13:1:43/Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel; Bela the son of Beor: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
13:1:44/And when Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his place.
13:1:45/And when Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
13:1:46/And when Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his place: and the name of his city was Avith.
13:1:47/And when Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his place.
13:1:48/And when Samlah died, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his place.
13:1:49/And when Shaul died, Baalhanan the son of Achbor reigned in his place.
13:1:50/And when Baalhanan died, Hadad reigned in his place: and the name of his city was Pai; and his wife’s name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
13:1:51/Hadad also died. And the chiefs of Edom were; chief Timnah, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,
13:1:52/Chief Aholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,
13:1:53/Chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,
13:1:54/Chief Magdiel, chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.
13:2:1/These are the descendants of Israel; Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,
13:2:2/Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
13:2:3/The sons of Judah were Er, Onan, and Shelah, born to him by the daughter of Shua the Canaanite. Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the LORD's eyes, so the LORD took his life.
13:2:4/And Tamar, his daughter-in-law, gave birth to Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in total.
13:2:5/The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.
13:2:6/And the sons of Zerah were Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five in total.
13:2:7/And the sons of Carmi were Achar, who caused trouble for Israel by sinning with the devoted things.
13:2:8/And the sons of Ethan were Azariah.
13:2:9/The sons of Hezron born to him were Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
13:2:10/And Ram fathered Amminadab; and Amminadab fathered Nahshon, leader of the descendants of Judah;
13:2:11/And Nahshon fathered Salmon, and Salmon fathered Boaz,
13:2:12/And Boaz fathered Obed, and Obed fathered Jesse,
13:2:13/And Jesse fathered his firstborn Eliab, Abinadab the second, Shimma the third,
13:2:14/Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
13:2:15/Ozem the sixth, David the seventh:
13:2:16/Whose sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three.
13:2:17/And Abigail gave birth to Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.
13:2:18/And Caleb, the son of Hezron, had children with Azubah his wife, and with Jerioth: their sons were Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
13:2:19/After Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
13:2:20/And Hur fathered Uri, and Uri fathered Bezalel.
13:2:21/Later, Hezron married the daughter of Machir, the father of Gilead, when he was sixty years old; she bore him Segub.
13:2:22/And Segub fathered Jair, who owned twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
13:2:23/He captured Geshur and Aram, along with the towns of Jair, from them, as well as Kenath and its surrounding settlements, sixty towns in total. All these were descendants of Machir, the father of Gilead.
13:2:24/After Hezron died in Calebephratah, Abiah, Hezron’s wife, bore him Ashur, the father of Tekoa.
13:2:25/And the sons of Jerahmeel, the firstborn of Hezron, were Ram the firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
13:2:26/Jerahmeel also had another wife named Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
13:2:27/And the sons of Ram, the firstborn of Jerahmeel, were Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
13:2:28/And the sons of Onam were Shammai and Jada. And the sons of Shammai were Nadab and Abishur.
13:2:29/Abishur's wife was named Abihail, who bore him Ahban and Molid.
13:2:30/And the sons of Nadab were Seled and Appaim; but Seled died without children.
13:2:31/And the sons of Appaim were Ishi, and the sons of Ishi were Sheshan, and the descendants of Sheshan were Ahlai.
13:2:32/And the sons of Jada, the brother of Shammai, were Jether and Jonathan; and Jether died without children.
13:2:33/And the sons of Jonathan were Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
13:2:34/Now Sheshan had no sons, only daughters. But Sheshan had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.
13:2:35/And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant as a wife, and she bore him Attai.
13:2:36/And Attai fathered Nathan, and Nathan fathered Zabad,
13:2:37/And Zabad fathered Ephlal, and Ephlal fathered Obed,
13:2:38/And Obed fathered Jehu, and Jehu fathered Azariah,
13:2:39/And Azariah fathered Helez, and Helez fathered Eleasah,
13:2:40/And Eleasah fathered Sisamai, and Sisamai fathered Shallum,
13:2:41/And Shallum fathered Jekamiah, and Jekamiah fathered Elishama.
13:2:42/Now the sons of Caleb, the brother of Jerahmeel, were Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah, the father of Hebron.
13:2:43/And the sons of Hebron were Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
13:2:44/And Shema fathered Raham, the father of Jorkoam; and Rekem fathered Shammai.
13:2:45/And the son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Bethzur.
13:2:46/And Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez; and Haran fathered Gazez.
13:2:47/And the sons of Jahdai were Regem, Jotham, Gesham, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
13:2:48/Maachah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
13:2:49/She also bore Shaaph, the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah, and the father of Gibea; and the daughter of Caleb was Achsa.
13:2:50/These were the descendants of Caleb, the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratah; Shobal the father of Kirjathjearim.
13:2:51/Salma the father of Bethlehem, Hareph the father of Bethgader.
13:2:52/And Shobal, the father of Kirjathjearim, had descendants; Haroeh, and half of the Manahethites.
13:2:53/And the clans of Kirjathjearim were the Ithrites, Puhites, Shumathites, and Mishraites; from them came the Zareathites and Eshtaulites,
13:2:54/The descendants of Salma were Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Manahethites, the Zorites.
13:2:55/And the clans of the scribes who lived at Jabez were the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Suchathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the ancestor of the house of Rechab.
13:3:1/Here are the sons of David, born to him in Hebron; the firstborn was Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second was Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelitess.

13:4:1/The descendants of Judah were Pharez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
13:4:2/Reaiah, Shobal's son, fathered Jahath; Jahath fathered Ahumai and Lahad. These are the clans of the Zorathites.
13:4:3/These were from the lineage of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, Idbash, and their sister Hazelelponi.
13:4:4/Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah. These are the descendants of Hur, the firstborn of Ephratah and the progenitor of Bethlehem.
13:4:5/Ashur, the founder of Tekoa, had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
13:4:6/Naarah bore him Ahuzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were Naarah's sons.

13:4:10/Jabez prayed to the God of Israel, "Please bless me abundantly, expand my territory, be with me, and keep me from harm so I won't suffer!" And God granted his request.

13:4:19/The sons of his wife Hodiah, Naham's sister, were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.
13:4:20/The sons of Shimon were Amnon, Rinnah, Benhanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were Zoheth and Benzoheth.

13:4:22/Jokim, the people of Cozeba, Joash, Saraph, who ruled in Moab, and Jashubilehem. These records are ancient.
13:4:23/They were potters living among plants and hedges, serving the king in his work, and they settled there.

13:4:25/Shallum was his son, Mibsam his son, and Mishma his son.
13:4:26/The descendants of Mishma were Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, and Shimei his son.
13:4:27/Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many children, nor did their family grow as much as the children of Judah.
13:4:28/They lived in Beersheba, Moladah, and Hazarshual,
13:4:29/and in Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
13:4:30/Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
13:4:31/Bethmarcaboth, Hazarsusim, Bethbirei, and Shaaraim. These were their cities until the reign of David.
13:4:32/Their villages included Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan—five cities.
13:4:33/And all the villages around these cities as far as Baal. These were their settlements, and they kept a genealogical record.

13:4:35/Joel, Jehu the son of Josibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
13:4:36/Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, and Benaiah,
13:4:37/Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;
13:4:38/These individuals were leaders in their families, and their ancestral houses grew significantly.
13:4:39/They went to the entrance of Gedor, to the east side of the valley, in search of pasture for their flocks.
13:4:40/They found rich and good pasture, and the land was spacious, peaceful, and quiet, for those from Ham had lived there previously.
13:4:41/Those listed by name arrived during the reign of Hezekiah, king of Judah, attacked their tents and the inhabitants found there, completely destroying them to this day. They settled in their place because there was ample pasture for their flocks.
13:4:42/Some of them, five hundred men from the Simeonites, went to Mount Seir, led by Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
13:4:43/They defeated the remaining Amalekites who had escaped and have lived there to this day.
13:5:1/Now Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, had his birthright given to Joseph's sons because he dishonored his father's bed. So, the family records don't follow the birthright.
13:5:2/Judah became more prominent than his brothers, and from him came the leader, but the birthright belonged to Joseph.
13:5:3/The sons of Reuben, Israel's firstborn, were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
13:5:4/The descendants of Joel were Shemaiah, Gog, Shimei,
13:5:5/Micah, Reaia, Baal,
13:5:6/and Beerah, whom Tilgathpilneser, king of Assyria, took captive. He was a leader of the Reubenites.
13:5:7/His relatives, by their clans, when listed in their genealogy, were the leaders Jeiel and Zechariah,
13:5:8/and Bela, son of Azaz, son of Shema, son of Joel. They lived in Aroer, up to Nebo and Baalmeon.
13:5:9/To the east, they settled as far as the edge of the desert, from the Euphrates River because their livestock had multiplied in Gilead.
13:5:10/During Saul's reign, they fought against the Hagarites, who were defeated by their hands. They lived in the Hagarites' tents throughout the region east of Gilead.
13:5:11/The Gadites lived next to them in Bashan, reaching as far as Salcah.
13:5:12/Joel was the leader, followed by Shapham, then Jaanai and Shaphat in Bashan.
13:5:13/Their relatives in their families were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jachan, Zia, and Heber—seven in total.
13:5:14/These were the descendants of Abihail, son of Huri, son of Jaroah, son of Gilead, son of Michael, son of Jeshishai, son of Jahdo, son of Buz.
13:5:15/Ahi, son of Abdiel, son of Guni, was the leader of their family.
13:5:16/They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its towns, and on all the pasturelands of Sharon as far as their borders.
13:5:17/All these were recorded in genealogies during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.
13:5:18/The Reubenites, Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 warriors, skilled in carrying shield and sword, shooting with bows, and trained in warfare.
13:5:19/They fought against the Hagarites, Jetur, Nephish, and Nodab.
13:5:20/They were victorious because they prayed to God during the battle, and He answered them since they trusted in Him.
13:5:21/They captured 50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, 2,000 donkeys, and 100,000 people.
13:5:22/Many were killed because God was involved in the battle. They lived in the conquered lands until they were taken captive.
13:5:23/The half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land, growing in number from Bashan to Baalhermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon.
13:5:24/These were the leaders of their families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, warriors of renown and heads of their families.
13:5:25/But they sinned against the God of their ancestors by worshiping the gods of the peoples God had destroyed before them.
13:5:26/So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria and Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria, who deported the Reubenites, Gadites, and half-tribe of Manasseh to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the Gozan River, where they are to this day.

13:7:2/And the sons of Tola were Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Jibsam, and Shemuel, leaders of their family line, specifically from Tola. They were courageous warriors in their time, with a total of twenty-two thousand six hundred members during the era of David.
13:7:3/And the sons of Uzzi were Izrahiah, and Izrahiah's sons were Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Ishiah, making five in total, all of them leading figures.
13:7:4/Together, according to their family generations, they formed military units totaling thirty-six thousand men, as they had many wives and children.
13:7:5/And their relatives across all the families of Issachar were also courageous warriors, totaling eighty-seven thousand when counted by their genealogies.

13:7:7/And the sons of Bela were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri, five in total, leaders of their family, known as brave warriors; their total count by genealogy was twenty-two thousand thirty-four.
13:7:8/And the sons of Becher were Zemira, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jerimoth, Abiah, Anathoth, and Alameth. These were all the sons of Becher.

13:7:22/And Ephraim, their father, grieved for many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.
13:7:23/And when he was with his wife again, she conceived and bore a son, whom he named Beriah, because tragedy had struck his household.

13:7:40/All these were the descendants of Asher, leaders of their family lines, distinguished and brave warriors, chiefs among the leaders. The total number of men fit for war and battle was twenty-six thousand.
13:8:1/Benjamin had several sons: Bela was his firstborn, followed by Ashbel, and then Aharah,

13:9:1/So all Israel were recorded by genealogies; and, look, they were written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, who were taken to Babylon because of their sins.
13:9:2/The first people to live in their own lands in their cities were the Israelites, the priests, Levites, and the Nethinims.
13:9:3/And in Jerusalem lived descendants of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh;
13:9:4/Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, from the descendants of Pharez the son of Judah.
13:9:5/And from the Shilonites; Asaiah the firstborn, and his sons.
13:9:6/And from the sons of Zerah; Jeuel, and their brothers, six hundred and ninety.
13:9:7/And from the sons of Benjamin; Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hasenuah,
13:9:8/And Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephathiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
13:9:9/And their brothers, according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty-six. All these men were leaders of their ancestral houses.
13:9:10/And among the priests; Jedaiah, and Jehoiarib, and Jachin,
13:9:11/And Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the leader of the house of God;
13:9:12/And Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasiai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
13:9:13/And their brothers, leaders of their ancestral houses, one thousand seven hundred and sixty; very capable men for the work of serving in the house of God.
13:9:14/And among the Levites; Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, from the sons of Merari;
13:9:15/And Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Micah, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;
13:9:16/And Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
13:9:17/And the gatekeepers were Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brothers: Shallum was the chief;
13:9:18/Who until now waited at the king’s gate on the east side: they were gatekeepers in the groups of the children of Levi.
13:9:19/And Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brothers, from his family, the Korahites, were in charge of the service work, guardians of the gates of the tabernacle: and their ancestors, in charge of the camp of the LORD, were guardians of the entrance.
13:9:20/And Phinehas the son of Eleazar was their leader in the past, and the LORD was with him.
13:9:21/And Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
13:9:22/All those chosen to be gatekeepers at the gates numbered two hundred and twelve. They were recorded by their genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer appointed to their trusted positions.
13:9:23/So they and their children were in charge of the gates of the house of the LORD, the house of the tent, by shifts.
13:9:24/The gatekeepers were stationed on the four sides: east, west, north, and south.
13:9:25/And their relatives in their villages were required to come periodically, every seven days, to be with them.
13:9:26/For the four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted with the responsibility for the rooms and treasuries in the house of God.
13:9:27/And they stayed around the house of God because the responsibility was theirs, and they had to open it every morning.
13:9:28/And some of them were in charge of the serving vessels, for they were required to bring them in and out by count.
13:9:29/Some were appointed to take care of the vessels, all the instruments of the sanctuary, the fine flour, the wine, the oil, the incense, and the spices.
13:9:30/And some of the priests' sons mixed the spice ointment.
13:9:31/And Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, was in charge of preparing the offerings baked in pans.
13:9:32/And some of their brothers, from the sons of the Kohathites, were in charge of preparing the showbread every Sabbath.
13:9:33/And these are the singers, leaders among the fathers of the Levites, who stayed in the rooms and were exempt from other duties because they were engaged in their work day and night.
13:9:34/These leaders of the fathers among the Levites were chiefs throughout their generations; they lived in Jerusalem.
13:9:35/And in Gibeon lived the father of Gibeon, Jehiel, whose wife’s name was Maachah:
13:9:36/And his firstborn son Abdon, then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Ner, and Nadab.
13:9:37/And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.
13:9:38/And Mikloth fathered Shimeam. And they also lived with their relatives in Jerusalem, opposite their other relatives.
13:9:39/And Ner fathered Kish; and Kish fathered Saul; and Saul fathered Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
13:9:40/And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal: and Meribbaal fathered Micah.
13:9:41/And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, and Ahaz.
13:9:42/And Ahaz fathered Jarah; and Jarah fathered Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri fathered Moza;
13:9:43/And Moza fathered Binea; and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
13:9:44/And Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan: these were the sons of Azel.
13:10:1/The Philistines fought against Israel; the Israelites fled from them and were killed on Mount Gilboa.
13:10:2/The Philistines pursued Saul and his sons, killing Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchishua, Saul's sons.
13:10:3/The battle was fierce against Saul, and archers hit him, causing severe injuries.
13:10:4/Saul then told his armor-bearer, "Draw your sword and kill me with it; I don't want these uncircumcised men to come and mistreat me." But his armor-bearer was too scared to do it. So, Saul took his own sword and fell on it.
13:10:5/Seeing that Saul was dead, his armor-bearer also killed himself with his sword.
13:10:6/Thus, Saul, his three sons, and his entire household died together.
13:10:7/When the Israelites in the valley saw that their army had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and ran away. The Philistines then moved in and occupied them.
13:10:8/The next day, when the Philistines came to loot the bodies, they found Saul and his sons dead on Mount Gilboa.
13:10:9/After stripping him, they took his head and armor, and sent them throughout Philistine territory to proclaim the news to their idols and people.
13:10:10/They placed his armor in the temple of their gods and hung his head in the temple of Dagon.
13:10:11/When the people of Jabesh-gilead heard what the Philistines had done to Saul,
13:10:12/All the brave men set out, retrieved the bodies of Saul and his sons, brought them back to Jabesh, and buried their bones under an oak in Jabesh, then fasted for seven days.
13:10:13/Saul died because of his unfaithfulness to the LORD, for not obeying the LORD's command, and also for consulting a medium for guidance,
13:10:14/Instead of seeking guidance from the LORD. Therefore, the LORD killed him and transferred the kingdom to David, the son of Jesse.
13:11:1/Then all Israel came together to David in Hebron, saying, "Look, we are your own flesh and blood.
13:11:2/And even before, when Saul was king, you were the one leading Israel in and out; and the LORD your God told you, 'You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will be the leader over my people Israel.'
13:11:3/So all the elders of Israel came to the king in Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the LORD; and they anointed David king over Israel, as the LORD had declared through Samuel.
13:11:4/David and all Israel then went to Jerusalem, which is Jebus; where the Jebusites, the original inhabitants of the land, were.
13:11:5/And the people of Jebus told David, 'You will not enter here.' Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion, now known as the City of David.
13:11:6/David announced, 'Whoever strikes the Jebusites first will become the leader and commander.' So Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and became the leader.
13:11:7/David lived in the fortress; therefore, it was called the City of David.
13:11:8/He expanded the city all around, from the Millo and around, and Joab rebuilt the rest of the city.
13:11:9/Thus, David became more and more powerful, because the LORD Almighty was with him.
13:11:10/These are also the leaders of the mighty warriors who were with David, who strengthened their support for him in his kingdom, along with all Israel, to make him king, according to the LORD's word concerning Israel.
13:11:11/Here is the list of the mighty warriors David had; Jashobeam, an Hachmonite, the leader of the officers: he wielded his spear against three hundred killed by him at one time.
13:11:12/Next to him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty warriors.
13:11:13/He was with David at Pasdammim, where the Philistines had gathered for battle. There was a field full of barley, and the people fled from the Philistines.
13:11:14/But they took a stand in the middle of the field, defended it, and defeated the Philistines; and the LORD brought about a great victory.
13:11:15/Now three of the thirty leaders went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam, while the Philistine army camped in the Valley of Rephaim.
13:11:16/At that time, David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem.
13:11:17/David expressed a longing, saying, "If only someone would get me a drink of water from the well by the gate of Bethlehem!"
13:11:18/So the three broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well of Bethlehem by the gate, and carried it back to David. But David refused to drink it and instead poured it out as an offering to the LORD.
13:11:19/He said, "God forbid that I should do this! Should I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?" Because they risked their lives to bring it back, he refused to drink it. Such were the deeds of the three mightiest warriors.
13:11:20/And Abishai, Joab's brother, was the leader of the three. He raised his spear against three hundred men, killed them, and became famous among the three.
13:11:21/Among the three, he was more honored than the other two and became their commander, but he did not attain the rank of the first three.
13:11:22/Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a brave man from Kabzeel, performed great deeds. He struck down two of Moab's best warriors. He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.
13:11:23/He killed an impressive Egyptian, who was five cubits tall. Although the Egyptian had a spear like a weaver's rod, Benaiah went down to him with a club, snatched the spear from the Egyptian's hand, and killed him with his own spear.
13:11:24/These are the deeds of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, who earned a reputation among the three mighty warriors.
13:11:25/He was distinguished among the thirty, but he did not reach the rank of the first three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard.
13:11:26/Also among the valiant warriors were Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo from Bethlehem,
13:11:27/Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
13:11:28/Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Antothite,
13:11:29/Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
13:11:30/Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
13:11:31/Ithai the son of Ribai from Gibeah of the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
13:11:32/Hurai from the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
13:11:33/Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
13:11:34/The sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shage the Hararite,
13:11:35/Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
13:11:36/Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
13:11:37/Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
13:11:38/Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Haggeri,
13:11:39/Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor-bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
13:11:40/Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

13:11:47/Eliel, and Obed, and Jasiel the Mesobaite.
13:12:1/Now these are the people who came to David in Ziklag, while he was still hiding because of Saul, the son of Kish. They were among the elite warriors, aiding in the battle.
13:12:2/They were skilled with bows, able to use both the right and left hand for slinging stones and shooting arrows from a bow, including those from Saul’s own tribe of Benjamin.
13:12:3/The leader was Ahiezer, followed by Joash, the sons of Shemaah from Gibeath; and Jeziel, and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; along with Berachah, and Jehu from Anathoth.
13:12:4/And Ismaiah from Gibeon, a standout among the thirty, leading them; and Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, and Josabad from Gederah,
13:12:5/Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, and Shephatiah from Haruph,
13:12:6/Elkanah, Jesiah, Azareel, Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites,
13:12:7/And Joelah, and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham from Gedor.
13:12:8/From the Gadites, some separated themselves to join David in the wilderness stronghold, warriors ready for battle, skilled with shield and spear, with faces like lions and as swift as gazelles on the mountains;
13:12:9/Ezer the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
13:12:10/Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
13:12:11/Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
13:12:12/Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
13:12:13/Jeremiah the tenth, Machbanai the eleventh.
13:12:14/These were from the sons of Gad, leaders of the army: the least could lead a hundred, and the greatest, a thousand.
13:12:15/They crossed the Jordan in the first month when it overflowed all its banks; they chased away all the valley dwellers, to the east and to the west.
13:12:16/And members from the tribes of Benjamin and Judah came to the stronghold to join David.
13:12:17/David went out to meet them and said, "If you've come in peace to assist me, my heart will join with yours. But if you're here to betray me to my enemies, even though I've done no wrong, may the God of our ancestors see it and judge."
13:12:18/Then the spirit came upon Amasai, the leader of the captains, and he said, "We are yours, David, and with you, son of Jesse. Peace, peace to you, and peace to your allies; for your God assists you." Then David welcomed them and made them leaders of his troops.
13:12:19/Some from Manasseh defected to David when he was going with the Philistines to fight against Saul. But they didn't help the Philistines because, after consultation, the Philistine lords sent him away, saying, "He might defect to his master Saul at the cost of our heads."
13:12:20/As he went to Ziklag, men from Manasseh joined him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zilthai, leaders of thousands in Manasseh.
13:12:21/They helped David against raiding bands, for they were all mighty warriors and commanders in the army.
13:12:22/Day by day, more came to help David until he had a great army, like God's own army.
13:12:23/These are the numbers of the warriors ready for battle who came to David in Hebron to transfer Saul’s kingdom to him, as the LORD had commanded.
13:12:24/The men of Judah carrying shield and spear numbered 6,800, ready for battle.
13:12:25/From the tribe of Simeon, 7,100 mighty warriors ready for battle.
13:12:26/From the Levites, 4,600.
13:12:27/And Jehoiada, leader of the Aaronites, with 3,700,
13:12:28/And Zadok, a young warrior, with 22 captains from his family.
13:12:29/From Benjamin, Saul’s tribe, 3,000, most of whom had remained loyal to Saul’s house until then.
13:12:30/From Ephraim, 20,800 mighty warriors, famous in their own clans.
13:12:31/From the half-tribe of Manasseh, 18,000, designated by name to come and make David king.
13:12:32/From Issachar, men who understood the times and knew what Israel should do, 200 chiefs, with all their relatives under their command.
13:12:33/From Zebulun, 50,000 experienced soldiers, equipped for battle with all types of weapons, ready to assist with undivided loyalty.
13:12:34/From Naphtali, 1,000 commanders, with 37,000 men carrying shields and spears.
13:12:35/From Dan, 28,600 men ready for battle.
13:12:36/From Asher, 40,000 experienced soldiers ready for battle.
13:12:37/From across the Jordan, from the Reubenites, Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, 120,000 men equipped with all kinds of weapons for battle.
13:12:38/All these warriors, ready for battle, came to Hebron with a unified purpose to make David king over all Israel. And all the rest of Israel was of one mind to make David king.
13:12:39/They stayed with David for three days, eating and drinking, for their relatives had prepared for them.
13:12:40/Moreover, those nearby, from as far as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali, brought food on donkeys, camels, mules, and oxen—provisions of flour, fig cakes, clusters of raisins, wine, oil, oxen, and sheep in abundance, for there was joy in Israel.
13:13:1/And David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds, and with every leader.
13:13:2/And David said to the entire assembly of Israel, "If it seems good to you, and if it's in line with the will of the LORD our God, let's reach out to our brothers everywhere who are left in all the land of Israel, and to the priests and Levites in their towns and surrounding areas, so they can join us.
13:13:3/And let's bring the ark of our God back to us: for we didn't consult it during Saul's time.
13:13:4/And the whole assembly agreed to do so, for the idea was well received by everyone.
13:13:5/So David assembled all Israel, from the Shihor River in Egypt to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.
13:13:6/And David and all Israel went up to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath Jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring from there the ark of God the LORD, who is enthroned between the cherubim, whose name is invoked over it.
13:13:7/And they transported the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
13:13:8/And David and all Israel celebrated before God with all their might, with singing, and with harps, lyres, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.
13:13:9/And when they reached the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza reached out his hand to steady the ark, because the oxen stumbled.
13:13:10/And the LORD's anger burned against Uzza, and He struck him down because he touched the ark; and there he died before God.
13:13:11/And David was upset because the LORD had struck Uzza; that's why that place is called Perez Uzza to this day.
13:13:12/And David was afraid of God that day, thinking, "How can I bring the ark of God to my home?"
13:13:13/So David did not take the ark to his own city, but diverted it to the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.
13:13:14/And the ark of God stayed with the family of Obed-Edom in his house for three months. And the LORD blessed Obed-Edom's household and everything he had.
13:14:1/Now Hiram, the king of Tyre, sent messengers to David, along with cedar timber, masons, and carpenters, to build him a house.
13:14:2/And David realized that the LORD had established him as king over Israel, for his kingdom was highly exalted, because of his people Israel.
13:14:3/And David took more wives in Jerusalem: and David had more sons and daughters.
13:14:4/Now these are the names of his children whom he had in Jerusalem; Shammua, and Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,
13:14:5/And Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpalet,
13:14:6/And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
13:14:7/And Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphalet.
13:14:8/And when the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to search for David. And David heard of it, and went out to confront them.
13:14:9/And the Philistines came and spread out in the valley of Rephaim.
13:14:10/And David asked God, saying, "Should I go up against the Philistines? Will you hand them over to me?" And the LORD said to him, "Go up; for I will hand them over to you."
13:14:11/So they went up to Baalperazim; and David defeated them there. Then David said, "God has broken through my enemies by my hand like a flood." Therefore, they named that place Baalperazim.
13:14:12/And when they left their gods there, David ordered them to be burned.
13:14:13/And the Philistines spread out again in the valley.
13:14:14/Therefore, David asked God again; and God told him, "Do not go up after them; circle around them, and attack them near the mulberry trees."
13:14:15/And it shall be, when you hear the sound of movement in the tops of the mulberry trees, then you shall go out to battle: for God has gone out before you to strike down the Philistine army.
13:14:16/David therefore did as God had commanded him: and they struck down the Philistine army from Gibeon to Gazer.
13:14:17/And David's fame spread throughout all lands; and the LORD made all nations fear him.
13:15:1/David built houses in the city of David, prepared a place for the ark of God, and set up a tent for it.
13:15:2/Then David declared that only the Levites should carry the ark of God because the LORD had chosen them for this task and to serve Him forever.
13:15:3/David brought all of Israel together in Jerusalem to move the ark of the LORD to the place he had prepared for it.
13:15:4/And David gathered the descendants of Aaron and the Levites:
13:15:5/From the Kohathites, Uriel was the leader, with 120 of his relatives.
13:15:6/From the Merarites, Asaiah was the leader, with 220 of his relatives.
13:15:7/From the Gershonites, Joel was the leader, with 130 of his relatives.
13:15:8/From the Elizaphanites, Shemaiah was the leader, with 200 of his relatives.
13:15:9/From the Hebronites, Eliel was the leader, with 80 of his relatives.
13:15:10/From the Uzzielites, Amminadab was the leader, with 112 of his relatives.
13:15:11/David summoned Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and the Levites: Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab,
13:15:12/And told them, "You are the leaders of the Levite families. Purify yourselves and your relatives so you can bring the ark of the LORD God of Israel to the place I have prepared for it."
13:15:13/Because we didn't do it correctly the first time, the LORD our God punished us since we didn't consult Him properly.
13:15:14/So the priests and Levites purified themselves to transport the ark of the LORD God of Israel.
13:15:15/The Levites carried the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles, as Moses had instructed according to the LORD's command.
13:15:16/David instructed the Levite leaders to appoint musicians to play instruments like lyres, harps, and cymbals, and to sing joyfully.
13:15:17/The Levites appointed Heman, son of Joel; Asaph, son of Berechiah; and from the Merarites, Ethan, son of Kushaiah;
13:15:18/Along with their second-tier relatives: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obededom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.
13:15:19/So the musicians, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were assigned to play the bronze cymbals;
13:15:20/And Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah played lyres tuned to Alamoth;
13:15:21/And Mattithiah, Elipheleh, Mikneiah, Obededom, Jeiel, and Azaziah played harps tuned to Sheminith to lead the music.
13:15:22/Chenaniah, the lead Levite in music, directed the music because he was skilled.
13:15:23/Berechiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the ark.
13:15:24/And Shebaniah, Jehoshaphat, Nethaneel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, played the trumpets before the ark of God, and Obededom and Jehiah were gatekeepers for the ark.
13:15:25/So David, the elders of Israel, and the commanders of thousands went to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD from Obededom's house with joy.
13:15:26/When God helped the Levites carrying the ark of the covenant of the LORD, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
13:15:27/David wore a robe of fine linen, as did all the Levites carrying the ark, the singers, and Chenaniah, the music director. David also wore a linen ephod.
13:15:28/Thus, all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouts, the sound of the horn, trumpets, and cymbals, and loud music from lyres and harps.
13:15:29/As the ark of the covenant of the LORD arrived in the city of David, Michal, daughter of Saul, watched from a window and saw King David dancing and celebrating. She felt contempt for him in her heart.
13:16:1/So they brought the ark of God and placed it in the center of the tent that David had set up for it. They then offered burnt sacrifices and peace offerings before God.
13:16:2/After David finished offering the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
13:16:3/He distributed to every person in Israel, both men and women, a loaf of bread, a generous portion of meat, and a container of wine.
13:16:4/He assigned some of the Levites to serve before the ark of the LORD, to keep records, and to express gratitude and praise to the LORD God of Israel.
13:16:5/Asaph was the leader, followed by Zechariah, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obededom. Jeiel played the psalteries and harps, while Asaph played the cymbals.
13:16:6/Benaiah and Jahaziel, the priests, played trumpets continuously before the ark of the covenant of God.
13:16:7/On that day, David first handed over this psalm to thank the LORD to Asaph and his brothers.
13:16:8/Express gratitude to the LORD, call on his name, and share his deeds with the people.
13:16:9/Sing to him, sing hymns to him, and discuss all his amazing works.
13:16:10/Take pride in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD be joyful.
13:16:11/Search for the LORD and his strength, constantly seek his presence.
13:16:12/Remember the incredible works he has done, his miracles, and the judgments he pronounced.
13:16:13/You descendants of Israel, his servants, children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
13:16:14/He is the LORD our God; his judgments are found throughout the earth.
13:16:15/Always remember his covenant, the promise he made for a thousand generations.
13:16:16/This includes the covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath to Isaac.
13:16:17/He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, and to Israel as an everlasting covenant.
13:16:18/He said, "I will give you the land of Canaan as your inherited possession."
13:16:19/When you were few in number, just a handful, and strangers in the land.
13:16:20/As they moved from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people.
13:16:21/He allowed no one to oppress them; for their sake, he rebuked kings.
13:16:22/Saying, "Do not touch my anointed ones; do my prophets no harm."
13:16:23/Sing to the LORD, all the earth; day by day, proclaim his salvation.
13:16:24/Share his glory among the nations, his marvelous works among all peoples.
13:16:25/For the LORD is great and highly to be praised; he is to be revered above all gods.
13:16:26/For all the gods of the peoples are mere idols, but the LORD created the heavens.
13:16:27/Majesty and splendor are before him; strength and joy are in his dwelling place.
13:16:28/Give to the LORD, families of the peoples, give to the LORD glory and strength.
13:16:29/Give to the LORD the glory due to his name; bring an offering, and come before him; worship the LORD in the splendor of holiness.
13:16:30/Revere him, all the earth; the world also will be stable, not to be shaken.
13:16:31/Let the heavens be joyful, and let the earth be glad; let it be known among the nations, "The LORD reigns."
13:16:32/Let the sea and everything in it roar; let the fields and everything in them rejoice.
13:16:33/Then the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the LORD, for he comes to judge the earth.
13:16:34/Express gratitude to the LORD, for he is good; his steadfast love endures forever.
13:16:35/And say, "Save us, O God of our salvation, gather us and deliver us from the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name and glory in your praise."
13:16:36/Blessed be the LORD God of Israel forever and ever. And all the people said, "Amen," and praised the LORD.
13:16:37/So he left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD to minister before the ark regularly, according to each day's requirements.
13:16:38/And Obededom with their sixty-eight brothers; Obededom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be gatekeepers.
13:16:39/And Zadok the priest, and his priestly brothers, before the tabernacle of the LORD at the high place that was at Gibeon,
13:16:40/To offer burnt offerings to the LORD on the altar of burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, and to do everything that is written in the law of the LORD, which he commanded Israel.
13:16:41/And with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest who were chosen and specifically named, to give thanks to the LORD, because his steadfast love endures forever.
13:16:42/And with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those who should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were gatekeepers.
13:16:43/And all the people went to their homes, and David returned to bless his household.
13:17:1/One day, as David was sitting in his house, he said to Nathan the prophet, "Look, I live in a house made of cedar, but the ark of God's covenant is under a tent."
13:17:2/Then Nathan replied to David, "Go ahead and do what's in your heart, because God is with you."
13:17:3/That very night, God spoke to Nathan, saying,
13:17:4/"Go and tell my servant David, 'This is what the LORD says: You are not to build me a house to live in.
13:17:5/Since the day I brought Israel up until now, I have not lived in a house but have moved from tent to tent, and from one dwelling place to another.
13:17:6/Wherever I have traveled with all Israel, did I ever ask any of the leaders whom I appointed to shepherd my people, "Why haven't you built me a house of cedar?"'
13:17:7/Now, this is what you are to tell my servant David: 'The LORD of hosts says, I took you from tending sheep to be ruler over my people Israel.
13:17:8/I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have eliminated all your enemies before you. I will make you as famous as the greatest people on earth.
13:17:9/I will designate a place for my people Israel and will plant them so they can live in their own place without being disturbed anymore. The wicked will not oppress them anymore as they did at the beginning,
13:17:10/And since the time I appointed leaders over my people Israel. I will also subdue all your enemies. Moreover, I declare to you that the LORD will build you a house.
13:17:11/When your time comes and you rest with your ancestors, I will raise up your descendant, one of your own sons, to succeed you, and I will establish his kingdom.
13:17:12/He is the one who will build a house for me, and I will secure his throne forever.
13:17:13/I will be his father, and he will be my son. I will never take my love away from him as I took it away from your predecessor.
13:17:14/But I will place him in my house and in my kingdom forever, and his throne will be established forever.'"
13:17:15/Following all these words and this entire vision, Nathan spoke to David.
13:17:16/Then King David went in and sat before the LORD, and said, "Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my family, that you have brought me this far?
13:17:17/And as if this was not enough in your sight, O God, you have spoken about the future of your servant's family for a long time and have looked on me as someone of high rank, O LORD God.
13:17:18/What more can David say to you for honoring your servant? You know your servant.
13:17:19/O LORD, for your servant's sake and according to your own heart, you have done all this greatness and revealed all these great things.
13:17:20/O LORD, there is no one like you, nor is there any God besides you, according to everything we have heard with our ears.
13:17:21/And what nation on earth is like your people Israel, whom God went to redeem as his own people, making yourself a name of great and awesome deeds, by driving out nations before your people whom you redeemed from Egypt?
13:17:22/You made your people Israel your own forever, and you, LORD, became their God.
13:17:23/So now, LORD, let the promise you have made concerning your servant and his house be established forever, and do as you have said.
13:17:24/Let it be established so that your name will be exalted forever, saying, 'The LORD of hosts is the God of Israel, and the house of David your servant is established before you.'
13:17:25/For you, my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house. Therefore, your servant has found courage to pray before you.
13:17:26/And now, LORD, you are God, and you have promised this goodness to your servant.
13:17:27/Now, please bless the house of your servant so that it may continue before you forever. For you, O LORD, have blessed it, and it will be blessed forever.
13:18:1/After this, David defeated the Philistines, subdued them, and captured Gath and its surrounding towns from the Philistines.
13:18:2/He also defeated Moab, and the Moabites became David's subjects, bringing him gifts.
13:18:3/David defeated Hadarezer, king of Zobah, near Hamath, as he was establishing his rule up to the Euphrates River.
13:18:4/David captured from him a thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand foot soldiers. David crippled all the chariot horses but kept a hundred chariots.
13:18:5/When the Syrians from Damascus came to support Hadarezer, king of Zobah, David killed twenty-two thousand Syrian men.
13:18:6/Then David placed military garrisons in Syria of Damascus, and the Syrians became David's subjects, bringing him gifts. Thus, the LORD protected David wherever he went.
13:18:7/David seized the gold shields carried by Hadarezer's officers and brought them to Jerusalem.
13:18:8/Also, from Tibhath and Chun, cities of Hadarezer, David acquired a great amount of bronze, which Solomon used to make the bronze sea, pillars, and bronze articles.
13:18:9/When Tou, king of Hamath, heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadarezer, king of Zobah;
13:18:10/He sent his son Hadoram to King David to ask about his well-being and to congratulate him for his victory over Hadarezer, since Hadarezer had been at war with Tou. He brought with him all kinds of items made of gold, silver, and bronze.
13:18:11/David dedicated these items to the LORD, along with the silver and gold he had taken from all these nations: Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and Amalek.
13:18:12/Furthermore, Abishai, son of Zeruiah, killed eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
13:18:13/He placed military garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became David's subjects. Thus, the LORD protected David wherever he went.
13:18:14/So David ruled over all Israel, administering justice and fairness to all his people.
13:18:15/Joab, son of Zeruiah, was in charge of the army; Jehoshaphat, son of Ahilud, was the recorder.
13:18:16/Zadok, son of Ahitub, and Abimelech, son of Abiathar, were the priests; and Shavsha was the secretary; 
13:18:17/Benaiah, son of Jehoiada, was in charge of the Cherethites and Pelethites; and David's sons were key advisors to the king.
13:19:1/After this event, Nahash, the king of the Ammonites, passed away, and his son succeeded him as king.
13:19:2/David said, "I will show kindness to Hanun, Nahash's son, because his father was kind to me." So, David sent messengers to comfort him about his father's death. David's servants arrived in Ammonite territory to console Hanun.
13:19:3/However, the Ammonite princes said to Hanun, "Do you really think David is honoring your father by sending these comforters? Aren't his servants here to scout, overthrow, and spy on our land?"
13:19:4/So, Hanun took David's servants, shaved them, cut their clothes at the buttocks, and sent them away humiliated.
13:19:5/Some people went and informed David about how the men were treated. David sent someone to meet them because they were deeply embarrassed. He told them, "Stay in Jericho until your beards grow back, then return."
13:19:6/Seeing they had angered David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent a thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen from Mesopotamia, Syriamaachah, and Zobah.
13:19:7/They managed to hire thirty-two thousand chariots, along with the king of Maachah and his troops, who camped before Medeba. The Ammonites also rallied from their cities for the battle.
13:19:8/When David heard about it, he dispatched Joab with all his elite warriors.
13:19:9/The Ammonites positioned themselves for battle at the city gate, while the allied kings took their positions in the open field.
13:19:10/Joab, seeing the battle lines against him both in front and behind, selected the best troops of Israel to face the Syrians.
13:19:11/He assigned the rest of the forces to his brother Abishai, positioning them against the Ammonites.
13:19:12/He said, "If the Syrians overpower me, you must come to my aid; if the Ammonites overpower you, I'll help you."
13:19:13/"Let's be brave and fight valiantly for our people and the cities of our God. May the LORD do what seems right to Him."
13:19:14/So Joab and his troops advanced towards the Syrians for battle, and the Syrians fled from them.
13:19:15/When the Ammonites saw the Syrians fleeing, they too fled from Abishai and retreated into the city. Then Joab returned to Jerusalem.
13:19:16/Seeing their defeat by Israel, the Syrians sent messengers to summon additional Syrian forces from beyond the river, with Shophach, the commander of Hadarezer's army, leading them.
13:19:17/When David was informed, he gathered all Israel, crossed the Jordan, engaged them, and arranged his forces for battle. David fought the Syrians.
13:19:18/But the Syrians fled from Israel, and David killed seven thousand charioteers and forty thousand foot soldiers, including Shophach, the army commander.
13:19:19/When Hadarezer's servants realized they were defeated by Israel, they made peace with David and became his subjects. After that, the Syrians refused to support the Ammonites again.
13:20:1/After a year had passed, during the season when kings typically went to war, Joab led the army's forces, devastated the land of the Ammonites, and laid siege to Rabbah. David, however, stayed in Jerusalem. Joab conquered Rabbah and destroyed it.
13:20:2/David removed the crown from their king's head, which weighed a talent of gold and was adorned with precious stones, and placed it on his own head. He also took a great amount of loot from the city.
13:20:3/He took the people within the city and subjected them to harsh treatment with saws, iron harrows, and axes. This was how David treated all the Ammonite cities. Then David and all his people returned to Jerusalem.
13:20:4/After this, a war broke out in Gezer with the Philistines; during this time, Sibbechai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the giants, and they were defeated.
13:20:5/There was another battle with the Philistines, where Elhanan, the son of Jair, killed Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite, whose spear was as big as a weaver's beam.
13:20:6/And again, there was a battle in Gath, where there was a man of great size, with twenty-four fingers and toes, six on each hand and foot, who was also descended from the giants.
13:20:7/But when he taunted Israel, Jonathan, the son of Shimea, David's brother, killed him.
13:20:8/These were descendants of the giants in Gath; they fell by the hand of David and his servants.
13:21:1/And Satan rose against Israel, inciting David to take a census of Israel.
13:21:2/And David instructed Joab and the leaders of the people, "Go, count Israel from Beersheba to Dan; and report back to me with the total, so I may know it."
13:21:3/Joab responded, "May the LORD multiply his people a hundred times over. But my lord the king, aren't they all your servants? Why does my lord want to do this? Why should he bring guilt upon Israel?"
13:21:4/Yet the king's command was stronger than Joab's objections. So Joab left, traveled throughout all Israel, and then returned to Jerusalem.
13:21:5/Joab presented the total population count to David. All of Israel had 1,100,000 men who could handle a sword, and Judah had 470,000 men who could handle a sword.
13:21:6/However, Joab did not include Levi and Benjamin in the count because the king's order was detestable to him.
13:21:7/And God was displeased with this action, so he struck Israel.
13:21:8/And David said to God, "I have sinned greatly by doing this. Now, I beg you, take away the guilt of your servant, for I have acted very foolishly."
13:21:9/And the LORD spoke to Gad, David's seer, saying,
13:21:10/"Go and tell David, 'This is what the LORD says: I am offering you three options. Choose one of them for me to carry out against you.'"
13:21:11/So Gad went to David and told him, "This is what the LORD says: 'Choose
13:21:12/Either three years of famine, three months of being defeated by your enemies with their swords overtaking you, or three days of the LORD's sword—plague in the land, with the angel of the LORD wreaking havoc throughout all Israel's territories. Now decide what answer I should take back to the one who sent me.'"
13:21:13/David said to Gad, "I am in deep distress. Let us fall into the hands of the LORD, for his mercy is very great, but do not let me fall into human hands."
13:21:14/So the LORD sent a plague upon Israel, and 70,000 men of Israel fell.
13:21:15/And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it, but as he was about to destroy it, the LORD saw and reconsidered the disaster, and said to the angel causing the destruction, "Enough, withdraw your hand now." And the angel of the LORD was standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
13:21:16/When David looked up, he saw the angel of the LORD standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand extended over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell on their faces.
13:21:17/And David said to God, "Was it not I who ordered the census of the people? I am the one who has sinned and done wrong. But these sheep, what have they done? LORD my God, let your hand be against me and my family, but do not let this plague be on your people."
13:21:18/Then the angel of the LORD instructed Gad to tell David to go up and build an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
13:21:19/And David went up at the word of Gad, which he spoke in the name of the LORD.
13:21:20/Ornan turned around and saw the angel; and his four sons with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
13:21:21/As David approached Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, stepped off the threshing floor, and bowed down to David with his face to the ground.
13:21:22/Then David said to Ornan, "Let me have the site of your threshing floor so I can build an altar to the LORD on it. Sell it to me at the full price, so the plague on the people may be stopped."
13:21:23/Ornan said to David, "Take it, and let my lord the king do what is good in his eyes. Look, I also provide the oxen for burnt offerings, the threshing sledges for wood, and the wheat for the grain offering; I give it all."
13:21:24/But King David said to Ornan, "No, I insist on buying it for the full price. I will not take what is yours for the LORD, nor offer burnt offerings that cost me nothing."
13:21:25/So David paid Ornan 600 shekels of gold for the site.
13:21:26/David built an altar there to the LORD, offered burnt offerings and peace offerings, and called on the LORD; and He answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.
13:21:27/And the LORD commanded the angel, and he sheathed his sword.
13:21:28/At that time, when David saw that the LORD had answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he offered sacrifices there.
13:21:29/For the tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offering were at that time on the high place at Gibeon.
13:21:30/But David could not go before it to inquire of God, for he was afraid of the sword of the angel of the LORD.
13:22:1/Then David said, "This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar for burnt offerings for Israel."
13:22:2/And David ordered the gathering of the foreigners in the land of Israel; he assigned masons to cut dressed stones to construct the house of God.
13:22:3/And David stockpiled a large amount of iron for the nails for the gate doors and for the fittings; and he gathered a vast quantity of bronze, too much to weigh.
13:22:4/He also acquired a great number of cedar trees because the people of Sidon and Tyre brought a lot of cedar wood to David.
13:22:5/And David said, "Solomon, my son, is young and inexperienced, and the temple to be built for the LORD must be extremely magnificent, famous, and glorious throughout all lands. I will therefore make preparations for it now." So David made extensive preparations before his death.
13:22:6/Then he summoned Solomon his son and instructed him to build a house for the LORD God of Israel.
13:22:7/And David told Solomon, "My son, I had it in my heart to build a house for the name of the LORD my God.
13:22:8/But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, 'You have shed a lot of blood and have waged great wars. You will not build a house for my name because you have shed so much blood on the earth in my sight.
13:22:9/Look, a son will be born to you, who will be a man of peace; I will give him rest from all his enemies around him. His name will be Solomon, and I will grant peace and quiet to Israel in his days.
13:22:10/He will build a house for my name; he will be my son, and I will be his father. I will establish his kingdom over Israel forever.
13:22:11/Now, my son, may the LORD be with you; succeed and build the house of the LORD your God, as he has said about you.
13:22:12/May the LORD grant you wisdom and understanding, and may he put you in charge of Israel, so that you may follow the law of the LORD your God.
13:22:13/Then you will prosper if you are careful to observe the decrees and laws that the LORD gave Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous; do not be afraid or discouraged.
13:22:14/Now, look, in my efforts I have prepared for the house of the LORD 100,000 talents of gold, 1,000,000 talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond weighing; they are in great quantity. Timber and stone I have also prepared, and you can add to them.
13:22:15/Moreover, you have many workers with you, stonecutters, carpenters, and artisans of every kind skilled in every kind of work.
13:22:16/The gold, the silver, the bronze, and the iron are beyond measure. Get up and start the work, and may the LORD be with you."
13:22:17/David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to support Solomon his son, saying,
13:22:18/"Isn't the LORD your God with you? And hasn't he given you peace on every side? For he has handed over the inhabitants of the land to me, and the land is subdued before the LORD and his people.
13:22:19/Now, set your heart and soul to seek the LORD your God. Get up and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, so that you can bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the holy vessels of God into the temple that will be built for the name of the LORD.
13:23:1/So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
13:23:2/And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, along with the priests and the Levites.
13:23:3/Now the Levites were counted from the age of thirty years and older: and their total number, counting each man individually, was thirty-eight thousand.
13:23:4/Out of these, twenty-four thousand were assigned to advance the work of the LORD's house; and six thousand served as officers and judges:
13:23:5/Furthermore, four thousand were gatekeepers; and four thousand praised the LORD with the instruments which I made, said David, to praise with them.
13:23:6/And David organized them into groups among the sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
13:23:7/From the Gershonites came Laadan, and Shimei.
13:23:8/The sons of Laadan; the leader was Jehiel, followed by Zetham, and Joel, making three.
13:23:9/The sons of Shimei; Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the leaders of the fathers of Laadan.
13:23:10/And the sons of Shimei were Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
13:23:11/And Jahath was the leader, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah didn't have many sons; therefore, they were counted together, according to their father’s household.
13:23:12/The sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
13:23:13/The sons of Amram; Aaron and Moses: and Aaron was set apart, to consecrate the most holy things, he and his sons forever, to burn incense before the LORD, to serve him, and to bless in his name forever.
13:23:14/Regarding Moses the man of God, his sons were named from the tribe of Levi.
13:23:15/The sons of Moses were Gershom, and Eliezer.
13:23:16/Among the sons of Gershom, Shebuel was the chief.
13:23:17/And the sons of Eliezer were Rehabiah the chief. And Eliezer had no other sons; but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.
13:23:18/From the sons of Izhar; Shelomith was the chief.
13:23:19/From the sons of Hebron; Jeriah was the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
13:23:20/From the sons of Uzziel; Micah was the first and Jesiah the second.
13:23:21/The sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. The sons of Mahli; Eleazar, and Kish.
13:23:22/And Eleazar died, leaving no sons, only daughters: and their cousins, the sons of Kish, married them.
13:23:23/The sons of Mushi; Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
13:23:24/These were the sons of Levi by their ancestral houses; even the leaders of the fathers, as they were counted by name individually, who worked in the service of the house of the LORD, from the age of twenty years and older.
13:23:25/For David said, The LORD God of Israel has given rest to his people, so they may live in Jerusalem forever: 
13:23:26/And also to the Levites; they will no longer carry the tabernacle, nor any of its equipment for its service.
13:23:27/For by David's final instructions, the Levites were counted from twenty years old and older: 
13:23:28/Because their duty was to assist the sons of Aaron in the service of the LORD's house, in the courtyards, and in the rooms, and in the purification of all holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God; 
13:23:29/Including for the showbread, and for the fine flour for grain offerings, and for the unleavened bread, and for what is baked in the pan, and for what is fried, and for all kinds of measurements and sizes; 
13:23:30/And to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD, and likewise in the evening: 
13:23:31/And to offer all burnt offerings to the LORD on the sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the appointed feasts, by number, according to the regulation commanded to them, continually before the LORD: 
13:23:32/And that they should keep the responsibility of the tabernacle of meeting, and the responsibility of the holy place, and the responsibility of the sons of Aaron their brothers, in the service of the house of the LORD.
13:24:1/Here are the divisions of Aaron's sons: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar were Aaron's sons.
13:24:2/But Nadab and Abihu died before their father without having any children, so Eleazar and Ithamar took on the role of priests.
13:24:3/David assigned their duties, dividing them between Zadok from Eleazar's descendants and Ahimelech from Ithamar's descendants, based on their specific roles in service.
13:24:4/There were more leaders found among Eleazar's descendants than Ithamar's, leading to their division. From Eleazar's line, there were sixteen leaders, and from Ithamar's, eight, according to their family lineage.

13:26:1/Regarding the organization of the gatekeepers: Among the Korahites was Meshelemiah, the son of Kore, from the descendants of Asaph.

13:26:3/Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Elioenai the seventh.
13:26:4/Also, the sons of Obed-Edom were Shemaiah the eldest, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, and Nethaneel the fifth.
13:26:5/Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth: because God had blessed him.
13:26:6/Shemaiah's sons also had sons, who led in their father's house because they were courageous warriors.
13:26:7/The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, along with their strong brothers Elihu and Semachiah.
13:26:8/All these were from the sons of Obed-Edom: they, their sons, and their brothers were capable men with the strength for service, totaling sixty-two from Obed-Edom.
13:26:9/And Meshelemiah had sons and brothers who were strong warriors, eighteen in total.
13:26:10/Also, Hosah, from the descendants of Merari, had sons; Simri was the leader (even though he wasn't the firstborn, his father appointed him as the leader);
13:26:11/Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brothers of Hosah totaled thirteen.
13:26:12/These were the divisions of the gatekeepers among the leaders, who had their own duties, one against another, to serve in the house of the LORD.
13:26:13/They cast lots, both the young and the old, according to their family lineage, for each gate.
13:26:14/The eastward lot fell to Shelemiah. Then for his son Zechariah, a wise advisor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
13:26:15/To Obed-Edom went the southward direction; and to his sons, the storehouse.
13:26:16/Shuppim and Hosah were assigned the westward direction, with the gate Shallecheth, by the causeway of the ascent, watch opposite watch.
13:26:17/Eastward there were six Levites, northward four per day, southward four per day, and at the storehouse two by two.
13:26:18/At Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.
13:26:19/These are the divisions of the gatekeepers among the Korahites and Merarites.
13:26:20/Among the Levites, Ahijah was in charge of the treasures of the house of God and the treasures of the dedicated items.
13:26:21/Regarding the descendants of Laadan; the sons of the Gershonite Laadan, leading families, even of Laadan the Gershonite, were Jehieli.
13:26:22/The sons of Jehieli were Zetham, and his brother Joel, who were in charge of the treasures of the house of the LORD.
13:26:23/From the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
13:26:24/And Shebuel, the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was the overseer of the treasures.
13:26:25/And his relatives through Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
13:26:26/Shelomith and his relatives were in charge of all the treasures of the dedicated items that King David, the family heads, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and the army commanders had dedicated.
13:26:27/They dedicated part of the spoils of war to maintain the house of the LORD.
13:26:28/And everything that Samuel the seer, Saul the son of Kish, Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah had dedicated; and whatever anyone had dedicated was under the supervision of Shelomith and his relatives.
13:26:29/From the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were assigned to external duties over Israel as officers and judges.
13:26:30/From the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his relatives, valiant warriors numbering one thousand seven hundred, were in charge of Israel's affairs west of the Jordan, in all the work of the LORD and in the service of the king.
13:26:31/Among the Hebronites, Jerijah was the leader, among the Hebronites, according to their ancestral lineage. In the fortieth year of David's reign, they were sought out, and among them were found mighty warriors at Jazer in Gilead.
13:26:32/And his relatives, valiant warriors, numbered two thousand seven hundred leading men, whom King David appointed over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, for every matter related to God and the affairs of the king.
13:27:1/The Israelites were organized by their numbers, including the leading families, commanders of thousands and hundreds, and officers who served the king in various duties. These groups rotated in and out every month throughout the year, with each group consisting of 24,000 members.
13:27:2/For the first month, the leader was Jashobeam, son of Zabdiel, commanding a force of 24,000.
13:27:3/From the descendants of Perez came the chief of all the army commanders for the first month.
13:27:4/In charge of the second month's division was Dodai the Ahohite, with Mikloth serving as the leader of his division, which also numbered 24,000.
13:27:5/The third month's army commander was Benaiah, son of Jehoiada, a chief priest, leading a division of 24,000.
13:27:6/This Benaiah was renowned among the thirty warriors and stood above them; his division included his son Ammizabad.
13:27:7/Asahel, brother of Joab, led the fourth month's division, succeeded by his son Zebadiah, with their division numbering 24,000.
13:27:8/The fifth month was under the command of Shamhuth the Izrahite, with his division also numbering 24,000.
13:27:9/For the sixth month, Ira, son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, commanded a division of 24,000.
13:27:10/The seventh month's commander was Helez the Pelonite, from the Ephraimites, leading a division of 24,000.
13:27:11/Sibbecai the Hushathite, from the Zarhites, led the eighth month's division of 24,000.
13:27:12/The ninth month's division was commanded by Abiezer the Anetothite, from the Benjamites, also numbering 24,000.
13:27:13/Maharai the Netophathite, from the Zarhites, commanded the tenth month's division of 24,000.
13:27:14/For the eleventh month, Benaiah the Pirathonite, from the Ephraimites, led a division of 24,000.
13:27:15/The twelfth month's division was under Heldai the Netophathite, from Othniel, numbering 24,000.
13:27:16/Additionally, over the tribes of Israel: Eliezer son of Zichri led the Reubenites; Shephatiah son of Maachah led the Simeonites.
13:27:17/Hashabiah son of Kemuel was over the Levites; Zadok was over the Aaronites.
13:27:18/Elihu, one of David's brothers, was over Judah; Omri son of Michael was over Issachar.
13:27:19/Ishmaiah son of Obadiah was over Zebulun; Jerimoth son of Azriel was over Naphtali.
13:27:20/Hoshea son of Azaziah was over the Ephraimites; Joel son of Pedaiah was over the half-tribe of Manasseh.
13:27:21/Iddo son of Zechariah was over the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead; Jaasiel son of Abner was over Benjamin.
13:27:22/Azareel son of Jeroham was over Dan. These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
13:27:23/However, David did not count those under twenty years old, following the LORD's promise to multiply Israel like the stars in the sky.
13:27:24/Joab son of Zeruiah began the census, but did not complete it due to divine wrath against Israel; the results were not included in King David's records.
13:27:25/Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the king's treasures; Jehonathan son of Uzziah oversaw the storehouses in the fields, cities, villages, and fortresses.
13:27:26/Ezri son of Chelub managed the agricultural labor.
13:27:27/Shimei the Ramathite was over the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite managed the wine cellars' produce.
13:27:28/Baalhanan the Gederite oversaw the olive and sycamore trees in the lowlands, while Joash was in charge of the oil cellars.
13:27:29/Shitrai the Sharonite managed the herds in Sharon, and Shaphat son of Adlai oversaw the herds in the valleys.
13:27:30/Obil the Ishmaelite was in charge of the camels, and Jehdeiah the Meronothite managed the donkeys.
13:27:31/Jaziz the Hagerite oversaw the flocks. These individuals managed King David's assets.
13:27:32/Jonathan, David's uncle, was a counselor, wise man, and scribe; Jehiel son of Hachmoni assisted the king's sons.
13:27:33/Ahithophel served as the king's advisor, and Hushai the Archite was the king's friend.
13:27:34/After Ahithophel, Jehoiada son of Benaiah and Abiathar served, with Joab as the commander of the king's army.
13:28:1/David gathered all the leaders of Israel, including the tribal princes, the commanders of the units serving the king, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, the overseers of the king's property and possessions, his sons, the officials, the mighty warriors, and all the brave soldiers, to Jerusalem.
13:28:2/Then King David stood up and said, "Listen to me, my brothers and my people. I wanted to build a temple as a resting place for the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord and for God's footstool, and I prepared for its construction.
13:28:3/But God told me, 'You are not to build a temple for my name because you are a warrior and have shed blood.'
13:28:4/However, the Lord, the God of Israel, chose me from my entire family to be king over Israel forever. He chose Judah as leader, and from the tribe of Judah, my family, and from my father's sons, He was pleased to make me king over all Israel.
13:28:5/Among all my sons (for the Lord has given me many), He has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the Lord's kingdom over Israel.
13:28:6/And He said to me, 'Your son Solomon is the one who will build my temple and my courts, for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
13:28:7/Furthermore, I will establish his kingdom forever if he remains committed to following my commands and decrees, as he is doing today.'
13:28:8/So now, in the presence of all Israel, the assembly of the Lord, and in the hearing of our God, be diligent in observing all the commands of the Lord your God, so you may possess this good land and leave it as an inheritance to your children forever.
13:28:9/And you, Solomon my son, recognize the God of your father and serve Him with a whole heart and a willing mind. For the Lord searches every heart and understands every motive behind the thoughts. If you seek Him, He will be found by you; but if you abandon Him, He will reject you forever.
13:28:10/Be careful now, for the Lord has chosen you to build a temple as His sanctuary. Be strong and carry out the task."
13:28:11/Then David gave Solomon the plans for the temple porch, its buildings, its treasuries, its upper rooms, its inner chambers, and the place for the mercy seat,
13:28:12/And the plans for everything he had in mind for the courtyards of the Lord's temple, all the surrounding rooms, the treasuries of God's temple, and the treasuries for the dedicated things.
