18:14:1/A person born of a woman lives only a short time and is filled with distress.
18:14:2/He emerges like a flower, only to be cut down: he also vanishes like a shadow, never to stay.
18:14:3/And do you focus your attention on such a one, and bring me into trial with you?
18:14:4/Who can produce something pure from something impure? No one.
18:14:5/Given that his days are fixed, the number of his months is known to you, you have set limits he cannot exceed;
18:14:6/Look away from him, that he may rest, until he completes his day like a hired worker.
18:14:7/For there is hope for a tree, if it is cut down, that it will sprout again, and its new shoots will not fail.
18:14:8/Even if its roots grow old in the ground, and its stump dies in the soil;
18:14:9/At the scent of water it will bud and produce branches like a young plant.
18:14:10/But when a person dies, he withers away; when a person expires, where is he?
18:14:11/Just as water evaporates from the sea, and a river dries up and disappears,
18:14:12/So a person lies down and does not rise again; until the heavens are no more, they will not awaken or be roused from their sleep.
18:14:13/I wish you would hide me in the grave, keep me secret until your anger subsides, set a fixed time for me, and then remember me!
18:14:14/If a person dies, will he live again? Throughout all my appointed time, I will wait, until my renewal comes.
18:14:15/You will call, and I will answer you; you will long for the work of your hands.
18:14:16/For now, you count my steps and keep watch over my sin;
18:14:17/My wrongdoing is sealed in a bag, and you cover my sin.
18:14:18/Indeed, mountains fall and crumble, and rocks move from their places.
18:14:19/Water wears down stones; its torrents wash away the soil of the earth; so you destroy a person's hope.
18:14:20/You overpower him once and for all, and he is gone; you change his countenance and send him away.
18:14:21/His children achieve honor, but he does not know it; they become insignificant, but he does not perceive it.
18:14:22/Yet his body experiences pain, and his soul within him grieves.
18:15:1/Then Eliphaz the Temanite responded, saying,
18:15:2/Should a wise person speak meaningless knowledge and fill themselves with hot air?
18:15:3/Should they engage in pointless discussions or speeches that achieve nothing?
18:15:4/Indeed, you dismiss reverence and limit your prayers before God.
18:15:5/Your mouth reveals your guilt, and you choose the language of the deceitful.
18:15:6/Your own mouth condemns you, not me; indeed, your own lips testify against you.
18:15:7/Are you the first human ever born? Or were you formed before the hills?
18:15:8/Have you listened to God's confidential plans? And do you keep wisdom to yourself?
18:15:9/What do you know that we don't? What insights do you have that we lack?
18:15:10/Among us are the elderly, much older than your father.
18:15:11/Do you consider God's comfort insignificant? Is there a secret you're hiding?
18:15:12/Why are you letting your heart lead you astray? And why do your eyes flash,
18:15:13/That you turn your spirit against God and let such words escape your mouth?
18:15:14/What is a human, that they could be pure? And one born of a woman, that they could be righteous?
18:15:15/See, He places no trust in His holy ones; even the heavens are not pure in His eyes.
18:15:16/How much more detestable and filthy is a person, who drinks wrongdoing like water?
18:15:17/I will explain to you, listen to me; and what I have seen I will tell you;
18:15:18/Which wise people have relayed from their ancestors and have not concealed:
18:15:19/To whom alone the land was given, and no foreigner passed among them.
18:15:20/The wicked person suffers torment all their days, and the number of years is hidden from the tyrant.
18:15:21/A terrifying sound is in their ears; in times of peace, the destroyer will come upon them.
18:15:22/They do not believe they will escape the darkness, and they are destined for the sword.
18:15:23/They wander about for food, asking, 'Where is it?' They know that a day of darkness is at hand.
18:15:24/Distress and anguish terrify them; they overpower him like a king poised for attack.
18:15:25/For they stretch out their hand against God and stand defiant against the Almighty.
18:15:26/They charge at Him, neck extended, behind the thick shields.
18:15:27/Because they cover their face with their fatness and accumulate layers of fat on their sides.
18:15:28/And they live in ruined cities, in houses uninhabited, which are doomed to crumble into ruins.
18:15:29/They will not become wealthy, nor will their assets last, nor will their prosperity spread across the land.
18:15:30/They will not escape the darkness; the flame will wither their branches, and by the breath of His mouth, they will vanish.
18:15:31/Let not the deceived trust in illusions; for illusions will be their downfall.
18:15:32/Their demise will come before its time, and their branches will not flourish.
18:15:33/They will drop their unripe grapes like the vine and shed their blossoms like the olive tree.
18:15:34/For the assembly of the hypocritical will be barren, and fire will consume the tents of corruption.
18:15:35/They conceive trouble and give birth to illusions, and their schemes breed deceit.
18:16:1/Then Job answered and said,
18:16:2/I've heard plenty of this before: all of you are terrible at comforting.
18:16:3/Will these empty words ever end? What makes you so bold to answer like this?
18:16:4/I could talk like you if our roles were reversed, piling words against you and shaking my head.
18:16:5/But I would try to encourage you with my words, and my lips would offer you comfort.
18:16:6/Even when I speak, my grief isn't relieved; and when I stay silent, how does that help me?
18:16:7/But now, I'm just worn out; you've left me with nothing.
18:16:8/You've aged me before my time, which stands as evidence against me; my thinness accuses me to my face.
18:16:9/He tears me apart in his anger, hating me; he grinds his teeth at me; my adversary glares at me with hostility.
18:16:10/They open wide their mouths at me, hitting me in the face in scorn; they unite against me.
18:16:11/God has handed me over to the unjust, throwing me into the hands of the wicked.
18:16:12/I was at peace, but he shattered me; he grabbed me by the neck and smashed me to pieces, setting me up as his target.
18:16:13/His archers surround me, he splits my kidneys open without mercy; he spills my bile on the ground.
18:16:14/He breaks me open again and again, charging at me like a warrior.
18:16:15/I've clothed myself in sackcloth and buried my dignity in the dust.
18:16:16/My face is marred by crying, and the shadow of death is on my eyelids.
18:16:17/It's not because of any wrongdoing on my part; my prayers are sincere.
18:16:18/Earth, do not cover my blood; let my cry for justice find no resting place.
18:16:19/Even now, my witness is in heaven; my advocate is on high.
18:16:20/My friends mock me, but I cry my tears to God.
18:16:21/I wish someone could argue my case before God as one would for a friend.
18:16:22/Soon enough, I'll take the path from which I won't return.
18:17:1/My breath is foul, my days are over, the graves await me.
18:17:2/Aren't there mockers around me? And doesn't my eye endure their scorn?
18:17:3/Come on, guarantee me yourself; who will shake hands with me in agreement?
18:17:4/You have kept them from understanding; therefore, you will not lift them up.
18:17:5/Anyone who flatters his friends, even his children's eyes will grow weak.
18:17:6/I've become a joke among the people; I used to be like a musical instrument.
18:17:7/My eyes are dim from grief, and all my limbs are like shadows.
18:17:8/Honest people will be shocked at this, and the innocent will stand against the deceitful.
18:17:9/The righteous will keep to his path, and those with clean hands will grow stronger.
18:17:10/But as for all of you, come back now; I can't find one wise person among you.
18:17:11/My days are gone, my plans are shattered, along with the desires of my heart.
18:17:12/They turn night into day; the light seems short in the face of darkness.
18:17:13/If I wait, the grave will be my home; I have made my bed in the darkness.
18:17:14/I have called decay my father, and the worm my mother and sister.
18:17:15/So where is my hope now? Who can see any hope for me?
18:17:16/They will descend to the bars of the pit, when we rest together in the dust.
18:18:1/Then Bildad the Shuhite replied, saying,
18:18:2/How long will it take before you stop talking? Pay attention, and then we can speak.
18:18:3/Why are we considered as animals, and seen as disgusting in your eyes?
18:18:4/In his anger, he destroys himself: will the earth be abandoned for you? Will the rock be moved from its place?
18:18:5/Indeed, the light of the wicked will be extinguished, and the spark of his fire will not glow.
18:18:6/The light in his tent will become dark, and his lamp beside him will go out.
18:18:7/The strides of his power will be limited, and his own plans will bring him down.
18:18:8/He will be caught in a net by his own feet, and he will walk into a trap.
18:18:9/The trap will catch him by the heel, and the thief will overpower him.
18:18:10/A trap is set for him on the ground, and a snare lies in his path.
18:18:11/Fears will terrify him on all sides, and chase him at his heels.
18:18:12/His strength will be weakened by hunger, and disaster will be ready at his side.
18:18:13/It will consume the vitality of his skin; even the firstborn of death will devour his strength.
18:18:14/His confidence will be uprooted from his tent, and it will lead him to the king of terrors.
18:18:15/It will reside in his tent, because it belongs to none of his: sulfur will be scattered over his dwelling.
18:18:16/His roots below will dry up, and above his branches will be cut off.
18:18:17/His memory will vanish from the earth, and he will have no name in the streets.
18:18:18/He will be pushed from light into darkness, and banished from the world.
18:18:19/He will have neither son nor nephew among his people, nor any survivor in his dwellings.
18:18:20/Those who come after him will be shocked at his fate, just as those before were terrified.
18:18:21/Surely such are the homes of the wicked, and this is the place of one who does not know God.
18:19:1/Then Job answered and said,
18:19:2/How long will you torment my soul and crush me with your words?
18:19:3/You have insulted me ten times now; you're not ashamed to mistreat me.
18:19:4/Even if I have made a mistake, my error affects only me.
18:19:5/If you really want to accuse me and blame me for my disgrace,
18:19:6/Know that God has wronged me and trapped me with his net.
18:19:7/I cry out about this injustice, but I'm not heard: I shout, but there is no justice.
18:19:8/He has blocked my way so I can't move forward, and has shrouded my paths in darkness.
18:19:9/He has stripped me of my honor and removed the crown from my head.
18:19:10/He has broken me down on all sides, and I'm gone: my hope he has uprooted like a tree.
18:19:11/He has also unleashed his anger against me and considers me one of his enemies.
18:19:12/His forces advance, build their siege against me, and encamp around my dwelling.
18:19:13/He has driven my brothers far from me, and those I knew well have completely estranged me.
18:19:14/My relatives have failed me, and my close friends have forgotten me.
18:19:15/Those living in my house, and my servants, treat me like a stranger: I am a foreigner in their eyes.
18:19:16/I called to my servant, but he did not respond; I begged him with my own mouth.
18:19:17/My own wife finds my breath repulsive, even though I pleaded for the sake of my own children.
18:19:18/Even young children despise me; when I stand up, they talk against me.
18:19:19/All my intimate friends detest me; those I loved have turned against me.
18:19:20/My bones stick to my skin and flesh, and I have barely escaped with the skin of my teeth.
18:19:21/Show compassion for me, my friends, for God's hand has struck me.
18:19:22/Why do you persecute me as God does, and are not satisfied with my flesh?
18:19:23/I wish my words were written down, that they were inscribed in a book,
18:19:24/That they were etched with an iron stylus and lead, forever in the rock.
18:19:25/For I know that my redeemer lives, and he will stand upon the earth at the end.
18:19:26/And after my skin has been destroyed, yet in my flesh, I will see God,
18:19:27/Whom I will see for myself, and my eyes will behold, and not as a stranger. My heart yearns within me.
18:19:28/But you should ask yourselves, 'Why are we persecuting him?' realizing that the root of the issue lies within me.
18:19:29/Fear the sword; for wrath brings the punishment of the sword, so you may know there is a judgment.
18:20:1/Then Zophar the Naamathite responded, saying,
18:20:2/That's why my thoughts compel me to answer, and I'm in a hurry to do so.
18:20:3/I've heard the criticism against me, and my insight prompts me to respond.
18:20:4/Don't you know this from long ago, ever since humans were placed on earth,
18:20:5/That the success of the wicked is brief, and the happiness of the hypocrite lasts only a moment?
18:20:6/Even if his greatness soars to the heavens, and his head touches the clouds,
18:20:7/He will vanish forever like his own waste; those who have seen him will ask, 'Where is he?'
18:20:8/He will disappear like a dream and not be found; he will be swept away like a vision of the night.
18:20:9/The eye that saw him will see him no more; his place will no longer observe him.
18:20:10/His children will try to win favor with the poor, and his hands will give back their wealth.
18:20:11/His bones are filled with the sins of his youth, which will lie with him in the dust.
18:20:12/Even if evil tastes sweet in his mouth, even if he hides it under his tongue,
18:20:13/Even if he savors it and won't let it go, but keeps it in his mouth,
18:20:14/Yet his food in his stomach turns sour, it becomes the venom of vipers within him.
18:20:15/He has swallowed wealth, but he will vomit it up; God will force it out of his stomach.
18:20:16/He will suck the poison of vipers; the fangs of a snake will kill him.
18:20:17/He will not enjoy the streams, the rivers flowing with honey and cream.
18:20:18/What he worked for he must give back, and he cannot enjoy it; he will return his wealth without delighting in it.
18:20:19/Because he has oppressed and neglected the poor; because he has seized a house he did not build,
18:20:20/Surely he will not feel peace in his stomach; he cannot save what he desired.
18:20:21/Nothing is left of his food; therefore, no one will crave his wealth.
18:20:22/When he is at his peak, he will be in trouble; every hand of the wicked will come against him.
18:20:23/When he is about to fill his stomach, God will unleash His fury on him and rain it down on him while he is eating.
18:20:24/He will try to escape from an iron weapon, but a bronze arrow will pierce him.
18:20:25/It is pulled out and comes from his body; indeed, the shining blade comes out of his liver; terror will be upon him.
18:20:26/Total darkness is reserved for his treasures; an unfanned fire will consume him; it will go badly for anyone left in his tent.
18:20:27/The heavens will expose his guilt; the earth will rise up against him.
18:20:28/The wealth of his house will disappear, and his possessions will flow away on the day of God's anger.
18:20:29/This is the fate of the wicked from God, the heritage decreed for him by God.
18:21:1/But Job answered and said,
18:21:2/Listen carefully to my words, and let this be your comfort.
18:21:3/Allow me to speak; and after I have spoken, go ahead and mock.
18:21:4/As for me, is my complaint to a human? And if it is, why shouldn't I be upset?
18:21:5/Pay attention to me, be amazed, and put your hand over your mouth.
18:21:6/Whenever I remember, I am filled with fear, and shivering grips my body.
18:21:7/Why do the wicked live on, grow old, and even gain power?
18:21:8/Their descendants are established in their presence, and their offspring are in their sight.
18:21:9/Their homes are free from fear, and they are not punished by God's wrath.
18:21:10/Their bull breeds without fail; their cow calves and does not miscarry.
18:21:11/They send out their children like a flock, and their kids jump around.
18:21:12/They play the tambourine and harp, and celebrate to the sound of the flute.
18:21:13/They spend their days in prosperity, and suddenly they go down to the grave.
18:21:14/So they say to God, 'Leave us alone; we have no desire to know Your ways.'
18:21:15/'What is the Almighty, that we should serve Him? And what benefit do we get if we pray to Him?'
18:21:16/See, their prosperity is not in their own hands; I want no part of the plans of the wicked.
18:21:17/How often is the lamp of the wicked snuffed out? How often does disaster come upon them, the distribution of sorrows in His anger?
18:21:18/They are like straw before the wind, and like chaff that a storm sweeps away.
18:21:19/God stores up their iniquity for their children: He repays them, and they will know it.
18:21:20/Their own eyes will see their destruction, and they will drink from the wrath of the Almighty.
18:21:21/For what do they care about their household after them, when their months are cut off halfway?
18:21:22/Can anyone teach knowledge to God, since He judges even the highest?
18:21:23/One dies in full vigor, completely secure and at peace.
18:21:24/Their bodies are well fed, and their bones are rich with marrow.
18:21:25/And another dies with a bitter soul, never having enjoyed prosperity.
18:21:26/They both lie down in the dust, and worms cover them.
18:21:27/See, I know your thoughts and the schemes you wrongfully plot against me.
18:21:28/For you say, 'Where is the house of the noble? And where are the tents where the wicked lived?'
18:21:29/Haven't you asked those who travel the roads? And don't you accept their word
18:21:30/That the wicked are spared for the day of disaster? They are led away on the day of wrath.
18:21:31/Who will confront him with his actions? And who will repay him for what he has done?
18:21:32/Yet he will be carried to the grave, and watch will be kept over his tomb.
18:21:33/The soil of the valley will be sweet to him; all humanity will follow after him, and countless others have gone before him.
18:21:34/How then do you offer me empty comfort, when in your answers only falsehood remains?
18:22:1/Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
18:22:2/Can a person really benefit God, as someone wise benefits themselves?
18:22:3/Does it bring joy to the Almighty if you're righteous? Or does it benefit him if you make your ways perfect?
18:22:4/Will he correct you out of fear of you? Will he enter into judgment with you?
18:22:5/Isn't your wickedness significant? And aren't your sins endless?
18:22:6/You've taken a pledge from your brother for nothing, and stripped the naked of their clothing.
18:22:7/You haven't given water to the thirsty, and you've withheld bread from the hungry.
18:22:8/But the powerful person owned the land; and the respected person lived in it.
18:22:9/You've sent widows away empty-handed, and the strength of the orphans has been crushed.
18:22:10/That's why traps surround you, and sudden fear terrifies you;
18:22:11/Or darkness, so you cannot see; and floods of water cover you.
18:22:12/Isn't God in the heights of heaven? And see how high the stars are!
18:22:13/And you say, 'How does God know? Can he judge through the thick clouds?'
18:22:14/Thick clouds cover him, so he doesn't see; and he walks on the vault of heaven.
18:22:15/Have you noticed the path that wicked men have walked?
18:22:16/Who were cut down before their time, whose foundations were swept away by a flood?
18:22:17/Who said to God, 'Leave us alone': and 'What can the Almighty do to us?'
18:22:18/Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the plans of the wicked are far from me.
18:22:19/The righteous see it and are happy: and the innocent mock them.
18:22:20/While our possessions are not diminished, but the remainder of them the fire consumes.
18:22:21/Get to know him now, and be at peace: thereby good will come to you.
18:22:22/Accept, please, the law from his mouth, and keep his words in your heart.
18:22:23/If you return to the Almighty, you'll be restored, you'll remove iniquity far from your dwellings.
18:22:24/Then you'll treat gold like dust, and the gold of Ophir like the stones of the brooks.
18:22:25/Yes, the Almighty will be your defense, and you'll have plenty of silver.
18:22:26/For then you'll delight in the Almighty, and lift your face to God.
18:22:27/You'll pray to him, and he'll hear you, and you'll fulfill your vows.
18:22:28/You'll also decree a thing, and it will be established for you: and light will shine on your ways.
18:22:29/When people are brought low, then you'll say, 'There's a lifting up'; and he'll save the humble person.
18:22:30/He'll deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the purity of your hands.
18:23:1/Then Job answered and said,
18:23:2/Even today, my complaint is bitter: my suffering is heavier than my sighs.
18:23:3/If only I knew where to find him! If only I could go to his dwelling!
18:23:4/I would present my case before him and fill my mouth with arguments.
18:23:5/I would find out what he would answer me, and understand what he would tell me.
18:23:6/Would he oppose me with his great power? No, he would give me strength.
18:23:7/There, the righteous could argue with him; and I would be forever freed from my judge.
18:23:8/Look, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him;
18:23:9/To the left, where he is working, but I cannot see him; he hides on the right, so I cannot see him.
18:23:10/Yet he knows the path I take; when he has tested me, I will come out like gold.
18:23:11/My feet have closely followed his steps; I have kept to his way without turning aside.
18:23:12/I have not departed from the commands of his lips; I have treasured the words of his mouth more than my daily bread.
18:23:13/But he is unchangeable, and who can oppose him? He does whatever he desires.
18:23:14/For he carries out what is decreed for me, and many such plans are with him.
18:23:15/That is why I am terrified in his presence; when I think of this, I fear him.
18:23:16/For God has made my heart faint; the Almighty has terrified me.
18:23:17/Because I was not silenced by the darkness, nor by the deep shadow that covers my face.
18:24:1/Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do those who know him not see his days?
18:24:2/Some move boundary stones; they forcefully steal flocks and feed on them.
18:24:3/They drive away the donkey of the orphan, they take the widow’s ox as collateral.
18:24:4/They push the needy aside: the poor of the earth hide together.
18:24:5/Look, like wild donkeys in the desert, they go out to their work; getting up early for a prey: the wilderness provides food for them and for their children.
18:24:6/They harvest their grain in the field: and they collect the crops of the wicked.
18:24:7/They make the naked sleep without clothes, leaving them without cover in the cold.
18:24:8/They are soaked by mountain showers, and hug rocks for lack of shelter.
18:24:9/They snatch the fatherless from the breast, and take collateral from the poor.
18:24:10/They make them go naked without clothes, and take away the bundle from the hungry;
18:24:11/Who make oil within their walls, and press their wine, yet suffer thirst.
18:24:12/People moan from within the city, and the souls of the wounded cry out: yet God does not charge them with folly.
18:24:13/They are among those who rebel against the light; they do not know its ways nor stay in its paths.
18:24:14/The murderer rises with the light, kills the poor and needy, and at night is like a thief.
18:24:15/The eye of the adulterer watches for dusk, saying, 'No eye will see me.' and disguises his face.
18:24:16/In the dark, they break into houses, which they marked for themselves in the daytime: they do not know the light.
18:24:17/For them, the morning is as dark as death; if someone recognizes them, they fear the terrors of the darkness of death.
18:24:18/He moves swiftly as the waters; their portion on earth is cursed: they do not turn towards the vineyards.
18:24:19/Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so does the grave those who have sinned.
18:24:20/The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feast on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken like a tree.
18:24:21/He mistreats the barren who does not bear: and does not help the widow.
18:24:22/He also pulls down the mighty with his power: he rises up, and no one is sure of life.
18:24:23/Though he is given safety, on which he relies; yet his eyes are on their ways.
18:24:24/They are lifted up for a little while, but then are gone and brought low; they are removed as all others, and cut off like the tops of the ears of corn.
18:24:25/And if it is not so now, who will prove me a liar, and make my speech worthless?
18:25:1/Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said, 
18:25:2/Power and awe belong to him; he establishes peace in his heavenly realms.
18:25:3/Can his armies be counted? And who doesn't bask in his light? 
18:25:4/So how can a person be right with God? Or how can someone born of a woman be pure? 
18:25:5/Look even at the moon, it doesn't shine bright; even the stars aren't clean in his eyes.
18:25:6/How much less significant is a person, who is but a worm? And the children of humanity, who are also but worms?
18:26:1/But Job replied, saying,
18:26:2/"How have you helped the powerless? How have you saved the arm that lacks strength?
18:26:3/How have you advised someone without wisdom? And how have you clearly explained the facts?
18:26:4/To whom have you spoken these words? And whose spirit was inspired by you?
18:26:5/Dead things are formed from beneath the waters, along with their inhabitants.
18:26:6/The realm of the dead is fully exposed to him, and destruction is unhidden.
18:26:7/He stretches out the north over empty space and suspends the earth on nothing.
18:26:8/He wraps up the waters in his thick clouds, yet the clouds do not burst under their weight.
18:26:9/He conceals the view of his throne, covering it with his cloud.
18:26:10/He has set a boundary for the waters, marking the limit between day and night.
18:26:11/The foundations of heaven tremble and are amazed at his rebuke.
18:26:12/With his power, he parts the sea, and with his wisdom, he strikes down the haughty.
18:26:13/By his spirit, he has adorned the heavens; his hand has shaped the fleeing serpent.
18:26:14/Behold, these are but the outskirts of his ways; and how faint is the whisper we hear of him? But the thunder of his power, who can comprehend?
18:27:1/Moreover Job continued his parable, and said, 
18:27:2/As God lives, who has taken away my right to justice; and the Almighty, who has troubled my soul;
18:27:3/As long as I breathe, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils; 
18:27:4/My lips will not speak evil, nor will my tongue utter lies.
18:27:5/I refuse to justify you: until I die, I will not compromise my integrity.
18:27:6/I will firmly hold onto my righteousness and will not let it go: my heart will not reproach me as long as I live.
18:27:7/May my enemy be like the wicked, and those who rise up against me like the unrighteous.
18:27:8/For what hope does the hypocrite have, even if he gains, when God takes away his life? 
18:27:9/Will God listen to his cry when trouble comes upon him? 
18:27:10/Will he find joy in the Almighty? Will he always call upon God? 
18:27:11/I will teach you about the ways of God: I will not hide what is with the Almighty.
18:27:12/See, all of you have witnessed it; why then do you act so foolishly? 
18:27:13/This is what a wicked person will receive from God, and the inheritance of oppressors from the Almighty.
18:27:14/If his children multiply, they are destined for the sword: and his descendants will not have enough to eat.
18:27:15/Those who survive him will be buried in death: and his widows will not mourn.
18:27:16/Even if he accumulates silver like dust, and piles up clothing like clay; 
18:27:17/He may pile it up, but the righteous will wear it, and the innocent will share the silver.
18:27:18/He builds his house as fragile as a moth's cocoon, and like a shack that a watchman makes.
18:27:19/The wealthy man will lie down, but he will not be gathered up: he opens his eyes, and he is gone.
18:27:20/Terrors seize him like water, a storm snatches him away in the night.
18:27:21/The east wind carries him off, and he goes: and it hurls him out of his place with a storm.
18:27:22/For God will hurl his wrath upon him, and not spare: he desperately tries to escape from His power.
18:27:23/People will clap their hands at him, and will jeer him out of his place.
18:28:1/There's definitely a source for silver, and a place where gold is refined.
18:28:2/Iron is extracted from the earth, and copper is smelted from ore.
18:28:3/He puts an end to darkness, and thoroughly explores every detail: the dark rocks, and the deepest shadows.
18:28:4/Water bursts forth from its source; even the streams that were forgotten by foot: they dry up, they vanish from human sight.
18:28:5/From the earth comes food, and beneath it, it's as if fire has transformed it.
18:28:6/Its rocks are the source of sapphires, and it contains particles of gold.
18:28:7/There's a path no bird knows, unseen by the vulture's eye:
18:28:8/Young lions have not walked it, nor has the mighty lion crossed it.
18:28:9/He reaches out his hand to the rock; he overturns mountains from their roots.
18:28:10/He carves out channels among the rocks; his eyes spot every valuable thing.
18:28:11/He controls the rivers to prevent them from overflowing; and brings hidden things to light.
18:28:12/But where can wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
18:28:13/Humans do not know its value; it cannot be found in the land of the living.
18:28:14/The depths say, 'It's not in me'; and the sea says, 'It's not with me.'
18:28:15/It can't be bought with gold, nor can its price be weighed out in silver.
18:28:16/It can't be measured with the gold of Ophir, with precious onyx, or sapphires.
18:28:17/Gold and crystal cannot compare to it; nor can it be exchanged for jewelry of fine gold.
18:28:18/Coral and pearls are not even worth mentioning; the value of wisdom is far beyond rubies.
18:28:19/The topaz of Ethiopia cannot compare to it; it cannot be valued with the purest gold.
18:28:20/So where does wisdom come from? And where is the place of understanding?
18:28:21/It is hidden from the eyes of all living, and concealed from the birds of the air.
18:28:22/Even Destruction and Death say, 'We've only heard rumors of it with our ears.'
18:28:23/God understands its way, and he knows its place.
18:28:24/For he looks to the ends of the earth and sees everything under the heavens;
18:28:25/To establish the force of the wind; and he measures the waters with precision.
18:28:26/When he set a law for the rain, and a path for the thunderstorm,
18:28:27/Then he saw it and declared it; he established it, and also searched it out.
18:28:28/And to humanity he said, 'Look, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to turn away from evil is understanding.'
18:29:1/Moreover Job continued his parable, and said, 
18:29:2/I wish I could go back to the months past, to the days when God looked after me; 
18:29:3/When his light shone over my head, and by his light, I walked through darkness; 
18:29:4/Back to the days of my youth, when God's mystery was over my home; 
18:29:5/When the Almighty was still with me, and my children were around me; 
18:29:6/When my paths were smooth as if washed with cream, and the rocks flowed with oil for me; 
18:29:7/When I walked out to the city gate, when I took my place in the public square!
18:29:8/Young men saw me and hid, while the elderly stood up in respect.
18:29:9/Leaders stopped speaking and covered their mouths with their hands.
18:29:10/The nobles were silent, their tongues stuck to the roof of their mouths.
18:29:11/When people heard me, they praised me; and when they saw me, they approved. 
18:29:12/Because I helped the poor who cried out, the orphans, and those with no one to assist them.
18:29:13/The blessing of those about to perish came upon me; and I made the widow's heart sing with joy.
18:29:14/I wore righteousness like clothing; my fairness was like a robe and a crown.
18:29:15/I was eyes to the blind, and I was legs to the lame.
18:29:16/I was like a father to the needy: and I investigated cases I did not know.
18:29:17/And I broke the jaws of the wicked, taking the victims from their teeth.
18:29:18/Then I thought, 'I will die in my own home, and my days will be as numerous as the sand.'
18:29:19/My roots spread out to the waters, and the dew rested on my branches all night.
18:29:20/My honor was always fresh with me, and my strength was renewed in my grasp.
18:29:21/People listened to me and waited, staying silent for my advice.
18:29:22/After I spoke, they had nothing to add; my words fell gently on them.
18:29:23/They waited for my words like rain; they opened their mouths wide for the spring rain.
18:29:24/If I smiled at them, they could hardly believe it; they valued the favor of my face.
18:29:25/I chose their path and led, sitting as a chief, living like a king among his troops, comforting those who mourned.
18:30:1/But now, those younger than me mock me, whose fathers I wouldn't have considered worthy to sit with my sheepdogs.
18:30:2/Indeed, what use would I have for the strength of their hands, in those whose vigor has faded away?
18:30:3/Due to lack and hunger, they were isolated; fleeing into the wilderness, into places long deserted and barren.
18:30:4/They gathered mallows by the bushes and juniper roots for their food.
18:30:5/They were expelled from society, (people shouted at them as they would at a thief;)
18:30:6/Forced to live in the cliffs of valleys, in caves of the earth, and among the rocks.
18:30:7/They cried out among the bushes; they huddled under the nettles.
18:30:8/They were offspring of fools, yes, children of worthless men: they were more despised than the earth itself.
18:30:9/And now I am the subject of their songs, yes, I am their mocking phrase.
18:30:10/They detest me, they keep their distance from me, and do not hesitate to spit in my direction.
18:30:11/Because he has loosened my bonds, and afflicted me, they have also thrown off restraint in my presence.
18:30:12/The young ones rise up against me on my right; they push aside my feet, and they pave their path of destruction against me.
18:30:13/They ruin my path, they contribute to my disaster, without anyone to help me.
18:30:14/They come at me like a flood breaking through: in my desolation, they roll themselves upon me.
18:30:15/Terrors turn against me: they chase my soul like the wind: and my well-being disappears like a cloud.
18:30:16/And now my soul is poured out within me; days of suffering grip me.
18:30:17/My bones are pierced within me at night, and my muscles get no rest.
18:30:18/The sheer force of my illness changes my clothing: it binds me tight like the collar of my coat.
18:30:19/He has thrown me into the mud, and I have become like dust and ashes.
18:30:20/I cry out to you, but you do not answer me: I stand up, but you pay me no attention.
18:30:21/You have become harsh to me: with your strong hand you oppose me.
18:30:22/You lift me up to the wind; you make me ride on it, and you dissolve my being.
18:30:23/For I know that you will bring me to death, to the dwelling place appointed for all the living.
18:30:24/Yet, he will not reach out his hand to the grave, even though they cry out in his downfall.
18:30:25/Did I not weep for those in trouble? Was not my soul pained for the needy?
18:30:26/When I hoped for good, evil came to me; and when I waited for light, darkness arrived.
18:30:27/My insides churned and found no rest; days of affliction confronted me.
18:30:28/I walked in mourning without sunlight; I stood up and cried out in the assembly.
18:30:29/I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.
18:30:30/My skin turns black on me, and my bones burn with fever.
18:30:31/My harp is tuned to mourning, and my flute to the sound of those who weep.
18:31:1/I made a promise to myself to stay pure; why then should I lust after a young woman?
18:31:2/For what connection to God could come from above? And what inheritance from the Almighty from the heavens?
18:31:3/Isn't destruction meant for the wicked? And a strange punishment for those who do wrong?
18:31:4/Doesn't he observe my ways, and count every step I take?
18:31:5/If I have lived a lie, or if I've rushed into deceit;
18:31:6/Let me be judged fairly so that God may see my honesty.
18:31:7/If I have strayed from the right path, and my heart has followed what my eyes see, and if I have stained my hands;
18:31:8/Then let me plant crops, but let someone else eat them; yes, let my descendants be uprooted.
18:31:9/If my heart has been led astray by a woman, or if I've lurked at my neighbor's door;
18:31:10/Then let my wife belong to another, and let others take advantage of her.
18:31:11/For this is a terrible sin; yes, it is a wrongdoing to be judged by the courts.
18:31:12/For it is a fire that consumes to destruction, and would eliminate all my gains.
18:31:13/If I have ignored the rights of my male or female servants when they had a grievance against me;
18:31:14/What will I do when God stands up? And when he holds me accountable, what will I say?
18:31:15/Didn't the same one who made me in the womb make them? And weren't we formed in the womb by the same hand?
18:31:16/If I have denied the needy their desires, or have caused the widow's eyes to shed tears;
18:31:17/Or have eaten my food alone, without sharing it with the orphan;
18:31:18/(For from my youth he was raised with me as a father, and I have been her guide since my mother's womb;)
18:31:19/If I have seen anyone dying for lack of clothing, or the needy without a cloak;
18:31:20/If they have not praised me for warming them with the wool of my sheep;
18:31:21/If I have raised my hand against the orphan, when I saw I had support in the community;
18:31:22/Then let my arm be torn from my shoulder, and be broken off at the joint.
18:31:23/For the thought of destruction from God was terrifying to me, and because of his majesty I could not stand.
18:31:24/If I have put my trust in gold, or said to pure gold, 'You are my security';
18:31:25/If I have rejoiced because my wealth was vast, and because I had amassed a great fortune;
18:31:26/If I have gazed at the sun shining, or the moon moving in splendor;
18:31:27/And my heart was secretly enticed, or my hand threw kisses in homage;
18:31:28/This too would be a sin deserving judgment, for I would have denied the God above.
18:31:29/If I have gloated over my enemy's misfortune, or exulted when harm befell him;
18:31:30/I have not allowed my mouth to sin by cursing his life.
18:31:31/If the people in my household have never said, 'If only we had meat to eat! We are never satisfied.'
18:31:32/I did not let strangers sleep in the streets; I opened my doors to the traveler.
18:31:33/If I have concealed my sins as people do, by hiding my guilt in my heart;
18:31:34/Because I feared the crowd, or was afraid of family scorn, so that I kept quiet and did not go outside;
18:31:35/Oh, how I wish someone would listen to me! Look, my defense is that the Almighty would answer me, and that my accuser had written down charges.
18:31:36/I would surely carry it on my shoulder and wear it like a crown.
18:31:37/I would tell him the number of my steps; I would approach him like a prince.
18:31:38/If my land accuses me, or all its furrows cry out together;
18:31:39/If I have eaten its yield without payment, or caused its owners to lose their lives;
18:31:40/Let thorns grow instead of wheat, and weeds instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
18:32:1/So these three men stopped responding to Job, because he believed he was right.
18:32:2/Then Elihu, the son of Barachel the Buzite, from the family of Ram, became angry. He was upset with Job for justifying himself instead of God.
18:32:3/He was also angry with Job's three friends because they couldn't find an answer and yet had condemned Job.
18:32:4/Elihu had waited to speak until Job was done because the others were older than he.
18:32:5/When Elihu saw that there was no response from these three men, he became angry.
18:32:6/And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite said, "I am young, and you are much older; that's why I was hesitant and afraid to share my opinion with you.
18:32:7/"I thought, 'Let age speak; let the years teach wisdom.'
18:32:8/But it is the spirit in a person, the breath of the Almighty, that gives them understanding.
18:32:9/It's not only the old who are wise, nor the aged who understand what is right.
18:32:10/Therefore, I say, listen to me; I too will share my insights.
18:32:11/Look, I waited for your arguments; I listened to your reasoning while you searched for the right words.
18:32:12/Yes, I paid attention to you, and none of you proved Job wrong; none of you had an answer to his statements.
18:32:13/So you shouldn't claim, 'We have found wisdom; God will defeat him, not a human.'
18:32:14/Job hasn't directed his words at me, and I won't respond to him with your arguments.
18:32:15/They were stunned; they had no more responses; they stopped talking.
18:32:16/When I had waited (for they didn't speak, but stood still and didn't respond anymore),
18:32:17/I thought, 'I will also give my answer; I too will share my opinion.'
18:32:18/For I am full of words, and the spirit within me compels me.
18:32:19/Look, my belly is like wine that has no vent; it's ready to burst like new wineskins.
18:32:20/I will speak so I can find relief; I will open my lips and reply.
18:32:21/Please, don't let me show favoritism to anyone or flatter any person.
18:32:22/For I don't know how to flatter; if I did, my Maker would soon take me away.
18:33:1/So, Job, please listen to what I have to say and pay attention to all my words.
18:33:2/Look, I've started speaking; my tongue is moving in my mouth.
18:33:3/My words come from a sincere heart, and my lips will speak knowledge clearly.
18:33:4/God's spirit created me, and the Almighty's breath gives me life.
18:33:5/If you can respond, get your arguments ready and stand up.
18:33:6/Look, I'm here as you wanted, in God's place: I too was made from clay.
18:33:7/Don't be scared by me; I won't come down hard on you.
18:33:8/You've definitely said these things in my hearing, and I've heard you claim,
18:33:9/"I am pure, without sin; I am innocent and have no guilt in me."
18:33:10/"Look, God finds faults in me; He treats me like an enemy,"
18:33:11/"He puts my feet in shackles and watches every move I make."
18:33:12/But you're wrong in this; let me tell you, God is greater than any human.
18:33:13/Why argue with Him? He doesn't have to explain His actions to anyone.
18:33:14/God speaks in one way, or in another, yet people don't notice.
18:33:15/In dreams, in visions at night, when deep sleep falls on people as they lie in bed,
18:33:16/He opens people's ears and seals their instruction,
18:33:17/To turn them from wrongdoing and keep pride away from them.
18:33:18/He keeps their souls from the pit, their lives from ending by the sword.
18:33:19/They're disciplined with pain on their beds, with constant distress in their bones,
18:33:20/So that they loathe bread and no longer crave their favorite foods.
18:33:21/Their bodies waste away unseen; their bones, once hidden, now stick out.
18:33:22/Their souls draw near to the grave, their lives to those who bring death.
18:33:23/If there's a messenger for them, a mediator, one out of a thousand, to show them how to be upright,
18:33:24/Then God is merciful to them and says, 'Save them from going down to the pit; I have found a ransom.'
18:33:25/Their bodies become healthier than when they were young; they return to the days of their youth.
18:33:26/They pray to God, who is pleased with them, they see His face with joy, for He restores to them their righteousness.
18:33:27/He looks at humans and if anyone says, 'I have sinned, I have twisted what is right, and it was not worth it,'
18:33:28/God will rescue their soul from going to the pit, and their life will see the light.
18:33:29/See, God does all these things for people, time and again,
18:33:30/To bring them back from the pit, so they may enjoy the light of life.
18:33:31/Pay attention, Job, listen to me; be silent, and I will speak.
18:33:32/If you have anything to say, answer me; speak up, for I want to prove you right.
18:33:33/If not, listen to me; be silent, and I will teach you wisdom.
18:34:1/Furthermore Elihu answered and said,
18:34:2/Listen to my words, you wise people; and pay attention, you who have knowledge.
18:34:3/Just as the ear tests words, the mouth tastes food.
18:34:4/Let's decide what's right; let's figure out together what is good.
18:34:5/For Job has claimed, 'I am in the right, yet God has denied me justice.'
18:34:6/Should I lie against my own right? My wound is incurable, though I am without sin.
18:34:7/Who is like Job, who drinks scorn like water?
18:34:8/Who keeps company with those who do wrong, and walks with wicked people.
18:34:9/For he has said, 'It profits a person nothing to take delight in God.'
18:34:10/So listen to me, you people of understanding: it is unthinkable that God would do wrong, and that the Almighty would act unjustly.
18:34:11/For he repays a person for their work, and ensures that everyone gets what their actions deserve.
18:34:12/Indeed, God will not act wickedly, and the Almighty will not twist justice.
18:34:13/Who has put him in charge of the earth? Or who has laid out the whole world?
18:34:14/If he focused his heart on humanity, if he gathered to himself his spirit and his breath,
18:34:15/All flesh would perish together, and humans would return to dust.
18:34:16/If you have understanding, listen to this; pay attention to what I say.
18:34:17/Can someone who hates justice govern? Will you condemn the one who is most just?
18:34:18/Is it right to tell a king, 'You are wicked,' and to rulers, 'You are wrong'?
18:34:19/How much less to him who does not favor the rich over the poor, for they are all the work of his hands.
18:34:20/In an instant they will die, and people will be troubled at midnight and pass away; the powerful will be removed without human intervention.
18:34:21/For his eyes are on the ways of humans, and he sees all their steps.
18:34:22/There is no darkness, nor deep shadow, where evildoers can hide themselves.
18:34:23/For he does not need to consider a person further, that they should go before God in judgment.
18:34:24/He shatters the powerful without investigation and sets others in their place.
18:34:25/Therefore he recognizes their deeds, and overturns them in the night, so they are destroyed.
18:34:26/He strikes them down as wicked in the sight of others,
18:34:27/Because they turned away from following him and had no regard for any of his ways,
18:34:28/So that they caused the cry of the poor to come to him, and he heard the cry of the afflicted.
18:34:29/When he gives peace, who can cause trouble? And when he hides his face, who can see him? Whether it is against a nation or a single individual,
18:34:30/That the godless should not rule, lest the people be ensnared.
18:34:31/Surely it is right to say to God, 'I have been punished; I will not offend anymore;
18:34:32/Teach me what I do not see; if I have done wrong, I will not do so again.'
18:34:33/Should it be according to your terms? He will repay it, whether you refuse or choose; and not I. So tell us what you know.
18:34:34/Let people of understanding speak to me, and let a wise person listen to me.
18:34:35/Job has spoken without knowledge, and his words lack insight.
18:34:36/My wish is that Job may be tested to the utmost for responding like wicked people.
18:34:37/For he adds rebellion to his sin; he claps his hands among us, and multiplies his words against God.
18:35:1/Elihu continued speaking, saying,
18:35:2/Do you really think it's right to claim, "I am more righteous than God"?
18:35:3/You've asked, "What's in it for me?" and, "What do I gain by not sinning?"
18:35:4/I will respond to you and your friends as well.
18:35:5/Look up at the heavens and see; gaze at the clouds so high above you.
18:35:6/If you sin, how does it affect Him? Or if you keep sinning, what does it do to Him?
18:35:7/If you're righteous, what do you give Him? Or what does He receive from you?
18:35:8/Your wrongdoing may harm another person like yourself; and your righteousness may benefit another human.
18:35:9/Because of widespread oppression, the oppressed cry out; they scream for relief from the power of the mighty.
18:35:10/Yet no one asks, "Where is God my Creator, who inspires songs in the night,
18:35:11/Who teaches us more than the animals of the earth and makes us wiser than the birds in the sky?"
18:35:12/There they cry out, but no one answers, due to the arrogance of wicked people.
18:35:13/Indeed, God does not listen to empty pleas, nor does the Almighty pay attention to them.
18:35:14/Even though you claim you can't see Him, judgment is before Him; so you should trust in Him.
18:35:15/But now, because things are not as you say, He has acted out of anger; yet you do not recognize the severity of it.
18:35:16/Therefore, Job speaks without purpose; he multiplies words without understanding.
18:36:1/Elihu also proceeded, and said, 
18:36:2/Allow me a moment, and I will show you that I still have things to say about God.
18:36:3/I will bring my knowledge from afar, and will attribute righteousness to my Creator.
18:36:4/Indeed, my words will be truthful: someone with perfect knowledge is with you.
18:36:5/Look, God is powerful, and does not despise anyone: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
18:36:6/He does not preserve the life of the wicked: but gives justice to the poor.
18:36:7/He does not take his eyes off the righteous: but with kings, they are on the throne; yes, he establishes them forever, and they are lifted high.
18:36:8/And if they are bound in chains, and caught in the ropes of suffering; 
18:36:9/Then he shows them their actions, and their sins that they have gone beyond.
18:36:10/He also opens their ear to correction, and commands that they turn away from sin.
18:36:11/If they listen and serve him, they will spend their days in prosperity, and their years in joy.
18:36:12/But if they do not listen, they will perish by the sword, and they will die without understanding.
18:36:13/But the hypocrites in heart accumulate anger: they do not cry out when he binds them.
18:36:14/They die young, and their life ends among the impure.
18:36:15/He rescues the poor in their suffering, and opens their ears in oppression.
18:36:16/In the same way, he would have led you out of a tight spot into a spacious place, where there is no confinement; and what is set on your table would be rich in abundance.
18:36:17/But you have followed the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice catch up with you.
18:36:18/Because there is anger, be careful lest he sweep you away with a blow: then no great ransom can free you.
18:36:19/Will he value your wealth? No, not gold, nor all the forces of power.
18:36:20/Do not long for the night, when people are cut off in their place.
18:36:21/Be careful, do not look favorably on sin: for you have chosen this rather than suffering.
18:36:22/Look, God is lifted high by his power: who teaches like him? 
18:36:23/Who has directed his path? or who can say, You have done wrong? 
18:36:24/Remember to praise his work, which people observe.
18:36:25/Everyone can see it; people can view it from afar.
18:36:26/Look, God is immense, and we do not fully understand him, nor can the number of his years be discovered.
18:36:27/For he makes small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to its vapor: 
18:36:28/Which the clouds drop and distill upon people abundantly.
18:36:29/Can anyone understand the spreading of the clouds, or the thunder from his dwelling? 
18:36:30/Look, he spreads his light over it, and covers the depths of the sea.
18:36:31/For by these, he judges the people; he provides food in abundance.
18:36:32/With clouds, he covers the light; and commands it not to shine through the cloud that comes between.
18:36:33/The thunder announces his presence, the livestock also sense the approaching storm.
18:37:1/This also makes my heart tremble and moves it from its place.
18:37:2/Listen closely to the sound of his voice, and the noise that comes from his mouth.
18:37:3/He directs it across the entire sky, and his lightning to the ends of the earth.
18:37:4/After it, a voice roars: he thunders with the voice of his majesty; and he does not hold them back when his voice is heard.
18:37:5/God thunders wonderfully with his voice; he does great things that we cannot understand.
18:37:6/For he commands the snow, 'Fall on the earth'; likewise to the light rain, and to the heavy rain of his strength.
18:37:7/He seals up the hand of every person; so that all people may know his work.
18:37:8/Then the animals go into hiding and stay in their lairs.
18:37:9/From the south comes the storm, and cold from the north.
18:37:10/By the breath of God, frost is created, and the expanse of the waters is restricted.
18:37:11/Also, by watering, he tires the thick cloud; he scatters his bright cloud.
18:37:12/And it is turned around by his guidance: so that they may do whatever he commands them on the face of the inhabited earth.
18:37:13/He causes it to happen, whether for discipline, or for his land, or for kindness.
18:37:14/Pay attention to this, O Job: stop and consider the marvelous works of God.
18:37:15/Do you know when God dispatches them, and causes the light of his cloud to shine?
18:37:16/Do you know the balance of the clouds, the marvelous works of him who is perfect in knowledge?
18:37:17/How your clothes become warm when he calms the earth with the south wind?
18:37:18/Have you, with him, spread out the sky, which is strong, and like a cast mirror?
18:37:19/Teach us what we should say to him; we cannot arrange our words because of darkness.
18:37:20/Should it be reported to him that I wish to speak? If someone speaks, surely they will be swallowed up.
18:37:21/And now, people do not see the bright light in the clouds, but the wind passes and clears them.
18:37:22/Clear weather comes from the north: with God is awesome majesty.
18:37:23/Concerning the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, in judgment, and abundant in righteousness; he does not oppress.
18:37:24/Therefore, people revere him: he does not regard those who think themselves wise.
18:38:1/Then the LORD answered Job from the whirlwind, saying,
18:38:2/Who is this that obscures my plans with words lacking insight?
18:38:3/Brace yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall answer me.
18:38:4/Where were you when I laid the earth's foundation? Tell me, if you have understanding.
18:38:5/Who determined its measurements—surely you know! Or who stretched the measuring line across it?
18:38:6/On what were its footings set, or who laid its cornerstone,
18:38:7/While the morning stars sang together, and all the angels shouted for joy?
18:38:8/Who contained the sea behind doors when it burst forth from the womb,
18:38:9/When I made the clouds its garment and wrapped it in thick darkness,
18:38:10/When I fixed limits for it and set its doors and bars in place,
18:38:11/And said, 'This far you may come and no farther; here is where your proud waves halt'?
18:38:12/Have you ever commanded the morning to appear and caused the dawn to know its place,
18:38:13/So that it might take the earth by the edges and shake the wicked out of it?
18:38:14/The earth takes shape like clay under a seal; its features stand out like those of a garment.
18:38:15/But the light of the wicked is withheld, and their uplifted arm is broken.
18:38:16/Have you journeyed to the springs of the sea or walked in the recesses of the deep?
18:38:17/Have the gates of death been revealed to you? Or have you seen the gates of the shadow of death?
18:38:18/Have you comprehended the vast expanses of the earth? Tell me, if you know all this.
18:38:19/Where does light reside, and where is the place of darkness,
18:38:20/That you might lead it to its boundaries and discern the paths to its home?
18:38:21/Surely you know, for you were born then, and the number of your days is great!
18:38:22/Have you entered the storehouses of the snow or seen the storehouses of the hail,
18:38:23/Which I reserve for times of trouble, for days of war and battle?
18:38:24/What is the path to where lightning is dispersed, or the place where the east winds are scattered over the earth?
18:38:25/Who has cut a channel for the torrents of rain, and a path for the thunderstorm,
18:38:26/To water a land where no one lives, an uninhabited desert,
18:38:27/To satisfy a desolate wasteland and make it sprout with grass?
18:38:28/Does the rain have a father? Who fathers the drops of dew?
18:38:29/From whose womb comes the ice? Who gives birth to the frost from the heavens
18:38:30/When the waters become hard as stone, when the surface of the deep is frozen?
18:38:31/Can you bind the chains of the Pleiades or loose the cords of Orion?
18:38:32/Can you bring forth the constellations in their seasons or lead out the Bear with its cubs?
18:38:33/Do you know the laws of the heavens? Can you set up God's dominion over the earth?
18:38:34/Can you raise your voice to the clouds and cover yourself with a flood of water?
18:38:35/Can you send lightning bolts on their way? Do they report to you, 'Here we are'?
18:38:36/Who has put wisdom in the innermost being or given understanding to the mind?
18:38:37/Who has the wisdom to count the clouds? Who can tip over the water jars of the heavens
18:38:38/When the dust becomes hard and the clods of earth stick together?
18:38:39/Can you hunt the prey for the lion or satisfy the hunger of the young lions
18:38:40/When they crouch in their dens or lie in wait in a thicket?
18:38:41/Who provides food for the raven when its young cry out to God and wander about for lack of food?
18:39:1/Do you know when the mountain goats give birth? Can you watch when the deer gives birth?
18:39:2/Can you count the months they carry their young? Do you know the time they give birth?
18:39:3/They crouch down, they give birth to their young, they get rid of their pain.
18:39:4/Their offspring thrive and grow strong in the wild; they leave and do not return.
18:39:5/Who has let the wild donkey go free? Who has untied the ropes of the wild donkey?
18:39:6/I have made the wilderness its home, and the salt flats its habitat.
18:39:7/It laughs at the commotion of the town; it does not hear the shouts of a driver.
18:39:8/It roams the mountains for its pasture and searches for any green thing.
18:39:9/Will the wild ox consent to serve you? Will it stay by your manger at night?
18:39:10/Can you hold the wild ox in a furrow with a harness? Will it plow the valleys behind you?
18:39:11/Would you rely on it for its great strength? Would you leave your heavy work to it?
18:39:12/Can you trust it to haul in your grain and bring it to your threshing floor?
18:39:13/Did you give the peacock its beautiful wings, or wings and feathers to the ostrich?
18:39:14/Which leaves its eggs on the ground and warms them in the dust,
18:39:15/Forgetting that a foot might crush them, or that wild animals might trample them.
18:39:16/She treats her young harshly, as if they were not hers; she is unconcerned that her labor might be in vain,
18:39:17/Because God has not endowed her with wisdom, nor given her a share of understanding.
18:39:18/Yet when she spreads her feathers to run, she laughs at horse and rider.
18:39:19/Have you given the horse its strength? Have you clothed its neck with a mane that quivers?
18:39:20/Can you make it leap like a locust? Its majestic snorting is terrifying.
18:39:21/It paws in the valley and rejoices in its strength; it charges into the fray.
18:39:22/It laughs at fear, unafraid; it does not shy away from the sword.
18:39:23/The quiver rattles against it, along with the flashing spear and shield.
18:39:24/With fierce and raging excitement it swallows the ground; it cannot stand still at the sound of the trumpet.
18:39:25/At the trumpet's blast it snorts, 'Aha!' It smells the battle from afar, the thunder of the captains, and the war cry.
18:39:26/Is it by your understanding that the hawk soars, stretching her wings toward the south?
18:39:27/Is it at your command that the eagle mounts up and makes her nest on high?
18:39:28/She lives and stays on the rock, on the crag of the rock and the stronghold.
18:39:29/From there she seeks out food; her eyes detect it from afar.
18:39:30/Her young ones also suck up blood; and where the slain are, there she is.
18:40:1/Furthermore, the LORD responded to Job, saying,
18:40:2/Does the one who argues with the Almighty think they can teach Him? Anyone who criticizes God, let them respond.
18:40:3/Then Job replied to the LORD, saying,
18:40:4/I am insignificant; what can I possibly say to you? I will cover my mouth with my hand.
18:40:5/I have spoken once, but I will not speak again; yes, twice, but I will add nothing more.
18:40:6/Then the LORD answered Job from the storm, saying,
18:40:7/Prepare yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall inform me.
18:40:8/Do you also wish to nullify my judgment? Do you condemn me so you can be declared righteous?
18:40:9/Do you have an arm like God's? Or can you thunder with a voice like His?
18:40:10/Now adorn yourself with majesty and splendor; clothe yourself with glory and beauty.
18:40:11/Unleash the fury of your anger; look at everyone who is proud and humble them.
18:40:12/Observe everyone who is proud, bring them down; and crush the wicked where they stand.
18:40:13/Bury them all in the dust together; shroud their faces in obscurity.
18:40:14/Then I will admit to you that your own right hand can save you.
18:40:15/Look now at the behemoth, which I created just as I created you; it eats grass like an ox.
18:40:16/See now, its strength is in its hips, and its power is in the muscles of its belly.
18:40:17/It sways its tail like a cedar; the tendons of its thighs are tightly knit.
18:40:18/Its bones are like tubes of bronze; its limbs are like bars of iron.
18:40:19/It ranks first among the works of God; only its Maker can approach it with His sword.
18:40:20/The mountains yield food for it, where all the wild animals play.
18:40:21/It lies under the lotus plants, in the shelter of the reeds and marsh.
18:40:22/The lotus trees cover it with their shade; the willows by the brook surround it.
18:40:23/Behold, it drinks up a river and is not alarmed; it is confident, though the Jordan rushes into its mouth.
18:40:24/It catches sight with its eyes; its nostrils pierce through traps.
18:41:1/Can you catch Leviathan with a hook, or trap his tongue with a line you lower?
18:41:2/Can you put a hook into his nose, or pierce his jaw with a spike?
18:41:3/Will he beg you for mercy or speak gently to you?
18:41:4/Will he make a deal with you, to serve you forever?
18:41:5/Can you play with him like a bird, or tie him up for your girls?
18:41:6/Will your friends have a feast with him, will they divide him up among the traders?
18:41:7/Can you fill his skin with harpoons, or his head with fishing spears?
18:41:8/Touch him once and you'll never forget the battle that follows.
18:41:9/See, any hope of subduing him is false; will not one be overwhelmed at just the sight of him?
18:41:10/No one is so brave that they dare stir him up. Who then can stand against me?
18:41:11/Who has given to me that I should repay him? Everything under heaven belongs to me.
18:41:12/I will not hide his limbs, his mighty power, or his graceful proportions.
18:41:13/Who can strip off his outer coat? Who can penetrate his double coat of armor?
18:41:14/Who can open the doors of his face, ringed about with fearsome teeth?
18:41:15/His back is made of rows of shields, shut up tightly as with a seal.
18:41:16/Each is so close to the next that no air can pass between.
18:41:17/They are joined to one another, they clasp each other and cannot be separated.
18:41:18/His sneezing flashes forth light, and his eyes are like the eyelids of dawn.
18:41:19/Out of his mouth go flaming torches; sparks of fire leap out.
18:41:20/Smoke pours from his nostrils, as from a boiling pot over burning reeds.
18:41:21/His breath sets coals ablaze, and flames dart from his mouth.
18:41:22/Strength resides in his neck, and despair turns into joy before him.
18:41:23/The folds of his flesh are tightly joined; they are firm and immovable.
18:41:24/His heart is as hard as stone, even as hard as a lower millstone.
18:41:25/When he rises up, the mighty are terrified; they retreat before his thrashing.
18:41:26/The sword that reaches him has no effect, nor does the spear, the dart, or the javelin.
18:41:27/He treats iron as straw and bronze as rotten wood.
18:41:28/Arrows do not make him flee; slingstones are turned to rubble against him.
18:41:29/Clubs are regarded as straw; he laughs at the rattling of the lance.
18:41:30/His undersides are like sharp potsherds; he spreads jagged marks in the mud.
18:41:31/He makes the depths churn like a boiling cauldron and stirs up the sea like a pot of ointment.
18:41:32/Behind him he leaves a glistening wake; one would think the deep had white hair.
18:41:33/On earth, there is nothing like him, a creature without fear.
18:41:34/He looks down on all that are haughty; he is king over all that are proud.
18:42:1/Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
18:42:2/I know that you can do everything, and that no thought can be hidden from you.
18:42:3/Who is he that hides counsel without knowledge? Therefore, I have spoken of things I did not understand, things too wonderful for me, which I did not know.
18:42:4/Listen, please, and I will speak: I will ask you, and you inform me.
18:42:5/I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear: but now my eye sees you.
18:42:6/Therefore, I despise myself, and repent in dust and ashes.
18:42:7/And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words to Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against you, and against your two friends: for you have not spoken of me what is right, as my servant Job has.
18:42:8/Therefore, take for yourselves now seven bulls and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal with you according to your folly, because you have not spoken of me what is right, like my servant Job.
18:42:9/So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did as the LORD commanded them: the LORD also accepted Job.
18:42:10/And the LORD restored the fortunes of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.
18:42:11/Then all his brothers, and all his sisters, and all those who had been his acquaintances before, came to him, and ate bread with him in his house: and they consoled him, and comforted him over all the adversity that the LORD had brought upon him: each one also gave him a piece of money, and each a gold earring.
18:42:12/So the LORD blessed the latter part of Job's life more than his beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand female donkeys.
18:42:13/He also had seven sons and three daughters.
18:42:14/And he named the first Jemima; and the second, Kezia; and the third, Kerenhappuch.
18:42:15/And in all the land no women were found as beautiful as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them an inheritance among their brothers.
18:42:16/After this, Job lived a hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, to four generations.
18:42:17/So Job died, old and full of days.
19:1:1/Happy is the person who doesn't follow the advice of the wicked, doesn't stand in the path of sinners, nor sits in the company of mockers.
19:1:2/But finds joy in the teachings of the LORD, meditating on them day and night.
19:1:3/They will be like a tree planted by streams of water, producing fruit in its season, whose leaves do not wither, and everything they do will succeed.
19:1:4/The wicked are not like this; instead, they are like chaff that the wind blows away.
19:1:5/Therefore, the wicked will not withstand judgment, nor will sinners be part of the gathering of the righteous.
19:1:6/For the LORD watches over the path of the righteous, but the path of the wicked leads to destruction.
19:2:1/Why do nations rebel, and the people plot futile things?
19:2:2/The kings of the earth take their stand, and the rulers conspire together, against the LORD and against his anointed one, saying,
19:2:3/"Let's break their chains and throw off their shackles."
19:2:4/The One enthroned in heaven laughs; the Lord scoffs at them.
19:2:5/Then he will speak to them in his anger and terrify them in his fury.
19:2:6/Yet I have installed my king on Zion, my holy mountain.
19:2:7/I will proclaim the LORD's decree: He said to me, "You are my Son; today I have become your father.
19:2:8/Ask me, and I will make the nations your inheritance, the ends of the earth your possession.
19:2:9/You will break them with a rod of iron; you will shatter them like pottery."
19:2:10/So now, you kings, be wise; be warned, you rulers of the earth.
19:2:11/Serve the LORD with fear and celebrate his rule with trembling.
19:2:12/Pay homage to the Son, lest he become angry and you be destroyed in your way, for his wrath can flare up in a moment. Blessed are all who take refuge in him.
19:3:1/Lord, how the number of my troubles has increased! Many are those who rise up against me.
19:3:2/Many are saying about me, "God won't save him." Selah.
19:3:3/But you, O LORD, are a shield around me; my glory, and the one who lifts my head high.
19:3:4/I called out to the LORD with my voice, and he answered me from his holy mountain. Selah.
19:3:5/I lay down and slept; I woke up again because the LORD supported me.
19:3:6/I will not fear even if tens of thousands assail me on every side.
19:3:7/Rise up, O LORD; save me, my God! For you have struck all my enemies on the jaw; you have broken the teeth of the wicked.
19:3:8/Salvation belongs to the LORD; your blessing is on your people. Selah.
19:4:1/Listen to me when I call, O God who makes me right: you've given me space when I was under pressure; be merciful to me, and listen to my prayer.
19:4:2/Hey, people, how long will you turn my honor into disgrace? How long will you chase after what's meaningless and pursue lies? Pause and think.
19:4:3/But understand that the LORD has chosen the devout for himself: the LORD will listen when I call to him.
19:4:4/Be amazed, and don't sin: talk with your own heart on your bed, and be quiet. Pause and think.
19:4:5/Make your sacrifices out of what's right, and place your trust in the LORD.
19:4:6/There are many who ask, "Who can show us anything good?" LORD, let the light of your face shine on us.
19:4:7/You have filled my heart with joy, more than when their grain and wine abound.
19:4:8/I will lie down and sleep in peace, for you alone, LORD, make me live in safety.
19:5:1/Listen to my words, O LORD, pay attention to my thoughts.
19:5:2/Pay attention to my cry for help, my King and my God, because I will pray to you.
19:5:3/You will hear my voice in the morning, O LORD; in the morning, I will send my prayers to you and wait expectantly.
19:5:4/For you are not a God who takes pleasure in evil; wickedness cannot dwell with you.
19:5:5/The foolish cannot stand in your presence; you despise all who do wrong.
19:5:6/You will destroy those who tell lies; the LORD detests the violent and deceitful.
19:5:7/But as for me, I will enter your house because of your great mercy; in reverence, I will bow down towards your holy temple.
19:5:8/Guide me, O LORD, in your righteousness because of my enemies; make your way clear before me.
19:5:9/There is nothing reliable in what they say; their innermost self is full of malice; their throat is an open grave; they flatter with their tongue.
19:5:10/Eliminate them, O God; let them be caught in their own schemes; throw them out for their many sins, for they have rebelled against you.
19:5:11/But let all who take refuge in you be glad; let them always sing for joy. Spread your protection over them, that those who love your name may rejoice in you.
19:5:12/For you, LORD, will bless the righteous; you will surround them with your favor as with a shield.
19:6:1/O LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger, nor discipline me in your wrath.
19:6:2/Have mercy on me, O LORD; for I am frail: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are deeply troubled.
19:6:3/My soul is also deeply troubled: but you, O LORD, how long will it be?
19:6:4/Come back, O LORD, rescue my soul: save me because of your kindness.
19:6:5/For in death there is no memory of you: in the grave who will praise you?
19:6:6/I am exhausted from my moaning; every night my bed is drenched; I soak my couch with my tears.
19:6:7/My eye is dimmed because of sorrow; it grows old because of all my adversaries.
19:6:8/Go away from me, all you who do evil; for the LORD has heard the sound of my weeping.
19:6:9/The LORD has heard my plea; the LORD will accept my prayer.
19:6:10/May all my enemies be disgraced and deeply troubled: may they turn back and be disgraced suddenly.
19:7:1/O LORD my God, I trust in you: save me from all who persecute me, and rescue me:
19:7:2/So they don't tear my soul apart like a lion, shredding it, with no one to save me.
19:7:3/O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there is wrongdoing in my hands;
19:7:4/If I have repaid someone with evil who was at peace with me; (indeed, I have even helped the one who was unjustly my enemy:)
19:7:5/Let the enemy chase after my soul, and capture it; let him trample my life to the ground, and lay my honor in the dust. Pause and think about that.
19:7:6/Rise up, O LORD, in your anger, stand up against the fury of my enemies: and wake up for me to the judgment you have ordered.
19:7:7/Then the assembly of the people will surround you: for their sake, therefore, rise to your throne.
19:7:8/The LORD will judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and the integrity that is within me.
19:7:9/Let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous: for the just God examines the heart and mind.
19:7:10/My defense comes from God, who saves those who are pure in heart.
19:7:11/God judges the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every single day.
19:7:12/If they do not turn, he will sharpen his sword; he has drawn his bow, and prepared it.
19:7:13/He has also prepared deadly weapons for them; he makes his arrows fiery shafts against the persecutors.
19:7:14/See, they are in labor with evil, they conceive trouble, and give birth to lies.
19:7:15/They dig a pit, and excavate it, and then fall into the hole they have made.
19:7:16/Their trouble will come back on their own heads, and their violence will descend on their own skulls.
19:7:17/I will praise the LORD for his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD Most High.

19:8:2/From the mouths of infants and nursing babies, you have established strength because of your adversaries, to silence the enemy and the avenger.
19:8:3/When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers, the moon and the stars, which you have set in place;
19:8:4/What is humanity, that you think of them? And the children of man, that you care for them?
19:8:5/For you have made them slightly less than divine beings, and have crowned them with glory and honor.

19:8:7/All sheep and oxen, indeed, and the wild animals of the field;
