19:16:8/I keep the LORD constantly before me; because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
19:16:9/Therefore, my heart is joyful, and my soul rejoices; my body also will rest in hope.
19:16:10/For you will not abandon my soul to the grave; nor will you let your Holy One see decay.
19:16:11/You will show me the way of life; being in your presence brings complete joy; at your right hand, there are eternal pleasures.
19:17:1/Listen to what is right, LORD, pay attention to my cry, listen to my prayer that comes from sincere lips.
19:17:2/Let my judgment come directly from you; let your eyes see what is fair.
19:17:3/You have tested my heart; you have visited me in the night; you have tried me, and will find nothing wrong; I have resolved that my mouth will not sin.
19:17:4/Regarding the actions of people, by the words of your lips I have avoided the ways of the violent.
19:17:5/Guide my steps in your paths, so that my feet do not slip.
19:17:6/I have called on you, because you will answer me, God: turn your ear to me, and listen to my words.
19:17:7/Show your wonderful love, O you who save by your right hand those who take refuge in you from their adversaries.
19:17:8/Protect me as the apple of your eye, hide me in the shadow of your wings,
19:17:9/From the wicked who do me harm, from my mortal enemies who surround me.
19:17:10/They are closed in by their own fat: with their mouths they speak arrogantly.
19:17:11/They have now surrounded us in our steps; they set their eyes to cast us to the ground.
19:17:12/Like a lion eager for its prey, and like a young lion lurking in hiding places.
19:17:13/Rise up, LORD, confront them, bring them down: rescue my life from the wicked, who are your instruments.
19:17:14/From people who are your hand, LORD, from people of the world, whose portion is in this life, and whose belly you fill with your hidden treasure: they are satisfied with children, and leave their abundance to their offspring.
19:17:15/As for me, I will see your face in righteousness: I will be satisfied, when I awake, with seeing your likeness.
19:18:1/I will love you, O LORD, my strength.
19:18:2/The LORD is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my shield, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
19:18:3/I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy of praise: so I will be saved from my enemies.
19:18:4/The pains of death surrounded me, and the floods of wickedness made me afraid.
19:18:5/The pains of hell surrounded me: the traps of death confronted me.
19:18:6/In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried to my God: he heard my voice from his temple, and my cry came before him, into his ears.
19:18:7/Then the earth shook and quaked; the foundations of the mountains trembled and were shaken, because he was angry.
19:18:8/Smoke rose from his nostrils, and devouring fire from his mouth; coals were ignited by it.
19:18:9/He parted the heavens and came down; darkness was under his feet.
19:18:10/And he rode upon a cherub, and flew; yes, he flew upon the wings of the wind.
19:18:11/He made darkness his hiding place; his canopy around him was dark waters and thick clouds.
19:18:12/At the brightness before him, his thick clouds passed, hailstones and coals of fire.
19:18:13/The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Most High uttered his voice; hailstones and coals of fire.
19:18:14/Yes, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and confused them.
19:18:15/Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were revealed at your rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.
19:18:16/He reached down from on high, he took me; he drew me out of deep waters.
19:18:17/He rescued me from my powerful enemy, and from those who hated me, for they were too strong for me.
19:18:18/They confronted me in the day of my disaster: but the LORD was my support.
19:18:19/He brought me out into a spacious place; he rescued me because he delighted in me.
19:18:20/The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands he has repaid me.
19:18:21/For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
19:18:22/For all his judgments were before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.
19:18:23/I was also blameless before him, and I kept myself from my sin.
19:18:24/Therefore the LORD has repaid me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
19:18:25/With the merciful you show yourself merciful; with an upright man you show yourself upright;
19:18:26/With the pure you show yourself pure; and with the crooked you show yourself shrewd.
19:18:27/For you will save the afflicted people; but will bring down high looks.
19:18:28/For you will light my lamp: the LORD my God will illuminate my darkness.
19:18:29/For by you I have run through a troop; and by my God I have leaped over a wall.
19:18:30/As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the LORD is proven: he is a shield to all those that trust in him.
19:18:31/For who is God except the LORD? or who is a rock except our God?
19:18:32/It is God who arms me with strength, and makes my way perfect.
19:18:33/He makes my feet like the feet of a deer, and sets me on my high places.
19:18:34/He trains my hands for battle, so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
19:18:35/You have also given me the shield of your salvation: and your right hand has held me up, and your gentleness has made me great.
19:18:36/You have broadened my path beneath me, so that my ankles did not turn.
19:18:37/I pursued my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn back until they were destroyed.
19:18:38/I crushed them so they could not rise; they fell beneath my feet.
19:18:39/For you equipped me with strength for the battle; you made those who rose against me bow down under me.
19:18:40/You also gave me the necks of my enemies, so that I might destroy those who hate me.
19:18:41/They cried for help, but there was no one to save them; they even cried to the LORD, but he did not answer them.
19:18:42/Then I beat them as fine as the dust before the wind; I cast them out like the mud in the streets.
19:18:43/You have delivered me from the strife of the people; you have made me the head of nations; people I had not known serve me.
19:18:44/As soon as they hear of me, they obey me; foreigners submit to me.
19:18:45/Foreigners lose heart and come trembling out of their fortresses.
19:18:46/The LORD lives; blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.
19:18:47/It is God who avenges me, and subdues peoples under me.
19:18:48/He delivers me from my enemies; indeed, you lift me up above those who rise against me; you have rescued me from the violent man.
19:18:49/Therefore I will give thanks to you, O LORD, among the nations, and sing praises to your name.
19:18:50/Great salvation he brings to his king; and shows mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his descendants forever.
19:19:1/The sky displays the majesty of God; the expanse shows the work of his hands.
19:19:2/Each day tells the next one, and each night reveals knowledge to the next.
19:19:3/There is no speech or language where their voice is not heard.
19:19:4/Their message has spread throughout the earth, and their words to the ends of the world. He has set a home in the heavens for the sun,
19:19:5/Which is like a groom leaving his room, and celebrates like an athlete eager to run a race.
19:19:6/It rises at one end of the heavens and makes its circuit to the other; nothing is deprived of its warmth.
19:19:7/The law of the LORD is flawless, refreshing the soul: the decree of the LORD is trustworthy, giving wisdom to the simple.
19:19:8/The precepts of the LORD are right, bringing joy to the heart: the command of the LORD is clear, giving insight for living.
19:19:9/Revering the LORD is pure, lasting forever: the decrees of the LORD are true, completely righteous.
19:19:10/They are more desirable than gold, even the finest gold; they are sweeter than honey, even honey dripping from the comb.
19:19:11/Also, by them your servant is warned; in keeping them there is great reward.
19:19:12/Who can discern their own mistakes? Forgive my hidden faults.
19:19:13/Also keep your servant from willful sins; may they not rule over me. Then I will be blameless, innocent of great sin.

19:22:1/My God, my God, why have you abandoned me? Why are you so far from saving me, and from hearing my cries of anguish?
19:22:2/Oh my God, I cry out during the day, but you do not answer; and at night, but I find no rest.
19:22:3/Yet you are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.
19:22:4/Our ancestors put their trust in you; they trusted, and you rescued them.
19:22:5/They cried out to you and were saved; they trusted in you and were not disappointed.
19:22:6/But I am a worm, not even human; scorned by everyone, despised by the people.
19:22:7/All who see me mock me; they sneer and shake their heads, saying,
19:22:8/"He relied on the Lord; let the Lord rescue him. Let him deliver him, since he delights in him."
19:22:9/But you are the one who brought me forth from the womb; you made me trust you at my mother's breasts.
19:22:10/From birth I was cast on you; from my mother's womb, you have been my God.
19:22:11/Do not be far from me, for trouble is near and there is no one to help.
19:22:12/Many bulls surround me; strong bulls of Bashan encircle me.
19:22:13/They open their mouths wide at me, like a tearing and roaring lion.
19:22:14/I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of place. My heart has turned to wax; it has melted within me.
19:22:15/My strength is dried up like a piece of pottery; my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth; you lay me in the dust of death.
19:22:16/For dogs have surrounded me; a band of evil men has encircled me, they have pierced my hands and my feet.
19:22:17/I can count all my bones. People stare and gloat over me.
19:22:18/They divide my clothes among them and cast lots for my garment.
19:22:19/But you, O Lord, do not be far off. O my Strength, come quickly to help me.
19:22:20/Rescue my life from the sword, my precious life from the power of the dogs.
19:22:21/Save me from the lion's mouth; from the horns of the wild oxen, you have answered me.
19:22:22/I will declare your name to my brothers and sisters; in the assembly, I will praise you.

19:22:24/For he has not despised or scorned the suffering of the afflicted one; he has not hidden his face from him but has listened to his cry for help.
19:22:25/My praise comes from you in the great assembly; I will fulfill my vows before those who fear him.
19:22:26/The poor will eat and be satisfied; those who seek the Lord will praise him—may your hearts live forever!

19:22:28/For dominion belongs to the Lord and he rules over the nations.
19:22:29/All the rich of the earth will feast and worship; all who go down to the dust will kneel before him—those who cannot keep themselves alive.

19:69:1/Save me, O God; for the waters have risen up to my soul.
19:69:2/I'm sinking in deep mud with no foothold; I've entered deep waters, and the flood sweeps over me.
19:69:3/I'm exhausted from crying; my throat is parched: my eyes grow dim waiting for my God.
19:69:4/Those who hate me without reason outnumber the hairs of my head; those who seek to destroy me are powerful, even though I did nothing to them.
19:69:5/O God, you know my foolishness; my sins are not hidden from you.
19:69:6/Let not those who hope in you be put to shame because of me, O Lord GOD of hosts; let not those who seek you be dishonored because of me, O God of Israel.
19:69:7/Because for your sake I have faced disgrace; shame has covered my face.
19:69:8/I have become a stranger to my brothers, an outsider to my own mother's children.
19:69:9/For zeal for your house consumes me, and the insults of those who insult you fall on me.
19:69:10/When I wept and fasted, it brought me scorn.
19:69:11/I made sackcloth my clothing, and I became a byword to them.
19:69:12/Those who sit at the city gate gossip about me, and drunkards make up songs about me.
19:69:13/But as for me, my prayer is to you, O LORD, at an acceptable time; O God, in your great mercy, answer me with your sure salvation.
19:69:14/Rescue me from the mud, don't let me sink; deliver me from those who hate me, and from the deep waters.
19:69:15/Do not let the floodwaters engulf me or the depths swallow me up; do not let the pit close its mouth over me.
19:69:16/Hear me, O LORD, for your steadfast love is good; turn to me according to your abundant mercy.
19:69:17/Do not hide your face from your servant, for I am in distress; answer me quickly.
19:69:18/Come near and rescue my soul; redeem me because of my enemies.
19:69:19/You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor; all my adversaries are before you.
19:69:20/Insults have broken my heart, and I am in despair. I looked for sympathy, but there was none; for comforters, but I found none.
19:69:21/They also gave me gall for my food, and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

19:69:25/Let their camp be desolate; let no one dwell in their tents.
19:69:26/For they persecute those you have struck, and they recount the pain of those you have wounded.
19:69:27/Add guilt to their guilt; let them not enter into your righteousness.
19:69:28/Let them be wiped out of the book of life and not be recorded with the righteous.
19:69:29/But I am afflicted and in pain; let your salvation, O God, set me on high.

19:73:1/God is truly good to Israel, especially to those with a pure heart.
19:73:2/But as for me, I almost lost my footing; my steps nearly slipped.
19:73:3/I felt envious of the foolish when I saw the success of the wicked.
19:73:4/They don't suffer in their death; their strength remains strong.
19:73:5/They don't face troubles like others; they aren't afflicted like everyone else.
19:73:6/So pride surrounds them like a chain; violence covers them like clothing.
19:73:7/Their eyes bulge with fatness; they have more than they could ever want.
19:73:8/They are corrupt and speak maliciously about oppression; they speak arrogantly.
19:73:9/They blaspheme against heaven, and their tongues strut across the earth.
19:73:10/So God's people turn to them, and they drink their fill of the cup of abundance.
19:73:11/And they say, "How does God know? Does the Most High have knowledge?"
19:73:12/Look, these are the wicked, always at ease, increasing in wealth.

19:73:14/For I am afflicted all day long and punished every morning.
19:73:15/If I had said, "I will speak like them," I would have betrayed your children.

19:73:18/Indeed, you place them on slippery ground; you cast them down to ruin.

19:73:22/I was senseless and ignorant; I was like a brute beast before you.
19:73:23/Yet I am always with you; you hold me by my right hand.
19:73:24/You guide me with your counsel, and later you will take me into glory.
19:73:25/Whom do I have in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you.

19:74:3/Step into the endless ruins; see all the destruction the enemy has caused in the sanctuary.

19:74:6/But now they tear down its beautifully carved work all at once with axes and hammers.

19:78:3/These are things we have heard and known, things our ancestors have told us.

19:78:6/So the next generation would know them, even the children yet to be born, and they in turn would tell their children.
19:78:7/Then they would put their trust in God and not forget his deeds but keep his commands.
19:78:8/They would not be like their ancestors—a stubborn and rebellious generation, whose hearts were not loyal to God, whose spirits were not faithful to him.
19:78:9/The warriors of Ephraim, though armed with bows, turned back on the day of battle.
19:78:10/They did not keep God's covenant and refused to live by his law.
19:78:11/They forgot what he had done, the wonders he had shown them.
19:78:12/He did miracles in the sight of their ancestors in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.
19:78:13/He split the sea and led them through; he made the water stand up like a wall.
19:78:14/He guided them with a cloud by day and with light from the fire all night.
19:78:15/He split rocks in the wilderness and gave them water as abundant as the seas.
19:78:16/He brought streams out of a rocky crag and made water flow down like rivers.
19:78:17/Yet they continued to sin against him, rebelling in the wilderness against the Most High.
19:78:18/They willfully tested God by demanding the food they craved.
19:78:19/They spoke against God; they said, "Can God spread a table in the wilderness?"
19:78:20/True, he struck the rock, and water gushed out, streams flowed abundantly, but can he also give us bread? Can he supply meat for his people?"
19:78:21/When the Lord heard them, he was furious; his fire broke out against Jacob, and his wrath rose against Israel,
19:78:22/Because they did not believe in God or trust in his deliverance.
19:78:23/Yet he had commanded the skies above and opened the doors of the heavens;
19:78:24/He rained down manna for them to eat, he gave them the grain of heaven.
19:78:25/Humans ate the bread of angels; he sent them all the food they could eat.
19:78:26/He let loose the east wind from the heavens and by his power made the south wind blow.
19:78:27/He rained meat down on them like dust, birds like sand on the seashore.
19:78:28/He made them fall inside their camp, all around their tents.
19:78:29/They ate till they were gorged—he had given them what they craved.
19:78:30/But before they turned from what they craved, even while the food was still in their mouths,
19:78:31/God's anger rose against them; he killed the sturdiest among them, cutting down the young men of Israel.
19:78:32/In spite of all this, they kept on sinning; despite his wonders, they did not believe.
19:78:33/So he ended their days in futility and their years in terror.
19:78:34/Whenever God slew them, they would seek him; they eagerly turned back to him.
19:78:35/They remembered that God was their Rock, that God Most High was their Redeemer.
19:78:36/But then they would flatter him with their mouths, lying to him with their tongues;
19:78:37/Their hearts were not loyal to him, they were not faithful to his covenant.
19:78:38/Yet he was merciful; he forgave their iniquities and did not destroy them. Time after time he restrained his anger and did not stir up his full wrath.
19:78:39/He remembered that they were but flesh, a passing breeze that does not return.
19:78:40/How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness and grieved him in the desert!
19:78:41/Again and again they tested God; they pushed the Holy One of Israel to the limit.
19:78:42/They did not remember his power—the day he redeemed them from the oppressor,
19:78:43/How he displayed his signs in Egypt, his wonders in the region of Zoan.
19:78:44/He turned their rivers into blood; they could not drink from their streams.
19:78:45/He sent swarms of flies that devoured them, and frogs that devastated them.
19:78:46/He gave their crops to the grasshopper, their produce to the locust.
19:78:47/He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore-figs with sleet.
19:78:48/He gave over their cattle to the hail, their livestock to bolts of lightning.
19:78:49/He unleashed against them his hot anger, his wrath, indignation, and hostility—a band of destroying angels.
19:78:50/He made a path for his anger; he did not spare them from death but gave their lives over to the plague.
19:78:51/He struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, the first fruits of manhood in the tents of Ham.
19:78:52/But he brought his own people out like sheep and led them in the wilderness like a flock.
19:78:53/He guided them safely, so they were unafraid; but the sea engulfed their enemies.
19:78:54/Thus he brought them to the border of his holy land, to the hill country his right hand had taken.
19:78:55/He drove out nations before them and allotted their lands to them as an inheritance; he settled the tribes of Israel in their homes.
19:78:56/But they put God to the test and rebelled against the Most High; they did not keep his statutes.
19:78:57/Like their ancestors they were disloyal and faithless, as unreliable as a faulty bow.
19:78:58/They angered him with their high places; they aroused his jealousy with their idols.
19:78:59/When God heard them, he was furious; he completely rejected Israel.
19:78:60/So he abandoned the dwelling at Shiloh, the tent he had set up among humans.
19:78:61/He sent the ark of his might into captivity, his splendor into the enemy's hands.
19:78:62/He gave his people over to the sword; he was furious with his inheritance.
19:78:63/Fire consumed their young men, and their maidens had no wedding songs;
19:78:64/Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows could not weep.
19:78:65/Then the Lord awoke as from sleep, like a warrior refreshed with wine.
19:78:66/He beat back his enemies; he put them to everlasting shame.

19:78:68/But he chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which he loved.

20:1:9/For they will be like a graceful garland on your head and necklaces around your neck.
20:1:10/My child, if sinners try to tempt you, do not give in.
20:1:11/If they say, "Come with us, let's hide and wait to attack someone innocent for no reason;
20:1:12/Let's swallow them whole, like the grave; completely, as those who go down to the pit;
20:1:13/We'll find all kinds of valuable things and fill our homes with loot;
20:1:14/Join us, and we'll all share the loot";
20:1:15/My child, do not go along with them, stay away from their path;
20:1:16/For their feet rush into evil, they're quick to shed blood.
20:1:17/Indeed, it's pointless to set a net where any bird can see it.
20:1:18/But these people set a trap for their own blood; they ambush only themselves.
20:1:19/That's the fate of all who are greedy for gain; it takes away the life of its possessors.
20:1:20/Wisdom calls out in the open; she raises her voice in the public squares;
20:1:21/She cries out at the busiest corners, at the city gates she speaks her words, saying,
20:1:22/"How long, you naive people, will you love being simple-minded? Scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
20:1:23/Turn at my warning: see, I will pour out my spirit on you, I will make my words known to you.
20:1:24/Because I called and you refused; I reached out, and no one paid attention;
20:1:25/But you ignored all my advice, and did not want my correction;
20:1:26/I too will laugh when disaster strikes you; I will mock when what you fear comes;
20:1:27/When what you fear comes like a storm, and your disaster comes like a whirlwind; when distress and anguish come upon you.
20:1:28/Then they will call on me, but I will not answer; they will look for me, but will not find me:
20:1:29/Because they hated knowledge, and did not choose to respect the LORD:
20:1:30/They wanted none of my advice; they despised all my correction.
20:1:31/Therefore, they will eat the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own schemes.
20:1:32/For the waywardness of the naive will kill them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them.
20:1:33/But whoever listens to me will live securely and be at ease, without fear of harm.
20:2:1/My child, if you accept my words and store up my commands within you;
20:2:2/So that you turn your ear to wisdom, and apply your heart to understanding;
20:2:3/Indeed, if you call out for insight and cry aloud for understanding;
20:2:4/If you look for it as for silver and search for it as for hidden treasure;
20:2:5/Then you will understand what it means to fear the LORD, and you will gain knowledge of God.
20:2:6/For the LORD gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.
20:2:7/He holds success in store for the upright, he is a shield to those whose walk is blameless,
20:2:8/He guards the courses of justice and protects the way of his faithful ones.
20:2:9/Then you will understand what is right and just and fair—every good path.
20:2:10/When wisdom enters your heart, and knowledge is delightful to your soul,
20:2:11/Discretion will protect you, understanding will guard you,
20:2:12/To save you from the way of the wicked, from those who speak twisted things;
20:2:13/Who leave the straight paths to walk in dark ways;
20:2:14/Who take joy in doing wrong and delight in the perverseness of evil,
20:2:15/Whose paths are crooked and who are devious in their course;
20:2:16/To save you from the outsider woman, from the foreigner with her smooth words,
20:2:17/Who leaves the companion of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God.
20:2:18/For her house leads down to death, and her paths to the spirits of the dead.
20:2:19/None who go to her come back or regain the paths of life.
20:2:20/So you may walk in the way of the good and keep to the paths of the righteous.
20:2:21/For the upright will live in the land, and the blameless will remain in it;
20:2:22/But the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the unfaithful will be torn from it.
20:3:1/My child, do not forget my teaching; let your heart hold onto my instructions.
20:3:2/For they will bring you a long and peaceful life.
20:3:3/Never let go of kindness and truth; wear them like a necklace, write them deep within your heart.
20:3:4/Then you will gain favor and a good reputation in the sight of God and people.
20:3:5/Trust in the LORD with all your heart; do not depend on your own understanding.
20:3:6/In everything you do, put God first, and he will guide your steps.
20:3:7/Do not think you know everything; respect the LORD and avoid wrongdoing.
20:3:8/This will bring health to your body and nourishment to your bones.
20:3:9/Honor the LORD with your wealth and with the best part of everything you produce.
20:3:10/Then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will brim over with new wine.
20:3:11/My child, do not resent the LORD's discipline, and do not be upset by his correction.
20:3:12/For the LORD disciplines those he loves, just as a father disciplines the child he delights in.
20:3:13/Joyful is the person who finds wisdom, the one who gains understanding.
20:3:14/For wisdom is more profitable than silver, and her wages are better than gold.
20:3:15/She is more valuable than rubies; nothing you desire can compare with her.
20:3:16/Long life is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor.
20:3:17/Her ways are pleasant, and all her paths are peaceful.
20:3:18/She is a tree of life to those who embrace her; those who hold her tight are happy.
20:3:19/The LORD created the earth by wisdom; by understanding he established the heavens.
20:3:20/By his knowledge the deep fountains of the earth burst forth, and the dew settles from the sky.
20:3:21/My child, don't lose sight of them; preserve sound wisdom and discretion.
20:3:22/They will be life for your soul and adornment for your neck.
20:3:23/Then you will walk on your way securely, and your foot will not stumble.
20:3:24/When you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
20:3:25/Do not fear sudden terror or the ruin that overtakes the wicked.
20:3:26/For the LORD will be your confidence and will keep your foot from being caught.
20:3:27/Do not withhold good from those who deserve it when it's in your power to help.
20:3:28/Do not say to your neighbor, "Go away, come back later; I'll give it tomorrow" when you have it with you.
20:3:29/Do not plan harm against your neighbor, who lives trustfully near you.
20:3:30/Do not quarrel with someone for no reason when they have done you no harm.
20:3:31/Do not envy a violent person or choose any of their ways.
20:3:32/For the LORD detests the perverse but takes the upright into his confidence.
20:3:33/The LORD's curse is on the house of the wicked, but he blesses the home of the righteous.
20:3:34/He mocks proud mockers but shows favor to the humble and oppressed.
20:3:35/The wise will inherit honor, but fools get only shame.
20:4:1/Listen, children, to a father's guidance, and pay attention to gain understanding.
20:4:2/For I offer you sound teaching; do not abandon my instruction.
20:4:3/I was once my father's child, gentle and the only one cherished by my mother.
20:4:4/He also taught me, saying, "Hold my words in your heart: follow my commands, and you will live."
20:4:5/Acquire wisdom, acquire understanding: do not forget it; nor turn away from what I say.
20:4:6/Do not abandon her, and she will protect you; love her, and she will guard you.
20:4:7/Wisdom is the most important thing; so get wisdom, and with all your efforts gain understanding.
20:4:8/Value her highly, and she will elevate you; she will honor you if you embrace her.
20:4:9/She will place on your head a graceful garland; she will present you with a glorious crown.
20:4:10/Listen, my son, and accept my words; and you will have a long life.
20:4:11/I have guided you in the ways of wisdom; I have led you on straight paths.
20:4:12/When you walk, your steps will not be hindered; and if you run, you will not stumble.
20:4:13/Hold on to instruction; do not let go. Guard her, for she is your life.
20:4:14/Do not set foot on the path of the wicked, or walk in the way of evildoers.
20:4:15/Avoid it, do not travel on it; turn away from it and pass on.
20:4:16/For they cannot rest until they do evil; they are robbed of sleep till they make someone stumble.
20:4:17/For they consume the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
20:4:18/But the path of the righteous is like the morning sun, shining ever brighter till the full light of day.
20:4:19/The way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know what makes them stumble.
20:4:20/My son, pay attention to my words; turn your ear to my sayings.
20:4:21/Do not let them out of your sight; keep them within your heart.
20:4:22/For they are life to those who find them, and health to one's whole body.
20:4:23/Guard your heart above all else, for it determines the course of your life.
20:4:24/Keep your mouth free of perversity; keep corrupt talk far from your lips.
20:4:25/Let your eyes look directly forward, and your gaze be straight before you.
20:4:26/Carefully consider the path for your feet, and all your ways will be sure.
20:4:27/Do not swerve to the right or to the left; keep your foot from evil.
20:5:1/My son, pay attention to my wisdom, and listen closely to my understanding:
20:5:2/So you may exercise caution, and your words may hold knowledge.
20:5:3/For the words of a seductive woman are sweet as honey, and her speech is smoother than oil:
20:5:4/But in the end, she is as bitter as poison, sharp as a double-edged sword.
20:5:5/Her path leads to death; her steps are bound for destruction.
20:5:6/So you might not think about the path of life, her ways are unpredictable, and you cannot know them.
20:5:7/Listen to me now, therefore, O children, and do not stray from the words of my mouth.
20:5:8/Stay far away from her, and do not go near the door of her house:
20:5:9/Or you might lose your dignity to others, and your years to someone merciless:
20:5:10/Or strangers might consume your wealth; and your hard work might end up in the house of a stranger;
20:5:11/And you grieve at the end, when your flesh and body are spent,
20:5:12/And say, "How I hated discipline, and my heart scorned correction;
20:5:13/And did not listen to the voice of my teachers, nor turned my ear to those who instructed me!
20:5:14/I was on the verge of complete ruin in the midst of the community and assembly."
20:5:15/Drink water from your own cistern, flowing water from your own well.
20:5:16/Let your springs spread out, streams of water in the public squares.
20:5:17/Keep them for yourself alone, not for sharing with strangers.
20:5:18/May your fountain be blessed, and take joy in the wife of your youth.
20:5:19/May she be as a loving deer and graceful doe; let her breasts always satisfy you; be intoxicated always with her love.
20:5:20/And why, my son, would you be captivated by a seductive woman, and embrace the chest of a stranger?
20:5:21/For a man's ways are in full view of the LORD, and he examines all his paths.
20:5:22/His own wrongdoings will trap the wicked man, and he will be caught in the ropes of his sin.
20:5:23/He will die for lack of discipline; led astray by his great folly.
20:6:1/My child, if you've promised to pay for a friend's debt or shaken hands on a deal with a stranger,
20:6:2/You've trapped yourself with your own words, caught by what you've said.
20:6:3/Do this now, my child, and free yourself, since you've fallen into your friend's hands; go, humble yourself, and plead with your friend.
20:6:4/Don't allow yourself to sleep or even to blink until you've escaped.
20:6:5/Free yourself like a deer from a hunter's grasp, and like a bird from the snare of a fowler.
20:6:6/Consider the ant, you lazy person; observe its ways and become wise:
20:6:7/It has no leader, overseer, or ruler,
20:6:8/Yet it stores its provisions in summer and gathers its food at harvest.
20:6:9/How long will you lie there, you sluggard? When will you get up from your sleep?
20:6:10/Just a little more sleep, a little more slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest:
20:6:11/And then poverty will pounce on you like a bandit; scarcity will attack you like an armed robber.
20:6:12/A troublemaker and a villain goes around with a corrupt mouth.
20:6:13/He signals with his eyes, shuffles his feet, and points with his fingers;
20:6:14/Deceit is in his heart, he constantly schemes evil; he stirs up conflict.
20:6:15/Therefore, his disaster will strike suddenly; in an instant, he will be broken beyond healing.
20:6:16/There are six things the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to him:
20:6:17/Arrogant eyes, a lying tongue, hands that kill the innocent,
20:6:18/A heart that plots evil, feet that hurry to do wrong,
20:6:19/A false witness who pours out lies, and anyone who stirs up conflict among friends.
20:6:20/My child, obey your father's commands, and don't neglect your mother's instruction:
20:6:21/Keep them always in your heart; tie them around your neck.
20:6:22/When you walk, they will guide you; when you sleep, they will watch over you; when you awake, they will speak to you.
20:6:23/For these commands are a lamp, this teaching is a light, and the corrections of discipline are the way to life,
20:6:24/To protect you from the wicked woman, from the smooth talk of a wayward woman.
20:6:25/Don't lust in your heart after her beauty or let her captivate you with her eyes.
20:6:26/For a prostitute can reduce you to a loaf of bread, and an adulteress preys upon your very life.
20:6:27/Can a man scoop fire into his lap without his clothes being burned?
20:6:28/Can a man walk on hot coals without his feet being scorched?
20:6:29/So is he who sleeps with another man's wife; no one who touches her will go unpunished.
20:6:30/People do not despise a thief if he steals to satisfy his hunger when he is starving;
20:6:31/Yet if he is caught, he must pay sevenfold, though it costs him all the wealth of his house.
20:6:32/But a man who commits adultery lacks judgment; whoever does so destroys himself.
20:6:33/He will suffer wounds and dishonor, and his disgrace will not be wiped away.
20:6:34/For jealousy arouses a husband's fury, and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge.
20:6:35/He will not accept any compensation; he will refuse a bribe, no matter how great.
20:7:1/My child, hold onto my words, and treasure my commandments within you.
20:7:2/Follow my commandments, and you will live; cherish my law as you would the pupil of your eye.
20:7:3/Tie them around your fingers, inscribe them on the tablet of your heart.
20:7:4/Tell wisdom, "You are my sister," and call understanding your close relative:
20:7:5/So they can protect you from the unfamiliar woman, from the outsider who sweet talks with her words.
20:7:6/From the window of my house, I looked out through my lattice,
20:7:7/And saw among the naive, I noticed among the young men, a young man lacking sense,
20:7:8/Walking down the street near her corner; he took the path to her house,
20:7:9/In the twilight, in the evening, in the pitch-black night:
20:7:10/And there, he met a woman dressed like a prostitute, cunning of heart.
20:7:11/(She is loud and defiant; her feet do not stay at home:
20:7:12/Now in the streets, now in the squares, she lurks at every corner.)
20:7:13/So she grabbed him, kissed him, and with a brazen face said to him,
20:7:14/"I have peace offerings with me; today I have fulfilled my vows.
20:7:15/That's why I came out to meet you, to search for you eagerly, and I have found you.
20:7:16/I have adorned my bed with colorful linens, with intricate carvings, with fine linen from Egypt.
20:7:17/I have scented my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
20:7:18/Come, let's enjoy passionate love until morning; let's delight ourselves with love.
20:7:19/For my husband is not at home, he has gone on a long trip:
20:7:20/He took a bag of money with him, and will return at the set time."
20:7:21/With her persuasive speech she led him astray; with her smooth talk she seduced him.
20:7:22/He followed her immediately, like an ox going to the slaughter, or like a fool to the punishment of the stocks;
20:7:23/Until an arrow pierces his liver; like a bird rushing into a trap, not knowing it will cost him his life.
20:7:24/Listen to me now then, my children, and pay attention to the words of my mouth.
20:7:25/Do not let your heart turn to her ways, do not stray into her paths.
20:7:26/For she has brought down many wounded; indeed, many strong men have been killed by her.
20:7:27/Her house is the path to the grave, leading down to the chambers of death.
20:8:1/Doesn't wisdom call out? And understanding raise her voice?
20:8:2/She stands at the top of high places, by the road, at the crossroads.
20:8:3/She cries out at the city gates, at the entrance of the city, at the doorways.
20:8:4/To you, O people, I call out; my voice is for all humanity.
20:8:5/You who are naive, grasp wisdom; and you fools, gain a heart of understanding.
20:8:6/Listen, for I will speak of noble things; and from my lips will come what is right.
20:8:7/For my mouth will utter truth; and wickedness is detestable to my lips.
20:8:8/All the words of my mouth are just; there is nothing twisted or deceitful in them.
20:8:9/They are clear to those who understand, and straightforward to those who find knowledge.
20:8:10/Choose my instruction instead of silver, and knowledge over the finest gold.
20:8:11/For wisdom is more precious than rubies; and nothing you desire can compare with her.
20:8:12/I, wisdom, live with prudence, and I attain knowledge and discretion.
20:8:13/The fear of the LORD means hating evil; I hate pride and arrogance, evil behavior, and perverse speech.
20:8:14/I possess counsel and sound wisdom; I have insight; I have power.
20:8:15/Through me kings reign, and rulers issue decrees that are just.
20:8:16/Through me princes govern, and nobles, all the judges of the earth.
20:8:17/I love those who love me, and those who seek me diligently will find me.
20:8:18/With me are riches and honor, enduring wealth and prosperity.
20:8:19/My fruit is better than fine gold; what I yield surpasses choice silver.
20:8:20/I walk in the way of righteousness, along the paths of justice,
20:8:21/Granting wealth to those who love me, and filling their treasuries.
20:8:22/The LORD brought me forth as the first of his works, before his deeds of old.
20:8:23/I was formed long ages ago, at the very beginning, when the world came to be.
20:8:24/When there were no watery depths, I was given birth, when there were no springs overflowing with water.
20:8:25/Before the mountains were settled in place, before the hills, I was given birth,
20:8:26/Before he made the earth or its fields or any of the dust of the world.
20:8:27/When he established the heavens, I was there; when he drew a circle on the surface of the deep,
20:8:28/When he made firm the skies above, when he established the fountains of the deep,
20:8:29/When he set the sea its boundary so the waters would not overstep his command, when he marked out the foundations of the earth,
20:8:30/Then I was the craftsman at his side. I was filled with delight day after day, rejoicing always in his presence,
20:8:31/Rejoicing in his whole world and delighting in mankind.
20:8:32/Now then, my children, listen to me; blessed are those who keep my ways.
20:8:33/Listen to my instruction and be wise; do not disregard it.
20:8:34/Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at my doorway.
20:8:35/For whoever finds me finds life and receives favor from the LORD.
20:8:36/But those who miss me harm themselves; all who hate me love death.
20:9:1/Wisdom has built her house; she has set up its seven pillars.
20:9:2/She has prepared her meat; she has mixed her wine; she has also set her table.
20:9:3/She has sent out her servants, and she calls from the highest points of the city,
20:9:4/"If you're naive, come this way." To those lacking sense, she says,
20:9:5/"Come, eat my food and drink the wine I have mixed."
20:9:6/Leave your foolish ways behind and live; walk in the path of insight.
20:9:7/Correcting a mocker brings shame to yourself; rebuking a wicked person stains your reputation.
20:9:8/Don't criticize a mocker, or they will hate you; correct a wise person, and they will love you.
20:9:9/Educate a wise person, and they become wiser; teach a righteous person, and they will add to their learning.
20:9:10/The fear of the Lord is the foundation of wisdom, and knowing the Holy One brings understanding.
20:9:11/For through wisdom your days will be many, and years will be added to your life.
20:9:12/If you are wise, your wisdom will reward you; if you are a mocker, you alone will suffer.
20:9:13/A foolish woman is loud; she is ignorant and knows nothing.
20:9:14/She sits at the door of her house, on a seat at the highest point of the city,
20:9:15/Calling out to those who pass by, who go straight on their way,
20:9:16/"If you're naive, come this way." To those lacking sense, she says,
20:9:17/"Stolen water is sweet; food eaten in secret is delicious!"
20:9:18/But little do they know that the dead are there, that her guests are in the depths of the grave.
20:10:1/The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.
20:10:2/Wealth gained by wrongdoing brings no real benefit, but living righteously saves from death.
20:10:3/The LORD will not let the righteous go hungry, but he denies the wicked their desires.
20:10:4/Being lazy leads to poverty, while hard work leads to wealth.
20:10:5/Gathering crops in summer shows wisdom, but sleeping through the harvest brings shame.
20:10:6/Blessings are on the head of the righteous, but violence silences the wicked.
20:10:7/The memory of the righteous is cherished, but the reputation of the wicked will decay.
20:10:8/Those who are wise accept guidance, but those who talk too much will stumble.
20:10:9/Those who live with integrity walk securely, but those who take crooked paths will be exposed.
20:10:10/Making gestures to deceive others causes trouble, but those who talk too much will stumble.
20:10:11/The words of the righteous are like a fountain of life, but violence silences the wicked.
20:10:12/Hatred stirs up conflict, but love covers all wrongs.
20:10:13/Wisdom is found in the words of the discerning, but a rod is for the back of those lacking sense.
20:10:14/Wise people store up knowledge, but the foolish are on the brink of ruin.
20:10:15/A rich person's wealth is their fortified city, but poverty is the ruin of the poor.
20:10:16/The efforts of the righteous lead to life, the gains of the wicked to sin.
20:10:17/Following instruction is the path to life, but ignoring correction leads astray.
20:10:18/Concealing hatred with lies and spreading slander are foolish acts.
20:10:19/Talking too much can lead to sin, but being thoughtful with words is wise.
20:10:20/The words of the righteous are as valuable as silver, but the heart of the wicked is worthless.
20:10:21/The words of the righteous nourish many, but fools die for lack of sense.
20:10:22/The LORD's blessing brings wealth without adding sorrow.
20:10:23/Doing wrong is fun for a fool, but wisdom belongs to those with understanding.
20:10:24/What the wicked fear will overtake them, but the righteous will see their desires fulfilled.
20:10:25/Just as a whirlwind passes, so does the wicked, but the righteous have an eternal foundation.
20:10:26/Just as vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so is the lazy to those who send them.
20:10:27/Revering the LORD leads to a long life, but the wicked will have their years cut short.
20:10:28/The hope of the righteous brings joy, but the expectations of the wicked come to nothing.
20:10:29/The LORD's way is a stronghold for the blameless, but ruin for those who do evil.
20:10:30/The righteous will never be uprooted, but the wicked will not remain in the land.
20:10:31/The words of the righteous are full of wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be silenced.
20:10:32/The righteous know what is fitting, but the wicked only speak what is perverse.
20:11:1/Using dishonest scales is detestable to the LORD, but accurate weights bring him joy.
20:11:2/When arrogance arrives, so does disgrace, but wisdom is with those who are humble.
20:11:3/The honesty of the upright will guide them, but the deceitfulness of the unfaithful will destroy them.
20:11:4/Wealth is useless on the day of wrath, but righteousness saves from death.
20:11:5/The righteousness of the blameless makes their paths straight, but the wicked are brought down by their own wickedness.
20:11:6/The righteousness of the upright saves them, but the unfaithful are caught by their own desires.
20:11:7/When a wicked person dies, their expectations come to nothing, and the hopes of the unjust vanish.
20:11:8/The righteous are rescued from trouble, and the wicked take their place.
20:11:9/A hypocrite destroys their neighbor with their words, but the just are saved through knowledge.
20:11:10/When the righteous prosper, the city rejoices; when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.
20:11:11/The city is lifted up by the blessing of the upright, but it is overthrown by the words of the wicked.
20:11:12/Someone lacking sense despises their neighbor, but a person of understanding remains silent.
20:11:13/A gossip reveals secrets, but a trustworthy person keeps a confidence.
20:11:14/Without guidance, a people falls, but safety is found in an abundance of advisors.
20:11:15/Being a guarantor for a stranger will surely bring trouble, but those who dislike co-signing are secure.
20:11:16/A gracious woman gains honor, and strong men gain wealth.
20:11:17/A kind person benefits themselves, but a cruel person brings trouble on themselves.
20:11:18/The wicked do deceptive work, but those who sow righteousness have a sure reward.
20:11:19/Pursuing righteousness leads to life, but chasing evil leads to death.
20:11:20/Those with perverse hearts are an abomination to the LORD, but those whose ways are upright are his delight.
20:11:21/Even if the wicked join forces, they will not go unpunished, but the offspring of the righteous will be delivered.
20:11:22/A beautiful woman lacking discretion is like a gold ring in a pig's snout.
20:11:23/The righteous desire only good, but the wicked can expect only wrath.
20:11:24/Some give freely and gain more, others withhold unduly and come to poverty.
20:11:25/A generous person will prosper, and whoever refreshes others will be refreshed themselves.
20:11:26/Those who hoard grain are cursed by the people, but blessings are on the head of those who sell it.
20:11:27/Those who earnestly seek good find favor, but trouble will come to those who search for evil.
20:11:28/Those who trust in their wealth will fall, but the righteous will thrive like a green leaf.
20:11:29/Those who bring trouble on their family will inherit only wind, and the fool will be servant to the wise.
20:11:30/The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and the wise win souls.
20:11:31/Indeed, the righteous will be rewarded on earth, how much more the wicked and the sinner.
20:12:1/Anyone who loves learning loves knowledge, but someone who hates correction is foolish.
20:12:2/A good person gains favor from the LORD, but a person with evil plans will be condemned.
20:12:3/Wickedness won't secure a person's position, but the foundation of the righteous will remain unshaken.
20:12:4/A virtuous woman is a treasure to her husband, but a woman who brings shame is like decay to his well-being.
20:12:5/The thoughts of the righteous are just, but the plans of the wicked are deceitful.
20:12:6/The words of the wicked are a trap for violence, but the speech of the upright will rescue them.
20:12:7/The wicked will be overthrown and vanish, but the household of the righteous will endure.
20:12:8/A person will be praised based on their wisdom, but one with a corrupt heart will be scorned.
20:12:9/It's better to be lowly with a servant than to pretend to be rich and have nothing to eat.
20:12:10/A righteous person cares for the life of their animal, but even the kindest acts of the wicked are cruel.
20:12:11/Someone who works their land will have plenty of food, but those who chase fantasies lack sense.
20:12:12/The wicked crave the traps of evil people, but the root of the righteous bears fruit.
20:12:13/The wicked are trapped by their own lies, but the righteous escape trouble.
20:12:14/A person will be satisfied with good by the words they speak, and they will be rewarded for their actions.
20:12:15/The way of a fool seems right to them, but a wise person listens to advice.
20:12:16/A fool's anger is quickly known, but a prudent person conceals dishonor.
20:12:17/Someone who speaks the truth promotes justice, but a false witness spreads deceit.
20:12:18/Speaking harshly can wound like a sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
20:12:19/A truthful lip will last forever, but a lying tongue lasts only a moment.
20:12:20/Deceit is in the hearts of those plotting evil, but those advising peace have joy.
20:12:21/No harm comes to the righteous, but the wicked are filled with trouble.
20:12:22/Lying lips are detestable to the LORD, but those who are truthful are his joy.
20:12:23/A wise person keeps knowledge to themselves, but the heart of fools blurts out folly.
20:12:24/The diligent will lead, but the lazy will be put to forced labor.
20:12:25/Sadness weighs down the heart, but a kind word cheers it up.
20:12:26/The righteous are better than their neighbors, but the path of the wicked leads them astray.
20:12:27/A lazy person doesn't cook what they hunt, but the diligent treasure their resources.
20:12:28/In the path of righteousness is life, and along that path, there is no death.

20:22:14/The mouth of an immoral woman is a deep pit; those detested by the LORD will fall into it.
20:22:15/Foolishness is deeply rooted in the heart of a child, but discipline will drive it far away.
20:22:16/Those who exploit the poor to increase their wealth and those who give gifts to the rich will only come to poverty.
20:22:17/Pay attention and listen to the sayings of the wise; apply your heart to my knowledge.
20:22:18/It's enjoyable to keep them in your heart and have them ready on your lips.
20:22:19/So that your trust may be in the LORD, I teach you today, yes, you.
20:22:20/Haven't I written to you excellent things about counsel and knowledge,
20:22:21/To make you know the certainty of true words, so you can give truthful answers to those who sent you?
20:22:22/Do not exploit the poor because they are poor and do not crush the needy in court,
20:22:23/For the LORD will take up their case and will exact life for life from those who rob them.
20:22:24/Do not befriend a hot-tempered person or associate with someone easily angered,
20:22:25/Or you may learn their ways and get yourself ensnared.
20:22:26/Do not be one who shakes hands in pledge or puts up security for debts;
20:22:27/If you lack the means to pay, your very bed will be snatched from under you.
20:22:28/Do not move the ancient boundary stone set up by your ancestors.
20:22:29/Do you see someone skilled in their work? They will serve before kings; they will not serve before obscure people.
20:23:1/When you sit down to eat with a ruler, pay close attention to what is in front of you:
20:23:2/And if you're someone who loves to eat, you might as well put a knife to your throat.
20:23:3/Don't crave his fancy food, because it's deceptive.
20:23:4/Don't exhaust yourself trying to get rich; stop relying on your own cleverness.
20:23:5/Why set your eyes on something that will disappear? For wealth certainly takes off like an eagle, flying towards the sky.
20:23:6/Don't eat the food of someone who is stingy, nor desire their fancy dishes:
20:23:7/For as they think in their heart, so are they: "Eat and drink," they say to you, but their heart is not with you.
20:23:8/The bite you've eaten you will vomit up, and waste your flattering words.
20:23:9/Don't speak to a fool, for they will scorn the wisdom of your words.
20:23:10/Don't move ancient boundary stones or encroach on the fields of orphans:
20:23:11/For their defender is strong; he will take up their case against you.
20:23:12/Give your heart to learning and your ears to words of knowledge.
20:23:13/Don't hold back discipline from a child: if you discipline them with the rod, they won't die.
20:23:14/You should discipline them with the rod and save their soul from the grave.
20:23:15/My child, if your heart is wise, then my own heart will be glad.
20:23:16/Yes, my innermost being will rejoice when your lips speak what is right.
20:23:17/Don't let your heart envy sinners, but always be zealous for the fear of the LORD.
20:23:18/For there is surely a future hope; and your expectation will not be cut off.
20:23:19/Listen, my child, and be wise, and set your heart on the right path.
20:23:20/Don't be among heavy drinkers or those who gorge themselves on meat:
20:23:21/For the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty, and drowsiness will clothe a man with rags.
20:23:22/Listen to your father, who gave you life, and don't despise your mother when she is old.
20:23:23/Buy the truth and don't sell it; get wisdom, discipline, and understanding.
20:23:24/The father of a righteous child has great joy; a man who fathers a wise son will be glad in him.
20:23:25/Your father and your mother will be glad, and she who gave birth to you will rejoice.
20:23:26/My child, give me your heart, and let your eyes delight in my ways.
20:23:27/For a prostitute is a deep pit; an adulteress is a narrow well.
20:23:28/She also lies in wait like a bandit, increasing the unfaithful among men.
20:23:29/Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has strife? Who has complaints? Who has needless bruises? Who has bloodshot eyes?
20:23:30/Those who linger over wine, who go to sample bowls of mixed wine.
20:23:31/Don't gaze at wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup, when it goes down smoothly.
20:23:32/In the end, it bites like a snake and poisons like a viper.
20:23:33/Your eyes will see strange sights, and your heart will speak twisted things.
20:23:34/Yes, you will be like one who lies down in the middle of the sea, or like one who lies at the top of a mast.
20:23:35/"They hit me," you will say, "but I didn't feel it; they beat me, but I didn't know it. When will I wake up so I can find another drink?"
20:24:1/Don't be jealous of those who do wrong, nor wish to be in their company.
20:24:2/For their hearts plot destruction, and their words are always about causing trouble.
20:24:3/It's through wisdom that a house is built; and it's established through understanding.
20:24:4/And through knowledge, its rooms are filled with all kinds of precious and beautiful treasures.
20:24:5/A wise person is strong; indeed, a person with knowledge grows stronger.
20:24:6/With wise advice, you'll conduct your affairs successfully: safety lies in having many advisers.
20:24:7/Wisdom is too complex for a fool; he doesn't know what to say in public.
20:24:8/Someone who plans to do harm will be known as a troublemaker.
20:24:9/Even thinking foolish thoughts is sinful; and mocking others is detestable to people.
20:24:10/If you give up when trouble comes, it shows that your strength is limited.
20:24:11/If you fail to rescue those who are being dragged to death, and those who are about to be killed;
20:24:12/If you claim, 'We didn't know about it,' doesn't the one who weighs hearts perceive it? The one who guards your life knows it, and he will repay everyone according to their actions.
20:24:13/My child, eat honey because it's good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to your taste:
20:24:14/So will the knowledge of wisdom be to your soul: when you have found it, then there will be a future, and your hope will not be cut off.
20:24:15/Don't set a trap, you wicked person, against the home of the righteous; don't destroy their place of rest.
20:24:16/For a righteous person may fall seven times and rise again, but the wicked will stumble into trouble.
20:24:17/Don't be happy when your enemy falls, and don't feel joy when they stumble.
20:24:18/Otherwise, the LORD will see it, be displeased, and turn his anger away from them.
20:24:19/Don't worry because of evildoers, nor be envious of the wicked.
20:24:20/For there will be no future for the evil person; the lamp of the wicked will be snuffed out.
20:24:21/My child, fear the LORD and the king: and don't associate with those who are rebellious.
20:24:22/For their disaster will arise suddenly; and who knows the ruin that comes from both of them?
20:24:23/These also are sayings of the wise. It's not good to show favoritism in judgment.
20:24:24/Whoever tells the wicked, 'You are in the right,' will be cursed by peoples, abhorred by nations.
20:24:25/But those who rebuke the wicked will have delight, and a good blessing will come upon them.
20:24:26/Everyone will respect someone who gives an honest answer.
20:24:27/Get your work done outside; prepare your fields; after that, build your house.
20:24:28/Don't testify against your neighbor without reason; don't lie about them.
20:24:29/Don't say, 'I'll do to them as they have done to me; I'll pay them back for what they did.'
20:24:30/I passed by the field of a lazy person, by the vineyard of someone with no sense;
20:24:31/And saw it was all overgrown with thorns, the ground covered with nettles, and its stone wall broken down.
20:24:32/Then I observed and took it to heart; I looked and received instruction.
20:24:33/Just a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest,
20:24:34/And poverty will come on you like a robber, and need like an armed man.
20:25:1/These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
20:25:2/It is God's glory to conceal things, but the honor of kings is to investigate matters.
20:25:3/The sky is high, the earth is deep, and the hearts of kings are unfathomable.
20:25:4/Remove the impurities from silver, and a vessel for the silversmith will emerge.
20:25:5/Remove the wicked from the king's presence, and his throne will be established in righteousness.
20:25:6/Don't rush to present yourself before the king, and don't take the place of the great.
20:25:7/It's better to be invited up than to be demoted in front of a noble, whom you have seen.
20:25:8/Don't be quick to start a conflict, lest you end up not knowing what to do when your neighbor shames you.
20:25:9/Settle your dispute with your neighbor directly; don't reveal another's secret.
20:25:10/Otherwise, the one who hears it might shame you, and your bad reputation won't go away.
20:25:11/A timely spoken word is like apples of gold in settings of silver.
20:25:12/Like a gold earring or fine gold jewelry, so is constructive criticism to an attentive ear.
20:25:13/Like the coolness of snow at harvest time is a reliable messenger to those who send him; he refreshes the spirit of his masters.
20:25:14/Someone who brags about a fake gift is like clouds and wind without rain.
20:25:15/Patience persuades a ruler, and a gentle tongue can break bones.
20:25:16/If you find honey, eat just enough so you don't overindulge and vomit it.
20:25:17/Keep your visits to your neighbor's house brief; otherwise, he might get tired of you and start to dislike you.
20:25:18/A person who lies about their neighbor is as destructive as a club, a sword, or a sharp arrow.
20:25:19/Trusting an unreliable person in times of trouble is like having a broken tooth or a lame foot.
20:25:20/Singing songs to a sad heart is like taking away someone's coat on a cold day or pouring vinegar on soda.
20:25:21/If your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he's thirsty, give him water to drink.
20:25:22/Doing so will heap burning coals on his head, and the LORD will reward you.
20:25:23/The north wind brings rain, and a sly tongue brings angry looks.
20:25:24/It's better to live on the corner of a roof than share a house with a quarrelsome partner.
20:25:25/Like refreshing cold water to a parched soul, so is good news from a distant land.
20:25:26/A righteous person yielding to the wicked is like a muddied spring or a polluted well.
20:25:27/Eating too much honey is not good, nor is seeking one's own glory glorious.
20:25:28/A person who can't control their temper is like a city with broken-down walls.
20:26:1/Just as snow in summer and rain during harvest are out of place, so is honor for a fool.
20:26:2/Like a bird wandering or a swallow flying, an undeserved curse will not come to pass.
20:26:3/A whip is for the horse, a bridle for the donkey, and a rod for the back of fools.
20:26:4/Don't respond to a fool's nonsense, or you'll stoop to his level.
20:26:5/Correct a fool's folly, or he'll think he's actually wise.
20:26:6/Sending a message through a fool is like cutting off your own feet and inviting trouble.
20:26:7/Just as the legs of the lame are unequal, so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
20:26:8/Giving honor to a fool is like tying a stone in a sling—pointless.
20:26:9/Like a thorn that pricks the hand of a drunkard, so is a proverb in the mouths of fools.
20:26:10/The great God who formed everything punishes fools and those who do wrong.
20:26:11/Just as a dog returns to its vomit, a fool repeats his foolishness.
20:26:12/If you see someone who thinks they're always right, there's more hope for a fool than for them.
20:26:13/The lazy person claims, "There's a lion outside! I might get killed in the streets!"
20:26:14/Just as a door swings on its hinges, so does the lazy person in bed.
20:26:15/The lazy person buries his hand in the dish; it tires him to bring it back to his mouth.
20:26:16/The lazy person thinks he's smarter than seven people who can give a sensible answer.
20:26:17/Getting involved in an argument that's not yours is like grabbing a dog by the ears.
20:26:18/Like a madman shooting firebrands or deadly arrows,
20:26:19/So is the person who deceives their neighbor and says, "I was only joking!"
20:26:20/Without wood, a fire goes out; without a gossip, conflict calms down.
20:26:21/Just as charcoal to embers and wood to fire, so is a quarrelsome person for kindling strife.
20:26:22/The words of a gossip are like deep wounds; they go down into the innermost parts.
20:26:23/Smooth talk from insincere lips and a wicked heart are like a cheap pot covered with silver dross.
20:26:24/Someone who hides their hatred has lying lips, and anyone who spreads slander is a fool.
20:26:25/When they speak graciously, don't trust them, for there are seven detestable things in their heart.
20:26:26/Though malice may be concealed by deception, their wickedness will be exposed in the assembly.
20:26:27/Whoever digs a pit will fall into it; if someone rolls a stone, it will roll back on them.
20:26:28/A lying tongue hates those it hurts, and a flattering mouth causes ruin.
20:27:1/Don't brag about tomorrow; you don't know what the day will bring.
20:27:2/Let others praise you, not your own mouth; someone else, not your own lips.
20:27:3/A stone is heavy, and sand is burdensome; but a fool's anger is heavier than both.
20:27:4/Anger is cruel, and fury is overwhelming; but who can stand before jealousy?
20:27:5/Direct criticism is better than hidden love.
20:27:6/The wounds from a friend are trustworthy; but an enemy's kisses are misleading.
20:27:7/A satisfied person despises honey, but to a hungry person, even the bitter tastes sweet.
20:27:8/Like a bird that strays from its nest, is a person who strays from their home.
20:27:9/Fragrance and incense bring joy to the heart, and the sweetness of a friend comes from their sincere advice.
20:27:10/Don't abandon your friend or your father's friend, and don't go to your brother's house in your time of trouble; a neighbor nearby is better than a brother far away.
20:27:11/My child, be wise and make my heart glad, so I can respond to those who taunt me.
20:27:12/A wise person sees danger and takes cover; the naive keep going and suffer for it.
20:27:13/Take the garment of someone who guarantees a loan for a stranger; hold it as collateral if it's for an outsider.
20:27:14/Anyone who loudly blesses their friend early in the morning, it will be taken as a curse.
20:27:15/Constant dripping on a rainy day and a quarrelsome partner are alike.
20:27:16/Hiding them is like trying to grasp the wind, or like holding oil in your right hand.
20:27:17/Iron sharpens iron; so one person sharpens another.
20:27:18/Whoever tends a fig tree will eat its fruit; so he who looks after his master will be honored.
20:27:19/Just as water reflects a face, so a person's heart reflects the person.
20:27:20/Death and destruction are never satisfied; likewise, human eyes are never content.
20:27:21/Just as refining silver and gold tests their quality, so a person is tested by the praise they receive.
20:27:22/Even if you grind a fool in a mortar, grinding them like grain with a pestle, their foolishness will not leave them.
20:27:23/Make sure you know the condition of your flocks, give careful attention to your herds.
20:27:24/For wealth is not forever, nor does a crown last from generation to generation.
20:27:25/When the hay is removed and new growth appears and the grass from the hills is gathered in,
20:27:26/The lambs will provide you with clothing, and the goats with the price of a field.
20:27:27/And you will have enough goat's milk for your food, for the food of your household, and for the sustenance of your servant girls.
20:28:1/The wicked run away when no one is chasing them, but the righteous are as confident as a lion.
20:28:2/When a country is rebellious, it has many rulers, but with a person of understanding and knowledge, its stability will last.
20:28:3/A poor person who oppresses the less fortunate is like a rain that destroys all crops.
20:28:4/Those who abandon the law praise the wicked, but those who follow the law fight against them.
20:28:5/Wicked people do not understand what is fair, but those who seek the LORD understand everything.
20:28:6/It's better to be poor and live with integrity than to be crooked in your ways, even if you're wealthy.
20:28:7/Someone who follows the law is a wise child, but a companion of gluttons disgraces their father.
20:28:8/Someone who increases their wealth through excessive interest and unfair gain collects it for someone who will be kind to the poor.
20:28:9/Anyone who turns their ear away from listening to the law, even their prayers are detestable.
20:28:10/Whoever leads the righteous astray in an evil path will fall into their own trap, but the upright will inherit good things.
20:28:11/A rich person may think they're wise, but a poor person with discernment can see right through them.
20:28:12/When the righteous triumph, there is great celebration, but when the wicked rise to power, people go into hiding.
20:28:13/Someone who hides their sins won't succeed, but whoever confesses and renounces them will find mercy.
20:28:14/Blessed is the person who always fears the LORD, but one who hardens their heart will fall into trouble.
20:28:15/A wicked ruler over the poor is as threatening as a roaring lion or a charging bear.
20:28:16/A ruler lacking in understanding is also a great oppressor, but one who hates dishonest gain will live a long life.
20:28:17/A person who is violent against another's life will run to the pit; let no one hold them back.
20:28:18/Those who walk in integrity will be rescued, but those who are crooked in their ways will fall all at once.
20:28:19/Someone who works their land will have plenty of food, but one who chases fantasies will have their fill of poverty.
20:28:20/A trustworthy person will be showered with blessings, but one eager to get rich will not go unpunished.
20:28:21/Showing favoritism is not good—because for a piece of bread, a person will do wrong.
20:28:22/Someone eager to get rich has an envious eye and doesn't realize that poverty will come upon them.
20:28:23/Someone who rebukes a person will later find more favor than one who flatters with their tongue.
20:28:24/Anyone who steals from their father or mother and says, "It's not wrong," is a partner to a destroyer.
20:28:25/Someone with a haughty heart stirs up conflict, but those who trust in the LORD will prosper.
20:28:26/Those who trust in their own heart are fools, but those who walk in wisdom will be kept safe.
20:28:27/Whoever gives to the poor will not want, but one who closes their eyes to them will receive many curses.
20:28:28/When the wicked rise to power, people go into hiding, but when they perish, the righteous increase.
20:29:1/Someone who is repeatedly corrected but remains stubborn will suddenly be destroyed beyond repair.
20:29:2/When good leaders are in charge, the people are happy; but when the bad ones rule, the people grieve.
20:29:3/Anyone who loves wisdom makes their father proud, but someone who hangs out with prostitutes wastes their wealth.
20:29:4/A king establishes the country through fair judgment, but one who accepts bribes ruins it.
20:29:5/A person who flatters their neighbor is setting a trap for them.
20:29:6/An evil person's wrongdoing is a trap for them, but the righteous can sing and be happy.
20:29:7/Good people care about the needs of the poor; the wicked couldn't care less.
20:29:8/Mockers can cause trouble in a city, but the wise can calm anger.
20:29:9/Arguing with a fool, whether they get angry or laugh, leads to no peace.
20:29:10/Those who are violent hate the honest, but the righteous care about their lives.
20:29:11/A fool spills all their thoughts, but a wise person holds them back until later.
20:29:12/If a leader listens to lies, all their followers are corrupt.
20:29:13/The poor and the liar have this in common: the Lord gives light to the eyes of both.
20:29:14/A king who judges the poor fairly will have a stable reign forever.
20:29:15/Discipline and correction lead to wisdom, but a child left to themselves brings shame to their mother.
20:29:16/When the wicked increase, wrongdoing increases, but the righteous will see their downfall.
20:29:17/Discipline your child, and they will bring you peace; they will bring joy to your soul.
20:29:18/Without guidance, people fall apart, but those who follow the law are happy.
20:29:19/A servant won't be corrected by mere words; even if they understand, they won't respond.
20:29:20/Do you see someone who speaks without thinking? They have less hope than a fool.
20:29:21/Someone who spoils their servant from childhood will end up with them as a child.
20:29:22/An angry person causes conflict, and someone with a temper commits many sins.
20:29:23/Pride leads to downfall, but humility brings honor.
20:29:24/Being an accomplice to a thief is hating oneself; they hear the curse but don't reveal it.
20:29:25/Fearing people is a trap, but trusting in the Lord means safety.
20:29:26/Many seek the favor of a ruler, but justice for each person comes from the Lord.
20:29:27/The unjust are detestable to the righteous, and those who are upright are detestable to the wicked.
20:30:1/The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spoke to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal,
20:30:2/I am more ignorant than anyone, lacking the understanding of a human.
20:30:3/I haven't learned wisdom, nor do I possess knowledge of the holy.
20:30:4/Who has gone up to heaven and come back down? Who has collected the wind in their hands? Who has wrapped up the waters in a cloak? Who has established all the ends of the earth? What is his name, and what is his son's name, if you know?
20:30:5/Every word of God is flawless; he is a protector to those who trust in him.
20:30:6/Do not add to his words, or he will correct you, and you will be proven a liar.
20:30:7/Two things I ask of you; do not deny them to me before I die:
20:30:8/Keep falsehood and lies far from me; give me neither poverty nor riches but only my daily bread.
20:30:9/Otherwise, I may have too much and deny you, saying, "Who is the LORD?" or I may become poor and steal, and so dishonor the name of my God.
20:30:10/Do not slander a servant to their master, or they may curse you, and you will be found guilty.
20:30:11/There is a generation that curses their father and does not bless their mother.
20:30:12/There is a generation that is pure in their own eyes, yet is not cleansed of their filth.
20:30:13/There is a generation—oh, how arrogant are their eyes! How their eyelids are lifted up!
20:30:14/There is a generation whose teeth are like swords and their jaws like knives, to devour the poor from the earth and the needy from among humanity.
20:30:15/The leech has two daughters, crying, "Give, give." There are three things that are never satisfied, four that never say, "Enough":
20:30:16/The grave; the barren womb; the earth that is never satisfied with water; and the fire that never says, "Enough."
20:30:17/The eye that mocks a father and scorns obedience to a mother, the ravens of the valley will pick it out, and young eagles will eat it.
20:30:18/There are three things that are too amazing for me, four that I do not understand:
20:30:19/The way of an eagle in the sky; the way of a snake on a rock; the way of a ship on the high seas; and the way of a man with a young woman.
20:30:20/This is the way of an adulterous woman: she eats and wipes her mouth and says, "I've done nothing wrong."
20:30:21/For three things the earth trembles, for four it cannot bear:
20:30:22/For a servant when they become king; a fool when they are filled with food;
20:30:23/For an unloved woman when she gets a husband; and a servant girl who displaces her mistress.
20:30:24/There are four things on earth that are small but exceedingly wise:
20:30:25/Ants are creatures of little strength, yet they store up their food in the summer;
20:30:26/Rock badgers are creatures of little power, yet they make their homes in the crags;
20:30:27/Locusts have no king, yet they all advance in ranks;
20:30:28/A lizard can be caught with the hand, yet it is found in kings' palaces.
20:30:29/There are three things that move with dignity, four that move well:
20:30:30/A lion, mighty among beasts, who retreats before nothing;
20:30:31/A strutting rooster, a he-goat, and a king secure against rebellion.
20:30:32/If you have acted foolishly by exalting yourself or if you have planned evil, put your hand over your mouth.
20:30:33/Indeed, churning milk produces butter, and twisting a nose produces blood; so stirring up anger produces strife.
20:31:1/The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy his mother taught him.
20:31:2/What, my son? And what, the son of my womb? And what, the son of my commitments?
20:31:3/Do not give your strength to women, nor your ways to those that can ruin kings.
20:31:4/It's not for kings, O Lemuel, it's not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes to indulge in strong drink:
20:31:5/Otherwise, they might drink and forget the laws, and twist the rights of all the afflicted.
20:31:6/Provide strong drink to those who are dying, and wine to those with heavy hearts.
20:31:7/Let them drink and forget their poverty, and remember their misery no more.
20:31:8/Speak up for those who cannot speak, in the cause of all who are destined for destruction.
20:31:9/Speak up, judge fairly, and defend the rights of the poor and needy.
20:31:10/Who can find a virtuous woman? For her value is far beyond rubies.
20:31:11/The heart of her husband trusts in her, and he will have no lack of gain.
20:31:12/She brings him good, not harm, all the days of her life.
20:31:13/She seeks wool and flax, and works eagerly with her hands.
20:31:14/She is like the merchant ships, bringing her food from afar.
20:31:15/She also rises while it is still night, and provides food for her household and tasks for her maidens.
20:31:16/She considers a field and buys it; with the fruit of her hands she plants a vineyard.
20:31:17/She equips herself with strength, and strengthens her arms.
20:31:18/She senses that her profit is good; her lamp does not go out at night.
20:31:19/She puts her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.
20:31:20/She extends her hand to the poor; yes, she reaches out her hands to the needy.
20:31:21/She is not afraid of the snow for her household, for all her household are clothed in scarlet.
20:31:22/She makes bed coverings for herself; her clothing is fine linen and purple.
20:31:23/Her husband is respected at the city gates, where he sits among the elders of the land.
20:31:24/She makes linen garments and sells them, and supplies the merchants with sashes.
20:31:25/Strength and dignity are her clothing, and she laughs at the time to come.
20:31:26/She opens her mouth with wisdom, and the teaching of kindness is on her tongue.
20:31:27/She looks well to the ways of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness.
20:31:28/Her children rise up and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praises her:
20:31:29/Many women have done excellently, but you surpass them all.
20:31:30/Charm is deceptive, and beauty is fleeting; but a woman who fears the LORD is to be praised.
20:31:31/Give her the reward she has earned, and let her works bring her praise at the city gates.
21:1:1/The words of the Teacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.
21:1:2/Everything is utterly meaningless, says the Teacher, completely meaningless; everything is meaningless.
21:1:3/What benefit does a person get from all their hard work under the sun?
21:1:4/One generation goes, another comes, but the earth remains forever.
21:1:5/The sun rises, and the sun sets, then rushes back to where it rises.
21:1:6/The wind blows to the south, then turns to the north; round and round it goes, ever returning on its course.
21:1:7/All rivers flow into the sea, yet the sea is never full. To the place the rivers come from, there they return again.
21:1:8/Everything is wearisome beyond description; no one can express it fully. The eye is never satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.
21:1:9/What has been will be again, what has been done will be done again; there is nothing new under the sun.
21:1:10/Is there anything of which one can say, "Look! This is something new"? It was here already, long ago; it was here before our time.
21:1:11/Nobody remembers the former generations, and even those yet to come will not be remembered by those who follow them.
21:1:12/I, the Teacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
21:1:13/And I applied my mind to seek and explore by wisdom all that is done under the heavens: this heavy burden God has laid on mankind.
