23:28:13/But the word of the LORD was to them line upon line, line upon line; here a little, there a little; so that they might go, and fall backward, and be broken, and snared, and captured.
23:28:14/Therefore, listen to the word of the LORD, you scornful men, who rule this people in Jerusalem.
23:28:15/Because you have said, "We have made a covenant with death, and with the grave we are in agreement; when the overwhelming scourge passes through, it will not come to us, for we have made lies our refuge, and under falsehood we have hidden ourselves."
23:28:16/Therefore, this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "Look, I am laying in Zion a stone, a tested stone, a precious cornerstone for a sure foundation; the one who believes will not be in haste.
23:28:17/And I will make justice the measuring line, and righteousness the plumb line; hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, and waters will overflow the hiding place.
23:28:18/Your covenant with death will be annulled, and your agreement with the grave will not stand; when the overwhelming scourge passes through, you will be trampled by it.
23:28:19/From the time it passes through, it will take you; for morning by morning it will pass through, by day and by night; and it will be sheer terror to understand the message.
23:28:20/For the bed is too short to stretch out on, and the blanket too narrow to wrap oneself in.
23:28:21/For the LORD will rise up as at Mount Perazim, he will be angry as in the Valley of Gibeon, to do his work, his strange work; and to perform his task, his unusual task.
23:28:22/Now therefore, do not be mockers, lest your chains be made strong; for I have heard from the Lord GOD of hosts of a destruction, even determined upon the whole earth.
23:28:23/Give ear and hear my voice; listen and hear my speech.
23:28:24/Does the plowman plow all day to sow? Does he open and break the clods of his ground?
23:28:25/When he has leveled its surface, does he not scatter black cumin, sow cumin, and place wheat in rows, barley in its designated spot, and spelt in its place?
23:28:26/For his God instructs him rightly and teaches him.
23:28:27/For black cumin is not threshed with a sledge, nor is a cartwheel rolled over cumin; but black cumin is beaten out with a stick, and cumin with a rod.
23:28:28/Grain for bread is crushed; indeed, he does not continue to thresh it forever. Because the wheel of his cart and his horses eventually damage it, he does not crush it.
23:28:29/This also comes from the LORD of hosts; he is wonderful in counsel and excellent in wisdom.
23:29:1/Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David lived! Keep adding year to year; let them continue their sacrifices.
23:29:2/Yet I will trouble Ariel, and there will be sadness and pain: and it will be to me like Ariel.
23:29:3/And I will encircle you completely, and lay siege to you with towers, and I will build ramparts against you.
23:29:4/And you will be humbled, and will speak from the ground, and your voice will be low from the dust, and your voice will be like that of a ghost from the ground, and your words will whisper from the dust.
23:29:5/Also, the multitude of your foreigners will be like fine dust, and the multitude of the fierce ones will be like chaff that vanishes away: indeed, it will happen suddenly in an instant.
23:29:6/You will be visited by the LORD of hosts with thunder, and with earthquake, and loud noise, with storm and tempest, and the flame of a consuming fire.
23:29:7/And the multitude of all the nations that fight against Ariel, even all that fight against her and her stronghold, and that distress her, will be like a dream, a vision of the night.
23:29:8/It will be as when a hungry person dreams they are eating, but they wake up hungry: or as when a thirsty person dreams they are drinking, but they wake up faint and thirsty: so will the multitude of all the nations be, that fight against Mount Zion.
23:29:9/Pause and be amazed; shout out and cry: they are drunk, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.
23:29:10/For the LORD has poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep, and has closed your eyes: the prophets and your leaders, the seers he has covered.
23:29:11/And the vision of all has become to you like the words of a book that is sealed, which when they give it to someone who can read, saying, "Please read this," they say, "I can't; it's sealed."
23:29:12/And the book is given to someone who cannot read, saying, "Please read this," and they say, "I don't know how to read."
23:29:13/Therefore the Lord said, "Because this people approach me with their mouths and honor me with their lips, but have removed their hearts far from me, and their reverence for me is based on merely human rules,
23:29:14/Therefore, watch, I will perform a marvelous work among this people, a marvelous work and a wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men will perish, and the understanding of their prudent men will be hidden."
23:29:15/Woe to those who go to great lengths to hide their plans from the LORD, whose deeds are done in darkness, and who say, "Who sees us? Who knows us?"
23:29:16/Surely your turning things upside down will be regarded as the potter's clay: for can the work say of its maker, "He didn't make me"? Or can the thing formed say of the one who formed it, "He has no understanding"?
23:29:17/Isn't it just a short time until Lebanon will be turned into a fertile field, and the fertile field will be considered as a forest?
23:29:18/And in that day the deaf will hear the words of the book, and out of gloom and darkness the eyes of the blind will see.
23:29:19/The humble also will increase their joy in the LORD, and the needy among people will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
23:29:20/For the ruthless will be no more, the mocker will be finished, and all who are eager for evil will be cut off:
23:29:21/Those who make a person guilty for a word, and set a trap for the one who reprimands in the court, and with false arguments deny justice to the righteous.
23:29:22/Therefore, this is what the LORD, who redeemed Abraham, says regarding the house of Jacob: "Jacob will no longer be ashamed, nor will his face grow pale.
23:29:23/But when he sees his children, the work of my hands, in his midst, they will honor my name, they will honor the Holy One of Jacob, and will stand in awe of the God of Israel.
23:29:24/Those who went astray in spirit will gain understanding, and those who complained will accept instruction.
23:30:1/Doom to the defiant ones, says the LORD, who seek advice but not from me; who seek protection but not from my spirit, only to pile up one sin on another.
23:30:2/Those who head down to Egypt without seeking my guidance; to rely on Pharaoh's power and place their trust in the protection of Egypt!
23:30:3/Therefore, Pharaoh's power will bring you shame, and your trust in Egypt's shadow will lead to your downfall.
23:30:4/For his officials were in Zoan, and his envoys reached Hanes.
23:30:5/They were all disgraced by a nation that could not benefit them, not an aid or gain, but only a cause for shame and insult.
23:30:6/The burden on the animals of the south: through a land of distress and danger, where lions, vipers, and fiery flying serpents live, they will carry their wealth on donkeys' backs and their treasures on camels, to a nation that will not benefit them.
23:30:7/For the Egyptians will offer help that is useless and pointless: that's why I have declared about this, Their only strength is to sit still.
23:30:8/Now go, write this down for them on a tablet, and record it in a book, so it may remain forever and ever.
23:30:9/This is a rebellious people, deceitful children, children unwilling to listen to the LORD's instruction.
23:30:10/Who tell the seers, "Do not see," and the prophets, "Do not prophesy the truth to us. Tell us pleasant things, prophesy illusions.
23:30:11/Get out of the way, turn aside from the path, stop confronting us with the Holy One of Israel."
23:30:12/Therefore, the Holy One of Israel says, "Because you despise this message and trust in oppression and deceit, and rely on them,
23:30:13/this sin will become like a high wall, cracked and bulging, that collapses suddenly, in an instant.
23:30:14/It will break like a potter's jar, shattered so mercilessly that among its pieces not a fragment will be found for taking coals from a hearth or scooping water out of a cistern."
23:30:15/For the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel, says, "In repentance and rest you will be saved; in quietness and trust will be your strength." But you were unwilling.
23:30:16/But you said, "No, we will flee on horses." Therefore, you will flee! And, "We will ride on swift horses." Therefore, those who pursue you will be swift!
23:30:17/A thousand will flee at the threat of one; at the threat of five you will all flee until you are left like a flagstaff on a mountaintop, like a banner on a hill.
23:30:18/Yet the LORD waits to be gracious to you; therefore, he will rise up to show you compassion. For the LORD is a God of justice. Blessed are all who wait for him.
23:30:19/People will live in Zion, in Jerusalem; you will weep no more. He will be very gracious to you at the sound of your cry; when he hears it, he will answer you.
23:30:20/And though the Lord gives you the bread of adversity and the water of affliction, your teachers will not be hidden anymore, but your eyes shall see your teachers.
23:30:21/And your ears shall hear a word behind you, saying, "This is the way, walk in it," when you turn to the right or when you turn to the left.
23:30:22/You will also defile the silver plating of your idols and the golden covering of your images. You will throw them away like a menstrual cloth and say to them, "Get away from me."
23:30:23/Then he will give rain for your seed with which you sow the soil, and bread from the yield of the ground, which will be rich and plentiful. On that day, your livestock will graze in broad pastures.
23:30:24/The oxen and donkeys that work the ground will eat seasoned fodder, which has been winnowed with shovel and fork.
23:30:25/On every lofty mountain and every high hill there will be streams running with water, on the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.
23:30:26/Furthermore, the light of the moon will be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be sevenfold, like the light of seven days, on the day the LORD binds up the injuries of his people and heals the wounds inflicted by his blow.
23:30:27/Behold, the name of the LORD comes from afar, burning with his anger, and in thick rising smoke; his lips are full of wrath, and his tongue is like a consuming fire.
23:30:28/His breath is like an overflowing stream that reaches up to the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of destruction; and a bridle that leads to ruin will be placed on the jaws of the peoples.
23:30:29/You will sing as on a night when a festival is kept, and your hearts will be joyful as when people march to the sound of the flute, to the mountain of the LORD, to the Rock of Israel.
23:30:30/And the LORD will make his majestic voice heard and show the descending of his arm, with furious anger and the flame of a consuming fire, with cloudburst, storm, and hailstones.
23:30:31/For at the voice of the LORD, the Assyrian will be terrified, when He strikes with the rod.
23:30:32/And every stroke of the appointed staff that the LORD lays on him will be to the sound of tambourines and lyres, as He battles with brandished arm against them.
23:30:33/For Topheth has long been prepared; indeed, it has been made ready for the king. Its fire pit has been made deep and wide, with an abundance of fire and wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of sulfur, sets it ablaze.
23:31:1/Doomed are those who seek help from Egypt, relying on horses, and putting their faith in chariots because they are numerous, and in horsemen because they are very powerful; yet they do not turn to the Holy One of Israel, nor do they seek the LORD!
23:31:2/But He too is wise, and will bring disaster, and will not retract His words: but will rise against the house of the wicked, and against those who assist evildoers.
23:31:3/The Egyptians are mere humans, not gods; their horses are flesh, not spirit. When the LORD stretches out His hand, both the helper and the helped will fall, and they will all perish together.
23:31:4/For the LORD has told me this: Just as a lion or a young lion growls over its prey, and is not intimidated by the shouts of a group of shepherds, so the LORD of hosts will come down to fight for Mount Zion, and for its hill.
23:31:5/Like birds in flight, so will the LORD of hosts protect Jerusalem; He will shield it, save it, and pass over it to preserve it.
23:31:6/Turn back to Him from whom the people of Israel have deeply strayed.
23:31:7/For on that day, everyone will discard their silver and gold idols, which you made with your own hands as a sin.
23:31:8/Then the Assyrian will fall by a sword not wielded by a mighty warrior; and a sword not held by an ordinary man will consume him: but he will flee from the sword, and his young men will be forced to flee.
23:31:9/He will rush to his stronghold out of fear, and his leaders will be terrified of the banner, says the LORD, whose fire is in Zion, and whose furnace is in Jerusalem.
23:32:1/A king will rule with fairness, and leaders will govern with justice.
23:32:2/And a person will be like a shelter from the wind, a refuge from the storm; like streams of water in a desert, like the shade of a huge rock in a parched land.
23:32:3/The eyes of those who see will not be clouded, and the ears of those who hear will listen attentively.
23:32:4/Even the impulsive will gain understanding, and those who struggle to speak will talk clearly and confidently.
23:32:5/The despicable person will no longer be praised as generous, nor will the miser be called kind.
23:32:6/For the despicable person will speak evil, and their heart will plot wrongdoing, to engage in deceit and to spread lies about the LORD, to leave the hungry empty and to deprive the thirsty of drink.
23:32:7/The tools of the miser are harmful: he plots evil schemes to ruin the poor with false accusations, even when the needy speaks the truth.
23:32:8/But the generous person plans generous actions; and by these actions, they will stand firm.
23:32:9/Stand up, you women who are comfortable; listen to my voice, you daughters who feel secure; pay attention to my words.
23:32:10/You will be troubled for many days and years, you women who are too comfortable: for the harvest will fail, and there will be no gathering of crops.
23:32:11/Shudder, you women who are at ease; be distressed, you who are complacent: strip off your clothes, and dress in sackcloth around your waists.
23:32:12/You will mourn for the breasts, for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vines.
23:32:13/Thorns and briers will grow on the land of my people; yes, on all the joyful houses in the city of celebration.
23:32:14/The palaces will be abandoned; the bustling city will be deserted; the forts and watchtowers will become dens forever, a delight for wild donkeys, a pasture for flocks.
23:32:15/Until the spirit is poured upon us from above, and the wilderness becomes a fertile field, and the fertile field is considered a forest.
23:32:16/Then justice will reside in the wilderness, and righteousness will remain in the fertile field.
23:32:17/And the result of righteousness will be peace; the effect of righteousness will be tranquility and security forever.
23:32:18/And my people will live in peaceful homes, in secure dwellings, and in restful places.
23:32:19/When it hails, falling on the forest; and the city will be utterly humbled.
23:32:20/Blessed are you who plant beside all waters, who let the feet of the ox and the donkey roam free.
23:33:1/Doom to you who destroy, though you weren't destroyed; who betray, though none betrayed you! When you stop destroying, you will be destroyed; when you stop betraying, betrayal will come to you.
23:33:2/O LORD, be kind to us; we have waited for you. Be our strength every morning, our salvation in times of distress.
23:33:3/At the sound of the uproar, the people fled; when you rose up, the nations scattered.
23:33:4/Your plunder will be collected as caterpillars gather; as locusts swarm, so will they swarm over it.
23:33:5/The LORD is exalted, for he lives on high; he has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
23:33:6/Wisdom and knowledge will be the stability of your times, and the strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD is his treasure.
23:33:7/See, their heroes cry out in the streets; the envoys of peace weep bitterly.
23:33:8/The highways are deserted, travelers have stopped. He has broken the covenant, despised the cities, he cares for no one.
23:33:9/The earth mourns and withers; Lebanon is ashamed and decays; Sharon is like a desert; and Bashan and Carmel shake off their leaves.
23:33:10/Now I will rise, says the LORD; now I will be exalted; now I will lift myself up.
23:33:11/You will conceive chaff, you will give birth to stubble; your breath, as fire, will consume you.
23:33:12/And the people will be like the burnings of lime; like thorns cut up they will be burned in the fire.
23:33:13/Hear, you who are far off, what I have done; and, you who are near, acknowledge my power.
23:33:14/The sinners in Zion are terrified; trembling grips the hypocrites. Who among us can live with the consuming fire? Who among us can live with everlasting flames?
23:33:15/Those who walk righteously and speak honestly; who reject profit from oppression, who wave away a bribe instead of grabbing it, who stop their ears from hearing about bloodshed and shut their eyes from looking at evil;
23:33:16/They will live on high; their fortress will be the mountain strongholds: they will be provided with bread, their water will be reliable.
23:33:17/Your eyes will see the king in his beauty; they will see a land that stretches afar.
23:33:18/Your heart will ponder the terror: "Where is the scribe? Where is the one who weighed the tribute? Where is the one who counted the towers?"
23:33:19/You will not see a fierce people, a people with too obscure a speech for you to understand, with a stammering tongue that you cannot comprehend.
23:33:20/Look upon Zion, the city of our festivals; your eyes will see Jerusalem as a peaceful abode, a tent that will not be moved; its stakes will never be pulled up, nor any of its ropes broken.
23:33:21/But there the majestic LORD will be for us a place of broad rivers and streams; no galley with oars will go there, nor will any mighty ship pass by it.
23:33:22/For the LORD is our judge, the LORD is our lawgiver, the LORD is our king; he will save us.
23:33:23/Your rigging is loose; they could not secure the base of their mast, they could not spread the sail. Then the prey of a great spoil was divided; even the lame took the prey.
23:33:24/And the resident will not say, "I am sick"; the people who live there will be forgiven their iniquity.
23:34:1/Come closer, nations, to listen; and pay attention, people: let the earth and everything in it hear; the world, and all that comes out of it.
23:34:2/For the LORD's anger is against all nations, and his wrath against all their armies: he has completely destroyed them, he has handed them over to be slaughtered.
23:34:3/Their dead will be thrown out, and their bodies will stink; the mountains will flow with their blood.
23:34:4/And the entire sky will dissolve, and the heavens will roll up like a scroll: all the stars will fall, as leaves drop from the vine, and as ripe figs fall from the fig tree.
23:34:5/For my sword will be unsheathed in the heavens: look, it will descend upon Edom, and upon the people I have doomed, for judgment.
23:34:6/The sword of the LORD is drenched in blood, it is gorged with fat, with the blood of lambs and goats, with the fat of the kidneys of rams: for the LORD has a sacrifice in Bozrah, and a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
23:34:7/And the wild oxen will fall with them, and the young bulls with the strong bulls; their land will be drenched with blood, and their soil enriched with fat.
23:34:8/For it is the day of the LORD's vengeance, the year of retribution for Zion's cause.
23:34:9/And its streams will be turned into tar, and its dust into sulfur, and its land will become burning tar.
23:34:10/It will not be extinguished night or day; its smoke will rise forever. From generation to generation it will lie desolate; no one will ever pass through it again.
23:34:11/But the pelican and the porcupine will take it over; the owl and the raven will live in it. He will stretch over it the measuring line of chaos and the plumb line of desolation.
23:34:12/Its nobles will have nowhere to proclaim a kingdom, and all its princes will be nothing.
23:34:13/Thorns will overrun its palaces, nettles and brambles its fortresses. It will become a lair for jackals, a court for ostriches.
23:34:14/The desert creatures will meet with the hyenas, and the wild goat will call to its friend; the night creature will also settle there and find a place of rest.
23:34:15/There the owl will nest and lay eggs, hatch them, and care for her young under her shadow; there also the vultures will gather, each with its mate.
23:34:16/Search in the book of the LORD and read: not one of these will be missing, none will lack its mate. For His mouth has commanded, and His Spirit has gathered them.
23:34:17/He has cast the lot for them, and His hand has divided it to them by line. They will possess it forever, from generation to generation they will dwell there.
23:35:1/The wilderness and the lonely places will be joyful for them; and the desert will be happy, blooming like a rose.
23:35:2/It will bloom profusely and celebrate with joy and singing: the splendor of Lebanon will be granted to it, the majesty of Carmel and Sharon, they will witness the splendor of the LORD, and the magnificence of our God.
23:35:3/Encourage those with weak hands, and make firm the knees that give way.
23:35:4/Tell those with anxious hearts, "Be strong, do not fear: look, your God will come with vengeance, with divine retribution; He will come to save you."
23:35:5/Then the eyes of the blind will be opened, and the ears of the deaf will be cleared.
23:35:6/Then the lame will leap like a deer, and the mute tongue will shout for joy: for water will gush forth in the wilderness, and streams in the desert.
23:35:7/And the dry ground will turn into a pool, and the thirsty land into springs of water: in the dwelling of jackals, where they lay, there will be grass with reeds and rushes.
23:35:8/And a highway will be there, a road, and it will be called the Highway of Holiness; the impure will not travel on it; it will be for those walking on the way: even if they are fools, they will not go astray.
23:35:9/No lion will be there, nor any ferocious beast will go up on it; they will not be found there; but the redeemed will walk there.
23:35:10/And those the LORD has saved will return, and enter Zion with singing, with eternal joy crowning their heads: they will attain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing will vanish.
23:36:1/In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah's reign, Sennacherib, the king of Assyria, attacked all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.
23:36:2/The king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem to King Hezekiah with a large army. He stood by the conduit of the upper pool on the road to the launderer's field.
23:36:3/Then Eliakim, Hilkiah's son, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the secretary, and Joah, Asaph's son, the recorder, came out to meet him.
23:36:4/And Rabshakeh said to them, "Tell Hezekiah that the great king, the king of Assyria, says, 'What is this confidence you have?'
23:36:5/"You claim to have strategy and strength for war, but these are just empty words. On whom are you depending, that you have rebelled against me?
23:36:6/"Look, you are relying on Egypt, that splintered reed of a staff, which pierces the hand of anyone who leans on it. Such is Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, to all who trust in him.
23:36:7/"But if you tell me, 'We trust in the LORD our God,' isn't he the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah removed, telling Judah and Jerusalem, 'You must worship before this altar'?
23:36:8/"Now then, make a bargain with my master, the king of Assyria: I will give you two thousand horses—if you can put riders on them!
23:36:9/"How can you repel one of the least of my master's officials, even relying on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?
23:36:10/"Have I come to attack and destroy this land without the LORD's guidance? The LORD himself told me, 'Go up against this land and destroy it.'"
23:36:11/Then Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to Rabshakeh, "Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, since we understand it. Don't speak to us in Hebrew in the hearing of the people on the wall."
23:36:12/But Rabshakeh replied, "Has my master sent me to speak these words only to your master and to you, and not to the men sitting on the wall—who, like you, will have to eat their own waste and drink their own urine?"
23:36:13/Then Rabshakeh stood and called out in Hebrew, "Listen to the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!
23:36:14/"This is what the king says: Do not let Hezekiah deceive you. He cannot deliver you.
23:36:15/"Do not let Hezekiah persuade you to trust in the LORD, saying, 'The LORD will surely deliver us. This city will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.'
23:36:16/"Do not listen to Hezekiah. For this is what the king of Assyria says: 'Make peace with me and come out to me. Then each of you will eat from your own vine and fig tree and drink water from your own cistern,
23:36:17/"Until I come and take you to a land like your own—a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.'
23:36:18/"Do not let Hezekiah mislead you by saying, 'The LORD will deliver us.' Have any of the gods of the nations ever delivered their land from the hand of the king of Assyria?
23:36:19/"Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they rescued Samaria from my hand?
23:36:20/"Who among all the gods of these lands have saved their lands from me, that the LORD should save Jerusalem from my hand?"
23:36:21/But they remained silent and did not answer him a word, for the king's command was, "Do not answer him."
23:36:22/Then Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah, who was in charge of the palace, Shebna the secretary, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn and reported to him the words of Rabshakeh.
23:37:1/When King Hezekiah heard this, he tore his clothes, put on sackcloth, and went into the temple of the LORD.
23:37:2/He sent Eliakim, the palace administrator, Shebna the secretary, and the senior priests, all wearing sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz.
23:37:3/They told him, "This is what Hezekiah says: Today is a day of distress, rebuke, and disgrace. It's like when children are about to be born, but there's no strength to deliver them.
23:37:4/Perhaps the LORD your God will hear the words of the Rabshakeh, whom his master, the king of Assyria, has sent to insult the living God, and will rebuke him for the words the LORD your God has heard. Therefore, offer a prayer for the surviving remnant."
23:37:5/So King Hezekiah's officials came to Isaiah.
23:37:6/Isaiah said to them, "Tell your master, 'This is what the LORD says: Do not be afraid of the words you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
23:37:7/Look, I will send a spirit upon him, and he will hear a rumor and return to his own land; and I will make him fall by the sword in his own land.'"
23:37:8/So the Rabshakeh returned and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah, for he had heard that the king had left Lachish.
23:37:9/He heard reports about Tirhakah, king of Ethiopia, saying, "He has come out to fight against you." So he sent messengers again to Hezekiah, saying,
23:37:10/"Tell Hezekiah king of Judah, 'Do not let your God, in whom you trust, deceive you by saying, "Jerusalem will not be handed over to the king of Assyria."
23:37:11/You have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all countries, destroying them completely. And will you be delivered?
23:37:12/Did the gods of the nations that were destroyed by my ancestors deliver them—the nations such as Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the people of Eden who were in Telassar?
23:37:13/Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivvah?'
23:37:14/Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Then he went up to the temple of the LORD and spread it out before the LORD.
23:37:15/And Hezekiah prayed to the LORD, saying,
23:37:16/"LORD of hosts, God of Israel, enthroned between the cherubim, you alone are God over all the kingdoms of the earth. You have made heaven and earth.
23:37:17/Turn your ear, LORD, and hear; open your eyes, LORD, and see; listen to all the words Sennacherib has sent to insult the living God.
23:37:18/It is true, LORD, that the Assyrian kings have laid waste all the nations and their lands,
23:37:19/And have thrown their gods into the fire, for they were not gods but the work of human hands—wood and stone. So they have destroyed them.
23:37:20/Now, LORD our God, save us from his hand, so that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you, LORD, are the only God."
23:37:21/Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah, saying, "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Because you have prayed to me concerning Sennacherib king of Assyria,
23:37:22/This is the word the LORD has spoken against him: 'The virgin daughter of Zion despises you and mocks you. The daughter of Jerusalem shakes her head at you.
23:37:23/Whom have you insulted and blasphemed? Against whom have you raised your voice and lifted your eyes in pride? Against the Holy One of Israel!
23:37:24/Through your servants, you have insulted the Lord. You have said, "With my many chariots, I have climbed the heights of the mountains, the utmost heights of Lebanon. I have cut down its tallest cedars, the choicest of its pines. I have reached its remotest heights, the finest of its forests.
23:37:25/I have dug wells and drunk foreign waters. With the soles of my feet, I have dried up all the streams of Egypt."
23:37:26/Have you not heard? Long ago I did it; from ancient times I planned it. Now I have brought it to pass, that you should turn fortified cities into piles of rubble.
23:37:27/Their inhabitants, powerless, are dismayed and put to shame. They are like plants in the field, like tender green shoots, like grass on the rooftops, scorched before it grows up.
23:37:28/But I know your sitting down, your going out and coming in, and your raging against me.
23:37:29/Because you rage against me and your arrogance has reached my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, and I will make you return by the way you came.
23:37:30/This will be a sign for you: This year you will eat what grows by itself, and in the second year what springs from that. But in the third year, sow and reap, plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
23:37:31/The surviving remnant of the house of Judah will again take root downward and bear fruit upward.
23:37:32/For out of Jerusalem will come a remnant, and out of Mount Zion a band of survivors. The zeal of the LORD of hosts will accomplish this.
23:37:33/Therefore, this is what the LORD says about the king of Assyria: He will not enter this city or shoot an arrow here. He will not come before it with shield or build a siege ramp against it.
23:37:34/By the way he came, by the same he will return; he will not enter this city, declares the LORD.
23:37:35/I will defend this city and save it, for my own sake and for the sake of my servant David."
23:37:36/Then the angel of the LORD went out and struck down 185,000 in the Assyrian camp. When the people got up the next morning—there were all the dead bodies!
23:37:37/So Sennacherib king of Assyria broke camp and withdrew. He returned to Nineveh and stayed there.
23:37:38/While he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer killed him with the sword, and they escaped to the land of Ararat. And Esarhaddon his son succeeded him as king.
23:38:1/In those days, Hezekiah was gravely ill. Isaiah the prophet, son of Amoz, came to him and said, "This is what the LORD says: Get your affairs in order, because you are going to die; you will not recover."
23:38:2/Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the LORD,
23:38:3/He said, "Please remember, LORD, how I have lived truthfully before you with a whole heart, doing what is right in your eyes." And Hezekiah cried bitterly.
23:38:4/Then the word of the LORD came to Isaiah, saying,
23:38:5/"Go and tell Hezekiah, 'This is what the LORD, the God of your ancestor David, says: I have heard your prayer and seen your tears. Look, I will add fifteen years to your life.
23:38:6/And I will save you and this city from the king of Assyria's hand; I will protect this city.
23:38:7/This will be the sign to you from the LORD that the LORD will do what he has promised:
23:38:8/See, I will make the shadow cast by the sun on the sundial of Ahaz go back ten steps." So the sunlight went back the ten steps it had gone down.
23:38:9/This is the account of Hezekiah king of Judah when he was ill and then recovered from his illness:
23:38:10/I thought, "In the prime of my life, I must enter the gates of the grave; I am deprived of the rest of my years."
23:38:11/I said, "I will not see the LORD, the LORD in the land of the living; I will look on humanity no more among the inhabitants of the earth.
23:38:12/My dwelling is pulled up and removed from me like a shepherd's tent. I have rolled up my life like a weaver; He cuts me off from the loom; from day to night you bring me to an end.
23:38:13/I waited patiently till morning, but like a lion, he breaks all my bones; from day to night you bring me to an end.
23:38:14/I cried like a crane or a swallow; I moaned like a dove. My eyes grow weak looking heavenward. LORD, I am in distress; be my guarantor.
23:38:15/What can I say? He has spoken to me, and he himself has done this. I will wander all my years because of the bitterness of my soul.
23:38:16/LORD, by such things people live; and in all of them is the life of my spirit. So you will restore me and make me live.
23:38:17/Indeed, it was for my own peace that I had great bitterness; but you have loved my soul out of the pit of destruction, for you have thrown all my sins behind your back.
23:38:18/For the grave cannot praise you, death cannot celebrate you; those who go down to the pit cannot hope for your faithfulness.
23:38:19/The living, the living—they praise you, as I am doing today; parents tell their children about your faithfulness.
23:38:20/The LORD was ready to save me; therefore, we will sing my songs with stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the LORD.
23:38:21/For Isaiah had said, "Let them take a lump of figs and apply it as a poultice on the boil, and he will recover."
23:38:22/Hezekiah also had said, "What is the sign that I will go up to the house of the LORD?"
23:39:1/At that time Merodachbaladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah because he had heard that Hezekiah had been ill and had recovered.
23:39:2/And Hezekiah was pleased with them, and showed them his treasury, the silver, the gold, the spices, the fine oil, his armory, and everything in his treasures. There was nothing in his house or in his entire realm that Hezekiah did not show them.
23:39:3/Then Isaiah the prophet came to King Hezekiah and asked, "What did these men say? And where did they come from to visit you?" And Hezekiah said, "They have come from a distant country, from Babylon."
23:39:4/Isaiah then asked, "What have they seen in your house?" And Hezekiah replied, "They have seen everything in my house. There is nothing among my treasures that I did not show them."
23:39:5/Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, "Listen to the word of the LORD Almighty:"
23:39:6/"Look, the time is coming when everything in your house, and all that your ancestors have stored up until this day, will be taken to Babylon. Nothing will be left," says the LORD.
23:39:7/"And some of your own descendants, your own offspring, will be taken away. They will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon."
23:39:8/Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, "The word of the LORD you have spoken is good." He also said, "For there will be peace and truth in my lifetime."
23:40:1/Comfort, comfort my people, says your God.
23:40:2/Talk to Jerusalem with tenderness, and proclaim to her that her time of hardship is over, that her sins are forgiven; for she has received from the LORD twice over for all her sins.
23:40:3/A voice cries out in the wilderness, 'Prepare the way for the LORD, make straight in the desert a highway for our God.'
23:40:4/Every valley shall be raised up, and every mountain and hill made low; the crooked places shall become straight, and the rough places smooth.
23:40:5/And the glory of the LORD will be revealed, and all people will see it together; for the LORD has spoken.
23:40:6/The voice said, 'Cry out.' And I said, 'What shall I cry out?' All people are like grass, and all their glory is like the flowers of the field.
23:40:7/The grass withers, the flower fades, when the breath of the LORD blows on it; surely the people are grass.
23:40:8/The grass withers, the flower fades, but the word of our God endures forever.
23:40:9/O Zion, messenger of good news, go up on a high mountain; O Jerusalem, messenger of good news, raise your voice with strength; raise it, do not be afraid; say to the cities of Judah, 'Look, your God!'
23:40:10/Look, the Lord GOD comes with power, and his arm rules for him; look, his reward is with him, and his recompense before him.
23:40:11/He will tend his flock like a shepherd; he will gather the lambs in his arms, and carry them close to his heart; he will gently lead those that have young.
23:40:12/Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, or with the breadth of his hand marked off the heavens? Who has held the dust of the earth in a basket, or weighed the mountains on the scales and the hills in a balance?
23:40:13/Who has understood the mind of the LORD, or instructed him as his counselor?
23:40:14/Whom did he consult to enlighten him, and who taught him the right way? Who was it that taught him knowledge or showed him the path of understanding?
23:40:15/Indeed, the nations are like a drop from a bucket, and are regarded as dust on the scales; he lifts up the islands like fine dust.
23:40:16/Even Lebanon is not enough to fuel, nor its animals enough for a burnt offering.
23:40:17/All the nations are as nothing before him; they are regarded by him as less than nothing and emptiness.
23:40:18/To whom, then, will you compare God? What image will you compare him to?
23:40:19/The craftsman casts an idol, and the goldsmith overlays it with gold and fashions silver chains for it.
23:40:20/A person too poor to present such an offering selects wood that will not rot; they look for a skilled craftsman to set up an idol that will not topple.
23:40:21/Do you not know? Have you not heard? Has it not been told you from the beginning? Have you not understood since the earth was founded?
23:40:22/He sits enthroned above the circle of the earth, and its people are like grasshoppers. He stretches out the heavens like a canopy, and spreads them out like a tent to live in.
23:40:23/He brings princes to naught and reduces the rulers of this world to nothing.
23:40:24/No sooner are they planted, no sooner are they sown, no sooner do they take root in the ground, than he blows on them and they wither, and a whirlwind sweeps them away like chaff.
23:40:25/To whom then will you compare me, that I should be like him? says the Holy One.
23:40:26/Look up and see who has created these stars, the One who leads out their host by number, calling them all by name; because of his great power and mighty strength, not one of them is missing.
23:40:27/Why do you say, O Jacob, and speak, O Israel, 'My way is hidden from the LORD, and my right is disregarded by my God'?
23:40:28/Do you not know? Have you not heard? The LORD is the everlasting God, the Creator of the ends of the earth. He does not grow tired or weary, and his understanding no one can fathom.
23:40:29/He gives strength to the weary and increases the power of the weak.
23:40:30/Even youths grow tired and weary, and young men stumble and fall;
23:40:31/But those who hope in the LORD will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.
23:41:1/Stay quiet before me, O islands; and let the people regain their strength: let them approach, then let them speak: let's come together for judgment.
23:41:2/Who brought forth the righteous man from the east, summoned him to his side, handed nations over to him, and made him ruler over kings? He turned them into dust with his sword, and like scattered straw with his bow.
23:41:3/He chased them and moved on safely; even by paths his feet had not traveled.
23:41:4/Who has accomplished and done this, summoning the generations from the start? I the LORD, the first, and with the last; I am he.
23:41:5/The islands saw it and were afraid; the ends of the earth trembled, drew close, and came together.
23:41:6/They supported each other; and everyone told their neighbor, Be strong.
23:41:7/So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, and the one smoothing with the hammer supported the one striking the anvil, saying, It's ready for soldering: and he secured it with nails, so it wouldn't move.
23:41:8/But you, Israel, are my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the offspring of Abraham my friend.
23:41:9/You whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, and called from its leaders, and said to you, You are my servant; I have chosen you and not rejected you.
23:41:10/Do not fear; for I am with you: do not be dismayed; for I am your God: I will strengthen you; yes, I will help you; yes, I will support you with my righteous right hand.
23:41:11/See, all those angry with you will be ashamed and disgraced: they will be as nothing; and those who oppose you will perish.
23:41:12/You will look for them, and not find them, those who argued with you: those who fight against you will be as nothing, as if they never existed.
23:41:13/For I the LORD your God will hold your right hand, telling you, Do not fear; I will assist you.
23:41:14/Do not fear, you lowly Jacob, and you people of Israel; I will help you, declares the LORD, and your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
23:41:15/See, I will make you into a new sharp threshing tool with teeth: you will thresh the mountains, and crush them, and turn the hills into chaff.
23:41:16/You will scatter them, and the wind will carry them away, and a whirlwind will disperse them: and you will rejoice in the LORD, and take pride in the Holy One of Israel.
23:41:17/When the poor and needy search for water, and there is none, and their tongue is parched from thirst, I the LORD will answer them, I the God of Israel will not abandon them.
23:41:18/I will open rivers on the barren heights, and springs in the midst of the valleys: I will turn the desert into pools of water, and the parched ground into springs.
23:41:19/I will plant in the desert the cedar, the acacia, the myrtle, and the olive; I will set in the wasteland the fir tree, the pine, and the box tree together:
23:41:20/So that they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together, that the hand of the LORD has done this, and the Holy One of Israel has created it.
23:41:21/Present your case, says the LORD; bring forth your strong arguments, says the King of Jacob.
23:41:22/Let them bring them forth, and show us what will happen: let them reveal the past events, what they were, that we may consider them, and know their outcome; or declare to us things to come.
23:41:23/Show the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that you are gods: indeed, do something good or bad, that we may be dismayed, and see it together.
23:41:24/See, you are nothing, and your deeds amount to nothing: an abomination is he who chooses you.
23:41:25/I have raised up one from the north, and he will come: from the sunrise he will call upon my name: and he will come upon princes as upon mortar, and as the potter treads clay.
23:41:26/Who has declared from the beginning, that we may know? and beforehand, that we may say, He is right? indeed, there is no one who shows, indeed, there is no one who declares, indeed, there is no one who hears your words.
23:41:27/The first will say to Zion, Look, look at them: and I will give to Jerusalem one who brings good news.
23:41:28/For I looked, and there was no one; among them, and there was no adviser, that, when I asked of them, could respond.
23:41:29/See, they are all futile; their works are nothing: their cast images are wind and confusion.
23:42:1/Look at my servant, whom I support; my chosen one, who brings me great joy; I have placed my spirit upon him: he will deliver justice to the nations.
23:42:2/He won't shout or raise his voice, nor make his voice heard in the streets.
23:42:3/He won't break a bruised reed, or snuff out a smoldering wick: he will bring forth justice faithfully.
23:42:4/He won't falter or lose heart until he has established justice on earth: and the distant lands will await his teachings.
23:42:5/This is what God the LORD says, the creator of the heavens, who stretched them out; who spread out the earth and all that comes from it; who gives breath to its people, and life to those who walk on it:
23:42:6/I, the LORD, have called you in righteousness, and will hold your hand; I will keep you and will make you to be a covenant for the people and a light for the nations,
23:42:7/To open eyes that are blind, to free captives from prison, and to release from the dungeon those who sit in darkness.
23:42:8/I am the LORD; that is my name! I will not yield my glory to another or my praise to idols.
23:42:9/See, the former things have taken place, and new things I declare; before they happen I announce them to you.
23:42:10/Sing to the LORD a new song, his praise from the ends of the earth, you who go down to the sea, and all that fills it, the islands, and their inhabitants.
23:42:11/Let the desert and its towns raise their voices; let the settlements where Kedar lives rejoice. Let the people of the rock sing; let them shout from the mountaintops.
23:42:12/Let them give glory to the LORD and proclaim his praise in the islands.
23:42:13/The LORD will march out like a champion, like a warrior he will stir up his zeal; with a shout, he will raise the battle cry and will triumph over his enemies.
23:42:14/For a long time I have kept silent, I have been quiet and held myself back. But now, like a woman in childbirth, I cry out, I gasp and pant.
23:42:15/I will lay waste the mountains and hills and dry up all their vegetation; I will turn rivers into islands and dry up the pools.
23:42:16/And I will lead the blind by ways they have not known, along unfamiliar paths I will guide them; I will turn the darkness into light before them and make the rough places smooth. These are the things I will do; I will not forsake them.
23:42:17/Those who trust in idols, who say to the images, 'You are our gods,' will be turned back in utter shame.
23:42:18/Hear, you deaf; look, you blind, and see!
23:42:19/Who is blind but my servant, and deaf like the messenger I send? Who is blind like the one in covenant with me, blind like the servant of the LORD?
23:42:20/You have seen many things, but you pay no attention; your ears are open, but you do not listen.
23:42:21/The LORD is pleased for his righteousness' sake; he will exalt the law and make it glorious.
23:42:22/But this is a people plundered and looted, all of them trapped in pits or hidden away in prisons. They have become plunder, with no one to rescue them; they have been made loot, with no one to say, 'Send them back.'
23:42:23/Who among you will listen to this or pay close attention in time to come?
23:42:24/Who handed Jacob over to become loot, and Israel to the plunderers? Was it not the LORD, against whom we have sinned? For they would not follow his ways; they did not obey his law.
23:42:25/So he poured on them his burning anger and the violence of war. It enveloped them in flames, yet they did not understand; it consumed them, but they did not take it to heart.
23:43:1/But now, this is what the LORD says, the one who created you, Jacob, and formed you, Israel: Do not be afraid, for I have redeemed you. I have called you by name; you are mine.
23:43:2/When you go through deep waters, I will be with you; when you go through rivers, they won't sweep you away. When you walk through fire, you won't be scorched, and the flames won't set you ablaze.
23:43:3/For I am the LORD your God, the Holy One of Israel, your Savior. I gave Egypt as your ransom, Ethiopia and Seba in your place.
23:43:4/Since you are precious in my eyes, you have been honored, and I have loved you. Therefore, I will exchange others for you and give nations in exchange for your life.
23:43:5/Do not be afraid, for I am with you. I will bring your descendants from the east and gather you from the west.
23:43:6/I will say to the north, 'Give them up!' and to the south, 'Do not hold them back.' Bring my sons from afar and my daughters from the ends of the earth.
23:43:7/Everyone who is called by my name, whom I created for my glory, whom I formed and made.
23:43:8/Bring out the people who are blind yet have eyes, and the deaf yet have ears.
23:43:9/Let all the nations gather together, and let the peoples assemble. Who among them can declare this and show us the former things? Let them bring their witnesses to prove they were right, so others may hear and say, 'It is true.'
23:43:10/You are my witnesses, declares the LORD, and my servant whom I have chosen, so that you may know and believe me and understand that I am he. Before me no god was formed, nor will there be one after me.
23:43:11/I, even I, am the LORD, and apart from me there is no savior.
23:43:12/I have declared, saved, and proclaimed, when there was no foreign god among you. Therefore, you are my witnesses, declares the LORD, that I am God.
23:43:13/Indeed, before the day was, I am he; and there is no one who can deliver from my hand. I will act, and who can reverse it?
23:43:14/This is what the LORD says, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: For your sake, I have sent to Babylon and brought down all their nobles, and the Chaldeans, whose cry is in the ships.
23:43:15/I am the LORD, your Holy One, the creator of Israel, your King.
23:43:16/This is what the LORD says, who makes a way in the sea and a path through the mighty waters.
23:43:17/Who brings out the chariot and horse, the army and the power; they will lie down together, they will not rise again; they are extinguished, snuffed out like a wick.
23:43:18/Forget the former things; do not dwell on the past.
23:43:19/See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.
23:43:20/The wild animals will honor me, the jackals and the owls, because I provide water in the wilderness and rivers in the desert, to give drink to my chosen people.
23:43:21/The people I formed for myself will declare my praise.
23:43:22/Yet you have not called on me, Jacob; you have grown tired of me, Israel.
23:43:23/You have not brought me sheep for burnt offerings, nor honored me with your sacrifices. I have not burdened you with grain offerings nor wearied you with demands for incense.
23:43:24/You have not bought any fragrant calamus for me, or lavished on me the fat of your sacrifices. But you have burdened me with your sins and wearied me with your offenses.
23:43:25/I, even I, am the one who wipes out your transgressions for my own sake, and I will not remember your sins.
23:43:26/Remind me; let us argue the matter together. State your case, so that you may be proved right.
23:43:27/Your first father sinned, and your mediators have transgressed against me.
23:43:28/Therefore, I have disgraced the princes of the sanctuary; I have consigned Jacob to destruction and Israel to scorn.
23:44:1/Listen now, Jacob, my servant, and Israel, whom I have chosen:
23:44:2/This is what the LORD who created you, and shaped you from before you were born, says: I will support you; do not be afraid, Jacob, my servant, and Jesurun, whom I have chosen.
23:44:3/I will pour water on the thirsty land and streams on the dry ground; I will pour my spirit on your descendants, and my blessing on your children.
23:44:4/They will grow like grass in a meadow, like poplars by flowing streams.
23:44:5/Some will say, 'I belong to the LORD'; others will call themselves by the name of Jacob; another will write on his hand, 'The LORD's,' and adopt the name Israel.
23:44:6/This is what the LORD, the King of Israel and its Redeemer, the LORD Almighty, says: I am the first and I am the last; apart from me there is no God.
23:44:7/Who else has called forth the generations from the beginning? Let them show us what is yet to come, and predict what will happen.
23:44:8/Do not fear, nor be afraid; haven't I told you from long ago and declared it? You are my witnesses. Is there any God besides me? No, there is no other Rock; I know not one.
23:44:9/Those who craft idols are all nothing; their cherished works will not benefit them. They are their own witnesses; they see nothing and know nothing, so they will be put to shame.
23:44:10/Who has created a god or cast an idol to no benefit?
23:44:11/Behold, all who associate with it will be ashamed; the craftsmen themselves are just men. Let them all come together and stand up; they will all be frightened and put to shame.
23:44:12/The blacksmith takes tools and works in the coals; he shapes it with hammers and works it with his strong arms. Yet he is hungry and his strength fails; he doesn't drink water and grows faint.
23:44:13/The carpenter measures with a line and makes an outline with a marker; he roughs it out with chisels and marks it with compasses. He shapes it in human form, in all its glory, to dwell in a shrine.
23:44:14/He cuts down cedars or perhaps took a cypress or oak. He let it grow among the trees of the forest, or planted a pine, and the rain made it grow.
23:44:15/It is used as fuel for burning; some of it he takes and warms himself, he kindles a fire and bakes bread. But he also fashions a god and worships it; he makes an idol and bows down to it.
23:44:16/He burns half of it in the fire; over that half he eats meat, he roasts a roast and is satisfied. He also warms himself and says, "Ah, I am warm, I see the fire."
23:44:17/From the rest he makes a god, his idol; he bows down to it and worships. He prays to it and says, "Save me; you are my god."
23:44:18/They know nothing, they understand nothing; their eyes are plastered over so they cannot see, and their minds closed so they cannot understand.
23:44:19/No one stops to think, no one has the knowledge or understanding to say, "Half of it I used for fuel; I even baked bread over its coals, I roasted meat and I ate. Shall I make a detestable thing from what is left? Shall I bow down to a block of wood?"
23:44:20/He feeds on ashes; a deluded heart misleads him. He cannot save himself, or say, "Isn't this thing in my right hand a lie?"
23:44:21/Remember these things, Jacob, and Israel, for you are my servant. I have made you, you are my servant; Israel, you will not be forgotten by me.
23:44:22/I have swept away your offenses like a cloud, your sins like the morning mist. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.
23:44:23/Sing for joy, you heavens, for the LORD has done this; shout aloud, you earth beneath. Burst into song, you mountains, you forests and all your trees, for the LORD has redeemed Jacob, and displays his glory in Israel.
23:44:24/This is what the LORD, your Redeemer, who formed you in the womb says: I am the LORD, the Maker of all things, who stretches out the heavens, who spreads out the earth by myself,
23:44:25/Who foils the signs of false prophets and makes fools of diviners, who overthrows the learning of the wise and turns it into nonsense,
23:44:26/Who carries out the words of his servants and fulfills the predictions of his messengers, who says of Jerusalem, 'It shall be inhabited,' and of the towns of Judah, 'They shall be rebuilt, and I will restore their ruins,'
23:44:27/Who says to the watery deep, 'Be dry, and I will dry up your streams,'
23:44:28/Who says of Cyrus, 'He is my shepherd and will accomplish all that I please; he will say of Jerusalem, "Let it be rebuilt," and of the temple, "Let its foundations be laid."'
23:45:1/This is what the LORD says to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have grasped to subdue nations before him; I will disarm kings to open doors before him so that gates will not remain closed:
23:45:2/I will lead the way and straighten out the winding paths: I will shatter the bronze gates and slice through the iron bars:
23:45:3/And I will give you the treasures hidden in darkness and the secret riches stored in secret places, so you may know that I, the LORD, who calls you by your name, am the God of Israel.
23:45:4/For the sake of Jacob my servant, and Israel my chosen, I have called you by your name and given you a title of honor, even though you do not know me.
23:45:5/I am the LORD, and there is no other; apart from me there is no God. I will strengthen you, though you have not acknowledged me:
23:45:6/So that people may know from the rising of the sun to its setting that there is none besides me. I am the LORD, and there is no other.
23:45:7/I create the light and make the darkness: I bring peace and create calamity: I, the LORD, do all these things.
23:45:8/Let the heavens rain down righteousness; let the skies pour it down. Let the earth open wide so salvation and righteousness can sprout together; I, the LORD, have created it.

23:45:19/I have not spoken in secret, from somewhere in a land of darkness; I did not say to Jacob's descendants, 'Seek me in vain.' I, the LORD, speak the truth; I declare what is right.

23:45:21/Declare and present your case; let them take counsel together. Who has announced this from ancient times? Who has declared it from that time? Have not I, the LORD? And there is no other god besides me, a righteous God and a Savior; there is none besides me.

23:55:12/You will go out in joy and be led forth in peace; the mountains and hills will burst into song before you, and all the trees of the field will clap their hands.
23:55:13/Instead of thorns, the fir tree will grow, and instead of briers, the myrtle will grow. This will be for the LORD's renown, for an everlasting sign that will not be destroyed.
23:56:1/This is what the LORD says, "Maintain justice and do what is right, for my salvation is close at hand and my righteousness will soon be revealed."
23:56:2/Blessed is the person who does this, the one who holds it firmly; who keeps the Sabbath without desecrating it, and keeps their hands from doing any wrong.
23:56:3/And let not the foreigner who has joined themselves to the LORD say, "The LORD will surely exclude me from his people." And let not the eunuch complain, "I am only a barren tree."
23:56:4/For this is what the LORD says: "To the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths, who choose what pleases me and hold fast to my covenant,
23:56:5/To them I will give within my temple and its walls a memorial and a name better than sons and daughters; I will give them an everlasting name that will not be cut off.
23:56:6/And foreigners who bind themselves to the LORD to minister to him, to love the name of the LORD, and to be his servants, all who keep the Sabbath without desecrating it and who hold fast to my covenant—
23:56:7/These I will bring to my holy mountain and give them joy in my house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and sacrifices will be accepted on my altar; for my house will be called a house of prayer for all nations."
23:56:8/The Sovereign LORD, who gathers the exiles of Israel, declares, "I will gather still others to them besides those already gathered."
23:56:9/All you animals of the field, come to devour, all you animals in the forest.
23:56:10/His watchmen are blind, lacking knowledge; they are all silent dogs, unable to bark, dreaming, lying down, loving to sleep.
23:56:11/Indeed, they are greedy dogs that can never have enough. They are shepherds with no understanding; they all turn to their own way, each seeks their own gain.
23:56:12/Come, they say, let's get wine and let's drink our fill of beer; and tomorrow will be like today, only much better.
23:57:1/Good people pass away, and no one cares. Merciful people are taken away, with no one realizing that the righteous are spared from the coming evil.
23:57:2/They will find peace; they will rest in their beds, each one walking in their integrity.
23:57:3/But come here, you children of a sorceress, offspring of an adulterer and a prostitute.
23:57:4/Who are you mocking? Against whom do you open your mouth wide and stick out your tongue? Aren't you the offspring of rebellion, born of deceit,
23:57:5/Burning with lust among the idols under every green tree, murdering the children in the valleys under the cliffs of the rocks?
23:57:6/Your share is among the smooth stones of the stream; they are your lot. Even to them you have poured out drink offerings and offered grain offerings. Should I be comforted by these?
23:57:7/On a high and lofty mountain you have set your bed, and there you went up to offer sacrifices.
23:57:8/Behind the door and the doorpost you have set up your memorial. For you have uncovered yourself to someone other than me, and have gone up; you have enlarged your bed and made a pact with them; you loved their bed where you saw it.
23:57:9/You went to the king with oil and increased your perfumes, and sent your envoys far away, degrading yourself even to the depths.
23:57:10/You are exhausted by your extensive travels, yet you did not say, 'It's hopeless.' You found renewed strength, so you did not weaken.
23:57:11/Whom were you so afraid of that you lied, and didn't remember me or take it to heart? Have I not been silent for a long time, and you don't fear me?
23:57:12/I will expose your righteousness and your deeds, but they will not benefit you.
23:57:13/When you cry out, let your collection of idols save you! The wind will carry them all off, a mere breath will take them away. But whoever takes refuge in me will inherit the land and possess my holy mountain.
23:57:14/And it will be said: "Build up, build up, prepare the road! Remove the obstacles out of the way of my people."
23:57:15/For this is what the high and exalted One says—He who lives forever, whose name is Holy: "I live in a high and holy place, but also with the one who is contrite and lowly in spirit, to revive the spirit of the lowly and to revive the heart of the contrite.
23:57:16/For I will not accuse forever, nor will I always be angry, for then the spirit of humans would grow faint before me— the breath of life I have created.
23:57:17/I was angry because of their greedy dishonesty; I punished them, and hid myself in anger, yet they kept turning back to their own ways.
23:57:18/I have seen their ways, but I will heal them; I will guide them and restore comfort to them and their mourners,
23:57:19/creating praise on their lips. Peace, peace, to those far and near," says the LORD. "And I will heal them."
23:57:20/But the wicked are like the tossing sea, which cannot rest, whose waves cast up mire and mud.
23:57:21/"There is no peace," says my God, "for the wicked."
23:58:1/Shout loudly, don't hold back, raise your voice like a trumpet, and show my people their wrongdoings, and the descendants of Jacob their sins.
23:58:2/Yet they seek me every day, and are eager to know my ways, as if they were a nation that did what was right, and did not abandon the laws of their God: they ask me for just rulings; they enjoy coming close to God.
23:58:3/"Why have we fasted," they say, "and you haven't noticed? Why have we humbled ourselves, and you haven't paid attention?" Look, on the day of your fast, you seek your own pleasure and exploit all your workers.
23:58:4/Indeed, you fast for conflict and quarreling, and to strike with a wicked fist. You cannot fast as you do today, hoping to make your voice heard on high.
23:58:5/Is this the kind of fast I have chosen? Only a day for people to humble themselves? Is it just for bowing one's head like a reed and for lying in sackcloth and ashes? Is that what you call a fast, a day acceptable to the LORD?
23:58:6/Isn't this the fast I choose: to release the chains of injustice, to untie the cords of the yoke, to set the oppressed free, and to break every yoke?
23:58:7/Isn't it to share your food with the hungry and to provide the poor wanderer with shelter—when you see the naked, to clothe them, and not to turn away from your own flesh and blood?
23:58:8/Then your light will break forth like the dawn, and your healing will quickly appear; then your righteousness will go before you, and the glory of the LORD will be your rear guard.
23:58:9/Then you will call, and the LORD will answer; you will cry for help, and he will say: Here I am. If you do away with the yoke of oppression, with the pointing finger and malicious talk,
23:58:10/And if you spend yourselves in behalf of the hungry and satisfy the needs of the oppressed, then your light will rise in the darkness, and your night will become like the noonday.
23:58:11/And the LORD will guide you always; he will satisfy your needs in a sun-scorched land and will strengthen your frame. You will be like a well-watered garden, like a spring whose waters never fail.
23:58:12/Your people will rebuild the ancient ruins and will raise up the age-old foundations; you will be called Repairer of Broken Walls, Restorer of Streets with Dwellings.
23:58:13/If you keep your feet from breaking the Sabbath and from doing as you please on my holy day; if you call the Sabbath a delight and the LORD's holy day honorable, and if you honor it by not going your own way and not doing as you please or speaking idle words,
23:58:14/Then you will find your joy in the LORD, and I will take you to ride on the heights of the land and to feast on the inheritance of your father Jacob. For the mouth of the LORD has spoken.
23:59:1/Look, the LORD's hand isn't too short to save, nor is his ear too dull to hear.
23:59:2/But your wrongdoings have created a separation between you and your God, and your sins have made him hide his face from you, so that he won't listen.
23:59:3/Your hands are stained with blood, and your fingers with wrongdoing; your lips have told lies, your tongue whispers deceit.
23:59:4/No one calls for justice, nor does anyone argue honestly: they rely on empty arguments and speak falsehoods; they plan harm and give birth to evil.
23:59:5/They hatch deadly eggs and spin webs of deceit: whoever eats their eggs dies, and when one is crushed, a viper comes out.
23:59:6/Their webs can't serve as clothing, nor can they cover themselves with what they make: their actions are actions of wrongdoing, and acts of violence are in their hands.
23:59:7/They rush into sin, eager to spill innocent blood: their thoughts are thoughts of wrongdoing; ruin and destruction are in their paths.
23:59:8/They don't know the way of peace; there's no fairness in their tracks: they've made their paths crooked; anyone who walks in them won't know peace.
23:59:9/That's why justice is far from us, and fairness doesn't reach us: we hope for light but find darkness; for brightness, but we walk in gloom.
23:59:10/We grope along the wall like the blind, we grope as if we had no eyes: we stumble at midday as in the twilight; among the strong, we're like the dead.
23:59:11/We all growl like bears, and moan sadly like doves: we hope for justice, but there is none; for salvation, but it's far from us.
23:59:12/For our offenses are many in your sight, and our sins testify against us: our offenses are with us, and we acknowledge our iniquities;
23:59:13/In rebelling and lying against the LORD, and turning away from our God, talking oppression and revolt, conceiving and uttering from the heart false words.
23:59:14/And justice is turned back, and righteousness stands at a distance; for truth has stumbled in the public squares, and honesty cannot enter.
23:59:15/Yes, truth is missing; and whoever turns away from evil makes themselves a target: and the LORD saw it, and it displeased him that there was no justice.
23:59:16/He saw that there was no one, and was astonished that there was no one to intervene; so his own arm brought him salvation, and his righteousness upheld him.
23:59:17/He put on righteousness as a breastplate, and a helmet of salvation on his head; he put on garments of vengeance for clothing, and wrapped himself in zeal as in a cloak.
23:59:18/According to their deeds, so will he repay, wrath to his adversaries, retribution to his enemies; to the islands he will repay retribution.
23:59:19/So they will fear the name of the LORD from the west, and his glory from the rising of the sun. When the enemy comes in like a flood, the Spirit of the LORD will put him to flight.
23:59:20/And the Redeemer will come to Zion, to those in Jacob who turn from transgression, declares the LORD.
23:59:21/As for me, this is my covenant with them, says the LORD; My spirit that is upon you, and my words which I have put in your mouth, shall not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouth of your offspring, nor from the mouth of your offspring's offspring, says the LORD, from now on and forever.
23:60:1/Get up, shine; for your light has arrived, and the glory of the LORD has risen upon you.
23:60:2/For, look, darkness will cover the earth, and deep darkness the people: but the LORD will rise upon you, and his glory will be seen on you.
23:60:3/And nations will come to your light, and kings to the brightness of your dawn.
23:60:4/Look around and see: everyone gathers and comes to you: your sons will come from afar, and your daughters will be carried at your side.
23:60:5/Then you will see and be radiant, and your heart will thrill and swell; because the wealth of the seas will be brought to you, the riches of nations will come to you.
23:60:6/A multitude of camels will cover you, the young camels of Midian and Ephah; all from Sheba will come: they will bring gold and frankincense; and they will proclaim the praises of the LORD.
23:60:7/All the flocks of Kedar will be gathered to you, the rams of Nebaioth will serve you: they will be accepted as offerings on my altar, and I will beautify my glorious temple.
23:60:8/Who are these that fly like a cloud, and like doves to their nests?
23:60:9/Indeed, the distant lands will wait for me, and the ships of Tarshish first, to bring your sons from afar, their silver and gold with them, to the name of the LORD your God, and to the Holy One of Israel, because he has made you glorious.
23:60:10/And foreigners will rebuild your walls, and their kings will serve you: for in my anger I struck you, but in my favor I have had mercy on you.
23:60:11/Therefore your gates will always be open; they will not be shut day or night, so that people may bring you the wealth of nations, and their kings led in procession.
23:60:12/For the nation and kingdom that will not serve you will perish; indeed, those nations will be utterly ruined.
23:60:13/The splendor of Lebanon will come to you, the juniper, the fir, and the cypress together, to adorn the place of my sanctuary; and I will glorify the place where my feet rest.
23:60:14/The descendants of those who oppressed you will come bowing to you; and all who despised you will bow down at your feet; and they will call you The City of the LORD, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
23:60:15/Whereas you have been abandoned and hated, with no one passing through, I will make you an everlasting pride, a joy from generation to generation.
23:60:16/You will also nurse on the milk of nations, and nurse at the breast of kings: and you will know that I, the LORD, am your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
23:60:17/Instead of bronze I will bring gold, and instead of iron I will bring silver, and instead of wood, bronze, and instead of stones, iron. I will also make your overseers peace, and your taskmasters righteousness.
23:60:18/Violence will no longer be heard in your land, nor devastation or destruction within your borders; but you will call your walls Salvation, and your gates Praise.
23:60:19/The sun will no longer be your light by day, nor for brightness will the moon give light to you: but the LORD will be your everlasting light, and your God your glory.
23:60:20/Your sun will no longer set, nor will your moon wane: for the LORD will be your everlasting light, and the days of your mourning will be over.
23:60:21/Your people will all be righteous: they will possess the land forever, the shoot I have planted, the work of my hands, for the display of my splendor.
23:60:22/A small one will become a thousand, and a little one a strong nation: I, the LORD, will speed it up in its time.

23:61:2/To announce the year of the LORD's favor, and the day of vengeance of our God; to comfort all who mourn;
23:61:3/To provide for those who grieve in Zion, to bestow on them a crown of beauty instead of ashes, the oil of gladness instead of mourning, and a garment of praise instead of a spirit of despair; so they will be called oaks of righteousness, a planting of the LORD for the display of his splendor.
23:61:4/They will rebuild the ancient ruins and restore the places long devastated; they will renew the ruined cities that have been devastated for generations.

23:61:10/I will greatly rejoice in the LORD, my soul will exult in my God; for he has clothed me with the garments of salvation, he has wrapped me with a robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom adorns his head like a priest, and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.
23:61:11/For as the earth brings forth its shoots, and as a garden causes what is sown in it to sprout up, so the Lord GOD will cause righteousness and praise to sprout up before all the nations.

23:62:3/You will be a splendid crown in the LORD's hand, and a royal headband in the hand of your God.
23:62:4/You will no longer be called Abandoned, nor will your land be called Wasteland. Instead, you will be called My Delight Is in Her, and your land Married; for the LORD delights in you, and your land will be united in marriage.
23:62:5/Just as a young man marries a maiden, so your children will marry you. And as a groom is happy with his bride, so your God will be full of joy over you.
23:62:6/I have placed guards on your walls, Jerusalem; they will not be silent day or night. You who call on the LORD, give yourselves no rest,
23:62:7/And give him no rest until he establishes Jerusalem and makes her the praise of the earth.

23:62:9/But those who harvest it will eat it and praise the LORD, and those who gather the grapes will drink it in the sacred courts of my sanctuary.

23:63:1/Who is this coming from Edom, with clothes dyed from Bozrah? This one, glorious in his attire, moving in the greatness of his strength? I, who speak in righteousness, powerful to save.
23:63:2/Why are your clothes red, and your garments like those of someone who has been treading in the winepress?
23:63:3/I have pressed the grapes alone; no one was with me. For I will crush them in my anger, and stomp them in my rage; their blood will splash on my clothes, and I will stain all my clothing.
23:63:4/For the day of revenge is in my heart, and the time for my people to be freed has arrived.
23:63:5/And I looked, but there was no one to help; I was amazed that no one supported me. So my own arm achieved salvation for me; and my own rage supported me.
23:63:6/And I will stomp on the nations in my anger, and make them drunk in my fury, and I will bring their power down to the earth.
23:63:7/I will talk about the LORD's acts of kindness, and the praises of the LORD, for all that the LORD has given us, and the great goodness toward the house of Israel, which he has given them according to his mercies, and according to the abundance of his acts of kindness.
23:63:8/For he said, Surely they are my people, children who will not deceive: so he became their Savior.

23:63:10/But they rebelled, and grieved his Holy Spirit: so he turned against them as an enemy, and fought against them.
23:63:11/Then he remembered the days of old, Moses and his people, saying, Where is the one who brought them up out of the sea with the shepherd of his flock? Where is the one who put his Holy Spirit in their midst?
23:63:12/Who led them with the right hand of Moses, with his glorious arm, dividing the water before them, to make for himself an everlasting name?
23:63:13/Who led them through the depths, like a horse in the desert, so they did not stumble?

23:63:19/We belong to you. You never ruled over them; they were not called by your name.

23:64:2/Just like when fire kindles brushwood and the fire makes water boil, to reveal your name to your enemies, so that nations would tremble before you!
23:64:3/When you did awesome deeds that we did not expect, you came down, and the mountains quaked at your presence.
23:64:4/From the beginning of time, no one has heard, nor has anyone perceived, nor has any eye seen any God besides you, who acts on behalf of those who wait for him.

23:64:6/Yet we have all become like something unclean, and all our righteous acts are like a polluted garment; we all fade like a leaf, and our sins, like the wind, take us away.
23:64:7/No one calls on your name or strives to lay hold of you; for you have hidden your face from us and have given us over to our sins.
23:64:8/But now, O LORD, you are our Father; we are the clay, and you are our potter; we are all the work of your hand.
23:64:9/Do not be exceedingly angry, O LORD, and do not remember our sins forever. Please look at us, for we are all your people.

23:64:11/Our holy and glorious temple, where our ancestors praised you, has been burned with fire, and all our precious things have become ruins.
23:64:12/Will you restrain yourself at these things, O LORD? Will you keep silent and afflict us so severely?
23:65:1/I am sought by those who did not ask for me; I am found by those who did not seek me. I said, "Here I am, here I am," to a nation that did not call on my name.
23:65:2/I have reached out my hands all day long to a rebellious people, who walk in paths not good, following their own ideas;
23:65:3/A people who constantly provoke me to anger right to my face; who offer sacrifices in gardens, and burn incense on altars made of bricks; 
23:65:4/Who stay among the graves, and spend nights in secret places, who eat pork, and their pots hold broth of detestable things;
23:65:5/Who say, 'Keep away, don't come near me, for I am too sacred for you.' Such people are like smoke in my nostrils, a fire that keeps burning all day.
23:65:6/See, it is written before me: I will not keep silent but will repay, will indeed repay into their laps,
