23:65:7/Both your sins and the sins of your ancestors," says the LORD. "Because they burned incense on the mountains and scorned me on the hills, I will measure into their laps the full payment for their former deeds."
23:65:8/This is what the LORD says: "As when juice is found in a cluster of grapes and people say, 'Don't destroy it, there is a blessing in it,' so will I do for my servants' sake; I will not destroy them all.
23:65:9/I will bring forth descendants from Jacob, and from Judah those who will possess my mountains; my chosen will inherit them, and my servants will live there.
23:65:10/Sharon will become a pasture for flocks, and the Valley of Achor a resting place for herds, for my people who seek me.
23:65:11/But as for you who forsake the LORD, who forget my holy mountain, who spread a table for Fortune and fill bowls of mixed wine for Destiny,
23:65:12/I will destine you for the sword, and all of you will fall in the slaughter; because when I called, you did not answer, when I spoke, you did not listen; but you did what was evil in my eyes and chose what I did not delight in."
23:65:13/Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says: "My servants will eat, but you will go hungry; my servants will drink, but you will go thirsty; my servants will rejoice, but you will be put to shame.
23:65:14/My servants will sing out of the joy of their hearts, but you will cry out from the anguish of your heart and wail in brokenness of spirit.
23:65:15/You will leave your name as a curse to my chosen ones, and the Sovereign LORD will put you to death, but to his servants he will give another name.
23:65:16/Whoever invokes a blessing in the land will do so by the God of truth; whoever takes an oath in the land will swear by the God of truth. For the past troubles will be forgotten and hidden from my eyes.
23:65:17/See, I will create new heavens and a new earth. The former things will not be remembered, nor will they come to mind.
23:65:18/But be glad and rejoice forever in what I will create, for I will create Jerusalem to be a delight and its people a joy.
23:65:19/I will rejoice over Jerusalem and take delight in my people; the sound of weeping and of crying will be heard in it no more.
23:65:20/Never again will there be in it an infant who lives but a few days, or an old man who does not live out his years; the one who dies at a hundred will be thought a mere child; the one who fails to reach a hundred will be considered accursed.
23:65:21/They will build houses and dwell in them; they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.
23:65:22/No longer will they build houses and others live in them, or plant and others eat. For as the days of a tree, so will be the days of my people; my chosen ones will long enjoy the work of their hands.
23:65:23/They will not labor in vain, nor will they bear children doomed to misfortune; for they will be a people blessed by the LORD, they and their descendants with them.
23:65:24/Before they call I will answer; while they are still speaking I will hear.
23:65:25/The wolf and the lamb will feed together, and the lion will eat straw like the ox, and dust will be the serpent's food. They will neither harm nor destroy on all my holy mountain," says the LORD.
23:66:1/The LORD says, "Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house could you build for me? Where would my resting place be?
23:66:2/For I have made all these things with my own hands, and they all belong to me, says the LORD. But I will pay attention to the one who is poor, humble, and respects my word.
23:66:3/Killing an ox is like murdering a person; sacrificing a lamb is like breaking a dog's neck; offering grain is like offering pig's blood; burning incense is like worshiping an idol. They have chosen their own paths, and their souls delight in their detestable practices.
23:66:4/So, I will also choose harsh treatment for them and bring their fears upon them. Because when I called, no one answered; when I spoke, they did not listen. They did evil in my sight and chose what displeases me.
23:66:5/Listen to the LORD's word, you who respect his word. Your own brothers who hate you and exclude you because of my name have said, 'Let the LORD be glorified, so we can see your joy,' but they will be put to shame.
23:66:6/A sound of uproar from the city, a sound from the temple, the sound of the LORD repaying his enemies what they deserve.
23:66:7/Before she was in labor, she gave birth; before her pain came, she delivered a male child.
23:66:8/Who has ever heard of such things? Who has ever seen things like this? Can a country be born in a day or a nation be brought forth in a moment? Yet no sooner is Zion in labor than she gives birth to her children.
23:66:9/Would I bring to the moment of birth and not deliver?" says the LORD. "Would I, who cause to deliver, shut the womb?" says your God.
23:66:10/Be joyful with Jerusalem and rejoice for her, all you who love her; be delighted with her, all you who mourn over her.
23:66:11/So that you may nurse and be satisfied from her comforting breast; that you may drink deeply and delight in her overflowing abundance.
23:66:12/For this is what the LORD says: "I will extend peace to her like a river, and the wealth of nations like a flooding stream; you will nurse and be carried on her arm and dandled on her knees.
23:66:13/As a mother comforts her child, so will I comfort you; and you will be comforted in Jerusalem.
23:66:14/When you see this, your heart will rejoice and you will flourish like grass; the hand of the LORD will be made known to his servants, but his fury will be shown to his foes.
23:66:15/For behold, the LORD will come with fire and his chariots like a whirlwind, to execute his anger with fury and his rebuke with flames of fire.
23:66:16/For with fire and with his sword the LORD will execute judgment on all people, and many will be those slain by the LORD.
23:66:17/Those who consecrate and purify themselves to go into the gardens, following one in the midst, who eat pig's flesh, detestable things, and mice, will come to an end together, declares the LORD.
23:66:18/And I, knowing their actions and thoughts, am coming to gather all nations and languages. They will come and see my glory.
23:66:19/I will set a sign among them, and I will send some of those who survive to the nations—to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, who draw the bow, to Tubal and Javan, to the distant islands that have not heard of my fame or seen my glory. They will proclaim my glory among the nations.
23:66:20/And they will bring all your brothers from all the nations as an offering to the LORD, on horses, in chariots, in litters, on mules, and on camels, to my holy mountain Jerusalem," says the LORD, "just as the Israelites bring their grain offering in a clean vessel to the house of the LORD.
23:66:21/And I will also take some of them as priests and Levites," says the LORD.
23:66:22/"For as the new heavens and the new earth that I will make will endure before me," declares the LORD, "so will your descendants and your name endure.
23:66:23/And it will happen that from one new moon to another and from one Sabbath to another, all humanity will come to worship before me," says the LORD.
23:66:24/And they will go out and see the corpses of the men who have rebelled against me; for their worm will not die, nor will their fire be quenched, and they will be abhorrent to all humanity.
24:1:1/The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests that were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin: 
24:1:2/To whom the word of the LORD came in the days of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign.
24:1:3/It also came during the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, up to the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah the son of Josiah king of Judah, until the time Jerusalem was taken captive in the fifth month.
24:1:4/Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying, 
24:1:5/Before I formed you in the womb I knew you; before you were born I set you apart; I appointed you as a prophet to the nations.
24:1:6/Then I said, "Ah, Sovereign LORD! I don't know how to speak; I'm too young."
24:1:7/But the LORD said to me, "Do not say, 'I'm too young.' You must go to everyone I send you to and say whatever I command you.
24:1:8/Do not be afraid of them, for I am with you and will rescue you," declares the LORD.
24:1:9/Then the LORD reached out his hand, touched my mouth, and said to me, "I have put my words in your mouth.
24:1:10/See, today I appoint you over nations and kingdoms to uproot and tear down, to destroy and overthrow, to build and to plant."
24:1:11/Moreover, the word of the LORD came to me, saying, "Jeremiah, what do you see?" And I said, "I see a branch of an almond tree."
24:1:12/Then the LORD said to me, "You have seen correctly, for I am watching to see that my word is fulfilled."
24:1:13/And the word of the LORD came to me a second time, saying, "What do you see?" And I said, "I see a boiling pot, tilting away from the north."
24:1:14/Then the LORD said to me, "From the north disaster will be poured out on all the inhabitants of the land.
24:1:15/For I am about to summon all the clans of the kingdoms of the north," declares the LORD. "They will come and each will set up their throne at the entrance of the gates of Jerusalem, against all its surrounding walls and against all the towns of Judah.
24:1:16/I will pronounce my judgments on them for all their wickedness in forsaking me, in burning incense to other gods, and in worshiping what their hands have made.
24:1:17/Therefore, prepare yourself and get up, and speak to them everything I command you. Do not be terrified by them, or I will terrify you before them.
24:1:18/For today, I have made you a fortified city, an iron pillar, and bronze walls against the whole land—against the kings of Judah, its officials, its priests, and the people of the land.
24:1:19/They will fight against you, but they will not overcome you, for I am with you to rescue you," declares the LORD.
24:2:1/Furthermore, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
24:2:2/Go and proclaim loudly to Jerusalem, saying, This is what the LORD says; I remember your early devotion, the love of your betrothal, when you followed me in the wilderness, in a land that was barren.
24:2:3/Israel was sacred to the LORD, the first of his harvest: anyone who harmed him would be guilty; disaster would come upon them, says the LORD.
24:2:4/Listen to the word of the LORD, O house of Jacob, and all the clans of the house of Israel:
24:2:5/This is what the LORD says, What wrongdoing did your ancestors find in me, that they drifted away from me, and pursued emptiness, becoming empty themselves?
24:2:6/They did not ask, 'Where is the LORD who brought us out of Egypt, who led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts and ravines, through a land of drought and deep darkness, through a land that no one traveled, and where no one lived?'
24:2:7/And I brought you into a fertile land, to enjoy its fruit and its good things; but when you entered, you defiled my land, and made my heritage detestable.
24:2:8/The priests did not ask, 'Where is the LORD?' Those who dealt with the law did not know me: the shepherds rebelled against me, and the prophets prophesied by Baal, following useless idols.
24:2:9/Therefore, I will still argue with you, says the LORD, and with your children's children I will argue.
24:2:10/Go across to the coasts of Cyprus and look; send to Kedar and observe closely; see if there has ever been anything like this.
24:2:11/Has a nation ever swapped its gods, (yet they are not gods at all)? Yet my people have exchanged their Glory for worthless idols.
24:2:12/Be appalled at this, you heavens, shudder with great horror, says the LORD.
24:2:13/For my people have committed two sins: They have abandoned me, the spring of living water, and they have dug their own cisterns, broken cisterns that cannot hold water.
24:2:14/Is Israel a servant, a slave by birth? Why then has he become plunder?
24:2:15/The young lions have roared at him, they have growled, and they have made his land desolate; his cities are burned, without anyone living in them.
24:2:16/Even the people of Noph and Tahpanhes have cracked your skull.
24:2:17/Have you not brought this on yourself by forsaking the LORD your God when he led you in the way?
24:2:18/And now why do you journey to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Nile? Or why do you journey to Assyria, to drink the waters of the Euphrates?
24:2:19/Your own wickedness will punish you, and your backsliding will rebuke you. Know and see that it is an evil and bitter thing for you to forsake the LORD your God, and the fear of me is not in you, declares the Lord GOD of hosts.
24:2:20/Long ago I broke your yoke and tore off your chains; but you said, 'I will not serve.' Yet on every high hill and under every green tree you lay down as a prostitute.
24:2:21/Yet I had planted you as a choice vine, all of pure seed: how then have you turned degenerate and become a wild vine to me?
24:2:22/Even though you wash yourself with lye and use much soap, the stain of your guilt is still before me, declares the Lord GOD.
24:2:23/How can you say, 'I am not defiled, I have not gone after the Baals'? Look at your behavior in the valley; understand what you have done: you are a swift young camel running here and there;
24:2:24/A wild donkey accustomed to the desert, sniffing the wind in her craving - in her mating season, who can restrain her? Any males that pursue her need not tire themselves; at mating time they will find her.
24:2:25/Keep your feet from going unshod and your throat from thirst. But you said, 'It's hopeless: I love foreign gods, and I must go after them.'
24:2:26/Just as a thief is disgraced when caught, so the house of Israel is disgraced - they, their kings, their officials, their priests, and their prophets.
24:2:27/They say to wood, 'You are my father,' and to stone, 'You gave me birth.' For they have turned their back to me, and not their face. But in the time of their trouble, they say, 'Come and save us!'
24:2:28/But where are your gods that you made for yourself? Let them rise up if they can save you in your time of trouble; for as many as your cities are your gods, O Judah.
24:2:29/Why do you argue with me? You all have rebelled against me, says the LORD.
24:2:30/In vain I have struck your children; they accepted no discipline. Your own sword has devoured your prophets like a ravenous lion.
24:2:31/O generation, see the word of the LORD. Have I been a desert to Israel or a land of deep darkness? Why do my people say, 'We are free to roam; we will come to you no more'?
24:2:32/Can a young woman forget her jewelry, or a bride her wedding ornaments? Yet my people have forgotten me, days without number.
24:2:33/Why do you beautify your way to seek love? Therefore, you have also taught the wicked your ways.
24:2:34/Also on your skirts is found the blood of the innocent poor; you did not catch them breaking in. Yet in spite of all these things,
24:2:35/you say, 'I am innocent; surely his anger has turned from me.' Behold, I will judge you because you say, 'I have not sinned.'
24:2:36/Why do you go about so much, changing your ways? You will also be disappointed by Egypt, as you were disappointed by Assyria.
24:2:37/From there you will go out with your hands on your head, for the LORD has rejected those you trust; you will not succeed with them.
24:3:1/People ask, "If a man divorces his wife and she leaves him to be with another man, can he take her back again? Wouldn't such an action defile the land? But you have been unfaithful with many lovers; yet I am willing to take you back, says the LORD."
24:3:2/Look up to the barren heights and see where you haven't been violated. You waited for them by the roadside like a nomad in the desert; you have defiled the land with your promiscuity and your wickedness.
24:3:3/That's why the rains have been withheld, and there has been no spring rain. Yet you have the brazen look of a prostitute; you refuse to be ashamed.
24:3:4/From now on, won't you call out to me, 'My Father, you are the guide of my youth?'
24:3:5/Will he hold onto his anger forever? Will he keep it to the end? Look, you have spoken and acted in evil ways as much as you could.
24:3:6/The LORD said to me during the reign of King Josiah, "Have you seen what faithless Israel has done? She has gone up on every high hill and under every spreading tree and has been unfaithful there.
24:3:7/And even after she had done all this, I thought she might return to me, but she did not. And her treacherous sister Judah saw it.
24:3:8/I saw that for all the reasons faithless Israel had committed adultery, I had sent her away and given her a certificate of divorce. Yet her treacherous sister Judah was not afraid; she also went and was unfaithful.
24:3:9/Because of her casual promiscuity, she defiled the land and committed adultery with stone and wood.
24:3:10/And in spite of all this, her treacherous sister Judah has not returned to me with all her heart, but only in pretense," says the LORD.
24:3:11/And the LORD said to me, "Faithless Israel is more righteous than unfaithful Judah.
24:3:12/Go, proclaim this message toward the north: 'Return, faithless Israel,' says the LORD, 'I will no longer look on you in anger, for I am merciful,' says the LORD, 'I will not be angry forever.
24:3:13/Only acknowledge your guilt—that you have rebelled against the LORD your God, you have scattered your favors to foreign gods under every spreading tree, and have not obeyed me,'" says the LORD.
24:3:14/"Return, faithless people," says the LORD, "for I am your husband. I will choose you—one from a town and two from a clan—and bring you to Zion.
24:3:15/And I will give you shepherds after my own heart, who will lead you with knowledge and understanding.
24:3:16/And when you have increased and become fruitful in the land, in those days," says the LORD, "people will no longer talk about the ark of the covenant of the LORD. It will not come to mind or be remembered; it will not be missed, nor will another one be made.
24:3:17/At that time they will call Jerusalem the Throne of the LORD, and all nations will gather in Jerusalem to honor the name of the LORD. No longer will they follow the stubbornness of their evil hearts.
24:3:18/In those days the house of Judah will join the house of Israel, and together they will come from a northern land to the land I have given your ancestors as an inheritance.
24:3:19/But I said, 'How can I put you among the children and give you a pleasant land, a beautiful inheritance of the nations?' And I said, 'You will call me, My Father, and will not turn away from following me.'
24:3:20/Surely as a wife unfaithfully leaves her husband, so you have been unfaithful to me, O house of Israel," says the LORD.
24:3:21/A cry is heard on the barren heights, the weeping and pleading of the people of Israel, because they have perverted their ways and forgotten the LORD their God.
24:3:22/"Return, faithless people; I will cure you of backsliding." "Yes, we will come to you, for you are the LORD our God.
24:3:23/Indeed, the salvation of Israel is found in the LORD our God, not in the hills or mountains.
24:3:24/Shame has consumed the labor of our ancestors from our youth—their flocks and herds, their sons and daughters.
24:3:25/We lie down in our shame, and our disgrace covers us. For we have sinned against the LORD our God, both we and our ancestors, from our youth till this day, and have not obeyed the voice of the LORD our God.
24:4:1/If you want to return, O Israel, says the LORD, come back to me: and if you're willing to remove your detestable acts from my sight, then you won't be forced to leave.
24:4:2/And you shall swear, "The LORD lives," in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; and the nations will bless themselves in him, and in him they will take pride.
24:4:3/For this is what the LORD says to the men of Judah and Jerusalem, Break up your unplowed ground, and do not sow among thorns.
24:4:4/Dedicate yourselves to the LORD, and remove the hardness from your hearts, you men of Judah and residents of Jerusalem: or else my anger will flare up like fire, and burn with no one to extinguish it, because of the wickedness of your actions.
24:4:5/Announce in Judah, and proclaim in Jerusalem; and say, Sound the trumpet throughout the land: cry aloud, gather together, and say, Let's go into the fortified cities.
24:4:6/Raise the flag towards Zion: retreat, do not delay: for I will bring disaster from the north, and immense destruction.
24:4:7/The lion has left his den, and the destroyer of nations is on his way; he has set out from his place to make your land a wasteland; and your cities will be destroyed, left without any inhabitants.
24:4:8/For this, wear sackcloth, mourn and wail: for the fierce anger of the LORD has not turned away from us.
24:4:9/And it will happen on that day, says the LORD, that the heart of the king will fail, and the heart of the princes; and the priests will be shocked, and the prophets will be astounded.
24:4:10/Then I said, Ah, Sovereign LORD! You have truly misled this people and Jerusalem, by saying, "You will have peace," while the sword pierces to the soul.
24:4:11/At that time, it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A scorching wind from the barren heights in the desert blows towards the daughter of my people, not to winnow or cleanse,
24:4:12/A wind too strong for that comes at my command; now I will pronounce judgment against them.
24:4:13/Behold, he will come up like clouds, and his chariots like a whirlwind: his horses are faster than eagles. Woe to us! For we are ruined.
24:4:14/O Jerusalem, cleanse your heart from wickedness so you may be saved. How long will your harmful thoughts linger within you?
24:4:15/For a voice declares from Dan, and proclaims trouble from Mount Ephraim.
24:4:16/Inform the nations; indeed, announce against Jerusalem, that besiegers come from a distant land, and raise their voices against the cities of Judah.
24:4:17/They surround her like guards in a field, because she has rebelled against me, says the LORD.
24:4:18/Your own conduct and actions have brought this upon you; this is your punishment, and it is bitter, piercing to your heart.
24:4:19/My anguish, my anguish! I writhe in pain! Oh, the agony of my heart! My heart pounds within me; I cannot keep silent, for you have heard, O my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.
24:4:20/Disaster follows disaster; the whole land lies in ruins. In an instant my tents are destroyed, my shelter in a moment.
24:4:21/How long must I see the battle standard and hear the sound of the trumpet?
24:4:22/For my people are foolish, they do not know me; they are senseless children, and they have no understanding. They are skilled in doing evil, but do not know how to do good.
24:4:23/I looked at the earth, and it was formless and empty; and at the heavens, and their light was gone.
24:4:24/I looked at the mountains, and they were quaking; all the hills were swaying.
24:4:25/I looked, and there were no people; all the birds of the sky had fled.
24:4:26/I looked, and the fertile land was a desert; all its cities were torn down before the LORD, before his fierce anger.
24:4:27/For this is what the LORD says, The whole land will be desolate; yet I will not make a complete end.
24:4:28/Because of this the earth will mourn, and the heavens above grow dark; because I have spoken, I have planned, and I will not change my mind, nor will I turn back from it.
24:4:29/The whole city flees at the sound of the horsemen and archers. They go into thickets and climb up on the rocks; every city is abandoned, and no one lives in them.
24:4:30/And when you are plundered, what will you do? Though you dress in crimson, though you adorn yourself with jewels of gold, though you enlarge your eyes with paint, in vain you will make yourself beautiful; your lovers will despise you, they will seek your life.
24:4:31/For I have heard a cry as of a woman in labor, the anguish as of one giving birth to her first child, the cry of the daughter of Zion gasping for breath, stretching out her hands, saying, "Alas for me now! For my soul is weary because of murderers."
24:5:1/Go through the streets of Jerusalem, look around, and understand, search its wide places to see if you can find anyone who acts justly, who seeks truth; and I will forgive it.
24:5:2/Even though they claim, "The LORD is alive," they are actually lying.
24:5:3/O LORD, don't you focus on truth? You have punished them, but they didn't mourn; you have wiped them out, but they refused to learn their lesson: they have become more stubborn than a rock; they have refused to turn back.
24:5:4/So I thought, these must be the poor; they are ignorant: for they don't understand the way of the LORD, or the justice of their God.
24:5:5/I will go to the leaders and speak to them; for they know the way of the LORD, and the justice of their God: but even they have completely broken off the yoke, and torn apart the chains.
24:5:6/Therefore, a lion from the forest will kill them, a wolf in the evening will destroy them, a leopard will lurk around their cities: anyone who leaves will be torn to pieces: because their wrongdoings are numerous, and their rebellions have increased.
24:5:7/How can I forgive you for this? Your children have abandoned me, and sworn by gods that are not real: when I had provided for them fully, they then committed adultery, and gathered in large numbers in the prostitutes’ houses.
24:5:8/They were like well-fed horses in the morning: each one lusted after his neighbor’s wife.
24:5:9/Shouldn't I punish these actions? says the LORD: and shouldn't I seek revenge on such a nation as this?
24:5:10/Climb up on her walls and destroy; but do not completely destroy: remove her defenses; for they do not belong to the LORD.
24:5:11/The house of Israel and the house of Judah have been utterly unfaithful to me, says the LORD.
24:5:12/They have denied the LORD, and said, "He won't do anything; we won't face war or famine."
24:5:13/And the prophets will become like the wind, and the word is not in them: so it will be done to them.
24:5:14/Therefore, this is what the LORD God of hosts says, Because you have said this, watch, I will make my words in your mouth a fire, and this people wood, and it will consume them.
24:5:15/Look, I will bring a nation against you from far away, O house of Israel, says the LORD: it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation, a nation whose language you do not know, nor can you understand what they say.
24:5:16/Their quiver is like an open grave, they are all mighty warriors.
24:5:17/And they will consume your harvest, and your bread, which your sons and daughters should eat: they will consume your flocks and your herds: they will consume your vines and your fig trees: they will destroy with the sword your fortified cities, in which you trust.
24:5:18/Yet in those days, says the LORD, I will not completely destroy you.
24:5:19/And when you ask, "Why has the LORD our God done all these things to us?" you shall answer them, "Just as you have abandoned me and served foreign gods in your own land, so you will serve strangers in a land that is not yours."
24:5:20/Announce this in the house of Jacob, and proclaim it in Judah, saying,
24:5:21/Listen to this, you foolish and senseless people, who have eyes but do not see, who have ears but do not hear:
24:5:22/Aren't you afraid of me? says the LORD. Won't you tremble in my presence, who have set the sand as the boundary of the sea, by a perpetual decree, so it cannot pass it: and though its waves toss, they cannot prevail; though they roar, they cannot cross it?
24:5:23/But this people has a stubborn and rebellious heart; they have turned away and gone.
24:5:24/They do not say in their heart, "Let us now fear the LORD our God, who gives rain, both the early and the late, in its season; he secures for us the appointed weeks of the harvest."
24:5:25/Your wrongdoings have turned these away, and your sins have kept good from you.
24:5:26/Among my people are found wicked men: they watch as one who sets snares; they set a trap, they catch people.
24:5:27/As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they have become great and grown rich.
24:5:28/They have grown fat and sleek: indeed, they surpass the deeds of the wicked: they do not plead the case, the case of the orphan, to make it prosper; and they do not defend the rights of the needy.
24:5:29/Shouldn't I punish these actions? says the LORD. Shouldn't I seek revenge on such a nation as this?
24:5:30/A shocking and horrible thing has happened in the land;
24:5:31/The prophets prophesy lies, and the priests rule by their own authority; and my people love it this way: but what will you do in the end?
24:6:1/You children of Benjamin, gather and flee from the center of Jerusalem, sound the trumpet in Tekoa, and light a beacon in Bethhaccerem: for danger looms from the north, bringing massive destruction.
24:6:2/I have compared the daughter of Zion to a beautiful and delicate woman.
24:6:3/Shepherds and their flocks will come to her; they will set up their tents all around her; they will graze each in his own area.
24:6:4/Get ready for battle against her; get up, let's attack at noon. Oh no! The day is fading, and the shadows of evening are getting longer.
24:6:5/Get up, let's move at night and destroy her palaces.
24:6:6/For this is what the LORD Almighty says, "Cut down trees and build a siege ramp against Jerusalem. This city must be punished; it is filled with oppression."
24:6:7/Just as a fountain spills out its waters, so she spills out her wickedness. Violence and destruction are heard within her; suffering and wounds are ever before me.
24:6:8/Let this be a warning to you, Jerusalem, or I will turn away from you; I will make you a desolation, an uninhabited land.
24:6:9/This is what the LORD Almighty says, "They will thoroughly pick over the remnant of Israel as a vine; pass your hand again like a grape gatherer over the branches."
24:6:10/To whom can I speak and give warning? Who will listen? Behold, their ears are closed, and they cannot hear. See, the word of the LORD is offensive to them; they find no pleasure in it.
24:6:11/Therefore, I am filled with the LORD's fury; I am tired of holding it in. I will pour it out on the children in the street and on the gathering of young men together; for even the husband with the wife shall be caught, as well as the elderly with those of advanced years.
24:6:12/Their houses will be turned over to others, along with their fields and wives, for I will stretch out my hand against the inhabitants of the land," says the LORD.
24:6:13/For from the least to the greatest, all are greedy for gain; prophets and priests alike, all practice deceit.
24:6:14/They have treated the wound of my people carelessly, saying, 'Peace, peace,' when there is no peace.
24:6:15/Were they ashamed when they committed abomination? No, they were not at all ashamed, nor did they know how to blush. Therefore, they will fall among those who fall; when I punish them, they will be brought down," says the LORD.
24:6:16/This is what the LORD says, "Stand at the crossroads and look; ask for the ancient paths, ask where the good way is, and walk in it, and you will find rest for your souls. But they said, 'We will not walk in it.'"
24:6:17/I appointed watchmen over you and said, 'Listen to the sound of the trumpet!' But they said, 'We will not listen.'
24:6:18/Therefore, hear, you nations; be witness, assembly, to what will happen to them.
24:6:19/Hear, O earth: I am bringing disaster on this people, the fruit of their schemes, because they have not listened to my words and have rejected my law.
24:6:20/What is the point of bringing me incense from Sheba, and sweet cane from distant lands? Your burnt offerings are not acceptable, nor your sacrifices pleasing to me.
24:6:21/Therefore, this is what the LORD says, "Behold, I will place obstacles before this people. Parents and children alike will stumble over them; neighbors and friends will perish."
24:6:22/This is what the LORD says, "Look, an army is coming from the north; a great nation is being stirred up from the ends of the earth.
24:6:23/They are armed with bow and spear; they are cruel and show no mercy. Their roar is like the sea as they ride on horses, arrayed as a man for battle against you, O daughter of Zion."
24:6:24/We have heard reports about them; our hands hang limp. Anguish has gripped us, pain like that of a woman in labor.
24:6:25/Do not go out into the fields or walk on the roads, for the enemy's sword is everywhere and fear is on every side.
24:6:26/O daughter of my people, dress in sackcloth and roll in ashes. Mourn as for an only son, a bitter lament, for suddenly the destroyer will come upon us.
24:6:27/I have made you a watchtower and a fortress among my people, so you can know and test their ways.
24:6:28/They are all stubborn rebels, going about with slander. They are bronze and iron; they all act corruptly.
24:6:29/The bellows blow fiercely, the lead is consumed by the fire; in vain the smelter refines, for the wicked are not removed.
24:6:30/They will be called worthless silver, because the LORD has rejected them.
24:7:1/The message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD was,
24:7:2/Stand at the entrance of the LORD's temple, and announce this message, saying, Listen to the word of the LORD, all you from Judah who enter these gates to worship the LORD.
24:7:3/This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Change your ways and your actions, and I will let you live in this place.
24:7:4/Don't be fooled by deceptive words, chanting, 'This is the temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD, the temple of the LORD.'
24:7:5/If you genuinely change your ways and your actions; if you truly administer justice between one person and another;
24:7:6/If you do not oppress the foreigner, the orphan, and the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place, or follow other gods to your own harm,
24:7:7/Then I will let you live in this place, in the land I gave to your ancestors forever and ever.
24:7:8/But look, you are trusting in deceptive words that are worthless.
24:7:9/Will you steal, murder, commit adultery, swear falsely, burn incense to Baal, and follow other gods you have not known,
24:7:10/And then come and stand before me in this temple, which bears my name, and say, 'We are safe'—only to continue doing all these detestable acts?
24:7:11/Has this temple, which bears my name, become a den of robbers to you? But I have been watching, declares the LORD.
24:7:12/Go now to my place in Shiloh, where I first made a dwelling for my name, and see what I did to it because of the wickedness of my people Israel.
24:7:13/And now, because you have done all these things, declares the LORD, and I spoke to you, rising up early and speaking, but you did not listen; and I called you, but you did not answer,
24:7:14/Therefore, I will do to the temple that bears my name, in which you trust, and to the place I gave to you and your ancestors, just as I did to Shiloh.
24:7:15/And I will thrust you from my presence, just as I did all your fellow countrymen, the entire offspring of Ephraim.
24:7:16/So do not pray for this people, do not offer any plea or petition for them, and do not plead with me, for I will not listen to you.
24:7:17/Don't you see what they are doing in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem?
24:7:18/The children gather wood, the fathers light the fire, and the women knead dough to make cakes for the queen of heaven. They pour out drink offerings to other gods to provoke me to anger.
24:7:19/Do they provoke me to anger? declares the LORD. Do they not harm themselves, to their own shame?
24:7:20/Therefore, this is what the Sovereign LORD says: My anger and my fury will be poured out on this place—on humans and animals, on the trees of the field and the crops of the land—and it will burn and not be quenched.
24:7:21/This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Add your burnt offerings to your other sacrifices and eat the meat.
24:7:22/For when I brought your ancestors out of Egypt, I did not speak to them or command them about burnt offerings and sacrifices.
24:7:23/But I did command them this: Obey my voice, and I will be your God, and you will be my people. Walk in all the ways I command you, so that it may go well with you.
24:7:24/But they did not listen or pay attention; instead, they followed the stubborn inclinations of their evil hearts. They went backward and not forward.
24:7:25/From the day your ancestors left Egypt until now, I have sent all my servants the prophets to you, again and again.
24:7:26/Yet they did not listen to me or pay attention. They were stiff-necked and did more evil than their ancestors.
24:7:27/Therefore, tell them all these words, but they will not listen to you; call to them, but they will not answer you.
24:7:28/But say to them, 'This is the nation that has not obeyed the LORD their God or responded to correction. Truth has perished; it has vanished from their lips.
24:7:29/Cut off your hair and throw it away; take up a lament on the barren heights, for the LORD has rejected and abandoned this generation that is under his wrath.
24:7:30/For the people of Judah have done evil in my eyes, declares the LORD. They have set up their detestable idols in the temple that bears my name and have defiled it.
24:7:31/They have built the high places of Topheth in the Valley of Ben Hinnom to burn their sons and daughters in the fire—something I did not command, nor did it enter my mind.
24:7:32/So beware, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when it will no longer be called Topheth or the Valley of Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter, for they will bury in Topheth until there is no more room.
24:7:33/And the corpses of this people will be food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth, and no one will frighten them away.
24:7:34/Then I will put an end to the sounds of joy and gladness and to the voices of the bride and bridegroom in the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem, for the land will become desolate.
24:8:1/At that time, says the LORD, they will bring out the bones of the kings of Judah, and the bones of his princes, and the bones of the priests, and the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the people of Jerusalem, from their graves:
24:8:2/And they will spread them before the sun, and the moon, and all the stars, which they loved, served, followed, sought, and worshipped: they will not be collected or buried; they will be like waste on the ground.
24:8:3/And choosing death over life will be preferred by all who are left of this wicked family, wherever I have driven them, says the LORD of hosts.
24:8:4/Moreover, you should tell them, This is what the LORD says; If they fall, won't they get up? If someone turns away, won't they come back?
24:8:5/Why then has the people of Jerusalem turned away in constant backsliding? They cling to deceit and refuse to return.
24:8:6/I listened and heard, but they did not speak correctly: no one regretted their wickedness, asking, "What have I done?" Everyone turned to their own path, as a horse charges into battle.
24:8:7/Indeed, the stork in the sky knows her seasons; and the dove, the swift, and the crane keep the time of their return; but my people do not know the LORD's judgment.
24:8:8/How can you say, 'We are wise, and the law of the LORD is with us'? But look, the making of it has been in vain; the scribes' work is useless.
24:8:9/The wise are put to shame, they are dismayed and caught: look, they have rejected the word of the LORD; so what wisdom do they have?
24:8:10/Therefore, I will give their wives to others, and their fields to new owners: because from the least to the greatest, everyone is greedy for gain; from the prophet to the priest, everyone deals falsely.
24:8:11/They have treated the wound of my people carelessly, saying, 'Peace, peace,' when there is no peace.
24:8:12/Were they ashamed when they committed abomination? No, they were not at all ashamed, nor could they blush: therefore, they will fall among those who fall: at the time of their punishment, they will be brought down, says the LORD.
24:8:13/I will surely consume them, says the LORD: there will be no grapes on the vine, nor figs on the fig tree, and the leaf will wither; and what I have given them will be taken away from them.
24:8:14/Why do we sit still? Gather together, and let's go into the fortified cities and be silent there: for the LORD our God has made us silent and given us bitter water to drink, because we have sinned against the LORD.
24:8:15/We hoped for peace, but no good came; for a time of healing, but behold, terror!
24:8:16/The sound of his horses was heard from Dan: the whole land trembled at the sound of the neighing of his mighty ones; for they have come and devoured the land and everything in it; the city and those who live in it.
24:8:17/For, look, I will send venomous snakes among you, which cannot be charmed, and they will bite you, says the LORD.
24:8:18/When I try to comfort myself against sorrow, my heart is faint within me.
24:8:19/Listen to the cry of the daughter of my people from a distant land: "Isn't the LORD in Zion? Isn't her king there?" Why have they angered me with their carved images, and with foreign idols?
24:8:20/The harvest is over, the summer has ended, and we are not saved.
24:8:21/For the injury of the daughter of my people, I am injured; I mourn; dismay has taken hold of me.
24:8:22/Is there no balm in Gilead; is there no physician there? Why then has the health of the daughter of my people not been restored?
24:9:1/I wish my head were waters and my eyes a fountain of tears, so I could cry day and night for the slain of my people!
24:9:2/I wish I had a traveler's shelter in the desert, so I could leave my people and go away from them! They are all adulterers, a group of traitors.
24:9:3/They twist their words like a bow for lies: they don't stand up for the truth on earth; they go from one evil to another and they don't know me, says the LORD.
24:9:4/Be careful of your neighbor, and don't trust any brother: every brother will completely betray, and every neighbor will go around spreading rumors.
24:9:5/They will deceive each other and refuse to tell the truth: they've trained their tongues to lie, and exhaust themselves committing wrongdoing.
24:9:6/You live among deception; through deceit they refuse to know me, says the LORD.
24:9:7/Therefore, this is what the LORD of hosts says, I will refine them and test them; for what else can I do because of my people?
24:9:8/Their tongue is like a sharp arrow; it speaks deceit: someone speaks peacefully to their neighbor with their mouth, but in their heart, they set a trap.
24:9:9/Shouldn't I punish them for these things? says the LORD. Shouldn't I take revenge on such a nation as this?
24:9:10/I will weep for the mountains and wail for the desert pastures, because they are scorched, so no one can pass through; no one can hear the sound of the cattle; both the birds of the sky and the animals have fled; they are gone.
24:9:11/And I will turn Jerusalem into ruins, a home for dragons; and I will make the cities of Judah empty, without an inhabitant.
24:9:12/Who is wise enough to understand this? Who has been instructed by the LORD and can explain it? Why has the land perished and been scorched like a desert that no one can cross?
24:9:13/And the LORD says, Because they have abandoned my law which I set before them, and have not listened to my voice or walked in it;
24:9:14/But have followed the stubbornness of their own hearts and the Baals, as their fathers taught them;
24:9:15/Therefore, this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says; Look, I will feed this people with bitterness and give them poisonous water to drink.
24:9:16/I will scatter them among nations that neither they nor their ancestors have known, and I will send the sword after them until I have destroyed them.
24:9:17/This is what the LORD of hosts says, Consider and call for the mourning women to come; send for the skilled women to come;
24:9:18/And let them hurry and raise a wail over us, so that our eyes overflow with tears and our eyelids stream with water.
24:9:19/For a voice of wailing is heard from Zion, 'How we are ruined! We are utterly ashamed, because we have left the land, because our homes have thrown us out.'
24:9:20/Yet listen to the word of the LORD, O women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth; teach your daughters how to wail, and each one her neighbor a lament.
24:9:21/For death has climbed in through our windows and has entered our palaces, to eliminate the children from the streets and the young men from the public squares.
24:9:22/Say, 'This is what the LORD declares, "Even the bodies of men will fall like dung on the open field, like cut wheat behind the reaper, with no one to gather them."'
24:9:23/This is what the LORD says, 'Let not the wise boast of their wisdom or the strong boast of their strength or the rich boast of their riches,
24:9:24/But let the one who boasts boast about this: that they have the understanding to know me, that I am the LORD, who exercises kindness, justice, and righteousness on earth, for in these I delight,' says the LORD.
24:9:25/'Behold, the days are coming,' says the LORD, 'when I will punish all who are circumcised only in the flesh—
24:9:26/Egypt, Judah, Edom, the Ammonites, Moab, and all those with shaved temples who live in the desert. For all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart.'
24:10:1/Listen to the message the LORD has for you, people of Israel:
24:10:2/This is what the LORD says: Do not adopt the customs of the non-believers, and do not be terrified by the celestial signs as they are.
24:10:3/The practices of the people are pointless: someone cuts down a tree from the forest, crafted by the skill of a craftsman with an axe.
24:10:4/They decorate it with silver and gold; they secure it with nails and hammers so it won't fall over.
24:10:5/They stand tall like palm trees but cannot speak; they must be carried because they cannot walk. Do not fear them; they can't cause harm, nor can they do any good.
24:10:6/For there is no one like you, O LORD; you are great, and your name is mighty in power.
24:10:7/Who would not revere you, O King of nations? Indeed, it is your due: among all the wise men of the nations and in all their kingdoms, there is no one like you.
24:10:8/But they are completely senseless and foolish; their teachings are nothing but nonsense.
24:10:9/Silver beaten into plates is imported from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, crafted by artisans and goldsmiths; they wear blue and purple garments, all the work of skilled craftsmen.
24:10:10/But the LORD is the true God; he is the living God and the eternal king. When he is angry, the earth quakes, and the nations cannot endure his fury.
24:10:11/Tell them this: The gods who did not create the heavens and the earth will perish from the earth and from under the heavens.
24:10:12/He made the earth by his power, established the world by his wisdom, and stretched out the heavens by his understanding.
24:10:13/When he speaks, the waters in the heavens roar, and he brings clouds from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning for the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses.
24:10:14/Every person is senseless in their knowledge; every goldsmith is shamed by their idols, for their cast images are false, and there is no breath in them.
24:10:15/They are worthless, a work of mockery; when their time comes, they will perish.
24:10:16/The portion of Jacob is not like these, for he is the Maker of all things, and Israel is the tribe of his inheritance; The LORD of hosts is his name.
24:10:17/Collect your belongings from the land, you who live under siege.
24:10:18/For this is what the LORD says: Look, I will throw out the inhabitants of the land at this time and will bring distress on them so they may feel it.
24:10:19/Woe to me because of my injury! My wound is severe. But I thought, "This is surely my suffering, and I must endure it."
24:10:20/My dwelling is destroyed; all my ropes are snapped. My children have left me, and they are no more; there is no one to pitch my tent anymore or to set up my curtains.
24:10:21/For the shepherds have become senseless and have not sought the LORD; therefore, they have not prospered, and all their flock is scattered.
24:10:22/Listen, the report is coming—a great commotion from the land of the north! It will make the cities of Judah desolate, a haunt of jackals.
24:10:23/O LORD, I understand that a person's way is not in themselves; it is not in one's power to direct their steps.
24:10:24/O LORD, correct me, but with justice; not in your anger, or you will reduce me to nothing.
24:10:25/Unleash your anger on the nations that do not acknowledge you, on the families that do not call on your name. For they have devoured Jacob; they have devoured him completely and ruined his homeland.
24:11:1/The message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD was,
24:11:2/Listen to the words of this covenant, and tell them to the people of Judah and those living in Jerusalem;
24:11:3/And tell them, This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Cursed is the person who does not obey the terms of this covenant,
24:11:4/Which I commanded your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, from the furnace of iron, saying, Listen to my voice and follow all that I command you. Then you will be my people, and I will be your God,
24:11:5/So that I can fulfill the promise I made to your ancestors, to give them a land rich with milk and honey, as it is today. Then I responded, "Amen, LORD."
24:11:6/Then the LORD told me, Announce all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Listen to the terms of this covenant and follow them.
24:11:7/For I strongly warned your ancestors when I brought them up from Egypt, and I have continued to warn them to this day, saying, Listen to my voice.
24:11:8/Yet they did not listen or pay attention but followed their own desires and wicked hearts. Therefore, I will bring upon them all the terms of this covenant, which I commanded them to follow but they did not.
24:11:9/And the LORD said to me, A conspiracy has been found among the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.
24:11:10/They have returned to the sins of their ancestors who refused to listen to my words. They have followed other gods to serve them. Both the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken the covenant I made with their ancestors.
24:11:11/Therefore, this is what the LORD says: I am bringing disaster on them that they cannot escape. Even if they cry out to me, I will not listen to them.
24:11:12/Then the cities of Judah and the people of Jerusalem will go and cry to the gods they burn incense to, but those gods will not save them at all in their time of trouble.
24:11:13/For as many as your cities are, so are your gods, O Judah; and as many as the streets of Jerusalem, you have set up altars to shameful idols, altars to burn incense to Baal.
24:11:14/So do not pray for these people, nor offer any plea or petition for them, for I will not listen when they call to me in their distress.
24:11:15/What right does my beloved have in my house when she has engaged in many vile deeds? Can vows and sacred meat prevent your disaster? When you engage in your wickedness, then you rejoice.
24:11:16/The LORD once called you a thriving olive tree, beautiful with good fruit. But with a great roar, he has set it on fire, and its branches are broken.
24:11:17/For the LORD of hosts, who planted you, has decreed disaster for you because of the evil the house of Israel and the house of Judah have done to themselves, provoking me by burning incense to Baal.
24:11:18/And the LORD has made it known to me, and I know it; then you showed me their actions.
24:11:19/But I was like a gentle lamb led to the slaughter; I did not realize that they had plotted against me, saying, "Let's destroy the tree and its fruit; let's cut him off from the land of the living, so his name will be forgotten."
24:11:20/But, O LORD of hosts, who judges righteously, who tests the heart and mind, let me see your vengeance on them, for to you I have committed my cause.
24:11:21/Therefore, this is what the LORD says about the men of Anathoth who are seeking your life and saying, "Do not prophesy in the name of the LORD or you will die by our hands":
24:11:22/This is what the LORD of hosts says: I will punish them. The young men will die by the sword; their sons and daughters will die by famine.
24:11:23/And there will be no survivors for them, for I will bring disaster on the men of Anathoth in the year of their punishment.
24:12:1/You are just, O LORD, when I bring my case before you. Yet, let me discuss your decisions: Why do the wicked thrive? Why are all those who are deceitful happy?
24:12:2/You have planted them, and they have taken root: they grow and bear fruit. You are on their lips but far from their hearts.
24:12:3/But you, O LORD, know me; you see me and test my heart toward you. Drag them off like sheep to be butchered, set them aside for the day of slaughter.
24:12:4/How long will the land grieve, and the plants of every field dry up, because of the evil of its inhabitants? The animals and birds are perishing because they think, 'He will not see our final end.'
24:12:5/If you have raced with people and they have worn you out, then how can you compete with horses? And if you stumble in a safe land, what will you do in the treacherous Jordan floodplains?
24:12:6/Even your own brothers and your father's household have betrayed you. They have raised a loud cry against you. Do not trust them, even though they speak kindly to you.
24:12:7/I have abandoned my house, I have deserted my inheritance; I have handed over the love of my life to her enemies.
24:12:8/My inheritance has become to me like a lion in the forest; it roars against me, therefore I have come to hate it.
24:12:9/My inheritance is like a colorful bird attacked by other birds; come, gather all the wild beasts, bring them to devour.
24:12:10/Many shepherds have ruined my vineyard, they have trampled down my field, they have turned my prized possession into a desolate wasteland.
24:12:11/They have made it a wasteland, desolate, it mourns to me. The whole land is made desolate because no one takes it to heart.
24:12:12/Invaders have come to all the barren heights in the wilderness; for the sword of the LORD will devour from one end of the land to the other; no one will have peace.
24:12:13/They have planted wheat but will harvest thorns. They have toiled to no avail and will be disappointed by their harvests because of the LORD's fierce anger.
24:12:14/This is what the LORD says against all my evil neighbors who encroach on the inheritance I have given my people Israel: "Look, I will uproot them from their land and uproot the house of Judah from among them.
24:12:15/And after I have uprooted them, I will once again have compassion and will bring each of them back to their own inheritance, to their own land.
24:12:16/And if they diligently learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name, 'As the LORD lives,' just as they taught my people to swear by Baal, then they will be established among my people.
24:12:17/But if they do not listen, I will completely uproot and destroy that nation," declares the LORD.
24:13:1/The LORD said to me, "Go and buy a linen belt, and put it around your waist, but do not let it touch water."
24:13:2/So I bought a belt as the LORD instructed, and wore it around my waist.
24:13:3/Then the LORD spoke to me again,
24:13:4/"Take the belt you have bought, which is around your waist, and go to the Euphrates. Hide it there in a crevice in the rocks."
24:13:5/So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, just as the LORD had commanded me.
24:13:6/After a long time, the LORD said to me, "Go back to the Euphrates and retrieve the belt I told you to hide there."
24:13:7/So I went to the Euphrates, dug up the belt from where I had hidden it, and found that it was ruined and completely useless.
24:13:8/Then the LORD spoke to me, saying,
24:13:9/"This is how I will ruin the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem."
24:13:10/"These wicked people, who refuse to listen to my words, who follow their own desires, and who worship and serve other gods, will be like this belt—completely useless."
24:13:11/"Just as a belt clings to a person's waist, I brought the entire house of Israel and the entire house of Judah close to me," declares the LORD, "so they could be my people, for renown, praise, and honor. But they did not listen."
24:13:12/"Therefore, tell them this word; 'This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Every jar will be filled with wine.' And they will say to you, 'Don't we already know that every jar will be filled with wine?'"
24:13:13/"Then tell them, 'This is what the LORD says: I will fill all the inhabitants of this land with drunkenness—including the kings who sit on David's throne, the priests, the prophets, and all the residents of Jerusalem.'"
24:13:14/"I will smash them against each other, fathers and sons alike," declares the LORD. "I will show no compassion, nor will I spare or have mercy. I will destroy them."
24:13:15/"Listen and pay attention, do not be arrogant, for the LORD has spoken."
24:13:16/"Honor the LORD your God before he brings darkness, before you stumble on the darkening hills. You hope for light, but he will turn it into deep shadow, making it pitch dark."
24:13:17/"But if you do not listen, I will weep in secret because of your pride; my eyes will weep bitterly, overflowing with tears, because the LORD's flock will be taken captive."
24:13:18/"Tell the king and the queen mother to humble themselves, for their exalted positions will be brought down, the crown of their glory will fall."
24:13:19/"The cities of the south will be locked up, and no one will open them. Judah will be exiled, completely taken away."
24:13:20/"Look up and see those coming from the north. Where is the flock that was entrusted to you, your beautiful sheep?"
24:13:21/"What will you say when your allies, whom you yourself have trained, turn against you? Will not pain seize you like a woman in labor?"
24:13:22/"And if you wonder in your heart why these things have happened to you—it's because of your great sin that your skirts have been lifted up and you have been violated."
24:13:23/"Can an Ethiopian change his skin or a leopard its spots? Likewise, can you do good who are accustomed to doing evil?"
24:13:24/"Therefore, I will scatter you like chaff that is blown away by the desert wind."
24:13:25/"This is your lot, the portion I have measured out to you," declares the LORD, "because you have forgotten me and trusted in lies."
24:13:26/"Therefore, I will expose your skirts over your face, that your shame may be seen."
24:13:27/"I have seen your adulteries and your lustful neighs, the lewdness of your prostitution on the hills and in the fields. How long will you remain unclean, O Jerusalem?"
24:14:1/The message from the LORD that came to Jeremiah about the drought.
24:14:2/Judah is in mourning, its gates are weakened; they have turned dark to the ground; and the cry of Jerusalem has risen.
24:14:3/And their leaders have sent their young ones to fetch water: they went to the wells and found no water; they returned with their containers empty; they were embarrassed and dismayed, and covered their heads.
24:14:4/Because the soil is cracked, due to no rain on the land, the farmers were embarrassed, they covered their heads.
24:14:5/Indeed, the deer also gave birth in the field, and abandoned it because there was no grass.
24:14:6/And the wild donkeys stood on the barren heights, they gasped for air like dragons; their eyes failed because there was no grass.
24:14:7/O LORD, although our wrongdoings testify against us, act for the sake of your name: for our backsliding is extensive; we have sinned against you.
24:14:8/O the hope of Israel, the savior in times of distress, why should you be like a stranger in the land, and like a traveler who stops just to spend the night?
24:14:9/Why should you be like a stunned man, like a warrior who cannot save? Yet you, O LORD, are among us, and we bear your name; do not abandon us.
24:14:10/This is what the LORD says to these people, They have loved to wander, they have not restrained their feet, therefore the LORD does not accept them; he will now remember their wrongdoing, and punish their sins.
24:14:11/Then the LORD said to me, Do not pray for the well-being of this people.
24:14:12/When they fast, I will not listen to their plea; and when they offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them. Instead, I will destroy them with the sword, famine, and plague.
24:14:13/Then I said, Ah, Sovereign LORD! The prophets are telling them, You will not see the sword or suffer famine; indeed, I will give you lasting peace in this place.
24:14:14/Then the LORD said to me, The prophets are prophesying lies in my name. I did not send them, nor did I command them or speak to them. They are prophesying to you false visions, divinations, idolatries, and the deceit of their own minds.
24:14:15/Therefore, this is what the LORD says about the prophets who are prophesying in my name: I did not send them, yet they say, 'Sword and famine will not touch this land.' By sword and famine those prophets will be consumed.
24:14:16/And the people to whom they prophesy will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and sword. They will have no one to bury them, their wives, their sons, and their daughters. I will pour out on them their own wickedness.
24:14:17/Therefore, you must say this word to them; Let my eyes overflow with tears night and day, and let them not cease, for the virgin daughter of my people has been struck with a great wound, with a very harsh blow.
24:14:18/If I go out into the field, then behold, those slain by the sword! And if I enter the city, then behold, those sick with famine! For both prophet and priest ply their trade throughout the land and have no knowledge.
24:14:19/Have you completely rejected Judah? Does your soul loathe Zion? Why have you struck us down so there is no healing for us? We hoped for peace, but no good has come; for a time of healing, but behold, terror!
24:14:20/We acknowledge, O LORD, our wickedness and the iniquity of our ancestors; for we have sinned against you.
24:14:21/Do not despise us, for your own name's sake; do not dishonor your glorious throne. Remember, do not break your covenant with us.
24:14:22/Are there any among the worthless idols of the nations that can bring rain? Or can the heavens themselves send showers? Are you not he, O LORD our God? Therefore, we will wait for you, for you have made all these things.
24:15:1/Then the LORD said to me, "Even if Moses and Samuel stood before me, my heart would not turn towards these people. Send them away from my presence and let them go.
24:15:2/And if they ask you, 'Where should we go?' you should tell them, 'This is what the LORD says: Those destined for death, to death; those for the sword, to the sword; those for famine, to famine; and those for captivity, to captivity.'
24:15:3/I will summon four kinds of destroyers against them, declares the LORD: the sword to kill, the dogs to drag away, the birds of the sky to feast, and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy.
24:15:4/I will scatter them among all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem.
24:15:5/Who will have pity on you, O Jerusalem? Who will mourn for you? Who will turn aside to ask how you are doing?
24:15:6/You have abandoned me, declares the LORD, you have gone backwards. So, I will stretch out my hand against you and destroy you; I am tired of holding back.
24:15:7/I will winnow them with a winnowing fork at the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children, I will destroy my people, since they do not turn from their ways.
24:15:8/The number of their widows will surpass the sand of the seas; I will bring against them, against the mothers of their young men, a destroyer at midday; I will suddenly bring down upon them anguish and terror.
24:15:9/The woman who bore seven sons pines away; she breathes her last; her sun sets while it is still day; she is shamed and disgraced. And the rest I will hand over to the sword in the presence of their enemies, declares the LORD.
24:15:10/Alas, my mother, that you gave birth to me, a man of conflict and strife for the whole world! I have not lent or borrowed, yet everyone curses me.
24:15:11/The LORD said, "Surely I will ensure your welfare; surely I will make your enemies plead with you in times of disaster and times of distress.
24:15:12/Can iron break iron from the north, or bronze?
24:15:13/Your wealth and your treasures I will give as plunder without cost, for all your sins, throughout all your territory.
24:15:14/And I will make you serve your enemies in a land you do not know, for my anger has kindled a fire that will burn against you."
24:15:15/O LORD, you know; remember me and care for me. Avenge me on my persecutors. Do not take me away in your long-suffering. Know that for your sake I endure scorn.
24:15:16/When I discovered your words, I devoured them; they were my joy and my heart's delight, for I bear your name, O LORD God of hosts.
24:15:17/I never sat with the mockers to enjoy myself; I sat alone because of your hand upon me, for you filled me with indignation.
24:15:18/Why is my pain unending and my wound grievous and incurable? Will you be to me like a deceptive brook, like waters that fail?
24:15:19/Therefore, this is what the LORD says: "If you return, I will restore you, and you will stand before me. If you separate the precious from the worthless, you will be my spokesman. Let them turn to you, but you must not turn to them.
24:15:20/And I will make you to this people a fortified wall of bronze; they will fight against you but will not overcome you, for I am with you to save and deliver you, declares the LORD.
24:15:21/And I will rescue you from the grasp of the wicked and redeem you from the grip of the ruthless."
24:16:1/The word of the LORD came also unto me, saying,
24:16:2/Do not take a wife for yourself, nor have sons or daughters in this place.
24:16:3/For this is what the LORD says about the sons and daughters born in this place, and about their mothers who gave birth to them, and their fathers who fathered them in this land;
24:16:4/They will die from terrible deaths; they will not be mourned or buried; instead, they will be like waste on the ground: and they will be killed by the sword and by famine; and their bodies will be food for the birds of the sky, and for the animals of the earth.
24:16:5/For this is what the LORD says, Do not enter the house of mourning, do not go to grieve or lament for them: for I have taken away my peace from this people, says the LORD, including my love and compassion.
24:16:6/Both the great and the small will die in this land: they will not be buried, no one will mourn for them, cut themselves, or shave their heads for them;
24:16:7/No one will tear their clothes in mourning to comfort them for the dead; no one will offer them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
24:16:8/You must also not go into the house of feasting, to sit with them to eat and to drink.
24:16:9/For this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says; Look, I will eliminate from this place, before your eyes and in your days, the sounds of joy and gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
24:16:10/And when you tell this people all these things, and they ask you, 'Why has the LORD declared all this great disaster against us? What have we done wrong? What sin have we committed against the LORD our God?'
24:16:11/Then you will tell them, 'Because your ancestors abandoned me,' says the LORD, 'and followed other gods, served and worshiped them, abandoned me and did not keep my law;
24:16:12/And you have acted worse than your ancestors; for, see, each of you follows the stubbornness of your evil heart, refusing to listen to me:
24:16:13/Therefore, I will throw you out of this land into a land you do not know, neither you nor your ancestors; and there you will serve other gods day and night; where I will not show you favor.'
24:16:14/Therefore, look, the days are coming,' says the LORD, 'when it will no longer be said, 'The LORD lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;'
24:16:15/But, 'The LORD lives, who brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the lands where he had driven them: and I will bring them back into their land that I gave to their ancestors.'
24:16:16/Behold, I will send for many fishermen,' says the LORD, 'and they will fish for them; and afterwards, I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them from every mountain, and from every hill, and out of the holes of the rocks.
24:16:17/For my eyes are on all their ways: they are not hidden from my face, nor is their iniquity concealed from my eyes.
24:16:18/And first I will doubly repay their iniquity and their sin, because they have defiled my land, they have filled my inheritance with the corpses of their detestable and abominable idols.
24:16:19/O LORD, my strength, and my fortress, and my refuge in the day of trouble, the nations will come to you from the ends of the earth and say, 'Surely our ancestors inherited nothing but lies, worthless things in which there is no profit.
24:16:20/Can a person make gods for themselves, which are not gods?
24:16:21/Therefore, see, I will make them know, this time I will make them know my power and my might; and they shall know that my name is The LORD.
24:17:1/Judah's sin is permanently marked with an iron pen and a diamond point; it's deeply engraved on their hearts and on the altars' horns.
24:17:2/While their children remember their altars and sacred groves near the green trees on the high hills.
24:17:3/Oh, my mountain in the field, I will surrender your wealth and all your treasures to be plundered, and your high places for sin, across your entire territory.
24:17:4/And you will lose the heritage I gave you; I will make you serve your enemies in a foreign land because you have ignited my anger, which will burn forever.
24:17:5/This is what the LORD says: Cursed is the person who trusts in humans, relies on physical strength, and turns their heart away from the LORD.
24:17:6/He will be like a shrub in the desert, not knowing when relief comes; he will live in the dry wilderness, in an uninhabited salty land.
24:17:7/Blessed is the person who trusts in the LORD, whose confidence is in the LORD.
24:17:8/He will be like a tree planted by the water, extending its roots to the stream. It won't fear when heat comes; its leaves will stay green. It won't worry in a year of drought and never stops producing fruit.
24:17:9/The heart is more deceitful than anything else and is terribly corrupt. Who can understand it?
24:17:10/I, the LORD, examine the heart and test the mind, to reward each person according to their conduct, according to what their actions deserve.
24:17:11/Just as a partridge that broods over eggs it didn't lay, so is the person who gains wealth unjustly; in the middle of their days, it will leave them, and in the end, they will be a fool.
24:17:12/A glorious high throne from the beginning is our holy place.
24:17:13/O LORD, the hope of Israel, all who abandon you will be put to shame. Those who turn away from you will be written in the dust because they have forsaken the LORD, the source of living waters.
24:17:14/Heal me, O LORD, and I will be healed; save me, and I will be saved, for you are my praise.
24:17:15/See, they keep saying to me, "Where is the word of the LORD? Let it come now."
24:17:16/As for me, I haven't rushed away from being a shepherd following you. I haven't longed for the day of disaster, you know what I've spoken, it was in your presence.
24:17:17/Don't be a terror to me; you are my refuge in the day of disaster.
24:17:18/Let those who persecute me be put to shame, but keep me from shame; let them be terrified, but don't let me be terrified. Bring upon them the day of disaster and destroy them with double destruction.
24:17:19/This is what the LORD said to me: "Go and stand at the gate where the people's children enter, and where the kings of Judah come in and out, and at all the gates of Jerusalem.
24:17:20/And tell them, 'Listen to the word of the LORD, you kings of Judah, all of Judah, and all the residents of Jerusalem who enter these gates:
24:17:21/This is what the LORD says: Be careful, and do not carry a load on the Sabbath day or bring it through the gates of Jerusalem.
24:17:22/Do not take a load out of your houses on the Sabbath day or do any work, but keep the Sabbath day holy, as I commanded your ancestors.
24:17:23/But they did not listen or pay attention; they were stubborn and would not listen or accept discipline.
24:17:24/If you listen to me carefully, says the LORD, and bring no load through the city gates on the Sabbath day, but keep the Sabbath day holy by not doing any work on it,
24:17:25/then kings and officials who sit on David's throne will enter the gates of this city, riding in chariots and on horses, along with their officials, the people of Judah, and the residents of Jerusalem. And this city will remain forever.
24:17:26/People will come from the cities of Judah, the areas around Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin, the lowlands, the hills, and the south, bringing burnt offerings, sacrifices, grain offerings, and incense, and bringing thanksgiving sacrifices to the house of the LORD.
24:17:27/But if you do not listen to me to keep the Sabbath day holy and not to carry a load and enter the gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath day, then I will ignite a fire in its gates, and it will consume the palaces of Jerusalem and not be extinguished.
24:18:1/The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD was,
24:18:2/Get up, and go down to the potter's house, and there I will let you hear my words.
24:18:3/So I went down to the potter's house, and there he was, working on the wheel.
24:18:4/And the pot he was shaping from the clay was spoiled in his hands; so he formed it into another pot, shaping it as seemed best to him.
24:18:5/Then the word of the LORD came to me:
24:18:6/O house of Israel, can't I do with you as this potter does? declares the LORD. Look, as clay is in the potter's hand, so are you in my hand, O house of Israel.
24:18:7/Whenever I announce that a nation or kingdom is to be uprooted, torn down, and destroyed,
24:18:8/But if that nation I warned turns from its evil, then I will relent and not inflict on it the disaster I had planned.
24:18:9/And whenever I announce that a nation or kingdom is to be built up and planted,
24:18:10/But if it does evil in my sight and does not obey me, then I will reconsider the good I had intended to do for it.
24:18:11/Now therefore, say to the people of Judah and those living in Jerusalem, 'This is what the LORD says: Look, I am planning disaster for you and devising a plan against you. So turn from your evil ways, each one of you, and reform your ways and your actions.'
24:18:12/But they said, 'It's hopeless: we will follow our own plans, and each of us will act according to the stubbornness of our evil heart.'
24:18:13/Therefore this is what the LORD says: Inquire among the nations: Who has heard of such things? The virgin Israel has done a most terrible thing.
24:18:14/Does the snow of Lebanon ever vanish from its rocky slopes? Do its cool waters from distant sources ever stop flowing?
24:18:15/Yet my people have forgotten me; they burn incense to worthless idols, which made them stumble in their ways, leaving the ancient paths to walk in bypaths, not on a highway,
24:18:16/Making their land desolate, an object of perpetual scorn; everyone who passes by it will be shocked and shake their head.
24:18:17/I will scatter them before the enemy like the east wind; I will show them my back and not my face in the day of their disaster.
24:18:18/Then they said, 'Come, let's make plans against Jeremiah; for the teaching will not be lost from the priest, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophet. Come, let's attack him with our tongues and pay no attention to anything he says.'
24:18:19/Pay attention to me, O LORD, and listen to what my adversaries are saying.
24:18:20/Should good be repaid with evil? Yet they have dug a pit for my life. Remember how I stood before you to speak good on their behalf, to turn away your wrath from them.
24:18:21/Therefore, hand their children over to famine; give them over to the power of the sword. Let their wives be made childless and widows; let their men be put to death, their young men struck down by the sword in battle.
24:18:22/Let a cry be heard from their houses when you bring an army suddenly upon them. For they have dug a pit to capture me and have hidden snares for my feet.
24:18:23/Yet, LORD, you know all their plans to kill me. Do not forgive their crime or blot out their sin from your sight. Let them be tripped up before you; deal with them in the time of your anger.
24:19:1/The LORD says, "Go and get a potter's clay jar, and gather some of the elders of the people and the senior priests.
24:19:2/Then head to the Valley of Ben Hinnom, near the entrance of the east gate, and there announce the message I will give you.
24:19:3/And say, 'Listen to the word of the LORD, O kings of Judah and people of Jerusalem; the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: I am about to bring disaster on this place, and it will be so severe that it will make everyone's ears ring who hears about it.
24:19:4/Because they have abandoned me and have made this place foreign, burning incense here to other gods that neither they, their ancestors, nor the kings of Judah have known, and have filled this place with the blood of the innocent.
24:19:5/They have also built high places for Baal to burn their children in the fire as offerings to Baal, something I did not command or mention, nor did it ever enter my mind.
24:19:6/Therefore, the time is coming, declares the LORD, when this place will no longer be called Topheth or the Valley of Ben Hinnom, but the Valley of Slaughter.
24:19:7/I will ruin the plans of Judah and Jerusalem in this place; I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies and at the hands of those who seek their lives; and I will give their corpses as food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
24:19:8/And I will turn this city into ruins and an object of scorn; everyone who passes by will be shocked and scoff at all its wounds.
24:19:9/I will make them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters, and they will eat each other's flesh during the siege and distress inflicted by their enemies who seek their lives.
24:19:10/Then you shall break the jar in the sight of the men who accompany you,
24:19:11/And you shall say to them, 'This is what the LORD of hosts says: I will shatter this people and this city, just as one shatters a potter's jar that cannot be repaired. And they will bury the dead in Topheth until there is no more room.
