24:19:12/This is what I will do to this place, declares the LORD, and to its inhabitants, making this city like Topheth:
24:19:13/And the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah will be defiled like the place of Topheth—all the houses where they burned incense on the roofs to all the starry hosts and poured out drink offerings to other gods.'
24:19:14/Then Jeremiah returned from Topheth, where the LORD had sent him to prophesy, and he stood in the court of the LORD's house and said to all the people,
24:19:15/'This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: I am about to bring on this city and all its towns all the disaster I have pronounced against it, because they have stiffened their necks, refusing to listen to my words.'
24:20:1/Now Pashur, the son of Immer the priest, who was also the chief official in the LORD's temple, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
24:20:2/Then Pashur struck Jeremiah the prophet and put him in the stocks at the high gate of Benjamin, near the LORD's temple.
24:20:3/The next day, Pashur released Jeremiah from the stocks. Jeremiah then said to him, "The LORD has not named you Pashur, but Magormissabib."
24:20:4/For this is what the LORD says, "I will make you a terror to yourself and to all your friends. They will fall by the sword of their enemies while you watch. I will hand all of Judah over to the king of Babylon. He will take them captive to Babylon and kill them with the sword."
24:20:5/I will also hand over the strength of this city, all its hard work, its valuable possessions, and the treasures of the kings of Judah to their enemies. They will plunder them, take them, and carry them off to Babylon.
24:20:6/And you, Pashur, along with everyone in your household, will be taken captive to Babylon. There you will die and be buried, you and all your friends to whom you have lied."
24:20:7/O LORD, you have misled me, and I allowed myself to be misled. You are stronger than I, and you have prevailed. I am ridiculed all day long; everyone mocks me.
24:20:8/Whenever I speak, I cry out proclaiming violence and destruction. So the word of the LORD has brought me insult and reproach all day long.
24:20:9/But if I say, "I will not mention him or speak any more in his name," his word is in my heart like a fire, a fire shut up in my bones. I am weary of holding it in; indeed, I cannot.
24:20:10/I hear many whispering, "Terror on every side! Report him! Let's report him!" All my close friends are waiting for me to slip, saying, "Perhaps he will be deceived; then we will prevail over him and take our revenge on him."
24:20:11/But the LORD is with me like a mighty warrior; so my persecutors will stumble and not prevail. They will fail and be thoroughly disgraced; their dishonor will never be forgotten.
24:20:12/O LORD Almighty, you who examine the righteous and probe the heart and mind, let me see your vengeance on them, for to you I have committed my cause.
24:20:13/Sing to the LORD! Give praise to the LORD! He rescues the life of the needy from the hands of the wicked.
24:20:14/Cursed be the day I was born! May the day my mother gave birth to me not be blessed.
24:20:15/Cursed be the man who brought my father the news, saying, "A child is born to you—a son!" making him very happy.
24:20:16/May that man be like the towns the LORD overthrew without pity. May he hear wailing in the morning, a battle cry at noon.
24:20:17/For he did not kill me in the womb, with my mother as my grave, her womb eternally pregnant.
24:20:18/Why did I ever come out of the womb to see trouble and sorrow and to end my days in shame?
24:21:1/The message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when King Zedekiah sent Pashur son of Melchiah, and Zephaniah son of Maaseiah the priest, to ask him,
24:21:2/"Please inquire of the LORD for us; for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon is waging war against us. Perhaps the LORD will act on our behalf with his miraculous deeds, so that he will withdraw from us."
24:21:3/Then Jeremiah said to them, "This is what you should tell Zedekiah:
24:21:4/This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I am about to turn the weapons of war in your hands, which you are using to fight the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans who are besieging you outside the walls, and I will gather them inside this city.
24:21:5/And I myself will fight against you with a stretched-out hand and with a strong arm, in anger, fury, and great wrath.
24:21:6/And I will strike down the inhabitants of this city, both people and animals; they will die of a severe plague.
24:21:7/After that, says the LORD, I will hand over Zedekiah king of Judah, his officials, and the people in this city who survive the plague, sword, and famine, into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, into the hands of their enemies, and those who want to kill them. He will strike them down with the sword; he will not spare them, nor will he show pity or mercy.'
24:21:8/And to this people you shall say, 'This is what the LORD says: I present to you the choice of life or death.
24:21:9/Anyone who stays in this city will die by the sword, famine, or plague. But anyone who goes out and surrenders to the Chaldeans who are besieging you will live; they will escape with their life.
24:21:10/For I have set my face against this city for harm and not for good, says the LORD. It will be handed over to the king of Babylon, and he will burn it with fire.'
24:21:11/Regarding the royal house of Judah, hear the word of the LORD;
24:21:12/'O house of David, this is what the LORD says: Administer justice every morning, and rescue the victim from the hand of the oppressor, lest my wrath go forth like fire and burn with none to quench it, because of your evil deeds.'
24:21:13/Behold, I am against you, resident of the valley, rock of the plain, says the LORD. You who say, 'Who will come down against us? Or who will enter our dwellings?'
24:21:14/But I will punish you according to the outcome of your actions, says the LORD. I will ignite a fire in its forest, and it will consume everything around it."
24:22:1/The LORD says; Go down to the palace of the king of Judah, and deliver this message there,
24:22:2/And tell him, Listen to the word of the LORD, O king of Judah, you who sit on David's throne, you, your officials, and your people who enter through these gates:
24:22:3/The LORD says; Carry out justice and righteousness, rescue the plundered from the hands of their oppressor: do not mistreat or do violence to the foreigner, the orphan, or the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place.
24:22:4/If you truly do this, then kings who sit on David's throne will enter through the gates of this palace, riding in chariots and on horses, along with their servants and their people.
24:22:5/But if you do not listen to these words, I swear by myself, declares the LORD, that this palace will become a ruin.
24:22:6/For this is what the LORD says to the royal house of Judah; You are like Gilead to me, the summit of Lebanon, yet I will surely turn you into a desert, into cities without inhabitants.
24:22:7/And I will send destroyers against you, each armed for battle: they will chop down your finest cedars and throw them into the fire.
24:22:8/Many nations will pass by this city and each will ask his neighbor, Why has the LORD done such a thing to this great city?
24:22:9/And the answer will be, Because they abandoned the covenant of the LORD their God, and worshiped and served other gods.
24:22:10/Do not weep for the dead or mourn for them; weep bitterly for the one who is exiled, for he will never return nor see his homeland again.
24:22:11/For this is what the LORD says about Shallum son of Josiah king of Judah, who succeeded Josiah his father as king and who has left this place; He will never return here,
24:22:12/But he will die in the place where they have exiled him and will never see this land again.
24:22:13/Woe to him who builds his palace by unrighteousness and his upper rooms by injustice, making his countrymen work for nothing, not paying them for their labor;
24:22:14/He says, 'I will build myself a great palace with spacious upper rooms.' So he makes large windows in it, panels it with cedar, and paints it with vermilion.
24:22:15/Do you think you are more royal because you compete in cedar? Did not your father eat and drink and administer justice and righteousness? Then it went well with him.
24:22:16/He defended the cause of the poor and needy, and so all went well. Is that not what it means to know me? declares the LORD.
24:22:17/But your eyes and heart are set only on dishonest gain, on shedding innocent blood, on oppression and on violence to carry it out.
24:22:18/Therefore, this is what the LORD says about Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah; They will not mourn for him, saying, 'Alas, my brother!' or 'Alas, sister!' They will not mourn for him, saying, 'Alas, master!' or 'Alas, his majesty!'
24:22:19/He will have the burial of a donkey—dragged away and thrown outside the gates of Jerusalem.
24:22:20/Go up to Lebanon and cry out, let your voice be heard in Bashan, cry out from Abarim, for all your lovers are shattered.
24:22:21/I spoke to you in your prosperity, but you said, 'I will not listen.' This has been your way from your youth, that you have not obeyed my voice.
24:22:22/The wind will sweep away all your shepherds, and your lovers will go into exile. Surely then you will be ashamed and disgraced for all your wickedness.
24:22:23/O inhabitant of Lebanon, nestled among the cedars, how you will groan when pains come upon you, agony like that of a woman in labor!
24:22:24/As surely as I live, declares the LORD, even if Coniah son of Jehoiakim king of Judah were a signet ring on my right hand, I would still pull you off;
24:22:25/And I will hand you over to those who seek your life, to those you fear—Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and the Babylonians.
24:22:26/I will hurl you and the mother who gave birth to you into another country, where you were not born, and there you both will die.
24:22:27/But to the land to which they long to return, there they will not return.
24:22:28/Is this man Coniah a despised, shattered pot, a vessel no one cares for? Why are they thrown out, he and his descendants, and cast into a land they do not know?
24:22:29/O earth, earth, earth, listen to the word of the LORD.
24:22:30/This is what the LORD says, Record this man as childless, a man who will not prosper in his lifetime: for none of his offspring will prosper, none will sit on the throne of David or rule anymore in Judah.
24:23:1/Doom to the shepherds who are destroying and scattering the sheep of my pasture! declares the LORD.
24:23:2/This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says to the shepherds who tend my people: You have scattered my flock, driven them away, and not attended to them. Behold, I will attend to you for your evil actions, declares the LORD.
24:23:3/I will gather the remnants of my flock from all the countries where I have driven them and bring them back to their pastures, where they will be fruitful and multiply.
24:23:4/I will appoint shepherds over them who will tend to them. They will no longer be afraid, dismayed, or missing, declares the LORD.
24:23:5/Behold, the time is coming, declares the LORD, when I will raise up a righteous Branch from David's line, a King who will reign wisely and do what is just and right in the land.
24:23:6/In his days, Judah will be saved, and Israel will live in safety. And this is the name by which he will be called: THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.
24:23:7/Therefore, behold, the time is coming, declares the LORD, when people will no longer say, 'The LORD lives, who brought the Israelites up out of Egypt,'
24:23:8/But, 'The LORD lives, who brought up and led the descendants of the house of Israel out of the northern land and from all the countries where I had banished them,' so they will live in their own land.
24:23:9/My heart is broken within me because of the prophets; all my bones tremble. I am like a drunken man, like a man overcome by wine, because of the LORD and his holy words.
24:23:10/The land is full of adulterers; because of the curse the land mourns, the pastures in the wilderness are dried up. Their course is evil, and their might is not right.
24:23:11/Both prophet and priest are godless; even in my temple I find their wickedness, declares the LORD.
24:23:12/Therefore, their path will be slippery in the darkness; they will be driven on and fall in it. For I will bring disaster on them, the year of their punishment, declares the LORD.
24:23:13/I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria; they prophesied by Baal and led my people Israel astray.
24:23:14/And in the prophets of Jerusalem, I have seen a horrible thing: they commit adultery and walk in lies; they strengthen the hands of evildoers, so that no one turns from his wickedness. They are all like Sodom to me, and its inhabitants like Gomorrah.
24:23:15/Therefore, this is what the LORD of hosts says about the prophets: Behold, I will feed them with wormwood and give them poisoned water to drink. For from the prophets of Jerusalem ungodliness has spread throughout the land.
24:23:16/This is what the LORD of hosts says: Do not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you. They fill you with false hopes. They speak visions from their own minds, not from the mouth of the LORD.
24:23:17/They keep saying to those who despise me, 'The LORD says: You will have peace.' And to everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his heart, they say, 'No harm will come to you.'
24:23:18/But who has stood in the council of the LORD to see or to hear his word? Who has listened and heard his word?
24:23:19/Behold, the storm of the LORD! Wrath has gone forth, a whirling tempest; it will burst upon the head of the wicked.
24:23:20/The anger of the LORD will not turn back until he has executed and accomplished the intents of his heart. In the latter days, you will understand it clearly.
24:23:21/I did not send these prophets, yet they ran. I did not speak to them, yet they prophesied.
24:23:22/But if they had stood in my council, they would have proclaimed my words to my people and would have turned them from their evil ways and from the evil of their deeds.
24:23:23/Am I only a God nearby, declares the LORD, and not a God far away?
24:23:24/Can anyone hide in secret places so that I cannot see him? declares the LORD. Do I not fill heaven and earth? declares the LORD.
24:23:25/I have heard what the prophets have said, who prophesy lies in my name, claiming, 'I had a dream! I had a dream!'
24:23:26/How long will this continue in the hearts of these lying prophets, who prophesy the delusions of their own minds?
24:23:27/They think they can make my people forget my name by their dreams, which they tell one another, just as their ancestors forgot my name for Baal.
24:23:28/The prophet who has a dream may share his dream, but the one who has my word should speak my word faithfully. What has straw in common with grain? declares the LORD.
24:23:29/Is not my word like fire, declares the LORD, and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces?
24:23:30/Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, declares the LORD, who steal my words from one another.
24:23:31/Behold, I am against the prophets, declares the LORD, who use their tongues and declare, 'The LORD declares.'
24:23:32/Behold, I am against those who prophesy false dreams, declares the LORD, and tell them, leading my people astray with their lies and their recklessness. I did not send them or command them, and they do not benefit this people at all, declares the LORD.
24:23:33/And when this people, or a prophet, or a priest asks you, 'What is the burden of the LORD?' you shall say to them, 'What burden? I will forsake you, declares the LORD.'
24:23:34/And as for the prophet, priest, or anyone who says, 'The burden of the LORD,' I will punish that man and his household.
24:23:35/This is what you shall say to one another, and to your brothers: 'What has the LORD answered?' or 'What has the LORD spoken?'
24:23:36/But 'the burden of the LORD' you shall mention no more, for the burden is every man's own word, and you pervert the words of the living God, the LORD of hosts, our God.
24:23:37/This is what you shall say to the prophet: 'What has the LORD answered you?' and 'What has the LORD spoken?'
24:23:38/But since you say, 'The burden of the LORD,' therefore thus says the LORD: Because you say this phrase, 'The burden of the LORD,' and I have sent to you, saying, 'Do not say, "The burden of the LORD,"'
24:23:39/Therefore, behold, I will surely forget you and cast you away from my presence, along with the city that I gave to you and your ancestors.
24:23:40/And I will bring upon you everlasting disgrace and perpetual shame, which will not be forgotten.
24:24:1/The LORD showed me two baskets of figs placed in front of the temple of the LORD, after Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had taken Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, along with the carpenters and smiths, from Jerusalem to Babylon.
24:24:2/One basket had very good figs, like those that are first ripe; and the other basket had very bad figs, which were so bad they couldn't be eaten.
24:24:3/Then the LORD asked me, "What do you see, Jeremiah?" And I said, "Figs; the good ones are very good, and the bad ones are very bad, so bad they can't be eaten."
24:24:4/Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
24:24:5/This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Just like these good figs, I will look favorably on those from Judah who have been exiled to Babylon for their own good.
24:24:6/I will keep my eye on them for their benefit, and I will bring them back to this land. I will rebuild them and not tear them down; I will plant them and not uproot them.
24:24:7/And I will give them a heart to know me, that I am the LORD. They will be my people, and I will be their God, because they will return to me with all their heart.
24:24:8/And as for the bad figs, which are so bad they can't be eaten, this is what the LORD says: In the same way, I will deal with Zedekiah king of Judah, his princes, and the remainder of Jerusalem, those remaining in this land and those living in Egypt.
24:24:9/I will make them a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, a disgrace, a byword, a taunt, and a curse in all the places where I will drive them.
24:24:10/And I will send the sword, famine, and plague among them until they are completely wiped out from the land I gave to them and their ancestors.
24:25:1/The message that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, which was also the first year of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon;
24:25:2/Which Jeremiah the prophet spoke to all the people of Judah and to all the residents of Jerusalem, saying,
24:25:3/From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah, up to this day, which is the twenty-third year, the word of the LORD has come to me, and I have consistently spoken to you, getting up early to do so; but you have not listened.
24:25:4/And the LORD has sent all his servants the prophets to you, again and again, but you have not listened or paid any attention.
24:25:5/They said, 'Turn back now, each of you, from your evil ways and from your wrong actions, and live in the land that the LORD has given to you and your ancestors forever and ever;
24:25:6/And do not follow other gods to serve and worship them, and do not provoke me to anger with what you make with your hands; then I will not harm you.'
24:25:7/Yet you have not listened to me, says the LORD, so as to provoke me to anger with what your hands have made, to your own detriment.
24:25:8/Therefore, this is what the LORD of hosts says; Because you have not listened to my words,
24:25:9/Look, I will send for all the families of the north, says the LORD, and for Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and I will bring them against this land and its inhabitants, and against all the surrounding nations. I will completely destroy them and make them an object of horror, a source of constant hissing, and everlasting ruins.
24:25:10/I will remove from them the sounds of joy and happiness, the voices of the bride and the bridegroom, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the lamps.
24:25:11/And this entire land will become a desolate wasteland, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon for seventy years.
24:25:12/But when seventy years are completed, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation, says the LORD, for their wrongdoing, and the land of the Chaldeans, and will make it desolate forever.
24:25:13/I will bring upon that land all the words I have declared against it, all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah has prophesied against all the nations.
24:25:14/For many nations and great kings will make slaves of them as well; and I will repay them according to their deeds and the work of their hands.
24:25:15/For this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says to me; 'Take this cup of the wine of wrath from my hand, and make all the nations to whom I send you drink it.
24:25:16/They will drink and stagger and go mad because of the sword that I will send among them.'
24:25:17/Then I took the cup from the LORD’s hand, and made all the nations drink, to whom the LORD had sent me:
24:25:18/Including Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, its kings and its officials, to make them a ruin, an object of horror, hissing, and cursing, as it is today;
24:25:19/Pharaoh king of Egypt, his servants, his officials, and all his people;
24:25:20/And all the mixed peoples, all the kings of the land of Uz, all the kings of the land of the Philistines (including Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnants of Ashdod),
24:25:21/Edom, Moab, and the Ammonites,
24:25:22/All the kings of Tyre, all the kings of Sidon, and the kings of the coastlands across the sea,
24:25:23/Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who cut the corners of their hair,
24:25:24/All the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the mixed peoples living in the desert,
24:25:25/All the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of Media,
24:25:26/And all the kings of the north, near and far, one after another, and all the kingdoms of the world that are on the face of the earth. And the king of Sheshach will drink after them.
24:25:27/Therefore, tell them, 'This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Drink, get drunk, vomit, fall and rise no more, because of the sword I will send among you.'
24:25:28/And if they refuse to take the cup from your hand to drink, then you shall say to them, 'This is what the LORD of hosts says: You will certainly drink.
24:25:29/See, I am beginning to bring disaster on the city that bears my name, and should you go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, for I am summoning a sword against all the inhabitants of the earth, declares the LORD of hosts.'
24:25:30/Therefore, prophesy against them all these words, and say to them, 'The LORD will roar from on high; he will thunder from his holy dwelling; he will roar mightily against his land. He will shout like those who tread grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.
24:25:31/A tumult will reach to the ends of the earth, for the LORD has a dispute with the nations; he will enter into judgment with all people; he will put the wicked to the sword,' declares the LORD.
24:25:32/This is what the LORD of hosts says: 'Look, disaster is spreading from nation to nation; a great storm is being stirred up from the farthest parts of the earth.'
24:25:33/And those slain by the LORD on that day will extend from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be mourned, gathered, or buried; they will be like dung on the ground.
24:25:34/Wail, you shepherds, and cry out; roll in the ashes, you leaders of the flock. For the days of your slaughter and dispersion have arrived, and you will fall like precious vessels.
24:25:35/And the shepherds will have no way to flee, nor the leaders of the flock any means of escape.
24:25:36/A cry of the cry of the shepherds, and a wailing of the leaders of the flock, will be heard, for the LORD is laying waste their pasture.
24:25:37/And the peaceful habitations are cut down because of the fierce anger of the LORD.
24:25:38/He has left his lair like a lion, for their land has become desolate because of the sword of the oppressor, and because of his fierce anger.
24:26:1/At the start of Jehoiakim's reign, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this message came from the LORD:
24:26:2/The LORD says; Stand in the courtyard of the LORD's house, and speak to all the cities of Judah who come to worship in the LORD's house, all the words I command you to speak to them; do not omit a single word:
24:26:3/Perhaps they will listen and each turn from their evil ways, so I can change my mind about the disaster I plan to bring on them because of their wicked actions.
24:26:4/You must tell them, The LORD says; If you do not listen to me, to follow my law which I have laid out for you,
24:26:5/To listen to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I have sent to you again and again, but you have not listened;
24:26:6/Then I will make this house like Shiloh, and this city will become a curse to all the nations of the earth.
24:26:7/So the priests, the prophets, and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the LORD.
24:26:8/When Jeremiah finished speaking everything the LORD had commanded him to say to all the people, the priests, the prophets, and all the people seized him, saying, You must surely die.
24:26:9/Why have you prophesied in the name of the LORD, saying, This house will be like Shiloh, and this city will be desolate, without an inhabitant? And all the people gathered against Jeremiah in the house of the LORD.
24:26:10/When the princes of Judah heard about this, they went up from the king's house to the house of the LORD and sat at the entrance of the new gate of the LORD's house.
24:26:11/Then the priests and the prophets said to the princes and to all the people, This man deserves to die because he has prophesied against this city, as you have heard with your own ears.
24:26:12/Then Jeremiah said to all the princes and to all the people, The LORD sent me to prophesy against this house and against this city all the words you have heard.
24:26:13/So now, reform your ways and your actions and obey the LORD your God; then the LORD will relent and not bring the disaster he has pronounced against you.
24:26:14/As for me, I am in your hands; do with me whatever you think is good and right.
24:26:15/But be sure of this: if you put me to death, you will bring the guilt of innocent blood on yourselves, on this city, and on its inhabitants, because the LORD has truly sent me to you to speak all these words in your hearing.
24:26:16/Then the princes and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, This man does not deserve to die, for he has spoken to us in the name of the LORD our God.
24:26:17/Then some of the elders of the land stood up and spoke to the entire assembly of the people, saying,
24:26:18/Micah of Moresheth prophesied during the reign of Hezekiah king of Judah. He told all the people of Judah, The LORD of hosts says; Zion will be plowed like a field, Jerusalem will become a heap of rubble, and the temple hill will become overgrown with thickets.
24:26:19/Did Hezekiah king of Judah and all Judah put him to death? Did he not fear the LORD and seek the LORD's favor, and did not the LORD relent concerning the disaster he had pronounced against them? We are about to bring a great disaster on ourselves.
24:26:20/There was also a man who prophesied in the name of the LORD, Uriah son of Shemaiah from Kiriath-jearim, who prophesied against this city and against this land in words similar to all those of Jeremiah.
24:26:21/And when King Jehoiakim, with all his warriors and all the officials, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death. But Uriah heard of it and was afraid, so he fled and went to Egypt.
24:26:22/King Jehoiakim then sent men to Egypt, Elnathan son of Achbor and others with him, to Egypt.
24:26:23/They brought Uriah back from Egypt and took him to King Jehoiakim, who killed him with the sword and threw his body into the burial place of the common people.
24:26:24/However, Ahikam son of Shaphan supported Jeremiah, so he was not handed over to the people to be put to death.
24:27:1/At the start of Jehoiakim's reign, son of Josiah, king of Judah, this message came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
24:27:2/The LORD told me to make bonds and yokes and wear them around my neck,
24:27:3/And to send them to the king of Edom, the king of Moab, the king of the Ammonites, the king of Tyre, and the king of Sidon, through the messengers coming to Jerusalem to Zedekiah king of Judah;
24:27:4/And instruct them to tell their leaders, "This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Tell your masters;
24:27:5/I created the earth, humans, and animals that walk on it with my immense power and outstretched arm, and I give it to whoever I choose.
24:27:6/Now, I have handed all these lands over to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, my servant; I've even given him the wild animals to serve him.
24:27:7/And all nations will serve him, his son, and his grandson, until his own land's time comes; then many nations and great kings will make him their servant.
24:27:8/Any nation or kingdom that refuses to serve Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, or to put their neck under his yoke, I will punish with war, famine, and disease until I have destroyed them through him.
24:27:9/So, do not listen to your prophets, diviners, dreamers, magicians, or sorcerers who tell you, 'You won't have to serve the king of Babylon.'
24:27:10/They are lying to you, leading you to be removed far from your land; I will drive you out, and you will perish.
24:27:11/But the nations that submit to the yoke of the king of Babylon and serve him, I will let them remain in their own land," says the LORD; "and they will farm it and live there."
24:27:12/I also told Zedekiah king of Judah all these things, saying, "Submit to the yoke of the king of Babylon, serve him and his people, and live.
24:27:13/Why should you and your people die by the sword, famine, and disease, as the LORD has warned against any nation that refuses to serve the king of Babylon?
24:27:14/So, do not listen to the prophets who tell you, 'You won't have to serve the king of Babylon.' They are deceiving you.
24:27:15/I haven't sent them," says the LORD, "yet they lie in my name, leading to your expulsion and death, you and the prophets who lie to you."
24:27:16/I also told the priests and all the people, "The LORD says, 'Do not listen to your prophets who claim, 'Soon the LORD's house vessels will be brought back from Babylon.' They are lying to you.
24:27:17/Do not listen to them; serve the king of Babylon, and live. Why should this city be destroyed?
24:27:18/If they are true prophets and have the LORD's word, let them plead with the LORD of hosts not to let the remaining items in the LORD's house, the royal palace of Judah, and Jerusalem be taken to Babylon.
24:27:19/For this is what the LORD of hosts says about the pillars, the sea, the stands, and the remaining items in this city,
24:27:20/Which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon did not take when he exiled Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, along with all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;
24:27:21/Indeed, the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says about the items remaining in the LORD's house, the royal palace of Judah, and Jerusalem;
24:27:22/They will be taken to Babylon and remain there until the day I attend to them," says the LORD. "Then, I will bring them back and restore them to this place."
24:28:1/That year, at the start of Zedekiah's reign over Judah, in the fourth year and fifth month, Hananiah son of Azur, a prophet from Gibeon, spoke to me in the LORD's house, in front of the priests and all the people, saying,
24:28:2/"This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: I have broken the yoke of the king of Babylon.
24:28:3/Within two years, I will bring back to this place all the items from the LORD's house that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away and brought to Babylon.
24:28:4/And I will return Jeconiah son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, along with all the captives of Judah who went to Babylon, says the LORD, because I will break the yoke of the king of Babylon."
24:28:5/Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah in front of the priests and all the people standing in the LORD's house,
24:28:6/"Amen! May the LORD do so! May the LORD fulfill the words you have prophesied and bring back from Babylon to this place the items from the LORD's house and all the captives.
24:28:7/However, listen now to this message I am speaking in your hearing and in the hearing of all the people.
24:28:8/The prophets before us, long ago, prophesied war, disaster, and disease against many countries and great kingdoms.
24:28:9/When a prophet predicts peace and their prophecy comes true, then it will be known that the LORD has truly sent that prophet."
24:28:10/Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah and broke it.
24:28:11/And Hananiah declared in front of all the people, "This is what the LORD says: 'In the same way, I will break the yoke of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon from the neck of all nations within two years.'" And the prophet Jeremiah went on his way.
24:28:12/After Hananiah broke the yoke from off Jeremiah's neck, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying,
24:28:13/"Go and tell Hananiah, 'This is what the LORD says: You have broken yokes of wood, but you will make in their place yokes of iron.
24:28:14/For this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: I have put an iron yoke on the neck of all these nations, so they will serve Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and they will serve him. I have even given him the animals of the field.'"
24:28:15/Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, "Listen, Hananiah; the LORD has not sent you, yet you have made this people trust in a lie.
24:28:16/Therefore, this is what the LORD says: 'I am about to remove you from the face of the earth. This year you will die because you have preached rebellion against the LORD.'"
24:28:17/So Hananiah the prophet died that same year in the seventh month.
24:29:1/Here are the contents of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the remaining elders who were taken as captives, as well as to the priests, prophets, and all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had taken from Jerusalem to Babylon;
24:29:2/This happened after King Jeconiah, the queen, the eunuchs, the princes of Judah and Jerusalem, and the craftsmen and metalworkers had left Jerusalem.
24:29:3/It was delivered by Elasah son of Shaphan and Gemariah son of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah king of Judah sent to Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. It said,
24:29:4/"This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says to all the captives I have sent from Jerusalem to Babylon:
24:29:5/"Build homes and live in them; plant gardens and eat their produce.
24:29:6/"Marry and have sons and daughters; find wives for your sons and give your daughters in marriage, so that they too may have sons and daughters. Increase in number there; do not decrease.
24:29:7/"Also, seek the welfare of the city to which I have carried you into exile. Pray to the LORD for it, because if it prospers, you too will prosper."
24:29:8/"Do not let your prophets and diviners among you deceive you, and do not listen to the dreams you encourage them to have.
24:29:9/"They are prophesying lies to you in my name. I have not sent them," declares the LORD.
24:29:10/"This is what the LORD says: When seventy years are completed for Babylon, I will come to you and fulfill my good promise to bring you back to this place.
24:29:11/"For I know the plans I have for you," declares the LORD, "plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.
24:29:12/"Then you will call on me and come and pray to me, and I will listen to you.
24:29:13/"You will seek me and find me when you seek me with all your heart.
24:29:14/"I will be found by you," declares the LORD, "and will bring you back from captivity. I will gather you from all the nations and places where I have banished you," declares the LORD, "and will bring you back to the place from which I carried you into exile."
24:29:15/"Because you have said, 'The LORD has raised up prophets for us in Babylon,'
24:29:16/"know that this is what the LORD says about the king who sits on David's throne and all the people who remain in this city, your fellow citizens who did not go with you into exile—
24:29:17/"This is what the LORD of hosts says: 'I will send the sword, famine, and plague against them and will make them like poor figs that are so bad they cannot be eaten.
24:29:18/"I will pursue them with the sword, famine, and plague and will make them an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, a curse and an object of dread, ridicule, and scorn among all the nations where I drive them,
24:29:19/"because they have not listened to my words,' says the LORD, 'which I sent to them again and again by my servants the prophets. But you would not listen,' says the LORD.
24:29:20/"Hear the word of the LORD, all you exiles whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
24:29:21/"This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says about Ahab son of Kolaiah and Zedekiah son of Maaseiah, who are prophesying lies to you in my name: 'I will deliver them into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he will put them to death before your very eyes.
24:29:22/"Because of them, a curse will be used by all the exiles from Judah in Babylon, saying, 'May the LORD treat you like Zedekiah and Ahab, whom the king of Babylon burned in the fire,'
24:29:23/"because they have done outrageous things in Israel; they have committed adultery with their neighbors' wives and have spoken lies in my name, which I did not command them. I am the one who knows, and I am witness," declares the LORD.
24:29:24/"Thus you shall also speak to Shemaiah the Nehelamite, saying,
24:29:25/"This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Because you have sent letters in your own name to all the people in Jerusalem, to Zephaniah son of Maaseiah the priest, and to all the priests, saying,
24:29:26/'The LORD has appointed you priest instead of Jehoiada the priest to be in charge in the house of the LORD; you should put any madman who acts like a prophet into the stocks and neck-irons.
24:29:27/"So why have you not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth who poses as a prophet among you?
24:29:28/"For he has sent to us in Babylon, saying, 'This exile will be long: build houses and settle down; plant gardens and eat their produce.'"
24:29:29/And Zephaniah the priest read this letter in the hearing of Jeremiah the prophet.
24:29:30/Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying,
24:29:31/"Send to all the exiles, saying, 'This is what the LORD says about Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, even though I did not send him, and has led you to believe a lie,
24:29:32/"this is what the LORD says: I will surely punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite and his descendants. He will not have anyone living among this people, nor will he see the good that I will do for my people,' declares the LORD, 'because he has preached rebellion against the LORD.'"
24:30:1/The message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD was,
24:30:2/This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Write down all the words I have spoken to you in a book.
24:30:3/For the time is coming, says the LORD, when I will bring back my people Israel and Judah from captivity. I will bring them back to the land I gave their ancestors, and they will take possession of it again.
24:30:4/These are the words the LORD spoke concerning Israel and Judah.
24:30:5/This is what the LORD says: We have heard a sound of terror, of fear, and not of peace.
24:30:6/Now ask and see: Can a man bear children? Then why do I see every man with his hands on his stomach like a woman in labor, and every face turned pale with fear?
24:30:7/Alas! That day is so great there is none like it. It is a time of distress for Jacob, but he will be saved out of it.
24:30:8/On that day, declares the LORD of hosts, I will break the yoke off your neck and tear off your bonds. No longer will foreigners enslave you.
24:30:9/Instead, they will serve the LORD their God and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.
24:30:10/So do not fear, my servant Jacob, says the LORD, nor be dismayed, Israel. For I will save you from a distance, your descendants from the land of their captivity. Jacob will return and will be at peace and secure, with no one to make him afraid.
24:30:11/For I am with you, says the LORD, to save you. Though I completely destroy all the nations where I have scattered you, I will not completely destroy you. I will discipline you justly and will not let you go unpunished.
24:30:12/This is what the LORD says: Your injury is incurable, your wound is severe.
24:30:13/There is no one to plead your cause, no remedy for your sore, no healing for you.
24:30:14/All your allies have forgotten you; they care nothing for you. I have struck you as an enemy would and punished you as would the cruel, because your guilt is so great and your sins so many.
24:30:15/Why do you cry out over your wound, your pain that has no cure? Because of your great guilt and many sins, I have done these things to you.
24:30:16/But all who devour you will be devoured; all your enemies will go into exile. Those who plunder you will be plundered; all who prey on you I will make prey.
24:30:17/But I will restore you to health and heal your wounds, declares the LORD, because you are called an outcast, Zion for whom no one cares.
24:30:18/This is what the LORD says: I will restore the fortunes of Jacob's tents and have compassion on his dwellings; the city will be rebuilt on its ruins, and the palace will stand in its proper place.
24:30:19/From them will come songs of thanksgiving and the sound of rejoicing. I will increase them, and they will not be decreased; I will honor them, and they will not be belittled.
24:30:20/Their children will be as in days of old, and their community will be established before me; I will punish all who oppress them.
24:30:21/Their leader will be one of their own; their ruler will arise from among them. I will bring him near and he will come close to me, for who is he who will devote himself to be close to me? declares the LORD.
24:30:22/Then you will be my people, and I will be your God.
24:30:23/Behold, the storm of the LORD will burst out in wrath, a driving wind swirling down on the heads of the wicked.
24:30:24/The fierce anger of the LORD will not turn back until he fully accomplishes the purposes of his heart. In the latter days, you will understand this.
24:31:1/At that time, says the LORD, I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they will be my people.
24:31:2/This is what the LORD says: The people who survived the sword found favor in the wilderness; Israel, when I went to give him rest.
24:31:3/The LORD appeared to us in the past, saying: Indeed, I have loved you with an everlasting love; therefore, I have continued to show you kindness.
24:31:4/Once again I will rebuild you, and you will be rebuilt, O virgin of Israel. You will again be adorned with your tambourines and go out in joyful dancing.
24:31:5/You will plant vineyards again on the hills of Samaria; the planters will plant and enjoy the fruit.
24:31:6/For there will be a day when the watchmen on the hills of Ephraim will call out, 'Arise, let us go up to Zion, to the LORD our God.'
24:31:7/For this is what the LORD says: Sing with joy for Jacob; shout for the foremost of the nations. Make your praises heard, and say, 'LORD, save your people, the remnant of Israel.'
24:31:8/Behold, I will bring them from the north and gather them from the ends of the earth. Among them will be the blind and the lame, expectant mothers and women in labor; a great throng will return.
24:31:9/They will come with weeping; I will lead them with prayers of supplication. I will guide them to streams of water, on a straight path where they will not stumble, because I am Israel's father, and Ephraim is my firstborn son.
24:31:10/Listen to the word of the LORD, O nations; proclaim it in distant coastlands: He who scattered Israel will gather them and will watch over his flock like a shepherd.
24:31:11/For the LORD has redeemed Jacob and ransomed him from the hand of one stronger than he.
24:31:12/They will come and shout for joy on the heights of Zion; they will be radiant over the bounty of the LORD—over the grain, the new wine, and the oil, and over the young of the flock and the herd. Their life will be like a well-watered garden, and they will sorrow no more.
24:31:13/Then young women will dance and be glad, young men and old as well. I will turn their mourning into gladness; I will give them comfort and joy instead of sorrow.
24:31:14/I will satisfy the priests with abundance, and my people will be filled with my bounty, declares the LORD.
24:31:15/This is what the LORD says: A voice is heard in Ramah, mourning and great weeping, Rachel weeping for her children and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more.
24:31:16/This is what the LORD says: Restrain your voice from weeping and your eyes from tears, for your work will be rewarded, declares the LORD. They will return from the land of the enemy.
24:31:17/So there is hope for your future, declares the LORD. Your children will return to their own territory.
24:31:18/I have surely heard Ephraim's moaning: 'You disciplined me, and I have been disciplined like an untrained calf. Restore me, and I will return, because you are the LORD my God.
24:31:19/After I strayed, I repented; after I came to understand, I beat my breast. I was ashamed and humiliated because I bore the disgrace of my youth.'
24:31:20/Is not Ephraim my dear son, the child in whom I delight? Though I often speak against him, I still remember him. Therefore my heart yearns for him; I have great compassion for him, declares the LORD.
24:31:21/Set up road signs; put up guideposts. Take note of the highway, the road that you take. Return, O virgin Israel, return to these your towns.
24:31:22/How long will you wander, unfaithful daughter Israel? The LORD has created a new thing on the earth: A woman will surround a man.
24:31:23/This is what the LORD Almighty, the God of Israel, says: When I bring them back from captivity, the people in the land of Judah and in its towns will once again use these words: 'The LORD bless you, O righteous dwelling, O sacred mountain.'
24:31:24/People will live together in Judah and all its towns—farmers and those who move about with their flocks.
24:31:25/I will refresh the weary and satisfy the faint.
24:31:26/At this I awoke and looked around. My sleep had been pleasant to me.
24:31:27/Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of humans and the seed of animals.
24:31:28/And just as I have watched over them to uproot and tear down, to overthrow, destroy, and bring disaster, so I will watch over them to build and to plant, declares the LORD.
24:31:29/In those days people will no longer say, 'The parents have eaten sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge.'
24:31:30/But everyone will die for their own sin; whoever eats sour grapes—their own teeth will be set on edge.
24:31:31/Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah.
24:31:32/It will not be like the covenant I made with their ancestors when I took them by the hand to lead them out of Egypt, because they broke my covenant, though I was a husband to them, declares the LORD.
24:31:33/But this is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after those days, declares the LORD: I will put my law in their minds and write it on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people.
24:31:34/No longer will they teach their neighbor, or say to one another, 'Know the LORD,' because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest, declares the LORD. For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.
24:31:35/This is what the LORD says, He who appoints the sun to shine by day, who decrees the moon and stars to shine by night, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar—The LORD Almighty is His name:
24:31:36/Only if these decrees vanish from my sight, declares the LORD, will Israel ever cease being a nation before me.
24:31:37/This is what the LORD says: Only if the heavens above can be measured and the foundations of the earth below be searched out will I reject all the descendants of Israel because of all they have done, declares the LORD.
24:31:38/Behold, the days are coming, declares the LORD, when the city will be rebuilt for the LORD from the Tower of Hananel to the Corner Gate.
24:31:39/The measuring line will stretch from there straight to the hill of Gareb and then turn toward Goah.
24:31:40/And the whole valley where dead bodies and ashes are thrown, and all the terraces out to the Kidron Valley on the east as far as the corner of the Horse Gate, will be holy to the LORD. The city will never again be uprooted or demolished.
24:32:1/The message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.
24:32:2/At that time, the king of Babylon's army was besieging Jerusalem, and Jeremiah the prophet was confined in the courtyard of the guard, which was in the king of Judah's palace.
24:32:3/Zedekiah king of Judah had imprisoned him, asking, "Why do you prophesy and say, 'This is what the LORD says: I am about to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will capture it;
24:32:4/And Zedekiah king of Judah will not escape from the Chaldeans but will definitely be handed over to the king of Babylon. They will speak face to face, and Zedekiah will see him eye to eye;
24:32:5/And he will take Zedekiah to Babylon, where he will stay until I deal with him, says the LORD. Even if you fight the Chaldeans, you will not succeed."
24:32:6/And Jeremiah said, "The LORD spoke to me, saying,
24:32:7/Look, Hanameel, the son of your uncle Shallum, will come to you and say, 'Buy my field in Anathoth, because you have the right to redeem it by purchase.'
24:32:8/So Hanameel, my uncle's son, came to me in the courtyard of the guard as the LORD had said, and told me, 'Please buy my field in Anathoth in the territory of Benjamin, because you have the right of inheritance and redemption. Buy it for yourself.' Then I realized this was the LORD's command.
24:32:9/So I bought the field in Anathoth from Hanameel, my uncle's son, and paid him seventeen shekels of silver.
24:32:10/And I signed the deed, sealed it, called in witnesses, and weighed out the silver on scales.
24:32:11/Then I took the purchase deed, both the sealed copy containing the terms and conditions, as well as the unsealed copy,
24:32:12/And I handed the purchase deed to Baruch son of Neriah, son of Maaseiah, in the presence of Hanameel, my uncle's son, and in the presence of the witnesses who had signed the purchase deed, and before all the Jews sitting in the courtyard of the guard.
24:32:13/And I instructed Baruch in their presence, saying,
24:32:14/"This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Take these documents, both the sealed and unsealed copies of the purchase deed, and place them in a clay jar so they will last a long time.
24:32:15/For this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Homes, fields, and vineyards will once again be bought in this land."
24:32:16/After I had given the purchase deed to Baruch son of Neriah, I prayed to the LORD, saying,
24:32:17/"Oh Sovereign LORD! You have made the heavens and the earth by your great power and outstretched arm. Nothing is too difficult for you.
24:32:18/You show love to thousands but bring the consequences of the fathers' sins into the laps of their children after them. Great and powerful God, whose name is the LORD of hosts,
24:32:19/You have great plans and perform mighty deeds. Your eyes are open to all the ways of mankind; you reward everyone according to their conduct and as their deeds deserve.
24:32:20/You performed signs and wonders in Egypt and have continued to do so in Israel and among all humanity, and have made a name for yourself, as is the case today.
24:32:21/You brought your people Israel out of Egypt with signs and wonders, with a strong hand and an outstretched arm, and with great terror.
24:32:22/And you gave them this land, which you swore to their ancestors to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey.
24:32:23/They came in and took possession of it, but they did not obey your voice or walk in your law. They did nothing of what you commanded them to do, so you have brought all this disaster upon them.
24:32:24/See the siege ramps; they have come to the city to capture it. And the city has been handed over to the Babylonians who are attacking it, because of the sword, famine, and plague. What you have spoken has happened; as you see, it is so.
24:32:25/And yet, O Sovereign LORD, you have told me to buy the field with money and get witnesses, even though the city is being handed over to the Babylonians."
24:32:26/Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying,
24:32:27/"I am the LORD, the God of all mankind. Is anything too hard for me?
24:32:28/Therefore, this is what the LORD says: I am about to hand this city over to the Babylonians and to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, who will capture it.
24:32:29/The Babylonians who are attacking this city will come in and set it on fire; they will burn it down, along with the houses where people have provoked me to anger by burning incense on the roofs to Baal and pouring out drink offerings to other gods.
24:32:30/From their youth, the people of Israel and Judah have done only what is evil in my sight; they have only provoked me to anger with the work of their hands, declares the LORD.
24:32:31/This city has aroused my anger and wrath from the day it was built to this day, so I must remove it from my presence
24:32:32/because of all the evil of the Israelites and the people of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger—they, their kings, their officials, their priests, their prophets, the people of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
24:32:33/They turned their backs to me, not their faces; though I taught them again and again, they would not listen or respond to discipline.
24:32:34/They placed their detestable idols in the house that bears my Name, defiling it.
24:32:35/They built the high places of Baal in the Valley of Ben Hinnom to sacrifice their sons and daughters to Molech, though I never commanded it, nor did it enter my mind that they should do such a detestable thing and so make Judah sin.
24:32:36/Now therefore, this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about this city you say will be handed over to the king of Babylon through sword, famine, and plague:
24:32:37/"Behold, I will gather them from all the countries where I have driven them in my anger, fury, and great wrath. I will bring them back to this place and let them live in safety.
24:32:38/They will be my people, and I will be their God.
24:32:39/I will give them singleness of heart and action, so that they will always fear me for their own good and the good of their children after them.
24:32:40/I will make an everlasting covenant with them: I will never stop doing good to them, and I will inspire them to fear me, so they will never turn away from me.
24:32:41/Yes, I will delight in doing them good, and I will assuredly plant them in this land with all my heart and soul.
24:32:42/For this is what the LORD says: Just as I have brought all this great disaster on this people, so I will bring on them all the good I have promised them.
24:32:43/Fields will be bought in this land, about which you say, 'It is a desolate waste, without people or animals, and it has been handed over to the Babylonians.'
24:32:44/People will buy fields for money, sign deeds, seal them, and call in witnesses in the land of Benjamin, in the areas around Jerusalem, in the towns of Judah, in the towns of the hill country, in the towns of the lowland, and in the towns of the Negev, because I will restore their fortunes, declares the LORD.
24:33:1/Moreover, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah a second time, while he was still confined in the prison courtyard, saying,
24:33:2/"This is what the LORD says, the one who created it, the LORD who formed it to establish it; the LORD is his name;
24:33:3/Reach out to me, and I will respond to you, and show you great and mighty things, which you do not know.
24:33:4/For this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about the houses of this city and the royal palaces of Judah that have been demolished by the siege ramps and the sword;
24:33:5/They are coming to fight the Babylonians, but it will only result in filling the city with the corpses of those I have struck down in my anger and wrath, and for all whose evil I have turned my face away from this city.
24:33:6/Look, I will bring it healing and restoration, and I will heal them and reveal to them an abundance of peace and truth.
24:33:7/And I will reverse the fortunes of Judah and Israel and rebuild them as before.
24:33:8/I will cleanse them from all their sin against me and forgive all their sins of rebellion against me.
24:33:9/And this will bring me joy, praise, and honor before all nations on earth that hear of all the good I do for them; they will be in awe and tremble at the abundant prosperity and peace I provide for them.
24:33:10/"This is what the LORD says; Once more there will be heard in this place, which you say is a wasteland without people or animals, in the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem that are deserted, without people, without inhabitants, and without animals,
24:33:11/the sounds of joy and gladness, the voices of bride and groom, and the voices of those who say, 'Praise the LORD of hosts, for the LORD is good; his steadfast love endures forever!' as they bring thanksgiving sacrifices to the house of the LORD. For I will restore the fortunes of the land as they were before," says the LORD.
24:33:12/"This is what the LORD of hosts says; In this place, desolate without people or animals, and in all its cities, there will again be pastures for shepherds to rest their flocks.
24:33:13/In the towns of the hill country, in the towns of the foothills, in the towns of the Negev, in the territory of Benjamin, the areas around Jerusalem, and the towns of Judah, flocks will again pass under the hand of the one who counts them," says the LORD.
24:33:14/"Look, the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will fulfill the good promise I made to the people of Israel and Judah.
24:33:15/In those days and at that time, I will make a righteous Branch sprout from David's line; he will do what is just and right in the land.
24:33:16/In those days Judah will be saved and Jerusalem will live in safety. And this is the name by which it will be called: The LORD Our Righteous Savior.'
24:33:17/For this is what the LORD says: 'David will never fail to have a man to sit on the throne of the house of Israel;
24:33:18/nor will the priests, the Levites, ever fail to have a man to stand before me to offer burnt offerings, to burn grain offerings, and to present sacrifices.'"
24:33:19/And the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying,
24:33:20/"This is what the LORD says; If you can break my covenant with the day and my covenant with the night, so that day and night no longer come at their appointed times,
24:33:21/then my covenant with David my servant—and my covenant with the Levites who are priests ministering before me—can be broken and David will no longer have a descendant to reign on his throne.
24:33:22/Just as the stars of the sky cannot be counted and the sand of the sea cannot be measured, so I will increase the descendants of David my servant and the Levites who minister before me."
24:33:23/Moreover, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying,
24:33:24/"Have you not noticed what these people are saying, 'The LORD has rejected the two kingdoms he chose'? So they despise my people and no longer regard them as a nation.
24:33:25/This is what the LORD says: 'If I have not established my covenant with day and night and the fixed laws of heaven and earth,
24:33:26/then I will reject the descendants of Jacob and David my servant and will not choose one of his descendants to rule over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. But I will restore their fortunes and have compassion on them.'"
24:34:1/The message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, his entire army, and all the kingdoms under his control, along with all the people, waged war against Jerusalem and all its surrounding cities, was this:
24:34:2/This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Go and speak to Zedekiah king of Judah, and tell him, 'This is what the LORD says: I am going to hand this city over to the king of Babylon, and he will set it on fire.
24:34:3/You won't escape from him but will definitely be captured and handed over to him. You will see the king of Babylon with your own eyes, he will speak to you face to face, and you will go to Babylon.'
24:34:4/However, listen to the LORD's message, O Zedekiah king of Judah; 'This is what the LORD says about you: You will not die by the sword.
24:34:5/But you will die peacefully. Like the ceremonies for your predecessors, the former kings before you, so will they burn incense for you and mourn for you, saying, "Alas, lord!" because I have declared it, says the LORD.'
24:34:6/Then Jeremiah the prophet relayed all these words to Zedekiah king of Judah in Jerusalem,
24:34:7/While the king of Babylon's army was fighting against Jerusalem and against all the remaining cities of Judah, Lachish, and Azekah, for these fortified cities were the only ones left in Judah.
24:34:8/This message came to Jeremiah from the LORD after King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people in Jerusalem to proclaim freedom for them;
24:34:9/Ensuring that every man would release his male and female Hebrew slaves, so that no one would enslave a fellow Jew.
24:34:10/When all the officials and people who had entered into the covenant heard that everyone was to release their male and female slaves and no longer hold them in bondage, they complied and let them go.
24:34:11/But later they changed their minds and took back the male and female slaves they had released, forcing them into slavery again.
24:34:12/Therefore, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
24:34:13/This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I made a covenant with your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, from a life of slavery, saying,
24:34:14/At the end of seven years, each of you must release your fellow Hebrew who has been sold to you. After serving you for six years, you must let them go free. But your ancestors did not listen to me or pay attention.
24:34:15/Recently you repented and did what is right in my eyes by proclaiming freedom to one another, and you made a covenant before me in the temple that bears my name.
24:34:16/But then you changed your minds and profaned my name by forcing back into slavery the men and women you had set free, according to their desire, to be your slaves again.'
24:34:17/Therefore, this is what the LORD says: 'You have not obeyed me by proclaiming freedom, each for your fellow countrymen and countrywomen. Behold, I proclaim freedom for you, says the LORD, to the sword, to plague, and to famine. I will make you a horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
24:34:18/And I will hand over those who have violated my covenant, who have not fulfilled the terms of the covenant they made before me when they cut a calf in two and walked between its parts—
24:34:19/The officials of Judah, the officials of Jerusalem, the court officials, the priests, and all the people of the land who walked between the parts of the calf—
24:34:20/I will hand them over to their enemies, to those who seek their lives. Their dead bodies will become food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
24:34:21/And Zedekiah king of Judah and his officials I will hand over to their enemies, to those who seek their lives, and to the army of the king of Babylon, which has withdrawn from you.
24:34:22/Behold, I will command, says the LORD, and bring them back to this city. They will fight against it, capture it, and burn it down. And I will make the cities of Judah desolate, without any inhabitants.
24:35:1/The message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD during the reign of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah, was this:
24:35:2/Go to the Rechabite family, talk to them, then bring them into one of the rooms of the LORD's house and offer them wine to drink.
24:35:3/So I took Jaazaniah son of Jeremiah, son of Habaziniah, his brothers, all his sons, and the whole Rechabite family;
24:35:4/And led them into the LORD's house, into the room of the sons of Hanan, son of Igdaliah, a man of God, next to the room of the officials, above the room of Maaseiah son of Shallum, the doorkeeper.
24:35:5/Then I placed pots full of wine and cups in front of the Rechabites and said to them, "Drink some wine."
24:35:6/But they replied, "We do not drink wine, because our forefather Jonadab son of Rechab gave us this command: 'Neither you nor your descendants must ever drink wine.
24:35:7/Also you must never build houses, sow seed, plant vineyards, or own any; but you must live in tents all your days, so that you may live a long time in the land where you are nomads.'
24:35:8/We have obeyed everything our forefather Jonadab son of Rechab commanded us, not drinking wine our entire lives—neither we, our wives, our sons, nor our daughters.
24:35:9/We have not built houses to live in or had vineyards, fields, or crops.
24:35:10/But we have lived in tents and have fully obeyed and done everything Jonadab our forefather commanded us.
24:35:11/However, when Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon invaded the land, we said, 'Let's go to Jerusalem to escape the Babylonian and Aramean armies.' So we have stayed in Jerusalem.
24:35:12/Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying,
24:35:13/This is what the LORD Almighty, the God of Israel, says: Go and tell the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, 'Can you not learn a lesson and obey my words?' declares the LORD.
24:35:14/'The commands of Jonadab son of Rechab that he gave his sons not to drink wine have been kept; to this day they do not drink wine because they obey their forefather's command. But I have spoken to you again and again, yet you have not obeyed me.
24:35:15/I have sent all my servants the prophets to you, again and again, saying, "Turn now, each of you, from your wicked ways and reform your actions; do not follow other gods to serve them. Then you will live in the land I have given to you and your ancestors." But you have not paid attention or listened to me.
24:35:16/The descendants of Jonadab son of Rechab have carried out the command their forefather gave them, but these people have not listened to me.'
24:35:17/Therefore, this is what the LORD God Almighty, the God of Israel, says: 'I am going to bring on Judah and everyone living in Jerusalem all the disaster I have pronounced against them, because I spoke to them but they did not listen; I called to them but they did not answer.'"
24:35:18/And Jeremiah said to the Rechabite family, "This is what the LORD Almighty, the God of Israel, says: 'Because you have obeyed the command of Jonadab your forefather, kept all his instructions, and done everything he commanded,
24:35:19/Therefore, this is what the LORD Almighty, the God of Israel, says: 'Jonadab son of Rechab will never fail to have a descendant to serve me.'"
24:36:1/In the fourth year of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah, this message came to Jeremiah from the LORD:
24:36:2/Get a scroll and write on it all the messages I've given you about Israel, Judah, and all the other nations, from the time I first spoke to you during Josiah's reign until now.
24:36:3/Hopefully, the people of Judah will hear about all the disaster I plan to bring on them and will turn from their wicked ways so that I can forgive their sins and wrongdoings.
24:36:4/Then Jeremiah called Baruch, son of Neriah, and Baruch wrote down on a scroll all the LORD's messages as Jeremiah dictated them.
24:36:5/Jeremiah instructed Baruch, saying, "I'm confined and can't go to the LORD's temple.
24:36:6/So you must go and read the LORD's messages from the scroll you've written at my dictation. Read them in the temple on a day of fasting, and also read them to all the people of Judah who come from their towns.
24:36:7/Maybe they will plead with the LORD and turn from their evil ways, for the LORD has announced great anger and wrath against this people."
24:36:8/And Baruch, son of Neriah, did everything Jeremiah the prophet instructed him, reading the words of the LORD from the book in the temple.
24:36:9/In the fifth year of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, a fast was proclaimed before the LORD for all the people in Jerusalem and those coming from the towns of Judah.
24:36:10/Then Baruch read from the book the words of Jeremiah in the LORD's temple, in the room of Gemariah, son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper courtyard, at the entrance of the New Gate of the LORD's temple, in the hearing of all the people.
24:36:11/When Michaiah, son of Gemariah, son of Shaphan, heard all the words of the LORD from the book,
24:36:12/he went down to the king's palace, to the scribe's chamber, where all the officials were sitting: Elishama the scribe, Delaiah son of Shemaiah, Elnathan son of Achbor, Gemariah son of Shaphan, Zedekiah son of Hananiah, and all the other officials.
24:36:13/Then Michaiah told them all the words he had heard when Baruch read the book in the hearing of the people.
24:36:14/So all the officials sent Jehudi, son of Nethaniah, son of Shelemiah, son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, "Bring the scroll from which you have read to the people and come." So Baruch, son of Neriah, took the scroll in his hand and went to them.
24:36:15/They said to him, "Please sit down and read it to us." So Baruch read it to them.
24:36:16/When they heard all the words, they looked at each other in fear and said to Baruch, "We must definitely report all these words to the king."
24:36:17/And they asked Baruch, "Tell us, how did you write all these words? Did Jeremiah dictate them?"
24:36:18/Baruch replied, "He dictated all these words to me, and I wrote them with ink in the book."
24:36:19/Then the officials told Baruch, "You and Jeremiah should go hide. Don't let anyone know where you are."
24:36:20/They went to the king in the courtyard but first stored the scroll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe. Then they reported everything they had heard to the king.
24:36:21/The king sent Jehudi to get the scroll, and he brought it from Elishama the scribe's chamber. Jehudi read it to the king and all the officials standing beside him.
24:36:22/The king was sitting in his winter apartment, with a fire burning in the firepot in front of him.
24:36:23/As Jehudi read three or four columns, the king cut the scroll with a scribe's knife and threw it into the firepot, until the entire scroll was consumed in the fire.
24:36:24/Yet neither the king nor any of his servants who heard all these words were afraid or tore their clothes in despair.
24:36:25/Even though Elnathan, Delaiah, and Gemariah urged the king not to burn the scroll, he wouldn't listen to them.
24:36:26/Then the king ordered Jerahmeel, son of the king, Seraiah son of Azriel, and Shelemiah son of Abdeel to arrest Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet. But the LORD had hidden them.
24:36:27/After the king burned the scroll containing the words Baruch had written at Jeremiah's dictation, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah:
24:36:28/"Get another scroll and write on it all the original words that were on the first scroll, which Jehoiakim king of Judah burned.
24:36:29/And tell Jehoiakim king of Judah, 'The LORD says: You burned this scroll, asking, "Why did you write that the king of Babylon would certainly come and destroy this land, wiping out both people and animals from it?"
24:36:30/Therefore, the LORD says about Jehoiakim king of Judah: None of his descendants will sit on David's throne, and his body will be thrown out to suffer in the heat by day and the frost by night.
24:36:31/I will punish him, his offspring, and his servants for their wrongdoing. I will bring upon them, the residents of Jerusalem, and the people of Judah all the disaster I have declared, but they refused to listen.'"
24:36:32/Then Jeremiah took another scroll and gave it to Baruch, the scribe, son of Neriah, who wrote on it at Jeremiah's dictation all the words of the book that Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire. And many similar words were added to them.
24:37:1/King Zedekiah, son of Josiah, took the throne instead of Coniah, son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, appointed as king in Judah.
24:37:2/But neither he, his officials, nor the people of the land listened to the words of the LORD, spoken through the prophet Jeremiah.
24:37:3/Zedekiah sent Jehucal, son of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah, son of Maaseiah the priest, to the prophet Jeremiah, asking, "Please pray to the LORD our God for us."
24:37:4/Jeremiah was able to move freely among the people because he hadn't been imprisoned.
24:37:5/Then Pharaoh's army advanced from Egypt. When the Chaldeans besieging Jerusalem heard the news, they withdrew from Jerusalem.
24:37:6/Then the word of the LORD came to the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
24:37:7/"This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Tell the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of me, 'Pharaoh's army, which has come to help you, will return to Egypt, to their own land.'"
24:37:8/"And the Chaldeans will come back, fight against this city, capture it, and set it on fire."
24:37:9/"This is what the LORD says: Do not deceive yourselves by thinking, 'The Chaldeans will surely leave us alone.' They will not."
24:37:10/"Even if you were to defeat the entire Chaldean army fighting against you and only wounded soldiers were left, they would still rise up, every man in his tent, and set this city on fire."
24:37:11/When the Chaldean army withdrew from Jerusalem because of Pharaoh's army,
24:37:12/Jeremiah left Jerusalem to go to the land of Benjamin, to separate himself from the people there.
24:37:13/While he was at the Benjamin Gate, a guard captain named Irijah, son of Shelemiah, grandson of Hananiah, arrested Jeremiah, accusing him of defecting to the Chaldeans.
24:37:14/Jeremiah responded, "That's not true; I'm not defecting to the Chaldeans." But Irijah didn't listen to him and took Jeremiah to the officials.
24:37:15/The officials were angry with Jeremiah, beat him, and imprisoned him in the house of Jonathan the scribe, which they had converted into a jail.
24:37:16/After Jeremiah had been in the dungeon and cells for many days,
24:37:17/King Zedekiah sent for him and asked him privately, "Is there any word from the LORD?" Jeremiah replied, "Yes, you will be handed over to the king of Babylon."
24:37:18/Jeremiah then asked King Zedekiah, "What have I done wrong to you, your officials, or your people that you have put me in prison?
24:37:19/Where are your prophets who prophesied to you, claiming, 'The king of Babylon won't attack you or this land'?
24:37:20/So now, please listen, my lord the king: Let my plea be heard by you; do not send me back to the house of Jonathan the scribe, or I will die there."
24:37:21/Then Zedekiah ordered that Jeremiah be kept in the courtyard of the guard and given a loaf of bread daily from the bakers' street until all the bread in the city was gone. So Jeremiah stayed in the courtyard of the guard.
24:38:1/Then Shephatiah the son of Mattan, and Gedaliah the son of Pashur, and Jucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashur the son of Malchiah, heard the words that Jeremiah had spoken unto all the people, saying,
24:38:2/This is what the LORD says, Anyone who stays in this city will die by the sword, famine, and disease. But those who surrender to the Chaldeans will live; they will escape with their lives.
24:38:3/This is what the LORD says, This city will definitely be handed over to the Babylonian army, and they will capture it.
24:38:4/So the officials said to the king, "Please, let this man be executed. By saying these things, he is demoralizing the soldiers who are left in the city, as well as all the people. This man is not looking out for the well-being of the people but their harm."
24:38:5/Then King Zedekiah said, "He is in your hands; the king can't do anything to stop you."
24:38:6/So they took Jeremiah and threw him into the cistern of Malchiah, the king's son, which was in the prison courtyard. They lowered Jeremiah with ropes. In the cistern, there was no water, only mud, and Jeremiah sank into the mud.
24:38:7/Now when Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, one of the eunuchs in the king's palace, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the cistern; the king was sitting at the Benjamin Gate,
24:38:8/Ebedmelech went out of the palace and said to the king,
24:38:9/"My lord the king, these men have acted wickedly in everything they did to Jeremiah the prophet. They have thrown him into the cistern where he will starve to death because there's no more bread in the city."
24:38:10/Then the king commanded Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, "Take thirty men from here with you and lift Jeremiah the prophet out of the cistern before he dies."
24:38:11/So Ebedmelech took the men with him, went to a room under the treasury in the palace, and took some old rags and worn-out clothes. He let these down to Jeremiah in the cistern with ropes.
24:38:12/And Ebedmelech the Ethiopian said to Jeremiah, "Put these old rags and worn-out clothes under your armpits to pad the ropes." Jeremiah did so.
24:38:13/So they pulled Jeremiah up with the ropes and lifted him out of the cistern. And Jeremiah stayed in the prison courtyard.
24:38:14/Then King Zedekiah sent for Jeremiah the prophet and had him brought to the third entrance to the temple of the LORD. "I have something to ask you," the king said to Jeremiah. "Do not hide anything from me."
24:38:15/Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, "If I tell you, won't you surely kill me? And if I give you advice, you won't listen to me anyway."
24:38:16/So King Zedekiah secretly promised Jeremiah, "As the LORD lives, who gave us our lives, I will not kill you or hand you over to those who are seeking your life."
24:38:17/Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, "This is what the LORD, the God of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: If you surrender to the officials of the king of Babylon, your life will be spared, and this city will not be burned down; you and your family will live.
