24:38:18/But if you do not surrender to the officials of the king of Babylon, this city will be handed over to the Babylonians, and they will burn it down, and you will not escape from them."
24:38:19/And Zedekiah the king said to Jeremiah, "I am afraid of the Judeans who have defected to the Babylonians, for fear they might hand me over to them and they will mock me."
24:38:20/But Jeremiah said, "They will not hand you over. Please, obey the LORD in what I am telling you, so it will go well for you, and your life will be spared.
24:38:21/But if you refuse to surrender, this is what the LORD has revealed to me:
24:38:22/All the women remaining in the palace of the king of Judah will be brought out to the officials of the king of Babylon. Those women will say, 'Your close friends have misled you and have overcome you. Your feet are stuck in the mud, and they have turned away from you.'
24:38:23/All your wives and children will be brought out to the Babylonians, and you will not escape from their hands but will be captured by the king of Babylon. And this city will be burned down."
24:38:24/Then Zedekiah said to Jeremiah, "Let no one know about these conversations, and you will not die.
24:38:25/If the officials hear that I've talked with you and they come to you and say, 'Tell us what you said to the king and what the king said to you; do not hide it from us, and we will not kill you,'
24:38:26/then you should tell them, 'I was presenting my petition to the king not to send me back to Jonathan's house to die there.'"
24:38:27/All the officials came to Jeremiah and questioned him, and he told them everything the king had ordered him to say. So they stopped questioning him, for the conversation had not been overheard.
24:38:28/So Jeremiah stayed in the prison courtyard until the day Jerusalem was captured. He was there when Jerusalem was taken.
24:39:1/In the ninth year of Zedekiah's reign over Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, and his entire army attacked Jerusalem and laid siege to it.
24:39:2/And in the eleventh year of Zedekiah, in the fourth month, on the ninth day of the month, the city's defenses were breached.
24:39:3/All the high-ranking officials of the king of Babylon entered and took their places at the central gate, including Nergalsharezer, Samgarnebo, Sarsechim, Rabsaris, Nergalsharezer, Rabmag, along with all the other Babylonian officials.
24:39:4/When Zedekiah, the king of Judah, saw them and all the soldiers, they fled, escaping the city at night through the king’s garden and the gate between the two walls, heading toward the plain.
24:39:5/However, the Babylonian army chased them and caught up with Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho. After capturing him, they took him to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, at Riblah in the land of Hamath, where he passed judgment on him.
24:39:6/Then the king of Babylon executed Zedekiah's sons in Riblah right before his eyes. He also killed all the leaders of Judah.
24:39:7/Moreover, he blinded Zedekiah and bound him with chains to take him to Babylon.
24:39:8/The Babylonians set fire to the royal palace and the houses of the people, and they demolished the walls of Jerusalem.
24:39:9/Then Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, took into exile to Babylon the remaining people in the city, those who had defected to him, and the rest of the population.
24:39:10/But Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, left behind the poorest people, who owned nothing, in the land of Judah, and at the same time gave them vineyards and fields.
24:39:11/Now Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, gave orders about Jeremiah to Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, saying,
24:39:12/"Take him, ensure his well-being, and do him no harm; but do as he asks of you."
24:39:13/So Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, sent, along with Nebushasban, Rabsaris, Nergalsharezer, Rabmag, and all the high officials of the king of Babylon;
24:39:14/They took Jeremiah from the courtyard of the guard and handed him over to Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, to take him home. So he lived among the people.
24:39:15/While Jeremiah was confined in the courtyard of the guard, the word of the LORD came to him, saying,
24:39:16/"Go and tell Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, 'This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: I am about to fulfill my words against this city for harm and not for good, and they will happen before you on that day.'
24:39:17/But I will rescue you on that day, declares the LORD, and you will not be handed over to the men you fear.
24:39:18/For I will surely save you, and you will not fall by the sword, but your life will be spared because you have trusted in me, declares the LORD."
24:40:1/The message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, after Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, had released him from Ramah. He had been taken there in chains along with all the others from Jerusalem and Judah who were being exiled to Babylon.
24:40:2/And the captain of the guard took Jeremiah aside and told him, "The LORD your God has declared this disaster on this place."
24:40:3/Now the LORD has brought it to pass, just as he said, because you sinned against the LORD and did not listen to his voice. This is why this disaster has happened to you.
24:40:4/And now, today, I am freeing you from the chains on your hands. If you want to come with me to Babylon, you're welcome to do so, and I'll take good care of you. But if you don't want to come to Babylon, that's fine too. Look, the whole land is in front of you; go wherever you think is best and most convenient for you."
24:40:5/Before he left, he also said, "Go back to Gedaliah, son of Ahikam and grandson of Shaphan, whom the king of Babylon has appointed as governor over the cities of Judah. Stay with him among the people, or go anywhere else you think is convenient." Then the captain of the guard gave him some food and a gift and let him go.
24:40:6/So Jeremiah went to Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, at Mizpah and stayed with him among the people who were left in the land.
24:40:7/When all the army officers and their men who were still in the open country heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, as governor over the land and had put under his care men, women, children, and the poorest people of the land who had not been exiled to Babylon,
24:40:8/they came to Gedaliah at Mizpah. This group included Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, Johanan and Jonathan, sons of Kareah, Seraiah, son of Tanhumeth, the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah, son of a Maachathite, along with their men.
24:40:9/And Gedaliah, son of Ahikam and grandson of Shaphan, assured them and their men, saying, "Do not be afraid to serve the Babylonians. Stay in the land, serve the king of Babylon, and it will go well with you."
24:40:10/As for me, I will stay at Mizpah to represent you before the Babylonians who come to us. But you, gather wine, summer fruits, and oil, store them in your containers, and live in the cities you have taken over."
24:40:11/Also, when all the Jews who were in Moab, among the Ammonites, in Edom, and in all the other countries heard that the king of Babylon had left a remnant in Judah and had appointed Gedaliah, son of Ahikam and grandson of Shaphan, over them,
24:40:12/all the Jews returned from all the places to which they had been scattered and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah at Mizpah. They harvested a great amount of wine and summer fruits.
24:40:13/Moreover, Johanan, son of Kareah, and all the army officers who were in the open country came to Gedaliah at Mizpah
24:40:14/and warned him, "Do you know for sure that Baalis, the king of the Ammonites, has sent Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, to kill you?" But Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, did not believe them.
24:40:15/Then Johanan, son of Kareah, spoke to Gedaliah in Mizpah in private, saying, "Let me go and kill Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, and no one will know. Why should he assassinate you and cause all the Jews who have gathered around you to scatter, and the remnant of Judah to perish?"
24:40:16/But Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, said to Johanan, son of Kareah, "Do not do this. You are spreading lies about Ishmael."
24:41:1/In the seventh month, Ishmael, son of Nethaniah and grandson of Elishama, who was of royal descent, along with ten princes, visited Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, in Mizpah. There, they shared a meal together in Mizpah.
24:41:2/Then Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, and the ten men with him stood up and attacked Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, with a sword, killing him. Gedaliah had been appointed governor over the land by the king of Babylon.
24:41:3/Ishmael also killed all the Jews who were with him and Gedaliah in Mizpah, as well as the Babylonian soldiers found there, and the warriors.
24:41:4/The day after he killed Gedaliah, nobody knew about it.
24:41:5/Some men from Shechem, Shiloh, and Samaria, eighty in total, came with shaved beards, torn clothes, and self-inflicted wounds, carrying offerings and incense to present at the LORD's house.
24:41:6/Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, left Mizpah to greet them, crying as he went. When he met them, he invited them to see Gedaliah, son of Ahikam.
24:41:7/When they arrived in the city, Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, and his men killed them and threw their bodies into a pit.
24:41:8/However, ten men among them pleaded with Ishmael, saying they had hidden stores of wheat, barley, oil, and honey in the fields. So he spared their lives and didn't kill them with their brothers.
24:41:9/The pit where Ishmael threw the bodies of the men he killed because of Gedaliah was originally dug by King Asa as a defense against Baasha, king of Israel. Ishmael filled it with the slain.
24:41:10/Then Ishmael took captive all the remaining people in Mizpah, including the king's daughters and everyone else Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, had left with Gedaliah. Ishmael took them captive and set off to go to the Ammonites.
24:41:11/But when Johanan, son of Kareah, and all the military commanders with him heard about all the evil Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, had done,
24:41:12/They gathered their forces and went to confront Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, finding him near the large pool in Gibeon.
24:41:13/When all the people with Ishmael saw Johanan, son of Kareah, and the military commanders with him, they were relieved.
24:41:14/So all the people Ishmael had taken from Mizpah turned around, went back, and joined Johanan, son of Kareah.
24:41:15/But Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, managed to escape from Johanan with eight men and fled to the Ammonites.
24:41:16/Johanan, son of Kareah, and all the military commanders with him took all the survivors they had rescued from Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah after he had killed Gedaliah, son of Ahikam. This included warriors, women, children, and eunuchs they had brought back from Gibeon.
24:41:17/They left and settled in Chimham near Bethlehem, planning to go to Egypt,
24:41:18/Because they were afraid of the Babylonians, since Ishmael, son of Nethaniah, had killed Gedaliah, son of Ahikam, whom the king of Babylon had appointed as governor over the land.
24:42:1/Then all the military leaders, Johanan the son of Kareah, Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the least to the greatest, approached,
24:42:2/And said to Jeremiah the prophet, "Please, let our plea be heard by you, and pray to the LORD your God for us, for all of us who remain; (we are only a few left from many, as you can see with your own eyes:)"
24:42:3/"So that the LORD your God may show us the way we should go, and what we should do."
24:42:4/Then Jeremiah the prophet told them, "I have heard you; look, I will pray to the LORD your God as you have requested; and whatever the LORD answers, I will tell you; I will not withhold anything from you."
24:42:5/Then they said to Jeremiah, "May the LORD be a true and faithful witness against us if we do not act according to everything the LORD your God sends you to tell us."
24:42:6/Whether it is good or bad, we will listen to the voice of the LORD our God, to whom we are sending you; so that it may go well with us when we listen to the voice of the LORD our God."
24:42:7/And after ten days, the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah.
24:42:8/Then he called Johanan the son of Kareah, all the military leaders who were with him, and all the people from the least to the greatest,
24:42:9/And said to them, "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, to whom you sent me to present your plea, says;"
24:42:10/"If you stay in this land, then I will build you up and not tear you down, I will plant you and not uproot you: for I regret the harm I have done to you."
24:42:11/"Do not be afraid of the king of Babylon, whom you are now afraid of; do not fear him, says the LORD: for I am with you to save you and deliver you from his hand."
24:42:12/"And I will show you mercy, so that he may have mercy on you and allow you to return to your own land."
24:42:13/"But if you say, 'We will not live in this land,' refusing to listen to the voice of the LORD your God,"
24:42:14/"Saying, 'No, but we will go to the land of Egypt, where we will not see war, nor hear the sound of the trumpet, nor be hungry for bread; and there we will live:'"
24:42:15/"Now therefore hear the word of the LORD, you remnant of Judah; This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says; If you are determined to go to Egypt and you do go to live there;"
24:42:16/"Then the sword, which you fear, will overtake you there in the land of Egypt, and the famine you are worried about will follow closely after you there in Egypt; and there you will die."
24:42:17/"So will it happen to all the men who decide to go to Egypt to live there; they will die by the sword, by famine, and by disease: and none of them will survive or escape the disaster I will bring upon them."
24:42:18/"For this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says; As my anger and wrath have been poured out on the inhabitants of Jerusalem; so will my wrath be poured out on you when you enter Egypt. You will become an object of horror, a curse, and ridicule; and you will never see this place again."
24:42:19/"The LORD has told you, O remnant of Judah; Do not go into Egypt. Know for certain that I have warned you today."
24:42:20/"For you were deceitful in your hearts when you sent me to the LORD your God, saying, 'Pray to the LORD our God for us; and whatever the LORD our God says, tell us, and we will do it.'"
24:42:21/"And now I have told you today; but you have not listened to the voice of the LORD your God or to anything he has sent me to tell you."
24:42:22/"Now therefore know for certain that you will die by the sword, by famine, and by disease in the place where you want to go and live."
24:43:1/After Jeremiah finished delivering all the words of the LORD their God to the people, words that the LORD their God had sent him to share, all of these words,
24:43:2/Azariah son of Hoshaiah, Johanan son of Kareah, and all the arrogant men responded to Jeremiah, saying, "You're lying: the LORD our God didn't send you to tell us not to go to Egypt to live there:
24:43:3/But it's Baruch son of Neriah who's pushing you against us, to hand us over to the Chaldeans, so they might kill us or take us as prisoners to Babylon."
24:43:4/So Johanan son of Kareah, all the military commanders, and all the people didn't listen to the LORD's command to stay in the land of Judah.
24:43:5/Instead, Johanan son of Kareah and all the military commanders took all the remaining people of Judah, who had come back from the nations where they had been scattered, to live in the land of Judah;
24:43:6/This included men, women, children, the king's daughters, and everyone else Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, along with Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch son of Neriah.
24:43:7/So they entered the land of Egypt because they didn't listen to the LORD's command, and they went as far as Tahpanhes.
24:43:8/Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,
24:43:9/"Take large stones in your hand, and hide them in the clay in the brick kiln at the entrance to Pharaoh's palace in Tahpanhes, in view of the men of Judah;
24:43:10/And tell them, 'This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: Look, I will send for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, my servant, and I will place his throne over these stones I have hidden; and he will set up his royal tent over them.
24:43:11/When he arrives, he will strike the land of Egypt, giving those destined for death to death, those for captivity to captivity, and those for the sword to the sword.
24:43:12/And I will set fire to the temples of the Egyptian gods; he will burn them and take them captive: and he will claim the land of Egypt as his own, as a shepherd wears his cloak; and he will leave there peacefully.
24:43:13/He will also destroy the idols of Bethshemesh in the land of Egypt; and the temples of the Egyptian gods he will burn with fire.
24:44:1/The message that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Jews living in Egypt, in Migdol, Tahpanhes, Noph, and the region of Pathros, was:
24:44:2/This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: You have witnessed all the disaster I brought on Jerusalem and all the cities of Judah; today, they are ruins, uninhabited.
24:44:3/Because of their evil deeds that provoked me to anger—burning incense and worshiping gods unknown to them, their ancestors, or you.
24:44:4/Yet, I consistently sent you all my prophets, who tirelessly said, 'Do not commit this detestable act I despise.'
24:44:5/But they did not listen or pay attention, refusing to turn from their wickedness and stop burning incense to other gods.
24:44:6/Therefore, my fury and anger were unleashed, scorching the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem; they are now desolate and empty.
24:44:7/So now, the LORD, the God of hosts, the God of Israel, asks: Why do you commit such a great evil against yourselves, ensuring the destruction of men, women, children, and infants from Judah, leaving none to survive?
24:44:8/By provoking me with the work of your hands, burning incense to other gods in Egypt where you've chosen to live, you're cutting yourselves off, becoming a curse and an object of ridicule among all nations.
24:44:9/Have you forgotten the sins of your ancestors, the kings of Judah, their wives, your own sins, and those of your wives, committed in Judah and the streets of Jerusalem?
24:44:10/To this day, they remain unrepentant, not fearing me or following my laws and decrees that I set before you and your ancestors.
24:44:11/Therefore, this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: I am determined to bring disaster on you and to eliminate all of Judah.
24:44:12/I will take the remnant of Judah who decided to go to Egypt to live, and they will all perish, falling by the sword and famine until they are completely gone.
24:44:13/I will punish those living in Egypt as I punished Jerusalem, with the sword, famine, and disease.
24:44:14/None of the survivors of Judah who went to Egypt will escape or survive to return to Judah, where they long to return and live; only a few will manage to return.
24:44:15/Then all the men who knew their wives had burned incense to other gods, along with all the women standing by—a large assembly—and all the people living in Egypt, in Pathros, responded to Jeremiah, saying,
24:44:16/Regarding the message you have spoken to us in the name of the LORD, we will not listen to you.
24:44:17/Instead, we will do everything we have vowed to do: burn incense to the queen of heaven and pour out drink offerings to her, just as we, our ancestors, our kings, and our officials did in the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem. For then we had plenty of food, were prosperous, and saw no misfortune.
24:44:18/But ever since we stopped burning incense to the queen of heaven and pouring out drink offerings to her, we have lacked everything and have been perishing by sword and famine.
24:44:19/And when we burned incense to the queen of heaven and poured out drink offerings to her, was it without our husbands' knowledge that we made cakes for her worship and poured out drink offerings to her?
24:44:20/Then Jeremiah said to all the people, both men and women, and to all the people who had given him that answer,
24:44:21/Did not the LORD remember and consider the incense you burned in the cities of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem, you, your ancestors, your kings, your officials, and the people of the land?
24:44:22/The LORD could no longer endure your wicked actions and the detestable things you did; so your land became a ruin, a desolation, and a curse, uninhabited as it is today.
24:44:23/Because you burned incense and sinned against the LORD, not obeying the LORD's voice or living by his law, statutes, or testimonies, this disaster has happened to you, as it is today.
24:44:24/Moreover, Jeremiah said to all the people, including the women, "Listen to the word of the LORD, all you of Judah who are in Egypt:
24:44:25/This is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: You and your wives have both spoken and acted on your vows, saying, 'We will surely keep our vows to burn incense to the queen of heaven and pour out drink offerings to her.' You will indeed keep your vows and carry them out.
24:44:26/Therefore, listen to the word of the LORD, all you of Judah living in Egypt: I swear by my great name, says the LORD, that my name will no longer be invoked by anyone from Judah in all the land of Egypt, saying, 'As the Lord GOD lives.'
24:44:27/I am watching over them for harm, not for good; all the men of Judah in Egypt will perish by the sword and famine until they are completely gone.
24:44:28/Yet a small number who escape the sword will return from Egypt to Judah, and all the remnant of Judah who went to Egypt to live there will know whose word will stand—mine or theirs.
24:44:29/And this will be a sign to you, declares the LORD, that I will punish you in this place, so you will know that my words will surely stand against you for harm:
24:44:30/This is what the LORD says: I will hand over Pharaoh Hophra, king of Egypt, to his enemies and to those seeking his life, just as I handed over Zedekiah king of Judah to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, his enemy who was seeking his life.
24:45:1/The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the instruction of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, saying,
24:45:2/This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says to you, O Baruch:
24:45:3/You said, "Woe is me now! For the LORD has added grief to my sorrow; I am worn out from my sighing, and I find no rest."
24:45:4/Tell him this, 'The LORD says: Look, what I have built I will tear down, and what I have planted I will uproot, this entire land included.
24:45:5/Are you seeking great things for yourself? Don't pursue them: for, look, I am going to bring disaster on all people, says the LORD: but I will let you keep your life as a prize wherever you go.
24:46:1/The message from the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations;
24:46:2/Regarding Egypt, against the army of Pharaoh Necho king of Egypt, which was by the Euphrates River in Carchemish, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon defeated in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah.
24:46:3/Prepare the shield and buckler, and advance for battle.
24:46:4/Ready the horses; mount up, horsemen, and take your positions with helmets on; polish the spears, and put on the armor.
24:46:5/Why have I seen them terrified and turning back? Their warriors are defeated, fleeing swiftly without looking back, because terror is all around, says the LORD.
24:46:6/Do not let the swift escape nor the strong man survive; they will stumble and fall near the north by the Euphrates River.
24:46:7/Who is this rising like the Nile, with waters surging like rivers?
24:46:8/Egypt rises like the Nile, its waters surging like rivers, saying, 'I will rise and cover the earth; I will destroy cities and their inhabitants.'
24:46:9/Charge, horses; drive furiously, chariots; let the warriors come forth; the Ethiopians and Libyans who carry shields; and the Lydians who draw the bow.
24:46:10/For this is the day of the Lord GOD of hosts, a day of vengeance, to avenge Himself on His foes. The sword will devour and be satisfied, drenched with their blood, for the Lord GOD of hosts has a sacrifice in the north country by the Euphrates River.
24:46:11/Go up to Gilead and get balm, O virgin daughter of Egypt. In vain you use many medicines; there is no healing for you.
24:46:12/The nations have heard of your disgrace, and your cry fills the earth. One warrior stumbles over another, and both fall down together.
24:46:13/The message that the LORD spoke to Jeremiah the prophet about how Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon would come and strike the land of Egypt.
24:46:14/Announce in Egypt, proclaim in Migdol, proclaim in Memphis and Tahpanhes: 'Take your positions and prepare, for the sword devours all around you.'
24:46:15/Why have your warriors been swept away? They did not stand because the LORD drove them away.
24:46:16/He made many fall; indeed, one fell upon another. They said, 'Get up, let's go back to our own people and to the land of our birth, away from the sword of the oppressor.'
24:46:17/There they exclaimed, 'Pharaoh king of Egypt is only a loud noise; he has missed his opportunity.'
24:46:18/As surely as I live, declares the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts, 'Just as Tabor is among the mountains and Carmel by the sea, so will he come.'
24:46:19/O daughter dwelling in Egypt, prepare yourself to go into exile; for Memphis will become a desolation, uninhabited.
24:46:20/Egypt is like a beautiful heifer, but a biting fly is coming from the north—it is coming!
24:46:21/Also her mercenaries in her midst are like fattened calves; for they too will turn and flee together, they will not stand their ground, for the day of their calamity has come upon them, the time of their punishment.
24:46:22/Its sound moves like a snake; for they will march with an army and come against her with axes, like those who chop wood.
24:46:23/They will chop down her forest, declares the LORD, though it cannot be searched, because they are more numerous than locusts, and are innumerable.
24:46:24/The daughter of Egypt will be put to shame; she will be handed over to the people of the north.
24:46:25/The LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says; 'Look, I am about to punish Amon of Thebes, Pharaoh, Egypt, its gods and kings, Pharaoh and those who trust in him.
24:46:26/And I will hand them over to those who seek their lives, to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and his officers. But afterward, it will be inhabited as in the past, declares the LORD.
24:46:27/But do not fear, O my servant Jacob, and do not be dismayed, O Israel. For see, I will save you from a distant place, and your descendants from the land of their captivity. Jacob will return and have peace and security, and no one will make him afraid.
24:46:28/Do not fear, O Jacob my servant, declares the LORD, for I am with you. I will make a complete end of all the nations where I have scattered you, but I will not make a complete end of you. I will discipline you justly, but will not leave you unpunished.
24:47:1/The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines, before Pharaoh attacked Gaza.
24:47:2/This is what the LORD says; Look, waters are rising from the north, becoming an overflowing flood, and will inundate the land and everything in it; the city, and those living in it will be overwhelmed: then people will scream, and all the residents of the land will wail.
24:47:3/Amid the sound of the stomping hooves of his mighty horses, the rush of his chariots, and the roar of his wheels, parents will not turn back to their children because their hands are too weak;
24:47:4/Because of the day that is coming to destroy all the Philistines, and to eliminate every ally of Tyre and Sidon: for the LORD will devastate the Philistines, the survivors from the land of Caphtor.
24:47:5/Baldness has come upon Gaza; Ashkelon is destroyed along with the last of their valley: how long will you inflict wounds on yourself?
24:47:6/O sword of the LORD, how long until you are silent? Return to your sheath, rest, and be still.
24:47:7/How can it be still, when the LORD has commanded it against Ashkelon and the seashore? There it has been directed.
24:48:1/This is what the LORD Almighty, the God of Israel, says about Moab: Disaster is coming for Nebo—it's already ruined. Kiriathaim is captured and shamed; Misgab is shattered and terrified.
24:48:2/Moab will no longer be praised. In Heshbon, they plot its downfall, saying, 'Let's erase it as a nation.' You too, Madmen, will be silenced; the sword is on your trail.
24:48:3/Screams of panic come from Horonaim, cries of great destruction and ruin.
24:48:4/Moab is shattered; the cries of its little ones echo far and wide.
24:48:5/As people climb the slope to Luhith, they weep continuously; on the road down to Horonaim, cries of distress over the destruction are heard.
24:48:6/Run for your lives, save yourselves, and be like a desert shrub.
24:48:7/Because you trusted in your achievements and treasures, you too will be captured, and Chemosh will go into exile, along with his priests and officials.
24:48:8/The destroyer will come upon every town, and no town will escape. The valley will be ruined, and the plateau destroyed, as the LORD has said.
24:48:9/Give Moab wings so it can fly away, for its towns will be left empty, with no one to live in them.
24:48:10/Cursed is the one who does the LORD's work deceitfully, and cursed is the one who holds back their sword from bloodshed.
24:48:11/Moab has been at ease from its youth, like wine left to settle undisturbed, not poured from jar to jar. So it remained the same, its flavor unchanged.
24:48:12/But the time is coming, says the LORD, when I will send those who will tip it over, empty its jars, and smash its jugs.
24:48:13/Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh, just as the house of Israel was ashamed when they trusted in Bethel.
24:48:14/How can you claim, 'We are warriors, battle-hardened heroes'?
24:48:15/Moab is ruined, its towns ascended by invaders, its finest young men slaughtered, declares the King, the LORD Almighty.
24:48:16/The end of Moab is near; its disaster hurries on.
24:48:17/Mourn for it, all who live around it, all who know its fame. Ask, 'How has the mighty scepter been broken, the glorious staff!'
24:48:18/Come down from your glory, Dibon, and sit in thirst, for the destroyer of Moab will attack you, destroying your strongholds.
24:48:19/You who live in Aroer, stand by the road and watch. Ask those fleeing and those escaping, 'What has happened?'
24:48:20/Moab is humiliated, for it is shattered. Wail and cry out! Announce by the Arnon that Moab is destroyed.
24:48:21/Judgment has come to the plateau—to Holon, Jahazah, Mephaath,
24:48:22/Dibon, Nebo, Bethdiblathaim,
24:48:23/Kiriathaim, Bethgamul, Bethmeon,
24:48:24/Kerioth, Bozrah, and all the towns of the land of Moab, far and near.
24:48:25/Moab's power is cut off, and its arm is broken, says the LORD.
24:48:26/Make Moab drunk, for it has boasted against the LORD. Moab will wallow in its vomit, and it too will be ridiculed.
24:48:27/Wasn't Israel a joke to you? Was he caught among thieves, that you shake your head in scorn whenever you talk about him?
24:48:28/Abandon the towns and dwell among the rocks, you residents of Moab. Be like a dove that nests at the entrance of a cave.
24:48:29/We have heard of Moab's pride—how very proud he is—of his arrogance, his pride, and his haughtiness of heart.
24:48:30/I know his fury, says the LORD, but it is futile; his idle boasts have accomplished nothing.
24:48:31/So I wail for Moab, I cry out for all Moab; I mourn for the men of Kirheres.
24:48:32/I weep for you as Jazer weeps, O vine of Sibmah. Your branches spread as far as the sea; they reached to the sea of Jazer. The destroyer has fallen on your summer fruits and grape harvest.
24:48:33/Joy and gladness are taken away from the fertile fields and from the land of Moab. I have stopped the flow of wine from the presses; no one treads them with shouts of joy. The shouting is not the shout of joy.
24:48:34/From the cry of Heshbon to Elealeh to Jahaz, they raise their voices, from Zoar to Horonaim to the third year heifer. Even the waters of Nimrim are dried up.
24:48:35/I will stop in Moab, says the LORD, the one who offers sacrifices on the high places and burns incense to his gods.
24:48:36/Therefore, my heart laments for Moab like a flute; it laments like a flute for the men of Kirheres. The wealth they acquired has perished.
24:48:37/Every head is shaved, every beard cut off; on all hands are cuts, and around the waist is sackcloth.
24:48:38/On all the rooftops of Moab and in its streets, there is mourning everywhere, for I have broken Moab like a jar that no one wants, says the LORD.
24:48:39/They wail, 'How it is broken! How Moab turns its back in shame!' So Moab has become an object of ridicule and horror to all those around it.
24:48:40/This is what the LORD says: Look! An eagle swoops down, spreading its wings over Moab.
24:48:41/Kerioth is captured, the strongholds are taken, and the hearts of Moab's warriors on that day will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
24:48:42/Moab will be destroyed and no longer be a nation, because it boasted against the LORD.
24:48:43/Fear, the pit, and the snare await you, resident of Moab, says the LORD.
24:48:44/Anyone who flees from the fear will fall into the pit, and anyone who climbs out of the pit will be caught in the snare. For I will bring upon Moab the year of their punishment, says the LORD.
24:48:45/Those who fled stand powerless under the shadow of Heshbon, because fire has erupted from Heshbon and flames from the midst of Sihon. It devours the foreheads of Moab, the skulls of the noisy boasters.
24:48:46/Woe to you, Moab! The people of Chemosh are destroyed; your sons are taken into exile, and your daughters into captivity.
24:48:47/Yet, I will restore the fortunes of Moab in the latter days, says the LORD. Here ends the judgment on Moab.
24:49:1/Regarding the Ammonites, this is what the LORD says: Doesn't Israel have any sons? Doesn't he have an heir? Why then does their king take over Gad, and his people live in its towns?
24:49:2/So, look, the time is coming, declares the LORD, when I will sound the alarm of war in Rabbah of the Ammonites; it will become a desolate mound, and its villages will be set on fire: then Israel will inherit those who inherited him, says the LORD.
24:49:3/Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai is ruined: cry out, you daughters of Rabbah, dress in mourning clothes; weep, and pace back and forth by the fences; because their king will go into exile, along with his priests and officials.
24:49:4/Why do you boast about your valleys, your fertile valley, O unfaithful daughter? You trust in your riches, saying, 'Who will come against me?'
24:49:5/Look, I am bringing terror on you, declares the Lord, the LORD of hosts, from all those around you; you will be driven out, each one straight ahead, with no one to gather the fugitives.
24:49:6/And later, I will restore the fortunes of the Ammonites, declares the LORD.
24:49:7/Regarding Edom, this is what the LORD of hosts says; Has wisdom vanished from Teman? Has counsel disappeared from the wise? Has their wisdom evaporated?
24:49:8/Run away, turn back, hide deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring disaster on Esau at the time I punish him.
24:49:9/If grape pickers came to you, wouldn't they leave a few grapes? If thieves came at night, they would destroy only until they had enough.
24:49:10/But I have stripped Esau bare, I have uncovered his hiding places, and he will not be able to conceal himself: his offspring is destroyed, along with his brothers and neighbors, and he is no more.
24:49:11/Leave your orphans; I will keep them alive; and let your widows trust in me.
24:49:12/For this is what the LORD says: Look, those who were not destined to drink the cup will certainly drink it; and are you the one who will go unpunished? You will not go unpunished, but you will surely drink it.
24:49:13/For I have sworn by myself, declares the LORD, that Bozrah will become a ruin, a disgrace, a waste, and a curse; and all its cities will be perpetual ruins.
24:49:14/I have heard a message from the LORD, and an envoy has been sent to the nations, saying, 'Gather together, come against her, and rise up for battle.'
24:49:15/For, look, I will make you small among the nations, and despised among people.
24:49:16/Your own terror has deceived you, and the pride of your heart, you who live in the clefts of the rocks, who hold the height of the hill: though you make your nest as high as the eagle, I will bring you down from there, says the LORD.
24:49:17/Also, Edom will become a wasteland: everyone who passes by it will be shocked and scoff at all its wounds.
24:49:18/Just as in the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring towns, says the LORD, no one will live there, no person will dwell in it.
24:49:19/Look, he will come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan to the lush pastureland: but in an instant I will make him run away from it. And who is the chosen one I will appoint for it? For who is like me? Who will summon me to court? And who is that shepherd who can stand before me?
24:49:20/Therefore, listen to the LORD's plan that he has devised against Edom, and his intentions that he has planned against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the little ones of the flock will drag them away; surely their pasture will be desolate because of them.
24:49:21/The earth trembles at the sound of their fall; at their cry, the noise is heard at the Red Sea.
24:49:22/Look, he will soar like an eagle and spread his wings over Bozrah: and on that day, the hearts of Edom's warriors will be like the heart of a woman in labor.
24:49:23/Regarding Damascus. Hamath and Arpad are dismayed, for they have heard bad news; they are disheartened, troubled like the restless sea.
24:49:24/Damascus has become weak, she turns to flee, and panic has gripped her; distress and pains have seized her, like a woman in labor.
24:49:25/How the city of renown is not deserted, the city of my joy!
24:49:26/Therefore, her young men will fall in her streets, and all her soldiers will be silenced in that day, says the LORD of hosts.
24:49:27/And I will ignite a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it will consume the fortresses of Ben-Hadad.
24:49:28/Regarding Kedar, and the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon will strike, this is what the LORD says: Rise up, advance against Kedar, and destroy the people of the East.
24:49:29/Their tents and their flocks will be taken; their curtains, all their goods, and their camels will be carried off. They will cry out to them, 'Terror on every side!'
24:49:30/Run, flee far away, hide deep, O inhabitants of Hazor, says the LORD; for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has made plans against you and has conceived a strategy against you.
24:49:31/Rise up, advance against a nation at ease, that lives securely, says the LORD, a nation that has neither gates nor bars, living alone.
24:49:32/Their camels will become plunder, and their vast herds will be spoils. I will scatter to the winds those who are in distant places and bring disaster from every side, says the LORD.
24:49:33/And Hazor will become a dwelling for jackals, a desolation forever; no one will live there, nor will any person dwell in it.
24:49:34/The word of the LORD that came to Jeremiah the prophet against Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah, saying,
24:49:35/This is what the LORD of hosts says: Look, I will break the bow of Elam, the mainstay of their might.
24:49:36/And upon Elam, I will bring the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; there will be no nation where Elam's exiles will not go.
24:49:37/For I will terrify Elam before their enemies and before those who seek their life; I will bring disaster upon them, my fierce anger, says the LORD; and I will send the sword after them until I have finished them off.
24:49:38/And I will set my throne in Elam, and will destroy from there the king and the officials, says the LORD.
24:49:39/But it will happen in the latter days, that I will restore the fortunes of Elam, says the LORD.
24:50:1/The message that the LORD delivered regarding Babylon and the land of the Chaldeans through the prophet Jeremiah.
24:50:2/Announce to the nations, proclaim it widely, raise a flag to signal; do not hide it: say, Babylon has been captured, Bel is humiliated, Merodach is shattered; her idols are disgraced, her statues are smashed.
24:50:3/A nation from the north will attack her, turning her land into a wasteland where no one lives; people and animals will flee.
24:50:4/In that time, says the LORD, the people of Israel and Judah will come together, mourning as they seek the LORD their God.
24:50:5/They will ask for directions to Zion, looking forward to joining the LORD in an everlasting covenant that will never be forgotten.
24:50:6/My people have been like lost sheep; their leaders have led them astray, causing them to wander from mountain to hill, forgetting their resting place.
24:50:7/Everyone who found them has preyed on them, and their enemies argued, "We are not guilty, because they sinned against the LORD, their true place of safety, the LORD, the hope of their ancestors."
24:50:8/Leave Babylon, flee from the land of the Chaldeans, and lead the way like rams in front of a flock.
24:50:9/I am about to stir up a great coalition of nations from the north to attack Babylon, and they will take her. Their arrows will not miss, like those of a skilled warrior.
24:50:10/Chaldea will be plundered; all who plunder her will have their fill, says the LORD.
24:50:11/Because you were happy and rejoiced at the destruction of my heritage, because you frolicked like a young cow in the grass and neighed like stallions,
24:50:12/your mother will be deeply ashamed; she who gave you birth will be disgraced. Look, the least of the nations will become a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
24:50:13/Because of the LORD's anger, it will be uninhabited, completely desolate. Everyone who passes by Babylon will be shocked and scoff at all her wounds.
24:50:14/Take up positions around Babylon, all you archers, shoot at her, spare no arrows, for she has sinned against the LORD.
24:50:15/Raise a war cry against her on every side! She surrenders; her towers fall, her walls are torn down. It is the LORD's vengeance, so take vengeance on her; do to her as she has done to others.
24:50:16/Stop the sower from Babylon, and the one who wields the sickle at harvest time. Because of the oppressor's sword, everyone will turn to their own people, flee to their own land.
24:50:17/Israel is like scattered sheep, chased away by lions. First the king of Assyria devoured them, and now King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon has crushed their bones.
24:50:18/Therefore, the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: I will punish the king of Babylon and his land just as I punished the king of Assyria.
24:50:19/And I will bring Israel back to his pasture, where he will graze on Carmel and Bashan, and his appetite will be satisfied on the hills of Ephraim and Gilead.
24:50:20/In those days, at that time, says the LORD, the wrongdoing of Israel will be searched for, but there will be none; and the sins of Judah, but they will not be found, for I will forgive those I preserve.
24:50:21/Attack the land of Merathaim and those living in Pekod. Pursue, kill, and completely destroy them, as I have commanded you, says the LORD.
24:50:22/The sound of battle is in the land, and great destruction.
24:50:23/How the hammer of the whole earth is cut down and broken! How Babylon has become a desolation among the nations!
24:50:24/I set a trap for you, O Babylon, and you were caught before you knew it; you were found and captured because you opposed the LORD.
24:50:25/The LORD has opened his arsenal and brought out the weapons of his wrath, for the Sovereign LORD of hosts has work to do in the land of the Chaldeans.
24:50:26/Come against her from the farthest borders, open her granaries, pile her up like heaps of ruins, and destroy her completely; let nothing of her be left.
24:50:27/Kill all her young bulls; let them go down to the slaughter. Woe to them, for their day has come, the time for their punishment.
24:50:28/The sound of those fleeing and escaping from the land of Babylon declares in Zion the vengeance of the LORD our God, the vengeance for his temple.
24:50:29/Summon archers against Babylon, all who draw the bow. Encamp all around her; let no one escape. Repay her for her deeds; do to her as she has done, for she has been arrogant against the LORD, against the Holy One of Israel.
24:50:30/Therefore, her young men will fall in the streets, and all her soldiers will be silenced in that day, says the LORD.
24:50:31/Behold, I am against you, O arrogant one, says the Lord GOD of hosts, for your day has come, the time when I will punish you.
24:50:32/The arrogant one will stumble and fall, and no one will raise him up. I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it will consume everything around him.
24:50:33/This is what the LORD of hosts says: The people of Israel and Judah have been wronged, and all who took them captive hold them tight; they refuse to let them go.
24:50:34/But their Redeemer is strong; the LORD of hosts is his name. He will vigorously defend their cause so that he may bring rest to their land, but unrest to the inhabitants of Babylon.
24:50:35/A sword is upon the Chaldeans, says the LORD, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon her officials, and upon her wise men.
24:50:36/A sword is upon the liars; they will become fools. A sword is upon her warriors; they will be dismayed.
24:50:37/A sword is upon their horses and chariots and all the foreign troops in her midst; they will become like women. A sword is upon her treasures; they will be plundered.
24:50:38/A drought is upon her waters, and they will dry up. It is a land of idols, and they are insane over their terrifying images.
24:50:39/Therefore, wild animals of the desert will live with the jackals, and ostriches will inhabit it. It will never be inhabited again, nor will it be settled from generation to generation.
24:50:40/As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and their neighboring towns, says the LORD, so no one will live there, nor will any person dwell in it.
24:50:41/Behold, a people is coming from the north; a great nation and many kings are being stirred up from the ends of the earth.
24:50:42/They wield bows and spears; they are cruel and show no mercy. Their sound is like the roaring sea as they ride on horses, arrayed as one man for battle against you, O daughter of Babylon.
24:50:43/The king of Babylon has heard the report about them, and his hands hang limp; distress has seized him, pain like that of a woman in labor.
24:50:44/He will come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan to a secure pasture; but in an instant, I will make them run away from her. Who is the chosen one I will appoint for this? Who is like me? Who will summon me? And what shepherd can stand against me?
24:50:45/Therefore, listen to the LORD's plan that he has devised against Babylon, and his purposes that he has purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely the smallest of the flock will drag them out; surely their pasture will be appalled at them.
24:50:46/At the sound of Babylon's capture, the earth trembles, and a cry is heard among the nations.
24:51:1/The LORD says, "Look, I will bring a destructive wind against Babylon and against those who oppose me from within her.
24:51:2/And I will send to Babylon winnowers who will scatter her and empty her land. In the day of disaster, they will surround her on all sides.
24:51:3/Let the archer draw his bow against those who prepare for battle, and do not spare her young men; completely destroy her entire army.
24:51:4/So the slain will fall in the land of the Chaldeans, and those pierced by swords will lie in her streets.
24:51:5/For Israel and Judah have not been abandoned by their God, the LORD Almighty, even though their land was filled with guilt against the Holy One of Israel.
24:51:6/Escape from the midst of Babylon, and save your lives. Do not be destroyed because of her sins. This is the time for the LORD's vengeance; he will repay her what she deserves.
24:51:7/Babylon was a golden cup in the LORD's hand, making the whole earth drunk. The nations drank her wine; therefore, they have gone mad.
24:51:8/Babylon will suddenly fall and be broken. Wail for her; get balm for her pain, perhaps she can be healed.
24:51:9/We tried to heal Babylon, but she cannot be healed. Abandon her and let us each return to our own country. For her judgment reaches to the skies, it rises as high as the heavens.
24:51:10/The LORD has vindicated us; come, let us tell in Zion what the LORD our God has done.
24:51:11/Sharpen the arrows, take up the shields! The LORD has stirred up the spirit of the kings of the Medes, because his purpose against Babylon is to destroy it, for it is the vengeance of the LORD, the vengeance for his temple.
24:51:12/Raise a banner against the walls of Babylon! Reinforce the guard, station the watchmen, prepare the ambushes! For the LORD has both planned and done what he spoke against the people of Babylon.
24:51:13/You who live by many waters and are rich in treasures, your end has come, the measure of your greed.
24:51:14/The LORD Almighty has sworn by himself: "I will surely fill you with troops, as with swarms of locusts, and they will shout in triumph over you."
24:51:15/He made the earth by his power; he founded the world by his wisdom and stretched out the heavens by his understanding.
24:51:16/When he thunders, the waters in the heavens roar; he makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He sends lightning with the rain and brings out the wind from his storehouses.
24:51:17/Every man is senseless and without knowledge; every goldsmith is shamed by his idols. His images are a fraud; they have no breath in them.
24:51:18/They are worthless, the objects of mockery; when their judgment comes, they will perish.
24:51:19/He who is the Portion of Jacob is not like these, for he is the Maker of all things, including the tribe of his inheritance—the LORD Almighty is his name.
24:51:20/"You are my war club, my weapon for battle— with you I shatter nations, with you I destroy kingdoms,
24:51:21/with you I shatter horse and rider, with you I shatter chariot and driver,
24:51:22/with you I shatter man and woman, with you I shatter old and young, with you I shatter young man and maiden,
24:51:23/with you I shatter shepherd and flock, with you I shatter farmer and oxen, with you I shatter governors and officials.
24:51:24/And I will repay Babylon and all the residents of Chaldea for all the evil they have done in Zion before your very eyes," says the LORD.
24:51:25/"I am against you, you destructive mountain, you who destroy the whole earth," declares the LORD. "I will stretch out my hand against you, roll you off the cliffs, and make you a burned-out mountain.
24:51:26/No rock from you will be taken for a cornerstone, nor any stone for a foundation, for you will be desolate forever," declares the LORD.
24:51:27/Raise a banner in the land, blow the trumpet among the nations, prepare the nations for battle against her, summon against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni and Ashkenaz; appoint a commander against her, bring up horses like a swarm of locusts.
24:51:28/Prepare the nations for battle against her— the kings of the Medes, their governors and all their officials, and all the countries they rule.
24:51:29/The land trembles and writhes in pain, for the LORD's purposes against Babylon stand, to make the land of Babylon a desolation, without inhabitants.
24:51:30/The warriors of Babylon have stopped fighting; they remain in their strongholds. Their strength is exhausted; they have become like women. Her dwellings are set on fire; the bars of her gates are broken.
24:51:31/One courier rushes to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to tell the king of Babylon that his city is captured from end to end,
24:51:32/the river crossings seized, the marshes set on fire, and the soldiers terrified."
24:51:33/For this is what the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says: "The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor at the time it is trampled; the time to harvest her will soon come."
24:51:34/"Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has devoured me, he has crushed me, he has made me an empty vessel, he has swallowed me like a monster, he has filled his belly with my delicacies, he has rinsed me out.
24:51:35/The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon," the inhabitants of Zion will say. "And my blood upon the inhabitants of Chaldea," Jerusalem will say.
24:51:36/Therefore this is what the LORD says: "See, I will defend your cause and avenge you; I will dry up her sea and make her springs dry.
24:51:37/Babylon will be a heap of ruins, a haunt of jackals, an object of horror and scorn, a place where no one lives.
24:51:38/They will roar together like lions, they will growl like lions' cubs.
24:51:39/While they are aroused, I will set out their feasts and make them drunk, so that they shout with laughter, then sleep a perpetual sleep and not wake up," declares the LORD.
24:51:40/"I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams together with goats.
24:51:41/How Sheshach has been captured, the praise of the whole earth seized! How Babylon has become an object of horror among the nations!
24:51:42/The sea has risen over Babylon; she is covered with its tumultuous waves.
24:51:43/Her cities are a desolation, a dry land and a wilderness, a land where no one lives, through which no son of man passes.
24:51:44/And I will punish Bel in Babylon, and I will make him spit out what he has swallowed. The nations will no longer stream to him. Even the wall of Babylon will fall.
24:51:45/My people, go out from her, and save your lives from the fierce anger of the LORD.
24:51:46/But do not lose heart or be afraid at the report heard in the land; one report comes this year, another the next, rumors of violence in the land and of ruler against ruler.
24:51:47/For the time is surely coming when I will punish the idols of Babylon; her whole land will be disgraced, and her slain will all lie fallen within her.
24:51:48/Then heaven and earth and all that is in them will shout for joy over Babylon, for the destroyers will come to her from the north," says the LORD.
24:51:49/Babylon must fall for the slain of Israel, just as for Babylon have fallen the slain of all the earth.
24:51:50/You who have escaped the sword, go, do not linger! Remember the LORD in a distant land, and let Jerusalem come to your mind.
24:51:51/"We are ashamed because we have heard insults; disgrace has covered our faces, for foreigners have entered the holy places of the LORD's house."
24:51:52/"Therefore, behold, the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will execute judgment on her idols, and throughout her land the wounded will groan.
24:51:53/Even if Babylon ascends to the heavens and fortifies her lofty stronghold, I will send destroyers against her," says the LORD.
24:51:54/A cry comes from Babylon, the sound of great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans!
24:51:55/For the LORD is laying Babylon waste and silencing her loud voice. Their waves roar like great waters, the noise of their voices resounds,
24:51:56/for the destroyer has come against her, against Babylon. Her warriors are captured, their bows are broken; for the LORD is a God of retribution, he will surely repay.
24:51:57/I will make her princes and her wise men, her governors, her deputies, and her warriors drunk, and they will sleep a perpetual sleep and not wake up," declares the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts.
24:51:58/This is what the LORD of hosts says: "The wide walls of Babylon will be completely razed, and her high gates will be set on fire; the peoples will labor for nothing, and the nations' efforts will go up in flames and they will be weary."
24:51:59/The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah into Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And this Seraiah was a quiet prince.
24:51:60/So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written against Babylon.
24:51:61/And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, "When you get to Babylon, see that you read all these words aloud;
24:51:62/then say, 'LORD, you have spoken against this place to cut it off, so that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but it shall be desolate forever.'
24:51:63/And when you finish reading this book, tie a stone to it and throw it into the middle of the Euphrates,
24:51:64/and say, 'Thus shall Babylon sink, never to rise again because of the disaster I will bring upon her; and they will be exhausted.'" These are the words of Jeremiah.
24:52:1/Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he ruled for eleven years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah from Libnah.
24:52:2/He did what was evil in the LORD's sight, just as Jehoiakim had done.
24:52:3/Because of the LORD's anger, disaster struck Jerusalem and Judah until he finally banished them from his presence. Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
24:52:4/In the ninth year of his reign, on the tenth day of the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, arrived with his entire army, besieged Jerusalem, and built siege works all around it.
24:52:5/The city was under siege until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
24:52:6/By the ninth day of the fourth month, the famine in the city had become so severe that the people had no food.
24:52:7/Then the city wall was breached, and all the soldiers fled. They left the city at night through the gate between the two walls near the king's garden, while the Babylonians surrounded the city. They fled toward the Arabah.
24:52:8/But the Babylonian army pursued King Zedekiah and caught up with him in the plains of Jericho. His entire army was scattered from him.
24:52:9/They captured the king and brought him to the king of Babylon at Riblah, where they passed sentence on him.
24:52:10/The king of Babylon killed Zedekiah's sons right before his eyes. He also killed all the officials of Judah at Riblah.
24:52:11/Then he blinded Zedekiah, bound him with bronze shackles, and took him to Babylon, where he was imprisoned until the day of his death.
24:52:12/On the tenth day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard and servant of the king of Babylon, entered Jerusalem.
24:52:13/He burned the temple of the LORD, the royal palace, and all the houses of Jerusalem. He set fire to every significant building.
24:52:14/The entire Babylonian army under the captain of the guard tore down all the walls around Jerusalem.
24:52:15/Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, deported some of the poorest people, those who remained in the city, those who had defected to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the craftsmen.
24:52:16/But Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, left some of the poorest people of the land to work the vineyards and fields.
24:52:17/The Babylonians broke the bronze pillars of the LORD's temple, the stands, and the bronze Sea in the temple, and carried the bronze to Babylon.
24:52:18/They also took the pots, shovels, wick trimmers, dishes, and all the bronze articles used in temple service.
24:52:19/The captain of the guard took away the basins, fire pans, sprinkling bowls, pots, lampstands, dishes, and bowls, whether gold or silver.
24:52:20/The two pillars, one Sea, and the twelve bronze bulls under the Sea, which Solomon had made for the LORD's temple, were too heavy to weigh.
24:52:21/Each pillar was eighteen cubits high and twelve cubits in circumference; it was four fingers thick and hollow.
24:52:22/A bronze capital was on top of each pillar. The height of one capital was five cubits, with a network and pomegranates around the capital, all of bronze. The second pillar, with its pomegranates, was similar.
24:52:23/There were ninety-six pomegranates on the sides; the total number of pomegranates around the network was one hundred.
24:52:24/The captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, Zephaniah the second priest, and the three doorkeepers.
24:52:25/He also took from the city an official in charge of the soldiers, seven royal advisers who were found in the city, the secretary of the commander of the army who mustered the people of the land, and sixty men from the people of the land who were found in the city.
24:52:26/Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, took them and brought them to the king of Babylon at Riblah.
24:52:27/And the king of Babylon struck them down and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was taken into exile from its land.
24:52:28/These are the people Nebuchadnezzar took into exile: in the seventh year, 3,023 Jews;
24:52:29/in Nebuchadnezzar's eighteenth year, 832 people from Jerusalem;
24:52:30/in his twenty-third year, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, took 745 Jewish people into exile. The total number of people exiled was 4,600.
24:52:31/On the twenty-fifth day of the twelfth month of the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, Evil-Merodach king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, released Jehoiachin king of Judah from prison.
24:52:32/He spoke kindly to him and gave him a seat of honor higher than those of the other kings who were with him in Babylon.
24:52:33/He changed Jehoiachin's prison clothes, and Jehoiachin dined regularly at the king's table for the rest of his life.
24:52:34/And his daily needs were provided by the king of Babylon, a regular allowance for each day, until the day of his death, for the rest of his life.
25:1:1/How lonely sits the city that was once bustling with people! How has she become like a widow, once great among nations, a princess among provinces, now forced to pay tribute!
25:1:2/She weeps bitterly in the night, tears on her cheeks. Among all her lovers, there is no one to comfort her. All her friends have betrayed her; they have become her enemies.
25:1:3/Judah has been taken into exile due to affliction and harsh labor. She lives among the nations and finds no rest; all her pursuers have caught up with her in tight places.
25:1:4/The roads to Zion mourn because no one comes to the appointed festivals. All her gates are deserted; her priests sigh, her young women grieve, and she is bitter.
25:1:5/Her foes have become the masters, her enemies are at ease. The LORD has made her suffer for her many sins. Her children have gone into exile, led away by the enemy.
25:1:6/All the splendor has departed from Daughter Zion. Her princes are like deer that find no pasture; they are weakened and flee before the pursuer.
25:1:7/In her days of misery and wandering, Jerusalem remembers all the precious things she had in days of old. When her people fell into enemy hands, there was no one to help her. Her enemies looked at her and laughed at her downfall.
25:1:8/Jerusalem has sinned greatly and so has become unclean. All who honored her despise her, for they have seen her nakedness; she herself groans and turns away.
25:1:9/Her uncleanness is in her skirts; she did not consider her future. Her downfall was astonishing; she had no comforter. "O LORD, see my affliction, for the enemy has triumphed."
25:1:10/The enemy laid hands on all her treasures; she saw pagan nations enter her sanctuary—those you had forbidden to enter your assembly.
25:1:11/All her people groan as they search for bread; they trade their treasures for food to keep themselves alive. "Look, LORD, and consider, for I am despised."
25:1:12/Does it mean nothing to you, all who pass by? Look around and see. Is there any suffering like my suffering that was inflicted on me, that the LORD brought on me in his fierce anger?
25:1:13/From on high he sent fire, sent it down into my bones. He spread a net for my feet and turned me back. He made me desolate, faint all the day long.
25:1:14/My sins have been bound into a yoke; by his hands they were woven together. They have been placed on my neck, and the Lord has sapped my strength. He has given me into the hands of those I cannot withstand.
25:1:15/The Lord has rejected all the warriors in my midst; he has summoned an assembly against me to crush my young men. The Lord has trampled the Virgin Daughter of Judah as in a winepress.
25:1:16/For these things I weep; my eyes overflow with tears. No one is near to comfort me, no one to restore my spirit. My children are desolate because the enemy has prevailed.
25:1:17/Zion stretches out her hands, but there is no one to comfort her. The LORD has decreed for Jacob that his neighbors become his foes; Jerusalem has become an unclean thing among them.
25:1:18/The LORD is righteous, yet I rebelled against his command. Listen, all you peoples; look on my suffering. My young men and women have gone into exile.
25:1:19/I called to my allies but they betrayed me. My priests and elders perished in the city while they searched for food to keep themselves alive.
25:1:20/"See, LORD, how distressed I am! I am in torment within, and in my heart I am disturbed, for I have been most rebellious. Outside, the sword bereaves; inside, there is only death.
25:1:21/People have heard my groaning, but there is no one to comfort me. All my enemies have heard of my distress; they are pleased that you have done it. May you bring the day you have announced so they may become like me.
25:1:22/Let all their wickedness come before you; deal with them as you have dealt with me because of all my sins. My groans are many and my heart is faint.
25:2:1/How has the LORD shrouded the daughter of Zion with a cloud in his anger, and hurled down from heaven to earth the splendor of Israel, forgetting his sanctuary in the day of his wrath!
25:2:2/The LORD has devoured all the dwellings of Jacob without mercy; in his fury, he has demolished the fortresses of the daughter of Judah, bringing them to the ground and defiling the kingdom and its leaders.
25:2:3/In his intense anger, he has cut off every power of Israel; he has withdrawn his support in the face of the enemy, and his anger burned against Jacob like a consuming fire, engulfing everything around.
25:2:4/He has drawn his bow like an enemy; he stood ready to attack, killing all who were a delight to the eye in the sanctuary of the daughter of Zion; he unleashed his rage like fire.
25:2:5/The LORD has become an enemy: he has devoured Israel, destroying all her palaces; he has demolished her fortresses and increased mourning and lamentation in the daughter of Judah.
25:2:6/He has forcefully stripped away his sanctuary as if it were a garden; he has ruined his meeting places: the LORD has made the festivals and Sabbaths be forgotten in Zion, and in his fierce anger, he has scorned both king and priest.
25:2:7/The LORD has rejected his altar, detested his sanctuary, and surrendered the walls of her palaces to the enemy; they have raised a clamor in the house of the LORD, as on the day of a festival.
25:2:8/The LORD has resolved to demolish the wall of the daughter of Zion; he has stretched out a measuring line and did not hold back from destruction: thus, he made the ramparts and walls mourn; they wasted away together.
25:2:9/Her gates have sunk into the ground; he has destroyed and shattered her bars: her king and her leaders are exiled among the nations: the law is no more; her prophets no longer receive visions from the LORD.
25:2:10/The elders of the daughter of Zion sit in silence on the ground; they have thrown dust on their heads and dressed in sackcloth: the young women of Jerusalem bow their heads to the ground in despair.
25:2:11/My eyes overflow with tears, my insides churn, my liver spills on the ground, because of the destruction of my people; as infants and babies faint in the city streets.
25:2:12/They ask their mothers, "Where is bread and wine?" as they faint like the wounded in the city streets, their lives ebbing away in their mothers' arms.
25:2:13/What can I say for you? To what can I compare you, O daughter of Jerusalem? What can I liken to you, that I may comfort you, O virgin daughter of Zion? For your breach is vast as the sea; who can heal you?
25:2:14/Your prophets have seen for you false and deceptive visions; they have not exposed your iniquity to restore your fortunes, but have seen for you oracles that are false and misleading.
25:2:15/All who pass by clap their hands at you; they scoff and shake their heads at the daughter of Jerusalem: "Is this the city that was called the perfection of beauty, the joy of the whole earth?"
25:2:16/All your enemies open their mouths wide against you; they scoff and grind their teeth and say, "We have swallowed her up. This is indeed the day we have waited for; we have lived to see it."
25:2:17/The LORD has done what he planned; he has fulfilled his word, which he decreed long ago. He has overthrown without pity; he has let the enemy gloat over you and exalted the horn of your foes.
25:2:18/The hearts of the people cry out to the LORD. O wall of the daughter of Zion, let your tears flow like a river day and night; give yourself no rest, let your eyes not stop weeping.
25:2:19/Get up, cry out in the night, at the start of the night watches; pour out your heart like water in the presence of the LORD. Lift your hands to him for the lives of your children, who faint from hunger at the head of every street.
25:2:20/See, O LORD, and consider! To whom have you done this? Should women eat their offspring, the children they have cared for? Should priest and prophet be killed in the sanctuary of the Lord?
25:2:21/Young and old lie together in the dust of the streets; my young women and young men have fallen by the sword; you have slain them in the day of your anger, slaughtering without pity.
25:2:22/You have summoned as on a festival day my terrors on every side, and on the day of the LORD's anger, no one escaped or survived; those I had cared for and brought up, my enemy has destroyed.

25:4:1/How has the gold lost its shine! How has the purest gold changed! The sacred stones are scattered at the top of every street.
25:4:2/The noble sons of Zion, once worth their weight in fine gold, how are they now considered as mere clay pots, the work of a potter's hands!
25:4:3/Even sea monsters nurse their young, but the daughter of my people has become heartless, like ostriches in the desert.
25:4:4/The infant's tongue sticks to the roof of its mouth from thirst; the children beg for bread, but no one gives them any.
25:4:5/Those who once ate delicacies are now destitute in the streets; those raised in luxury now cling to garbage piles.
25:4:6/The punishment of my people's sin is greater than the punishment of Sodom, which was destroyed in an instant without a hand laid on it.
25:4:7/Her Nazarites were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk, their bodies more radiant than rubies, their appearance as sapphire.
25:4:8/Now their faces are darker than soot; they are not recognized in the streets. Their skin shrinks to their bones; it has become as dry as a stick.
25:4:9/Those killed by the sword are better off than those who die of hunger; the latter pine away, struck down by lack of food.
25:4:10/Compassionate women have cooked their own children; they became their food during the ruin of my people.
25:4:11/The LORD has fulfilled his wrath; he has poured out his fierce anger. He has kindled a fire in Zion that has consumed its foundations.
25:4:12/The kings of the earth and all the world's inhabitants would not have believed that the enemy could enter the gates of Jerusalem.

25:4:16/The LORD's anger has scattered them; he no longer looks upon them. They showed no respect for the priests and did not favor the elders.
25:4:17/As for us, our eyes have failed, looking in vain for help; we have watched for a nation that could not save us.

25:4:19/Our pursuers are faster than eagles in the sky; they chase us over the mountains and lie in wait for us in the desert.

25:5:2/Our heritage has been taken over by strangers, our homes by foreigners.
25:5:3/We are orphans without fathers, our mothers are like widows.
25:5:4/We have to buy our own water to drink; our wood comes at a price.
25:5:5/We are constantly persecuted: we work hard, but find no rest.
25:5:6/We have allied ourselves with the Egyptians and the Assyrians, just to have enough food.
25:5:7/Our ancestors sinned, and are no more; and we are left to bear their punishments.
25:5:8/Slaves have become our masters: there is no one to rescue us from their grip.
25:5:9/We risk our lives just to get our bread, because of the threat of violence in the wilderness.
25:5:10/Our skin is scorched as if by an oven, due to the severe famine.
