25:5:12/Princes were hung by their hands; elders were shown no respect.
25:5:13/Young men were forced to grind grain, and children stumbled under heavy loads.
25:5:14/The elders no longer sit in the city gates, the young men have stopped their music.
25:5:15/The joy in our hearts has ended; our dancing has turned to mourning.
25:5:16/The crown has fallen from our head: woe to us, for we have sinned!
25:5:17/Because of this our hearts are sick; because of these things our eyes grow dim.
25:5:18/On the mountain of Zion, which lies desolate, foxes prowl over it.
25:5:19/You, O LORD, remain forever; your throne endures from generation to generation.
25:5:20/Why do you always forget us, and forsake us for so long?
25:5:21/Bring us back to you, O LORD, and we will return; renew our days as before.
25:5:22/But you have completely rejected us; you are extremely angry with us.
26:1:1/It happened in the thirtieth year, on the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, while I was among the captives by the river of Chebar, that the heavens opened up, and I had visions of God.
26:1:2/On the fifth day of the month, which was the fifth year of King Jehoiachin's captivity,
26:1:3/The word of the LORD came directly to Ezekiel the priest, the son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the river Chebar; and the LORD's hand was upon him there.
26:1:4/As I watched, a whirlwind came from the north, a huge cloud with fire engulfing itself and a brightness around it, and from the center, something that looked like glowing metal, out of the middle of the fire.
26:1:5/From within it came the forms of four living creatures. This was their appearance; they resembled humans.
26:1:6/Each one had four faces, and each one had four wings.
26:1:7/Their legs were straight, and their feet were like the hooves of a calf, shining like polished bronze.
26:1:8/They had human hands under their wings on their four sides; and all four had faces and wings.
26:1:9/Their wings touched one another; they did not turn when they moved, each one went straight forward.
26:1:10/Regarding the appearance of their faces, each of the four had a human face, and on the right side, each had a lion's face, and on the left, an ox's face; all four also had an eagle's face.
26:1:11/That's how their faces looked. Their wings were spread out above; each had two touching another creature and two covering their bodies.
26:1:12/Each one moved straight ahead; wherever the spirit would go, they would go, without turning as they moved.
26:1:13/As for the appearance of the living creatures, they looked like burning coals of fire or like torches. Fire moved back and forth among the creatures, bright, and lightning flashed out of the fire.
26:1:14/And the living creatures darted back and forth like flashes of lightning.
26:1:15/While I was watching the living creatures, I saw one wheel on the ground beside each creature with its four faces.
26:1:16/The appearance of the wheels and their craftsmanship was like sparkling beryl, and all four had the same form. Their appearance and structure were as if one wheel were within another.
26:1:17/When they moved, they went in any of their four directions without turning as they moved.
26:1:18/Their rims were tall and awesome, and the rims of all four were full of eyes all around.
26:1:19/When the living creatures moved, the wheels beside them moved; and when the living creatures were lifted up from the ground, the wheels were lifted up.
26:1:20/Wherever the spirit wanted to go, they went, because there the spirit went; and the wheels were lifted up alongside them, for the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.
26:1:21/When those moved, these moved; when those stood still, these stood still; and when those were lifted up from the ground, the wheels were lifted up alongside them, for the spirit of the living creatures was in the wheels.
26:1:22/Over the heads of the living creatures there was something like a vault, sparkling like ice, stretched out above their heads.
26:1:23/Under the vault, their wings were straight, one toward the other. Each one had two wings covering its body on one side and two covering its body on the other.
26:1:24/When they moved, I heard the sound of their wings like the roar of rushing waters, like the voice of the Almighty, a tumult like the noise of an army. When they stood still, they lowered their wings.
26:1:25/And there was a voice from above the vault over their heads when they stood still and lowered their wings.
26:1:26/Above the vault over their heads was what looked like a throne of sapphire, and high above on the throne was a figure like that of a human.
26:1:27/I saw something that looked like glowing metal with fire encircling it from what appeared to be his waist up; and from what appeared to be his waist down, I saw something that looked like fire, and there was a brilliance around him.
26:1:28/Like the appearance of a rainbow in the clouds on a rainy day, so was the radiance around him. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the LORD. When I saw it, I fell facedown, and I heard the voice of one speaking.
26:2:1/He said to me, "Son of man, stand up on your feet, and I will speak to you."
26:2:2/As he spoke to me, the spirit entered into me and set me on my feet, and I listened to the one speaking to me.
26:2:3/He said to me, "Son of man, I am sending you to the people of Israel, to a rebellious nation that has rebelled against me. They and their ancestors have been in rebellion against me to this very day.
26:2:4/They are defiant and stubborn. I am sending you to them, and you are to say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says.'
26:2:5/Whether they listen or fail to listen—for they are a rebellious house—they will know that a prophet has been among them.
26:2:6/And you, son of man, do not be afraid of them or their words, even though briers and thorns are all around you and you live among scorpions. Do not be afraid of what they say or be terrified by their looks, for they are a rebellious house.
26:2:7/You must speak my words to them, whether they listen or fail to listen, for they are rebellious.
26:2:8/But you, son of man, listen to what I say to you. Do not be rebellious like that rebellious house. Open your mouth and eat what I give you."
26:2:9/When I looked, there was a hand stretched out to me, and in it was a scroll.
26:2:10/He unrolled it before me, and it was written on both sides; on it were written words of lament, mourning, and woe.
26:3:1/He also said to me, "Human, eat what you find; eat this scroll, and then go and speak to the house of Israel."
26:3:2/So I opened my mouth, and he fed me the scroll.
26:3:3/Then he told me, "Human, let your stomach consume, and fill your insides with this scroll I am giving you." So I ate it, and in my mouth, it was as sweet as honey.
26:3:4/He then instructed me, "Human, go to the house of Israel and speak my words to them."
26:3:5/You are not being sent to people with a foreign tongue and a difficult language, but to the house of Israel;
26:3:6/Not to many peoples with foreign tongues and difficult languages, whose words you would not understand. Indeed, if I had sent you to them, they would have listened to you.
26:3:7/But the house of Israel will not listen to you because they are unwilling to listen to me; for all the house of Israel are stubborn and hard-hearted.
26:3:8/See, I have made your face strong against their faces, and your forehead strong against their foreheads.
26:3:9/I have made your forehead as hard as diamond, harder than flint. Do not fear them or be dismayed by their looks, even though they are a rebellious house.
26:3:10/Furthermore, he said to me, "Human, absorb all my words that I will speak to you into your heart, and listen closely with your ears.
26:3:11/And go to the exiles, to the children of your people, and speak to them. Tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says,' whether they listen or refuse to listen.
26:3:12/Then the spirit lifted me up, and I heard behind me the sound of a great roar, saying, "Praise the glory of the LORD from his place."
26:3:13/I also heard the sound of the wings of the living creatures touching each other, and the sound of the wheels beside them, and a great roaring sound.
26:3:14/So the spirit lifted me up and took me away, and I went in bitterness, in the anger of my spirit; but the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.
26:3:15/Then I arrived among the exiles at Telabib, who lived by the river Chebar, and I sat where they sat, and stayed there overwhelmed among them for seven days.
26:3:16/At the end of seven days, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:3:17/"Human, I have appointed you as a watchman for the house of Israel. Therefore, listen to the word from my mouth and give them warning from me.
26:3:18/When I say to the wicked, 'You will surely die,' and you do not warn them or speak out to dissuade the wicked from their evil ways in order to save their life, that wicked person will die for their sin, and I will hold you accountable for their blood.
26:3:19/However, if you do warn the wicked and they do not turn from their wickedness or from their wicked ways, they will die for their sin; but you will have saved yourself.
26:3:20/Again, when a righteous person turns from their righteousness and commits sin, and I put a stumbling block before them, they will die. Since you did not warn them, they will die for their sin. The righteous acts they did will not be remembered, and I will hold you accountable for their blood.
26:3:21/But if you warn the righteous person not to sin and they do not sin, they will surely live because they took warning, and you will have saved yourself."
26:3:22/And the hand of the LORD was on me there, and he said to me, "Get up, go out to the plain, and there I will speak with you."
26:3:23/So I got up and went out to the plain, and behold, the glory of the LORD stood there, like the glory I had seen by the river Chebar, and I fell on my face.
26:3:24/Then the spirit entered into me and set me on my feet, and spoke with me and said to me, "Go, shut yourself inside your house.
26:3:25/But you, human, understand that they will put bands on you and will bind you with them, and you will not go out among them.
26:3:26/And I will make your tongue stick to the roof of your mouth so that you will be mute and unable to rebuke them, for they are a rebellious house.
26:3:27/But when I speak with you, I will open your mouth, and you shall say to them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says.' Let those who listen, listen, and let those who refuse, refuse; for they are a rebellious house.
26:4:1/You too, son of man, take a tile, place it in front of you, and draw on it the city of Jerusalem.
26:4:2/Surround it with a siege, build a rampart against it, and raise a siege mound against it; also set up a camp against it, and place battering rams around it.
26:4:3/Also, take an iron pan, and use it as an iron wall between you and the city: face it directly, and it will be under siege, and you will besiege it. This will be a sign to the house of Israel.
26:4:4/Also, lie on your left side, and place the sin of the house of Israel upon it: for the number of days you lie on it, you will bear their sin.
26:4:5/For I have assigned to you the years of their sin, equal to the number of days, three hundred and ninety days: thus, you will bear the sin of the house of Israel.
26:4:6/And when you have completed these, lie again on your right side, and you will bear the sin of the house of Judah for forty days: I have assigned you each day for a year.
26:4:7/Therefore, you shall face the siege of Jerusalem, your arm shall be bare, and you shall prophesy against it.
26:4:8/And, look, I will put constraints on you, and you will not turn from one side to another until you have completed the days of your siege.
26:4:9/Also, take wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and spelt, and put them in a single container, and make bread from them for the number of days you will lie on your side, three hundred and ninety days you will eat it.
26:4:10/And the food you eat shall be measured, twenty shekels a day; you shall eat it at set times.
26:4:11/You shall also drink water by measure, one-sixth of a hin; you shall drink at set times.
26:4:12/And you shall eat it as barley cakes, and you shall bake it using human excrement in their presence.
26:4:13/And the LORD said, In this way, the children of Israel will eat their contaminated bread among the nations where I will drive them.
26:4:14/Then I said, Ah Lord GOD! Look, I have never been defiled: from my youth until now I have never eaten anything that died of itself or was torn by beasts; no detestable meat has ever entered my mouth.
26:4:15/Then he said to me, See, I have given you cow's dung instead of human dung, and you shall prepare your bread with it.
26:4:16/Moreover, he said to me, Son of man, see, I will cut off the supply of bread in Jerusalem: they shall eat bread by weight, and with anxiety; and they shall drink water by measure, and with dread.
26:4:17/So that they may lack bread and water, be shocked at each other, and waste away because of their sin.
26:5:1/And you, human, take a sharp knife, use a barber's razor, and shave your head and beard: then use scales to weigh and divide the hair.
26:5:2/You must burn a third of it in the fire in the middle of the city, when the days of the siege are over: take another third and chop at it with a knife: and scatter the last third to the wind; and I will pursue them with a sword.
26:5:3/You should also take a few hairs and tie them in your clothes.
26:5:4/Then take some of those again, and throw them into the fire, and burn them in the fire; from them a fire will spread throughout all the house of Israel.
26:5:5/This is what the Sovereign LORD says; This is Jerusalem: I have placed it among the nations and countries around it.
26:5:6/And it has turned my judgments into wickedness more than the nations, and my laws more than the countries around it: for they have rejected my judgments and my laws, they have not followed them.
26:5:7/Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says; Because you have been more rebellious than the nations around you, not following my statutes or keeping my judgments, nor even following the practices of the nations around you;
26:5:8/Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says; Look, I am against you, and I will carry out judgments among you in the sight of the nations.
26:5:9/And I will do things to you that I have never done before, and will never do again, because of all your detestable practices.
26:5:10/Therefore parents will eat their children among you, and children will eat their parents; I will execute judgments on you, and scatter any survivors to the winds.
26:5:11/Therefore, as surely as I live, says the Sovereign LORD; Surely, because you have defiled my sanctuary with all your vile acts and detestable practices, I will also reduce you; my eye will not spare you, nor will I have pity.
26:5:12/A third of you will die from disease, and be consumed by famine among you: a third will fall by the sword around you; and I will scatter a third to all the winds, and I will pursue them with a sword.
26:5:13/This way my anger will be fulfilled, and I will bring my fury to rest upon them, and I will be satisfied: and they will know that I, the LORD, have spoken in my zeal, when I have fulfilled my fury in them.
26:5:14/Moreover, I will make you desolate, and a disgrace among the nations around you, in the sight of all who pass by.
26:5:15/So you will be a disgrace and a taunt, a warning and a horror to the nations around you, when I execute judgments on you in anger and fury and with furious rebukes. I, the LORD, have spoken.
26:5:16/When I send the deadly arrows of famine against them, which will be for their destruction, and which I will send to destroy you: and I will increase the famine upon you, and will break your supply of bread:
26:5:17/So I will send famine and wild beasts against you, and they will leave you childless: and plague and blood will pass through you; and I will bring the sword against you. I, the LORD, have spoken.
26:6:1/And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
26:6:2/Son of man, turn your attention toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy against them,
26:6:3/And say, You mountains of Israel, listen to the word of the Lord GOD; This is what the Lord GOD says to the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the valleys; Look, I myself will bring a sword upon you, and I will destroy your high places.
26:6:4/Your altars will be deserted, and your idols will be shattered: and I will lay down your slain men in front of your idols.
26:6:5/And I will place the dead bodies of the children of Israel in front of their idols; and I will scatter your bones around your altars.
26:6:6/Throughout all your living places the cities will be ruined, and the high places will be desolate; so that your altars may be ruined and left desolate, and your idols may be broken and end, and your images may be cut down, and your works may be obliterated.
26:6:7/And the slain will fall among you, and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:6:8/Yet I will leave a remnant, so that you may have some who will escape the sword among the nations, when you are scattered through the countries.
26:6:9/And those of you who escape will remember me among the nations where they are taken captive, because I am heartbroken over their promiscuous heart, which has turned away from me, and over their eyes, which lust after their idols: and they will loathe themselves for the evils which they have committed in all their detestable acts.
26:6:10/And they will know that I am the LORD, and that I did not threaten in vain to bring this disaster upon them.
26:6:11/This is what the Lord GOD says; Clap your hands, and stomp your feet, and say, Alas for all the detestable acts of wickedness of the house of Israel! For they will fall by the sword, by famine, and by pestilence.
26:6:12/Those who are far away will die of the pestilence; those who are near will fall by the sword; and those who remain and are besieged will die by famine: this is how I will fulfill my anger upon them.
26:6:13/Then you will know that I am the LORD, when their slain lie among their idols around their altars, on every high hill, on all the mountaintops, under every green tree, and under every thick oak, the places where they offered pleasing aromas to all their idols.
26:6:14/So I will stretch out my hand against them, and make the land more desolate than the wilderness toward Diblath, in all their dwellings: and they will know that I am the LORD.
26:7:1/Furthermore, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:7:2/Also, you, human, this is what the Lord GOD says to the land of Israel; The end has come upon the four corners of the land.
26:7:3/The end has arrived for you, and I will unleash my anger upon you, and judge you based on your actions, and repay you for all your detestable practices.
26:7:4/And I will not look upon you with pity or spare you: I will repay you for your actions, and your detestable practices will be exposed among you: and you will realize that I am the LORD.
26:7:5/This is what the Lord GOD says; A disaster, a unique disaster, behold, is coming.
26:7:6/The end has come, the end is here: it waits for you; behold, it has arrived.
26:7:7/Dawn has come for you, O inhabitants of the land: the time has come, the day of trouble is near, without the echo of the mountains.
26:7:8/Soon I will pour out my fury on you, and fulfill my anger against you: and I will judge you according to your ways, and repay you for all your detestable practices.
26:7:9/And I will not look upon you with pity or spare you: I will repay you according to your actions and the detestable practices among you; and you will know that I am the LORD who strikes.
26:7:10/Look, the day is here, it has arrived: the morning has dawned; authority has flourished, arrogance has sprouted.
26:7:11/Violence has grown into a rod of wickedness: none of them will remain, nor their crowd, nor any of theirs: and there will be no mourning for them.
26:7:12/The time has come, the day is near: let not the buyer rejoice, nor the seller grieve: for wrath is upon their entire crowd.
26:7:13/For the seller will not return to what has been sold, even though they are still alive: for the vision concerns the entire crowd, which will not return; nor will anyone strengthen themselves in their wrongdoing.
26:7:14/They have sounded the trumpet, readying everyone; but no one goes to battle: for my wrath is upon their entire crowd.
26:7:15/The sword is outside, and plague and famine are inside: whoever is in the field will die by the sword; and whoever is in the city, famine and plague will consume them.
26:7:16/But those who escape will be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them mourning, each for their own sins.
26:7:17/All hands will be weak, and all knees will tremble like water.
26:7:18/They will also wear sackcloth, and terror will cover them; and shame will be on all faces, and baldness on all their heads.
26:7:19/They will throw their silver into the streets, and their gold will be considered unclean: their silver and gold will not be able to save them on the day of the LORD's wrath: they will not satisfy their hunger or fill their stomachs: because it has been the cause of their sin.
26:7:20/Regarding the beauty of his jewelry, he set it in majesty: but they made the images of their detestable idols and vile things with it: therefore I have made it unclean for them.
26:7:21/And I will hand it over to strangers as plunder, and to the wicked of the earth as loot; and they will desecrate it.
26:7:22/I will also turn my face from them, and they will desecrate my treasured place: for invaders will enter and defile it.
26:7:23/Make a chain: for the land is full of bloodshed, and the city is full of violence.
26:7:24/Therefore, I will bring the most ruthless of the nations, and they will take possession of their houses: I will also end the pride of the powerful, and their sacred places will be profaned.
26:7:25/Destruction is coming; and they will seek peace, but there will be none.
26:7:26/Calamity will follow calamity, and rumor will follow rumor; then they will seek a vision from the prophet; but the law will vanish from the priest, and advice from the elders.
26:7:27/The king will mourn, and the prince will be clothed with despair, and the hands of the people of the land will tremble: I will treat them according to their conduct, and judge them as they deserve; and they will know that I am the LORD.
26:8:1/And it happened in the sixth year, in the sixth month, on the fifth day of the month, as I was sitting in my house, and the elders of Judah were sitting before me, that the hand of the Lord GOD suddenly came upon me.
26:8:2/Then I saw something that looked like fire: from his waist down it was all fire, and from his waist up it looked like a bright, shining light, the color of amber.
26:8:3/He reached out what seemed like a hand and grabbed me by my hair; the spirit lifted me up between the earth and the sky and took me in visions of God to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the inner gate facing north; where the idol that provokes jealousy was located.
26:8:4/And there, I saw the glory of the God of Israel, just like the vision I had seen in the plain.
26:8:5/Then he said to me, "Son of man, now look towards the north." So I looked northward, and there, at the entrance of the gate of the altar, was this idol that provokes jealousy.
26:8:6/He then said to me, "Son of man, do you see what they are doing? The great detestable acts that the house of Israel is committing here, driving me far from my sanctuary? But turn again, and you will see even more detestable acts."
26:8:7/And he brought me to the entrance of the court; when I looked, there was a hole in the wall.
26:8:8/Then he said to me, "Son of man, dig into the wall." And when I dug into the wall, there was a door.
26:8:9/And he said to me, "Go in, and see the vile abominations they are committing here."
26:8:10/So I went in and saw; and there, depicted all around the wall, were all kinds of crawling creatures, detestable animals, and all the idols of the house of Israel.
26:8:11/And there in front of them stood seventy men of the elders of the house of Israel, and in the middle of them stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan, each with his censer in his hand; and a thick cloud of incense was rising.
26:8:12/Then he said to me, "Son of man, have you seen what the elders of the house of Israel do in the dark, each in his room of pictures? For they say, 'The LORD does not see us; the LORD has abandoned the land.'"
26:8:13/He also said to me, "Turn again, and you will see greater abominations that they are doing."
26:8:14/Then he brought me to the entrance of the gate of the LORD's house which was toward the north; and there, women were sitting, weeping for Tammuz.
26:8:15/Then he said to me, "Have you seen this, O son of man? Turn again, and you will see abominations greater than these."
26:8:16/And he brought me into the inner court of the LORD's house, and there, at the entrance of the temple of the LORD, between the porch and the altar, were about twenty-five men, with their backs toward the temple of the LORD, and their faces toward the east; and they were worshiping the sun toward the east.
26:8:17/Then he said to me, "Have you seen this, O son of man? Is it a trivial matter to the house of Judah to commit the abominations they commit here? For they have filled the land with violence, and have again provoked me to anger: and see, they are putting the branch to their nose.
26:8:18/Therefore, I too will act in fury: my eye will not spare, nor will I have pity: and though they cry in my ears with a loud voice, yet I will not listen to them.
26:9:1/He also shouted in my ears with a loud voice, saying, "Call those in charge of the city to come here, each with his weapon of destruction in hand."
26:9:2/And look, six men came from the direction of the upper gate, which faces north, each carrying a weapon for slaughter; and among them was one man dressed in linen, with a writing kit at his side. They entered and stood beside the bronze altar.
26:9:3/The glory of the God of Israel had moved from the cherubim, where it had been, to the threshold of the temple. He called to the man dressed in linen, who had the writing kit at his side.
26:9:4/And the LORD said to him, "Walk through the center of the city, through the center of Jerusalem, and mark the foreheads of those who grieve and lament over all the detestable things done within it."
26:9:5/To the others, He said in my hearing, "Follow him through the city and strike. Do not look with pity or spare anyone.
26:9:6/Kill completely the old and young, both girls, boys, and women, but do not touch anyone who has the mark. Start at my sanctuary." So they began with the elders who were in front of the temple.
26:9:7/He told them, "Defile the temple and fill its courts with the slain. Go out!" And they went out and killed throughout the city.
26:9:8/As they were killing, and I was the only one left, I fell facedown, crying out, "Ah, Sovereign LORD! Are you going to destroy all the remaining Israelites by pouring out your wrath on Jerusalem?"
26:9:9/He replied to me, "The sin of the house of Israel and Judah is extremely great; the land is soaked with blood and the city is full of corruption. They claim, 'The LORD has abandoned the land; the LORD does not see.'
26:9:10/As for me, my eye will not spare, nor will I show pity, but I will bring their conduct down on their own heads."
26:9:11/Then the man dressed in linen, with the writing kit at his side, reported back, saying, "I have done as you commanded me."
26:10:1/Then I looked, and saw above the heads of the cherubim something like a sapphire stone, resembling a throne.
26:10:2/He instructed the man dressed in linen, "Go between the wheels, beneath the cherub, and fill your hand with coals of fire from between the cherubim, then scatter them over the city." And he did so in my presence.
26:10:3/Now the cherubim were on the right side of the house when the man entered; and the cloud filled the inner court.
26:10:4/Then the glory of the LORD rose from the cherub and moved to the threshold of the house; the house was filled with the cloud, and the courtyard shone with the brightness of the LORD's glory.
26:10:5/The sound of the cherubim's wings could be heard as far as the outer court, like the voice of Almighty God when he speaks.
26:10:6/When he had given the command to the man dressed in linen, "Take fire from between the wheels, from between the cherubim," the man went in and stood beside the wheels.
26:10:7/One cherub reached out his hand from between the cherubim to the fire that was between them, took some, and put it into the hands of the man in linen; who then took it and left.
26:10:8/Under their wings, the cherubim appeared to have the form of a human hand.
26:10:9/When I looked, there were four wheels beside the cherubim, one wheel beside one cherub, and another wheel beside another cherub. The wheels looked as if they were made of beryl stone.
26:10:10/Their appearance was the same for all four, as if a wheel were inside another wheel.
26:10:11/When they moved, they went in any of their four directions without turning as they moved; they followed the direction the head faced, without turning as they moved.
26:10:12/Their entire body, backs, hands, wings, and the wheels, were covered with eyes all around, even the wheels of all four.
26:10:13/Regarding the wheels, I heard them being called "wheel" in my hearing.
26:10:14/Each one had four faces: the first was the face of a cherub, the second the face of a man, the third the face of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.
26:10:15/The cherubim rose. This is the living creature I had seen by the river Chebar.
26:10:16/When the cherubim moved, the wheels moved with them; and when the cherubim lifted their wings to rise from the ground, the wheels did not turn away from them.
26:10:17/When the cherubim stood still, the wheels stood still; and when they rose, the wheels rose with them, because the spirit of the living creature was in them.
26:10:18/Then the glory of the LORD moved away from the threshold of the house and stood over the cherubim.
26:10:19/The cherubim lifted their wings and rose from the ground in my sight. When they went out, the wheels were beside them. They stopped at the entrance of the east gate of the LORD's house, and the glory of the God of Israel hovered over them.
26:10:20/This is the living creature I saw beneath the God of Israel by the river Chebar; and I realized they were the cherubim.
26:10:21/Each had four faces and four wings, and under their wings was what looked like human hands.
26:10:22/Their faces looked the same as those I had seen by the river Chebar. Each one moved straight ahead.
26:11:1/Furthermore, the spirit lifted me up and took me to the east gate of the LORD's house, which faces east. There, at the gate's entrance, I saw twenty-five men, among them Jaazaniah the son of Azur, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, leaders of the people.
26:11:2/He then said to me, "Son of man, these are the men who plot evil and give harmful advice in this city:
26:11:3/They say, 'The disaster won't come soon; let's build houses. This city is our cooking pot, and we are the meat.'
26:11:4/So, prophesy against them, prophesy, O son of man."
26:11:5/And the Spirit of the LORD came over me and told me to say, "This is what the LORD says: You have said this, O house of Israel, but I know every thought that crosses your mind.
26:11:6/You have increased the number of your dead in this city, filling its streets with them.
26:11:7/Therefore, this is what the Sovereign LORD says: The dead you have placed in the midst of it, they are the meat, and this city is the cooking pot; but I will take you out of it.
26:11:8/You have feared the sword; and I will bring a sword upon you, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:11:9/And I will take you out from it, hand you over to strangers, and execute judgments upon you.
26:11:10/You will fall by the sword; I will judge you at the border of Israel; and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:11:11/This city will not be your cooking pot, nor will you be the meat in it; I will judge you at the border of Israel:
26:11:12/And you will realize that I am the LORD, for you have not followed my decrees or carried out my judgments, but have conformed to the practices of the nations around you."
26:11:13/And as I was prophesying, Pelatiah the son of Benaiah died. Then I fell face down, cried out loudly, and said, "Oh Sovereign LORD! Will you completely destroy the remnant of Israel?"
26:11:14/Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:11:15/"Son of man, your brothers, your own family, the whole house of Israel, all of them, are those to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, 'Get away from the LORD; this land has been given to us as a possession.'"
26:11:16/Therefore, say, "This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Although I have sent them far away among the nations and scattered them among the countries, I will be a sanctuary to them for a little while in the countries where they have gone."
26:11:17/Therefore, say, "This is what the Sovereign LORD says: I will gather you from the people and assemble you from the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel."
26:11:18/When they return, they will remove all its vile images and detestable idols.
26:11:19/And I will give them one heart, and put a new spirit within them. I will remove the heart of stone from their flesh and give them a heart of flesh,
26:11:20/So that they may follow my decrees and keep my laws and do them. They will be my people, and I will be their God.
26:11:21/But as for those whose hearts pursue their detestable things and abominations, I will bring their conduct down on their own heads, says the Sovereign LORD."
26:11:22/Then the cherubim lifted up their wings, with the wheels beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel was above them.
26:11:23/And the glory of the LORD rose from within the city and stood on the mountain east of the city.
26:11:24/Afterward, the spirit took me up and brought me in a vision by the Spirit of God to the exiles in Chaldea. The vision I had seen left me.
26:11:25/Then I told the exiles all the things the LORD had shown me.
26:12:1/The word of the LORD also came unto me, saying,
26:12:2/Son of man, you live among a rebellious people, who have eyes to see but do not see, and ears to hear but do not hear, for they are a rebellious people.
26:12:3/Therefore, you, son of man, pack your belongings for exile, and in their presence, move from one place to another, perhaps they will understand, despite being a rebellious people.
26:12:4/Then you must take your belongings out in their presence, as if you're preparing for exile; and in the evening, leave in their presence, as those going into captivity do.
26:12:5/In their view, break through the wall and take your belongings out through it.
26:12:6/You must carry it on your shoulders in their sight and take it out at dusk; cover your face so you do not see the ground, for I have made you a sign to the house of Israel.
26:12:7/And I did as I was commanded: I took out my belongings by day, as if going into captivity, and in the evening I broke through the wall with my hands; I took it out at dusk and carried it on my shoulder in their sight.
26:12:8/And in the morning came the word of the LORD unto me, saying,
26:12:9/Son of man, hasn't the house of Israel, the rebellious people, asked you, 'What are you doing?'
26:12:10/Tell them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: This message concerns the prince in Jerusalem and all the people of Israel who are there.'
26:12:11/Say, 'I am your sign: just as I have done, so it will be done to them: they will go into exile, into captivity.'
26:12:12/And the prince among them will carry his belongings on his shoulder at dusk and leave; they will break through the wall to take their belongings out; he will cover his face so that he cannot see the ground with his eyes.
26:12:13/I will also spread my net for him, and he will be caught in my trap; I will bring him to Babylon, to the land of the Chaldeans, but he will not see it, even though he will die there.
26:12:14/And I will scatter to every wind all who are around him to help him, along with all his troops; and I will draw the sword after them.
26:12:15/And they will know that I am the LORD when I scatter them among the nations and disperse them in the countries.
26:12:16/But I will spare a few of them from the sword, famine, and plague so that they can tell of all their detestable practices among the nations where they go; then they will know that I am the LORD.
26:12:17/Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:12:18/Son of man, eat your bread with anxiety, and drink your water with trembling and with caution;
26:12:19/And say to the people of the land, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says about the inhabitants of Jerusalem and the land of Israel: They will eat their bread with anxiety and drink their water in despair, for their land will be stripped of everything in it because of the violence of all who live there.
26:12:20/And the inhabited cities will be destroyed, and the land will become desolate; and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:12:21/And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
26:12:22/Son of man, what is that proverb you have in the land of Israel, saying, 'The days go by, and every vision comes to nothing'?
26:12:23/Tell them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: I will put an end to this proverb, and they will no longer use it as a proverb in Israel.' But tell them, 'The days are near when every vision will be fulfilled.
26:12:24/For there will no longer be any false vision or flattering divination within the house of Israel.
26:12:25/For I am the LORD; I will speak, and the word that I speak will come to pass; it will no longer be delayed. For in your days, O rebellious house, I will say the word and will perform it, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:12:26/Again the word of the LORD came to me, saying.
26:12:27/Son of man, look, those of the house of Israel say, 'The vision he sees is for many days from now, and he prophesies about times far off.'
26:12:28/Therefore say to them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: None of my words will be delayed any longer; whatever I have spoken will be done, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:13:1/And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:13:2/Son of man, speak out against the prophets of Israel who prophesy, and tell those who prophesy from their own hearts, Listen to the word of the LORD;
26:13:3/This is what the Lord GOD says; Woe to the foolish prophets, who follow their own spirit and have seen nothing!
26:13:4/O Israel, your prophets are like foxes in the deserts.
26:13:5/You have not stepped into the gaps, nor repaired the wall for the house of Israel to stand firm in the battle on the day of the LORD.
26:13:6/They have seen false visions and told lying divinations, claiming, The LORD says; when the LORD has not sent them; and they have led others to hope that they would confirm the word.
26:13:7/Have you not seen a false vision, and have you not spoken a lying divination, when you say, The LORD says it; even though I have not spoken?
26:13:8/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says; Because you have spoken falsehoods and seen lies, therefore, behold, I am against you, says the Lord GOD.
26:13:9/And my hand will be against the prophets who see false visions and who divine lies: they shall not be in the assembly of my people, nor be listed in the records of the house of Israel, nor shall they enter into the land of Israel; and you will know that I am the Lord GOD.
26:13:10/Because they have misled my people, saying, Peace; when there was no peace; and one built a wall, and, look, others covered it with whitewash:
26:13:11/Tell those who cover it with whitewash that it will fall: there will be a torrential rain; and you, O great hailstones, will fall; and a violent wind will break it.
26:13:12/Indeed, when the wall has fallen, will it not be said to you, Where is the whitewash you applied?
26:13:13/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says; I will break it down with a violent wind in my wrath; and there will be a torrential rain in my anger, and great hailstones in my wrath to destroy it.
26:13:14/So I will tear down the wall you have covered with whitewash and bring it down to the ground, so that its foundation will be exposed; it will fall, and you will perish in its midst: and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:13:15/Thus I will fulfill my wrath on the wall, and on those who have covered it with whitewash, and will say to you, The wall is no more, nor those who whitewashed it;
26:13:16/Namely, the prophets of Israel who prophesy about Jerusalem, and who see visions of peace for her, when there is no peace, says the Lord GOD.
26:13:17/Also, you son of man, set your face against the daughters of your people, who prophesy from their own hearts; and prophesy against them,
26:13:18/And say, This is what the Lord GOD says; Woe to the women who sew magic charms on all their wrists, and make veils for the heads of people of every height to ensnare lives! Will you ensnare the lives of my people, but preserve your own?
26:13:19/And will you profane me among my people for handfuls of barley and for pieces of bread, to put to death those who should not die and to keep alive those who should not live, by your lying to my people who listen to lies?
26:13:20/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says; Behold, I am against your magic charms by which you hunt lives there like birds, and I will tear them from your arms, and will let the lives go, the lives you hunt like birds.
26:13:21/Your veils also I will tear off and deliver my people out of your hand, and they shall no longer be in your hand to be hunted; and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:13:22/Because you have disheartened the righteous with lies, when I had not made them sad; and encouraged the wicked not to turn from his wicked way and save his life:
26:13:23/Therefore, you will no longer see false visions nor practice divination: for I will deliver my people out of your hand: and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:14:1/Then some of the elders of Israel came to me and sat down in front of me.
26:14:2/And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:14:3/Son of man, these men have placed their idols in their hearts and have set the obstacle of their sin right before them: should I even be consulted by them?
26:14:4/So, talk to them and tell them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Every person from the house of Israel who sets up idols in their heart and places the obstacle of their sin before them, and then comes to the prophet; I, the LORD, will respond to them in accordance with their many idols,
26:14:5/So that I might confront the people of Israel in their own hearts, because they have all become estranged from me due to their idols.'
26:14:6/Therefore, tell the house of Israel, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Repent and turn away from your idols; and turn your faces away from all your detestable practices.
26:14:7/For anyone from the house of Israel, or any foreigner living in Israel, who separates themselves from me, sets up idols in their heart, places the obstacle of their sin before them, and then comes to a prophet to inquire about me; I, the LORD, will answer them myself.
26:14:8/And I will set my face against that person, make them a warning and a proverb, and cut them off from among my people; and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:14:9/And if the prophet is deceived and speaks a word, I, the LORD, have deceived that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand against him and will destroy him from among my people Israel.
26:14:10/And they will bear the consequences of their sin: the punishment of the prophet will be the same as the punishment of the one who seeks guidance from him,
26:14:11/So that the house of Israel may no longer stray from me, nor be defiled anymore with all their sins; but that they may be my people, and I may be their God, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:14:12/The word of the LORD came again to me, saying,
26:14:13/Son of man, when a land sins against me by committing a grave trespass, then I will stretch out my hand against it, cut off its supply of bread, send famine upon it, and eliminate both humans and animals from it.
26:14:14/Even if these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job, were in it, they could save only themselves by their righteousness, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:14:15/If I send wild beasts through the land and they ravage it, making it desolate so that no one can pass through because of the beasts,
26:14:16/Even if these three men were in it, as surely as I live, says the Sovereign LORD, they could save neither sons nor daughters; they alone would be saved, but the land would be desolate.
26:14:17/Or if I bring a sword upon that land and command, 'Sword, go through the land,' so that I eliminate both humans and animals from it,
26:14:18/Even if these three men were in it, as surely as I live, says the Sovereign LORD, they could save neither sons nor daughters, but only themselves would be saved.
26:14:19/Or if I send a plague into that land and pour out my wrath upon it through bloodshed, to cut off from it both humans and animals,
26:14:20/Even if Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as surely as I live, says the Sovereign LORD, they could save neither son nor daughter; they would save only themselves by their righteousness.
26:14:21/For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: How much worse will it be when I send my four dreadful judgments against Jerusalem—the sword, famine, wild beasts, and plague—to cut off from it both humans and animals?
26:14:22/Yet, look, there will be some survivors left in it, sons and daughters who will be brought out; they will come to you, and when you see their ways and their actions, you will be comforted concerning the disaster I have brought upon Jerusalem, all that I have brought upon it.
26:14:23/And they will comfort you when you see their ways and their actions; and you will know that I have not done without reason all that I have done in it, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:15:1/And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
26:15:2/Son of man, what makes the vine tree special compared to any other tree, or compared to a branch found in the forests?
26:15:3/Can its wood be used for any meaningful work? Or will people use a piece of it to hang any object?
26:15:4/Look, it's thrown into the fire as fuel; the fire consumes both its ends, and its middle is charred. Is it suitable for any work then?
26:15:5/Consider, when it was intact, it was unfit for any work: how much more unfit will it be for any work when the fire has consumed it, and it is charred?
26:15:6/Therefore, this is what the Sovereign LORD says; Just as the vine tree among the forest trees, which I have designated for the fire as fuel, so will I treat the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
26:15:7/And I will set my face against them; they will escape from one fire, only for another fire to consume them; and you will know that I am the LORD, when I set my face against them.
26:15:8/And I will make the land desolate, because they have committed a trespass, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:16:1/Once again, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:16:2/"Human, make Jerusalem aware of her detestable actions,
26:16:3/And tell her, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says to Jerusalem: Your origin and your birth are from the land of Canaan; your father was an Amorite, and your mother a Hittite.
26:16:4/Regarding your birth, on the day you were born your umbilical cord was not cut, you were not washed with water to cleanse you; you were not rubbed with salt or wrapped in cloths.
26:16:5/No one looked on you with pity or had compassion enough to do any of these things for you. Rather, you were thrown out into the open field, for on the day you were born you were despised.
26:16:6/Then I passed by and saw you kicking about in your blood, and as you lay there in your blood I said to you, "Live!" Yes, I said to you as you lay in your blood, "Live!"
26:16:7/I made you grow like a plant of the field. You grew up and developed and became the most beautiful of jewels. Your breasts were formed and your hair grew, you who were naked and bare.
26:16:8/Later I passed by, and when I looked at you and saw that you were old enough for love, I spread the corner of my garment over you and covered your naked body. I gave you my solemn oath and entered into a covenant with you, declares the Sovereign LORD, and you became mine.
26:16:9/Then I bathed you with water, washed the blood from you, and anointed you with oil.
26:16:10/I clothed you with an embroidered dress and put sandals of fine leather on you. I wrapped you in fine linen and covered you with silk.
26:16:11/I adorned you with jewelry: I put bracelets on your arms and a necklace around your neck,
26:16:12/And I put a ring on your nose, earrings on your ears, and a beautiful crown on your head.
26:16:13/So you were adorned with gold and silver; your clothes were of fine linen and silk and embroidered cloth. You ate fine flour, honey, and oil. You became exceedingly beautiful and rose to be a queen.
26:16:14/Your fame spread among the nations on account of your beauty, because the splendor I had given you made your beauty perfect, declares the Sovereign LORD.
26:16:15/But you trusted in your beauty and used your fame to become a prostitute. You lavished your favors on anyone who passed by and your beauty became his.
26:16:16/You took some of your garments to make gaudy high places, where you carried on your prostitution. Such things should not happen, nor should they ever occur.
26:16:17/You also took the beautiful jewelry I gave you, the jewelry made of my gold and silver, and you made for yourself male idols and engaged in prostitution with them.
26:16:18/And you took your embroidered clothes to cover them, and you offered my oil and incense before them.
26:16:19/Also my food that I provided for you—fine flour, oil, and honey with which I fed you—you set before them as a pleasing aroma. And so it was, declares the Sovereign LORD.
26:16:20/Moreover, you took your sons and daughters whom you bore to me and sacrificed them as food to the idols. Was your prostitution not enough?
26:16:21/You slaughtered my children and delivered them up as an offering by fire to them.
26:16:22/In all your detestable practices and your prostitution you did not remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and bare, kicking about in your blood.
26:16:23/After all your wickedness—'Woe, woe to you!' declares the Sovereign LORD—
26:16:24/You built a mound for yourself and made a lofty shrine in every public square.
26:16:25/At every street corner you built your lofty shrines and degraded your beauty, spreading your legs with increasing promiscuity to anyone who passed by.
26:16:26/You engaged in prostitution with the Egyptians, your lustful neighbors, and provoked me to anger with your increasing promiscuity.
26:16:27/So I stretched out my hand against you and reduced your territory; I gave you over to the greed of your enemies, the daughters of the Philistines, who were shocked by your lewd conduct.
26:16:28/You engaged in prostitution with the Assyrians too because you were insatiable; and even after that, you still were not satisfied.
26:16:29/Then you increased your promiscuity to include Babylonia, a land of merchants, but even with this you were not satisfied.
26:16:30/'How weak-willed you are,' declares the Sovereign LORD, 'when you do all these things, acting like a brazen prostitute!
26:16:31/When you built your mounds at the head of every street and made your lofty shrines in every public square, you were unlike a prostitute because you scorned payment.
26:16:32/You adulterous wife! You prefer strangers to your own husband!
26:16:33/All prostitutes receive gifts, but you give gifts to all your lovers, bribing them to come to you from everywhere for your illicit favors.
26:16:34/So in your prostitution you are the opposite of others; no one runs after you for your favors. You are the opposite, for you give payment and none is given to you.
26:16:35/'Therefore, you prostitute, hear the word of the LORD!
26:16:36/This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Because you poured out your lust and exposed your nakedness in your promiscuity with your lovers, and because of all your detestable idols, and because you gave them your children's blood,
26:16:37/Therefore, I am going to gather all your lovers, with whom you took pleasure, all those you loved as well as all those you hated. I will gather them against you from all around and will expose your nakedness to them, that they may see all your nakedness.
26:16:38/I will sentence you to the punishment of women who commit adultery and who shed blood; I will bring on you the blood vengeance of my wrath and jealousy.
26:16:39/Then I will hand you over to your lovers, and they will tear down your mounds and destroy your lofty shrines. They will strip you of your clothes and take your fine jewelry and leave you naked and bare.
26:16:40/They will bring a mob against you, who will stone you and hack you to pieces with their swords.
26:16:41/They will burn down your houses and execute judgments against you in the sight of many women. I will put an end to your prostitution, and you will no longer pay your lovers.
26:16:42/Then my anger toward you will subside and my jealousy will turn away from you; I will be calm and no longer angry.
26:16:43/Because you did not remember the days of your youth but enraged me with all these things, I will surely bring your conduct down on your own head, declares the Sovereign LORD. Did you not add lewdness to all your other detestable practices?
26:16:44/Everyone who quotes proverbs will quote this proverb about you: 'Like mother, like daughter.'
26:16:45/You are the daughter of your mother, who despised her husband and her children; and you are the sister of your sisters, who despised their husbands and their children. Your mother was a Hittite and your father an Amorite.
26:16:46/Your older sister is Samaria, who lives to the north of you with her daughters; and your younger sister, who lives to the south of you, is Sodom with her daughters.
26:16:47/Yet you have not merely walked in their ways or done according to their detestable practices. But, as if that were too little, you became more corrupt than they in all your ways.
26:16:48/As I live, declares the Sovereign LORD, your sister Sodom and her daughters have not done what you and your daughters have done.
26:16:49/Now this was the sin of your sister Sodom: She and her daughters were arrogant, overfed and unconcerned; they did not help the poor and needy.
26:16:50/They were haughty and did detestable things before me. Therefore I did away with them as you have seen.
26:16:51/Samaria has not committed half the sins you have. You have multiplied your detestable practices beyond theirs and have justified your sisters by all the detestable things you have done.
26:16:52/You who judged your sisters bear your own shame for the sins you have committed, more detestable than theirs. They appear more righteous than you. So be ashamed and bear your disgrace, for you have made your sisters seem righteous.
26:16:53/Yet I will restore the fortunes of Sodom and her daughters and of Samaria and her daughters, and your fortunes along with them,
26:16:54/So that you may bear your disgrace and be ashamed of all you have done in giving them comfort.
26:16:55/Your sisters, Sodom and her daughters, will return to what they were, and Samaria and her daughters will return to what they were, and you and your daughters will return to what you were.
26:16:56/Before your wickedness was uncovered, you acted more arrogantly than Sodom, which was not mentioned by your mouth in the days of your pride,
26:16:57/Before your evil was exposed. Now you are the scorn of the daughters of Syria and all those around her, and the daughters of the Philistines—those all around who despise you.
26:16:58/You have borne the penalty of your lewdness and detestable practices, declares the LORD.
26:16:59/'For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I will deal with you as you deserve, because you have despised my oath by breaking the covenant.
26:16:60/Yet I will remember my covenant with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish an everlasting covenant with you.
26:16:61/Then you will remember your ways and be ashamed when you receive your sisters, both your older and your younger; and I will give them to you as daughters, but not on the basis of your covenant.
26:16:62/I will establish my covenant with you; and you will know that I am the LORD,
26:16:63/So that you may remember and be ashamed and never again open your mouth because of your shame, when I have forgiven you for all you have done, declares the Sovereign LORD.
26:17:1/And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:17:2/Son of man, present a riddle, and tell a parable to the house of Israel;
26:17:3/And say, This is what the Lord GOD says; A great eagle with large wings, long feathers, full of colors, came to Lebanon, and took the highest branch of the cedar:
26:17:4/It clipped off the top of its young twigs, and carried it to a land of trade; it placed it in a city of merchants.
26:17:5/It also took some of the seed of the land, and planted it in a fertile field; it set it by abundant waters, and positioned it like a willow tree.
26:17:6/And it grew, and became a sprawling vine of low height, whose branches turned toward him, and its roots were beneath him: so it became a vine, and produced branches, and sprouted shoots.
26:17:7/There was also another great eagle with large wings and many feathers: and, look, this vine bent its roots toward him, and extended its branches toward him, so he might water it from the furrows of its planting.
26:17:8/It was planted in good soil by abundant waters, so it might grow branches, and bear fruit, to become a splendid vine.
26:17:9/Say, This is what the Lord GOD says; Will it thrive? Will he not pull up its roots, and cut off its fruit, so it withers? It will wither in all the leaves of its growth, even without great strength or many people to uproot it.
26:17:10/Indeed, being planted, will it thrive? Will it not completely wither when the east wind touches it? It will wither in the beds where it grew.
26:17:11/Moreover, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:17:12/Tell the rebellious house, Don't you know what these things mean? tell them, Look, the king of Babylon has come to Jerusalem, and has taken its king and its princes, and led them with him to Babylon;
26:17:13/And has taken one of the king’s descendants, and made a covenant with him, and has taken an oath from him: he has also taken the mighty of the land:
26:17:14/So that the kingdom might be humble, that it might not lift itself up, but that by keeping his covenant it might stand.
26:17:15/But he rebelled against him by sending his ambassadors to Egypt, so they might give him horses and many people. Will he thrive? Can he escape who does such things? Or can he break the covenant, and yet be delivered?
26:17:16/As I live, says the Lord GOD, surely in the place where the king lives who made him king, whose oath he despised, and whose covenant he broke, even with him in the midst of Babylon he shall die.
26:17:17/Neither shall Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company do anything for him in the war, by building siege ramps and constructing fortifications to cut off many lives:
26:17:18/Since he despised the oath by breaking the covenant, when, look, he had given his hand, and has done all these things, he shall not escape.
26:17:19/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says; As I live, surely my oath that he has despised, and my covenant that he has broken, I will bring it back on his own head.
26:17:20/And I will spread my net over him, and he shall be caught in my trap, and I will bring him to Babylon, and will argue with him there about his violation that he has violated against me.
26:17:21/And all his escapees with all his troops shall fall by the sword, and those who remain shall be scattered to all the winds: and you shall know that I the LORD have spoken it.
26:17:22/This is what the Lord GOD says; I will also take from the highest branch of the high cedar, and will set it; I will clip off from the top of its young twigs a tender one, and will plant it on a high and prominent mountain:
26:17:23/In the mountain of the height of Israel I will plant it: and it shall produce branches, and bear fruit, and become a magnificent cedar: and under it will dwell all kinds of birds; in the shade of its branches they will live.
26:17:24/And all the trees of the field shall know that I the LORD have brought down the high tree, have lifted up the low tree, have dried up the green tree, and have made the dry tree flourish: I the LORD have spoken and have done it.
26:18:1/The word of the LORD came to me again, saying,
26:18:2/Why do you use this proverb about the land of Israel, saying, "The parents have eaten sour grapes, and the children's teeth are set on edge"?
26:18:3/As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign LORD, you will no longer use this proverb in Israel.
26:18:4/Listen, every soul belongs to me; both the soul of the father and the soul of the son are mine. The soul that sins will die.
26:18:5/But if a person is righteous and practices justice and righteousness,
26:18:6/And does not participate in idolatrous feasts on the mountains, nor looks up to the idols of Israel, nor defiles his neighbor's wife, nor approaches a woman during her menstrual impurity,
26:18:7/And does not oppress anyone, but returns what he took in pledge, does not commit robbery, gives his food to the hungry, and clothes the naked,
26:18:8/Does not lend at interest or take any profit, refrains from injustice, judges fairly between one person and another,
26:18:9/Follows my decrees and faithfully keeps my laws, acting with integrity; such a person is righteous and will surely live, declares the Sovereign LORD.
26:18:10/If this person has a son who becomes a violent thief, who sheds blood or does any of these other things,
26:18:11/Though the father does none of them—this son eats at the mountain shrines, defiles his neighbor's wife,
26:18:12/Oppresses the poor and needy, commits robbery, does not return what he took in pledge, looks up to the idols, commits detestable acts,
26:18:13/Lends at interest and takes profit; will such a person live? He will not! Since he has done all these detestable things, he will surely die; his blood will be on his own head.
26:18:14/Now suppose this son has a son who sees all the sins his father has done, sees them but does not do the same:
26:18:15/He does not eat at the mountain shrines or look up to the idols of Israel, does not defile his neighbor's wife,
26:18:16/Does not oppress anyone, does not require a pledge, does not commit robbery, but gives his food to the hungry and clothes the naked,
26:18:17/He refrains from oppressing the poor, does not lend at interest or take a profit, obeys my rules and follows my decrees; he will not die for his father's sin; he will surely live.
26:18:18/But his father, because he cruelly oppressed, robbed his brother, and did what is not good among his people, will indeed die for his sin.
26:18:19/Yet you ask, 'Why does not the son bear the guilt of the father?' When the son has done what is just and right, has kept all my decrees, and has done them, he will surely live.
26:18:20/The person who sins is the one who will die. A son will not share the guilt of the father, nor will a father share the guilt of the son. The righteousness of the righteous will be credited to them, and the wickedness of the wicked will be charged against them.
26:18:21/But if the wicked turns away from all the sins they have committed and keeps all my decrees and does what is just and right, they will surely live; they will not die.
26:18:22/None of the offenses they have committed will be remembered against them. Because of the righteous things they have done, they will live.
26:18:23/Do I take any pleasure in the death of the wicked? declares the Sovereign LORD. Rather, am I not pleased when they turn from their ways and live?
26:18:24/But if a righteous person turns from their righteousness and commits sin and does the same detestable things the wicked person does, will they live? None of the righteous things that person has done will be remembered. Because of the unfaithfulness they are guilty of and because of the sins they have committed, they will die.
26:18:25/Yet you say, 'The LORD's way is not fair.' Listen now, O house of Israel: Is my way unfair? Is it not your ways that are unfair?
26:18:26/When a righteous person turns from their righteousness and commits sin, they will die for it; because of the sin they have committed they will die.
26:18:27/But if a wicked person turns away from the wickedness they have committed and does what is just and right, they will save their life.
26:18:28/Because they consider and turn away from all the transgressions they have committed, they will surely live; they will not die.
26:18:29/Yet the house of Israel says, 'The LORD's way is not fair.' O house of Israel, are my ways not fair? Is it not your ways that are unfair?
26:18:30/Therefore, I will judge you, O house of Israel, each according to his ways, declares the Sovereign LORD. Repent and turn from all your transgressions, so that sin will not be your downfall.
26:18:31/Cast away from you all the sins you have committed, and make yourselves a new heart and a new spirit. Why will you die, O house of Israel?
26:18:32/For I take no pleasure in the death of anyone, declares the Sovereign LORD. Repent and live!

26:19:2/And ask, "What is your mother? A lioness: she lay among lions, she raised her cubs among young lions.
26:19:3/She raised one of her cubs: it grew into a young lion, and it learned to hunt; it consumed people.
26:19:4/The nations heard about him; he was caught in their trap, and they brought him with chains to Egypt.
26:19:5/When she realized she had waited in vain and her hope was gone, she took another of her cubs and made him a young lion.
26:19:6/He roamed among the lions, became a young lion, learned to hunt, and consumed people.

26:20:1/It happened in the seventh year, on the fifth month, the tenth day of the month, that some of the elders of Israel came to seek guidance from the LORD, and sat before me.
26:20:2/Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:20:3/Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel, and tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says; Have you come to seek guidance from me? As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, I will not be sought by you.
26:20:4/Will you judge them, son of man, will you judge them? Make them aware of the detestable practices of their ancestors:
26:20:5/And tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says; On the day I chose Israel, and pledged my commitment to the descendants of the house of Jacob, and revealed myself to them in the land of Egypt, when I pledged my commitment to them, saying, I am the LORD your God;
26:20:6/On the day I pledged my commitment to them, to bring them out of the land of Egypt into a land I had scouted for them, flowing with milk and honey, the most splendid of all lands:
26:20:7/Then I told them, Discard every one of you the detestable things your eyes crave, and do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
26:20:8/But they rebelled against me, and refused to listen to me: they did not discard the detestable things their eyes craved, nor did they abandon the idols of Egypt: then I decided to pour out my wrath on them, to unleash my anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.
26:20:9/But I acted for the sake of my name, so that it would not be dishonored in the eyes of the nations among whom they lived, in whose sight I had made myself known to them by bringing them out of the land of Egypt.
26:20:10/Therefore, I led them out of the land of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.
26:20:11/And I gave them my laws, and showed them my decrees, which, if a person follows, they will live by them.
26:20:12/Also, I gave them my Sabbaths, as a sign between me and them, so they would know that I am the LORD who makes them holy.
26:20:13/But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness: they did not follow my statutes, and they rejected my decrees, which, if a person follows, they will live by them; and they greatly desecrated my Sabbaths: then I decided to pour out my wrath on them in the wilderness, to destroy them.
26:20:14/But I acted for the sake of my name, so that it would not be dishonored in the eyes of the nations, in whose sight I had brought them out.
26:20:15/Yet, I also pledged my commitment to them in the wilderness, that I would not bring them into the land I had given them, flowing with milk and honey, the most splendid of all lands;
26:20:16/Because they rejected my decrees, did not follow my statutes, but desecrated my Sabbaths: for their hearts pursued their idols.
26:20:17/Nevertheless, I spared them from destruction and did not put an end to them in the wilderness.
26:20:18/But I told their children in the wilderness, Do not follow the statutes of your fathers, nor observe their decrees, nor defile yourselves with their idols:
26:20:19/I am the LORD your God; follow my statutes, keep my decrees, and practice them;
26:20:20/And keep my Sabbaths holy; and they will be a sign between me and you, that you may know that I am the LORD your God.
26:20:21/Yet the children rebelled against me: they did not follow my statutes, nor kept my decrees to practice them, which, if a person follows, they will live by them; they desecrated my Sabbaths: then I decided to pour out my wrath on them, to unleash my anger against them in the wilderness.
26:20:22/Nevertheless, I held back my hand, and acted for the sake of my name, so that it would not be dishonored in the eyes of the nations, in whose sight I had brought them out.
26:20:23/I also pledged my commitment to them in the wilderness, that I would scatter them among the nations, and disperse them through the countries;
26:20:24/Because they had not carried out my decrees, but had rejected my statutes, and had desecrated my Sabbaths, and their eyes were fixed on their fathers’ idols.
26:20:25/Therefore, I also gave them statutes that were not good, and decrees by which they could not live;
26:20:26/And I allowed them to become defiled through their own offerings, in making them offer by fire all their firstborn, that I might devastate them, so they would know that I am the LORD.
26:20:27/Therefore, son of man, speak to the house of Israel, and tell them, 'This is what the Lord GOD says; In this also your ancestors blasphemed me, by acting treacherously against me.
26:20:28/For when I brought them into the land, which I had pledged to give them, then they saw every high hill and all the leafy trees, and they offered their sacrifices there, and there they presented their provocative offerings: there also they made their fragrant aromas, and poured out their drink offerings.
26:20:29/Then I asked them, What is the high place to which you go? And its name is called Bamah to this day.
26:20:30/Therefore, say to the house of Israel, 'This is what the Lord GOD says; Are you defiled in the same way as your ancestors? And do you engage in prostitution following their detestable practices?
26:20:31/For when you present your offerings, when you make your children pass through the fire, you defile yourselves with all your idols to this day: and shall I be sought by you, O house of Israel? As surely as I live, says the Lord GOD, I will not be sought by you.

26:20:34/And I will bring you out from the peoples, and gather you from the countries where you are scattered, with a mighty hand, an outstretched arm, and with poured-out wrath.
26:20:35/And I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples, and there I will plead with you face to face.

26:20:38/And I will purge out from among you the rebels, and those who transgress against me: I will bring them out of the country where they sojourn, but they shall not enter the land of Israel: and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:20:39/As for you, O house of Israel, thus says the Lord GOD; Go, serve every one of you his idols, and hereafter, if you will not listen to me: but no longer defile my holy name with your gifts, and with your idols.
26:20:40/For on my holy mountain, on the high mountain of Israel, says the Lord GOD, there all the house of Israel, all of them in the land, will serve me: there I will accept them, and there I will require your offerings, and the firstfruits of your oblations, with all your sacred things.

26:20:42/And you will know that I am the LORD, when I bring you into the land of Israel, into the country for which I pledged my commitment to give it to your ancestors.

26:20:44/And you will know that I am the LORD when I deal with you for my name's sake, not according to your wicked ways or your corrupt actions, O house of Israel, says the Lord GOD.

26:23:28/For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I am about to deliver you into the hands of those you hate, into the hands of those from whom you have turned away in disgust:
26:23:29/And they will deal with you hatefully, take all your possessions, and leave you naked and bare: and the shame of your sexual immorality will be exposed, both your lewdness and your promiscuity.
26:23:30/I will do these things to you because you have chased after the nations and because you are defiled by their idols.
26:23:31/You have followed the path of your sister; therefore, I will put her cup into your hand.
26:23:32/This is what the Sovereign LORD says: You will drink your sister’s cup, a deep and wide one; you will be scorned and derided, for it holds much.
26:23:33/You will be filled with drunkenness and sorrow, the cup of devastation and desolation, the cup of your sister Samaria.
26:23:34/You will drink it and drain it, then you will gnaw its fragments and tear your breasts; for I have spoken, declares the Sovereign LORD.
26:23:35/Therefore, this is what the Sovereign LORD says: Because you have forgotten me and cast me behind your back, you must bear the consequences of your lewdness and promiscuity.
26:23:36/The LORD said to me; Son of man, will you judge Aholah and Aholibah? Yes, expose their detestable practices;
26:23:37/For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands. They have committed adultery with their idols and even sacrificed their children, whom they bore to me, passing them through the fire to consume them.
26:23:38/Moreover, they have done this to me: they have defiled my sanctuary on the same day and desecrated my Sabbaths.
26:23:39/For when they had slaughtered their children for their idols, then they entered my sanctuary on the same day to desecrate it; and indeed, this is what they did in my house.
26:23:40/And furthermore, you sent for men to come from far, to whom a messenger was sent; and behold, they came: for whom you bathed yourself, painted your eyes, and adorned yourself with jewelry,
26:23:41/And you sat on a majestic bed with a table prepared before it, on which you placed my incense and my oil.
26:23:42/The sound of a carefree crowd was with her; and with men of the common sort, Sabeans from the wilderness were brought in, who put bracelets on their wrists and beautiful crowns on their heads.
26:23:43/Then I said concerning her who had grown old in adulteries, ‘Now they will commit sexual immorality with her, and she with them.’
26:23:44/Yet they went in to her, as men go in to a prostitute: so they went in to Aholah and to Aholibah, the sexually immoral women.
26:23:45/But righteous men, they will judge them with the judgment due to adulteresses and with the judgment due to women who shed blood; because they are adulteresses, and blood is on their hands.
26:23:46/For this is what the Sovereign LORD says: I will bring a mob against them and hand them over to be terrorized and plundered.
26:23:47/And the mob will stone them and cut them down with their swords; they will kill their sons and daughters, and burn their houses with fire.
26:23:48/Thus, I will put an end to lewdness in the land, that all women may take warning and not imitate your lewd behavior.
26:23:49/And they will repay you for your lewdness, and you will bear the sins of your idols; and you will know that I am the Sovereign LORD.
26:24:1/Again in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:24:2/Son of man, note down the name of this day, this very day: the king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem today.
26:24:3/Tell a parable to the rebellious house, and say to them, This is what the Lord GOD says; Put a pot on, set it on, and also pour water into it.
26:24:4/Collect the pieces into it, every good piece, the thigh, and the shoulder; fill it with the best bones.
26:24:5/Choose the best of the flock, and also burn the bones under it, and make it boil well, and let the bones of it simmer in it.
26:24:6/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says; Woe to the city of bloodshed, to the pot whose scum is in it, and whose scum has not been removed! Take it out piece by piece; let no lot be cast for it.
26:24:7/For its blood is in its midst; it placed it on the top of a rock; it did not pour it on the ground, to cover it with dust.
26:24:8/So that it might provoke fury to take vengeance; I have placed its blood on the top of a rock, so that it would not be covered.
26:24:9/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says; Woe to the city of bloodshed! I will even make the pile for the fire large.
26:24:10/Pile up wood, light the fire, cook the meat thoroughly, and season it well, and let the bones be burned.
26:24:11/Then place it empty on its coals, so that its metal may become hot and may burn, and that its impurities may melt in it, that its scum may be removed.
26:24:12/It has exhausted itself with lies, and its abundant scum did not go out of it; its scum shall be in the fire.
26:24:13/In your uncleanness is depravity: because I tried to cleanse you, and you were not cleansed, you will not be cleansed from your uncleanness anymore, until I have satisfied my fury on you.
26:24:14/I the LORD have spoken: it will happen, and I will do it; I will not hold back, nor will I spare, nor will I change my mind; according to your ways and your actions, they will judge you, says the Lord GOD.
26:24:15/Also, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:24:16/Son of man, see, I am about to take from you the delight of your eyes in a single stroke: yet you must not mourn or weep, nor let your tears flow.
26:24:17/Refrain from crying, do not mourn for the dead, keep your turban on your head, and your sandals on your feet, do not cover your face, and do not eat the food of mourners.
26:24:18/So I spoke to the people in the morning: and in the evening my wife died; and the next morning I did as I was commanded.
26:24:19/And the people asked me, Won't you tell us what these actions mean for us, that you are doing?
