26:24:20/Then I answered them, The word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:24:21/Tell the house of Israel, This is what the Lord GOD says; See, I will desecrate my sanctuary, the pride of your power, the delight of your eyes, and the desire of your soul; and your sons and your daughters whom you have left behind will fall by the sword.
26:24:22/And you will do as I have done: you will not cover your face, nor eat the food of mourners.
26:24:23/Your turbans will be on your heads, and your sandals on your feet: you will not mourn or weep; but you will waste away because of your sins, and mourn for each other.
26:24:24/Thus, Ezekiel is a sign to you: according to all that he has done, you will do: and when this comes, you will know that I am the Lord GOD.
26:24:25/Also, you son of man, will it not be on the day when I take from them their stronghold, the joy of their glory, the delight of their eyes, and the focus of their souls, their sons and daughters,
26:24:26/That someone who escapes on that day will come to you, to let you hear it with your own ears?
26:24:27/On that day your mouth will be opened to the one who has escaped, and you will speak and be no longer silent: and you will be a sign to them; and they will know that I am the LORD.
26:25:1/The word of the LORD came again to me, saying,
26:25:2/Son of man, turn your attention toward the Ammonites, and prophesy against them;
26:25:3/And tell the Ammonites, Listen to the word of the Lord GOD; This is what the Lord GOD says; Because you gloated over my sanctuary when it was defiled; and over the land of Israel when it was laid waste; and over the house of Judah when they were taken into captivity;
26:25:4/Therefore, I will hand you over to the people from the east to take over, and they will set up their palaces in you, and make their homes in you: they will eat your fruit, and they will drink your milk.
26:25:5/And I will turn Rabbah into a stable for camels, and the Ammonites into a resting place for flocks: and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:25:6/For this is what the Lord GOD says; Because you clapped your hands, stomped your feet, and rejoiced with all your scorn against the land of Israel;
26:25:7/Therefore, I will stretch out my hand against you, and will hand you over as plunder to the nations; and I will cut you off from the peoples, and I will cause you to vanish from the countries: I will destroy you; and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:25:8/This is what the Lord GOD says; Because Moab and Seir say, Look, the house of Judah is just like all the other nations;
26:25:9/Therefore, I will expose the flank of Moab from the cities, from his cities on his borders, the pride of the country, Bethjeshimoth, Baalmeon, and Kiriathaim,
26:25:10/To the people of the east along with the Ammonites, and will give them as possession, so that the Ammonites may not be remembered among the nations.
26:25:11/And I will carry out judgments on Moab; and they will know that I am the LORD.
26:25:12/This is what the Lord GOD says; Because Edom acted vengefully against the house of Judah and committed a grave offense by taking revenge on them;
26:25:13/Therefore this is what the Lord GOD says; I will also stretch out my hand against Edom, and will cut off both man and beast from it; and I will make it empty from Teman; and those from Dedan will fall by the sword.
26:25:14/And I will exact my vengeance on Edom through my people Israel: and they will act in Edom according to my anger and according to my fury; and they will experience my vengeance, says the Lord GOD.
26:25:15/This is what the Lord GOD says; Because the Philistines acted out of revenge, and took vengeance with spite in their hearts, to destroy because of longstanding hatred;
26:25:16/Therefore this is what the Lord GOD says; Look, I will stretch out my hand against the Philistines, and I will cut off the Cherethites, and destroy the remaining coastal people.
26:25:17/And I will unleash great vengeance on them with furious rebukes; and they will know that I am the LORD, when I lay my vengeance upon them.
26:26:1/On the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:26:2/Son of man, because Tyrus has mocked Jerusalem, saying, 'Aha, she is broken, the gateway of the peoples; she has turned to me; I will be filled, now that she is in ruins',
26:26:3/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says; 'I am against you, O Tyrus, and I will bring many nations against you, like the sea brings its waves.
26:26:4/They will destroy the walls of Tyrus and tear down her towers; I will also remove her rubble and make her a bare rock.
26:26:5/She will become a place for spreading nets in the middle of the sea, for I have declared it,' says the Lord GOD; 'and she will become plunder for the nations.
26:26:6/And her outlying villages will be killed by the sword; then they will know that I am the LORD.
26:26:7/For this is what the Lord GOD says; 'Look, I am bringing against Tyrus Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, a king of kings, from the north, with horses, chariots, cavalry, and a great army.
26:26:8/He will kill your outlying villages with the sword; he will build a siege ramp against you, construct a siege wall against you, and raise shields against you.
26:26:9/He will set up battering rams against your walls, and with his tools, he will demolish your towers.
26:26:10/Because of his horses' multitude, their dust will cover you; your walls will tremble at the noise of the cavalry, the wheels, and the chariots when he enters your gates as through a breach made in a city.
26:26:11/With the hooves of his horses, he will trample all your streets; he will kill your people by the sword, and your strong defenses will fall.
26:26:12/They will plunder your wealth and loot your merchandise; they will break down your walls and destroy your luxurious homes; they will throw your stones, timber, and rubble into the sea.
26:26:13/I will stop the music of your songs; the sound of your harps will be heard no more.
26:26:14/And I will make you a bare rock; you will become a place to spread nets; you will never be rebuilt, for I the LORD have spoken,' declares the Lord GOD.
26:26:15/This is what the Lord GOD says to Tyrus; 'Will not the coastlands tremble at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when slaughter is made in your midst?
26:26:16/Then all the princes of the sea will step down from their thrones, remove their robes, and strip off their embroidered garments. They will clothe themselves with trembling; they will sit on the ground, tremble every moment, and be appalled at you.
26:26:17/They will raise a lament for you and say to you, "How you are destroyed, city of renown, inhabited by seafaring people, strong on the sea, you and your inhabitants, who instilled fear in all who lived there!"
26:26:18/Now the coastlands tremble on the day of your fall; yes, the islands in the sea are terrified at your departure.
26:26:19/For this is what the Lord GOD says; 'When I make you a desolate city, like cities not inhabited; when I bring the deep upon you, and great waters cover you;
26:26:20/When I bring you down with those who descend into the pit, to the people of long ago, and place you in the low parts of the earth, in places desolate from antiquity, with those who go down to the pit, so that you will not be inhabited; and I will manifest glory in the land of the living;
26:26:21/I will make you a horror, and you will be no more; though you are sought for, you will never be found again,' declares the Lord GOD.
26:27:1/The word of the LORD came again to me, saying,
26:27:2/Now, you, son of man, sing a lament for Tyre;
26:27:3/And tell Tyre, you who are located at the entrance of the sea, a merchant to many peoples on numerous islands, This is what the Lord GOD says; Oh Tyre, you have claimed, 'I am of unmatched beauty.'
26:27:4/Your territory is in the heart of the seas, your builders have brought your beauty to perfection.
26:27:5/They constructed all your decks with fir trees from Senir; they used cedars from Lebanon to make masts for you.
26:27:6/The oaks of Bashan were used for your oars; the people of Ashur made your benches of ivory, sourced from the islands of Chittim.
26:27:7/Fine linen with embroidered work from Egypt was what you spread as your sail; blue and purple from the islands of Elishah was what clothed you.
26:27:8/The people of Sidon and Arvad were your sailors: your wise men, O Tyre, within you, were your navigators.
26:27:9/The elders of Gebal and their wise men were within you as your caulkers: all the ships of the sea and their sailors were in you to trade your goods.
26:27:10/Those from Persia, Lud, and Put were in your army, your warriors: they hung their shields and helmets in you; they enhanced your beauty.
26:27:11/The men of Arvad and your army were on your walls all around, and the Gammadims were in your towers: they hung their shields on your walls all around; they completed your beauty.
26:27:12/Tarshish was your merchant because of your wealth of goods; with silver, iron, tin, and lead, they traded at your markets.
26:27:13/Javan, Tubal, and Meshech, they were your traders: they exchanged human lives and vessels of bronze in your marketplace.
26:27:14/Those from the house of Togarmah traded at your markets with horses, horsemen, and mules.
26:27:15/The people of Dedan were your traders; many islands were the source of your goods: they brought you as tribute horns of ivory and ebony.
26:27:16/Syria was your trader because of your abundant manufactured goods: they traded at your markets with emeralds, purple, embroidered work, fine linen, coral, and agate.
26:27:17/Judah and the land of Israel, they were your traders: they traded in your markets with wheat from Minnith, Pannag, honey, oil, and balm.
26:27:18/Damascus was your trader in the abundance of your manufactured goods, for the wealth of all kinds of riches; with the wine of Helbon, and white wool.
26:27:19/Dan and Javan, traveling back and forth, traded in your markets: bright iron, cassia, and calamus were among your merchandise.
26:27:20/Dedan was your trader in luxurious garments for chariots.
26:27:21/Arabia and all the princes of Kedar, they traded with you in lambs, rams, and goats; these were your merchants.
26:27:22/The merchants of Sheba and Raamah, they were your traders: they traded in your markets with the finest of all spices, precious stones, and gold.
26:27:23/Haran, Canneh, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad, were your traders.
26:27:24/These were your traders in all kinds of merchandise, in blue garments, embroidered work, and in chests of rich apparel, secured with cords, made of cedar, among your goods.
26:27:25/The ships of Tarshish sang of your fame in your marketplace: and you were filled and made very glorious in the heart of the seas.
26:27:26/Your rowers brought you into great waters: the east wind has shattered you in the heart of the seas.
26:27:27/Your wealth, markets, goods, sailors, navigators, caulkers, those trading your merchandise, and all your warriors, that are within you, and all your company which is in your midst, shall fall into the heart of the seas on the day of your downfall.
26:27:28/The outskirts shall tremble at the sound of the cry of your navigators.
26:27:29/And all who handle the oar, the sailors, and all the sea pilots, shall come down from their ships, they shall stand on the land;
26:27:30/And shall raise their voices against you, and shall cry bitterly, and shall throw dust on their heads, they shall roll in ashes:
26:27:31/And they shall shave themselves bald for you, and wear sackcloth, and they shall weep for you with deep sorrow and intense mourning.
26:27:32/And in their mourning they shall sing a lament for you, and lament over you, saying, 'What city is like Tyre, like the silenced in the midst of the sea?'
26:27:33/When your goods went out over the seas, you satisfied many peoples; you enriched the kings of the earth with the abundance of your wealth and goods.
26:27:34/In the time when you are shattered by the seas in the depths of the waters, your goods and all your company within you shall fall.
26:27:35/All the inhabitants of the islands shall be shocked at you, and their kings shall be terribly afraid, they shall be disturbed in their demeanor.
26:27:36/The merchants among the peoples shall hiss at you; you shall become a horror, and never shall you be anymore.
26:28:1/The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying,
26:28:2/Son of man, tell the prince of Tyrus, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Because you are so proud and claim, "I am a God, I sit in the seat of God, surrounded by the seas," yet you are just a human, not a God, even though you think of yourself as a god:
26:28:3/Look, you think you're smarter than Daniel; no secret can be kept from you.
26:28:4/With your wisdom and understanding, you've amassed wealth, and filled your vaults with gold and silver.
26:28:5/Through your vast wisdom and trade, you've increased your wealth, and your heart has grown proud because of it.
26:28:6/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says: Because you've made your heart like the heart of a god;
26:28:7/Watch out, I'm going to bring foreigners against you, the most feared of nations. They will draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom and tarnish your splendor.
26:28:8/They will bring you down to the pit, and you will die a violent death in the heart of the seas.
26:28:9/Will you still claim to be a god in the face of your killer? You will be mortal, not a god, in the hands of those who strike you down.
26:28:10/You will die the death of the uncircumcised at the hands of foreigners. I have declared it, says the Lord GOD.
26:28:11/Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
26:28:12/Son of man, sing a lament for the king of Tyrus, and tell him, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: You were the model of perfection, full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.
26:28:13/You were in Eden, the garden of God; adorned with every precious stone—ruby, topaz, diamond, beryl, onyx, jasper, sapphire, emerald, carbuncle, and gold. Your music and craftsmanship were prepared on the day you were created.
26:28:14/You were the anointed guardian cherub. I placed you on the holy mountain of God; you walked among the fiery stones.
26:28:15/You were blameless in your ways from the day you were created until wickedness was found in you.
26:28:16/Through your widespread trade, you were filled with violence, and you sinned. So I cast you in disgrace from the mountain of God, and I expelled you, guardian cherub, from among the fiery stones.
26:28:17/Your heart became proud on account of your beauty, and you corrupted your wisdom because of your splendor. I threw you to the earth; I made a spectacle of you before kings.
26:28:18/You desecrated your sanctuaries by the multitude of your iniquities and the dishonesty of your trade. Therefore, I will bring forth a fire from within you; it will consume you, and I will reduce you to ashes on the ground in the sight of all who watch you.
26:28:19/All who knew you among the peoples are appalled at you; you have become a horror and will be no more.
26:28:20/Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
26:28:21/Son of man, set thy face against Zidon, and prophesy against it,
26:28:22/And say, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Behold, I am against you, O Zidon; and I will be glorified in your midst. And they will know that I am the LORD when I execute judgments in you and show myself holy in you.
26:28:23/For I will send disease and bloodshed into your streets, and the wounded will fall within you, with the sword against you on all sides. Then you will know that I am the LORD.
26:28:24/And there will no longer be a prickling brier or a painful thorn for the house of Israel from all those around them who despise them. And they will know that I am the Lord GOD.
26:28:25/This is what the Lord GOD says: When I gather the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and demonstrate my holiness through them in the sight of the nations, then they will live in their own land, which I gave to my servant Jacob.
26:28:26/They will live there securely, build houses, and plant vineyards. They will live in safety, when I execute judgments on all their neighbors who despise them. Then they will know that I am the LORD their God.
26:29:1/In the tenth year, in the tenth month, in the twelfth day of the month, the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
26:29:2/Son of man, confront Pharaoh king of Egypt, and deliver a prophecy against him and all of Egypt: 
26:29:3/Say this: 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Look, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the mighty dragon lying in the rivers, who claims, "The river is mine; I made it for myself."'
26:29:4/But I will put hooks in your jaws, and make the fish of your rivers cling to your scales. I will pull you out from your rivers, with all the fish sticking to your scales.
26:29:5/And I will leave you stranded in the wilderness, you and all the fish of your rivers. You will fall on the open fields; you will not be collected or gathered. I have given you as food to the beasts of the field and the birds of the sky.
26:29:6/And all the people of Egypt will realize that I am the LORD, because they have been a weak support to the house of Israel.
26:29:7/When they grasped you by the hand, you broke and tore their shoulder; and when they leaned on you, you broke and made their backs stiff.
26:29:8/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says: Look, I am bringing a sword against you, and will eliminate both people and animals from you.
26:29:9/And the land of Egypt will become desolate and ruined; and they will know that I am the LORD: because you claimed, "The river is mine; I made it."
26:29:10/So, I am against you and your rivers, and I will turn the land of Egypt into complete ruin, from the tower of Syene to the border of Ethiopia.
26:29:11/No human or animal will pass through it, nor will it be inhabited for forty years.
26:29:12/And I will make the land of Egypt desolate among desolate countries, and her cities among ruined cities will be desolate for forty years. I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them through the countries.
26:29:13/Yet, this is what the Lord GOD says: After forty years, I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples where they were scattered.
26:29:14/And I will restore the fortunes of Egypt and will bring them back to the land of Pathros, to the place of their origin, and there they will be a lowly kingdom.
26:29:15/It will be the lowest of kingdoms and will not assert itself above the nations anymore. I will reduce them so they will no longer dominate the nations.
26:29:16/And Egypt will no longer be a source of confidence for the house of Israel, reminding them of their wrongdoing when they turn to them. But they will know that I am the Lord GOD.
26:29:17/And it came to pass in the seven and twentieth year, in the first month, in the first day of the month, the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
26:29:18/Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made his army work hard against Tyre: every head was shaved, and every shoulder was rubbed raw. Yet he and his army got no reward from Tyre for the effort they put into it.
26:29:19/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says: Look, I am giving the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. He will carry off its wealth, seize its goods, and take its plunder; that will be the wages for his army.
26:29:20/I have given him the land of Egypt as payment for his labor, because they worked for me, says the Lord GOD.
26:29:21/On that day, I will make the power of the house of Israel grow, and I will enable you to speak out among them; and they will know that I am the LORD.
26:30:1/The word of the LORD came again unto me, saying, 
26:30:2/Son of man, prophesy and say, This is what the Lord GOD says; Cry out, 'Alas for the day!'
26:30:3/For the day is near, even the day of the LORD is near, a cloudy day; it will be a time of judgment for the nations.
26:30:4/And the sword will come upon Egypt, and great pain will be in Ethiopia, when the slain fall in Egypt, and they take away her multitude, and her foundations are broken down.
26:30:5/Ethiopia, Libya, Lydia, all the mixed peoples, Chub, and the men of the land that is in league, will fall with them by the sword.
26:30:6/This is what the LORD says; Those who support Egypt will fall; and the pride of her power will come down: from the tower of Syene they will fall in it by the sword, says the Lord GOD.
26:30:7/And they will be desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate, and her cities will be in the midst of the cities that are wasted.
26:30:8/And they will know that I am the LORD, when I set a fire in Egypt, and when all her helpers are destroyed.
26:30:9/On that day, messengers will go forth from me in ships to frighten the complacent Ethiopians, and great pain will come upon them, as in the day of Egypt; for, look, it comes.
26:30:10/This is what the Lord GOD says; I will also end the multitude of Egypt by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
26:30:11/He and his people with him, the most feared of the nations, will be brought to destroy the land: and they will draw their swords against Egypt, and fill the land with the slain.
26:30:12/And I will dry up the rivers, and sell the land into the hands of the wicked: and I will make the land desolate, and all that is in it, by the hand of foreigners: I the LORD have spoken it.
26:30:13/This is what the Lord GOD says; I will also destroy the idols, and I will make their images cease out of Noph; and there will no longer be a prince in the land of Egypt: and I will instill fear in the land of Egypt.
26:30:14/And I will make Pathros desolate, and will set fire in Zoan, and will execute judgments in No.
26:30:15/And I will pour out my fury upon Sin, the stronghold of Egypt; and I will eliminate the multitude of No.
26:30:16/And I will set fire in Egypt: Sin will be in great pain, and No will be torn apart, and Noph will face distresses daily.
26:30:17/The young men of Aven and of Pibeseth will fall by the sword: and these cities will go into captivity.
26:30:18/At Tehaphnehes also the day will be darkened, when I break there the yokes of Egypt: and the pride of her strength will end in her: as for her, a cloud will cover her, and her daughters will go into captivity.
26:30:19/Thus will I execute judgments in Egypt: and they will know that I am the LORD.
26:30:20/And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, in the seventh day of the month, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying, 
26:30:21/Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and, look, it will not be bound up to be healed, to put a splint to bind it, to make it strong to hold the sword.
26:30:22/Therefore this is what the Lord GOD says; Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and will break his arms, the strong, and that which was broken; and I will cause the sword to fall out of his hand.
26:30:23/And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.
26:30:24/And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and put my sword in his hand: but I will break Pharaoh’s arms, and he will groan before him with the groanings of a fatally wounded man.
26:30:25/But I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh will fall down; and they will know that I am the LORD, when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he stretches it out upon the land of Egypt.
26:30:26/And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them among the countries; and they will know that I am the LORD.
26:31:1/And it happened in the eleventh year, on the first day of the third month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:31:2/Son of man, speak to Pharaoh king of Egypt, and to his multitude; Who do you think you compare to in your greatness?
26:31:3/Look, the Assyrian was like a cedar in Lebanon with beautiful branches, and a shadowing canopy, towering high; its top was among the dense branches.
26:31:4/The waters made him grow, the deep lifted him up with its rivers flowing around his base, sending out streams to all the trees of the field.
26:31:5/So his height was higher than all the trees of the field, his branches grew thick, and his shoots extended because of the abundant waters.
26:31:6/All the birds of the sky nested in his branches, and under his branches all the wild animals gave birth, and under his shade lived all great nations.
26:31:7/So he was magnificent in his greatness, in the length of his branches: for his roots were beside abundant waters.
26:31:8/Not even the cedars in the garden of God could overshadow him: the fir trees did not match his branches, and the chestnut trees were not like his branches; no tree in the garden of God was as beautiful as he.
26:31:9/I made him beautiful with his many branches: so that all the trees of Eden, in the garden of God, envied him.
26:31:10/Therefore this is what the Sovereign LORD says; Because you have grown tall in stature, and he has raised his top among the dense branches, and his heart is proud of his height;
26:31:11/I have handed him over to a mighty nation; he will surely deal with him: I have expelled him for his wickedness.
26:31:12/And foreigners, the most fearsome of nations, have cut him down, leaving him: on the mountains and in all the valleys his branches have fallen, and his limbs are broken by all the streams of the land; and all the people of the earth have left his shade and abandoned him.
26:31:13/On his fallen trunk will all the birds of the sky rest, and all the wild animals will climb on his branches:
26:31:14/So that no trees by the waters grow proud of their height, nor raise their tops among the dense branches, nor stand tall in their height, all those that drink water: for they are all destined for death, to the depths of the earth, among mortals, with those who go down to the pit.
26:31:15/This is what the Sovereign LORD says; On the day he was brought down to the grave I caused mourning: I covered the deep for him, and held back its streams, and the great waters were stopped: and I made Lebanon mourn for him, and all the trees of the field wilted for him.
26:31:16/I caused the nations to tremble at the sound of his fall, when I sent him down to the grave with those who descend into the pit: and all the choice trees of Eden, the best of Lebanon, all that drink water, will be consoled in the depths of the earth.
26:31:17/They also descended to the grave with him, to those killed by the sword; and those who were his support, who lived under his shadow among the nations.
26:31:18/Who then are you like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? Yet you will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the depths of the earth: you will lie among the uncircumcised, with those killed by the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his multitude, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:32:1/And it happened in the twelfth year, on the first day of the twelfth month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:32:2/Son of man, sing a lament for Pharaoh king of Egypt, and tell him, You are like a young lion among the nations, and like a whale in the seas: you surged forth with your rivers, stirred up the waters with your feet, and muddied their rivers.
26:32:3/This is what the Sovereign LORD says; I will therefore spread my net over you with a group of many people; and they will haul you up in my net.
26:32:4/Then I will leave you on the land, I will throw you out into the open field, and will make all the birds of the sky settle on you, and I will satisfy the wild animals of the entire earth with you.
26:32:5/And I will spread your flesh on the mountains, and fill the valleys with your remains.
26:32:6/I will also drench the land with your blood, up to the mountains; and the riverbeds will be full of you.
26:32:7/And when I extinguish you, I will cover the skies, and darken their stars; I will cover the sun with clouds, and the moon will not shine.
26:32:8/All the shining lights in the heavens I will darken over you, and bring darkness upon your land, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:32:9/I will also trouble the hearts of many people, when I bring your destruction among the nations, into countries you have not known.
26:32:10/Indeed, I will make many people shocked at you, and their kings will shudder with fear because of you, when I brandish my sword before them; and they will tremble every moment, each one fearing for his own life, on the day of your downfall.
26:32:11/For this is what the Sovereign LORD says; The sword of the king of Babylon will come upon you.
26:32:12/By the swords of the mighty I will make your multitude fall, the most fearsome of the nations, all of them: and they will plunder the splendor of Egypt, and all its multitude will be destroyed.
26:32:13/I will also eliminate all its animals from beside the great waters; no human foot will stir them again, nor will the hooves of animals disturb them.
26:32:14/Then I will make their waters clear, and cause their rivers to flow smoothly, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:32:15/When I make the land of Egypt desolate, and the country is stripped of everything it contained, when I strike down all who live there, then they will know that I am the LORD.
26:32:16/This is the lament they will chant for her: the daughters of the nations will chant it; for Egypt and all her multitude they will chant it, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:32:17/It also happened in the twelfth year, on the fifteenth day of the month, that the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:32:18/Son of man, mourn for the multitude of Egypt, and cast them down, her and the daughters of majestic nations, to the lower parts of the earth, with those who go down to the pit.
26:32:19/Whom do you surpass in beauty? Go down, and be laid to rest with the uncircumcised.
26:32:20/They will fall among those slain by the sword: she is handed over to the sword: pull her and all her multitudes.
26:32:21/The strong among the mighty will speak to him from the depths of the grave with those who helped him: they have gone down, they lie still, slain by the sword.
26:32:22/Asshur is there and all her company; their graves surround him, all of them slain, fallen by the sword:
26:32:23/Whose graves are set in the sides of the pit, and her company is all around her grave; all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who spread terror in the land of the living.
26:32:24/There is Elam and all her multitude around her grave, all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who went down uncircumcised to the lower parts of the earth, who spread their terror in the land of the living; yet they have borne their disgrace with those who go down to the pit.
26:32:25/They have made her a bed among the slain with all her multitude; her graves surround him; all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword. Despite causing terror in the land of the living, they have borne their disgrace with those who go down to the pit; he is placed among those who are slain.
26:32:26/There is Meshech, Tubal, and all her multitude; her graves surround him; all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, though they caused their terror in the land of the living.
26:32:27/And they will not lie with the warriors who fell of the uncircumcised, who went down to the grave with their weapons of war, placing their swords under their heads, but their sins rest on their bones, even though they were once the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.
26:32:28/Yes, you will be shattered among the uncircumcised, and will lie with those slain by the sword.
26:32:29/There is Edom, her kings, and all her princes, who despite their might are laid with those slain by the sword; they will lie with the uncircumcised, and with those who go down to the pit.
26:32:30/There are the princes of the north, all of them, and all the Sidonians, who have gone down with the slain; in spite of the terror their might inspired, they are ashamed of their power; and they lie uncircumcised with those slain by the sword, and bear their disgrace with those who go down to the pit.
26:32:31/Pharaoh will see them and will be comforted over all his multitude, Pharaoh and all his army, slain by the sword, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:32:32/For I have spread my terror in the land of the living: and he will be laid to rest among the uncircumcised with those slain by the sword, Pharaoh and all his multitude, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:33:1/Once again, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:33:2/Human, speak to your people and tell them, 'When I send a sword against a land, and the people of the land choose someone from their outskirts to be their watchman,
26:33:3/If he sees the sword coming upon the land and blows the trumpet to warn the people,
26:33:4/Then anyone who hears the trumpet but doesn't heed the warning, if the sword comes and takes them away, their blood will be on their own head.
26:33:5/They heard the sound of the trumpet but didn't take warning; their blood will be on them. However, those who take warning will save their lives.
26:33:6/But if the watchman sees the sword coming and doesn't blow the trumpet, so the people aren't warned, and the sword comes and takes someone from among them, that person is taken away because of their sin, but I will hold the watchman responsible for their blood.
26:33:7/So you, human, I have made you a watchman for the house of Israel; therefore, listen to what I say and warn them for me.
26:33:8/When I say to the wicked, 'You will surely die,' and you don't speak out to warn the wicked from their ways, that wicked person will die in their sin, but I will hold you responsible for their blood.
26:33:9/However, if you do warn the wicked to turn from their ways and they do not do so, they will die in their sin, but you will have saved yourself.
26:33:10/Therefore, human, tell the house of Israel, 'You say, "Our offenses and sins weigh us down, and we are wasting away because of them. How then can we live?"'
26:33:11/Tell them, 'As surely as I live, declares the Sovereign LORD, I take no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but rather that they turn from their ways and live. Turn! Turn from your evil ways! Why will you die, O house of Israel?'
26:33:12/Therefore, human, say to your people, 'The righteousness of the righteous will not save them when they continue to commit sins, and the wickedness of the wicked will not cause them to stumble when they turn from their wickedness. And the righteous will not be able to live by their righteousness when they sin.'
26:33:13/When I tell the righteous that they will surely live, but then they trust in their righteousness and commit sin, none of their righteous deeds will be remembered; because of the sin they have committed, they will die.
26:33:14/Again, when I say to the wicked, 'You will surely die,' if they turn from their sin and do what is just and right,
26:33:15/If the wicked give back what they took in pledge, return what they have stolen, follow the decrees that give life, and do no evil, they will surely live; they will not die.
26:33:16/None of the sins they have committed will be held against them; they have done what is just and right; they will surely live.
26:33:17/Yet your people say, 'The Lord's way is not fair,' but it is their own way that is not fair.
26:33:18/When the righteous turn from their righteousness and commit iniquity, they will die because of it.
26:33:19/But if the wicked turn from their wickedness and do what is just and right, they will live by doing so.
26:33:20/Yet you say, 'The Lord's way is not fair.' O house of Israel, I will judge each of you according to your own ways.
26:33:21/In the twelfth year of our exile, in the tenth month, on the fifth day of the month, someone who had escaped from Jerusalem came to me and said, 'The city has been captured.'
26:33:22/The hand of the LORD was on me that evening, before the escapee arrived; He had opened my mouth, so when the man came to me in the morning, my mouth was opened and I was no longer silent.
26:33:23/Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:33:24/Human, those living in the ruins in the land of Israel are saying, 'Abraham was only one man, yet he possessed the land. But we are many; surely the land has been given to us as a possession.'
26:33:25/Therefore tell them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: You eat meat with the blood still in it, you look to your idols, and you shed blood; should you then possess the land?
26:33:26/You rely on your swords, you do detestable things, and each of you defiles his neighbor's wife. Should you then possess the land?'
26:33:27/Tell them, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: As surely as I live, those in the ruins will fall by the sword, those in the open field I will give to the beasts to be devoured, and those in strongholds and caves will die of disease.
26:33:28/I will make the land utterly desolate, and its proud strength will come to an end, and the mountains of Israel will be so desolate that no one will dare to pass through them.
26:33:29/Then they will know that I am the LORD, when I have made the land a desolate wasteland because of all the detestable things they have done.'
26:33:30/Also, human, your people are talking about you by the walls and at the doors of the houses, saying to each other, 'Come and hear the message that has come from the LORD.'
26:33:31/They come to you as people do, they sit before you as my people, and they listen to your words, but they do not put them into practice. With their mouths they express devotion, but their hearts are greedy for unjust gain.
26:33:32/Indeed, to them you are nothing more than one who sings love songs with a beautiful voice and plays an instrument well, for they hear your words but do not put them into practice.
26:33:33/When all this comes true—and it surely will—then they will know that a prophet has been among them.
26:34:1/And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:34:2/Son of man, prophesy against the leaders of Israel, prophesy, and say to them, This is what the Lord GOD says to the leaders; Woe to the leaders of Israel who only take care of themselves! Shouldn't the leaders take care of the people?
26:34:3/You consume the best parts for yourselves, and you dress in the finest clothes, you slaughter the well-fed animals: but you do not take care of the people.
26:34:4/You have not strengthened the weak, nor have you healed the sick, nor bound up the injured, nor brought back the strays, nor sought the lost; but with harshness and brutality you have ruled over them.
26:34:5/And they were scattered, because there is no leader: and they became prey to all the wild animals when they were scattered.
26:34:6/My people wandered through all the mountains, and on every high hill: yes, my people were scattered over the whole earth, and no one searched or looked for them.
26:34:7/Therefore, you leaders, hear the word of the LORD;
26:34:8/As I live, says the Lord GOD, surely because my people became prey, and my people became food for every wild animal, because there was no leader, nor did my leaders search for my people, but the leaders took care of themselves, and did not feed my people;
26:34:9/Therefore, O leaders, hear the word of the LORD;
26:34:10/This is what the Lord GOD says; Look, I am against the leaders; and I will demand my people from them, and stop them from feeding the people; the leaders shall not feed themselves anymore; for I will rescue my people from their mouths, so they may not be food for them.
26:34:11/For this is what the Lord GOD says; Look, I myself will search for my sheep and look after them.
26:34:12/As a shepherd looks after his scattered flock when he is with them, so will I look after my sheep. I will rescue them from all the places where they were scattered on a day of clouds and darkness.
26:34:13/And I will bring them out from the nations and gather them from the countries, and will bring them to their own land, and feed them on the mountains of Israel by the streams, and in all the inhabited places of the country.
26:34:14/I will feed them in good grazing land, and their pasture will be on the high mountains of Israel. There they will lie down in good grazing land, and they will feed in rich pasture on the mountains of Israel.
26:34:15/I will tend my sheep and have them lie down, declares the Lord GOD.
26:34:16/I will search for the lost and bring back the strays. I will bind up the injured and strengthen the weak, but the sleek and the strong I will destroy. I will shepherd the flock with justice.
26:34:17/And as for you, my flock, this is what the Lord GOD says; I will judge between one sheep and another, between rams and goats.
26:34:18/Is it not enough for you to feed on the good pasture? Must you also trample the rest of your pasture with your feet? Is it not enough for you to drink clear water? Must you also muddy the rest with your feet?
26:34:19/And as for my flock, they eat what you have trampled with your feet and drink what you have muddied with your feet.
26:34:20/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says to them; See, I myself will judge between the fat sheep and the lean sheep.
26:34:21/Because you shove with flank and shoulder, butting all the weak sheep with your horns until you have scattered them abroad;
26:34:22/Therefore, I will save my flock, and they will no longer be prey; and I will judge between sheep and sheep.
26:34:23/And I will place over them one shepherd, my servant David, and he will feed them; he will feed them and be their shepherd.
26:34:24/And I, the LORD, will be their God, and my servant David will be a prince among them; I, the LORD, have spoken.
26:34:25/And I will make a covenant of peace with them and rid the land of wild beasts so that they may live in the wilderness and sleep in the forests safely.
26:34:26/And I will make them and the places surrounding my hill a blessing. I will send down showers in season; there will be showers of blessing.
26:34:27/The trees of the field will yield their fruit and the ground will yield its crops, and they will be secure in their land. They will know that I am the LORD, when I break the bars of their yoke and rescue them from the hands of those who enslaved them.
26:34:28/They will no longer be prey to the nations, nor will wild animals devour them. They will live securely, and no one will make them afraid.
26:34:29/And I will provide for them a renowned planting place, and they will no longer be consumed with hunger in the land, nor bear the scorn of the nations anymore.
26:34:30/Thus they will know that I, the LORD their God, am with them, and that they, the house of Israel, are my people, says the Lord GOD.
26:34:31/And you my flock, the flock of my pasture, are people, and I am your God, declares the Lord GOD.
26:35:1/Furthermore, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:35:2/"Human, turn your face towards Mount Seir, and prophesy against it,
26:35:3/And tell it, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Look, O Mount Seir, I am against you, and I will stretch out my hand against you, making you utterly desolate.
26:35:4/I will turn your cities into ruins, and you will be desolate, and you will realize that I am the LORD.
26:35:5/Because you have harbored an everlasting hatred and have spilled the blood of the children of Israel by the sword during their time of disaster, when their guilt had reached its end,
26:35:6/Therefore, as surely as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will destine you for bloodshed, and bloodshed will follow you. Since you did not despise bloodshed, bloodshed will pursue you.
26:35:7/So I will make Mount Seir utterly desolate, cutting off from it anyone who comes and goes.
26:35:8/And I will fill its mountains with the dead; on your hills, in your valleys, and in all your streams, those killed by the sword will fall.
26:35:9/I will subject you to endless ruin; your cities will not be inhabited again. Then you will know that I am the LORD.
26:35:10/Because you claimed, 'These two nations and these two countries will be mine, and we will take possession of them,' even though the LORD was there,
26:35:11/Therefore, as surely as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will act in accordance with your anger and jealousy which you showed in your hatred towards them. I will make myself known to them when I judge you.
26:35:12/And you will realize that I am the LORD. I have heard all the insults you have hurled against the mountains of Israel, saying, 'They are desolate; they are given to us to devour.'
26:35:13/With your mouth, you have boasted against me and multiplied your words against me; I have heard them.
26:35:14/This is what the Lord GOD says: When the whole earth rejoices, I will make you desolate.
26:35:15/Just as you rejoiced at the desolation of the territory of the house of Israel, so I will do to you: you will be desolate, O Mount Seir, and all of Idumea, the whole of it. And they will know that I am the LORD.
26:36:1/Also, you, human, prophesy to the mountains of Israel, and say, 'Mountains of Israel, listen to the word of the LORD:
26:36:2/This is what the Sovereign LORD says; Because the enemy has said about you, 'Aha, even the ancient high places belong to us now':
26:36:3/Therefore, prophesy and say, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says; Because you have been made desolate and surrounded on all sides, so that you became a possession for the rest of the nations and have become the subject of gossip and scorn:
26:36:4/Therefore, mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Sovereign LORD; This is what the Sovereign LORD says to the mountains and hills, to the ravines and valleys, to the desolate ruins and the deserted towns, which have become plunder and mockery to the remaining nations around you:
26:36:5/This is why the Sovereign LORD says; In the heat of my jealousy I have spoken against the rest of the nations, and against all Edom, who took my land for themselves with joyful hearts and with spiteful minds, to plunder its pasturelands.'
26:36:6/Prophesy therefore concerning the land of Israel, and say to the mountains and hills, to the ravines and valleys, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says; Look, I have spoken in my jealousy and anger because you have endured the scorn of the nations:
26:36:7/Therefore, this is what the Sovereign LORD says; I swear that the nations around you will themselves endure their own shame.
26:36:8/But you, mountains of Israel, will put forth your branches and bear your fruit for my people Israel; they are soon to come home.
26:36:9/See, I am on your side; I will turn toward you, and you will be cultivated and sown:
26:36:10/And I will increase the population upon you, the whole house of Israel, all of it; the towns will be resettled, and the ruins rebuilt:
26:36:11/And I will increase both people and animals on you; they will multiply and be fruitful: and I will settle you as in your former times, and will do more good for you than ever before; and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:36:12/Yes, I will lead people to walk on you, my people Israel; they will possess you, and you will be their inheritance; you will never again deprive them of their people.
26:36:13/This is what the Sovereign LORD says; Because they say to you, 'You land devour people and bereave your nations':
26:36:14/Therefore, you will no longer devour people nor make your nations childless, declares the Sovereign LORD.
26:36:15/I will not let you hear insults from the nations anymore, nor will you bear disgrace from the peoples any longer, nor will you cause your nations to stumble any more, declares the Sovereign LORD."
26:36:16/Moreover, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:36:17/Son of man, when the house of Israel lived in their own land, they defiled it by their actions and their conduct; their ways were like the uncleanness of a woman in her menstrual impurity to me.
26:36:18/So I poured out my wrath on them because of the blood they had shed on the land and because they had defiled it with their idols.
26:36:19/And I scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed through the countries; according to their way and according to their actions I judged them.
26:36:20/And when they went to the nations, wherever they went, they profaned my holy name, when they said of them, 'These are the people of the LORD, and yet they had to leave his land.'
26:36:21/But I had concern for my holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations where they had gone.
26:36:22/Therefore say to the house of Israel, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says; It is not for your sake, O house of Israel, that I am going to do these things, but for the sake of my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations where you have gone.
26:36:23/And I will show the holiness of my great name, which has been profaned among the nations, the name you have profaned among them. Then the nations will know that I am the LORD, declares the Sovereign LORD, when I show myself holy through you before their eyes.
26:36:24/For I will take you from among the nations, gather you out of all countries, and bring you into your own land.
26:36:25/Then I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean; I will cleanse you from all your impurities and from all your idols.
26:36:26/I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit in you; I will remove from you your heart of stone and give you a heart of flesh.
26:36:27/And I will put my Spirit in you and move you to follow my decrees and be careful to keep my laws.
26:36:28/Then you will live in the land I gave your ancestors; you will be my people, and I will be your God.
26:36:29/I will save you from all your uncleanness. I will call for the grain and make it plentiful and will not bring famine upon you.
26:36:30/I will increase the fruit of the trees and the crops of the field, so that you will no longer suffer disgrace among the nations because of famine.
26:36:31/Then you will remember your evil ways and wicked deeds, and you will loathe yourselves for your sins and detestable practices.
26:36:32/Understand that it is not for your sake I am doing this, says the Sovereign LORD. Be ashamed and disgraced for your ways, O house of Israel.
26:36:33/This is what the Sovereign LORD says; On the day I cleanse you from all your sins, I will resettle your towns, and the ruins will be rebuilt.
26:36:34/The desolate land will be cultivated instead of lying desolate in the sight of all who pass by.
26:36:35/They will say, 'This land that was laid waste has become like the garden of Eden; and the cities that were lying in ruins, desolate and destroyed, are now fortified and inhabited.'
26:36:36/Then the nations that are left around you will know that I, the LORD, have rebuilt what was destroyed and have replanted what was desolate. I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will do it.
26:36:37/This is what the Sovereign LORD says; I will also let the house of Israel ask me to do this for them: I will increase their people like a flock.
26:36:38/Like the sacred flock, like the flock at Jerusalem during her appointed festivals, so will the ruined cities be filled with flocks of people. Then they will know that I am the LORD.
26:37:1/The hand of the LORD was upon me, and carried me out in the spirit of the LORD, and set me down in the midst of the valley which was full of bones,
26:37:2/And led me around them all over: and, look, there were a great many in the open valley; and, indeed, they were very dry.
26:37:3/And he said to me, Son of man, can these bones live? And I answered, O Lord GOD, only you know.
26:37:4/Then he said to me, Prophesy to these bones, and tell them, O you dry bones, listen to the word of the LORD.
26:37:5/This is what the Lord GOD says to these bones; Look, I will make breath enter you, and you will come to life:
26:37:6/And I will attach tendons to you, and make flesh grow on you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and you will come to life; and you will know that I am the LORD.
26:37:7/So I prophesied as I was instructed: and as I prophesied, there was a noise, and look a shaking, and the bones came together, bone to its bone.
26:37:8/And as I watched, look, the tendons and the flesh appeared on them, and skin covered them from above: but there was no breath in them.
26:37:9/Then he said to me, Prophesy to the wind, prophesy, son of man, and say to the wind, This is what the Lord GOD says; Come from the four winds, O breath, and breathe on these slain, that they may live.
26:37:10/So I prophesied as he commanded me, and breath entered them, and they came to life, and stood up on their feet, an exceedingly great army.
26:37:11/Then he said to me, Son of man, these bones represent the whole house of Israel: look, they say, Our bones are dried up, and our hope is gone; we are completely cut off.
26:37:12/Therefore prophesy and say to them, This is what the Lord GOD says; Look, O my people, I will open your graves and bring you up from them, and bring you back to the land of Israel.
26:37:13/And you will know that I am the LORD, when I open your graves, O my people, and bring you up from them,
26:37:14/And I will put my Spirit in you, and you will live, and I will settle you in your own land: then you will know that I the LORD have spoken, and I have done it, declares the LORD.
26:37:15/The word of the LORD came again to me, saying,
26:37:16/Moreover, you son of man, take one stick, and write on it, For Judah, and for the children of Israel his companions: then take another stick, and write on it, For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim and for all the house of Israel his companions:
26:37:17/And join them together into one stick; and they will become one in your hand.
26:37:18/And when the people ask you, 'Won't you tell us what you mean by these?'
26:37:19/Tell them, This is what the Lord GOD says; Look, I will take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel his allies, and join them with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in my hand.
26:37:20/And the sticks on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.
26:37:21/And tell them, This is what the Lord GOD says; Look, I will take the children of Israel from among the nations, where they have gone, and will gather them from all around, and bring them into their own land:
26:37:22/And I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel; and one king will be king to them all: and they will no longer be two nations, nor will they be divided into two kingdoms anymore.
26:37:23/They will no longer defile themselves with their idols, or with their detestable things, or with any of their sins: but I will save them from all their dwelling places where they have sinned, and will cleanse them: so they will be my people, and I will be their God.
26:37:24/And David my servant will be king over them; and they all will have one shepherd: they will also follow my laws, and observe my statutes, and do them.
26:37:25/And they will live in the land that I have given to Jacob my servant, where your ancestors lived; and they will live there, they, and their children, and their children's children forever: and my servant David will be their prince forever.
26:37:26/Furthermore, I will make a covenant of peace with them; it will be an everlasting covenant with them: and I will establish them, and increase their numbers, and will set my sanctuary among them forever.
26:37:27/My dwelling place will also be with them; yes, I will be their God, and they will be my people.
26:37:28/And the nations will know that I the LORD make Israel holy, when my sanctuary is among them forever.
26:38:1/The word of the LORD came to me, saying,
26:38:2/"Human, set your sights against Gog, of the land of Magog, the top prince of Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him,
26:38:3/And say, 'This is what the Lord GOD says: Look, I am against you, Gog, the top prince of Meshech and Tubal:
26:38:4/I will turn you around, put hooks in your jaws, and lead you out with all your army, horses, and horsemen, fully armed, a huge force with shields and armor, all wielding swords:
26:38:5/Persia, Ethiopia, and Libya will join you; all of them armed with shields and helmets:
26:38:6/Gomer and all its troops; the house of Togarmah from the far north and all its troops—many peoples with you.
26:38:7/Get ready, prepare yourself, you and all the crowds gathered around you, and take charge of them.
26:38:8/After a long time, you will be called into action. In the future years, you will invade a land that has recovered from war, whose people have been gathered from many nations to the mountains of Israel, which had long been desolate. They had been brought out from the nations, and now all of them live in safety.
26:38:9/You will advance like a storm; you will be like a cloud covering the land, you and all your troops, and many peoples with you.'
26:38:10/This is what the Lord GOD says: 'At that time, ideas will come into your mind, and you will devise an evil scheme.
26:38:11/You will say, "I will invade a land of unwalled villages; I will attack a peaceful and unsuspecting people—all of them living without walls and without gates and bars.
26:38:12/You will plunder and loot, turn your hand against the resettled ruins and the people gathered from the nations, rich in livestock and goods, living at the center of the land."
26:38:13/Sheba and Dedan, the merchants of Tarshish, and all its young lions will ask you, "Have you come to plunder? Have you gathered your hordes to loot, to carry off silver and gold, to take away livestock and goods, to seize great spoil?"
26:38:14/Therefore, human, prophesy and say to Gog, "This is what the Lord GOD says: On that day when my people Israel are living securely, will you not take notice?
26:38:15/You will come from your place in the far north, you and many peoples with you, all of them riding on horses, a great horde, a mighty army.
26:38:16/You will advance against my people Israel like a cloud covering the land. In the days to come, I will bring you against my land, so that the nations may know me when I am proved holy through you before their eyes, O Gog."
26:38:17/This is what the Lord GOD says: "Are you the one I spoke of in former days by my servants, the prophets of Israel, who prophesied for years in those days that I would bring you against them?
26:38:18/But on the day when Gog attacks the land of Israel, declares the Lord GOD, my fury will rise.
26:38:19/For in my zeal and in the fire of my wrath I declare that on that day there will be a great earthquake in the land of Israel.
26:38:20/So that the fish in the sea, the birds in the sky, the beasts of the field, all the creatures that move along the ground, and all the people on the face of the earth will tremble at my presence. The mountains will be overturned, the cliffs will crumble, and every wall will fall to the ground.
26:38:21/I will summon a sword against Gog on all my mountains, declares the Lord GOD. Every man's sword will be against his brother.
26:38:22/I will execute judgment on him with plague and bloodshed; I will pour down torrents of rain, hailstones, fire, and sulfur on him and on his troops and on the many peoples with him.
26:38:23/Thus I will show my greatness and my holiness and make myself known in the sight of many nations. Then they will know that I am the LORD."
26:39:1/Therefore, you, human, prophesy against Gog, and say, 'This is what the Sovereign LORD says: Look, I am against you, O Gog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal:
26:39:2/And I will turn you around, leaving only a sixth of you, and will bring you from the north, and place you on the mountains of Israel:
26:39:3/I will knock your bow from your left hand and make your arrows drop from your right hand.
26:39:4/You will fall on the mountains of Israel, you and all your troops and the people with you. I will give you as food to all kinds of carrion birds and to the wild animals.
26:39:5/You will fall in the open field, for I have declared it, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:39:6/I will send fire on Magog and on those who live securely in the coastlands, and they will know that I am the LORD.
26:39:7/So I will make my holy name known among my people Israel; I will no longer let my holy name be profaned, and the nations will know that I am the LORD, the Holy One in Israel.
26:39:8/It is coming, and it will surely take place, declares the Sovereign LORD. This is the day I have spoken of.
26:39:9/Those who live in the towns of Israel will go out and set fire to and burn the weapons, the shields and bucklers, the bows and arrows, the war clubs and spears. For seven years they will use them for fuel.
26:39:10/They will not need to take wood from the field or cut down any from the forests, for they will use the weapons for fuel. They will plunder those who plundered them and loot those who looted them, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:39:11/On that day, I will give Gog a burial place in Israel, in the valley of those who travel east toward the sea. It will block the way of travelers, because there Gog and all his hordes will be buried. It will be called the Valley of Hamon Gog.
26:39:12/For seven months the house of Israel will be burying them in order to cleanse the land.
26:39:13/All the people of the land will bury them, and it will bring them renown on the day that I display my glory, says the Sovereign LORD.
26:39:14/They will designate men to regularly pass through the land, burying those who remain on the surface of the ground, to cleanse it. At the end of seven months they will begin their search.
26:39:15/As the travelers pass through the land, if anyone sees a human bone, they will set up a marker beside it until the gravediggers have buried it in the Valley of Hamon Gog.
26:39:16/And also the name of the city will be Hamonah. Thus they will cleanse the land.
26:39:17/And you, human, this is what the Sovereign LORD says: Call to every kind of bird and all the wild animals, 'Assemble and come, gather from all around to my sacrificial meal that I am preparing for you, a great feast on the mountains of Israel, where you can eat flesh and drink blood.
26:39:18/You will eat the flesh of warriors and drink the blood of the princes of the earth, of rams, lambs, goats, and bulls, all of them fattened animals of Bashan.
26:39:19/You will eat fat until you are full and drink blood until you are drunk, at my sacrificial meal which I have prepared for you.
26:39:20/At my table you will be filled with horses and charioteers, with warriors and all kinds of fighting men,' declares the Sovereign LORD.
26:39:21/I will display my glory among the nations, and all the nations will see the judgment I have executed and the hand I have laid on them.
26:39:22/From that day forward the house of Israel will know that I am the LORD their God.
26:39:23/And the nations will know that the people of Israel went into exile for their sin, because they were unfaithful to me, so I hid my face from them and handed them over to their enemies, and they all fell by the sword.
26:39:24/I dealt with them according to their uncleanness and their offenses, and I hid my face from them.
26:39:25/Therefore, this is what the Sovereign LORD says: Now I will restore the fortunes of Jacob and have compassion on the whole house of Israel, and I will be zealous for my holy name.
26:39:26/After they have borne their shame and all their unfaithfulness by which they were unfaithful to me, when they live securely in their land with no one to make them afraid,
26:39:27/When I have brought them back from the peoples and gathered them from the lands of their enemies, and am proved holy through them in the sight of many nations,
26:39:28/Then they will know that I am the LORD their God, for though I sent them into exile among the nations, I will gather them to their own land, not leaving any behind.
26:39:29/I will no longer hide my face from them, for I have poured out my Spirit on the house of Israel, declares the Sovereign LORD.
26:40:1/In the twenty-fifth year of our captivity, at the start of the year, on the tenth day of the month, fourteen years after the city was taken, on that very day the hand of the LORD was on me, and he took me there.
26:40:2/In a vision from God, he took me to the land of Israel and placed me on a very high mountain, where there was something like the structure of a city to the south.
26:40:3/He took me there, and I saw a man whose appearance was like bronze, holding a linen cord and a measuring rod; he was standing in the gateway.
26:40:4/And the man said to me, "Son of man, look with your eyes, listen with your ears, and pay attention to everything I'm going to show you; for you were brought here so I could show them to you. Report everything you see to the house of Israel."
26:40:5/And I saw a wall surrounding the temple area, and in the man's hand was a measuring rod six cubits long, each cubit being a cubit and a handbreadth. He measured the thickness of the wall, one rod; and the height, one rod.
26:40:6/Then he went to the gate facing east, climbed its steps, and measured the threshold of the gate, which was one rod wide; and the other threshold was also one rod wide.
26:40:7/Each guardroom was one rod long and one rod wide; between the guardrooms was a space of five cubits; and the threshold of the gate by the vestibule of the gate at the inner end was one rod.
26:40:8/He also measured the vestibule of the gate on the inside, one rod.
26:40:9/Then he measured the vestibule of the gate, eight cubits; and its jambs, two cubits; and the vestibule of the gate was on the inside.
26:40:10/And the guardrooms of the gate facing east were three on one side and three on the other, all three having the same measurements; and the jambs on both sides had the same measurement.
26:40:11/He measured the width of the entrance of the gateway, ten cubits; and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.
26:40:12/There was a barrier of one cubit in front of the guardrooms on one side and a barrier of one cubit on the other side; the guardrooms were six cubits on one side and six cubits on the other side.
26:40:13/Then he measured the gate from the roof of one guardroom to the roof of another; the width was twenty-five cubits, door opposite door.
26:40:14/He also made posts of sixty cubits; even to the post of the courtyard all around the gate.
26:40:15/And from the front of the gate at the entrance to the front of the inner vestibule of the gate was fifty cubits.
26:40:16/There were shuttered windows looking toward the guardrooms and toward their posts within the gate all around, and similarly for the arches. And there were windows all around inside, and on each post were palm tree decorations.
26:40:17/Then he brought me into the outer court, and there were chambers and a pavement made all around the court; thirty chambers faced the pavement.
26:40:18/And the pavement ran along the side of the gates, corresponding to the length of the gates; this was the lower pavement.
26:40:19/Then he measured the width from the front of the lower gate to the front of the inner court on the outside, one hundred cubits on the east and on the north.
26:40:20/And the gate of the outer court that faced north, he measured its length and its width.
26:40:21/Its guardrooms, three on this side and three on that side, its posts and its arches, had the same measurements as the first gate; its length was fifty cubits, and its width twenty-five cubits.
26:40:22/Its windows, its arches, and its palm tree decorations had the same measurements as the gate facing east; seven steps led up to it, and its archway was in front of them.
26:40:23/And the gate of the inner court was opposite the gate to the north and to the east; he measured from gate to gate, one hundred cubits.
26:40:24/Then he led me to the south, and there was a gate facing south; he measured its posts and its arches according to these measurements.
26:40:25/And there were windows in it and in its arches all around like those windows; the length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.
26:40:26/Seven steps led up to it, and its archway was in front of them; it had palm trees on its posts, one on this side and one on that side.
26:40:27/And there was a gate in the inner court facing south; he measured from gate to gate toward the south, one hundred cubits.
26:40:28/He brought me to the inner court through the south gate; he measured the south gate according to these measurements.
26:40:29/Its guardrooms, its posts, and its arches according to these measurements; and there were windows in it and in its arches all around; it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
26:40:30/And the arches around it were twenty-five cubits long and five cubits wide.
26:40:31/Its arches faced the outer court; palm trees were on its posts, and eight steps led up to it.
26:40:32/He brought me into the inner court toward the east; he measured the gate according to these measurements.
26:40:33/Its guardrooms, its posts, and its arches were according to these measurements; and there were windows in it and in its arches all around; it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
26:40:34/Its arches faced the outer court; palm trees were on its posts, on this side and on that side; and eight steps led up to it.
26:40:35/He brought me to the north gate and measured it according to these measurements.
26:40:36/Its guardrooms, its posts, and its arches, and the windows all around; the length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.
26:40:37/Its posts faced the outer court; palm trees were on its posts, on this side and on that side; and eight steps led up to it.
26:40:38/And the chambers and their entrances were by the posts of the gates, where they washed the burnt offering.
26:40:39/In the porch of the gate were two tables on this side and two tables on that side, to slaughter the burnt offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering on.
26:40:40/And on the outside as one goes up to the entrance of the north gate were two tables; and on the other side, which was at the porch of the gate, were two tables.
26:40:41/Four tables were on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate; eight tables on which they slaughtered their sacrifices.
26:40:42/And the four tables for the burnt offering were made of cut stone, a cubit and a half long, a cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high; on these they placed the instruments used to slaughter the burnt offerings and the sacrifices.
26:40:43/And hooks, a handbreadth wide, were fastened all around inside; and on the tables was the flesh of the offering.
26:40:44/Outside the inner gate were the chambers for the singers in the inner court, which was at the side of the north gate; and their outlook was toward the south, one at the side of the east gate having the outlook toward the north.
26:40:45/And he said to me, "This chamber, facing south, is for the priests who are responsible for the temple.
26:40:46/And the chamber facing north is for the priests who are responsible for the altar; these are the sons of Zadok, who are from the sons of Levi and come near to the LORD to serve Him."
26:40:47/So he measured the court, one hundred cubits long and one hundred cubits wide, square; and the altar was in front of the temple.
26:40:48/He brought me to the porch of the temple and measured each post of the porch, five cubits on one side and five cubits on the other side; and the width of the gate was three cubits on one side and three cubits on the other side.
26:40:49/The length of the porch was twenty cubits, and the width eleven cubits; and he brought me by the steps by which they went up to it; and there were pillars by the posts, one on this side and another on that side.
26:41:1/Afterward, he took me to the temple and measured the doorposts, each six cubits wide on both sides, matching the width of the tabernacle.
26:41:2/The doorway was ten cubits wide; the sides of the doorway were five cubits on one side and five cubits on the other. He measured its length at forty cubits and its width at twenty cubits.
26:41:3/Then he moved inward and measured the doorpost at two cubits; the door at six cubits; and the doorway's width at seven cubits.
26:41:4/He measured its length at twenty cubits and its width at twenty cubits, in front of the temple, and told me, "This is the most holy place."
26:41:5/Next, he measured the wall of the building, six cubits thick; and the width of each side room around the building was four cubits.
26:41:6/The side rooms were on three levels, thirty in total, and they were inserted into the wall of the building so the rooms were connected around the building, but they did not extend into the wall itself.
26:41:7/There was an expansion and a winding staircase going upward to the side rooms because the winding staircase of the building went upward around the entire building. Thus, the width of the building increased from the lowest room to the highest through the middle.
26:41:8/I also saw the height of the building all around: the foundations of the side rooms were a full reed of six large cubits.
26:41:9/The outer wall of the side rooms was five cubits thick. The open area left was the space for the side rooms inside the building.
26:41:10/And between the rooms was a space of twenty cubits around the building on all sides.
26:41:11/The doors of the side rooms opened onto the area left free, one door facing north and another door facing south. The free space was five cubits wide all around.
26:41:12/The building facing the separated area at the west end was seventy cubits wide. The wall of the building was five cubits thick all around, and its length was ninety cubits.
26:41:13/So he measured the building, a hundred cubits long; and the separated area, and the building, with its walls, were also a hundred cubits long.
26:41:14/Also, the width of the front of the building and the separated area to the east was a hundred cubits.
26:41:15/He measured the length of the building facing the separated area at the back and the galleries on both sides at a hundred cubits, including the inner temple and the porches of the courtyard.
26:41:16/The doorposts, the narrow windows, and the galleries around their three levels, opposite the door, were paneled with wood all around, from the ground up to the windows, and the windows were covered.
26:41:17/Above the door, up to the inner room, and on the outside, and on all the walls around inside and outside, was measured.
26:41:18/It was decorated with cherubim and palm trees, with a palm tree between each cherub. Each cherub had two faces.
26:41:19/So that the face of a man was toward the palm tree on one side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the other side; it was made throughout the entire house.
26:41:20/From the ground to above the door, cherubim and palm trees were made, and on the temple wall.
26:41:21/The temple doorposts were squared, and the front of the sanctuary had the same appearance.
26:41:22/The wooden altar was three cubits high and its length two cubits; its corners, its length, and its walls were of wood. He said to me, "This is the table that stands before the LORD."
26:41:23/The temple and the sanctuary each had two doors.
26:41:24/And the doors each had two folding leaves, two leaves for one door and two leaves for the other.
26:41:25/On the doors of the temple were carved cherubim and palm trees like those carved on the walls, and there was a wooden canopy on the outside of the porch.
26:41:26/There were narrow windows and palm trees on one side and on the other, on the sides of the porch, and on the side rooms of the building, and the wooden canopies.
26:42:1/Then he led me out into the outer courtyard, the path leading northward: and he took me to the room that faced the separate area, directly in front of the building to the north.
26:42:2/The north entrance was a hundred cubits long and fifty cubits wide.
26:42:3/Opposite the twenty cubits reserved for the inner courtyard, and opposite the pavement meant for the outer courtyard, was a three-story gallery facing another gallery.
26:42:4/In front of the rooms was a walkway ten cubits wide on the inside, and the pathway was one cubit wide; their doors faced north.
26:42:5/The upper rooms were shorter because the galleries took up more space than those below or in the middle of the building.
26:42:6/They were spread over three stories but didn't have pillars like those in the courtyards: therefore, there was less space than at the lowest and middle levels from the ground.
26:42:7/And the external wall, opposite the rooms toward the outer courtyard at the front of the rooms, was fifty cubits long.
26:42:8/The length of the rooms in the outer courtyard was fifty cubits: and, look, in front of the temple it was a hundred cubits.
26:42:9/The entrance to these rooms was from the east as one enters them from the outer courtyard.
26:42:10/The rooms were part of the wall's thickness of the courtyard to the east, opposite the separate area, and opposite the building.
26:42:11/And the path in front of them was similar to the appearance of the rooms facing north, as long as they were and as wide as they were: and all their exits were both according to their designs, and according to their doors.
26:42:12/And like the doors of the rooms that were toward the south, there was a door at the head of the path, the path directly in front of the wall toward the east, as one enters them.
26:42:13/Then he said to me, "The north rooms and the south rooms, which are in front of the separate area, are sacred rooms where the priests who come near to the LORD will eat the most sacred offerings: there they will place the most sacred offerings, the grain offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering; because the place is holy.
26:42:14/When the priests enter there, they shall not leave the holy place to go into the outer courtyard without changing their garments that they serve in; for they are holy. They must put on other clothes before they go near the areas for the people."
26:42:15/After he finished measuring the inner temple, he took me out through the gate that faces east and measured it all around.
26:42:16/He measured the east side with the measuring rod, five hundred rods, by the measuring rod all around.
26:42:17/He measured the north side, five hundred rods, with the measuring rod all around.
26:42:18/He measured the south side, five hundred rods, with the measuring rod.
26:42:19/He turned to the west side and measured five hundred rods with the measuring rod.
26:42:20/He measured it on all four sides: it had a wall all around, five hundred rods long and five hundred rods wide, to separate the sacred from the common.
26:43:1/Afterward, he led me to the gate, the gate facing east:
26:43:2/And I saw the glory of the God of Israel coming from the east. His voice was like the roar of rushing waters, and the earth glowed with his brilliance.
26:43:3/It was just like the vision I had seen, the same vision I had when I came to destroy the city, and like the visions I had by the river Chebar; and I fell facedown.
26:43:4/The glory of the LORD entered the temple through the gate facing east.
26:43:5/Then the spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner courtyard, and I saw that the glory of the LORD filled the temple.
26:43:6/And I heard someone speaking to me from inside the temple while a man stood beside me.
