27:11:36/The king will do as he pleases, exalting and magnifying himself above every god, and will say unheard-of things against the God of gods. He will be successful until the time of wrath is completed, for what has been determined must take place.
27:11:37/He will show no regard for the gods of his ancestors or for the one desired by women, nor will he regard any god, but will exalt himself above them all.
27:11:38/Instead of them, he will honor a god of fortresses; a god unknown to his ancestors he will honor with gold and silver, with precious stones and costly gifts.
27:11:39/He will attack the mightiest fortresses with the help of a foreign god and will greatly honor those who acknowledge him, making them rulers over many and distributing land as a reward.
27:11:40/At the time of the end, the king of the south will engage him in battle, and the king of the north will storm out against him with chariots, cavalry, and a great fleet of ships. He will invade countries, sweeping through them like a flood.
27:11:41/He will also enter the Beautiful Land, and many countries will fall, but Edom, Moab, and the leaders of Ammon will be delivered from his hand.
27:11:42/He will extend his power over many countries; Egypt will not escape.
27:11:43/He will gain control of the treasures of gold and silver and all the riches of Egypt, with the Libyans and Cushites in submission.
27:11:44/But reports from the east and the north will alarm him, and he will set out in a great rage to destroy and annihilate many.
27:11:45/He will pitch his royal tents between the seas at the beautiful holy mountain. Yet he will come to his end, and no one will help him.
27:12:1/At that time, Michael, the great prince who protects your people, will arise. There will be a period of distress unlike anything that has happened from the beginning of nations until then. But at that time, your people—everyone whose name is found written in the book—will be rescued.
27:12:2/Many of those who lie in the dust of the earth will awake, some to eternal life, and others to shame and eternal disgrace.
27:12:3/Those who are wise will shine like the brightness of the heavens, and those who lead many to righteousness will shine like the stars forever and ever.
27:12:4/But you, Daniel, keep these words secret and seal the book until the end of time. Many will search eagerly, and knowledge will increase.
27:12:5/Then I, Daniel, looked, and there before me stood two others, one on each side of the riverbank.
27:12:6/One of them asked the man dressed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, "How long until the end of these astonishing events?"
27:12:7/And I heard the man dressed in linen, who was above the waters of the river, when he raised his right and left hands toward heaven and swore by the one who lives forever that it would be for a time, times, and half a time. When the power of the holy people has been finally broken, all these things will be completed.
27:12:8/I heard, but I did not understand. So I asked, "My lord, what will the outcome of all this be?"
27:12:9/He replied, "Go your way, Daniel, because the words are rolled up and sealed until the time of the end.
27:12:10/Many will be purified, cleansed, and refined, but the wicked will continue to be wicked. None of the wicked will understand, but those who are wise will understand.
27:12:11/From the time the daily sacrifice is abolished and the abomination that causes desolation is set up, there will be 1,290 days.
27:12:12/Blessed is the one who waits for and reaches the end of the 1,335 days.
27:12:13/But as for you, go your way until the end. You will rest, and then at the end of the days you will rise to receive your allotted inheritance.
28:1:1/The message from the LORD that came to Hosea, the son of Beeri, during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and during the reign of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.
28:1:2/The LORD's message began with Hosea. And the LORD told Hosea, "Go, marry a woman who has been unfaithful, and have children with her who are born of unfaithfulness: for the land has been utterly unfaithful, turning away from the LORD."
28:1:3/So he went and married Gomer, the daughter of Diblaim; she became pregnant and gave birth to a son for him.
28:1:4/And the LORD said to him, "Name him Jezreel; because soon, I will punish the house of Jehu for the massacre at Jezreel, and I will end the kingdom of the house of Israel."
28:1:5/"And when that day comes, I will break Israel's military power in the Jezreel Valley."
28:1:6/Then she became pregnant again and gave birth to a daughter. And God told him, "Name her Lo-ruhamah: for I will no longer show mercy to the house of Israel; I will utterly take them away."
28:1:7/But I will show mercy to the house of Judah, and I will save them by the LORD their God, and not by military might, nor by sword, nor by battle, by horses, nor by horsemen."
28:1:8/After she had weaned Lo-ruhamah, she became pregnant and gave birth to a son.
28:1:9/Then God said, "Name him Lo-ammi: for you are not my people, and I will not be your God."
28:1:10/"Yet the number of the children of Israel shall be like the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured or counted; and in the place where it was said to them, 'You are not my people,' it will be said to them, 'You are the children of the living God.'"
28:1:11/"Then the children of Judah and the children of Israel will be reunited, and they will choose one leader, and they will rise from the land: for great will be the day of Jezreel."
28:2:1/Tell your brothers, 'You are my people,' and to your sisters, 'You have received mercy.'
28:2:2/Argue with your mother, argue: for she is not my wife, and I am not her husband. Let her remove her unfaithfulness from her sight, and her adultery from her chest;
28:2:3/Otherwise, I will strip her bare and leave her as on the day she was born, turn her into a desert, make her like parched land, and let her die of thirst.
28:2:4/And I will show no mercy to her children because they are children of unfaithfulness.
28:2:5/For their mother has been unfaithful; she who conceived them has acted shamefully. She said, 'I will chase after my lovers, who provide me with my food and water, my wool and linen, my oil, and my drink.'
28:2:6/So, look, I will block her path with thorns and build a wall so that she cannot find her way.
28:2:7/She will chase after her lovers but not catch them; she will look for them but not find them. Then she will say, 'I will go back to my first husband, for I was better off then than now.'
28:2:8/She did not realize that it was I who gave her the grain, the new wine, and oil, who lavished on her silver and gold—which they used for Baal.
28:2:9/Therefore, I will take back my grain in its time and my wine in its season, and I will take back my wool and my linen intended to cover her nakedness.
28:2:10/Now I will expose her lewdness in the eyes of her lovers, and no one will rescue her from my hands.
28:2:11/I will also put an end to all her joy, her festivals, her new moons, her Sabbaths, and all her appointed feasts.
28:2:12/I will ruin her vines and her fig trees, which she said were her pay from her lovers; I will make them a thicket, and wild animals will devour them.
28:2:13/I will punish her for the days she burned incense to the Baals, when she put on her rings and jewelry, and went after her lovers, forgetting me," declares the LORD.
28:2:14/Therefore, I will woo her, lead her into the desert, and speak tenderly to her.
28:2:15/From there, I will give her back her vineyards, and make the Valley of Achor a door of hope. There she will respond as in the days of her youth, as in the day she came up from the land of Egypt.
28:2:16/In that day," declares the LORD, "you will call me 'my husband'; you will no longer call me 'my master.'
28:2:17/For I will remove the names of the Baals from her lips; their names will no longer be invoked.
28:2:18/In that day, I will make a covenant for them with the wild animals, the birds in the sky, and the creatures that move along the ground. I will abolish the bow, the sword, and war from the land, and will make them lie down in safety.
28:2:19/I will engage you to me forever; I will engage you in righteousness and justice, in love and compassion.
28:2:20/I will engage you in faithfulness, and you will acknowledge the LORD.
28:2:21/In that day, I will respond," declares the LORD. "I will respond to the skies, and they will respond to the earth;
28:2:22/And the earth will respond to the grain, the new wine, and the oil; and they will respond to Jezreel.
28:2:23/I will plant her for myself in the land; I will show my love to the one I called 'Not my loved one.' I will say to those called 'Not my people,' 'You are my people'; and they will say, 'You are my God.'
28:3:1/Then the LORD said to me, "Go again, love a woman who is loved by a friend but is an adulteress, just as the LORD loves the children of Israel, who turn to other gods and love flagons of wine.
28:3:2/So I bought her for fifteen pieces of silver, and a homer and a half of barley.
28:3:3/And I told her, "You must wait for me for many days; you must not be promiscuous, and you must not be with another man: and I will do the same for you."
28:3:4/For the children of Israel will live for many days without a king, without a prince, without a sacrifice, without an idol, without a priestly garment, and without household gods.
28:3:5/Afterward, the children of Israel will return and seek the LORD their God and David their king; and they will come trembling to the LORD and to his blessings in the days to come.
28:4:1/Listen to the word of the LORD, you children of Israel: for the LORD has a dispute with the people of the land, because there is no truth, no mercy, nor knowledge of God in the land.
28:4:2/Through swearing, lying, killing, stealing, and committing adultery, they break all bounds, and bloodshed follows bloodshed.
28:4:3/Therefore, the land will mourn, and everyone living in it will waste away, along with the beasts of the field and the birds of the sky; even the fish of the sea will be taken away.
28:4:4/But let no one argue or accuse another, for your people are like those who argue with the priest.
28:4:5/So you will stumble by day, and the prophet will stumble with you by night; and I will destroy your mother.
28:4:6/My people are destroyed from lack of knowledge. Because you have rejected knowledge, I also reject you as my priests; because you have ignored the law of your God, I also will ignore your children.
28:4:7/The more they increased, the more they sinned against me; I will change their honor into disgrace.
28:4:8/They feed on the sins of my people and are greedy for their iniquity.
28:4:9/It will be like people, like priest. I will punish them for their ways and repay them for their deeds.
28:4:10/They will eat but not have enough; they will engage in prostitution but not increase, because they have stopped paying attention to the LORD.
28:4:11/Prostitution, wine, and new wine take away the understanding.
28:4:12/My people consult a wooden idol, and a diviner's rod speaks to them. A spirit of prostitution leads them astray; they are unfaithful to their God.
28:4:13/They sacrifice on the mountaintops and burn offerings on the hills, under oak, poplar, and terebinth, where the shade is pleasant. Therefore, your daughters turn to prostitution and your brides to adultery.
28:4:14/I will not punish your daughters when they turn to prostitution, nor your daughters-in-law when they commit adultery, because the men themselves consort with harlots and sacrifice with shrine prostitutes—a people without understanding will come to ruin.
28:4:15/Though you, Israel, play the whore, let not Judah become guilty. Do not go to Gilgal, do not journey to Bethaven, and do not swear, 'As the LORD lives.'
28:4:16/For Israel is stubborn like a stubborn heifer. Can the LORD now feed them like a lamb in a spacious pasture?
28:4:17/Ephraim is joined to idols; leave him alone.
28:4:18/Their drink has gone sour; they continually engage in prostitution. Her rulers dearly love shameful ways.
28:4:19/A whirlwind will sweep them away, and their sacrifices will bring them shame.
28:5:1/Listen up, priests; pay attention, people of Israel; and listen closely, royal house; because judgment is coming for you, since you've been a trap at Mizpah and a net spread on Tabor.
28:5:2/Those who rebel are experts at causing destruction, even though I have rebuked them all.
28:5:3/I am fully aware of Ephraim, and Israel cannot hide from me: for now, Ephraim, you engage in unfaithfulness, and Israel is polluted.
28:5:4/They refuse to change their ways to return to their God: for a spirit of unfaithfulness is among them, and they do not know the LORD.
28:5:5/Israel's arrogance is evident for all to see: therefore, both Israel and Ephraim will fall because of their sins; Judah will fall with them.
28:5:6/They will take their flocks and herds to seek the LORD, but they won't find him; he has withdrawn from them.
28:5:7/They have been unfaithful to the LORD: they have produced offspring that are foreign to him: now a month will consume them along with their possessions.
28:5:8/Sound the horn in Gibeah, and the trumpet in Ramah: raise your voice at Bethaven, follow you, Benjamin.
28:5:9/Ephraim will be left desolate when I rebuke them: among the tribes of Israel, I have declared what will surely happen.
28:5:10/The leaders of Judah have crossed the line: therefore, I will unleash my fury on them like a flood.
28:5:11/Ephraim is crushed and judged harshly, because he willingly followed false commands.
28:5:12/So, I will be to Ephraim like a moth, and to the house of Judah like decay.
28:5:13/When Ephraim realized his illness, and Judah saw his injury, then Ephraim turned to the Assyrian, and sent to King Jareb: but he couldn't heal you or mend your wounds.
28:5:14/For I will be to Ephraim like a lion, and to the house of Judah like a young lion: I, even I, will tear them apart and leave; I will carry them off, and no one will rescue them.
28:5:15/I will leave and return to my place, until they admit their guilt and seek my presence: in their distress, they will earnestly search for me.
28:6:1/Come, let's return to the LORD. He has wounded us, but he will heal us; he has struck us, but he will bind our wounds.
28:6:2/In two days he will revive us; on the third day, he will restore us, so we may live in his presence.
28:6:3/Then we will truly know the LORD if we strive to know him. His arrival is as certain as the dawn; he will come to us like the rain, like the spring rains that water the earth.
28:6:4/O Ephraim, what should I do with you? O Judah, how should I deal with you? Your loyalty is like the morning mist, like the early dew that disappears.
28:6:5/That's why I have cut you down through the prophets; I have killed you with the words of my mouth; my judgments shine forth like the light.
28:6:6/I desire steadfast love, not sacrifice; the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
28:6:7/But like humans, they have broken the covenant; there they have betrayed me.
28:6:8/Gilead is a city of wrongdoers, stained with the blood of innocence.
28:6:9/Just as bands of robbers lie in wait for a man, so the priests band together to murder on the road to Shechem, committing shameful acts.
28:6:10/I have seen a shocking thing in the house of Israel: Ephraim's promiscuity is there, Israel is defiled.
28:6:11/Also, O Judah, a harvest is appointed for you, when I restore the fortunes of my people.
28:7:1/When I wanted to heal Israel, then the sin of Ephraim was exposed, along with the evil deeds of Samaria: for they engage in deception; and the thief enters, and a band of robbers plunders openly.
28:7:2/And they do not consider in their hearts that I remember all their evil deeds: now their own actions have surrounded them; they are in my full view.
28:7:3/They please the king with their wickedness, and the princes with their falsehoods.
28:7:4/They are all unfaithful, like an oven heated by the baker, who stops stirring after he has mixed the dough, until it rises.
28:7:5/On the day of our king, the princes have made him ill with bottles of wine; he has joined hands with mockers.
28:7:6/For they prepare their heart like an oven, while they lay in wait: their baker sleeps all night; in the morning it burns like a blazing fire.
28:7:7/They are all as hot as an oven, and have consumed their judges; all their kings have fallen: none among them calls out to me.
28:7:8/Ephraim has mixed himself among the nations; Ephraim is an unturned cake.
28:7:9/Foreigners have drained his strength, and he doesn't realize it: indeed, gray hairs are sprinkled on him, yet he is unaware.
28:7:10/And the arrogance of Israel testifies against him: yet they do not turn back to the LORD their God, nor seek him despite all this.
28:7:11/Ephraim is like a senseless dove, lacking understanding: they call to Egypt, they go to Assyria.
28:7:12/When they go, I will spread my net over them; I will bring them down like birds of the sky; I will discipline them, as their assembly has been warned.
28:7:13/Woe to them! for they have strayed from me: destruction to them! because they have sinned against me: although I have redeemed them, they have still lied about me.
28:7:14/And they have not cried out to me sincerely, when they wailed on their beds: they gather together for grain and wine, and they rebel against me.
28:7:15/Even though I have strengthened their arms, they still plot evil against me.
28:7:16/They turn back, but not to the Most High: they are like a faulty bow: their princes will fall by the sword because of the fury of their speech: this will be their mockery in the land of Egypt.
28:8:1/Sound the alarm. An eagle swoops down on the house of the LORD because they've broken my covenant and violated my laws.
28:8:2/Israel will cry out to me, "My God, we acknowledge you."
28:8:3/Israel has rejected what is good; now the enemy will chase them.
28:8:4/They've appointed kings without my consent; they've established leaders I didn't recognize. With their silver and gold, they've crafted idols, only to bring about their own destruction.
28:8:5/Your calf idol, O Samaria, has brought you down; my anger burns against them. How long until they seek purity?
28:8:6/It came from Israel: a craftsman made it, so it's not God. The calf of Samaria will be shattered.
28:8:7/They've planted the wind and will harvest the storm. It won't produce grain; if it does, foreigners will consume it.
28:8:8/Israel is consumed; now they are among the nations like a worthless vessel.
28:8:9/They've turned to Assyria, like a lone wild donkey. Ephraim has courted allies.
28:8:10/Even though they've sought alliances among the nations, I will now gather them, and they will grieve briefly over the burden of the king of princes.
28:8:11/Because Ephraim has built many altars for sinning, these altars will become his downfall.
28:8:12/I've written them profound teachings from my law, but they've treated them as alien.
28:8:13/They offer sacrifices, my offerings, and eat the meat, but the LORD does not accept them. Now he will remember their wickedness and punish their sins: they will return to Egypt.
28:8:14/Israel has forgotten his Creator and built temples; Judah has fortified many cities. But I will send fire upon his cities, and it will consume their fortresses.
28:9:1/Don't celebrate, Israel, like other nations might; for you have betrayed your God, you have chased after rewards on every threshing floor.
28:9:2/The threshing floor and the winepress won't sustain them, and the new wine will fail.
28:9:3/They won't live in the Lord's land; instead, Ephraim will go back to Egypt, and they will eat impure food in Assyria.
28:9:4/They won't present wine offerings to the Lord, nor will they please him: their sacrifices will be like mourning bread; everyone who eats it will be defiled. For their bread for their soul won't enter the house of the Lord.
28:9:5/What will you do on the solemn day, and on the day of the Lord's festival?
28:9:6/Indeed, they are gone due to destruction: Egypt will collect them, Memphis will bury them: nettles will take over their precious places for silver, thorns will invade their tents.
28:9:7/The days of punishment have arrived, the days of retribution are here; Israel will realize it: the prophet is a fool, the spiritual man is insane, because of your great sin and immense hatred.
28:9:8/The watchman of Ephraim was with my God: but the prophet is a trap of a bird catcher in all his paths, and hostility in the house of his God.
28:9:9/They have deeply corrupted themselves, as in the days of Gibeah: therefore he will remember their sin, he will punish their sins.
28:9:10/I discovered Israel like grapes in the desert; I saw your ancestors as the first fruits on the fig tree at its first season: but they went to Baalpeor, and dedicated themselves to that disgrace; and their shameful acts were as they loved.
28:9:11/As for Ephraim, their glory shall vanish like a bird, from birth, and from pregnancy, and from conception.
28:9:12/Even if they raise their children, I will make them childless, until no one is left: indeed, woe to them when I turn away from them!
28:9:13/Ephraim, as I saw Tyre, is planted in a delightful spot: but Ephraim will lead his children out to the killer.
28:9:14/Give them, O Lord: what will you give? Give them a womb that miscarries and dry breasts.
28:9:15/All their evil is in Gilgal: for there I began to hate them: because of the wickedness of their actions I will drive them out of my house, I will love them no more: all their leaders are rebels.
28:9:16/Ephraim is struck down, their root is dried up, they will bear no fruit: even if they give birth, I will kill the beloved offspring of their womb.
28:9:17/My God will reject them, because they did not listen to him: and they will be wanderers among the nations.
28:10:1/Israel is like a barren vine, producing fruit only for itself: with the abundance of its fruit, it has multiplied its altars; with the richness of its land, they have crafted impressive idols.
28:10:2/Their heart is divided; now they will be found guilty: he will demolish their altars, he will destroy their idols.
28:10:3/For now they will say, "We have no king, because we did not fear the LORD; what could a king do for us anyway?"
28:10:4/They have spoken lies, swearing falsely while making agreements: thus, justice emerges as poison in the plowed fields.
28:10:5/The people of Samaria will be terrified because of the golden calves of Bethaven: its people will grieve for it, and its priests who celebrated it will mourn, for its glory has vanished.
28:10:6/It will also be taken to Assyria as a gift to King Jareb: Ephraim will be humiliated, and Israel will regret its own advice.
28:10:7/As for Samaria, its king will disappear like foam on the water.
28:10:8/The high places of Aven, Israel's sin, will be destroyed: thorns and thistles will grow over their altars; and they will beg the mountains, "Cover us," and to the hills, "Fall on us."
28:10:9/O Israel, you have been sinning since the days of Gibeah: there they stood firm: the battle in Gibeah against the forces of evil did not defeat them.
28:10:10/I desire to discipline them; and the people will be rallied against them, when they bind themselves in their wrongdoing.
28:10:11/And Ephraim is like a trained heifer that loves to thresh grain; but I will come over her beautiful neck: I will put Ephraim to work; Judah will plow, and Jacob will break the ground.
28:10:12/Plant seeds of righteousness, harvest in kindness; break up your unplowed ground: for it is time to seek the LORD, until he comes and showers righteousness on you.
28:10:13/You have plowed wickedness, you have harvested injustice; you have eaten the fruit of deception: because you trusted in your own path, in the strength of your warriors.
28:10:14/Therefore, an uproar will break out among your people, and all your fortresses will be looted, as Shalman destroyed Betharbel on the day of battle: the mother was shattered along with her children.
28:10:15/So will Bethel do to you because of your immense wickedness: by morning, the king of Israel will be completely destroyed.
28:11:1/When Israel was young, I loved him and called my son out of Egypt.
28:11:2/But the more they were called, the more they turned away; they kept sacrificing to the Baals and burning incense to idols.
28:11:3/I taught Ephraim to walk, holding them by their arms; but they did not realize I healed them.
28:11:4/I led them with gentle ties, with ropes of love; and I lifted the yoke from their necks and bent down to feed them.
28:11:5/He will not return to Egypt, but Assyria will be his king because they refused to turn back.
28:11:6/And the sword will remain in his cities, destroying his branches and consuming them, because of their own schemes.
28:11:7/My people are determined to turn away from me. Even though they call to the Most High, none at all exalt him.
28:11:8/How can I give you up, Ephraim? How can I hand you over, Israel? How can I treat you like Admah? How can I make you like Zeboim? My heart is changed within me; all my compassion is aroused.
28:11:9/I will not carry out my fierce anger, nor will I devastate Ephraim again. For I am God, not a human—the Holy One among you. I will not come in wrath.
28:11:10/They will follow the LORD; he will roar like a lion. When he roars, his children will come trembling from the west.
28:11:11/They will come trembling like birds from Egypt, like doves from the land of Assyria. And I will settle them in their homes, declares the LORD.
28:11:12/Ephraim surrounds me with lies, and the house of Israel with deceit. But Judah still rules with God and is faithful with the holy ones.
28:12:1/Ephraim chases after the wind and follows the east wind: he constantly adds to his lies and destruction; and they form alliances with the Assyrians, and oil is transported to Egypt.
28:12:2/The LORD also has a dispute with Judah and will punish Jacob according to his actions; he will repay him based on what he has done.
28:12:3/He grabbed his brother's heel in the womb, and with his strength, he struggled with God.
28:12:4/Indeed, he struggled with the angel and overcame: he cried and pleaded with him: he met him at Bethel, and there he spoke with us.
28:12:5/Even the LORD God of hosts; the LORD is his name to remember.
28:12:6/So, turn back to your God: maintain kindness and justice, and always hope in your God.
28:12:7/He is a trader, using dishonest scales; he loves to exploit.
28:12:8/And Ephraim says, "Yet I have become wealthy, I have gained wealth for myself: in all my efforts, they will find no fault in me that is sin."
28:12:9/And I, the LORD your God since the time of Egypt, will again make you live in tents, as in the days of the appointed festival.
28:12:10/I have also spoken through the prophets, and I have given many visions, and through the prophets, I have used parables.
28:12:11/Is there wickedness in Gilead? Certainly, they are worthless: they sacrifice bulls in Gilgal; indeed, their altars are like piles of stones in the plowed fields.
28:12:12/And Jacob fled to the land of Aram, and Israel worked for a wife, and for a wife, he tended sheep.
28:12:13/And through a prophet, the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and through a prophet, he was kept safe.
28:12:14/Ephraim bitterly provoked Him to anger: therefore, his bloodguilt will be left on him, and his Lord will return his disgrace upon him.
28:13:1/When Ephraim spoke with fear, he was honored in Israel; but when he sinned by worshiping Baal, he faced his downfall.
28:13:2/And now they continue to sin more and more, creating silver idols and images with their own designs, all crafted by artisans. They even say to these idols, "Let those who offer sacrifices kiss the calves."
28:13:3/Therefore, they will disappear like the morning fog and the early dew, like chaff blown away by the wind, and like smoke from a chimney.
28:13:4/Yet I am the LORD your God since the time of Egypt, and you should recognize no god but me: for there is no savior besides me.
28:13:5/I knew you in the wilderness, in the land of severe drought.
28:13:6/They were satisfied according to their pasture; they were filled, and their heart became proud; therefore, they have forgotten me.
28:13:7/So, I will be to them like a lion; like a leopard I will lurk along their path:
28:13:8/I will confront them like a bear robbed of her cubs, and I will tear open their heart, and there I will devour them like a lion: the wild beast will tear them apart.
28:13:9/O Israel, you have brought destruction upon yourself; but your help is in me.
28:13:10/I will be your king: where is any other that can save you in all your cities? and your judges to whom you said, "Give us a king and princes"?
28:13:11/I gave you a king in my anger, and took him away in my wrath.
28:13:12/The guilt of Ephraim is stored up; his sin is kept secret.
28:13:13/The pains of childbirth will come upon him: he is an unwise son; for he should not stay long at the birth canal.
28:13:14/I will rescue them from the power of the grave; I will redeem them from death: O death, I will be your plagues; O grave, I will be your destruction: repentance will be hidden from my eyes.
28:13:15/Even if he is fruitful among his brothers, an east wind will come, the wind of the LORD will rise from the wilderness, and his source of water will dry up, and his spring will fail: he will plunder the treasures of all precious vessels.
28:13:16/Samaria will be left in ruins; for she has rebelled against her God: they will fall by the sword: their infants will be smashed to the ground, and their pregnant women will be torn open.
28:14:1/Israel, return to the LORD your God; for you have fallen due to your sin.
28:14:2/Bring your words and turn to the LORD: say to him, "Remove all our sins, and accept us graciously: so we will offer the praise of our lips."
28:14:3/Assyria won't save us; we won't rely on horses: nor will we say to our handmade idols, 'You are our gods.' For in you, the orphan finds compassion.
28:14:4/I will heal their waywardness, I will love them unconditionally: for my anger has turned away from them.
28:14:5/I will be like the dew to Israel: he will flourish like the lily, and his roots will grow deep like those of Lebanon.
28:14:6/His branches will spread out, and his beauty will be like the olive tree, and his fragrance like Lebanon.
28:14:7/Those who live in his shadow will come back; they will flourish like the grain, and grow like the vine: their fragrance will be like the wine of Lebanon.
28:14:8/Ephraim will say, "What do I have to do with idols anymore? I have heard him, and observed him: I am like a green fir tree. From me is your fruit found."
28:14:9/Who is wise, and will understand these things? Who is discerning, and will know them? For the ways of the LORD are right, and the righteous will walk in them: but the rebels will stumble in them.
29:1:1/The word of the LORD that came to Joel the son of Pethuel.
29:1:2/Listen up, elders, and everyone living in the land. Have you ever seen anything like this in your lifetime or in the lifetime of your ancestors?
29:1:3/Tell your children about it, let them tell their children, and those children tell the next generation.
29:1:4/What the palmerworm left, the locust has eaten; what the locust left, the cankerworm has eaten; and what the cankerworm left, the caterpillar has eaten.
29:1:5/Wake up, you drunkards, and cry; wail, all you wine drinkers, over the sweet wine, for it's taken away from your lips.
29:1:6/A nation has invaded my land, mighty and without number, with teeth like a lion and fangs of a mighty lion.
29:1:7/It has ruined my vines and stripped my fig trees bare, leaving them white and thrown away.
29:1:8/Mourn like a young woman in sackcloth grieving for the fiancé of her youth.
29:1:9/The grain offerings and drink offerings are withheld from the house of the LORD; the priests, the LORD’s ministers, are in mourning.
29:1:10/The fields are ruined, the ground is grieving; for the grain is destroyed, the new wine is dried up, the oil fails.
29:1:11/Feel ashamed, you farmers; wail, you vine growers, over the wheat and the barley, because the harvest of the field is lost.
29:1:12/The vine is dried up, and the fig tree is withered; the pomegranate, the palm, and the apple tree—all the trees of the field are dried up. Indeed, joy has dried up among people.
29:1:13/Dress in sackcloth and mourn, you priests; wail, you ministers of the altar. Come, spend the night in sackcloth, you ministers of my God; for the grain and drink offerings are withheld from the house of your God.
29:1:14/Declare a holy fast, call a solemn assembly, gather the elders and all the inhabitants of the land to the house of the LORD your God, and cry out to the LORD.
29:1:15/How terrible for that day! For the day of the LORD is near, and it will come as destruction from the Almighty.
29:1:16/Isn't the food cut off before our eyes, joy and gladness from the house of our God?
29:1:17/The seeds shrivel under the clods; the storehouses are desolate, the granaries are torn down because the grain has withered.
29:1:18/Listen to how the animals groan! The herds of cattle wander aimlessly because they have no pasture; even the flocks of sheep are suffering.
29:1:19/To you, O LORD, I call, for fire has devoured the open pastures and flames have burned all the trees of the field.
29:1:20/Even the wild animals cry out to you because the water streams are dried up, and fire has devoured the open pastures.
29:2:1/Sound the trumpet in Zion, and raise the alarm on my holy mountain: let everyone in the land tremble, for the day of the LORD is coming; it's almost here;
29:2:2/A day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and deep darkness, like dawn spreading across the mountains: a vast and powerful army comes, such as has never been seen before, nor will be again in the ages to come.
29:2:3/A fire consumes everything before them; and behind them, flames blaze: the land before them is like the Garden of Eden, but behind them, it's a desolate wasteland; nothing at all escapes them.
29:2:4/They look like horses; they charge forward like cavalry.
29:2:5/With a noise like that of chariots on the mountaintops they leap, like the crackling of a fire consuming stubble, like a mighty army ready for battle.
29:2:6/People are in anguish before them; every face turns pale.
29:2:7/They charge like warriors; they scale walls like soldiers. They each march straight ahead, not swerving from their paths.
29:2:8/They do not jostle each other; each marches straight ahead. They plunge through defenses without breaking ranks.
29:2:9/They rush upon the city; they run along the wall. They climb into houses; they enter through windows like thieves.
29:2:10/The earth quakes before them; the heavens tremble. The sun and moon grow dark, and the stars no longer shine.
29:2:11/And the LORD thunders at the head of his army; his forces are beyond number, and mighty is the one who obeys his command. The day of the LORD is great; it is dreadful. Who can endure it?
29:2:12/Even now, declares the LORD, return to me with all your heart, with fasting, crying, and mourning.
29:2:13/Tear your heart and not your clothes. Return to the LORD your God, for he is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger, abounding in love, and relents from sending calamity.
29:2:14/Who knows? He may turn and relent and leave behind a blessing—grain offerings and drink offerings for the LORD your God.
29:2:15/Sound the trumpet in Zion, declare a holy fast, call a sacred assembly.
29:2:16/Gather the people, consecrate the assembly; bring together the elders, gather the children, those nursing at the breast. Let the bridegroom leave his room and the bride her chamber.
29:2:17/Let the priests, who minister before the LORD, weep between the portico and the altar. Let them say, "Spare your people, LORD. Do not make your inheritance an object of scorn, a byword among the nations. Why should they say among the peoples, 'Where is their God?'"
29:2:18/Then the LORD will be zealous for his land and take pity on his people.
29:2:19/The LORD will reply to his people, "Look, I am sending you grain, new wine, and oil. You will be satisfied with them. I will no longer make you an object of scorn among the nations.
29:2:20/But I will drive the northern army far from you, pushing it into a parched and desolate land, its front columns into the eastern sea and its rear guard into the western sea. And its stench will go up; its foul smell will rise." Surely he has done great things.
29:2:21/Do not fear, O land; be glad and rejoice. Surely the LORD has done great things.
29:2:22/Do not be afraid, you animals of the field, for the pastures in the wilderness are becoming green. The trees are bearing their fruit; the fig tree and the vine yield their riches.
29:2:23/Then be glad, people of Zion, and rejoice in the LORD your God, for he has given you the autumn rains because he is faithful. He sends you abundant showers, both autumn and spring rains, as before.
29:2:24/The threshing floors will be filled with grain; the vats will overflow with new wine and oil.
29:2:25/I will repay you for the years the locusts have eaten—the great locust and the young locust, the other locusts and the locust swarm—my great army that I sent among you.
29:2:26/You will have plenty to eat, until you are full, and you will praise the name of the LORD your God, who has worked wonders for you; never again will my people be shamed.
29:2:27/Then you will know that I am in Israel, that I am the LORD your God, and that there is no other; never again will my people be shamed.
29:2:28/And afterward, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, your young men will see visions.
29:2:29/Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days.
29:2:30/I will show wonders in the heavens and on the earth, blood and fire and billows of smoke.
29:2:31/The sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the LORD.
29:2:32/And everyone who calls on the name of the LORD will be saved; for on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be deliverance, as the LORD has said, among the survivors whom the LORD calls.
29:3:1/For, look, in those days and at that time, when I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,
29:3:2/I will gather all nations and bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat. There I will put them on trial for what they did to my people and my inheritance, Israel, because they scattered my people among the nations and divided up my land.
29:3:3/They cast lots for my people, traded a boy for a prostitute, and sold a girl for wine to drink.
29:3:4/And what business do you have with me, O Tyre, Sidon, and all the regions of Palestine? Are you trying to pay me back for something? If you are, I will swiftly and speedily bring your actions back on your own heads.
29:3:5/Because you have taken my silver and my gold, and have carried my finest treasures into your temples,
29:3:6/You have sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks, removing them far from their homeland.
29:3:7/See, I am going to rouse them out of the places to which you sold them, and I will return your actions on your own heads.
29:3:8/I will sell your sons and daughters into the hands of the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, a nation far away. The LORD has spoken.
29:3:9/Announce this among the nations: Prepare for war! Rouse the warriors! Let all the fighting men draw near and attack.
29:3:10/Turn your plowshares into swords and your pruning hooks into spears. Let the weak say, 'I am strong.'
29:3:11/Come quickly, all you nations from every side, and assemble there. Bring down your warriors, LORD.
29:3:12/Let the nations be roused; let them advance into the Valley of Jehoshaphat, for there I will sit to judge all the nations on every side.
29:3:13/Swing the sickle, for the harvest is ripe. Come, trample the grapes, for the winepress is full and the vats overflow—so great is their wickedness!
29:3:14/Crowds upon crowds in the Valley of Decision! For the day of the LORD is near in the Valley of Decision.
29:3:15/The sun and moon will be darkened, and the stars will stop shining.
29:3:16/The LORD will roar from Zion and thunder from Jerusalem; the earth and the heavens will tremble. But the LORD will be a refuge for his people, a stronghold for the people of Israel.
29:3:17/Then you will know that I, the LORD your God, dwell in Zion, my holy hill. Jerusalem will be holy; never again will foreigners invade her.
29:3:18/In that day, the mountains will drip with new wine, and the hills will flow with milk; all the streams of Judah will run with water. A spring will flow out of the LORD's house and will water the Valley of Shittim.
29:3:19/Egypt will become a wasteland, and Edom will become a barren desert, because of the violence done to the people of Judah, in whose land they shed innocent blood.
29:3:20/But Judah will be inhabited forever and Jerusalem through all generations.
29:3:21/I will pardon their bloodshed that I have not pardoned: for the LORD dwells in Zion.
30:1:1/The words of Amos, who was among the herdsmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
30:1:2/And he said, The LORD will roar from Zion, and raise His voice from Jerusalem; the homes of the shepherds will grieve, and the summit of Carmel will dry up.
30:1:3/Thus says the LORD; For three sins of Damascus, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment; because they have brutally threshed Gilead with iron instruments: 
30:1:4/But I will send a fire into Hazael's house, which will consume the palaces of Benhadad.
30:1:5/I will also break the stronghold of Damascus, and eliminate the inhabitant from the plain of Aven, and the one who holds the scepter from the house of Eden: and the people of Syria will be taken captive to Kir, says the LORD.
30:1:6/Thus says the LORD; For three sins of Gaza, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment; because they took away an entire population, to hand them over to Edom:
30:1:7/But I will send a fire on the wall of Gaza, which will consume its palaces: 
30:1:8/And I will eliminate the inhabitant from Ashdod, and the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon, and I will turn my hand against Ekron: and the last of the Philistines will perish, says the Lord GOD.
30:1:9/Thus says the LORD; For three sins of Tyre, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment; because they handed over an entire population to Edom, and forgot the covenant of brotherhood: 
30:1:10/But I will send a fire on the wall of Tyre, which will consume its palaces.
30:1:11/Thus says the LORD; For three sins of Edom, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment; because he chased his brother with the sword, showing no compassion, his anger tore perpetually, and he maintained his fury forever: 
30:1:12/But I will send a fire upon Teman, which will consume the palaces of Bozrah.
30:1:13/Thus says the LORD; For three sins of the Ammonites, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment; because they have violently ripped open pregnant women in Gilead, to expand their territory: 
30:1:14/But I will ignite a fire in the wall of Rabbah, and it will consume its palaces, with shouting on the day of battle, with a storm on the day of the whirlwind: 
30:1:15/And their king will go into captivity, he and his officials together, says the LORD.
30:2:1/The LORD says: Because Moab has committed four major sins, I won't hold back punishment. They turned the bones of the king of Edom into lime.
30:2:2/But I will send a fire upon Moab, and it will consume the palaces of Kirioth. Moab will perish amid chaos, shouting, and the sound of the trumpet.
30:2:3/I will eliminate the judge from its midst and kill all its leaders along with him, says the LORD.
30:2:4/The LORD says: Because Judah has committed four major sins, I won't hold back punishment. They have rejected the law of the LORD, ignored his commands, and their lies led them astray, just like their ancestors.
30:2:5/But I will send a fire upon Judah, and it will consume the palaces of Jerusalem.
30:2:6/The LORD says: Because Israel has committed four major sins, I won't hold back punishment. They traded the innocent for silver and the needy for a pair of sandals.
30:2:7/They trample on the heads of the poor as on the dust of the ground and deny justice to the oppressed. A father and son use the same girl, desecrating my holy name.
30:2:8/They lie down on garments taken as pledges beside every altar, and drink wine bought with fines in the house of their god.
30:2:9/Yet I destroyed the Amorites before them, who were as tall as cedars and as strong as oaks, destroying their fruit above and roots below.
30:2:10/Also, I brought you up from Egypt and led you forty years in the wilderness to give you the land of the Amorite.
30:2:11/And I raised up prophets from your sons and Nazarites from your young men. Isn't this true, people of Israel? says the LORD.
30:2:12/But you made the Nazarites drink wine and told the prophets not to prophesy.
30:2:13/Behold, I am burdened by you, as a cart is burdened when it's full of sheaves.
30:2:14/Therefore, the swift will not escape, the strong will not muster their strength, and the warrior will not save himself.
30:2:15/The archer won't stand his ground, the swift-footed won't escape, and the horseman won't save himself.
30:2:16/And the bravest warriors will flee naked on that day, says the LORD.
30:3:1/Listen to this message that the LORD has spoken against you, O children of Israel, against the entire family which I brought up from the land of Egypt, saying,
30:3:2/I have only known you out of all the families of the earth; therefore, I will punish you for all your wrongdoings.
30:3:3/Can two walk together without agreeing to do so?
30:3:4/Does a lion roar in the forest when it has no prey? Does a young lion cry out from its den if it hasn't caught anything?
30:3:5/Can a bird get caught in a trap on the ground if no trap has been set for it? Can someone remove a trap from the ground if it hasn't caught anything?
30:3:6/If a trumpet sounds in a city, won't the people be alarmed? If disaster strikes a city, hasn't the LORD caused it?
30:3:7/Indeed, the Lord GOD does nothing without revealing his plan to his servants the prophets.
30:3:8/The lion has roared; who wouldn't be afraid? The Lord GOD has spoken; who wouldn't prophesy?
30:3:9/Announce in the palaces at Ashdod, and in the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say, Gather on the mountains of Samaria, and see the great chaos within it and the oppression in its midst.
30:3:10/For they do not know how to do right, says the LORD, who hoard violence and robbery in their palaces.
30:3:11/Therefore, this is what the Lord GOD says: An enemy will surround the land; he will bring down your strength from you, and your palaces will be plundered.
30:3:12/This is what the LORD says: As the shepherd rescues from the lion's mouth only two legs or a piece of an ear, so will the Israelites living in Samaria be rescued, with only the corner of a bed or part of a couch.
30:3:13/Listen and testify against the house of Jacob, declares the Lord GOD, the God of hosts,
30:3:14/On the day I punish Israel for its transgressions, I will also destroy the altars of Bethel; the horns of the altar will be cut off and fall to the ground.
30:3:15/And I will strike the winter house along with the summer house; the houses of ivory will perish, and the great houses will come to an end, declares the LORD.
30:4:1/Listen to this message, you cows of Bashan on Mount Samaria, you who oppress the poor and crush the needy, who tell your lords, "Bring us drinks."
30:4:2/The Sovereign LORD has sworn by his holiness that the time will come upon you when you will be taken away with hooks, and your descendants with fishhooks.
30:4:3/You will go out through the breaches in the walls, each cow straight ahead; and you will be thrown into the palace, declares the LORD.
30:4:4/Go to Bethel and sin more; in Gilgal, increase your sins. Bring your sacrifices every morning, your tithes every three years.
30:4:5/Offer a thanksgiving sacrifice with yeast, and announce and publicize your voluntary offerings; for you love doing this, O children of Israel, declares the Sovereign LORD.
30:4:6/I also gave you clean teeth in all your cities and lack of bread in all your places, yet you have not returned to me, declares the LORD.
30:4:7/I also withheld rain from you when the harvest was still three months away. I sent rain on one city but withheld it from another. One field received rain, and the field that received no rain withered.
30:4:8/So two or three cities wandered to one city to drink water, but they were not satisfied; yet you have not returned to me, declares the LORD.
30:4:9/I struck you with blight and mildew. When your gardens and vineyards, your fig trees and olive trees increased, the locust devoured them; yet you have not returned to me, declares the LORD.
30:4:10/I sent plagues among you as I did to Egypt. I killed your young men with the sword, along with your captured horses. I filled your nostrils with the stench of your camps; yet you have not returned to me, declares the LORD.
30:4:11/I overthrew some of you as I overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and you were like a burning stick snatched from the fire; yet you have not returned to me, declares the LORD.
30:4:12/Therefore, this is what I will do to you, Israel; and because I will do this to you, prepare to meet your God, O Israel.
30:4:13/For he who forms the mountains, creates the wind, and reveals his thoughts to mankind, who turns dawn into darkness, and treads on the heights of the earth—The LORD, The God of Hosts, is his name.
30:5:1/Listen to this word I am proclaiming against you, a lamentation, O house of Israel.
30:5:2/The virgin of Israel has fallen; she will not rise again: she is abandoned on her land with no one to lift her up.
30:5:3/For this is what the Lord GOD says; The city that sends out a thousand will only have a hundred left, and the one that sends out a hundred will only have ten left for the house of Israel.
30:5:4/For this is what the LORD says to the house of Israel, Search for me, and you will live:
30:5:5/But do not seek Bethel, do not go to Gilgal, and do not journey to Beersheba: for Gilgal will surely be taken into exile, and Bethel will come to nothing.
30:5:6/Search for the LORD, and you will live; otherwise, he might burst forth like fire on the house of Joseph, consuming it with no one in Bethel to extinguish it.
30:5:7/You who turn justice into bitterness and cast aside righteousness in the earth,
30:5:8/Search for the one who creates the Pleiades and Orion, who turns deep darkness into morning and darkens day into night: who calls for the waters of the sea and pours them out over the surface of the earth: The LORD is his name:
30:5:9/He empowers the weak against the mighty, so that the weak may challenge the strongholds.
30:5:10/They despise the one who rebukes at the city gate, and they detest the one who speaks honestly.
30:5:11/Since you trample on the poor and take from them levies of grain: you have built houses of cut stone, but you will not live in them; you have planted delightful vineyards, but you will not drink their wine.
30:5:12/For I am aware of your numerous transgressions and your significant sins: you oppress the righteous, accept bribes, and deny the poor justice at the city gates.
30:5:13/Therefore, the wise will remain silent at such a time; for it is a time of evil.
30:5:14/Seek what is good, not what is evil, so that you may live: and thus the LORD, the God of hosts, will be with you, as you have claimed.
30:5:15/Hate what is evil, love what is good, and establish justice at the city gates: perhaps the LORD God of hosts will show mercy to the remnants of Joseph.
30:5:16/Therefore, the LORD, the God of hosts, the LORD, says this; Crying will be heard in all the streets; and they will say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they will summon the farmers to mourn, and those skilled in lamentation to wail.
30:5:17/And in all the vineyards there will be wailing: for I will pass through you, says the LORD.
30:5:18/Woe to those who long for the day of the LORD! Why do you want it? The day of the LORD is darkness, not light.
30:5:19/It's as if a man fled from a lion, only to meet a bear; or went into the house, rested his hand on the wall, and a snake bit him.
30:5:20/Won't the day of the LORD be darkness, not light? Completely dark, with no glimmer of brightness?
30:5:21/I hate, I despise your festivals, and I take no delight in your solemn assemblies.
30:5:22/Even though you offer me burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept them: nor will I look at the fellowship offerings of your fattened animals.
30:5:23/Remove from me the noise of your songs; I will not listen to the melody of your stringed instruments.
30:5:24/But let justice flow like water, and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.
30:5:25/Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings during the forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
30:5:26/Yet you have carried the shrine of your king and the pedestals of your idols, the star of your god which you made for yourselves.
30:5:27/Therefore, I will send you into exile beyond Damascus, says the LORD, whose name is The God of hosts.
30:6:1/Woe to those who are complacent in Zion, and trust in the mountain of Samaria, named leaders of the nations, to whom the house of Israel came!
30:6:2/Go over to Calneh and see; then from there go to Hamath the great: then head down to Gath of the Philistines: are they better than these kingdoms? or is their territory larger than your territory?
30:6:3/You who postpone the day of disaster and bring near a reign of violence;
30:6:4/Who lie on beds of ivory and lounge on their couches, and eat lambs from the flock and calves from the stall;
30:6:5/Who sing idle songs to the sound of the harp and like David invent for themselves instruments of music;
30:6:6/Who drink wine by the bowlful and use the finest lotions, but they do not grieve over the ruin of Joseph.
30:6:7/Therefore, they will now go into exile at the head of the exiles, and the revelry of those who lounge will pass away.
30:6:8/The Lord GOD has sworn by himself, says the LORD the God of hosts, I detest the pride of Jacob and hate his fortresses; therefore, I will deliver up the city and everything in it.
30:6:9/And it shall happen, if ten men remain in one house, they too shall die.
30:6:10/And when a relative, one who burns the bodies, picks up someone to take the bones out of the house, and says to anyone inside the house, "Is anyone else with you?" and they say, "No," then he will say, "Keep quiet! We must not invoke the name of the LORD."
30:6:11/For, look, the LORD commands, and the large house will be smashed to pieces and the small house to bits.
30:6:12/Can horses run on the rocks? Can one plow the sea with oxen? Yet you have turned justice into poison and the fruit of righteousness into bitterness,
30:6:13/You who rejoice in worthless things, who boast, "Have we not taken horns for ourselves by our own strength?"
30:6:14/But, look, I will raise up against you a nation, O house of Israel, says the LORD the God of hosts; and they will oppress you from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of the Arabah.
30:7:1/The Lord GOD showed me a vision; I saw him creating locusts at the start of the late crop season, right after the king's harvest.
30:7:2/When the locusts had finished eating the crops across the land, I pleaded, "O Lord GOD, please forgive us. How can Jacob survive? He is so weak."
30:7:3/The LORD changed his mind about this. "It won't happen," said the LORD.
30:7:4/Then the Lord GOD showed me another vision: He summoned a fire that consumed the great deep and began to devour the land.
30:7:5/I cried out again, "O Lord GOD, please stop! How can Jacob survive? He is so weak."
30:7:6/The LORD changed his mind about this too. "This also won't happen," said the Lord GOD.
30:7:7/In another vision, the LORD stood beside a wall built with a plumb line, holding a plumb line in his hand.
30:7:8/And the LORD asked me, "Amos, what do you see?" I replied, "A plumb line." Then the LORD said, "Look, I am setting a plumb line among my people Israel; I will no longer overlook their sins.
30:7:9/The high places of Isaac will be deserted, and the sanctuaries of Israel will be in ruins; I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword."
30:7:10/Then Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent a message to Jeroboam, king of Israel, saying, "Amos is plotting against you within the house of Israel; the country cannot endure all his words.
30:7:11/For this is what Amos is saying: 'Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel will surely be exiled from their land.'"
30:7:12/Amaziah also said to Amos, "You seer, go, run away to the land of Judah, earn your bread there, and do your prophesying there.
30:7:13/But never again prophesy at Bethel, for it is the royal sanctuary and the national temple."
30:7:14/Amos replied to Amaziah, "I was not a prophet, nor was I the son of a prophet; I was a shepherd and a tender of sycamore figs.
30:7:15/But the LORD took me from following the flock and said to me, 'Go, prophesy to my people Israel.'
30:7:16/Now then, listen to the word of the LORD: You say, 'Do not prophesy against Israel, and do not preach against the house of Isaac.'
30:7:17/Therefore, this is what the LORD says: 'Your wife will become a prostitute in the city, your sons and daughters will fall by the sword, your land will be divided up with a measuring line, and you yourself will die in a defiled land. And Israel will certainly go into exile, away from their homeland.'"
30:8:1/The Lord GOD showed me a vision: I saw a basket of summer fruit.
30:8:2/He asked, "Amos, what do you see?" I replied, "A basket of summer fruit." Then the LORD said, "The end has come for my people Israel; I will not overlook their actions any longer."
30:8:3/The songs of the temple will turn into wails on that day," says the Lord GOD. "There will be many dead bodies everywhere, silently thrown out."
30:8:4/Listen, you who trample on the needy and destroy the poor of the land,
30:8:5/You who say, "When will the new moon be over so we can sell grain? And the Sabbath, so we can market wheat?"—skimping on the measure, boosting the price, and cheating with dishonest scales,
30:8:6/So you can buy the poor with silver and the needy for a pair of sandals, selling even the sweepings of the wheat.
30:8:7/The LORD has sworn by the pride of Jacob: "I will never forget any of their deeds.
30:8:8/Won't the land tremble for this, and everyone mourn who lives in it? It will all rise like the Nile; it will be stirred up and then sink like the river of Egypt.
30:8:9/On that day," declares the Lord GOD, "I will make the sun go down at noon and darken the earth in broad daylight.
30:8:10/I will turn your feasts into mourning and all your songs into lamentation; I will bring sackcloth on every waist and baldness on every head. I will make it like mourning for an only son, and its end like a bitter day.
30:8:11/Behold, the days are coming," declares the Lord GOD, "when I will send a famine through the land—not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water, but of hearing the words of the LORD.
30:8:12/People will stagger from sea to sea and wander from north to east, searching for the word of the LORD, but they will not find it.
30:8:13/In that day the beautiful virgins and strong young men will faint from thirst.
30:8:14/Those who swear by the guilt of Samaria, who say, 'As your god lives, O Dan,' and, 'As the way of Beersheba lives,' they will fall, never to rise again.
30:9:1/I saw the LORD standing upon the altar: and he said, Strike the top of the door so that the pillars tremble: and strike down all of them on the head; and I will kill the last of them with the sword: those who flee will not get away, and those who escape will not be saved.
30:9:2/Even if they dig into hell, from there my hand will take them; even if they climb up to heaven, from there I will bring them down.
30:9:3/And even if they hide on the peak of Carmel, I will search and take them from there; and if they hide from my sight at the bottom of the sea, from there I will command the serpent, and it will bite them.
30:9:4/And if they are taken captive by their enemies, from there I will command the sword, and it will kill them: and I will set my eyes on them for harm, and not for good.
30:9:5/And the Lord GOD of hosts is the one who touches the land, and it will melt, and everyone living in it will mourn: and it will rise up completely like a flood; and will be drowned, as by the flood of Egypt.
30:9:6/He is the one who builds his layers in the heavens, and has established his group on the earth; he who calls for the waters of the sea, and pours them out upon the surface of the earth: The LORD is his name.
30:9:7/Are you not like the children of the Ethiopians to me, O children of Israel? says the LORD. Haven't I brought Israel up from the land of Egypt? and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Syrians from Kir?
30:9:8/Behold, the eyes of the Lord GOD are on the sinful kingdom, and I will wipe it off the face of the earth; except that I will not completely destroy the house of Jacob, says the LORD.
30:9:9/For, look, I will command, and I will shake the house of Israel among all nations, like as corn is shaken in a sieve, yet not the smallest grain will fall to the ground.
30:9:10/All the sinners of my people will die by the sword, those who say, The disaster will not overtake or meet us.
30:9:11/On that day I will restore the fallen shelter of David, and repair its gaps; and I will restore its ruins, and rebuild it as in the days of old.
30:9:12/So that they may take over the remnants of Edom, and all the nations that bear my name, says the LORD who does this.
30:9:13/Behold, the days are coming, says the LORD, when the plowman will catch up with the reaper, and the one treading grapes will overtake the one sowing seed; and the mountains will drip with sweet wine, and all the hills will melt.
30:9:14/And I will restore the fortunes of my people Israel, and they will rebuild the ruined cities and live in them; they will plant vineyards and drink their wine, they will also make gardens and eat their fruit.
30:9:15/And I will plant them on their land, and they will never again be uprooted from their land which I have given them, says the LORD your God.
31:1:1/The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Lord GOD says about Edom; We've heard a rumor from the LORD, and a messenger has been sent among the nations, saying, "Get up, let's go to war against her."
31:1:2/Look, I've made you insignificant among the nations: you are deeply scorned.
31:1:3/Your own arrogance has misled you, you who live in the mountain clefts, in your lofty home, thinking, "Who can bring me down to the ground?"
31:1:4/Even if you soar like the eagle and make your nest among the stars, I will bring you down from there, declares the LORD.
31:1:5/If thieves came to you, if robbers in the night—oh, how you have been destroyed!—wouldn't they only steal until they had enough? If grape pickers came to you, wouldn't they leave a few grapes?
31:1:6/How Esau's treasures are searched out, how his hidden things are discovered!
31:1:7/All your allies have driven you to the border; those at peace with you have deceived you and prevailed against you; those who eat your bread have set a trap beneath you— you have no understanding.
31:1:8/Won't I on that day, declares the LORD, destroy the wise men from Edom, and understanding from the mountain of Esau?
31:1:9/And your warriors, O Teman, will be terrified, so that everyone from the mountain of Esau will be cut down by slaughter.
31:1:10/Because of the violence against your brother Jacob, shame will cover you, and you will be destroyed forever.
31:1:11/On the day you stood aloof, on the day that strangers carried off his wealth and foreigners entered his gates and cast lots for Jerusalem, you were just like one of them.
31:1:12/But you should not have gloated over your brother on the day of his misfortune; you should not have rejoiced over the people of Judah on the day of their destruction; you should not have boasted on the day of distress.
31:1:13/You should not have entered the gate of my people on the day of their calamity; indeed, you should not have gloated over their misfortune on the day of their calamity, nor laid hands on their wealth on the day of their calamity.
31:1:14/You should not have stood at the crossroads to cut off those who escaped; nor should you have handed over those who survived on the day of distress.
31:1:15/For the day of the LORD is near for all nations. As you have done, it will be done to you; your deeds will return upon your own head.
31:1:16/Just as you drank on my holy hill, so all the nations will drink continually. They will drink and gulp down, and they will be as if they had never been.
31:1:17/But on Mount Zion there will be deliverance, it will be holy, and the house of Jacob will reclaim their inheritance.
31:1:18/The house of Jacob will be a fire, the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau will be stubble. They will ignite and consume them, and there will be no survivors from the house of Esau; for the LORD has spoken.
31:1:19/Those from the Negev will take possession of the mountain of Esau, and those from the plains the Philistines. They will possess the fields of Ephraim and Samaria, and Benjamin will possess Gilead.
31:1:20/The exiles of this army of the children of Israel will possess the land of the Canaanites as far as Zarephath; the exiles from Jerusalem who are in Sepharad will possess the cities of the Negev.
31:1:21/And deliverers will ascend Mount Zion to govern the mountain of Esau, and the kingdom will belong to the LORD.
32:1:1/The word of the LORD came to Jonah, the son of Amittai, with a message.
32:1:2/Get up, go to Nineveh, that great city, and speak out against it; because their evil deeds have reached me.
32:1:3/But Jonah decided to run away to Tarshish, avoiding the LORD's presence. He went down to Joppa, found a ship heading to Tarshish, paid the fare, and boarded it to escape from the LORD.
32:1:4/However, the LORD unleashed a powerful wind over the sea, causing a violent storm that threatened to break the ship apart.
32:1:5/The sailors were terrified, each praying to his own god, and they threw the cargo overboard to lighten the ship. Meanwhile, Jonah had gone below deck, where he fell into a deep sleep.
32:1:6/The captain went to him and said, "What are you doing asleep? Get up and pray to your god! Maybe he will pay attention to us, and we won't perish."
32:1:7/They said to one another, "Let's cast lots to find out who is responsible for this disaster." They cast lots, and the lot pointed to Jonah.
32:1:8/So they asked him, "Please tell us, who is to blame for this disaster? What's your job? Where do you come from? What's your country? And what people are you from?"
32:1:9/He answered them, "I am a Hebrew; and I worship the LORD, the God of heaven, who made both the sea and the land."
32:1:10/The men were terrified and asked him, "Why did you do this?" They knew he was running away from the LORD because he had told them.
32:1:11/Then they asked him, "What should we do to you to make the sea calm down for us?" For the sea was getting more and more stormy.
32:1:12/He replied, "Pick me up and throw me into the sea, and it will become calm. I know that it's my fault this great storm has come upon you."
32:1:13/Despite their efforts to row back to land, they couldn't, because the sea grew even wilder against them.
32:1:14/Therefore, they cried out to the LORD, "Please, LORD, don't let us die for taking this man's life. Don't hold us accountable for killing an innocent man, for you, LORD, have done as you pleased."
32:1:15/So they picked up Jonah and threw him into the sea, and the sea stopped its raging.
32:1:16/Then the men greatly feared the LORD, offered a sacrifice to the LORD, and made vows.
32:1:17/Meanwhile, the LORD provided a huge fish to swallow Jonah, and Jonah was inside the fish for three days and three nights.
32:2:1/Then Jonah prayed to the LORD his God from inside the fish,
32:2:2/And said, I cried out because of my suffering to the LORD, and he heard me; from the depths of the grave I called for help, and you listened to my cry.
32:2:3/For you threw me into the deep, into the heart of the seas; and the floods surrounded me: all your waves and your billows swept over me.
32:2:4/Then I thought, I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.
32:2:5/The waters surrounded me, threatening my life; the deep enclosed me, seaweed was tangled around my head.
32:2:6/I sank down to the roots of the mountains; the earth with its bars closed behind me forever: yet you have brought up my life from the pit, O LORD my God.
32:2:7/When my life was ebbing away, I remembered the LORD: and my prayer reached you, into your holy temple.
32:2:8/Those who cling to worthless idols turn away from God’s love for them.
32:2:9/But with shouts of grateful praise, I will sacrifice to you; what I have vowed I will make good. Salvation comes from the LORD.
32:2:10/And the LORD commanded the fish, and it vomited Jonah onto dry land.
32:3:1/The word of the LORD came to Jonah a second time, saying,
32:3:2/Get up, go to Nineveh, that great city, and deliver the message I have given you.
32:3:3/So Jonah got up and went to Nineveh, as the LORD had instructed. Nineveh was an extremely large city, taking three days to go through.
32:3:4/Jonah started into the city, walking for a day, and he announced, "In forty days, Nineveh will be destroyed."
32:3:5/The people of Nineveh believed God, declared a fast, and everyone, from the greatest to the least, wore sackcloth.
32:3:6/When the news reached the king of Nineveh, he got up from his throne, took off his robe, covered himself with sackcloth, and sat in ashes.
32:3:7/He ordered a proclamation to be made throughout Nineveh, by the decree of the king and his nobles: "No human or animal, herd or flock, shall taste anything; they shall not eat or drink water.
32:3:8/But let humans and animals be covered with sackcloth, and let them urgently call out to God. Let everyone turn from their evil ways and from the violence in their hands.
32:3:9/Who knows? God may turn and relent, and turn from his fierce anger so that we do not perish."
32:3:10/And God saw what they did, how they turned from their evil ways; and God relented from the disaster that he had said he would bring upon them, and he did not do it.
32:4:1/But Jonah was extremely upset by this, and he was very angry.
32:4:2/He prayed to the LORD, saying, "Oh LORD, didn't I say this when I was still in my own country? That's why I ran away to Tarshish: because I knew you are a gracious and compassionate God, slow to anger, abounding in love, and you relent from sending calamity.
32:4:3/So now, LORD, please take my life from me; it's better for me to die than to live."
32:4:4/Then the LORD asked, "Do you have a good reason to be angry?"
32:4:5/So Jonah left the city and sat to the east of the city. There he made himself a shelter, sat in its shade, and waited to see what would happen to the city.
32:4:6/And the LORD God provided a plant and made it grow up over Jonah to give shade for his head to ease his discomfort. Jonah was very happy about the plant.
32:4:7/But at dawn the next day God provided a worm, which chewed the plant so that it withered.
32:4:8/As the sun rose, God provided a scorching east wind, and the sun blazed on Jonah's head so that he grew faint. He wanted to die and said, "It's better for me to die than to live."
32:4:9/But God said to Jonah, "Do you have a good reason to be angry about the plant?" And he said, "Yes, I do well to be angry, angry enough to die."
32:4:10/Then the LORD said, "You cared about the plant, which you did not labor over and did not grow; it came up in a night and perished in a night.
32:4:11/Should I not have concern for Nineveh, that great city, in which there are more than 120,000 people who cannot tell their right hand from their left—and also many animals?"
33:1:1/The message from the LORD that came to Micah the Morasthite during the reigns of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he received concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
33:1:2/Listen up, everyone; pay attention, Earth, and everything in it: and let the Lord GOD stand as a witness against you, the LORD from his holy temple.
33:1:3/For, look, the LORD is leaving his place and will descend to walk on the high places of the earth.
33:1:4/And the mountains will melt under him, and the valleys will split open, like wax before the fire, and like water rushing down a slope.
33:1:5/All this is because of Jacob's rebellion and the sins of the house of Israel. What is Jacob's rebellion? Isn't it Samaria? And what are Judah's high places? Aren't they Jerusalem?
33:1:6/So, I will turn Samaria into a pile of rubble in the field, like a spot for planting a vineyard: and I will tumble its stones down into the valley, revealing its foundations.
33:1:7/And all its carved images will be smashed, all its paid-for treasures will be burned with fire, and all its idols I will leave in ruins: because she earned them through prostitution, and they will go back to being used for prostitution.
33:1:8/That's why I will wail and howl, I will go about bare and naked: I will wail like the dragons and mourn like the owls.
33:1:9/Because her injury is fatal; it has reached Judah; it has reached the gate of my people, all the way to Jerusalem.
33:1:10/Don't announce it in Gath, don't cry at all: in the house of Aphrah roll yourself in the dust.
33:1:11/Move on, you who live in Saphir, in shameful nakedness: the residents of Zaanan did not come out to mourn for Bethezel; they will receive from you their stand.
33:1:12/The residents of Maroth anxiously waited for relief, but disaster came from the LORD to the gate of Jerusalem.
33:1:13/You who live in Lachish, hitch the chariot to the fastest horses: you were the beginning of sin for the daughter of Zion, for in you were found the transgressions of Israel.
33:1:14/Therefore, you must send gifts to Moreshethgath: the houses of Achzib will prove to be a deception to the kings of Israel.
33:1:15/Yet I will bring an heir to you, O resident of Mareshah: he will come to Adullam, the glory of Israel.
33:1:16/Shave your head and cut off your hair in mourning for your precious children; make your baldness as wide as an eagle; for they have gone into captivity away from you.
33:2:1/Doom to those who plan wrongdoing and do evil deeds in their beds! When daylight comes, they carry it out because they have the power to do so.
33:2:2/They covet fields and seize them by force; they desire houses and take them: thus they oppress people and their homes, even a person and their inheritance.
33:2:3/Therefore, this is what the LORD says; Look, I am planning a disaster against this family from which you won't be able to escape; you will no longer walk proudly, for it will be a time of calamity.
33:2:4/On that day, someone will recite a sad story about you, mourn with a bitter cry, and say, 'We are completely ruined: he has transferred the rights of my people; how he has taken them away from me! He has divided our fields among others.'
33:2:5/As a result, you will have no one in the LORD's assembly to throw a measuring line for land.
33:2:6/'Don't prophesy,' they tell the prophets. 'Don't prophesy about these things; disgrace will not overtake us.'
33:2:7/You who are called the house of Jacob, is the spirit of the LORD limited? Are these his actions? Don't my words benefit those who live righteously?
33:2:8/Recently, my people have acted as an enemy: you strip the rich robe from those who pass by without a care, like men returning from battle.
33:2:9/You have driven the women of my people from their comfortable homes; from their children, you have taken away my glory forever.
33:2:10/Get up and go, for this is not your place of rest; because it is defiled, it will destroy you with a grievous destruction.
33:2:11/If someone deceitfully prophesies about wine and strong drink, he would be the preferred prophet of this people.
33:2:12/I will surely gather all of you, Jacob; I will surely bring together the remnant of Israel. I will bring them together like sheep in a pen, like a flock in its pasture, noisy with people.
33:2:13/The one who breaks open the way will go up before them; they will break through the gate and go out. Their king will pass through before them, the LORD at their head.
33:3:1/And I said, Listen, please, O leaders of Jacob, and you rulers of the house of Israel; Shouldn't you know how to make fair decisions?
33:3:2/Who despise what is good, and love what is evil; who tear off their skin and their flesh from their bones;
33:3:3/Who also consume the flesh of my people, and strip their skin from them; they break their bones, and cut them up like meat for the pot, like flesh in the cauldron.
33:3:4/Then they will cry to the LORD, but he will not listen to them: he will even hide his face from them at that time, because they have acted terribly in their deeds.
33:3:5/This is what the LORD says about the prophets who lead my people astray, who bite with their teeth and proclaim, 'Peace'; and if someone doesn't feed them, they prepare to declare war against him.
33:3:6/Therefore, you will be in darkness, unable to see visions; it will be dark for you, unable to predict; and the sun will set on the prophets, and the day will turn dark over them.
33:3:7/Then the seers will be ashamed, and the diviners disgraced: indeed, they will all cover their mouths; for there will be no answer from God.
33:3:8/But truly I am filled with power by the spirit of the LORD, and with justice and strength, to declare to Jacob his wrongdoing, and to Israel his sin.
33:3:9/Listen to this, I beg you, you leaders of the house of Jacob, and rulers of the house of Israel, who detest fair judgment, and twist all that is right.
33:3:10/They build Zion with bloodshed, and Jerusalem with wrongdoing.
33:3:11/The leaders judge for bribes, the priests teach for a price, and the prophets tell fortunes for money: yet they rely on the LORD, saying, 'Isn't the LORD among us? No disaster will come upon us.'
33:3:12/Therefore, because of you, Zion will be plowed like a field, Jerusalem will become ruins, and the mountain of the temple will be like the high places of a forest.
33:4:1/But in the last days, it will happen that the mountain where the LORD's house stands will be the highest of all, towering over the hills. People from all over will stream to it.
33:4:2/And many nations will come and say, "Let's go up to the mountain of the LORD, to the house of the God of Jacob. He will teach us his ways, so we can walk in his paths." The law will come from Zion, the word of the LORD from Jerusalem.
