33:4:3/He will settle disputes for many peoples and correct strong nations far away. They'll turn their swords into plowshares and their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not take up sword against nation, nor will they train for war anymore.
33:4:4/Everyone will sit under their own vine and under their own fig tree, with no one to make them afraid, because the LORD Almighty has said so.
33:4:5/All people will walk in the name of their god, and we will walk in the name of the LORD our God forever and ever.
33:4:6/On that day, says the LORD, I will gather those who are limping and assemble those who were scattered and those I have hurt.
33:4:7/I will make the limping ones a remnant and those who were far off a strong nation. The LORD will rule over them on Mount Zion from that day and forever.
33:4:8/And you, watchtower of the flock, stronghold of Daughter Zion, to you it will come, even the former dominion will come, the kingdom to Daughter Jerusalem.
33:4:9/Now why do you cry out loud? Is there no king in you? Has your counselor perished, that pain seizes you like a woman in labor?
33:4:10/Writhe in agony and labor to give birth, Daughter Zion, like a woman in childbirth. For now you must leave the city to camp in the open field. You will go to Babylon; there you will be rescued. There the LORD will redeem you from the grip of your enemies.
33:4:11/Now many nations are gathered against you. They say, "Let her be defiled, let our eyes gloat over Zion!"
33:4:12/But they do not know the thoughts of the LORD; they do not understand his plan, that he has gathered them like sheaves to the threshing floor.
33:4:13/Rise and thresh, Daughter Zion, for I will make your horn iron and your hooves bronze, so you can crush many peoples. I will dedicate their ill-gotten gains to the LORD, their wealth to the Lord of all the earth.
33:5:1/Gather together, O daughter of warriors: we are under siege: the leader of Israel will be struck on the face with a rod.
33:5:2/But you, Bethlehem Ephratah, though you are small among the clans of Judah, from you will come forth the one who will rule over Israel; his origins are from ancient times, from eternity.
33:5:3/So he will abandon them until the time when she who is in labor gives birth; then the rest of his brothers will return to the people of Israel.
33:5:4/He will stand and shepherd in the power of the LORD, in the splendor of the name of the LORD his God; and they will live securely, for then he will be honored throughout the earth.
33:5:5/This man will be our peace when the Assyrian invades our land and marches through our fortresses. We will raise against him seven shepherds, even eight leaders of men.
33:5:6/They will devastate the land of Assyria with the sword, and the land of Nimrod at its entrances. He will deliver us from the Assyrian when he invades our land and marches within our borders.
33:5:7/The remnant of Jacob will be among many peoples like dew from the LORD, like showers on the grass, which do not wait for anyone or depend on human will.
33:5:8/And the remnant of Jacob will be among the nations, in the midst of many peoples, like a lion among the animals of the forest, like a young lion among flocks of sheep, which, if it passes through, tramples and tears to pieces, with no one to rescue.
33:5:9/Your hand will be lifted up in triumph over your enemies, and all your adversaries will be eliminated.
33:5:10/In that day, declares the LORD, I will remove your horses from among you and destroy your chariots.
33:5:11/I will destroy the cities of your land and tear down all your fortresses.
33:5:12/I will eliminate sorcery from your hand; you will no longer have fortune-tellers.
33:5:13/I will also remove your carved images and your sacred pillars from among you; you will no longer bow down to the work of your hands.
33:5:14/I will uproot your Asherah poles from among you and demolish your cities.
33:5:15/I will execute vengeance in anger and wrath upon the nations that have not obeyed.
33:6:1/Listen to what the LORD says; Stand up, argue your case before the mountains, and let the hills hear your voice.
33:6:2/Listen, O mountains, to the LORD’s dispute, and you enduring foundations of the earth: for the LORD has a dispute with his people, and he will argue his case with Israel.
33:6:3/My people, what have I done to you? How have I tired you? Answer me.
33:6:4/For I brought you up from the land of Egypt, and rescued you from a life of slavery; I sent Moses, Aaron, and Miriam to lead you.
33:6:5/My people, remember what Balak king of Moab plotted, and what Balaam son of Beor answered him, from Shittim to Gilgal, so you may recognize the righteousness of the LORD.
33:6:6/How should I come before the LORD, and bow down before the exalted God? Should I come to him with burnt offerings, with year-old calves?
33:6:7/Will the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousand rivers of olive oil? Should I offer my firstborn for my wrongdoing, the child of my body for the sin of my soul?
33:6:8/He has shown you, O human, what is good; and what does the LORD require of you but to act justly, to love kindness, and to walk humbly with your God?
33:6:9/The LORD’s voice calls to the city, and the wise will see your name: pay attention to the rod, and who has appointed it.
33:6:10/Are there still treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the short measure that is detestable?
33:6:11/Can I justify wicked scales and a bag of fraudulent weights?
33:6:12/For the wealthy among you are full of violence, and the residents have lied, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
33:6:13/Therefore, I will also make you sick by striking you, making you desolate because of your sins.
33:6:14/You will eat, but not be satisfied; your hunger will remain inside you; you will try to save, but you will not succeed; and what you do save, I will give to the sword.
33:6:15/You will plant, but not harvest; you will press olives, but not use the oil; and make wine, but not drink it.
33:6:16/Because you follow the practices of Omri and all the deeds of Ahab’s house, and you follow their advice, I will make you a ruin, and your inhabitants an object of scorn; therefore, you will bear the disgrace of my people.
33:7:1/Alas for me! I feel like I'm searching for summer fruits or the last grapes after the harvest: there's nothing left to eat; I long for the first ripe fruits.
33:7:2/The virtuous are gone from the earth; there's no one honest left among people: they all set traps to shed blood; they hunt their own brothers with malice.
33:7:3/They're eager to do wrong; leaders and judges demand bribes; the powerful articulate their harmful wishes: thus, they conspire together.
33:7:4/The best among them is like a thorn bush; the most honest is more dangerous than a thorn fence: the time of your watchmen, your punishment, is coming; soon they will be in confusion.
33:7:5/Don't trust a friend, don't confide in a close companion; be careful what you say to the one closest to you.
33:7:6/For a son disrespects his father, a daughter opposes her mother, a daughter-in-law her mother-in-law; a person's enemies are those of his own household.
33:7:7/So, I will look to the LORD; I will wait for the God who saves me: my God will hear me.
33:7:8/Don't gloat over me, my enemy: though I fall, I will rise; though I sit in darkness, the LORD will be my light.
33:7:9/I will endure the LORD's anger because I have sinned against him, until he defends my cause and establishes justice for me: he will bring me into the light, and I will see his righteousness.
33:7:10/Then my enemy, who questioned my faith in the LORD, will see God's vindication and be covered with shame; she will be trampled like mud in the streets.
33:7:11/When the time comes to rebuild your walls, that day will see the boundaries extended.
33:7:12/On that day, people will come to you from Assyria and the fortified cities, from the fortresses to the River, and from sea to sea, and mountain to mountain.
33:7:13/Yet the land will be desolate because of its inhabitants, as a result of their actions.
33:7:14/Shepherd your people with your staff, the flock of your inheritance, living alone in a forest in the midst of Carmel: let them graze in Bashan and Gilead as in days of old.
33:7:15/As in the days when you came out of Egypt, I will show them wonders.
33:7:16/The nations will see and be ashamed of their power; they will put their hands over their mouths, and their ears will become deaf.
33:7:17/They will lick the dust like a snake, they will come trembling out of their dens; they will turn in fear to the LORD our God and will be afraid of you.
33:7:18/Who is a God like you, who forgives sin and overlooks the transgression of the remnant of his inheritance? He does not hold on to his anger forever because he delights in showing mercy.
33:7:19/He will again have compassion on us; he will tread our iniquities underfoot. You will cast all our sins into the depths of the sea.
33:7:20/You will show faithfulness to Jacob and mercy to Abraham, as you have sworn to our ancestors from days long ago.
34:1:1/The message concerning Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
34:1:2/God is passionate, and the LORD seeks revenge; the LORD seeks revenge and is intensely angry; the LORD will take vengeance on his foes and stores up wrath for his enemies.
34:1:3/The LORD is patient and immensely powerful, and will by no means let the guilty go unpunished: the LORD directs the whirlwind and the storm, and the clouds are the dust beneath his feet.
34:1:4/He scolds the sea, making it dry, and dries up all the rivers: Bashan withers, as do Carmel, and the blossoms of Lebanon wither.
34:1:5/The mountains tremble before him, the hills dissolve, and the earth burns in his presence, indeed, the world and all who live in it.
34:1:6/Who can withstand his anger? And who can endure his fierce rage? His fury is unleashed like fire, and the rocks are shattered by him.
34:1:7/The LORD is good, a refuge in times of trouble; and he knows those who trust in him.
34:1:8/But with a sweeping flood, he will completely destroy its place, and darkness will chase his foes.
34:1:9/What are you plotting against the LORD? He will bring about total destruction; trouble will not strike twice.
34:1:10/Even though they are entangled like thorns, and drunk as if with wine, they will be consumed like dry stubble.
34:1:11/Someone from you has plotted evil against the LORD, a wicked advisor.
34:1:12/This is what the LORD says; Even if they are peaceful and numerous, they will still be cut down when he passes through. Though I have afflicted you, I will afflict you no more.
34:1:13/For now, I will break his yoke from you and tear your shackles apart.
34:1:14/And the LORD has issued a decree about you: Your name will no longer be spread. I will destroy the carved image and the cast idol from the house of your gods; I will prepare your grave, for you are contemptible.
34:1:15/Look, on the mountains, the feet of the one who brings good news, who proclaims peace! O Judah, celebrate your festivals, fulfill your vows: for the wicked will no longer pass through you; they are completely cut off.
34:2:1/The one who destroys has advanced before you: secure your fortress, be vigilant, strengthen your resolve, and greatly reinforce your strength.
34:2:2/For the LORD has removed the pride of Jacob, just as the pride of Israel, because the plunderers have completely looted them and ruined their vineyards.
34:2:3/The shields of his warriors are stained red, the heroes are dressed in scarlet: the chariots will blaze with fire on the day he prepares for battle, and the pine trees will be severely shaken.
34:2:4/The chariots will storm through the streets, crashing into each other in the open roads: they will blaze like torches, they will dart like lightning.
34:2:5/He will call upon his elite troops: they will stumble as they march; they will rush to its wall, and the defense will be set up.
34:2:6/The river gates will be flung open, and the palace will collapse.
34:2:7/And Huzzab will be taken prisoner, she will be led away, and her attendants will guide her, moaning like doves, beating on their chests.
34:2:8/But Nineveh has been like a water reservoir from days of old: yet they will run away. "Stand firm, stand firm," they will shout; but no one will turn back.
34:2:9/Seize the treasures of silver, seize the treasures of gold: for there is no end to the wealth and splendor from all its luxurious furnishings.
34:2:10/It is desolate, empty, and ruined: and hearts melt, knees knock together, agony is in every waist, and all faces turn pale.
34:2:11/Where is the lair of the lions, and the feeding ground of the young lions, where the lion, the old lion, roamed, and the lion's cub, with no one to frighten them?
34:2:12/The lion tore enough for his cubs, killed for his lionesses, filled his lairs with prey, and his dens with the torn flesh.
34:2:13/Behold, I am against you, declares the LORD of hosts, and I will burn your chariots in smoke, and the sword will devour your young lions: and I will eliminate your prey from the earth, and the sound of your messengers will no longer be heard.
34:3:1/Doom to the city soaked in blood, filled to the brim with lies and theft, where the victims never stop coming.
34:3:2/The sound of the whip, the clatter of wheels, horses galloping, and chariots bouncing.
34:3:3/Cavalrymen brandish their shining swords and gleaming spears: a mass of casualties, countless dead bodies, they trip over their own dead.
34:3:4/Because of the countless harlotries of the seductive sorceress, who trades nations with her sexual immorality, and clans through her sorceries.
34:3:5/See, I am against you, declares the LORD of hosts; I will lift your skirts over your face, I will show the nations your nakedness, and the kingdoms your disgrace.
34:3:6/I will throw detestable filth on you, make you vile, and turn you into a spectacle.
34:3:7/It will happen that all who see you will run from you, saying, 'Nineveh is ruined: who will mourn for her?' Where can I find comforters for you?
34:3:8/Are you better than populous No, situated by the Nile, surrounded by water, whose rampart was the sea, and her wall made from the sea?
34:3:9/Ethiopia and Egypt were her limitless strength; Put and the Libyans were her allies.
34:3:10/Yet she was taken captive, she went into exile; her infants were smashed at every street corner, they cast lots for her nobles, and all her great men were bound in chains.
34:3:11/You too will become drunk; you will go into hiding; you too will seek refuge from the enemy.
34:3:12/All your fortresses will be like fig trees with the first ripe figs: if shaken, they fall right into the eater's mouth.
34:3:13/See, your troops are like women among you; the gates of your land are wide open to your enemies; fire has consumed your bars.
34:3:14/Draw water for the siege, strengthen your defenses; work the clay, tread the mortar, repair the brick kiln.
34:3:15/There the fire will consume you; the sword will cut you down; it will devour you like the locust. Multiply yourself like the locust, multiply like the grasshopper.
34:3:16/You have increased your merchants more than the stars of heaven; the locust sheds its skin and flies away.
34:3:17/Your guards are like locusts, your officials like swarms of grasshoppers, which camp in the hedges on a cold day, but when the sun rises they fly away, and no one knows where they are.
34:3:18/Your shepherds are asleep, O king of Assyria; your nobles lie in the dust; your people are scattered on the mountains with no one to gather them.
34:3:19/There is no cure for your injury; your wound is severe. All who hear the news about you clap their hands at your fall, for who has not felt your endless cruelty?
35:1:1/The message that the prophet Habakkuk received in a vision.
35:1:2/O LORD, how long must I call for help, but you do not listen? Or cry out to you about violence, but you do not save?
35:1:3/Why do you make me witness wrongdoing and force me to look at trouble? Destruction and violence are before me; there is strife, and conflict abounds.
35:1:4/Therefore the law is paralyzed, and justice never prevails. The wicked hem in the righteous, so that justice is perverted.
35:1:5/Look at the nations and watch, and be utterly amazed. For I am going to do something in your days that you would not believe, even if you were told.
35:1:6/Indeed, I am raising up the Babylonians, that ruthless and impetuous people, who sweep across the whole earth to seize dwellings not their own.
35:1:7/They are feared and dreaded; their own justice and authority originate with themselves.
35:1:8/Their horses are swifter than leopards, fiercer than wolves at dusk. Their cavalry gallops headlong; their horsemen come from afar. They fly like an eagle swooping to devour.
35:1:9/They all come intent on violence. Their hordes advance like a desert wind, gathering prisoners like sand.
35:1:10/They mock kings and rulers are a laughingstock to them. They laugh at all fortified cities; by building earthen ramps they capture them.
35:1:11/Then they sweep past like the wind and go on—guilty people, whose own strength is their god.
35:1:12/Aren't you from everlasting, O LORD my God, my Holy One? We will not die. O LORD, you have appointed them to execute judgment; O Rock, you have ordained them to punish.
35:1:13/Your eyes are too pure to look on evil; you cannot tolerate wrongdoing. Why then do you tolerate the treacherous? Why are you silent while the wicked swallow up those more righteous than themselves?
35:1:14/You have made people like the fish in the sea, like sea creatures that have no ruler.
35:1:15/The wicked pull all of them up with hooks, catch them in their net, gather them in their dragnet; and so they rejoice and are glad.
35:1:16/Therefore they offer sacrifices to their net and burn incense to their dragnet, for by their net they live in luxury and enjoy the choicest food.
35:1:17/Is it to keep on emptying their net and mercilessly killing nations without pity?
35:2:1/I will stand at my watchpost, and station myself on the ramparts; I will look to see what he will say to me, and what I will reply when I am corrected.
35:2:2/And the LORD replied to me, "Write down the vision clearly on tablets, so that a runner can read it easily.
35:2:3/For the vision awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay.
35:2:4/See, the one whose desires are not upright will fail, but the righteous will live by their faithfulness.
35:2:5/Indeed, because he is betrayed by wine, he is arrogant and never at rest. Because he is as greedy as the grave and like death is never satisfied, he gathers to himself all the nations and takes captive all the peoples.
35:2:6/Won't all of them taunt him with ridicule and scorn, saying, 'Woe to him who piles up stolen goods and makes himself wealthy by extortion! How long must this go on?'
35:2:7/Will not your creditors suddenly arise? Will they not wake up and make you tremble? Then you will become their prey.
35:2:8/Because you have plundered many nations, the peoples who are left will plunder you. For you have shed human blood; you have destroyed lands and cities and everyone in them.
35:2:9/Woe to him who unjustly gains wealth for his house to place his nest on high, to escape the reach of disaster!
35:2:10/You have devised shame for your house by cutting off many peoples; you have sinned against yourself.
35:2:11/For the stones will cry out from the wall, and the beams from the woodwork will echo it.
35:2:12/Woe to him who builds a city with bloodshed and establishes a town by injustice!
35:2:13/Is it not indeed from the LORD of hosts that peoples labor only to feed the flames, and nations weary themselves for nothing?
35:2:14/For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD as the waters cover the sea.
35:2:15/Woe to him who makes his neighbors drink, pouring out your wrath and even making them drunk, to gaze on their nakedness!
35:2:16/You will be filled with disgrace instead of honor. Now it is your turn! Drink and expose your uncircumcision! The cup from the LORD’s right hand will come around to you, and utter shame will cover your glory.
35:2:17/The violence you have done to Lebanon will overwhelm you, and your destruction of animals will terrify you, because of your bloodshed and violence to the land, to the city and all who live there.
35:2:18/What value is an idol carved by a craftsman, or an image that teaches lies? For the one who makes it trusts in his own creation; he makes idols that cannot speak.
35:2:19/Woe to him who says to wood, 'Come to life!' Or to lifeless stone, 'Wake up!' Can it give guidance? It is covered with gold and silver; there is no breath in it at all.
35:2:20/But the LORD is in his holy temple; let all the earth be silent before him.
35:3:1/A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.
35:3:2/Lord, I have heard your message, and I was afraid: Lord, rejuvenate your work in the middle of the years, make it known; even in anger, remember to show mercy.
35:3:3/God came from Teman, and the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the skies, and the earth was filled with his praise.
35:3:4/His brightness was like the sunlight; he had rays flashing from his hand: and there his power was hidden.
35:3:5/Before him went disease, and fiery bolts shot out at his feet.
35:3:6/He stood and surveyed the earth: he looked, and made the nations tremble; the ancient mountains crumbled, the age-old hills bowed down: his ways are eternal.
35:3:7/I saw the tents of Cushan in distress; and the dwellings of the land of Midian did tremble.
35:3:8/Was the Lord angry with the rivers? Was your anger against the rivers? Was your wrath against the sea, that you rode on your horses and your chariots of salvation?
35:3:9/Your bow was fully revealed, according to the promises to the tribes, even your word. Selah. You split the earth with rivers.
35:3:10/The mountains saw you and writhed: the torrent of water swept by: the deep voiced its roar, and lifted its hands on high.
35:3:11/The sun and moon stood still in their places: at the flash of your arrows they moved, and at the gleam of your glittering spear.
35:3:12/You marched through the land in wrath, you threshed the nations in anger.
35:3:13/You went out for the salvation of your people, for salvation with your anointed; you struck the head from the house of the wicked, laying bare the foundation to the neck. Selah.
35:3:14/You pierced with his own spears the heads of his warriors: they came like a whirlwind to scatter me, their joy was like feasting on the poor in secret.
35:3:15/You trampled the sea with your horses, churning the great waters.
35:3:16/When I heard, my stomach churned; my lips quivered at the sound: decay crept into my bones, and I trembled where I stood, that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he comes up against the people, he will invade them with his troops.
35:3:17/Even though the fig tree does not bloom, and there are no grapes on the vines; even though the olive crop fails, and the fields produce no food; even though there are no sheep in the pen, and no cattle in the stalls:
35:3:18/Yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will be joyful in the God of my salvation.
35:3:19/The Lord God is my strength, and he will make my feet like the deer's, and he will make me walk on my high places. To the chief musician with my stringed instruments.
36:1:1/The message from the LORD that came to Zephaniah, the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hizkiah, during the reign of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah.
36:1:2/I will completely remove everything from the land, says the LORD.
36:1:3/I will eliminate humans and animals; I will wipe out the birds in the sky and the fish in the sea, along with the obstacles that lead the wicked astray: and I will erase humans from the land, says the LORD.
36:1:4/I will also extend my hand against Judah and all the residents of Jerusalem; and I will eliminate the remnants of Baal from this place, along with the names of the idolatrous priests;
36:1:5/And those who worship the celestial bodies on the rooftops; and those who worship and swear by the LORD, and also swear by Malcham;
36:1:6/And those who have turned away from the LORD; and those who have not sought the LORD or inquired of him.
36:1:7/Be silent before the Sovereign LORD: for the day of the LORD is near: for the LORD has prepared a sacrifice, he has invited his guests.
36:1:8/And on the day of the LORD’s sacrifice, I will punish the officials, the royal offspring, and all who wear foreign clothing.
36:1:9/On that day, I will also punish all those who leap over the threshold, who fill their masters’ houses with violence and deceit.
36:1:10/And on that day, says the LORD, there will be a cry from the Fish Gate, a wail from the Second Quarter, and a loud crash from the hills.
36:1:11/Wail, you residents of Maktesh, for all the trading people are destroyed; all who handle money are cut down.
36:1:12/And at that time, I will search Jerusalem with lamps and punish those who are complacent, those who think in their hearts, 'The LORD will not do good, nor will he do harm.'
36:1:13/As a result, their possessions will be plundered, and their houses will be left in ruins. They will build houses but not live in them; they will plant vineyards but not drink their wine.
36:1:14/The great day of the LORD is near, it is near and coming quickly, the sound of the day of the LORD is bitter; the warrior cries out there.
36:1:15/That day is a day of anger, a day of distress and anguish, a day of ruin and devastation, a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and thick darkness,
36:1:16/A day of the trumpet and battle cry against the fortified cities and against the corner towers.
36:1:17/I will bring such distress on people that they will walk like the blind, because they have sinned against the LORD. Their blood will be poured out like dust, and their bodies like refuse.
36:1:18/Neither their silver nor their gold will be able to save them on the day of the LORD’s anger; but the whole land will be consumed by the fire of his jealousy: for he will make a sudden end of all who live in the land.
36:2:1/Come together, yes, come together, O nation not desired;
36:2:2/Before the decree takes effect, before the day fades like chaff, before the fierce anger of the LORD falls upon you, before the day of the LORD's anger arrives.
36:2:3/Search for the LORD, all you humble of the earth, who have followed his commands; seek righteousness, seek humility: perhaps you will be sheltered on the day of the LORD's anger.
36:2:4/Gaza will be abandoned, and Ashkelon will become a wasteland: they will expel Ashdod at noon, and Ekron will be uprooted.
36:2:5/Woe to the inhabitants of the coastal region, the nation of the Cherethites! The LORD's message is against you; O Canaan, land of the Philistines, I will surely destroy you, leaving no one behind.
36:2:6/And the coastal region will become pastures and huts for shepherds, and pens for flocks.
36:2:7/And the coast will belong to the survivors of the house of Judah; they will graze there: in the houses of Ashkelon they will rest at night: for the LORD their God will visit them, and reverse their fortune.
36:2:8/I have heard the insults of Moab, and the taunts of the Ammonites, who have belittled my people and boasted against their territory.
36:2:9/Therefore, as surely as I live, declares the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, Moab will become like Sodom, and the Ammonites like Gomorrah, a place of weeds and salt pits, and a perpetual wasteland: the survivors of my people will plunder them, and the remnant of my people will take possession.
36:2:10/This will be their fate for their arrogance, because they have insulted and boasted against the people of the LORD of hosts.
36:2:11/The LORD will be fearsome to them: for he will starve all the gods of the earth; and people will worship him, each from their own place, all the islands of the nations.
36:2:12/You Ethiopians, too, will fall by my sword.
36:2:13/And he will stretch out his hand against the north, and destroy Assyria; and will turn Nineveh into a wasteland, parched like a desert.
36:2:14/And flocks will lie down in the middle of her, all the animals of the nations: both the cormorant and the bittern will nest in the upper lintels of it; their voices will sing in the windows; desolation will be at the thresholds; for he will strip bare the cedar work.
36:2:15/This is the jubilant city that lived carelessly, that said in her heart, I am, and there is no one else: how has she become a wasteland, a place for beasts to rest! Everyone who passes by her will hiss and shake their head.
36:3:1/Woe to the city that is dirty and corrupt, to the city that oppresses its people!
36:3:2/She didn't listen to the voice; she didn't accept correction; she didn't trust in the LORD; she didn't draw close to her God.
36:3:3/Her leaders are like roaring lions; her judges are like wolves at night, not sparing anything until morning.
36:3:4/Her prophets are irresponsible and deceitful; her priests have defiled the sanctuary, they have violated the law.
36:3:5/The just LORD is in its midst; he will not act unjustly: every morning he makes his judgment known, he never fails; but the unjust feel no shame.
36:3:6/I have destroyed nations: their fortresses are deserted; I made their streets empty, with no one passing by: their cities are ruined, with no one living there.
36:3:7/I thought, surely you will fear me, you will accept correction; so your homes would not be destroyed, no matter how I punished you: but they got up early and corrupted all their actions.
36:3:8/So wait for me, says the LORD, until the day I stand up to take action: for my plan is to gather the nations, to bring together the kingdoms, to pour out on them my fury, all my burning anger: for the whole earth will be consumed by the fire of my jealousy.
36:3:9/For then I will give the people a pure language, so they can all call on the name of the LORD, to serve him unitedly.
36:3:10/From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia, my worshipers, the scattered people, will bring me offerings.
36:3:11/On that day you will not be ashamed of all your actions, in which you have rebelled against me: for then I will remove from your midst those who take pride in your pride, and you will no longer be arrogant on my holy mountain.
36:3:12/I will leave in your midst a humble and poor people, and they will trust in the name of the LORD.
36:3:13/The survivors in Israel will not commit sin, nor tell lies; a deceitful tongue will not be found in their mouths: for they will graze and lie down, with no one to make them afraid.
36:3:14/Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be joyful and rejoice with all your heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
36:3:15/The LORD has removed your punishment, he has driven out your enemy: the king of Israel, the LORD, is among you: you will not see harm anymore.
36:3:16/On that day it will be said to Jerusalem, Do not fear: and to Zion, Do not let your hands hang down.
36:3:17/The LORD your God is with you, mighty to save; he will take great delight in you; in his love he will no longer rebuke you, but will rejoice over you with singing.
36:3:18/I will gather those who mourn for the festival, who are from you, to whom its reproach was a burden.
36:3:19/See, at that time I will deal with all who oppress you: I will save the lame and gather those who were driven away; I will give them praise and honor in every land where they were shamed.
36:3:20/At that time I will bring you back, even at the time when I gather you: for I will make you renowned and praised among all the peoples of the earth, when I restore your fortunes before your eyes, says the LORD.
37:1:1/In the second year of King Darius, on the first day of the sixth month, the word of the LORD came through Haggai the prophet to Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua son of Josedech, the high priest, saying,
37:1:2/The LORD of hosts says, "This people claim it's not yet time to rebuild the LORD's house."
37:1:3/Then the word of the LORD came through Haggai the prophet, saying,
37:1:4/"Is it time for you yourselves to live in your paneled houses while this house remains a ruin?"
37:1:5/So now, this is what the LORD of hosts says: "Think carefully about your ways."
37:1:6/"You have planted much but harvest little; you eat but never have enough; you drink but never have your fill; you dress yourselves but no one is warm; and he who earns wages does so to put them into a purse with holes."
37:1:7/This is what the LORD of hosts says: "Think carefully about your ways."
37:1:8/"Go up to the mountains, bring back timber, and build the house; and I will take pleasure in it and be honored," says the LORD.
37:1:9/"You expected much, but see, it turned out to be little. What you brought home, I blew away. Why?" declares the LORD of hosts. "Because of my house, which remains a ruin, while each of you is busy with your own house."
37:1:10/"Therefore, because of you the heavens have withheld their dew and the earth its crops."
37:1:11/"I called for a drought on the fields and the mountains, on the grain, the new wine, the oil, and whatever the ground produces, on men and livestock, and on all the labor of your hands."
37:1:12/Then Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, Joshua son of Josedech, the high priest, and all the remnant of the people obeyed the voice of the LORD their God and the message of Haggai the prophet, because the LORD their God had sent him. And the people showed reverence for the LORD.
37:1:13/Then Haggai, the LORD's messenger, delivered the LORD's message to the people, saying, "I am with you," declares the LORD.
37:1:14/And the LORD stirred up the spirit of Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and the spirit of Joshua son of Josedech, the high priest, and the spirit of all the remnant of the people. They came and began to work on the house of the LORD of hosts, their God,
37:1:15/On the twenty-fourth day of the sixth month, in the second year of King Darius.
37:2:1/On the twenty-first day of the seventh month, the word of the LORD came through the prophet Haggai, saying,
37:2:2/Tell Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and Joshua, the son of Josedech, the high priest, and the rest of the people,
37:2:3/Who among you remembers this house in its former glory? And how do you see it now? Doesn't it seem like nothing in comparison?
37:2:4/But now, be strong, Zerubbabel, declares the LORD; be strong, Joshua, son of Josedech, the high priest; and be strong, all you people of the land, declares the LORD, and work: for I am with you, declares the LORD of hosts.
37:2:5/Just as I promised when you came out of Egypt, my Spirit remains among you: do not fear.
37:2:6/For this is what the LORD of hosts says: In a little while, I will once more shake the heavens and the earth, the sea and the dry land.
37:2:7/And I will shake all nations, and what all nations desire will come, and I will fill this house with glory, says the LORD of hosts.
37:2:8/The silver is mine, and the gold is mine, declares the LORD of hosts.
37:2:9/The glory of this present house will be greater than the glory of the former house, says the LORD of hosts. And in this place, I will grant peace, declares the LORD of hosts.
37:2:10/On the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of the LORD came to Haggai the prophet, saying,
37:2:11/This is what the LORD of hosts says; Ask the priests about the law:
37:2:12/If someone carries consecrated meat in the fold of their garment, and that fold touches bread, stew, wine, oil, or any other food, does it become holy? The priests answered, No.
37:2:13/Then Haggai said, If someone who is unclean because of contact with a dead body touches any of these, does it become unclean? The priests answered, It becomes unclean.
37:2:14/Then Haggai responded, So is this people, and so is this nation before me, declares the LORD; and so is every work of their hands; and what they offer there is unclean.
37:2:15/Now, give careful thought to this from this day on—consider how things were before one stone was laid on another in the LORD's temple.
37:2:16/Before that time, when one came to a pile of twenty measures, there were only ten; when one came to the wine vat to draw fifty measures, there were only twenty.
37:2:17/I struck you with blight and mildew and hail in all the work of your hands; yet you did not turn to me, declares the LORD.
37:2:18/From this day on, from the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, from the day the foundation of the LORD's temple was laid, give it careful thought.
37:2:19/Is there still seed in the barn? Until now, the vine, the fig tree, the pomegranate, and the olive tree have not borne fruit. From this day on, I will bless you.
37:2:20/And again, the word of the LORD came to Haggai on the twenty-fourth day of the month, saying,
37:2:21/Tell Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, I will shake the heavens and the earth.
37:2:22/And I will overthrow the thrones of kingdoms; I will destroy the power of the kingdoms of the nations. I will overthrow the chariots and their riders; the horses and their riders will fall, each by the sword of his brother.
37:2:23/On that day, declares the LORD of hosts, I will take you, Zerubbabel, my servant, the son of Shealtiel, declares the LORD, and make you like my signet ring, for I have chosen you, declares the LORD of hosts.
38:1:1/In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of the LORD came to Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
38:1:2/The LORD has been extremely displeased with your ancestors.
38:1:3/So tell them, 'This is what the LORD of hosts says: Return to me, says the LORD of hosts, and I will return to you, says the LORD of hosts.
38:1:4/Don't be like your ancestors, to whom the earlier prophets proclaimed, 'This is what the LORD of hosts says: Turn away from your evil ways and your evil actions.' But they didn't listen or pay attention to me, says the LORD.
38:1:5/Where are your fathers now? And the prophets, do they live forever?
38:1:6/Yet my words and my decrees, which I commanded my servants the prophets, did they not overtake your fathers? So they repented and said, 'The LORD of hosts has dealt with us according to our ways and actions, just as he planned to do.'
38:1:7/On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month of Sebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of the LORD came to Zechariah, the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
38:1:8/I saw in the night, and there was a man riding on a red horse, standing among the myrtle trees in the valley; and behind him were red, speckled, and white horses.
38:1:9/Then I asked, 'My lord, what are these?' And the angel who was speaking with me said, 'I will show you what these are.'
38:1:10/And the man standing among the myrtle trees explained, 'These are the ones whom the LORD has sent to patrol the earth.'
38:1:11/They reported to the angel of the LORD standing among the myrtle trees, 'We have patrolled the earth, and behold, all the earth is calm and at peace.'
38:1:12/Then the angel of the LORD responded, 'O LORD of hosts, how long will you withhold mercy from Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, with which you have been angry for seventy years?'
38:1:13/And the LORD replied to the angel who was speaking with me with kind and comforting words.
38:1:14/So the angel who was speaking with me said, 'Proclaim this: This is what the LORD of hosts says: I am very passionate about Jerusalem and Zion, with great passion.
38:1:15/And I am extremely displeased with the nations that are at ease; for I was only a little displeased, but they added to the disaster.'
38:1:16/Therefore, this is what the LORD says: 'I have returned to Jerusalem with compassion; my house will be rebuilt in it, says the LORD of hosts, and a measuring line will be stretched out over Jerusalem.'
38:1:17/Proclaim further: This is what the LORD of hosts says: 'My cities will again overflow with prosperity, and the LORD will again comfort Zion and again choose Jerusalem.'
38:1:18/Then I looked up and saw four horns.
38:1:19/And I asked the angel who was speaking with me, 'What are these?' And he answered, 'These are the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.'
38:1:20/And the LORD showed me four craftsmen.
38:1:21/Then I asked, 'What are these coming to do?' And he said, 'These are the horns that scattered Judah, so no one could raise their head, but the craftsmen have come to terrify them, to throw down the horns of the nations who lifted up their horn against the land of Judah to scatter it.'
38:2:1/I looked up again, and saw a man holding a measuring line.
38:2:2/Then I asked, "Where are you going?" And he replied, "To measure Jerusalem, to find out its width and its length."
38:2:3/And then, the angel who was speaking with me stepped forward, and another angel came out to meet him,
38:2:4/And told him, "Go, tell this young man, 'Jerusalem will be inhabited like villages without walls because of the vast number of people and animals in it.
38:2:5/For I,' declares the LORD, 'will be a wall of fire all around her, and I will be the glory within her.'
38:2:6/"Come, come! Flee from the land of the north," declares the LORD, "for I have scattered you to the four winds of heaven," declares the LORD.
38:2:7/"Escape, O Zion, you who live with the daughter of Babylon."
38:2:8/For this is what the LORD of hosts says: "After being glorified, He has sent me against the nations that plundered you; for whoever touches you touches the apple of His eye.
38:2:9/Behold, I will wave my hand over them, and they will become plunder for their own servants. Then you will know that the LORD of hosts has sent me.
38:2:10/"Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion, for I am coming, and I will live among you," declares the LORD.
38:2:11/And many nations will join themselves to the LORD on that day and will become my people. I will live among you, and you will know that the LORD of hosts has sent me to you.
38:2:12/And the LORD will take Judah as His portion in the holy land and will again choose Jerusalem.
38:2:13/Be silent, all flesh, before the LORD, for He has awakened from His holy dwelling.
38:3:1/And he showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of the LORD, and Satan standing at his right hand to oppose him.
38:3:2/And the LORD said to Satan, "The LORD rebuke you, O Satan; indeed, the LORD who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you: is this not someone rescued from the fire?"
38:3:3/Now Joshua was wearing dirty clothes and stood before the angel.
38:3:4/And he responded and spoke to those standing before him, saying, "Remove the dirty clothes from him." And to him he said, "See, I have taken away your sin, and I will dress you in fine clothes."
38:3:5/And I said, "Let them place a clean turban on his head." So they placed a clean turban on his head and dressed him in clothes. And the angel of the LORD stood by.
38:3:6/And the angel of the LORD gave Joshua a solemn charge, saying,
38:3:7/"This is what the LORD of hosts says; If you follow my ways and keep my commands, then you will also govern my house and guard my courts, and I will give you a place among these standing here."
38:3:8/"Listen now, O Joshua the high priest, you and your colleagues who sit before you: for you are symbols of things to come: for, behold, I am going to bring my servant, the BRANCH."
38:3:9/"For see the stone that I have set before Joshua; on one stone there will be seven eyes: behold, I will engrave its inscription," says the LORD of hosts, "and I will remove the sin of this land in a single day."
38:3:10/"On that day," says the LORD of hosts, "you will invite each other to sit under the vine and fig tree."
38:4:1/The angel who was speaking with me returned and woke me up, like someone being awakened from sleep.
38:4:2/He asked me, "What do you see?" I replied, "I see a solid gold lampstand with a bowl at the top and seven lights on it, with seven channels to the lights.
38:4:3/There are also two olive trees by it, one on the right side of the bowl and the other on its left."
38:4:4/So I responded to the angel speaking with me, "What are these, my lord?"
38:4:5/The angel speaking with me replied, "Don't you know what these are?" And I said, "No, my lord."
38:4:6/Then he said to me, "This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel: 'Not by might nor by power, but by my Spirit,' says the LORD Almighty.
38:4:7/'What are you, mighty mountain? Before Zerubbabel, you will become level ground. And he will bring out the capstone to shouts of 'Grace, grace to it!'"
38:4:8/Furthermore, the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
38:4:9/"Zerubbabel's hands have laid the foundation of this temple; his hands will also complete it. Then you will know that the LORD Almighty has sent me to you.
38:4:10/Who dares to belittle the day of small beginnings? They will rejoice when they see the plumb line in the hand of Zerubbabel. (These seven are the eyes of the LORD, which range throughout the earth.)"
38:4:11/Then I asked him, "What are these two olive trees on the right and the left of the lampstand?"
38:4:12/Again I inquired, "What are these two olive branches beside the two gold pipes that pour out golden oil?"
38:4:13/He replied, "Don't you know what these are?" And I said, "No, my lord."
38:4:14/Then he said, "These are the two who are anointed to serve the Lord of all the earth."
38:5:1/Then I turned, looked up, and saw a flying scroll.
38:5:2/He asked me, "What do you see?" I replied, "I see a flying scroll; it's twenty cubits long and ten cubits wide."
38:5:3/He then told me, "This represents the curse that is spreading across the entire earth: anyone who steals will be eliminated on this side according to it; and anyone who lies will be eliminated on that side according to it."
38:5:4/"I will send it out," declares the LORD of hosts, "and it will enter the house of the thief and the house of anyone who lies using my name: it will stay in the middle of his house and will destroy it, along with its wood and stones."
38:5:5/Then the angel who was speaking with me stepped forward and said, "Now, look up and see what is being sent out."
38:5:6/I asked, "What is it?" He replied, "This is a measuring basket that is being sent out." He also said, "This represents the sin of the entire earth."
38:5:7/And look, a lead cover was lifted, and there was a woman sitting inside the basket.
38:5:8/He said, "This is wickedness." He then threw her back into the basket and placed the lead cover over its opening.
38:5:9/Then I looked up and saw two women coming with the wind in their wings; they had wings like those of a stork, and they lifted the basket into the sky.
38:5:10/So I asked the angel who was speaking with me, "Where are they taking the basket?"
38:5:11/He replied, "To build it a house in the land of Shinar: it will be set up there on its own foundation."
38:6:1/I turned, looked up, and saw four chariots coming out from between two mountains; and the mountains were made of brass.
38:6:2/The first chariot had red horses; and the second chariot had black horses;
38:6:3/In the third chariot were white horses; and in the fourth chariot were dappled and strong horses.
38:6:4/So I asked the angel speaking with me, "What are these, my lord?"
38:6:5/The angel replied, "These are the four spirits of the heavens, sent out from standing before the Lord of the whole earth."
38:6:6/The black horses are heading north; the white horses follow them; and the dappled horses head south.
38:6:7/And the strong horses went out, eager to roam the earth. He commanded, "Go, roam the earth." So they roamed across the earth.
38:6:8/Then he called out to me, "Look, those heading north have brought peace to my spirit in the north country."
38:6:9/And the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
38:6:10/"Take from the exiles, from Heldai, Tobijah, and Jedaiah, who have arrived from Babylon, and go today to the house of Josiah the son of Zephaniah;
38:6:11/Then take silver and gold, create crowns, and place them on the head of Joshua the son of Josedech, the high priest;
38:6:12/And tell him, 'This is what the LORD of hosts says: Here is the man called The BRANCH; he will emerge from his place and build the temple of the LORD.
38:6:13/He will build the temple of the LORD; he will receive honor, and will sit and rule on his throne. He will be a priest on his throne, and there will be harmony between the two roles.
38:6:14/And the crowns will be a memorial for Helem, Tobijah, Jedaiah, and Hen the son of Zephaniah, in the temple of the LORD.
38:6:15/Those from far away will come and help build the temple of the LORD, and you will know that the LORD of hosts has sent me to you. This will happen if you faithfully obey the voice of the LORD your God.
38:7:1/In the fourth year of King Darius, the word of the LORD came to Zechariah on the fourth day of the ninth month, which is Chisleu.
38:7:2/When Sherezer, Regemmelech, and their companions were sent to pray before the LORD at the house of God,
38:7:3/And to ask the priests in the house of the LORD of hosts, and the prophets, "Should I mourn and fast in the fifth month, as I have been doing for so many years?"
38:7:4/Then the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying,
38:7:5/Tell all the people of the land and the priests, 'When you fasted and mourned in the fifth and seventh month for seventy years, was it really for me that you fasted?
38:7:6/And when you ate and drank, wasn't it just for yourselves that you were eating and drinking?'
38:7:7/Shouldn't you listen to the words the LORD proclaimed through the earlier prophets when Jerusalem and its surrounding cities were inhabited and prosperous, and the Negev and the Shephelah were populated?
38:7:8/And the word of the LORD came to Zechariah, saying,
38:7:9/This is what the LORD of hosts says: 'Administer true justice, show mercy and compassion to one another,
38:7:10/Do not oppress the widow, the fatherless, the foreigner, or the poor; and do not plot evil against each other in your hearts.'
38:7:11/But they refused to pay attention, shrugged off their shoulders, and blocked their ears from hearing.
38:7:12/Yes, they made their hearts as hard as diamond, so they could not hear the law and the messages that the LORD of hosts had sent by his Spirit through the earlier prophets. Therefore, a great anger came from the LORD of hosts.
38:7:13/So it happened that just as he called and they did not listen, when they called, I did not listen, says the LORD of hosts.
38:7:14/But I scattered them with a tempest among all the nations they did not know. Thus the land was left desolate behind them, so that no one could come and go. This made the pleasant land desolate.
38:8:1/Again the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying, 
38:8:2/The LORD of hosts says; I felt intense jealousy for Zion, a jealousy filled with great passion.
38:8:3/The LORD says; I have returned to Zion and will live in the heart of Jerusalem: and Jerusalem will be known as a city of truth; and the mountain of the LORD of hosts the holy mountain.
38:8:4/The LORD of hosts says; Elderly men and women will once again live in the streets of Jerusalem, each leaning on a cane because of their age.
38:8:5/And the city streets will be filled with boys and girls playing freely.
38:8:6/The LORD of hosts says; If this seems amazing to the surviving people of this time, should it not seem amazing to me as well? says the LORD of hosts.
38:8:7/The LORD of hosts says; Look, I will rescue my people from the lands of the east and from the lands of the west; 
38:8:8/And I will bring them back, and they will live in the heart of Jerusalem: they will be my people, and I will be their God, in truth and in righteousness.
38:8:9/The LORD of hosts says; Be strong, all of you who are listening to these words from the prophets today, words that were spoken on the day the foundation of the LORD of hosts' temple was laid, signaling that the temple would be rebuilt.
38:8:10/For before these times, there was no pay for work, nor any earnings for animals; there was no peace for anyone coming or going because of the conflict: for I turned everyone against their neighbor.
38:8:11/But now, I will not treat the survivors of this people as I did before, says the LORD of hosts.
38:8:12/The crops will be abundant; the vines will produce their fruit, the ground will yield its harvest, and the skies will give their dew; and I will make the survivors of this people inherit these blessings.
38:8:13/And it will happen, just as you were once a curse among the nations, O house of Judah and house of Israel; so I will save you, and you will be a blessing. Do not be afraid, but be strong.
38:8:14/For this is what the LORD of hosts says; Just as I planned to bring disaster to you when your ancestors angered me, says the LORD of hosts, and I did not relent,
38:8:15/So now I have planned in these days to do good to Jerusalem and to the house of Judah. Do not be afraid.
38:8:16/These are the things you must do; Speak the truth to each other; make true and peaceful judgments in your courts; 
38:8:17/And do not plot evil in your hearts against one another; and do not love false oaths: for all these are things that I despise, says the LORD.
38:8:18/And the word of the LORD of hosts came unto me, saying, 
38:8:19/The LORD of hosts says; The fasts of the fourth, fifth, seventh, and tenth months will become times of joy and gladness, and cheerful festivals for the house of Judah. Therefore, love truth and peace.
38:8:20/The LORD of hosts says; It will happen that people and the inhabitants of many cities will come together; 
38:8:21/And the residents of one city will go to another, saying, Let's go at once to seek the LORD's favor, to pray before the LORD of hosts: I will go too.
38:8:22/Indeed, many peoples and powerful nations will come to seek the LORD of hosts in Jerusalem, and to pray before the LORD.
38:8:23/The LORD of hosts says; In those days, ten people from all languages and nations will grab hold of a Jewish person by the hem of their robe and say, We want to go with you because we have heard that God is with you.
38:9:1/The message from the LORD is heavy on the land of Hadrach, and Damascus will find its rest in it: when human eyes, including all the tribes of Israel, turn toward the LORD.
38:9:2/And Hamath will also be near it; Tyre, and Sidon, even though they are very wise.
38:9:3/And Tyre built herself a fortress and piled up silver like dust, and fine gold like the mud of the streets.
38:9:4/Watch, the LORD will throw her out, and strike her power in the sea; and she will be consumed by fire.
38:9:5/Ashkelon will see it and be afraid; Gaza will also see it and be deeply saddened, and Ekron; for what she hoped for will be disappointed; and the king will vanish from Gaza, and Ashkelon will not be inhabited.
38:9:6/And an illegitimate child will live in Ashdod, and I will eliminate the arrogance of the Philistines.
38:9:7/And I will remove the blood from his mouth, and the detestable things from between his teeth: but the one who remains, he will be for our God, and he will be like a leader in Judah, and Ekron like a Jebusite.
38:9:8/And I will camp around my house to protect it from the army, from those passing by, and from those returning: and no oppressor will pass through them anymore: for now I have seen with my own eyes.
38:9:9/Celebrate with great joy, O daughter of Zion; shout aloud, O daughter of Jerusalem: see, your King comes to you: he is righteous, and brings salvation; humble, and riding on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a donkey.
38:9:10/And I will remove the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow will be removed: and he will proclaim peace to the nations: and his rule will extend from sea to sea, and from the river to the ends of the earth.
38:9:11/As for you also, through the blood of your covenant I have released your prisoners from the waterless pit.
38:9:12/Return to the stronghold, you prisoners of hope: even today I declare that I will restore to you double.
38:9:13/When I have prepared Judah as my bow, filled the bow with Ephraim, and stirred up your sons, O Zion, against your sons, O Greece, and made you like the sword of a mighty warrior.
38:9:14/And the LORD will appear over them, and his arrow will flash like lightning: and the LORD God will sound the trumpet, and march in the storm winds of the south.
38:9:15/The LORD of hosts will protect them; and they will consume and trample with sling stones; and they will drink and roar as if with wine; and they will be filled like bowls, drenched like the corners of the altar.
38:9:16/And the LORD their God will save them on that day as the flock of his people: for they will sparkle in his land like jewels in a crown.
38:9:17/For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty! Grain will make the young men thrive, and new wine the young women.
38:10:1/Ask the LORD for rain when it's time for the spring rains; the LORD will send thunderclouds and give everyone rain showers for their fields.
38:10:2/For the idols have spoken nonsense, and the fortune-tellers have seen lies; they've told false dreams and offered empty comfort. So the people wandered like sheep, troubled because they had no leader.
38:10:3/I was furious with the leaders, and I punished the rebels: for the LORD of hosts has cared for his flock, the house of Judah, and made them like his majestic horse in battle.
38:10:4/From him came the cornerstone, from him the tent peg, from him the battle bow, from him every ruler together.
38:10:5/They will be like warriors, stomping their enemies in the mud of the streets in battle. They will fight because the LORD is with them, and those who ride horses will be put to shame.
38:10:6/And I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph. I will restore them because I have compassion on them. They will be as though I had never rejected them, for I am the LORD their God and I will answer them.
38:10:7/The people of Ephraim will be like warriors, and their hearts will be glad as with wine. Yes, their children will see it and be joyful; their hearts will rejoice in the LORD.
38:10:8/I will signal for them and gather them in. I have redeemed them, and they will multiply as they once did.
38:10:9/And I will plant them among the peoples; they will remember me in distant lands; they and their children will survive and return.
38:10:10/I will also bring them back from the land of Egypt, and gather them from Assyria. I will bring them into the lands of Gilead and Lebanon, and there will not be enough room for them.
38:10:11/He will pass through the sea of trouble, and strike down the waves of the sea. All the depths of the Nile will dry up. The pride of Assyria will be brought down, and the scepter of Egypt will depart.
38:10:12/And I will strengthen them in the LORD, and they will walk in his name, declares the LORD.
38:11:1/Open your doors, O Lebanon, so that the fire may consume your cedars.
38:11:2/Cry out, fir tree, for the cedar has fallen; the mighty are ruined: cry out, O oaks of Bashan, for the dense forest has been cut down.
38:11:3/There's a sound of shepherds wailing, for their splendor is ruined: a sound of young lions roaring, for the lushness of the Jordan is destroyed.
38:11:4/This is what the LORD my God says; Take care of the flock destined for slaughter;
38:11:5/Those who own them kill them without feeling guilty: and those who sell them say, 'Praise the LORD, I am rich'; and their own shepherds have no pity on them.
38:11:6/For I will no longer have pity on the people of the land, declares the LORD. But I will hand everyone over to their neighbor and their king. They will devastate the land, and I will not rescue them from their hands.

38:11:8/I also removed three shepherds in one month; I grew impatient with them, and they also detested me.
38:11:9/Then I said, I will not tend you. What is to die, let it die; what is to be cut off, let it be cut off; and let those left devour each other's flesh.
38:11:10/And I took my staff, Favor, and broke it, to annul my covenant that I had made with all the peoples.
38:11:11/It was annulled on that day, and so the oppressed of the flock who were watching me knew it was the word of the LORD.
38:11:12/And I said to them, "If it seems good to you, give me my wages; but if not, keep them." So they weighed out my wages, thirty pieces of silver.
38:11:13/And the LORD said to me, "Throw it to the potter"—the handsome price at which they valued me! So I took the thirty pieces of silver and threw them into the house of the LORD for the potter.
38:11:14/Then I broke my second staff, Union, breaking the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.
38:11:15/And the LORD said to me, "Take again the equipment of a foolish shepherd.
38:11:16/For behold, I am raising up a shepherd in the land who will not care for those being lost, nor seek the young, nor heal the injured, nor feed the healthy, but will eat the flesh of the fat ones, tearing off even their hoofs.
38:11:17/Woe to the worthless shepherd who abandons the flock! May the sword strike his arm and his right eye! His arm will be completely withered, and his right eye utterly blinded.

38:12:3/On that day, I will make Jerusalem a heavy stone for all nations: anyone who tries to lift it will be severely injured, even if all the nations of the earth unite against it.
38:12:4/On that day, says the LORD, I will strike every horse with panic and its rider with madness; I will keep a watchful eye on the house of Judah but will blind every horse of the attacking nations.
38:12:5/And the leaders of Judah will think to themselves, 'The people of Jerusalem are our strength because of the LORD Almighty, their God.'
38:12:6/On that day, I will make the leaders of Judah like a fiery furnace among the wood, like a flaming torch among sheaves; they will consume all the surrounding peoples on the right and the left, and Jerusalem will be inhabited again in its rightful place.
38:12:7/The LORD will save the dwellings of Judah first, so that the honor of the house of David and of Jerusalem's inhabitants may not surpass that of Judah.
38:12:8/On that day, the LORD will protect the people of Jerusalem; even the weakest among them will be like David, and the royal house will be like God, like the angel of the LORD going before them.
38:12:9/And it will happen on that day, I will aim to eliminate all the nations that attack Jerusalem.
38:12:10/I will pour out on the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem a spirit of grace and supplication; they will look on me, the one they have pierced, and they will mourn for him as one mourns for an only child, and grieve bitterly for him as one grieves for a firstborn.
38:12:11/On that day, there will be great mourning in Jerusalem, like the mourning of Hadadrimmon in the plain of Megiddo.

38:13:3/If anyone still prophesies, his own parents will tell him, 'You must die because you have lied in the name of the LORD.' When he prophesies, his own parents will fatally wound him.
38:13:4/On that day, every prophet will be ashamed of his prophetic vision and will no longer wear the hairy cloak to deceive people.
38:13:5/Instead, he will declare, 'I am not a prophet. I am a farmer; I've been taught to work the land since my youth.'
38:13:6/If someone asks him, 'What are these wounds on your hands?' he will answer, 'I received these wounds at the house of my friends.'

38:14:13/On that day, a great panic from the LORD will fall on them. Everyone will seize the hand of another, and their hands will turn against each other.
38:14:14/Judah too will fight at Jerusalem. The wealth of all the surrounding nations will be collected—large amounts of gold, silver, and clothing.
38:14:15/A similar plague will strike the horses, mules, camels, donkeys, and all the animals in those camps.
38:14:16/Then everyone who survives from all the nations that attacked Jerusalem will go up year after year to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, and to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.
38:14:17/If any of the earth's families do not go up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, there will be no rain for them.
38:14:18/If the family of Egypt does not go up and enter in, they will have no rain; they will receive the plague with which the LORD afflicts the nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.
38:14:19/This will be the punishment of Egypt and the punishment of all nations that do not go up to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles.

38:14:21/Indeed, every cooking pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the LORD of hosts, and all who come to sacrifice will take some of them and cook in them. And on that day there will no longer be a Canaanite in the house of the LORD of hosts.

39:1:7/By offering defiled food on my altar. And you ask, 'How have we defiled you?' By saying that the LORD's table is contemptible.

39:1:11/For from sunrise to sunset, my name will be great among the nations; and in every place incense and pure offerings will be made to my name, because my name will be great among the nations," says the LORD of hosts.
39:1:12/But you profane it by saying, 'The LORD's table is defiled, and its food is contemptible.'

40:1:1/The record of the ancestry of Jesus Christ, the descendant of David, the descendant of Abraham.
40:1:2/Abraham fathered Isaac; and Isaac fathered Jacob; and Jacob fathered Judah and his brothers; 
40:1:3/And Judah fathered Perez and Zerah with Tamar; and Perez fathered Hezron; and Hezron fathered Ram; 
40:1:4/And Ram fathered Amminadab; and Amminadab fathered Nahshon; and Nahshon fathered Salmon; 
40:1:5/And Salmon fathered Boaz with Rahab; and Boaz fathered Obed with Ruth; and Obed fathered Jesse; 
40:1:6/And Jesse fathered King David; and King David fathered Solomon with her who had been Uriah’s wife; 
40:1:7/And Solomon fathered Rehoboam; and Rehoboam fathered Abijah; and Abijah fathered Asa; 
40:1:8/And Asa fathered Jehoshaphat; and Jehoshaphat fathered Jehoram; and Jehoram fathered Uzziah; 
40:1:9/And Uzziah fathered Jotham; and Jotham fathered Ahaz; and Ahaz fathered Hezekiah;
40:1:10/And Hezekiah fathered Manasseh; and Manasseh fathered Amon; and Amon fathered Josiah; 
40:1:11/And Josiah fathered Jeconiah and his brothers, around the time they were deported to Babylon: 
40:1:12/And after the deportation to Babylon, Jeconiah fathered Shealtiel; and Shealtiel fathered Zerubbabel; 
40:1:13/And Zerubbabel fathered Abiud; and Abiud fathered Eliakim; and Eliakim fathered Azor; 
40:1:14/And Azor fathered Zadok; and Zadok fathered Achim; and Achim fathered Eliud; 
40:1:15/And Eliud fathered Eleazar; and Eleazar fathered Matthan; and Matthan fathered Jacob; 
40:1:16/And Jacob fathered Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, who is called the Messiah.
40:1:17/Therefore, all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; and from David to the deportation to Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the deportation to Babylon to the Messiah, fourteen generations.
40:1:18/Now the birth of Jesus Christ happened like this: When his mother Mary was pledged to be married to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant through the Holy Spirit.
40:1:19/Then Joseph her husband, being a righteous man and not wanting to expose her to public disgrace, planned to divorce her quietly.
40:1:20/But as he considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, "Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife, for the child conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.
40:1:21/She will give birth to a son, and you are to name him Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins."
40:1:22/All this took place to fulfill what the Lord had said through the prophet:
40:1:23/"Look, the virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and they will call him Emmanuel" (which means "God with us").
40:1:24/When Joseph woke up, he did what the angel of the Lord had commanded him and took Mary as his wife.
40:1:25/But he did not consummate their marriage until she gave birth to her firstborn son. And he named him Jesus.
40:2:1/Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea during the reign of King Herod, wise men from the east arrived in Jerusalem,
40:2:2/Asking, "Where is the one born King of the Jews? We saw his star in the east and have come to worship him."
40:2:3/When King Herod heard this, he was disturbed, and all of Jerusalem with him.
40:2:4/He called together all the chief priests and scribes of the people and asked them where the Christ was to be born.
40:2:5/They told him, "In Bethlehem of Judaea, as the prophet has written,"
40:2:6/"And you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for from you shall come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel."
40:2:7/Then Herod secretly called the wise men and found out exactly when the star had appeared.
40:2:8/He sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and search carefully for the child; and when you find him, let me know, so that I too may go and worship him."
40:2:9/After hearing the king, they went on their way; and the star they had seen in the east went ahead of them until it stopped over the place where the child was.
40:2:10/When they saw the star, they were overjoyed beyond measure.
40:2:11/Upon entering the house, they saw the child with Mary his mother, and they bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasures and presented him with gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
40:2:12/And having been warned in a dream not to go back to Herod, they returned to their country by another route.
40:2:13/After they had left, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, "Get up, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, for Herod is going to search for the child to kill him."
40:2:14/So he got up, took the child and his mother during the night, and left for Egypt,
40:2:15/And stayed there until the death of Herod. This was to fulfill what the Lord had said through the prophet: "Out of Egypt I called my son."
40:2:16/Then Herod, when he realized he had been outwitted by the wise men, was furious, and he ordered the killing of all the boys in Bethlehem and its vicinity who were two years old and under, in accordance with the time he had learned from the wise men.
40:2:17/This fulfilled what was spoken through the prophet Jeremiah:
40:2:18/"A voice is heard in Ramah, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more."
40:2:19/But when Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,
40:2:20/Saying, "Get up, take the child and his mother, and go to the land of Israel, for those who were trying to take the child's life are dead."
40:2:21/So he got up, took the child and his mother, and went to the land of Israel.
40:2:22/But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning in Judaea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there. Having been warned in a dream, he withdrew to the district of Galilee,
40:2:23/And he went and lived in a town called Nazareth. So was fulfilled what was said through the prophets, that he would be called a Nazarene.
40:3:1/In those days, John the Baptist arrived, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea,
40:3:2/And he proclaimed, "Change your ways: for the kingdom of heaven is near."
40:3:3/This is the one mentioned by the prophet Isaiah, who said, "A voice shouting in the wilderness, 'Prepare the way for the Lord, make his paths straight.'"
40:3:4/John himself wore clothing made of camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist; and he ate locusts and wild honey.
40:3:5/People from Jerusalem, all of Judaea, and the entire region around the Jordan went out to him,
40:3:6/And were baptized by him in the Jordan River, as they confessed their sins.
40:3:7/But when he saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming for baptism, he said to them, "You brood of vipers, who warned you to escape the coming wrath?"
40:3:8/"Therefore, produce actions that show you have changed your hearts and lives."
40:3:9/And don't think you can say to yourselves, 'We have Abraham as our father.' I tell you, God can create children for Abraham from these stones.
40:3:10/And now, the axe is already at the root of the trees. So, every tree that doesn't produce good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.
40:3:11/I baptize you with water as a sign of repentance. But the one coming after me is more powerful than I, whose sandals I'm not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
40:3:12/He has his winnowing fork in hand, and he will thoroughly clean his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn with fire that never goes out.
40:3:13/Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to be baptized by John.
40:3:14/But John tried to deter him, saying, "I need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?"
40:3:15/But Jesus replied, "Let it be so now; it is proper for us to do this to fulfill all righteousness." Then John agreed.
40:3:16/And when Jesus was baptized, he immediately came up from the water. Suddenly, the heavens were opened to him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and alighting on him.
40:3:17/And a voice from heaven said, "This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased."
40:4:1/Then Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
40:4:2/After fasting for forty days and forty nights, he was very hungry.
40:4:3/When the tempter approached him, he said, "If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread."
40:4:4/But Jesus replied, "It is written, 'People do not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.'"
40:4:5/Then the devil took him to the holy city and placed him on the highest point of the temple,
40:4:6/And said to him, "If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down. For it is written: 'He will command his angels concerning you, and they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.'"
40:4:7/Jesus said to him, "Again, it is written, 'Do not put the Lord your God to the test.'"
40:4:8/Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendor.
40:4:9/And he said to him, "All this I will give you if you will bow down and worship me."
40:4:10/Then Jesus said to him, "Away from me, Satan! For it is written: 'Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only.'"
40:4:11/Then the devil left him, and angels came and attended to him.
40:4:12/When Jesus heard that John had been put in prison, he withdrew to Galilee;
40:4:13/Leaving Nazareth, he went and lived in Capernaum, which is by the lake in the area of Zebulun and Naphtali,
40:4:14/To fulfill what was said through the prophet Isaiah:
40:4:15/"The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, the way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles;
40:4:16/The people living in darkness have seen a great light; on those living in the land of the shadow of death, a light has dawned."
40:4:17/From that time on, Jesus began to preach, "Repent, for the kingdom of heaven has come near."
40:4:18/As Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew, casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.
40:4:19/He said to them, "Follow me, and I will make you fishers of people."
40:4:20/Immediately they left their nets and followed him.
40:4:21/Moving on from there, he saw two other brothers, James son of Zebedee and his brother John, in a boat with their father Zebedee, repairing their nets. He called them.
40:4:22/And immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.
40:4:23/Jesus went throughout Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, proclaiming the good news of the kingdom, and healing every disease and sickness among the people.
40:4:24/News about him spread all over Syria, and people brought to him all who were ill with various diseases, those suffering severe pain, the demon-possessed, those having seizures, and the paralyzed; and he healed them.
40:4:25/Large crowds from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and the region across the Jordan followed him.
40:5:1/Seeing the crowds, he went up on the mountain, and when he sat down, his disciples came to him.
40:5:2/And he began to teach them, saying,
40:5:3/Happy are those who are spiritually poor, for the kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
40:5:4/Happy are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.
40:5:5/Happy are the gentle, for they will inherit the earth.
40:5:6/Happy are those who hunger and thirst for what is right, for they will be satisfied.
40:5:7/Happy are the compassionate, for they will receive compassion.
40:5:8/Happy are those with a clean heart, for they will see God.
40:5:9/Happy are those who work for peace, for they will be called the children of God.
40:5:10/Happy are those who are persecuted because they do what is right, for the kingdom of heaven is theirs.
40:5:11/Happy are you when people insult you, persecute you, and falsely say all kinds of evil against you because of me.
40:5:12/Be joyful and very glad, because your reward in heaven is great; for in the same way, they persecuted the prophets who were before you.
40:5:13/You are the salt of the earth, but if salt loses its taste, how can it be made salty again? It is then good for nothing but to be thrown out and trampled underfoot.
40:5:14/You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden.
40:5:15/People don't light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on a lampstand, and it gives light to everyone in the house.
40:5:16/In the same way, let your light shine before others, so that they may see your good deeds and give glory to your Father in heaven.
40:5:17/Don't think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I have not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.
40:5:18/Truly, I tell you, until heaven and earth disappear, not the smallest letter, not the least stroke of a pen, will by any means disappear from the Law until everything is accomplished.
40:5:19/Therefore, anyone who sets aside one of the least of these commands and teaches others accordingly will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever practices and teaches these commands will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.
40:5:20/For I tell you that unless your righteousness surpasses that of the Pharisees and the teachers of the law, you will certainly not enter the kingdom of heaven.
40:5:21/You have heard that it was said to the people long ago, 'You shall not murder,' and anyone who murders will be subject to judgment.
40:5:22/But I tell you that anyone who is angry with a brother or sister will be subject to judgment. Again, anyone who says to a brother or sister, 'Raca,' is answerable to the court. And anyone who says, 'You fool!' will be in danger of the fire of hell.
40:5:23/So if you are offering your gift at the altar and there remember that your brother or sister has something against you,
40:5:24/leave your gift there in front of the altar. First go and be reconciled to your brother or sister; then come and offer your gift.
