40:23:14/Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour widows' houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. Therefore, you will receive a greater condemnation.
40:23:15/Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel over sea and land to make a single convert, and when you do, you make them twice as much a child of hell as yourselves.
40:23:16/Woe to you, blind guides, who say, 'If anyone swears by the temple, it means nothing; but anyone who swears by the gold of the temple is bound by their oath.'
40:23:17/You fools and blind! For which is greater, the gold, or the temple that makes the gold sacred?
40:23:18/And, 'If anyone swears by the altar, it means nothing; but anyone who swears by the gift on it is bound by their oath.'
40:23:19/You fools and blind! For which is greater, the gift, or the altar that makes the gift sacred?
40:23:20/Therefore, anyone who swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.
40:23:21/And anyone who swears by the temple swears by it and by the one who dwells in it.
40:23:22/And anyone who swears by heaven swears by God's throne and by the one who sits on it.
40:23:23/Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you give a tenth of your spices—mint, dill, and cumin—but you have neglected the more important matters of the law—justice, mercy, and faithfulness. You should have practiced the latter, without neglecting the former.
40:23:24/You blind guides! You strain out a gnat but swallow a camel.
40:23:25/Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside they are full of greed and self-indulgence.
40:23:26/You blind Pharisee! First clean the inside of the cup and dish, and then the outside also will be clean.
40:23:27/Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs, which look beautiful on the outside but inside are full of the bones of the dead and everything unclean.
40:23:28/In the same way, on the outside you appear to people as righteous but on the inside you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.
40:23:29/Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the graves of the righteous,
40:23:30/And you say, 'If we had lived in the days of our ancestors, we would not have taken part with them in shedding the blood of the prophets.'
40:23:31/So you testify against yourselves that you are descendants of those who murdered the prophets.
40:23:32/Go ahead, then, and complete what your ancestors started!
40:23:33/You snakes, you brood of vipers, how will you escape being condemned to hell?
40:23:34/Therefore, I am sending you prophets and wise men and teachers. Some of them you will kill and crucify; others you will flog in your synagogues and pursue from town to town.
40:23:35/And so upon you will come all the righteous blood that has been shed on earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
40:23:36/Truly I tell you, all this will come on this generation.
40:23:37/Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing.
40:23:38/Look, your house is left to you desolate.
40:23:39/For I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, 'Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord.'
40:24:1/Jesus left the temple, and as he was leaving, his disciples approached him to point out the temple buildings.
40:24:2/Jesus responded, "Do you see all these things? Truly, I tell you, not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down."
40:24:3/While sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately and asked, "When will this happen, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?"
40:24:4/Jesus replied, "Be careful that no one deceives you."
40:24:5/Many will come in my name, claiming, 'I am the Messiah,' and will deceive many.
40:24:6/You will hear of wars and rumors of wars, but don't be alarmed. These things must happen, but the end is still to come.
40:24:7/Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
40:24:8/All these are the beginning of birth pains.
40:24:9/Then you will be handed over to be persecuted and put to death, and you will be hated by all nations because of me.
40:24:10/Many will turn away from the faith and will betray and hate each other.
40:24:11/Many false prophets will appear and deceive many people.
40:24:12/Because of the increase of wickedness, the love of most will grow cold,
40:24:13/but the one who stands firm to the end will be saved.
40:24:14/This good news of the kingdom will be proclaimed in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.
40:24:15/So when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by the prophet Daniel, standing in the holy place—let the reader understand—
40:24:16/then those in Judea should flee to the mountains.
40:24:17/Anyone on the rooftop should not go down to take anything out of their house.
40:24:18/And anyone in the field should not go back to get their cloak.
40:24:19/How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!
40:24:20/Pray that your flight will not take place in winter or on the Sabbath.
40:24:21/For then there will be great distress, unequaled from the beginning of the world until now—and never to be equaled again.
40:24:22/If those days had not been cut short, no one would survive, but for the sake of the elect those days will be shortened.
40:24:23/If anyone tells you, 'Look, here is the Messiah!' or, 'There he is!' do not believe it.
40:24:24/For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform great signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
40:24:25/See, I have told you ahead of time.
40:24:26/So if anyone tells you, 'There he is, out in the wilderness,' do not go out; or, 'Here he is, in the inner rooms,' do not believe it.
40:24:27/For as lightning that comes from the east is visible even in the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.
40:24:28/Wherever there is a carcass, there the vultures will gather.
40:24:29/Immediately after the distress of those days, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light; the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.
40:24:30/Then will appear the sign of the Son of Man in heaven. And then all the peoples of the earth will mourn when they see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven, with power and great glory.
40:24:31/He will send his angels with a loud trumpet call, and they will gather his elect from the four winds, from one end of the heavens to the other.
40:24:32/Learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.
40:24:33/So also, when you see all these things, you know that it is near, right at the door.
40:24:34/Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.
40:24:35/Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
40:24:36/But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
40:24:37/As it was in the days of Noah, so it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.
40:24:38/For in the days before the flood, people were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, up to the day Noah entered the ark;
40:24:39/and they knew nothing about what would happen until the flood came and took them all away. That is how it will be at the coming of the Son of Man.
40:24:40/Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.
40:24:41/Two women will be grinding with a hand mill; one will be taken and the other left.
40:24:42/Therefore keep watch, because you do not know on what day your Lord will come.
40:24:43/But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what time of night the thief was coming, he would have kept watch and would not have let his house be broken into.
40:24:44/So you also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him.
40:24:45/Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom the master has put in charge of the servants in his household to give them their food at the proper time?
40:24:46/It will be good for that servant whose master finds him doing so when he returns.
40:24:47/Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
40:24:48/But if that wicked servant says to himself, 'My master is staying away a long time,'
40:24:49/and he then begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with drunkards,
40:24:50/the master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of.
40:24:51/He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the hypocrites, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
40:25:1/Then the kingdom of heaven will be like ten bridesmaids who took their lamps and went out to meet the groom.
40:25:2/And five of them were wise, and five were foolish.
40:25:3/The foolish ones took their lamps but did not take any oil with them.
40:25:4/But the wise ones took oil in jars along with their lamps.
40:25:5/While the groom was delayed, they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
40:25:6/At midnight, a shout went up: 'Look, the groom is coming; go out to meet him.'
40:25:7/Then all the bridesmaids woke up and got their lamps ready.
40:25:8/And the foolish said to the wise, 'Give us some of your oil; our lamps are going out.'
40:25:9/But the wise answered, 'No, there may not be enough for both us and you. Instead, go to those who sell oil and buy some for yourselves.'
40:25:10/But while they were on their way to buy the oil, the groom arrived. The ones who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet, and the door was shut.
40:25:11/Later the others also came, saying, 'Lord, Lord, open the door for us.'
40:25:12/But he replied, 'Truly I tell you, I don't know you.'
40:25:13/Therefore keep watch, because you do not know the day or the hour when the Son of Man will come.
40:25:14/For the kingdom of heaven is like a man going on a long journey, who called his servants and entrusted his wealth to them.
40:25:15/To one he gave five bags of gold, to another two bags, and to another one bag, each according to his ability. Then he went on his journey.
40:25:16/The one who had received the five bags of gold went at once and put his money to work and gained five more bags.
40:25:17/In the same way, the one with two bags of gold gained two more.
40:25:18/But the one who had received one bag went off, dug a hole in the ground and hid his master's money.
40:25:19/After a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them.
40:25:20/The man who had received five bags of gold brought the other five. 'Master,' he said, 'you entrusted me with five bags of gold. See, I have gained five more.'
40:25:21/His master replied, 'Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master's happiness!'
40:25:22/The man with two bags of gold also came. 'Master,' he said, 'you entrusted me with two bags of gold; see, I have gained two more.'
40:25:23/His master replied, 'Well done, good and faithful servant! You have been faithful with a few things; I will put you in charge of many things. Come and share your master's happiness!'
40:25:24/Then the man who had received one bag of gold came. 'Master,' he said, 'I knew that you are a hard man, harvesting where you have not sown and gathering where you have not scattered seed.'
40:25:25/So I was afraid and went and hid your gold in the ground. See, here is what belongs to you.'
40:25:26/His master replied, 'You wicked, lazy servant! So you knew that I harvest where I have not sown and gather where I have not scattered seed?'
40:25:27/Well then, you should have put my money on deposit with the bankers, so that when I returned I would have received it back with interest.'
40:25:28/'So take the bag of gold from him and give it to the one who has ten bags.'
40:25:29/'For everyone who has will be given more, and they will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.'
40:25:30/'And throw that worthless servant outside, into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.'
40:25:31/When the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, he will sit on his glorious throne.
40:25:32/All the nations will be gathered before him, and he will separate the people one from another as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
40:25:33/He will put the sheep on his right and the goats on his left.
40:25:34/Then the King will say to those on his right, 'Come, you who are blessed by my Father; take your inheritance, the kingdom prepared for you since the creation of the world.'
40:25:35/For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink, I was a stranger and you invited me in,
40:25:36/I needed clothes and you clothed me, I was sick and you looked after me, I was in prison and you came to visit me.'
40:25:37/Then the righteous will answer him, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you something to drink?'
40:25:38/When did we see you a stranger and invite you in, or needing clothes and clothe you?'
40:25:39/When did we see you sick or in prison and go to visit you?'
40:25:40/The King will reply, 'Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me.'
40:25:41/Then he will say to those on his left, 'Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels.'
40:25:42/For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink,
40:25:43/I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, I needed clothes and you did not clothe me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after me.'
40:25:44/They also will answer, 'Lord, when did we see you hungry or thirsty or a stranger or needing clothes or sick or in prison, and did not help you?'
40:25:45/He will reply, 'Truly I tell you, whatever you did not do for one of the least of these, you did not do for me.'
40:25:46/And they will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.
40:26:1/After Jesus finished all these teachings, he told his disciples,
40:26:2/"You know that in two days it's the Passover feast, and the Son of Man will be handed over to be crucified."
40:26:3/Then the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders of the people gathered at the palace of the high priest, named Caiaphas,
40:26:4/And they plotted to arrest Jesus in a sneaky way and kill him.
40:26:5/But they said, "Not during the festival, or there might be a riot among the people."
40:26:6/While Jesus was in Bethany, at the home of Simon the leper,
40:26:7/A woman came to him with a jar of very expensive perfume, which she poured on his head as he was reclining at the table.
40:26:8/But when his disciples saw this, they were upset, asking, "Why this waste?
40:26:9/"This perfume could have been sold for a lot and the money given to the poor."
40:26:10/Understanding their reaction, Jesus said to them, "Why are you bothering this woman? She has done a beautiful thing for me.
40:26:11/"You will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me.
40:26:12/"By pouring this perfume on my body, she has prepared me for burial.
40:26:13/"Truly, I tell you, wherever this good news is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told in memory of her."
40:26:14/Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests,
40:26:15/And asked, "What are you willing to give me if I deliver him to you?" So they agreed to pay him thirty pieces of silver.
40:26:16/From that moment, he looked for an opportunity to betray Jesus.
40:26:17/On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the disciples came to Jesus and asked, "Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?"
40:26:18/He replied, "Go into the city to a certain man and tell him, 'The Teacher says: My appointed time is near; I will celebrate the Passover with my disciples at your house.'"
40:26:19/So the disciples did as Jesus had directed them and prepared the Passover.
40:26:20/When evening came, he was reclining at the table with the twelve.
40:26:21/And while they were eating, he said, "Truly, I tell you, one of you will betray me."
40:26:22/They were deeply distressed and began to say to him one after another, "Surely not I, Lord?"
40:26:23/He replied, "The one who has dipped his hand into the bowl with me will betray me.
40:26:24/"The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him, but woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born."
40:26:25/Then Judas, the one who would betray him, said, "Surely not I, Rabbi?" Jesus answered, "You have said so."
40:26:26/While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying, "Take and eat; this is my body."
40:26:27/Then he took a cup, and after giving thanks, he gave it to them, saying, "Drink from it, all of you;
40:26:28/"For this is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins.
40:26:29/"But I tell you, I will not drink from this fruit of the vine from now on until the day when I drink it new with you in my Father's kingdom."
40:26:30/After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
40:26:31/Then Jesus said to them, "Tonight, all of you will fall away because of me, for it is written: 'I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.'
40:26:32/"But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee."
40:26:33/Peter replied, "Even if everyone else falls away because of you, I never will."
40:26:34/Jesus said to him, "Truly, I tell you, tonight, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times."
40:26:35/But Peter declared, "Even if I have to die with you, I will never deny you." And all the disciples said the same.
40:26:36/Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane and said to his disciples, "Sit here while I go over there and pray."
40:26:37/He took Peter and the two sons of Zebedee along with him, and he began to be sorrowful and troubled.
40:26:38/Then he said to them, "My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death. Stay here and keep watch with me."
40:26:39/Going a little farther, he fell with his face to the ground and prayed, "My Father, if it is possible, may this cup be taken from me. Yet not as I will, but as you will."
40:26:40/He returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. He said to Peter, "Couldn't you men keep watch with me for one hour?
40:26:41/"Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak."
40:26:42/He went away a second time and prayed, "My Father, if it is not possible for this cup to be taken away unless I drink it, may your will be done."
40:26:43/He came back and found them sleeping again, because their eyes were heavy.
40:26:44/So he left them and went away once more and prayed the third time, saying the same thing.
40:26:45/Then he returned to the disciples and said to them, "Are you still sleeping and resting? Look, the hour has come, and the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.
40:26:46/"Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!"
40:26:47/While he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, arrived. With him was a large crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests and the elders of the people.
40:26:48/The betrayer had given them a sign, saying, "The one I kiss is the man; arrest him."
40:26:49/Immediately he went up to Jesus and said, "Greetings, Rabbi!" and kissed him.
40:26:50/Jesus replied, "Friend, do what you came for." Then the men stepped forward, seized Jesus, and arrested him.
40:26:51/At that moment, one of Jesus' companions reached for his sword, drew it out, and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.
40:26:52/Then Jesus said to him, "Put your sword back in its place, for all who draw the sword will die by the sword.
40:26:53/"Do you think I cannot call on my Father, and he will at once put at my disposal more than twelve legions of angels?
40:26:54/"But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that say it must happen in this way?"
40:26:55/At that time, Jesus said to the crowd, "Am I leading a rebellion, that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me? Every day I sat in the temple courts teaching, and you did not arrest me.
40:26:56/"But this has all taken place that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled." Then all the disciples deserted him and fled.
40:26:57/Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas the high priest, where the teachers of the law and the elders had assembled.
40:26:58/But Peter followed him at a distance, right up to the courtyard of the high priest. He entered and sat down with the guards to see the outcome.
40:26:59/The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false evidence against Jesus so they could put him to death,
40:26:60/But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward. Finally, two came forward
40:26:61/And declared, "This man said, 'I can destroy the temple of God and rebuild it in three days.'"
40:26:62/The high priest stood up and said to Jesus, "Aren't you going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?"
40:26:63/But Jesus remained silent. The high priest said to him, "I charge you under oath by the living God: Tell us if you are the Messiah, the Son of God."
40:26:64/Jesus said to him, "You have said so. But I say to all of you: From now on, you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven."
40:26:65/Then the high priest tore his clothes and said, "He has spoken blasphemy! Why do we need any more witnesses? Look, now you have heard the blasphemy.
40:26:66/"What do you think?" They answered, "He deserves to die."
40:26:67/Then they spit in his face and struck him with their fists. Others slapped him
40:26:68/And said, "Prophesy to us, Messiah. Who hit you?"
40:26:69/While Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard, a servant girl came up to him and said, "You also were with Jesus of Galilee."
40:26:70/But he denied it before everyone, saying, "I don't know what you're talking about."
40:26:71/When he went out to the gateway, another servant girl saw him and said to the people there, "This man was with Jesus of Nazareth."
40:26:72/He denied it again, with an oath: "I don't know the man."
40:26:73/After a little while, those standing nearby came up to Peter and said, "Surely you are one of them; your accent gives you away."
40:26:74/Then he began to curse and swear, "I don't know the man!" And immediately a rooster crowed.
40:26:75/And Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken: "Before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times." And he went outside and wept bitterly.
40:27:1/At dawn, all the chief priests and elders of the people plotted against Jesus to have him executed.
40:27:2/After they had tied him up, they led him away and handed him over to Pontius Pilate, the governor.
40:27:3/Then Judas, who had betrayed him, saw that Jesus was condemned, felt remorse, and returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
40:27:4/Saying, "I have sinned by betraying innocent blood." But they said, "What's that to us? That's your problem."
40:27:5/So he threw the silver coins into the temple, left, and went away and hanged himself.
40:27:6/The chief priests picked up the silver coins and said, "It's not lawful to put this into the treasury, since it's blood money."
40:27:7/So they decided to use the money to buy the potter's field as a burial place for foreigners.
40:27:8/That's why that field has been called the Field of Blood to this day.
40:27:9/This fulfilled what was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying, "And they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price set on him by the people of Israel,
40:27:10/And they used them to buy the potter's field, as the Lord directed me."
40:27:11/Jesus stood before the governor, who questioned him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" Jesus replied, "You have said so."
40:27:12/But when he was accused by the chief priests and elders, he gave no answer.
40:27:13/Then Pilate said to him, "Don't you hear how many charges they're bringing against you?"
40:27:14/But Jesus didn't respond at all, which amazed the governor greatly.
40:27:15/At the festival, the governor used to release to the crowd a prisoner of their choice.
40:27:16/At that time, they had a notorious prisoner named Barabbas.
40:27:17/So when they had gathered, Pilate asked them, "Who do you want me to release to you? Barabbas, or Jesus who is called the Messiah?"
40:27:18/He knew they had handed Jesus over out of jealousy.
40:27:19/While he was sitting on the judgment seat, his wife sent him a message, saying, "Don't have anything to do with that innocent man, for I have suffered a lot today in a dream because of him."
40:27:20/But the chief priests and elders convinced the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to have Jesus executed.
40:27:21/The governor asked them, "Which of the two do you want me to release to you?" They said, "Barabbas."
40:27:22/Pilate asked them, "Then what should I do with Jesus who is called the Messiah?" They all said, "Crucify him!"
40:27:23/The governor asked, "Why? What crime has he committed?" But they shouted even louder, "Crucify him!"
40:27:24/Seeing that he was getting nowhere, but that a riot was starting, Pilate took water, washed his hands in front of the crowd, and said, "I am innocent of this man's blood. It's your responsibility."
40:27:25/All the people answered, "Let his blood be on us and on our children!"
40:27:26/Then he released Barabbas to them. After having Jesus flogged, he handed him over to be crucified.
40:27:27/Then the governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium and gathered the whole company of soldiers around him.
40:27:28/They stripped him and put a scarlet robe on him.
40:27:29/After twisting a crown of thorns, they put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand. Then they knelt in front of him and mocked him, saying, "Hail, King of the Jews!"
40:27:30/They spat on him, took the reed, and struck him on the head.
40:27:31/After mocking him, they took off the robe, put his own clothes on him, and led him away to crucify him.
40:27:32/As they were going out, they found a man from Cyrene named Simon, whom they forced to carry Jesus' cross.
40:27:33/When they reached a place called Golgotha, which means Place of the Skull,
40:27:34/They offered him wine mixed with gall to drink. But after tasting it, he refused to drink it.
40:27:35/After crucifying him, they divided up his clothes by casting lots,
40:27:36/And sitting down, they kept watch over him there.
40:27:37/Above his head they placed the written charge against him: THIS IS JESUS, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
40:27:38/Two rebels were crucified with him, one on his right and one on his left.
40:27:39/Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads
40:27:40/And saying, "You who were going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days, save yourself! If you are the Son of God, come down from the cross."
40:27:41/In the same way, the chief priests, along with the scribes and elders, mocked him, saying,
40:27:42/"He saved others, but he can't save himself. If he's the King of Israel, let him come down now from the cross, and we'll believe in him.
40:27:43/He trusts in God; let God rescue him now if he wants him, for he said, 'I am the Son of God.'"
40:27:44/Even the rebels who were crucified with him taunted him in the same way.
40:27:45/From noon until three in the afternoon, darkness came over all the land.
40:27:46/About three in the afternoon, Jesus cried out in a loud voice, "Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?" which means, "My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?"
40:27:47/When some of those standing there heard this, they said, "He's calling for Elijah."
40:27:48/Immediately one of them ran, got a sponge, filled it with wine vinegar, put it on a stick, and offered it to Jesus to drink.
40:27:49/The others said, "Leave him alone. Let's see if Elijah comes to save him."
40:27:50/Jesus cried out again in a loud voice and gave up his spirit.
40:27:51/At that moment, the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom. The earth shook, rocks split,
40:27:52/And tombs broke open. The bodies of many holy people who had died were raised to life.
40:27:53/They came out of the tombs after Jesus' resurrection and went into the holy city and appeared to many people.
40:27:54/When the centurion and those with him who were guarding Jesus saw the earthquake and all that had happened, they were terrified and exclaimed, "Truly, this was the Son of God!"
40:27:55/Many women were there, watching from a distance. They had followed Jesus from Galilee to care for his needs.
40:27:56/Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James and Joseph, and the mother of Zebedee's sons.
40:27:57/As evening approached, a wealthy man from Arimathea named Joseph, who had also become a disciple of Jesus,
40:27:58/Went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body. Pilate ordered that it be given to him.
40:27:59/Joseph took the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth,
40:27:60/And placed it in his own new tomb that he had cut out of the rock. He then rolled a big stone in front of the entrance to the tomb and left.
40:27:61/Mary Magdalene and the other Mary were sitting there opposite the tomb.
40:27:62/The next day, the one after Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate,
40:27:63/Saying, "Sir, we remember that deceiver said while he was still alive, 'After three days I will rise again.'"
40:27:64/So give the order for the tomb to be made secure until the third day. Otherwise, his disciples might come and steal the body and tell the people he has been raised from the dead. This last deception would be worse than the first."
40:27:65/Pilate told them, "You have a guard; go, make the tomb as secure as you know how."
40:27:66/So they went and made the tomb secure by sealing the stone and setting a guard.
40:28:1/At the end of the Sabbath, as the first day of the week was dawning, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to visit the tomb.
40:28:2/Suddenly, there was a great earthquake because an angel of the Lord descended from heaven, came, rolled back the stone, and sat on it.
40:28:3/His appearance was like lightning, and his clothes were as white as snow.
40:28:4/The guards were so afraid of him that they shook and became like dead men.
40:28:5/The angel said to the women, "Don't be afraid. I know you're looking for Jesus, who was crucified.
40:28:6/He's not here; he has risen, just as he said. Come and see the place where he lay.
40:28:7/Now go quickly and tell his disciples that he has risen from the dead. He's going ahead of you into Galilee; you will see him there. Remember, I have told you."
40:28:8/They left the tomb quickly, filled with fear and great joy, and ran to tell his disciples.
40:28:9/As they went to tell the disciples, Jesus met them and greeted them. They approached, took hold of his feet, and worshiped him.
40:28:10/Then Jesus said to them, "Don't be afraid. Go and tell my brothers to go to Galilee, and they will see me there."
40:28:11/While they were on their way, some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had happened.
40:28:12/After the chief priests had met with the elders and devised a plan, they gave the soldiers a large sum of money,
40:28:13/telling them, "You must say, 'His disciples came during the night and stole him away while we were asleep.'
40:28:14/If this report gets to the governor, we will satisfy him and keep you out of trouble."
40:28:15/So the soldiers took the money and did as they were instructed. And this story has been widely circulated among the Jews to this very day.
40:28:16/Then the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.
40:28:17/When they saw him, they worshiped him, but some doubted.
40:28:18/Jesus came to them and said, "All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me.
40:28:19/Therefore, go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit,
40:28:20/teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely, I am with you always, to the very end of the age."
41:1:1/The beginning of the good news about Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
41:1:2/As it is written in the prophets, "Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way."
41:1:3/"A voice of one calling in the wilderness, 'Prepare the way for the Lord, make his paths straight.'"
41:1:4/John was baptizing in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
41:1:5/People from all over Judea and Jerusalem went out to him and were baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
41:1:6/John wore clothing made of camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
41:1:7/He preached, saying, "After me comes one more powerful than I, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to bend down and untie.
41:1:8/I have baptized you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit."
41:1:9/At that time, Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
41:1:10/Just as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw heaven being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.
41:1:11/And a voice came from heaven: "You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased."
41:1:12/Immediately the Spirit sent him out into the wilderness.
41:1:13/And he was in the wilderness forty days, being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and angels attended him.
41:1:14/After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, proclaiming the good news of God.
41:1:15/"The time has come," he said. "The kingdom of God has come near. Repent and believe the good news!"
41:1:16/As Jesus walked beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.
41:1:17/Jesus said to them, "Follow me, and I will make you fishers of people."
41:1:18/At once they left their nets and followed him.
41:1:19/Going a little farther, he saw James son of Zebedee and his brother John in a boat, preparing their nets.
41:1:20/Without delay he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.
41:1:21/They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.
41:1:22/The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught them as one who had authority, not as the teachers of the law.
41:1:23/Just then a man in their synagogue who was possessed by an impure spirit cried out,
41:1:24/"What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!"
41:1:25/Jesus rebuked him, saying, "Be quiet, and come out of him!"
41:1:26/And the impure spirit shook the man violently and came out of him with a shriek.
41:1:27/Everyone was so amazed that they asked each other, "What is this? A new teaching—and with authority! He even gives orders to impure spirits and they obey him."
41:1:28/News about him spread quickly over the whole region of Galilee.
41:1:29/As soon as they left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.
41:1:30/Simon's mother-in-law was in bed with a fever, and they immediately told Jesus about her.
41:1:31/So he went to her, took her hand and helped her up. The fever left her and she began to wait on them.
41:1:32/That evening after sunset the people brought to Jesus all the sick and demon-possessed.
41:1:33/The whole town gathered at the door.
41:1:34/And he healed many who had various diseases, and drove out many demons, but he would not let the demons speak because they knew who he was.
41:1:35/Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up, left the house and went off to a solitary place, where he prayed.
41:1:36/Simon and his companions went to look for him,
41:1:37/and when they found him, they exclaimed: "Everyone is looking for you!"
41:1:38/He replied, "Let us go somewhere else—to the nearby villages—so I can preach there also. That is why I have come."
41:1:39/So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.
41:1:40/A man with leprosy came to him and begged him on his knees, "If you are willing, you can make me clean."
41:1:41/Moved with compassion, Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. "I am willing," he said. "Be clean!"
41:1:42/Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cleansed.
41:1:43/Jesus sent him away at once with a strong warning:
41:1:44/"See that you don't tell this to anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them."
41:1:45/But the man went out and began to talk freely, spreading the news. As a result, Jesus could no longer enter a town openly but stayed outside in lonely places. Yet people still came to him from everywhere.
41:2:1/And again he entered into Capernaum after a few days; and word spread that he was in the house.
41:2:2/And immediately, many people gathered, so much so that there was no space left, not even near the door; and he shared his teachings with them.
41:2:3/They came to him, bringing a man paralyzed, carried by four of them.
41:2:4/And when they couldn't get close to him because of the crowd, they removed the roof above him; and after making an opening, they lowered the mat the paralyzed man was lying on.
41:2:5/Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralyzed man, "Son, your sins are forgiven."
41:2:6/But some of the scribes were sitting there, questioning in their minds,
41:2:7/"Why does this man speak like this? He's blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?"
41:2:8/Immediately, Jesus, knowing in his spirit that they were thinking this, said to them, "Why are you thinking these things in your hearts?
41:2:9/"Which is easier: to say to the paralyzed man, 'Your sins are forgiven,' or to say, 'Get up, take your mat and walk'?
41:2:10/"But so you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins..." He said to the paralyzed man,
41:2:11/"I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home."
41:2:12/And immediately the man got up, took his mat, and walked out in full view of them all. This amazed everyone and they praised God, saying, "We have never seen anything like this!"
41:2:13/Then he went out again by the sea; and all the crowd came to him, and he taught them.
41:2:14/As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector's booth. "Follow me," Jesus told him, and Levi got up and followed him.
41:2:15/While Jesus was having dinner at Levi's house, many tax collectors and sinners were eating with him and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.
41:2:16/When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw him eating with the sinners and tax collectors, they asked his disciples: "Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?"
41:2:17/On hearing this, Jesus said to them, "It's not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance."
41:2:18/John's disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. They came and asked him, "Why do John's disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but yours do not?"
41:2:19/Jesus answered, "How can the guests of the bridegroom fast while he is with them? They cannot, so long as they have him with them.
41:2:20/"But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and on that day they will fast."
41:2:21/"No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the new piece will pull away from the old, making the tear worse.
41:2:22/"And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the wineskins will be ruined. No, they pour new wine into new wineskins."
41:2:23/One Sabbath, he was going through the grainfields, and as his disciples walked along, they began to pick some heads of grain.
41:2:24/The Pharisees said to him, "Look, why are they doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?"
41:2:25/He answered, "Haven't you ever read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?
41:2:26/"How he entered the house of God during the time of Abiathar the high priest and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat, and also gave some to his companions?"
41:2:27/Then he said to them, "The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.
41:2:28/"So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath."
41:3:1/He entered the synagogue again, and there was a man there with a withered hand.
41:3:2/They watched him closely to see if he would heal the man on the Sabbath, hoping to find a reason to accuse him.
41:3:3/He said to the man with the withered hand, "Stand up in front of everyone."
41:3:4/Then he asked them, "Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath, or to do evil? To save a life, or to kill?" But they remained silent.
41:3:5/Looking around at them with anger, saddened by the stubbornness of their hearts, he said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." He did so, and his hand was completely restored.
41:3:6/The Pharisees left and immediately started plotting with the Herodians on how they could kill him.
41:3:7/But Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples, and a large crowd from Galilee followed him, and from Judea,
41:3:8/And from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and from beyond the Jordan, and from around Tyre and Sidon. When they heard about the amazing things he was doing, a large crowd came to him.
41:3:9/He told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him to avoid being crushed by the crowd.
41:3:10/For he had healed many, so that those with diseases were pushing forward to touch him.
41:3:11/And whenever the impure spirits saw him, they fell down before him and shouted, "You are the Son of God."
41:3:12/But he sternly warned them not to reveal who he was.
41:3:13/He went up on a mountainside and called to him those he wanted, and they came to him.
41:3:14/He appointed twelve that they might be with him and that he could send them out to preach,
41:3:15/And to have authority to heal sicknesses and to drive out demons.
41:3:16/And Simon he named Peter;
41:3:17/James son of Zebedee and John the brother of James; he named them Boanerges, which means "sons of thunder";
41:3:18/And Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot,
41:3:19/And Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. Then they went into a house.
41:3:20/Again, a crowd gathered so large that they couldn't even eat.
41:3:21/When his family heard about this, they went to take charge of him, for they said, "He is out of his mind."
41:3:22/And the teachers of the law who came down from Jerusalem said, "He is possessed by Beelzebul! By the prince of demons he is driving out demons."
41:3:23/He called them over and spoke to them in parables, "How can Satan drive out Satan?
41:3:24/If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
41:3:25/And if a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
41:3:26/If Satan opposes himself and is divided, he cannot stand; his end has come.
41:3:27/No one can enter a strong man's house and plunder his goods unless he first ties up the strong man. Then he can plunder his house.
41:3:28/Truly I tell you, all sins will be forgiven for the sons of men, and whatever blasphemies they utter;
41:3:29/But whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; they are guilty of an eternal sin."
41:3:30/This was because they were saying, "He has an impure spirit."
41:3:31/Then his mother and brothers arrived. Standing outside, they sent someone in to call him.
41:3:32/A crowd was sitting around him, and they told him, "Look, your mother and brothers are outside looking for you."
41:3:33/He replied, "Who are my mother and my brothers?"
41:3:34/Then he looked at those seated in a circle around him and said, "Here are my mother and my brothers!
41:3:35/For whoever does God's will is my brother and sister and mother."
41:4:1/He started teaching again by the seaside, and a huge crowd gathered around him. So much so, that he got into a boat and sat in the water while the entire crowd stood on the shore.
41:4:2/He taught them many things using stories, and began his lesson by saying,
41:4:3/"Listen up; imagine a farmer went out to plant some seeds.
41:4:4/As he scattered the seeds, some fell on the path, and birds came and ate them up.
41:4:5/Some seeds fell on rocky places where there wasn't much soil. They sprouted quickly because the soil was shallow.
41:4:6/But when the sun came up, they were scorched, and since they didn't have deep roots, they withered away.
41:4:7/Other seeds fell among thorns, which grew up and choked the plants, so they didn't produce any grain.
41:4:8/But some seeds fell on fertile soil, and they grew and produced a crop, multiplying thirty, sixty, or even a hundred times."
41:4:9/Then he added, "Anyone with ears to hear should listen and understand."
41:4:10/When he was alone, those around him, along with the twelve disciples, asked him about the parable.
41:4:11/He told them, "You've been given the opportunity to understand the secrets of the Kingdom of God. But for those outside, everything is said in parables,
41:4:12/so that 'they may be seeing but not perceiving, and hearing but not understanding; otherwise they might turn and be forgiven.'"
41:4:13/Then he said to them, "Don't you understand this parable? How then will you understand any parable?
41:4:14/The farmer plants the word.
41:4:15/Some people are like the seed along the path where the word is sown; as soon as they hear it, Satan comes and takes away the word that was planted in them.
41:4:16/And others are like the seed sown on rocky places; they hear the word and immediately receive it with joy.
41:4:17/But they have no root and last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.
41:4:18/Still others are like the seed sown among thorns; they hear the word,
41:4:19/but the worries of this life, the deceitfulness of wealth, and the desire for other things come in and choke the word, making it unfruitful.
41:4:20/And others are like the seed sown on good soil; they hear the word, accept it, and produce a crop—some thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times what was sown."
41:4:21/He also said to them, "Is a lamp brought in to be put under a basket or under a bed? Isn't it to be placed on a stand?
41:4:22/For nothing is hidden except to be made visible; nothing is secret except to come to light.
41:4:23/If anyone has ears to hear, let them hear."
41:4:24/Then he said to them, "Pay attention to what you hear. The measure you use will be the measure you receive, and even more will be added to you.
41:4:25/For whoever has will be given more; and whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them."
41:4:26/He also said, "This is what the Kingdom of God is like. A man scatters seed on the ground.
41:4:27/Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.
41:4:28/All by itself the soil produces grain—first the stalk, then the head, then the full kernel in the head.
41:4:29/As soon as the grain is ripe, he puts the sickle to it, because the harvest has come."
41:4:30/He continued, "What shall we say the Kingdom of God is like, or what parable shall we use to describe it?
41:4:31/It's like a mustard seed, which is the smallest of all seeds on earth.
41:4:32/Yet when planted, it grows and becomes the largest of all garden plants, with such big branches that the birds can perch in its shade."
41:4:33/With many similar parables, he shared the word with them, as much as they could understand.
41:4:34/He did not speak to them without using a parable. But privately, he explained everything to his disciples.
41:4:35/That day, when evening came, he said to them, "Let's go over to the other side."
41:4:36/After sending the crowd away, they took him along, just as he was, in the boat. There were also other boats with him.
41:4:37/A furious squall came up, and the waves broke over the boat, so that it was nearly swamped.
41:4:38/He was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. They woke him and said to him, "Teacher, don't you care if we drown?"
41:4:39/He got up, rebuked the wind, and said to the waves, "Silence! Be still!" Then the wind died down and it was completely calm.
41:4:40/He said to them, "Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith?"
41:4:41/They were terrified and asked each other, "Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!"
41:5:1/They arrived at the other side of the sea, in the region of the Gadarenes.
41:5:2/As soon as he got out of the boat, a man with an evil spirit came out of the tombs to meet him.
41:5:3/This man lived among the tombs, and no one could restrain him, not even with chains.
41:5:4/He had often been chained hand and foot, but he tore the chains apart and broke the irons on his feet. No one was strong enough to subdue him.
41:5:5/Day and night he wandered among the tombs and in the hills, screaming and cutting himself with stones.
41:5:6/But when he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and bowed down before him.
41:5:7/He shouted at the top of his voice, "What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? In God's name, don't torture me!"
41:5:8/For Jesus had said to him, "Come out of this man, you impure spirit!"
41:5:9/Then Jesus asked him, "What is your name?" "My name is Legion," he replied, "for we are many."
41:5:10/And he begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of the area.
41:5:11/A large herd of pigs was feeding on the nearby hillside.
41:5:12/The demons begged Jesus, "Send us among the pigs; allow us to go into them."
41:5:13/He gave them permission, and the impure spirits came out and went into the pigs. The herd, about two thousand in number, rushed down the steep bank into the sea and were drowned.
41:5:14/Those tending the pigs ran off and reported this in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.
41:5:15/When they came to Jesus, they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons, sitting there, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.
41:5:16/Those who had seen it told the people what had happened to the demon-possessed man—and told about the pigs as well.
41:5:17/Then the people began to plead with Jesus to leave their region.
41:5:18/As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged to go with him.
41:5:19/Jesus did not let him, but said, "Go home to your own people and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you."
41:5:20/So the man went away and began to tell in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him. And all the people were amazed.
41:5:21/When Jesus had again crossed over by boat to the other side of the lake, a large crowd gathered around him while he was by the lake.
41:5:22/Then one of the synagogue leaders, named Jairus, came, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet.
41:5:23/He pleaded earnestly with him, "My little daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so that she will be healed and live."
41:5:24/So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed and pressed around him.
41:5:25/And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years.
41:5:26/She had suffered a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all she had, yet instead of getting better she grew worse.
41:5:27/When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,
41:5:28/because she thought, "If I just touch his clothes, I will be healed."
41:5:29/Immediately her bleeding stopped and she felt in her body that she was freed from her suffering.
41:5:30/At once Jesus realized that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and asked, "Who touched my clothes?"
41:5:31/His disciples said to him, "You see the crowd pressing against you, and yet you ask, 'Who touched me?'"
41:5:32/But he kept looking around to see who had done it.
41:5:33/Then the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell at his feet and, trembling with fear, told him the whole truth.
41:5:34/He said to her, "Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be freed from your suffering."
41:5:35/While Jesus was still speaking, some people came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue leader. "Your daughter is dead," they said. "Why bother the teacher anymore?"
41:5:36/Overhearing what they said, Jesus told him, "Don't be afraid; just believe."
41:5:37/He did not let anyone follow him except Peter, James and John the brother of James.
41:5:38/When they arrived at the house of the synagogue leader, Jesus saw a commotion, with people crying and wailing loudly.
41:5:39/He went in and said to them, "Why all this commotion and wailing? The child is not dead but asleep."
41:5:40/They laughed at him. After he put them all out, he took the child's father and mother and the disciples who were with him, and went in where the child was.
41:5:41/He took her by the hand and said to her, "Talitha koum!" (which means "Little girl, I say to you, get up!").
41:5:42/Immediately the girl stood up and began to walk around (she was twelve years old). At this they were completely astonished.
41:5:43/He gave strict orders not to let anyone know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.
41:6:1/He left there and went to his hometown, accompanied by his disciples.
41:6:2/When the Sabbath came, he began teaching in the synagogue, and many who heard him were amazed. They asked, "Where did this man get these ideas? And how does he perform such remarkable miracles?
41:6:3/Isn't this the carpenter, Mary's son, and the brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren't his sisters living here among us?" They were deeply offended by him.
41:6:4/But Jesus told them, "A prophet is respected everywhere except in his own hometown, among his relatives, and in his own household."
41:6:5/He couldn't perform any significant miracles there, except for healing a few sick people by laying his hands on them.
41:6:6/He was amazed at their lack of faith. Then he went around teaching in the nearby villages.
41:6:7/He called the twelve disciples to him and started sending them out two by two, giving them authority over evil spirits.
41:6:8/He instructed them to take nothing for their journey except a walking stick—no food, no traveler's bag, no money in their belts.
41:6:9/He told them to wear sandals but not to wear two shirts.
41:6:10/He also said, "Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that place.
41:6:11/If any place refuses to welcome you or listen to you, shake the dust off your feet as you leave, as a warning to them. Truly, I tell you, it will be more bearable for Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town."
41:6:12/So they went out and preached that people should change their hearts and lives.
41:6:13/They drove out many demons, anointed many sick people with oil, and healed them.
41:6:14/King Herod heard about Jesus, for his name had become well known. He said, "John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and that's why miraculous powers are at work in him."
41:6:15/Others said, "He is Elijah." And still others claimed, "He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of old."
41:6:16/But when Herod heard about it, he said, "John, whom I beheaded, has been raised from the dead!"
41:6:17/For Herod himself had given orders to have John arrested, and he had him bound and put in prison. He did this because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, whom he had married.
41:6:18/John had been telling Herod, "It's not lawful for you to have your brother's wife."
41:6:19/So Herodias bore a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she was unable to do so,
41:6:20/because Herod feared John, knowing he was a righteous and holy man, and he protected him. When he listened to him, he was greatly perplexed; yet he liked to listen to him.
41:6:21/Finally, the opportune time came. On his birthday, Herod gave a banquet for his high officials, military commanders, and the leading men of Galilee.
41:6:22/When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests. The king said to the girl, "Ask me for anything you want, and I'll give it to you."
41:6:23/He promised her with an oath, "Whatever you ask, I will give you, up to half my kingdom."
41:6:24/She went out and said to her mother, "What should I ask for?" "The head of John the Baptist," she answered.
41:6:25/At once the girl hurried in to the king with the request: "I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter."
41:6:26/The king was deeply distressed, but because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he did not want to refuse her.
41:6:27/Immediately the king sent an executioner with orders to bring John's head. The man went, beheaded John in the prison,
41:6:28/and brought back his head on a platter. He presented it to the girl, and she gave it to her mother.
41:6:29/When John's disciples heard about this, they came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.
41:6:30/The apostles gathered around Jesus and reported to him all they had done and taught.
41:6:31/Then, because so many people were coming and going that they did not even have a chance to eat, he said to them, "Come with me by yourselves to a quiet place and get some rest."
41:6:32/So they went away by themselves in a boat to a solitary place.
41:6:33/But many who saw them leaving recognized them and ran on foot from all the towns and got there ahead of them.
41:6:34/When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began teaching them many things.
41:6:35/By this time it was late in the day, so his disciples came to him. "This is a remote place," they said, "and it's already very late.
41:6:36/Send the people away so they can go to the surrounding countryside and villages and buy themselves something to eat."
41:6:37/But he answered, "You give them something to eat." They said to him, "That would take more than half a year's wages! Are we to go and spend that much on bread and give it to them to eat?"
41:6:38/"How many loaves do you have?" he asked. "Go and see." When they found out, they said, "Five, and two fish."
41:6:39/Then Jesus directed them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.
41:6:40/So they sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.
41:6:41/Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. Then he gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people. He also divided the two fish among them all.
41:6:42/Everyone ate and was satisfied.
41:6:43/Afterward, the disciples picked up twelve baskets full of broken pieces of bread and fish.
41:6:44/The number of men who had eaten was about five thousand.
41:6:45/Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to Bethsaida, while he dismissed the crowd.
41:6:46/After leaving them, he went up on a mountainside to pray.
41:6:47/Later that night, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and he was alone on land.
41:6:48/He saw the disciples straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. Shortly before dawn, he went out to them, walking on the lake. He was about to pass by them,
41:6:49/but when they saw him walking on the lake, they thought he was a ghost. They cried out,
41:6:50/because they all saw him and were terrified. Immediately he spoke to them and said, "Take courage! It's me. Don't be afraid."
41:6:51/Then he climbed into the boat with them, and the wind died down. They were completely amazed,
41:6:52/for they had not understood about the loaves; their hearts were hardened.
41:6:53/When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret and anchored there.
41:6:54/As soon as they got out of the boat, people recognized Jesus.
41:6:55/They ran throughout that whole region and carried the sick on mats to wherever they heard he was.
41:6:56/And wherever he went—into villages, towns, or countryside—they placed the sick in the marketplaces. They begged him to let them touch even the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.
41:7:1/Then the Pharisees and some of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem gathered around him.
41:7:2/And they noticed some of his disciples eating bread with hands that were not washed, which they considered unclean.
41:7:3/For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, do not eat unless they thoroughly wash their hands, adhering to the tradition of the elders.
41:7:4/And when they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. And there are many other traditions they observe, such as the washing of cups, pots, bronze kettles, and dining tables.
41:7:5/Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him, "Why don't your disciples follow the tradition of the elders and eat their bread with unwashed hands?"
41:7:6/He replied, "Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites; as it is written: 'These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.'
41:7:7/However, they worship me in vain, teaching human rules as doctrines."
41:7:8/You disregard God's commandment but cling to human traditions, like the washing of pots and cups; and you do many other similar things."
41:7:9/And he said to them, "You skillfully set aside God's command to keep your own tradition.
41:7:10/For Moses said, 'Honor your father and your mother'; and, 'Anyone who curses their father or mother must be put to death.'
41:7:11/But you say, 'If anyone declares that what might have been used to help their father or mother is Corban (that is, dedicated to God),'
41:7:12/then you no longer let them do anything for their father or mother.
41:7:13/Thus, you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many things like that."
41:7:14/And when he had called all the people to him, he said to them, "Listen to me, everyone, and understand:
41:7:15/Nothing outside a person can defile them by going into them. Rather, it is what comes out of a person that defiles them."
41:7:16/If anyone has ears to hear, let them listen."
41:7:17/And when he had entered the house away from the crowd, his disciples asked him about the parable.
41:7:18/He said to them, "Are you also lacking in understanding? Don't you see that whatever enters a person from outside cannot defile them,
41:7:19/because it doesn't go into their heart but into their stomach, and then out of the body?" (In saying this, Jesus declared all foods clean.)
41:7:20/He went on: "What comes out of a person is what defiles them.
41:7:21/For from within, out of people's hearts, come evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder,
41:7:22/adultery, greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance, and foolishness.
41:7:23/All these evils come from inside and defile a person."
41:7:24/Then he left that place and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon. He entered a house and did not want anyone to know it; yet he could not keep his presence secret.
41:7:25/Immediately a woman whose little daughter was possessed by an impure spirit heard about him, and she came and fell at his feet.
41:7:26/The woman was a Greek, born in Syrian Phoenicia. She begged Jesus to drive the demon out of her daughter.
41:7:27/But Jesus told her, "Let the children be fed first, for it is not right to take the children's bread and toss it to the dogs."
41:7:28/She replied, "Yes, Lord, but even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs."
41:7:29/Then he told her, "For such a reply, you may go; the demon has left your daughter."
41:7:30/When she went home, she found her child lying on the bed, and the demon gone.
41:7:31/Leaving the region of Tyre and Sidon, he went to the Sea of Galilee, in the middle of the region of the Decapolis.
41:7:32/They brought to him a man who was deaf and had a speech impediment, and they begged Jesus to place his hand on him.
41:7:33/Jesus took him aside from the crowd, put his fingers into the man's ears, spit, and touched his tongue.
41:7:34/Then, looking up to heaven, he sighed and said to him, "Ephphatha," which means "Be opened."
41:7:35/Immediately the man's ears were opened, his tongue was loosened, and he began to speak clearly.
41:7:36/Jesus commanded them not to tell anyone. But the more he did so, the more widely they spread the news.
41:7:37/People were overwhelmed with amazement. "He has done everything well," they said. "He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak."
41:8:1/In those days, with a very large crowd and nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said,
41:8:2/I feel compassion for the crowd because they have been with me for three days and have nothing to eat.
41:8:3/And if I send them away hungry to their homes, they will collapse on the way; some of them have come from a long distance.
41:8:4/And his disciples responded, "How can anyone feed these people with bread in this remote place?"
41:8:5/He asked them, "How many loaves do you have?" They replied, "Seven."
41:8:6/He instructed the crowd to sit down on the ground. Then he took the seven loaves, gave thanks, broke them, and gave them to his disciples to distribute; and they handed them out to the crowd.
41:8:7/They also had a few small fish. He blessed them and ordered that these too be distributed.
41:8:8/So they ate and were satisfied, and they collected seven baskets of leftover pieces.
41:8:9/About four thousand people ate, and then he sent them away.
41:8:10/Immediately he got into a boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.
41:8:11/The Pharisees came out and started to argue with him, demanding a sign from heaven to test him.
41:8:12/He sighed deeply and said, "Why does this generation seek a sign? Truly, I tell you, no sign will be given to this generation."
41:8:13/Then he left them, got back into the boat, and crossed to the other side.
41:8:14/Now the disciples had forgotten to bring bread, and they had only one loaf with them in the boat.
41:8:15/He cautioned them, "Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod."
41:8:16/And they discussed among themselves that it was because they had no bread.
41:8:17/When Jesus knew this, he said to them, "Why are you discussing the fact you have no bread? Do you not yet perceive or understand? Are your hearts hardened?
41:8:18/Though you have eyes, do you not see? And though you have ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?
41:8:19/When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of leftovers did you pick up?" They said to him, "Twelve."
41:8:20/"And when I broke the seven for the four thousand, how many baskets full of leftovers did you pick up?" They answered, "Seven."
41:8:21/He said to them, "Do you still not understand?"
41:8:22/They came to Bethsaida, and some people brought a blind man to him, begging him to touch him.
41:8:23/He took the blind man by the hand, led him out of the village, spit on his eyes, placed his hands on him, and asked, "Do you see anything?"
41:8:24/He looked up and said, "I see people, but they look like trees walking."
41:8:25/Then Jesus placed his hands on the man's eyes again. The man looked intently, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.
41:8:26/He sent him home, saying, "Don't go into the village or tell anyone in the village."
41:8:27/Jesus and his disciples went to the villages around Caesarea Philippi. On the way, he asked his disciples, "Who do people say I am?"
41:8:28/They replied, "Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, one of the prophets."
41:8:29/He asked them, "But who do you say I am?" Peter answered, "You are the Messiah."
41:8:30/He strictly warned them not to tell anyone about him.
41:8:31/He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and teachers of the law, be killed, and after three days rise again.
41:8:32/He spoke plainly about this. Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.
41:8:33/But Jesus turned, looked at his disciples, and rebuked Peter, saying, "Get behind me, Satan! You do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns."
41:8:34/Then he called the crowd to him along with his disciples and said, "If anyone wants to follow me, they must deny themselves, take up their cross, and follow me.
41:8:35/For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for my sake and the gospel will save it.
41:8:36/What good is it for someone to gain the whole world, yet forfeit their soul?
41:8:37/Or what can anyone give in exchange for their soul?
41:8:38/If anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his Father's glory with the holy angels.
41:9:1/He told them, "I assure you, some of you standing here won't experience death before they see God's kingdom arrive with power."
41:9:2/Six days later, Jesus took Peter, James, and John and led them up a high mountain, where they were alone. There, he was transformed in front of them.
41:9:3/His clothes became dazzlingly white, whiter than any bleach on earth could make them.
41:9:4/Elijah and Moses appeared to them, talking with Jesus.
41:9:5/Peter said to Jesus, "Rabbi, it's wonderful for us to be here. Let's make three shelters—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
41:9:6/He didn't know what to say because they were all terrified.
41:9:7/A cloud overshadowed them, and a voice came from the cloud, "This is my beloved Son. Listen to him."
41:9:8/Suddenly, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus.
41:9:9/As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus instructed them not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
41:9:10/They kept the matter to themselves, discussing what "rising from the dead" meant.
41:9:11/They questioned him, "Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?"
41:9:12/He replied, "Elijah does indeed come first to restore all things. And how is it written about the Son of Man? That he must suffer greatly and be treated with contempt.
41:9:13/But I tell you, Elijah has already come, and they did to him whatever they pleased, just as it is written about him."
41:9:14/When they returned to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them, with teachers of the law arguing with them.
41:9:15/Immediately, when the crowd saw Jesus, they were overwhelmed with awe and ran to greet him.
41:9:16/He asked the teachers of the law, "What are you arguing with them about?"
41:9:17/Someone from the crowd answered, "Teacher, I brought you my son, who is possessed by a spirit that has robbed him of speech.
41:9:18/Whenever it seizes him, it throws him to the ground. He foams at the mouth, gnashes his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive out the spirit, but they couldn't."
41:9:19/He replied, "You unbelieving generation, how long must I stay with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring the boy to me."
41:9:20/So they brought the boy to him. As soon as the spirit saw Jesus, it immediately threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell to the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
41:9:21/Jesus asked the boy's father, "How long has he been like this?" "From childhood," he answered.
41:9:22/"It has often thrown him into fire or water to kill him. But if you can do anything, take pity on us and help us."
41:9:23/"'If you can'?" said Jesus. "Everything is possible for one who believes."
41:9:24/Immediately the boy's father exclaimed, "I do believe; help me overcome my unbelief!"
41:9:25/When Jesus saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he rebuked the impure spirit, "You deaf and mute spirit, I command you, come out of him and never enter him again."
41:9:26/The spirit shrieked, convulsed him violently, and came out. The boy looked so much like a corpse that many said, "He's dead."
41:9:27/But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him to his feet, and he stood up.
41:9:28/After Jesus had gone indoors, his disciples asked him privately, "Why couldn't we drive it out?"
41:9:29/He replied, "This kind can come out only by prayer."
41:9:30/They left that place and passed through Galilee. Jesus did not want anyone to know where they were,
41:9:31/because he was teaching his disciples. He told them, "The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men. They will kill him, and after three days he will rise."
41:9:32/But they did not understand what he meant and were afraid to ask him about it.
41:9:33/When they arrived in Capernaum and were in the house, he asked them, "What were you arguing about on the road?"
41:9:34/But they kept quiet because on the way they had argued about who was the greatest.
41:9:35/He sat down, called the twelve, and said to them, "If anyone wants to be first, he must be the very last, and the servant of all."
41:9:36/He took a little child and placed him among them. Taking the child in his arms, he said to them,
41:9:37/"Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me does not just welcome me but the one who sent me."
41:9:38/John said to him, "Teacher, we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we told him to stop, because he was not one of us."
41:9:39/But Jesus said, "Do not stop him, for no one who does a miracle in my name can in the next moment say anything bad about me.
41:9:40/For whoever is not against us is for us.
41:9:41/Truly I tell you, anyone who gives you a cup of water in my name because you belong to the Messiah will certainly not lose their reward."
41:9:42/"If anyone causes one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for them if a large millstone were hung around their neck and they were thrown into the sea.
41:9:43/If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It's better for you to enter life maimed than with two hands to go into hell, where the fire never goes out.
41:9:44/Where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.
41:9:45/If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It's better for you to enter life crippled than to have two feet and be thrown into hell, where the fire never goes out.
41:9:46/Where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.
41:9:47/If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out. It's better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,
41:9:48/Where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.
41:9:49/Everyone will be purified with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.
41:9:50/Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again? Have salt among yourselves, and be at peace with each other.
41:10:1/He got up from there and went to the region of Judea across the Jordan. Again, crowds gathered around him, and as usual, he taught them.
41:10:2/The Pharisees approached him to test him by asking, "Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?"
41:10:3/He replied, "What did Moses command you?"
41:10:4/They said, "Moses allowed a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away."
41:10:5/Jesus said to them, "Because of your hard hearts, he wrote you this commandment.
41:10:6/"But from the beginning of creation, God made them male and female.
41:10:7/"For this reason, a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife,
41:10:8/"And the two will become one flesh. So they are no longer two, but one flesh.
41:10:9/"Therefore, what God has joined together, let no one separate."
41:10:10/Back in the house, his disciples questioned him again about this matter.
41:10:11/He told them, "Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.
41:10:12/And if she divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery."
41:10:13/People were bringing little children to him for him to touch, but the disciples scolded them.
41:10:14/Seeing this, Jesus was indignant and said, "Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
41:10:15/Truly, I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it."
41:10:16/He embraced them, laid his hands on them, and blessed them.
41:10:17/As he was setting out on his journey, a man ran up, knelt before him, and asked, "Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?"
41:10:18/Jesus said to him, "Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
41:10:19/You know the commandments: 'Do not commit adultery, Do not murder, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honor your father and mother.'"
41:10:20/He responded, "Teacher, I have kept all these since my youth."
41:10:21/Looking at him with love, Jesus said, "One thing you lack: go, sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me."
41:10:22/But he was disheartened by this and went away sorrowful, for he had many possessions.
41:10:23/Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, "How difficult it will be for those who have wealth to enter the kingdom of God!"
41:10:24/His disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus said again, "Children, how hard it is for those who trust in wealth to enter the kingdom of God!
41:10:25/It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God."
41:10:26/They were exceedingly astonished and asked each other, "Then who can be saved?"
41:10:27/Jesus looked at them and said, "With humans it is impossible, but not with God; for all things are possible with God."
41:10:28/Peter began to say to him, "Look, we have left everything and followed you."
41:10:29/Jesus replied, "Truly, I tell you, no one who has left home, or brothers, or sisters, or mother, or father, or children, or fields for my sake and for the gospel
41:10:30/will fail to receive a hundred times as much in this present age: homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and fields—along with persecutions—and in the age to come, eternal life.
41:10:31/But many who are first will be last, and the last first."
41:10:32/They were on their way up to Jerusalem, with Jesus leading the way, and they were astonished, while those who followed were afraid. He took the Twelve aside and began to tell them what was going to happen to him,
