42:8:52/Meanwhile, all the people were wailing and mourning for her. "Stop wailing," Jesus said. "She is not dead but asleep."
42:8:53/They laughed at him, knowing that she was dead.
42:8:54/But he took her by the hand and said, "My child, get up!"
42:8:55/Her spirit returned, and at once she stood up. Then Jesus told them to give her something to eat.
42:8:56/Her parents were amazed, but he ordered them not to tell anyone what had happened.
42:9:1/Then he gathered his twelve disciples, giving them power and authority over all demons, and to heal illnesses.
42:9:2/He sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
42:9:3/He instructed them, "Take nothing for your journey—no staff, no bag, no bread, no money; and don't have an extra shirt.
42:9:4/Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave the area.
42:9:5/If anyone doesn't welcome you, as you leave that town, shake off the dust from your feet as a warning to them."
42:9:6/So they set out and traveled from village to village, spreading the good news and healing everywhere.
42:9:7/Now Herod the ruler heard about all that was happening, and he was puzzled because some were saying that John had been raised from the dead,
42:9:8/While others claimed that Elijah had appeared, and still others that one of the ancient prophets had come back to life.
42:9:9/Herod said, "I beheaded John. So who is this I hear such things about?" And he tried to see him.
42:9:10/When the apostles returned, they reported to Jesus what they had done. Then he took them with him and they withdrew by themselves to a town called Bethsaida.
42:9:11/But the crowds learned about it and followed him. He welcomed them, spoke to them about the kingdom of God, and healed those who needed healing.
42:9:12/As the day was ending, the Twelve came to him and said, "Send the crowd away so they can go to the surrounding villages and countryside to find lodging and food, because we are in a remote place here."
42:9:13/But he said to them, "You give them something to eat." They replied, "We have only five loaves of bread and two fish—unless we go and buy food for all these people."
42:9:14/(There were about five thousand men.) He said to his disciples, "Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each."
42:9:15/They did so, and had everyone sit down.
42:9:16/Then he took the five loaves and the two fish, looked up to heaven, blessed them, broke them, and gave them to the disciples to distribute to the crowd.
42:9:17/Everyone ate and was satisfied, and they picked up twelve baskets of leftover pieces.
42:9:18/Once when Jesus was praying in private and his disciples were with him, he asked them, "Who do the crowds say I am?"
42:9:19/They replied, "Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, that one of the prophets of long ago has come back to life."
42:9:20/He asked them, "But who do you say I am?" Peter answered, "God's Messiah."
42:9:21/He strictly warned them not to tell this to anyone.
42:9:22/He said, "The Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the teachers of the law, and he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life."
42:9:23/Then he said to them all, "If anyone wants to follow me, they must deny themselves, take up their cross daily, and follow me.
42:9:24/For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for me will save it.
42:9:25/What good is it for someone to gain the whole world, and yet lose or forfeit their very self?
42:9:26/If anyone is ashamed of me and my words, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his glory and in the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.
42:9:27/Truly I tell you, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God."
42:9:28/About eight days after Jesus said this, he took Peter, John, and James with him and went up onto a mountain to pray.
42:9:29/As he was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes became as bright as a flash of lightning.
42:9:30/Suddenly, two men, Moses and Elijah, appeared in glorious splendor, talking with Jesus.
42:9:31/They spoke about his departure, which he was about to bring to fulfillment at Jerusalem.
42:9:32/Peter and his companions were very sleepy, but when they became fully awake, they saw his glory and the two men standing with him.
42:9:33/As the men were leaving Jesus, Peter said to him, "Master, it's good for us to be here. Let's make three shelters—one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah." (He did not know what he was saying.)
42:9:34/While he was speaking, a cloud appeared and covered them, and they were afraid as they entered the cloud.
42:9:35/A voice came from the cloud, saying, "This is my Son, whom I have chosen; listen to him."
42:9:36/When the voice had spoken, they found that Jesus was alone. The disciples kept this to themselves and did not tell anyone at that time what they had seen.
42:9:37/The next day, when they came down from the mountain, a large crowd met him.
42:9:38/A man in the crowd called out, "Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.
42:9:39/A spirit seizes him and he suddenly screams; it throws him into convulsions so that he foams at the mouth. It scarcely ever leaves him and is destroying him.
42:9:40/I begged your disciples to drive it out, but they couldn't."
42:9:41/Jesus replied, "You unbelieving and twisted generation, how long shall I stay with you and put up with you? Bring your son here."
42:9:42/Even as the boy was coming, the demon threw him to the ground in a convulsion. But Jesus rebuked the impure spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
42:9:43/And they were all astonished at the greatness of God. While everyone was marveling at all that Jesus did, he said to his disciples,
42:9:44/"Listen carefully to what I am about to tell you: The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men."
42:9:45/But they did not understand what this meant. It was hidden from them, so that they did not grasp it, and they were afraid to ask him about it.
42:9:46/An argument started among the disciples as to which of them would be the greatest.
42:9:47/Jesus, knowing their thoughts, took a little child and had him stand beside him.
42:9:48/He told them, "Whoever welcomes this child in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me. For it is the one who is least among you all who is the greatest."
42:9:49/John spoke up, "Master, we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we tried to stop him, because he is not one of us."
42:9:50/Jesus said to him, "Do not stop him, for whoever is not against you is for you."
42:9:51/As the time approached for him to be taken up to heaven, Jesus resolutely set out for Jerusalem.
42:9:52/He sent messengers on ahead, who went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him;
42:9:53/But the people there did not welcome him, because he was heading for Jerusalem.
42:9:54/When his disciples James and John saw this, they asked, "Lord, do you want us to call fire down from heaven to destroy them?"
42:9:55/But Jesus turned and rebuked them.
42:9:56/For the Son of Man did not come to destroy people's lives but to save them. And they went to another village.
42:9:57/As they were walking along the road, a man said to him, "I will follow you wherever you go."
42:9:58/Jesus replied, "Foxes have dens and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head."
42:9:59/To another person, Jesus said, "Follow me." But he replied, "Lord, first let me go and bury my father."
42:9:60/Jesus said to him, "Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and proclaim the kingdom of God."
42:9:61/Another said, "I will follow you, Lord; but first let me say goodbye to my family."
42:9:62/Jesus replied, "No one who puts a hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God."
42:10:1/After these events, the Lord appointed seventy others and sent them out in pairs ahead of Him to every city and place where He planned to go.
42:10:2/So He told them, "The harvest is indeed plentiful, but the workers are few. Therefore, ask the Lord of the harvest to send out workers into His harvest field.
42:10:3/Go on your way; look, I am sending you out like lambs among wolves.
42:10:4/Don't carry a wallet, a bag, or sandals; and don't stop to greet anyone on the road.
42:10:5/Whenever you enter a house, first say, 'Peace to this house.'
42:10:6/If a peaceful person lives there, your peace will rest on them; if not, it will return to you.
42:10:7/Stay in that same house, eating and drinking whatever they offer, for the worker deserves their wages. Do not move around from house to house.
42:10:8/When you enter a city and they welcome you, eat what is offered to you.
42:10:9/Heal the sick who are there and tell them, 'The kingdom of God has come near to you.'
42:10:10/But when you enter a city and they do not welcome you, go into its streets and say,
42:10:11/'Even the dust of your city that clings to our feet, we wipe off as a warning to you. Yet be sure of this: the kingdom of God has come near.'
42:10:12/But I tell you, it will be more bearable on that day for Sodom than for that city.
42:10:13/Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! If the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
42:10:14/But it will be more bearable for Tyre and Sidon at the judgment than for you.
42:10:15/And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted to the heavens? No, you will go down to Hades.
42:10:16/Whoever listens to you listens to me; whoever rejects you rejects me; but whoever rejects me rejects the one who sent me."
42:10:17/The seventy returned with joy, saying, "Lord, even the demons submit to us in your name."
42:10:18/He said to them, "I saw Satan fall like lightning from heaven.
42:10:19/Behold, I have given you authority to tread on snakes and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing will harm you.
42:10:20/However, do not rejoice that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven."
42:10:21/In that moment, Jesus was filled with joy through the Holy Spirit and said, "I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and learned, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for this is what you were pleased to do.
42:10:22/Everything has been entrusted to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal Him."
42:10:23/Then He turned to His disciples and said privately, "Blessed are the eyes that see what you see.
42:10:24/For I tell you, many prophets and kings wanted to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it."
42:10:25/Then a legal expert stood up to test Him, saying, "Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?"
42:10:26/He said to him, "What is written in the Law? How do you read it?"
42:10:27/And he answered, "Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind; and love your neighbor as yourself."
42:10:28/He said to him, "You have answered correctly; do this and you will live."
42:10:29/But he wanted to justify himself, so he asked Jesus, "And who is my neighbor?"
42:10:30/Jesus replied, "A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho when he was attacked by robbers. They stripped him of his clothes, beat him, and went away, leaving him half dead.
42:10:31/A priest happened to be going down the same road, and when he saw the man, he passed by on the other side.
42:10:32/So too, a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.
42:10:33/But a Samaritan, as he traveled, came where the man was; and when he saw him, he took pity on him,
42:10:34/and went to him and bandaged his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. Then he put the man on his own donkey, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
42:10:35/The next day he took out two denarii and gave them to the innkeeper. 'Look after him,' he said, 'and when I return, I will reimburse you for any extra expense you may have.'
42:10:36/"Which of these three do you think was a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of robbers?"
42:10:37/The expert in the law replied, "The one who had mercy on him." Jesus told him, "Go and do likewise."
42:10:38/As they continued on their journey, He entered a certain village where a woman named Martha welcomed Him into her home.
42:10:39/She had a sister named Mary, who sat at the Lord's feet listening to what He said.
42:10:40/But Martha was distracted by all the preparations that had to be made. She came to Him and asked, "Lord, don’t you care that my sister has left me to do the work by myself? Tell her to help me."
42:10:41/Jesus answered, "Martha, Martha, you are worried and upset about many things,
42:10:42/but only one thing is necessary. Mary has chosen the better part, which will not be taken away from her."
42:11:1/It happened that, as he was praying in a certain place, when he finished, one of his disciples asked him, "Lord, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples."
42:11:2/He told them, "When you pray, say, 'Father, hallowed be your name. Your kingdom come. Your will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.
42:11:3/Give us each day our daily bread.
42:11:4/And forgive us our sins, as we also forgive everyone who owes us. And do not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil."
42:11:5/He then said to them, "Imagine one of you has a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say, 'Friend, lend me three loaves of bread;
42:11:6/because a friend of mine has arrived from a journey, and I have nothing to offer him.'
42:11:7/And he answers from inside, 'Don't bother me. The door is already locked, and my children and I are in bed. I can't get up to give you anything.'
42:11:8/I tell you, even though he won't get up and give him anything because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as much as he needs.
42:11:9/And I tell you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened to you.
42:11:10/For everyone who asks receives; the one who seeks finds; and to the one who knocks, the door will be opened.
42:11:11/If a son asks for bread from any of you who is a father, would you give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, would you give him a snake instead?
42:11:12/Or if he asks for an egg, would you offer him a scorpion?
42:11:13/So if you, despite being imperfect, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?"
42:11:14/He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. When the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke, and the people were amazed.
42:11:15/But some of them said, "He drives out demons by Beelzebub, the ruler of the demons."
42:11:16/And others, testing him, demanded a sign from heaven.
42:11:17/But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, "Every kingdom divided against itself is ruined, and a divided household falls.
42:11:18/If Satan is divided against himself, how can his kingdom stand? You say I drive out demons by Beelzebub.
42:11:19/And if I drive out demons by Beelzebub, by whom do your followers drive them out? So they will be your judges.
42:11:20/But if I drive out demons by the finger of God, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
42:11:21/When a strong man, fully armed, guards his own house, his possessions are safe.
42:11:22/But when someone stronger attacks and overpowers him, he takes away the armor the man relied on and divides up his plunder.
42:11:23/Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
42:11:24/When an impure spirit comes out of a person, it goes through arid places seeking rest and, finding none, it says, 'I will return to the house I left.'
42:11:25/When it arrives, it finds the house swept clean and put in order.
42:11:26/Then it goes and takes seven other spirits more wicked than itself, and they go in and live there. And the final condition of that person is worse than the first."
42:11:27/As he was saying these things, a woman in the crowd raised her voice and said to him, "Blessed is the womb that bore you and the breasts at which you nursed."
42:11:28/But he said, "Indeed, blessed are those who hear the word of God and obey it."
42:11:29/When the crowds were gathering in large numbers, he began to say, "This is a wicked generation. It asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah the prophet.
42:11:30/For just as Jonah was a sign to the Ninevites, so will the Son of Man be to this generation.
42:11:31/The queen of the South will rise at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, for she came from the ends of the earth to listen to Solomon's wisdom; and now, something greater than Solomon is here.
42:11:32/The people of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and now, something greater than Jonah is here.
42:11:33/No one lights a lamp and puts it in a hidden place or under a basket, but on a lampstand, so that those who enter can see the light.
42:11:34/The eye is the lamp of the body. When your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light. But when it is bad, your body is full of darkness.
42:11:35/Therefore, be careful lest the light in you be darkness.
42:11:36/If your whole body is full of light, with no part of it in darkness, it will be completely illuminated, as when a lamp shines its light on you."
42:11:37/While he was speaking, a Pharisee invited him to dine with him, so he went in and reclined at the table.
42:11:38/But the Pharisee was surprised to see that he did not first wash before the meal.
42:11:39/And the Lord said to him, "Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.
42:11:40/You fools! Didn't the one who made the outside make the inside as well?
42:11:41/But give what is inside as charity, and then everything will be clean for you.
42:11:42/But woe to you, Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and all kinds of herbs, and neglect justice and the love of God. You should have practiced the latter without leaving the former undone.
42:11:43/Woe to you, Pharisees! For you love the most important seats in the synagogues and respectful greetings in the marketplaces.
42:11:44/Woe to you, because you are like unmarked graves, which people walk over without knowing."
42:11:45/Then one of the experts in the law said to him, "Teacher, when you say these things, you insult us too."
42:11:46/And he said, "Woe to you experts in the law, too! For you burden people with burdens hard to bear, yet you yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers.
42:11:47/Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and it was your ancestors who killed them.
42:11:48/So you are witnesses and approve of the deeds of your ancestors; they killed the prophets, and you build their tombs.
42:11:49/For this reason also, the wisdom of God said, 'I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and persecute,'
42:11:50/so that this generation may be charged with the blood of all the prophets shed since the foundation of the world,
42:11:51/from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be charged against this generation.
42:11:52/Woe to you experts in the law! For you have taken away the key to knowledge. You yourselves have not entered, and you have hindered those who were entering."
42:11:53/As he said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to oppose him fiercely and to provoke him to speak about many things,
42:11:54/lying in wait for him, to catch something from his mouth that they might accuse him.
42:12:1/At that time, when a countless crowd had gathered, so much so that they were stepping on each other, he began to tell his disciples first and foremost, "Be cautious of the Pharisees' influence, which is all about pretending to be something you're not."
42:12:2/For there is nothing hidden that won't be uncovered; nor anything secret that won't become known.
42:12:3/So, whatever you've said in the dark will be heard in the light; and what you've whispered in private rooms will be shouted from the rooftops.
42:12:4/And I tell you, my friends, don't be afraid of those who can kill the body but after that can do no more.
42:12:5/But I will show you whom you should fear: Fear the one who, after killing, has the power to throw you into hell; yes, I tell you, fear him.
42:12:6/Aren't five sparrows sold for just a couple of pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten by God.
42:12:7/But even the hairs on your head are all counted. So don't be afraid; you are worth more than many sparrows.
42:12:8/Also, I tell you, whoever acknowledges me before others, the Son of Man will also acknowledge before the angels of God.
42:12:9/But whoever denies me before others will be denied before the angels of God.
42:12:10/And anyone who speaks against the Son of Man can be forgiven, but anyone who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
42:12:11/And when they bring you before synagogues, rulers, and authorities, don't worry about how you will defend yourselves or what you will say.
42:12:12/For the Holy Spirit will teach you at that moment what you should say.
42:12:13/Then someone in the crowd said to him, "Teacher, tell my brother to share the inheritance with me."
42:12:14/But he replied, "Friend, who appointed me as a judge or arbitrator over you?"
42:12:15/Then he said to them, "Watch out and be on guard against all kinds of greed; life does not consist in an abundance of possessions."
42:12:16/He told them a story: "The land of a certain wealthy man produced a great crop.
42:12:17/He thought to himself, 'What should I do, since I don't have space to store my crops?'
42:12:18/Then he said, 'This is what I'll do: I'll tear down my barns and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and goods.
42:12:19/And I'll say to myself, "You have plenty of goods stored up for many years; take it easy, eat, drink, and enjoy yourself."'
42:12:20/But God said to him, 'You fool, tonight your life will be demanded from you. Then who will get what you have prepared for yourself?'
42:12:21/This is how it will be for anyone who stores up things for themselves but is not rich toward God."
42:12:22/Then he said to his disciples, "Therefore, I tell you, don't worry about your life, what you will eat; or about your body, what you will wear.
42:12:23/Life is more than food, and the body more than clothes.
42:12:24/Consider the ravens: They don't plant or harvest; they have no storeroom or barn; yet God feeds them. And how much more valuable you are than birds!
42:12:25/Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to your life?
42:12:26/If you can't do such a small thing, why worry about the rest?
42:12:27/Consider how the wild flowers grow: They don't labor or spin yarn. Yet, I tell you, not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these.
42:12:28/If that's how God clothes the grass in the field, which is here today and thrown into the furnace tomorrow, how much more will he clothe you—you of little faith?
42:12:29/So don't set your heart on what you will eat or drink; don't worry about it.
42:12:30/For the pagan world runs after all such things, and your Father knows that you need them.
42:12:31/But seek his kingdom, and these things will be given to you as well.
42:12:32/Don't be afraid, little flock, for your Father has been pleased to give you the kingdom.
42:12:33/Sell your possessions and give to the poor. Provide purses for yourselves that will not wear out, a treasure in heaven that will never fail, where no thief comes near and no moth destroys.
42:12:34/For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
42:12:35/Be dressed ready for service and keep your lamps burning,
42:12:36/like servants waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet, so that when he comes and knocks they can immediately open the door for him.
42:12:37/Blessed are those servants whom the master finds awake when he comes. Truly I tell you, he will dress himself to serve, will have them recline at the table, and will come and wait on them.
42:12:38/And if he comes in the second or third watch of the night and finds them prepared in this way, blessed are those servants.
42:12:39/But understand this: If the owner of the house had known at what hour the thief was coming, he would not have let his house be broken into.
42:12:40/You also must be ready, because the Son of Man will come at an hour when you do not expect him."
42:12:41/Then Peter asked, "Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everyone?"
42:12:42/And the Lord answered, "Who, then, is the faithful and wise manager, whom the master puts in charge of his servants to give them their food allowance at the proper time?
42:12:43/Blessed is that servant whom the master finds doing so when he returns.
42:12:44/Truly I tell you, he will put him in charge of all his possessions.
42:12:45/But suppose the servant says to himself, 'My master is taking a long time in coming,' and he starts to beat the other servants, both men and women, and to eat and drink and get drunk.
42:12:46/The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour he is not aware of. He will cut him to pieces and assign him a place with the unbelievers.
42:12:47/That servant who knows his master's will and does not get ready or does not do what his master wants will be beaten with many blows.
42:12:48/But the one who does not know and does things deserving punishment will be beaten with few blows. From everyone who has been given much, much will be demanded; and from the one who has been entrusted with much, much more will be asked.
42:12:49/I have come to bring fire on the earth, and how I wish it were already kindled!
42:12:50/But I have a baptism to undergo, and what constraint I am under until it is completed!
42:12:51/Do you think I came to bring peace on earth? No, I tell you, but rather division.
42:12:52/From now on there will be five in one family divided against each other, three against two and two against three.
42:12:53/Father will be divided against son and son against father, mother against daughter and daughter against mother, mother-in-law against daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against mother-in-law."
42:12:54/He also said to the crowds, "When you see a cloud rising in the west, immediately you say, 'It's going to rain,' and it does.
42:12:55/And when the south wind blows, you say, 'It's going to be hot,' and it is.
42:12:56/You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky. How is it that you don't know how to interpret this present time?
42:12:57/And why don't you judge for yourselves what is right?
42:12:58/When you are going with your adversary to the magistrate, try hard to be reconciled on the way, or your adversary may drag you off to the judge, and the judge turn you over to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.
42:12:59/I tell you, you will not get out until you have paid the last penny.
42:13:1/At that time, some people told him about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
42:13:2/Jesus responded, "Do you think these Galileans were worse sinners than all other Galileans because they suffered this fate?
42:13:3/I tell you, no; but unless you change your ways, you will all perish just as they did.
42:13:4/Or what about those eighteen people who died when the tower in Siloam fell on them? Do you think they were more guilty than everyone else living in Jerusalem?
42:13:5/I tell you, no; but unless you change your ways, you will all perish just as they did.
42:13:6/He also told this parable: "A man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he went to look for fruit on it but found none.
42:13:7/He said to the gardener, 'Look, for three years now I've been coming to look for fruit on this fig tree and haven’t found any. Cut it down! Why should it use up the soil?'
42:13:8/"But the gardener answered, 'Sir, leave it alone for one more year, and I'll dig around it and fertilize it.
42:13:9/If it bears fruit next year, fine! If not, then cut it down.'"
42:13:10/And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath.
42:13:11/There was a woman there who had been crippled by a spirit for eighteen years. She was bent over and could not straighten up at all.
42:13:12/When Jesus saw her, he called her over and said, "Woman, you are set free from your infirmity."
42:13:13/He put his hands on her, and immediately she straightened up and praised God.
42:13:14/But the synagogue leader, indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the people, "There are six days for work. So come and be healed on those days, not on the Sabbath."
42:13:15/The Lord answered him, "You hypocrites! Doesn't each of you on the Sabbath untie your ox or donkey from the stall and lead it out to give it water?
42:13:16/Then shouldn't this woman, a daughter of Abraham whom Satan has kept bound for eighteen long years, be set free on the Sabbath day from what bound her?"
42:13:17/When he said this, all his opponents were humiliated, but the people were delighted with all the wonderful things he was doing.
42:13:18/Then he asked, "What is the kingdom of God like? What shall I compare it to?
42:13:19/It's like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his garden. It grew and became a tree, and the birds perched in its branches."
42:13:20/Again he asked, "What shall I compare the kingdom of God to?
42:13:21/It's like yeast that a woman took and mixed into about sixty pounds of flour until it worked all through the dough."
42:13:22/He continued his journey through towns and villages, teaching and making his way to Jerusalem.
42:13:23/Someone asked him, "Lord, are only a few people going to be saved?" He said to them,
42:13:24/"Make every effort to enter through the narrow door, because many, I tell you, will try to enter and will not be able to.
42:13:25/Once the owner of the house gets up and closes the door, you will stand outside knocking and pleading, 'Lord, open the door for us.' But he will answer, 'I don't know you or where you come from.'
42:13:26/Then you will say, 'We ate and drank with you, and you taught in our streets.'
42:13:27/But he will reply, 'I don't know you or where you come from. Away from me, all you evildoers!'
42:13:28/There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth when you see Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but you yourselves thrown out.
42:13:29/People will come from east and west and north and south, and will take their places at the feast in the kingdom of God.
42:13:30/Indeed there are those who are last who will be first, and first who will be last."
42:13:31/That same day some Pharisees came to Jesus and said, "Leave this place and go somewhere else. Herod wants to kill you."
42:13:32/He replied, "Go tell that fox, 'I will keep driving out demons and healing people today and tomorrow, and on the third day I will reach my goal.'
42:13:33/Yet I must press on today and tomorrow and the next day—for surely no prophet can die outside Jerusalem!
42:13:34/"Jerusalem, Jerusalem, you who kill the prophets and stone those sent to you, how often I have longed to gather your children together, as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you were not willing.
42:13:35/Look, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me again until you say, 'Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord.'"
42:14:1/As he entered the home of one of the leading Pharisees to share a meal on the Sabbath, they closely observed him.
42:14:2/And there, right in front of him, was a man suffering from severe swelling.
42:14:3/Jesus responded to the lawyers and Pharisees by asking, "Is it okay to heal on the Sabbath?"
42:14:4/They remained silent. So, he healed the man and sent him on his way.
42:14:5/Then he said to them, "If one of you has a donkey or an ox that falls into a pit, wouldn't you immediately pull it out on the Sabbath?"
42:14:6/But they had no reply to these points.
42:14:7/He then told a parable to those who were invited, noticing how they picked the places of honor, saying to them,
42:14:8/"When you're invited by someone to a wedding, don't sit in the place of honor, in case someone more distinguished than you has been invited by them;
42:14:9/and the host comes to you and says, 'Give this person your seat,' and then in embarrassment, you have to take the least important place.
42:14:10/Instead, when you're invited, go and sit in the least important place, so that when your host comes, he will say to you, 'Friend, move up to a better place.' Then you will be honored in front of all the other guests.
42:14:11/For everyone who exalts themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted."
42:14:12/Then he also said to the one who had invited him, "When you host a lunch or dinner, don't just invite your friends, family, or rich neighbors, in case they invite you back and you are repaid.
42:14:13/But when you give a banquet, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind,
42:14:14/and you will be blessed. Because they can't repay you, you will be repaid at the resurrection of the righteous."
42:14:15/When one of those at the table with him heard this, he said to Jesus, "Blessed is the one who will eat at the feast in the kingdom of God."
42:14:16/Then Jesus replied, "A certain man was preparing a great banquet and invited many guests.
42:14:17/At the time of the banquet he sent his servant to tell those who had been invited, 'Come, everything is now ready.'
42:14:18/But they all alike began to make excuses. The first said, 'I've just bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please excuse me.'
42:14:19/Another said, 'I've bought five pairs of oxen, and I'm on my way to try them out. Please excuse me.'
42:14:20/Another said, 'I've just got married, so I can't come.'
42:14:21/The servant came back and reported this to his master. Then the owner of the house became angry and ordered his servant, 'Go out quickly into the streets and alleys of the town and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.'
42:14:22/The servant said, 'Sir, what you ordered has been done, but there is still room.'
42:14:23/Then the master told his servant, 'Go out to the roads and country lanes and compel them to come in, so that my house will be full.
42:14:24/I tell you, not one of those who were invited will get a taste of my banquet.'"
42:14:25/Large crowds were traveling with Jesus, and turning to them he said,
42:14:26/"If anyone comes to me and does not put aside their father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters—yes, even their own life—they cannot be my disciple.
42:14:27/And whoever does not carry their cross and follow me cannot be my disciple.
42:14:28/"Suppose one of you wants to build a tower. Wouldn't you first sit down and estimate the cost to see if you have enough money to complete it?
42:14:29/Otherwise, if you lay the foundation and are not able to finish it, everyone who sees it will ridicule you,
42:14:30/saying, 'This person began to build and wasn't able to finish.'
42:14:31/"Or what king, going to war against another king, won't sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand men to oppose the one coming against him with twenty thousand?
42:14:32/If he is not able, he will send a delegation while the other is still a long way off and will ask for terms of peace.
42:14:33/In the same way, those of you who do not give up everything you have cannot be my disciples.
42:14:34/Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again?
42:14:35/It is not suitable for the soil or for the manure pile; it is thrown out. Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear."
42:15:1/Then all the tax collectors and sinners came close to listen to him.
42:15:2/And the Pharisees and scribes complained, saying, "This man welcomes sinners and even eats with them."
42:15:3/He told them this story:
42:15:4/"Which one of you, if you have a hundred sheep and lose one, doesn't leave the ninety-nine in the open country and go after the lost one until you find it?
42:15:5/And when you find it, you joyfully put it on your shoulders.
42:15:6/And when you get home, you call your friends and neighbors together and say, 'Celebrate with me; I've found my lost sheep.'
42:15:7/I tell you, in the same way, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who changes their ways than over ninety-nine righteous people who don't need to.
42:15:8/Or what woman, if she has ten silver coins and loses one, doesn't light a lamp, sweep the house, and search carefully until she finds it?
42:15:9/And when she finds it, she calls her friends and neighbors together and says, 'Celebrate with me; I've found the coin I lost.'
42:15:10/Likewise, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of God's angels over one sinner who changes their ways."
42:15:11/He continued, "A certain man had two sons:
42:15:12/And the younger of them said to his father, 'Father, give me my share of the estate.' So he divided his property between them.
42:15:13/Not long after that, the younger son gathered all he had, set off for a distant country, and there squandered his wealth in wild living.
42:15:14/After he had spent everything, there was a severe famine in that whole country, and he began to be in need.
42:15:15/So he went and hired himself out to a citizen of that country, who sent him to his fields to feed pigs.
42:15:16/He longed to fill his stomach with the pods that the pigs were eating, but no one gave him anything.
42:15:17/When he came to his senses, he said, 'How many of my father's hired servants have food to spare, and here I am starving to death!
42:15:18/I will set out and go back to my father and say to him, Father, I've sinned against heaven and against you,
42:15:19/I am no longer worthy to be called your son; treat me as one of your hired servants.'
42:15:20/So he got up and went to his father. But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion; he ran to his son, threw his arms around him and kissed him.
42:15:21/And the son said to him, 'Father, I've sinned against heaven and in your sight, and I'm no longer worthy to be called your son.'
42:15:22/But the father said to his servants, 'Quick! Bring the best robe and put it on him; put a ring on his finger and sandals on his feet.
42:15:23/And bring the fattened calf and kill it. Let's have a feast and celebrate.
42:15:24/For this son of mine was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.' So they began to celebrate.
42:15:25/Meanwhile, the older son was in the field. When he came near the house, he heard music and dancing.
42:15:26/So he called one of the servants and asked what was going on.
42:15:27/'Your brother has come,' he replied, 'and your father has killed the fattened calf because he has him back safe and sound.'
42:15:28/But he became angry and refused to go in. So his father came out and pleaded with him.
42:15:29/But he answered his father, 'Look! All these years I've been slaving for you and never disobeyed your orders. Yet you never gave me even a young goat so I could celebrate with my friends.
42:15:30/But when this son of yours who has squandered your property with prostitutes comes home, you kill the fattened calf for him!'
42:15:31/'My son,' the father said, 'you are always with me, and everything I have is yours.
42:15:32/But we had to celebrate and be glad, because this brother of yours was dead and is alive again; he was lost and is found.'
42:16:1/He also told his disciples, "There was a certain wealthy man who had a manager, and this manager was reported to him for squandering his property.
42:16:2/So he called him and said, 'What's this I hear about you? Give an account of your management, because you can't be manager any longer.'
42:16:3/The manager thought to himself, 'What will I do now? My boss is taking away my job. I'm not strong enough to dig, and I'm too ashamed to beg.
42:16:4/I've decided what to do so that when I'm removed from management, people will welcome me into their homes.'
42:16:5/So he called each one of his master's debtors, and he asked the first, 'How much do you owe my master?'
42:16:6/He replied, 'A hundred measures of oil.' The manager said, 'Take your bill, sit down quickly, and write fifty.'
42:16:7/Then he asked another, 'And how much do you owe?' He said, 'A hundred measures of wheat.' The manager said, 'Take your bill and write eighty.'
42:16:8/The master praised the dishonest manager for acting shrewdly. For the people of this world are more shrewd in dealing with their own kind than are the people of the light.
42:16:9/And I tell you, use worldly wealth to gain friends for yourselves, so that when it's gone, you will be welcomed into eternal dwellings.
42:16:10/Whoever is trustworthy in very small matters is also trustworthy in large ones, and whoever is dishonest in very small matters is also dishonest in large ones.
42:16:11/So if you haven't been trustworthy in handling worldly wealth, who will trust you with true riches?
42:16:12/And if you haven't been trustworthy with someone else's property, who will give you property of your own?
42:16:13/No servant can serve two masters. Either he will hate one and love the other, or he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and money."
42:16:14/The Pharisees, who loved money, heard all this and were scoffing at him.
42:16:15/He said to them, "You are the ones who justify yourselves in the eyes of others, but God knows your hearts. What is highly valued among people is detestable in God's sight.
42:16:16/The Law and the Prophets were proclaimed until John. Since then, the good news of the kingdom of God is being preached, and everyone is forcing their way into it.
42:16:17/But it is easier for heaven and earth to disappear than for the smallest part of the Law to become obsolete.
42:16:18/Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery, and the man who marries a divorced woman commits adultery.
42:16:19/There was a certain wealthy man who dressed in purple and fine linen and lived in luxury every day.
42:16:20/And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus, who was laid at his gate, covered with sores,
42:16:21/Longing to eat what fell from the rich man's table. Even the dogs came and licked his sores.
42:16:22/Eventually, the beggar died and was carried by the angels to Abraham's side. The rich man also died and was buried.
42:16:23/In Hades, where he was in torment, he looked up and saw Abraham far away, with Lazarus by his side.
42:16:24/He called out, 'Father Abraham, have pity on me and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, because I am in agony in this fire.'
42:16:25/But Abraham said, 'Child, remember that during your lifetime you received your good things, while Lazarus received bad things, but now he is comforted here and you are in agony.
42:16:26/And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm has been set in place, so that those who want to go from here to you cannot, nor can anyone cross over from there to us.'
42:16:27/He answered, 'Then I beg you, father, send Lazarus to my family's house,
42:16:28/For I have five brothers. Let him warn them, so they will not also come to this place of torment.'
42:16:29/Abraham replied, 'They have Moses and the Prophets; let them listen to them.'
42:16:30/'No, father Abraham,' he said, 'but if someone from the dead goes to them, they will repent.'
42:16:31/Abraham said to him, 'If they do not listen to Moses and the Prophets, they will not be convinced even if someone rises from the dead.'"
42:17:1/Then he said to the disciples, "It's inevitable that stumbling blocks will come, but woe to the one through whom they come!
42:17:2/It would be better for that person to have a millstone hung around their neck and be thrown into the sea than to cause one of these little ones to stumble.
42:17:3/Be on your guard: If your brother or sister sins against you, correct them; and if they repent, forgive them.
42:17:4/And if they sin against you seven times in a day, and seven times come back to you saying 'I repent,' you must forgive them."
42:17:5/And the apostles said to the Lord, "Increase our faith."
42:17:6/And the Lord said, "If you had faith as small as a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, 'Be uprooted and planted in the sea,' and it would obey you.
42:17:7/But which of you, having a servant plowing or tending sheep, will say to him when he comes in from the field, 'Come at once and sit down to eat'?
42:17:8/Instead, wouldn't you say to him, 'Prepare my meal, get yourself ready and serve me while I eat and drink; after that you may eat and drink'?
42:17:9/Do you thank the servant because he did what he was told to do? I don't think so.
42:17:10/So you also, when you have done everything you were told to do, should say, 'We are unworthy servants; we have only done our duty.'"
42:17:11/As he was on his way to Jerusalem, he passed between Samaria and Galilee.
42:17:12/As he was entering a village, ten men with leprosy met him. They stood at a distance
42:17:13/and called out in a loud voice, "Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!"
42:17:14/When he saw them, he said, "Go and show yourselves to the priests." And as they went, they were cleansed.
42:17:15/One of them, when he saw he was healed, came back, praising God in a loud voice.
42:17:16/He threw himself at Jesus' feet and thanked him—and he was a Samaritan.
42:17:17/Then Jesus asked, "Were not all ten cleansed? Where are the other nine?
42:17:18/Has no one returned to give praise to God except this foreigner?"
42:17:19/Then he said to him, "Get up and go on your way; your faith has healed you."
42:17:20/When asked by the Pharisees when the kingdom of God would come, he replied, "The kingdom of God does not come with your careful observation,
42:17:21/nor will people say, 'Here it is,' or 'There it is,' because the kingdom of God is within you."
42:17:22/Then he said to the disciples, "The time will come when you will long to see one of the days of the Son of Man, but you will not see it.
42:17:23/People will tell you, 'Look, there he is,' or 'Here he is.' Do not go running off after them.
42:17:24/For just as lightning flashes and lights up the sky from one side to the other, so will the Son of Man be in his day.
42:17:25/But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.
42:17:26/Just as it was in the days of Noah, so also will it be in the days of the Son of Man.
42:17:27/People were eating, drinking, marrying and being given in marriage up to the day Noah entered the ark. Then the flood came and destroyed them all.
42:17:28/Similarly, as it was in the days of Lot: People were eating, drinking, buying, selling, planting, building,
42:17:29/but on the day Lot left Sodom, fire and sulfur rained down from heaven and destroyed them all.
42:17:30/It will be just like this on the day the Son of Man is revealed.
42:17:31/On that day, no one on the rooftop, with their possessions inside, should go down to get them. Likewise, no one in the field should go back for anything.
42:17:32/Remember Lot's wife.
42:17:33/Whoever tries to keep their life will lose it, and whoever loses their life will preserve it.
42:17:34/I tell you, on that night two people will be in one bed; one will be taken and the other left.
42:17:35/Two women will be grinding grain together; one will be taken and the other left."
42:17:36/Two men will be in the field; one will be taken and the other left.
42:17:37/They asked him, "Where, Lord?" He replied, "Where there is a dead body, there the vultures will gather."
42:18:1/He told them a story to show that they should always pray and never give up.
42:18:2/He said, "In a certain city, there was a judge who didn't fear God or care about people.
42:18:3/And in that city, there was a widow who kept coming to him, saying, 'Get justice for me against my adversary.'
42:18:4/For a while, he refused. But later he thought to himself, 'Even though I don't fear God or care about people,
42:18:5/I will see that she gets justice, so she won't eventually wear me out with her coming!'"
42:18:6/And the Lord said, "Listen to what the unjust judge says.
42:18:7/Won't God bring about justice for His chosen ones, who cry out to Him day and night, even though He is patient with them?
42:18:8/I assure you, He will see that they get justice quickly. However, when the Son of Man comes, will He find faith on the earth?"
42:18:9/He also told this parable to some who were confident of their own righteousness and looked down on everyone else:
42:18:10/"Two men went up to the temple to pray, one a Pharisee and the other a tax collector.
42:18:11/The Pharisee stood by himself and prayed: 'God, I thank you that I am not like other people—robbers, evildoers, adulterers—or even like this tax collector.
42:18:12/I fast twice a week and give a tenth of all I get.'
42:18:13/But the tax collector stood at a distance. He wouldn't even look up to heaven, but beat his breast and said, 'God, have mercy on me, a sinner.'
42:18:14/I tell you, this man, rather than the other, went home justified before God. For all those who exalt themselves will be humbled, and those who humble themselves will be exalted."
42:18:15/People were also bringing babies to Jesus for Him to touch them. When the disciples saw this, they scolded them.
42:18:16/But Jesus called the children to Him and said, "Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
42:18:17/Truly I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it."
42:18:18/And a certain ruler asked Him, "Good Teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?"
42:18:19/Jesus said to him, "Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.
42:18:20/You know the commandments: 'Do not commit adultery, do not murder, do not steal, do not give false testimony, honor your father and mother.'"
42:18:21/And he said, "I have kept all these since I was a boy."
42:18:22/When Jesus heard this, He said to him, "You still lack one thing. Sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me."
42:18:23/But when he heard this, he became very sad, because he was very wealthy.
42:18:24/Seeing his reaction, Jesus said, "How difficult it is for the wealthy to enter the kingdom of God!
42:18:25/Indeed, it's easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God."
42:18:26/Those who heard this asked, "Then who can be saved?"
42:18:27/He replied, "What is impossible with humans is possible with God."
42:18:28/Then Peter said, "Look, we've left everything to follow you."
42:18:29/And He said to them, "Truly I tell you, no one who has left home or family or siblings or spouse or children for the sake of the kingdom of God
42:18:30/will fail to receive many times more in this age, and in the age to come, eternal life."
42:18:31/Then He took the Twelve aside and told them, "We are going up to Jerusalem, and everything that is written by the prophets about the Son of Man will be fulfilled.
42:18:32/He will be handed over to the Gentiles, mocked, insulted, and spit on.
42:18:33/They will flog Him and kill Him, and on the third day, He will rise again."
42:18:34/But they did not understand any of this. Its meaning was hidden from them, and they did not know what He was talking about.
42:18:35/As He approached Jericho, a blind man was sitting by the roadside begging.
42:18:36/When he heard the crowd going by, he asked what was happening.
42:18:37/They told him, "Jesus of Nazareth is passing by."
42:18:38/He shouted, "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!"
42:18:39/Those leading the way rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, "Son of David, have mercy on me!"
42:18:40/Jesus stopped and ordered the man to be brought to Him. When he came near, Jesus asked him,
42:18:41/"What do you want me to do for you?" "Lord, I want to see," he replied.
42:18:42/Jesus said to him, "Receive your sight; your faith has healed you."
42:18:43/Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus, praising God. When all the people saw it, they also praised God.
42:19:1/And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho.
42:19:2/And there was a man named Zacchaeus, who was a top tax collector, and he was wealthy.
42:19:3/He wanted to see who Jesus was, but couldn't because of the crowd, since he was short.
42:19:4/So he ran ahead and climbed a sycamore tree to see him, because Jesus was going to pass that way.
42:19:5/When Jesus reached the spot, he looked up and saw him, and said, "Zacchaeus, hurry and come down; I must stay at your house today."
42:19:6/So he hurried down and welcomed him joyfully.
42:19:7/But when everyone saw this, they complained, saying, "He has gone to stay with a sinner."
42:19:8/Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, "Look, Lord, I'll give half of my possessions to the poor; and if I've cheated anyone, I'll pay back four times the amount."
42:19:9/Jesus told him, "Today, salvation has come to this house, because he too is a descendant of Abraham."
42:19:10/For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost."
42:19:11/As they listened to this, he went on to tell a parable, because he was near Jerusalem and they thought the kingdom of God would appear immediately.
42:19:12/He said, "A certain nobleman went to a distant country to receive a kingdom for himself, and then return.
42:19:13/He called ten of his servants, gave them ten minas, and told them, 'Engage in business until I come back.'
42:19:14/But his subjects hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, 'We don't want this man to rule over us.'
42:19:15/When he returned, having received the kingdom, he ordered these servants to whom he had given the money to be called to him, to find out what they had gained through trading.
42:19:16/The first came, saying, 'Lord, your mina has earned ten more minas.'
42:19:17/He said to him, 'Well done, good servant! Because you have been faithful in a very small matter, have authority over ten cities.'
42:19:18/And the second came, saying, 'Lord, your mina has made five minas.'
42:19:19/He also said to him, 'You will be over five cities.'
42:19:20/Another came, saying, 'Lord, here is your mina, which I kept put away in a cloth.
42:19:21/For I was afraid of you, because you are a strict man; you take what you didn't deposit, and reap what you didn't sow.'
42:19:22/He said to him, 'I will judge you by your own words, you wicked servant! You knew that I am a strict man, taking what I didn't deposit and reaping what I didn't sow?
42:19:23/Why then didn't you put my money in the bank, so that when I returned, I could have collected it with interest?'
42:19:24/Then he said to those standing by, 'Take the mina away from him and give it to the one who has ten minas.'
42:19:25/(And they said to him, 'Lord, he has ten minas.')
42:19:26/'I tell you that to everyone who has, more will be given; but from the one who does not have, even what they have will be taken away.
42:19:27/But as for these enemies of mine who didn't want me to reign over them—bring them here and kill them in front of me.'"
42:19:28/After saying this, he went ahead, going up to Jerusalem.
42:19:29/When he approached Bethphage and Bethany, at the hill called the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
42:19:30/Telling them, "Go into the village ahead of you, and as you enter, you will find a colt tied, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it here.
42:19:31/If anyone asks you, 'Why are you untying it?' say, 'The Lord needs it.'"
42:19:32/Those who were sent went and found it just as he had told them.
42:19:33/And as they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, "Why are you untying the colt?"
42:19:34/They replied, "The Lord needs it."
42:19:35/They brought it to Jesus, threw their cloaks on the colt, and put Jesus on it.
42:19:36/As he went along, people spread their cloaks on the road.
42:19:37/As he approached the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole crowd of disciples began joyfully to praise God in loud voices for all the miracles they had seen,
42:19:38/Saying, "Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven and glory in the highest!"
42:19:39/Some of the Pharisees in the crowd said to him, "Teacher, rebuke your disciples."
42:19:40/He answered, "I tell you, if they keep quiet, the stones will cry out."
42:19:41/As he approached and saw the city, he wept over it,
42:19:42/Saying, "If you, even you, had only recognized on this day the things that bring you peace! But now they are hidden from your eyes.
42:19:43/For the days will come upon you when your enemies will build an embankment against you, surround you, and hem you in on every side,
42:19:44/And they will level you to the ground, you and your children within you. And they will not leave one stone on another in you, because you did not recognize the time of God's coming to you."
42:19:45/Then he entered the temple and began to drive out those who were selling,
42:19:46/Saying to them, "It is written, 'My house will be a house of prayer,' but you have made it a 'den of robbers.'"
42:19:47/And he taught daily in the temple. But the chief priests, the scribes, and the leaders of the people were trying to kill him,
42:19:48/Yet they could not find a way to do it, because all the people were captivated by what they heard.
42:20:1/It happened that on one of those days, while he was teaching the people in the temple and sharing the good news, the chief priests, scribes, and elders confronted him,
42:20:2/They questioned him, asking, "Tell us, by what authority are you doing these things? Or who gave you this authority?"
42:20:3/He replied, "I'll ask you one question; answer me:
42:20:4/John's baptism—was it from heaven, or from human origin?"
42:20:5/They debated among themselves, thinking, "If we say, 'From heaven,' he will ask, 'Then why didn't you believe him?'"
42:20:6/"But if we say, 'From human origin,' everyone will stone us because they are convinced John was a prophet."
42:20:7/So they said they didn't know where it was from.
42:20:8/Jesus told them, "Then I won't tell you by what authority I do these things."
42:20:9/He then told the people this parable: "A man planted a vineyard, leased it to some farmers, and went away for a long time.
42:20:10/At harvest time, he sent a servant to the farmers so they would give him some of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
42:20:11/He sent another servant, but they also beat him, treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty-handed.
42:20:12/He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him and threw him out.
42:20:13/Then the owner of the vineyard said, 'What shall I do? I will send my beloved son; perhaps they will respect him.'
42:20:14/But when the farmers saw him, they discussed it among themselves and said, 'This is the heir. Let's kill him, so the inheritance will be ours.'
42:20:15/So they threw him out of the vineyard and killed him. What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
42:20:16/He will come and destroy those farmers and give the vineyard to others." When they heard this, they said, "Certainly not!"
42:20:17/He looked at them and said, "Then what is the meaning of the scripture, 'The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone'?
42:20:18/Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces; but it will crush anyone it falls on."
42:20:19/The chief priests and the scribes wanted to arrest him immediately because they realized he had told this parable against them, but they were afraid of the people.
42:20:20/So they watched him closely and sent spies who pretended to be righteous, in order to trap him in his words and hand him over to the jurisdiction and authority of the governor.
42:20:21/They questioned him, saying, "Teacher, we know that you speak and teach correctly, and you do not show partiality but teach God's way truthfully.
42:20:22/Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar or not?"
42:20:23/But he saw through their deceit and said to them, "Why are you trying to trap me?
42:20:24/Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription does it have?" They replied, "Caesar's."
42:20:25/He said to them, "Then give back to Caesar what is Caesar's, and to God what is God's."
42:20:26/They were unable to catch him in his words in the presence of the people; and amazed by his answer, they fell silent.
42:20:27/Some Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question,
42:20:28/Asking, "Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man's brother dies, leaving a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.
42:20:29/Now there were seven brothers. The first married a woman and died childless.
42:20:30/Then the second married her, and he died childless.
42:20:31/Then the third married her; and in the same way all seven died, leaving no children.
42:20:32/Finally, the woman died too.
42:20:33/At the resurrection, whose wife will she be, since all seven were married to her?"
42:20:34/Jesus replied, "People in this age marry and are given in marriage.
42:20:35/But those who are considered worthy of taking part in that age and in the resurrection from the dead will neither marry nor be given in marriage,
42:20:36/And they can no longer die; for they are like the angels. They are God's children, being children of the resurrection.
42:20:37/Indeed, even Moses showed in the account of the bush, when he calls the Lord the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.
42:20:38/He is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for to him all are alive."
42:20:39/Some of the scribes replied, "Teacher, you have spoken well."
42:20:40/And they no longer dared to ask him any more questions.
42:20:41/He said to them, "How can they say that the Christ is David's son?
42:20:42/David himself declares in the Book of Psalms, 'The Lord said to my Lord, "Sit at my right hand,
42:20:43/Until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet."'
42:20:44/So if David calls him 'Lord,' how can he be his son?"
42:20:45/In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,
42:20:46/"Beware of the scribes, who like to walk around in long robes, love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and places of honor at banquets.
42:20:47/They devour widows' houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. These will receive a more severe punishment."
42:21:1/He looked up and noticed wealthy individuals putting their donations into the treasury.
42:21:2/He also saw a poor widow putting in two small coins.
42:21:3/He said, "Truly, I tell you, this poor widow has put in more than all of them:
42:21:4/For all of them have contributed out of their wealth to the offerings of God; but she, out of her poverty, has put in everything she had to live on."
42:21:5/As some were talking about the temple, how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts, he said,
42:21:6/"As for what you see here, the time will come when not one stone will be left on another; every one of them will be thrown down."
42:21:7/They asked him, "Teacher, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are about to take place?"
42:21:8/He said, "Be careful that you are not misled: for many will come in my name, claiming, 'I am he,' and, 'The time is near.' Do not follow them.
42:21:9/But when you hear of wars and disturbances, do not be terrified. These things must happen first, but the end will not come right away."
42:21:10/Then he told them, "Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
42:21:11/There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places, and terrifying events and great signs from heaven.
42:21:12/But before all this, they will seize you and persecute you. They will hand you over to synagogues and prisons, and you will be brought before kings and governors, all on account of my name.
42:21:13/And it will lead to an opportunity for your testimony.
42:21:14/So make up your minds not to worry beforehand how you will defend yourselves.
42:21:15/For I will give you words and wisdom that none of your adversaries will be able to resist or contradict.
42:21:16/You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends, and they will put some of you to death.
42:21:17/Everyone will hate you because of me.
42:21:18/Yet not a single hair of your head will perish.
42:21:19/By standing firm, you will gain life.
42:21:20/When you see Jerusalem being surrounded by armies, you will know that its desolation is near.
42:21:21/Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains, let those in the city get out, and let those in the country not enter the city.
42:21:22/For these are the days of punishment to fulfill all that is written.
42:21:23/How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers! There will be great distress in the land and wrath against this people.
42:21:24/They will fall by the sword and will be taken as prisoners to all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled on by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.
42:21:25/There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars. On the earth, nations will be in anguish and perplexity at the roaring and tossing of the sea.
42:21:26/People will faint from terror, apprehensive of what is coming on the world, for the heavenly bodies will be shaken.
42:21:27/Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.
42:21:28/When these things begin to take place, stand up and lift up your heads, because your redemption is drawing near."
42:21:29/He told them this parable: "Look at the fig tree and all the trees.
42:21:30/When they sprout leaves, you can see for yourselves and know that summer is near.
42:21:31/In the same way, when you see these things happening, you know that the kingdom of God is near.
42:21:32/Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.
42:21:33/Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.
42:21:34/Be careful, or your hearts will be weighed down with dissipation, drunkenness, and the anxieties of life, and that day will close on you suddenly like a trap.
42:21:35/For it will come on all those who live on the face of the whole earth.
42:21:36/Be always on the watch, and pray that you may be able to escape all that is about to happen, and that you may be able to stand before the Son of Man."
42:21:37/During the day, he was teaching in the temple, and at night he went out and stayed on the hill called the Mount of Olives.
42:21:38/And all the people came early in the morning to hear him at the temple.
42:22:1/The festival of unleavened bread was approaching, known as the Passover.
42:22:2/The chief priests and scribes were looking for a way to kill him, as they were afraid of the people's reaction.
42:22:3/Satan then entered Judas, known as Iscariot, who was one of the twelve disciples.
42:22:4/He went and discussed with the chief priests and commanders how he could betray him to them.
42:22:5/They were pleased and agreed to pay him money.
42:22:6/He agreed and looked for a chance to betray him when there was no crowd around.
42:22:7/The day arrived for the Passover lamb to be sacrificed.
42:22:8/He sent Peter and John, instructing them, "Go and prepare the Passover meal for us to eat."
42:22:9/They asked him, "Where do you want us to prepare it?"
42:22:10/He replied, "Look, when you enter the city, a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him into the house he enters.
42:22:11/Tell the owner of the house, 'The Teacher asks, where is the guest room where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?'"
42:22:12/He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Prepare it there."
42:22:13/They went and found everything as he had told them and prepared the Passover.
42:22:14/When the time came, he sat down to eat, and the twelve apostles joined him.
42:22:15/He told them, "I have eagerly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.
42:22:16/For I tell you, I will not eat it again until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God."
42:22:17/He took a cup, gave thanks, and said, "Take this and share it among yourselves.
42:22:18/For I tell you, I will not drink of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God comes."
42:22:19/Then he took bread, gave thanks, broke it, and gave it to them, saying, "This is my body, given for you. Do this in remembrance of me."
42:22:20/Similarly, after supper, he took the cup, saying, "This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.
42:22:21/But look, the hand of the one betraying me is with mine on the table.
42:22:22/Indeed, the Son of Man will go as it has been determined, but woe to that man by whom he is betrayed!"
42:22:23/They began to question among themselves which of them it might be who would do this.
42:22:24/A dispute also arose among them as to which of them was considered to be the greatest.
42:22:25/He said to them, "The kings of the Gentiles lord it over them; and those who have authority over them are called benefactors.
42:22:26/But you are not to be like that. Instead, the greatest among you should be like the youngest, and the one who rules like the one who serves.
42:22:27/For who is greater, the one who is at the table or the one who serves? Is it not the one who is at the table? But I am among you as one who serves.
42:22:28/You are those who have stood by me in my trials.
42:22:29/And I confer on you a kingdom, just as my Father conferred one on me,
42:22:30/so that you may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom and sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.
42:22:31/And the Lord said, "Simon, Simon, Satan has asked to sift all of you as wheat.
42:22:32/But I have prayed for you, Simon, that your faith may not fail. And when you have turned back, strengthen your brothers."
42:22:33/He replied, "Lord, I am ready to go with you to prison and to death."
42:22:34/But he said, "I tell you, Peter, before the rooster crows today, you will deny three times that you know me."
42:22:35/He asked them, "When I sent you without purse, bag or sandals, did you lack anything?" They said, "Nothing."
42:22:36/Then he said to them, "But now, if you have a purse, take it, and also a bag; and if you don't have a sword, sell your cloak and buy one.
42:22:37/For I tell you, what is written must be fulfilled in me: 'And he was counted among the lawbreakers.' Indeed, what is written about me is reaching its fulfillment."
42:22:38/They said, "Lord, look, here are two swords." He replied, "That's enough."
42:22:39/He went out and made his way as usual to the Mount of Olives, and his disciples followed him.
42:22:40/On reaching the place, he said to them, "Pray that you will not fall into temptation."
42:22:41/He withdrew about a stone's throw beyond them, knelt down, and prayed,
42:22:42/"Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."
42:22:43/An angel from heaven appeared to him and strengthened him.
42:22:44/In great anguish, he prayed more fervently, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground.
42:22:45/When he rose from prayer and went back to the disciples, he found them asleep, exhausted from sorrow.
42:22:46/He said to them, "Why are you sleeping? Get up and pray so that you will not fall into temptation."
42:22:47/While he was still speaking, a crowd came up, and the man known as Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He approached Jesus to kiss him.
42:22:48/But Jesus asked him, "Judas, are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?"
42:22:49/When Jesus' followers saw what was going to happen, they said, "Lord, should we strike with our swords?"
42:22:50/And one of them struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his right ear.
42:22:51/But Jesus responded, "Stop! No more of this." And he touched the man's ear and healed him.
42:22:52/Then Jesus said to the chief priests, commanders of the temple guard, and elders who had come for him, "Have you come out with swords and clubs as if I were a criminal?
42:22:53/Every day I was with you in the temple courts, and you did not lay a hand on me. But this is your moment, when darkness reigns."
42:22:54/Then they seized him and led him away, bringing him into the high priest's house. Peter followed at a distance.
42:22:55/And when some there had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had sat down together, Peter sat down with them.
42:22:56/A servant girl saw him seated there in the firelight. She looked closely at him and said, "This man was with him."
42:22:57/But he denied it. "Woman, I don't know him," he said.
42:22:58/A little later someone else saw him and said, "You also are one of them." "Man, I am not!" Peter replied.
42:22:59/About an hour later another asserted, "Certainly this fellow was with him, for he is a Galilean."
42:22:60/Peter replied, "Man, I don't know what you're talking about!" Just as he was speaking, the rooster crowed.
42:22:61/The Lord turned and looked straight at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word the Lord had spoken to him: "Before the rooster crows today, you will disown me three times."
42:22:62/And he went outside and wept bitterly.
42:22:63/The men who were guarding Jesus mocked him and beat him.
42:22:64/They blindfolded him and demanded, "Prophesy! Who hit you?"
42:22:65/And they said many other insulting things to him.
42:22:66/At daybreak, the council of the elders of the people, both chief priests and teachers of the law, met together, and Jesus was led before them.
42:22:67/"If you are the Christ," they said, "tell us." Jesus answered, "If I tell you, you will not believe me,
42:22:68/and if I asked you, you would not answer.
42:22:69/But from now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the mighty God."
42:22:70/They all asked, "So, are you the Son of God?" He replied, "You say that I am."
42:22:71/Then they said, "Why do we need any more testimony? We have heard it from his own lips."
42:23:1/And the entire crowd got up and took him to Pilate.
42:23:2/They started accusing him, saying, "We caught this man misleading our nation, forbidding us to pay taxes to Caesar, and claiming he is Christ, a King."
42:23:3/And Pilate asked him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" He replied, "You're saying it."
42:23:4/Then Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowd, "I find no reason to charge this man."
42:23:5/But they insisted more strongly, "He's causing trouble among the people, teaching all over Judea, starting from Galilee to here."
42:23:6/When Pilate heard about Galilee, he asked if the man was from there.
42:23:7/As soon as he learned that Jesus was under Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem at that time.
42:23:8/Herod was extremely pleased to see Jesus; he had wanted to see him for a long time because he had heard a lot about him and hoped to see him perform a miracle.
42:23:9/He asked Jesus many questions, but Jesus didn't answer any of them.
42:23:10/The chief priests and the scribes stood there, vehemently accusing him.
42:23:11/Herod and his soldiers treated him with contempt, mocked him, dressed him in an elegant robe, and sent him back to Pilate.
42:23:12/That day, Pilate and Herod became friends; previously, they had been enemies.
42:23:13/And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests, the rulers, and the people,
42:23:14/Told them, "You brought this man to me as someone who was misleading the people. Yet, after examining him in your presence, I have found no basis for your charges against him.
42:23:15/Neither has Herod, for he sent him back to us. Clearly, he has done nothing to deserve death.
42:23:16/Therefore, I will punish him and then release him."
42:23:17/(It was necessary for him to release one prisoner to them during the festival.)
42:23:18/But they all shouted together, "Get rid of this man and release Barabbas to us!"
42:23:19/(Barabbas had been imprisoned for a rebellion in the city and for murder.)
42:23:20/Pilate, wanting to release Jesus, spoke to them again.
42:23:21/But they kept shouting, "Crucify him, crucify him!"
42:23:22/For the third time he said to them, "Why? What crime has he committed? I have found no grounds for the death penalty. Therefore, I will have him punished and then release him."
42:23:23/But they kept demanding loudly that he be crucified, and their shouts prevailed.
42:23:24/So Pilate decided to grant their demand.
42:23:25/He released the man they asked for, who had been imprisoned for insurrection and murder, but he handed Jesus over to their will.
42:23:26/As they led him away, they seized Simon from Cyrene, who was coming in from the country, and placed the cross on him to carry behind Jesus.
42:23:27/A large number of people followed him, including women who mourned and wailed for him.
42:23:28/But Jesus turned to them and said, "Daughters of Jerusalem, don't weep for me; weep for yourselves and for your children.
42:23:29/For the time is coming when people will say, 'Blessed are the childless women, the wombs that never bore and the breasts that never nursed!'
42:23:30/Then they will begin to say to the mountains, 'Fall on us!' and to the hills, 'Cover us!'
42:23:31/For if they do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?"
42:23:32/Two other criminals were also led out with him to be executed.
42:23:33/When they came to the place called The Skull, there they crucified him, along with the criminals, one on his right, the other on his left.
42:23:34/Jesus said, "Father, forgive them, for they don't know what they're doing." And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
42:23:35/The people stood watching, and the rulers even sneered at him. They said, "He saved others; let him save himself if he is God's Messiah, the Chosen One."
42:23:36/The soldiers also mocked him, coming up to him and offering him sour wine,
42:23:37/And saying, "If you're the king of the Jews, save yourself."
42:23:38/A sign was also placed above him that read, "THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS."
42:23:39/One of the criminals hanging there hurled insults at him: "Aren't you the Christ? Save yourself and us!"
42:23:40/But the other criminal rebuked him, saying, "Don't you fear God, since you're under the same sentence?
42:23:41/We are punished justly, for we are getting what our deeds deserve. But this man has done nothing wrong."
42:23:42/Then he said, "Jesus, remember me when you come into your kingdom."
42:23:43/Jesus answered him, "Truly I tell you, today you will be with me in paradise."
42:23:44/It was now about noon, and darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon,
42:23:45/Because the sun stopped shining. And the curtain of the temple was torn in two.
