42:23:46/Jesus called out with a loud voice, "Father, into your hands I commit my spirit." When he had said this, he breathed his last.
42:23:47/When the centurion saw what had happened, he praised God and said, "Surely this was a righteous man."
42:23:48/And all the crowds that had gathered for this spectacle, when they saw what had taken place, beat their breasts and went away.
42:23:49/But all those who knew him, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.
42:23:50/Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the Council, a good and upright man,
42:23:51/Who had not consented to their decision and action. He came from the Judean town of Arimathea, and he himself was waiting for the kingdom of God.
42:23:52/This man went to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body.
42:23:53/He took it down, wrapped it in linen cloth, and placed it in a tomb cut in rock, where no one had ever lain.
42:23:54/It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was about to begin.
42:23:55/The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed Joseph and saw the tomb and how his body was laid in it.
42:23:56/Then they went home and prepared spices and perfumes. But they rested on the Sabbath in obedience to the commandment.
42:24:1/On the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they went to the tomb, bringing the spices they had prepared, along with some others.
42:24:2/They discovered the stone had been rolled away from the tomb.
42:24:3/When they went inside, they did not find the body of Lord Jesus.
42:24:4/While they were puzzled about this, suddenly two men in dazzling clothes stood beside them.
42:24:5/As they were terrified and bowed their faces to the ground, the men asked them, "Why are you looking for the living among the dead?
42:24:6/He is not here; he has risen. Remember how he told you, while he was still in Galilee,
42:24:7/'The Son of Man must be handed over to sinners, be crucified, and on the third day rise again.'"
42:24:8/Then they remembered his words.
42:24:9/They left the tomb and reported all these things to the eleven and to all the others.
42:24:10/It was Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the others with them who told the apostles.
42:24:11/But their words seemed like nonsense to them, and they did not believe them.
42:24:12/Peter, however, got up and ran to the tomb. Bending over, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he went away, wondering to himself what had happened.
42:24:13/That same day, two of them were going to a village called Emmaus, about seven miles from Jerusalem.
42:24:14/They were talking with each other about everything that had happened.
42:24:15/As they talked and discussed these things with each other, Jesus himself came up and walked along with them.
42:24:16/But they were kept from recognizing him.
42:24:17/He asked them, "What are you discussing together as you walk along?" They stood still, their faces downcast.
42:24:18/One of them, named Cleopas, asked him, "Are you the only one visiting Jerusalem who does not know the things that have happened there in these days?"
42:24:19/"What things?" he asked. "About Jesus of Nazareth," they replied. "He was a prophet, powerful in word and deed before God and all the people.
42:24:20/And how our chief priests and rulers delivered him to be sentenced to death, and crucified him.
42:24:21/But we had hoped that he was the one who was going to redeem Israel. And what is more, it is the third day since all this took place.
42:24:22/In addition, some women from our group amazed us. They went to the tomb early this morning
42:24:23/but didn't find his body. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels, who said he was alive.
42:24:24/Then some of our companions went to the tomb and found it just as the women had said, but they did not see Jesus."
42:24:25/He said to them, "How foolish you are, and how slow to believe all that the prophets have spoken!
42:24:26/Was it not necessary for the Christ to suffer these things and then enter his glory?"
42:24:27/And beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, he explained to them what was said in all the Scriptures concerning himself.
42:24:28/As they approached the village to which they were going, Jesus acted as if he were going farther.
42:24:29/But they urged him strongly, "Stay with us, for it is nearly evening; the day is almost over." So he went in to stay with them.
42:24:30/When he was at the table with them, he took bread, gave thanks, broke it and began to give it to them.
42:24:31/Then their eyes were opened and they recognized him, and he disappeared from their sight.
42:24:32/They asked each other, "Were not our hearts burning within us while he talked with us on the road and opened the Scriptures to us?"
42:24:33/They got up and returned at once to Jerusalem. There they found the Eleven and those with them, assembled together
42:24:34/and saying, "The Lord has truly risen and has appeared to Simon."
42:24:35/Then the two told what had happened on the way, and how Jesus was recognized by them when he broke the bread.
42:24:36/While they were still talking about this, Jesus himself stood among them and said to them, "Peace be with you."
42:24:37/They were startled and frightened, thinking they saw a ghost.
42:24:38/He said to them, "Why are you troubled, and why do doubts rise in your minds?
42:24:39/Look at my hands and my feet. It is I myself. Touch me and see; a ghost does not have flesh and bones, as you see I have."
42:24:40/After he said this, he showed them his hands and feet.
42:24:41/And while they still did not believe it because of joy and amazement, he asked them, "Do you have anything here to eat?"
42:24:42/They gave him a piece of broiled fish,
42:24:43/and he took it and ate it in their presence.
42:24:44/He said to them, "This is what I told you while I was still with you: Everything must be fulfilled that is written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets and the Psalms."
42:24:45/Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures,
42:24:46/and he told them, "This is what is written: The Christ will suffer and rise from the dead on the third day,
42:24:47/and repentance for the forgiveness of sins will be preached in his name to all nations, starting from Jerusalem.
42:24:48/You are witnesses of these things.
42:24:49/And I am going to send you what my Father has promised; but stay in the city until you have been clothed with power from on high."
42:24:50/He led them out to the vicinity of Bethany, raised his hands, and blessed them.
42:24:51/While he was blessing them, he left them and was taken up into heaven.
42:24:52/Then they worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.
42:24:53/And they stayed continually at the temple, praising God. Amen.
43:1:1/In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
43:1:2/The same was in the beginning with God.
43:1:3/Everything was made through him; and without him, nothing that exists would have been made.
43:1:4/In him was life; and that life was the light of humanity.
43:1:5/And the light shines in the darkness, but the darkness did not understand it.
43:1:6/There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
43:1:7/He came as a witness, to testify about the Light, so that through him everyone might believe.
43:1:8/He himself was not the Light, but he came to testify about the Light.
43:1:9/That was the true Light, which enlightens everyone coming into the world.
43:1:10/He was in the world, and though the world was made through him, the world did not recognize him.
43:1:11/He came to his own, but his own did not accept him.
43:1:12/But to all who did receive him, he gave the right to become children of God, to those who believe in his name:
43:1:13/Who were born, not of blood, nor of the desire of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
43:1:14/And the Word became flesh and lived among us, and we have seen his glory, the glory of the one and only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.
43:1:15/John testified about him and shouted, saying, "This is the one I was talking about, the one who comes after me but ranks ahead of me because he existed before me."
43:1:16/From his fullness, we have all received grace upon grace.
43:1:17/For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
43:1:18/No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is close to the Father's heart, has made him known.
43:1:19/This is John's testimony when the Jewish leaders sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, "Who are you?"
43:1:20/And he confessed, and did not deny; but confessed, "I am not the Messiah."
43:1:21/And they asked him, "What then? Are you Elijah?" He said, "I am not." "Are you the Prophet?" He answered, "No."
43:1:22/Then they said to him, "Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?"
43:1:23/He said, "I am the voice of one calling in the wilderness, 'Make straight the way for the Lord,' as the prophet Isaiah said."
43:1:24/And those who had been sent were from the Pharisees.
43:1:25/And they asked him, "Then why are you baptizing if you are not the Messiah, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?"
43:1:26/John answered them, "I baptize with water, but among you stands one you do not know.
43:1:27/He is the one who comes after me, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie."
43:1:28/These events took place in Bethany across the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
43:1:29/The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, "Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!
43:1:30/This is the one I meant when I said, 'A man who comes after me has surpassed me because he was before me.'
43:1:31/I myself did not know him, but the reason I came baptizing with water was so he might be revealed to Israel."
43:1:32/And John testified, "I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it remained on him.
43:1:33/I myself did not know him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water told me, 'The man on whom you see the Spirit come down and remain is the one who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.'
43:1:34/I have seen and testify that this is the Son of God."
43:1:35/The next day John was there again with two of his disciples.
43:1:36/And looking at Jesus as he walked by, he said, "Look, the Lamb of God!"
43:1:37/When the two disciples heard him say this, they followed Jesus.
43:1:38/Then Jesus turned, saw them following, and asked, "What are you looking for?" They said to him, "Rabbi" (which means Teacher), "where are you staying?"
43:1:39/He replied, "Come and see." So they went and saw where he was staying, and spent the day with him. It was about four in the afternoon.
43:1:40/One of the two who heard John speak and followed Jesus was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.
43:1:41/He first found his own brother Simon and told him, "We have found the Messiah" (which is translated the Christ).
43:1:42/And he brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, "You are Simon son of John. You will be called Cephas" (which is translated Peter).
43:1:43/The next day Jesus decided to leave for Galilee. Finding Philip, he said to him, "Follow me."
43:1:44/Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the town of Andrew and Peter.
43:1:45/Philip found Nathanael and told him, "We have found the one Moses wrote about in the Law, and about whom the prophets also wrote—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph."
43:1:46/And Nathanael said to him, "Can anything good come from Nazareth?" Philip said to him, "Come and see."
43:1:47/When Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, he said of him, "Here truly is an Israelite in whom there is no deceit."
43:1:48/Nathanael asked him, "How do you know me?" Jesus answered, "Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you."
43:1:49/Nathanael declared, "Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the King of Israel."
43:1:50/Jesus replied, "You believe because I told you I saw you under the fig tree. You will see greater things than that."
43:1:51/He then added, "Truly, I tell you, you will see heaven open, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man."
43:2:1/On the third day, there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and Jesus' mother was there.
43:2:2/Both Jesus and his disciples were invited to the wedding.
43:2:3/When the wine ran out, Jesus' mother told him, "They have no wine."
43:2:4/Jesus replied, "Woman, why involve me? My time has not yet come."
43:2:5/His mother told the servants, "Do whatever he tells you."
43:2:6/There were six stone water jars there, used by the Jews for ceremonial washing, each holding twenty to thirty gallons.
43:2:7/Jesus told them, "Fill the jars with water." So they filled them to the brim.
43:2:8/Then he said, "Now draw some out and take it to the master of the banquet." And they did so.
43:2:9/When the master of the banquet tasted the water that had been turned into wine, not knowing where it came from (though the servants who had drawn the water knew), he called the bridegroom
43:2:10/And said to him, "Everyone brings out the choice wine first and then the cheaper wine after the guests have had too much to drink; but you have saved the best till now."
43:2:11/This was the first of the signs Jesus performed in Cana of Galilee. He revealed his glory, and his disciples believed in him.
43:2:12/After this, he went down to Capernaum with his mother, brothers, and disciples, and they stayed there for a few days.
43:2:13/With the Jewish Passover near, Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
43:2:14/In the temple courts, he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves, and others sitting at tables exchanging money.
43:2:15/He made a whip out of cords and drove all from the temple courts, both sheep and cattle; he scattered the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.
43:2:16/To those who sold doves, he said, "Get these out of here! Stop turning my Father's house into a market!"
43:2:17/His disciples remembered that it is written: "Zeal for your house will consume me."
43:2:18/The Jews then responded to him, "What sign can you show us to prove your authority to do all this?"
43:2:19/Jesus answered them, "Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up."
43:2:20/The Jews replied, "It has taken forty-six years to build this temple, and you are going to raise it in three days?"
43:2:21/But the temple he had spoken of was his body.
43:2:22/After he was raised from the dead, his disciples recalled what he had said. Then they believed the Scripture and the words that Jesus had spoken.
43:2:23/While he was in Jerusalem at the Passover Festival, many people saw the signs he was performing and believed in his name.
43:2:24/But Jesus did not fully entrust himself to them, because he knew all people.
43:2:25/He did not need any testimony about mankind, for he knew what was in each person.
43:3:1/There was a man from the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, who was a leader of the Jews.
43:3:2/He came to Jesus at night and said, "Teacher, we know you are a teacher sent from God, because no one could perform the miracles you do unless God were with him."
43:3:3/Jesus replied, "Truly, I tell you, unless someone is born again, they cannot see the kingdom of God."
43:3:4/Nicodemus asked, "How can someone be born when they are old? Can they enter their mother's womb a second time to be born?"
43:3:5/Jesus answered, "Truly, I tell you, unless someone is born of water and the Spirit, they cannot enter the kingdom of God."
43:3:6/What is born of the flesh is flesh, and what is born of the Spirit is spirit.
43:3:7/Don't be surprised when I say to you, 'You must be born again.'
43:3:8/The wind blows wherever it pleases, and you hear its sound, but you can't tell where it comes from or where it's going. So it is with everyone born of the Spirit."
43:3:9/Nicodemus asked, "How can this be?"
43:3:10/Jesus replied, "You are Israel's teacher, and do you not understand these things?"
43:3:11/Truly, I tell you, we speak of what we know and testify to what we have seen, yet you do not accept our testimony.
43:3:12/If I have told you about earthly things and you do not believe, how will you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?
43:3:13/No one has ascended to heaven except the one who descended from heaven, the Son of Man.
43:3:14/Just as Moses lifted up the snake in the wilderness, so the Son of Man must be lifted up,
43:3:15/so that everyone who believes in him may have eternal life.
43:3:16/For God loved the world so much that he gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.
43:3:17/God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him.
43:3:18/Whoever believes in him is not condemned, but whoever does not believe stands condemned already because they have not believed in the name of God's one and only Son.
43:3:19/And this is the judgment: the light has come into the world, and people loved darkness rather than light because their deeds were evil.
43:3:20/For everyone who does evil hates the light and does not come to the light, lest their deeds should be exposed.
43:3:21/But whoever lives by the truth comes to the light, so that it may be clearly seen that their deeds have been done in God.
43:3:22/After this, Jesus and his disciples went into the Judean countryside, where he spent some time with them and baptized.
43:3:23/John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because there was plenty of water there, and people were coming and being baptized.
43:3:24/For John had not yet been put in prison.
43:3:25/Then a dispute arose between some of John's disciples and a Jew over the matter of ceremonial washing.
43:3:26/They came to John and said to him, "Rabbi, the man who was with you on the other side of the Jordan, the one you testified about, look, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him."
43:3:27/John replied, "A person can receive only what is given them from heaven.
43:3:28/You yourselves can testify that I said, 'I am not the Messiah but am sent ahead of him.'
43:3:29/The bride belongs to the bridegroom. The friend who attends the bridegroom waits and listens for him, and is full of joy when he hears the bridegroom's voice. That joy is mine, and it is now complete.
43:3:30/He must become greater; I must become less."
43:3:31/The one who comes from above is above all; the one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks as one from the earth. The one who comes from heaven is above all.
43:3:32/He testifies to what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts his testimony.
43:3:33/Whoever has accepted his testimony has certified that God is truthful.
43:3:34/For the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God gives the Spirit without limit.
43:3:35/The Father loves the Son and has placed everything in his hands.
43:3:36/Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life, but whoever rejects the Son will not see life, for God's wrath remains on them.
43:4:1/So when the Lord found out that the Pharisees had heard about Jesus attracting and baptizing more followers than John,
43:4:2/(Although it was actually his disciples who did the baptizing, not Jesus himself,)
43:4:3/He left Judea and went back to Galilee.
43:4:4/And he had to pass through Samaria on his way.
43:4:5/He arrived at a Samaritan city called Sychar, close to the land that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
43:4:6/Jacob's well was there. Jesus, tired from his journey, sat down by the well. It was around noon.
43:4:7/A Samaritan woman came to draw water, and Jesus asked her, "Please give me a drink."
43:4:8/(His disciples had gone into the city to buy food.)
43:4:9/The Samaritan woman asked him, "Why are you, a Jew, asking me, a Samaritan woman, for a drink?" (Jews usually didn't associate with Samaritans.)
43:4:10/Jesus replied, "If you knew the gift of God and who is asking you for a drink, you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water."
43:4:11/The woman said, "Sir, you don't have a bucket, and the well is deep. Where would you get this living water?
43:4:12/Are you greater than our ancestor Jacob, who gave us this well and drank from it himself, along with his children and livestock?"
43:4:13/Jesus answered, "Everyone who drinks this water will be thirsty again,
43:4:14/but whoever drinks the water I give them will never thirst. Indeed, the water I give them will become in them a spring of water welling up to eternal life."
43:4:15/The woman said to him, "Sir, give me this water so I won't get thirsty and have to keep coming here to draw water."
43:4:16/Jesus told her, "Go, call your husband and come back."
43:4:17/The woman answered, "I don't have a husband." Jesus said to her, "You're right when you say you don't have a husband.
43:4:18/You've had five husbands, and the man you're with now isn't your husband. You've spoken the truth."
43:4:19/The woman said, "Sir, I can see that you're a prophet.
43:4:20/Our ancestors worshiped on this mountain, but you Jews claim that the place where we must worship is in Jerusalem."
43:4:21/Jesus told her, "Believe me, dear woman, the time is coming when you won't worship the Father on this mountain or in Jerusalem.
43:4:22/You Samaritans worship what you don't understand; we worship what we do understand, for salvation comes from the Jews.
43:4:23/Yet a time is coming and has now come when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for they are the kind of worshipers the Father seeks.
43:4:24/God is spirit, and his worshipers must worship in spirit and in truth."
43:4:25/The woman said, "I know that Messiah (called Christ) is coming. When he comes, he'll explain everything to us."
43:4:26/Jesus declared, "I, the one speaking to you, am he."
43:4:27/Just then his disciples returned and were surprised to find him talking with a woman. But no one asked, "What do you want?" or "Why are you talking with her?"
43:4:28/Then, leaving her water jar, the woman went back to the city and said to the people,
43:4:29/"Come, see a man who told me everything I've ever done. Could this be the Messiah?"
43:4:30/They came out of the city and made their way toward him.
43:4:31/Meanwhile, his disciples urged him, "Rabbi, eat something."
43:4:32/But he said to them, "I have food to eat that you know nothing about."
43:4:33/Then his disciples said to each other, "Could someone have brought him food?"
43:4:34/"My food," said Jesus, "is to do the will of him who sent me and to complete his work.
43:4:35/Don't you say, 'There are still four months until harvest'? I tell you, open your eyes and look at the fields! They are ripe for harvest.
43:4:36/The reaper is already receiving his wages and gathering crops for eternal life, so that the sower and the reaper can be glad together.
43:4:37/Here the saying 'One sows and another reaps' is true.
43:4:38/I sent you to reap what you have not worked for. Others have done the hard work, and you have reaped the benefits of their labor."
43:4:39/Many Samaritans from that town believed in him because of the woman's testimony, "He told me everything I ever did."
43:4:40/So when the Samaritans came to him, they urged him to stay with them, and he stayed two days.
43:4:41/And because of his words, many more became believers.
43:4:42/They said to the woman, "We no longer believe just because of what you said; now we have heard for ourselves, and we know that this man really is the Savior of the world."
43:4:43/After the two days, he left for Galilee.
43:4:44/For Jesus himself had pointed out that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
43:4:45/When he arrived in Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him. They had seen all that he had done in Jerusalem at the Passover Festival, for they also had been there.
43:4:46/Once more he visited Cana in Galilee, where he had turned the water into wine. And there was a certain royal official whose son lay sick at Capernaum.
43:4:47/When this man heard that Jesus had arrived in Galilee from Judea, he went to him and begged him to come and heal his son, who was close to death.
43:4:48/Jesus told him, "Unless you people see signs and wonders, you will never believe."
43:4:49/The royal official said, "Sir, please come before my child dies."
43:4:50/Jesus replied, "Go, your son will live." The man took Jesus at his word and departed.
43:4:51/While he was still on the way, his servants met him with the news that his boy was living.
43:4:52/When he inquired as to the time when his son got better, they said to him, "Yesterday at one in the afternoon the fever left him."
43:4:53/Then the father realized that this was the exact time at which Jesus had said to him, "Your son will live." So he and his whole household believed.
43:4:54/This was the second sign Jesus performed after coming from Judea to Galilee.
43:5:1/After this, there was a Jewish festival; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
43:5:2/Now in Jerusalem near the sheep gate, there's a pool called Bethesda in Hebrew, which has five covered walkways.
43:5:3/Here, many people with disabilities, including the blind, lame, and paralyzed, lay waiting for the water to move.
43:5:4/For at certain times, an angel would come down into the pool and stir up the water. The first person to get in after the water was stirred would be healed of whatever disease they had.
43:5:5/There was a man there who had been disabled for thirty-eight years.
43:5:6/When Jesus saw him lying there and learned that he had been in this condition for a long time, he asked him, "Do you want to get well?"
43:5:7/The disabled man replied, "Sir, I have no one to help me into the pool when the water is stirred. While I am trying to get in, someone else goes down ahead of me."
43:5:8/Jesus told him, "Get up, pick up your mat, and walk."
43:5:9/Immediately, the man was healed, picked up his mat, and walked. This happened on the Sabbath.
43:5:10/So the Jewish leaders said to the man who had been healed, "It's the Sabbath; it's not permitted for you to carry your mat."
43:5:11/He replied, "The one who made me well said to me, 'Pick up your mat and walk.'"
43:5:12/Then they asked him, "Who is the man who told you to pick it up and walk?"
43:5:13/But the healed man didn't know who it was, for Jesus had slipped away into the crowd that was there.
43:5:14/Later, Jesus found him at the temple and said to him, "See, you are well again. Stop sinning or something worse may happen to you."
43:5:15/The man went away and told the Jewish leaders that it was Jesus who had made him well.
43:5:16/Therefore, the Jewish leaders persecuted Jesus and sought to kill him because he had done this on the Sabbath.
43:5:17/But Jesus answered them, "My Father is always at his work to this very day, and I too am working."
43:5:18/For this reason, the Jewish leaders tried all the more to kill him; not only was he breaking the Sabbath, but he was also calling God his own Father, making himself equal with God.
43:5:19/Jesus said to them, "Truly, truly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing by himself; he can do only what he sees the Father doing, because whatever the Father does the Son also does."
43:5:20/"For the Father loves the Son and shows him all he does. Yes, and he will show him even greater works than these, so that you will be amazed."
43:5:21/"Just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so the Son gives life to whom he is pleased to give it."
43:5:22/"Moreover, the Father judges no one, but has entrusted all judgment to the Son,"
43:5:23/"so that all may honor the Son just as they honor the Father. Whoever does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him."
43:5:24/"Truly, truly, I tell you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and will not be judged but has crossed over from death to life."
43:5:25/"Truly, truly, I tell you, a time is coming and has now come when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God and those who hear will live."
43:5:26/"For as the Father has life in himself, so he has granted the Son also to have life in himself,"
43:5:27/"and he has given him authority to judge because he is the Son of Man."
43:5:28/"Do not be amazed at this, for a time is coming when all who are in their graves will hear his voice"
43:5:29/"and come out—those who have done good will rise to live, and those who have done evil will rise to be condemned."
43:5:30/"By myself I can do nothing; I judge only as I hear, and my judgment is just, for I seek not to please myself but him who sent me."
43:5:31/"If I testify about myself, my testimony is not valid."
43:5:32/"There is another who testifies in my favor, and I know that his testimony about me is true."
43:5:33/"You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth."
43:5:34/"Not that I accept human testimony; but I mention it so that you may be saved."
43:5:35/"John was a lamp that burned and gave light, and you chose for a time to enjoy his light."
43:5:36/"But I have testimony greater than John's. The works that the Father has given me to finish—the very works that I am doing—testify that the Father has sent me."
43:5:37/"And the Father who sent me has himself testified concerning me. You have never heard his voice nor seen his form,"
43:5:38/"nor does his word dwell in you, for you do not believe the one he sent."
43:5:39/"You study the Scriptures diligently because you think that in them you have eternal life. These are the very Scriptures that testify about me,"
43:5:40/"yet you refuse to come to me to have life."
43:5:41/"I do not accept praise from humans."
43:5:42/"But I know you, that you do not have the love of God within you."
43:5:43/"I have come in my Father's name, and you do not accept me; but if someone else comes in his own name, you will accept him."
43:5:44/"How can you believe when you accept glory from one another but do not seek the glory that comes from the only God?"
43:5:45/"Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father. Your accuser is Moses, on whom your hopes are set."
43:5:46/"If you believed Moses, you would believe me, for he wrote about me."
43:5:47/"But if you do not believe his writings, how will you believe my words?"
43:6:1/After these events, Jesus crossed over the Sea of Galilee, also known as the Sea of Tiberias.
43:6:2/A large crowd followed him because they had seen the miracles he performed on those who were sick.
43:6:3/Jesus climbed a mountain and sat there with his disciples.
43:6:4/The Passover, a Jewish festival, was soon to take place.
43:6:5/When Jesus looked up and saw a large crowd coming toward him, he asked Philip, "Where can we buy bread for these people to eat?"
43:6:6/He asked this to test Philip, for he already knew what he was going to do.
43:6:7/Philip answered, "Even two hundred days' wages worth of bread wouldn't be enough for each person to have a little."
43:6:8/One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, said to him,
43:6:9/"There's a young boy here with five barley loaves and two small fish, but how far will they go among so many?"
43:6:10/Jesus said, "Have the people sit down." There was plenty of grass in that place, and the men sat down, numbering about five thousand.
43:6:11/Jesus took the loaves, gave thanks, and distributed them to those who were seated, as much as they wanted. He did the same with the fish.
43:6:12/When everyone was full, he told his disciples, "Gather the pieces that are left over. Let nothing be wasted."
43:6:13/So they collected them and filled twelve baskets with the pieces of the five barley loaves left over by those who had eaten.
43:6:14/Seeing the sign Jesus had performed, the people said, "Surely this is the Prophet who is to come into the world."
43:6:15/Realizing they intended to come and make him king by force, Jesus withdrew again to a mountain by himself.
43:6:16/When evening came, his disciples went down to the lake,
43:6:17/got into a boat, and set off across the lake for Capernaum. By now it was dark, and Jesus had not yet joined them.
43:6:18/A strong wind was blowing and the waters grew rough.
43:6:19/After rowing three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the lake and approaching the boat. They were frightened.
43:6:20/But he said to them, "It's me; don't be afraid."
43:6:21/They were willing to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat reached the shore where they were heading.
43:6:22/The next day, the crowd that had stayed on the opposite shore of the lake realized that only one boat had been there, and that Jesus had not entered it with his disciples, but that they had gone away alone.
43:6:23/However, other boats from Tiberias landed near the place where the people had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
43:6:24/When the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and went to Capernaum in search of Jesus.
43:6:25/When they found him on the other side of the lake, they asked him, "Rabbi, when did you get here?"
43:6:26/Jesus answered, "Truly, I tell you, you are looking for me not because you saw signs, but because you ate the loaves and had your fill.
43:6:27/Do not work for food that spoils, but for food that endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. For on him God the Father has placed his seal of approval."
43:6:28/Then they asked him, "What must we do to do the works God requires?"
43:6:29/Jesus answered, "The work of God is this: to believe in the one he has sent."
43:6:30/So they asked him, "What sign then will you give that we may see it and believe you? What will you do?
43:6:31/Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness; as it is written: 'He gave them bread from heaven to eat.'"
43:6:32/Jesus said to them, "Truly, I tell you, it was not Moses who gave you the bread from heaven, but it is my Father who gives you the true bread from heaven.
43:6:33/For the bread of God is the one who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world."
43:6:34/They said to him, "Sir, always give us this bread."
43:6:35/Jesus declared, "I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me will never go hungry, and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty.
43:6:36/But as I told you, you have seen me and still you do not believe.
43:6:37/All those the Father gives me will come to me, and whoever comes to me I will never drive away.
43:6:38/For I have come down from heaven not to do my will but to do the will of the one who sent me.
43:6:39/And this is the will of the one who sent me, that I shall lose none of all those he has given me, but raise them up at the last day.
43:6:40/For my Father's will is that everyone who looks to the Son and believes in him shall have eternal life, and I will raise them up at the last day."
43:6:41/At this, the Jews began to grumble about him because he said, "I am the bread that came down from heaven."
43:6:42/They said, "Isn't this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say, 'I came down from heaven'?"
43:6:43/Jesus answered, "Stop grumbling among yourselves.
43:6:44/No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws them, and I will raise them up at the last day.
43:6:45/It is written in the Prophets: 'They will all be taught by God.' Everyone who has heard the Father and learned from him comes to me.
43:6:46/Not that anyone has seen the Father except the one who is from God; only he has seen the Father.
43:6:47/Truly, I tell you, the one who believes has eternal life.
43:6:48/I am the bread of life.
43:6:49/Your ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, yet they died.
43:6:50/But here is the bread that comes down from heaven, which anyone may eat and not die.
43:6:51/I am the living bread that came down from heaven. Whoever eats this bread will live forever. This bread is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world."
43:6:52/Then the Jews began to argue sharply among themselves, "How can this man give us his flesh to eat?"
43:6:53/Jesus said to them, "Truly, I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you.
43:6:54/Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise them up at the last day.
43:6:55/For my flesh is real food and my blood is real drink.
43:6:56/Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in them.
43:6:57/Just as the living Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so the one who feeds on me will live because of me.
43:6:58/This is the bread that came down from heaven. Your ancestors ate manna and died, but whoever feeds on this bread will live forever."
43:6:59/He said this while teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
43:6:60/On hearing it, many of his disciples said, "This is a difficult teaching. Who can accept it?"
43:6:61/Aware that his disciples were grumbling about this, Jesus said to them, "Does this offend you?
43:6:62/Then what if you see the Son of Man ascend to where he was before?
43:6:63/The Spirit gives life; the flesh counts for nothing. The words I have spoken to you—they are full of the Spirit and life.
43:6:64/Yet there are some of you who do not believe." For Jesus had known from the beginning which of them did not believe and who would betray him.
43:6:65/He went on to say, "This is why I told you that no one can come to me unless the Father has enabled them."
43:6:66/From this time many of his disciples turned back and no longer followed him.
43:6:67/Then Jesus asked the Twelve, "Do you also want to leave?"
43:6:68/Simon Peter answered him, "Lord, who will we go to? You have the words of eternal life.
43:6:69/We have come to believe and to know that you are the Holy One of God."
43:6:70/Jesus replied, "Have I not chosen you, the Twelve? Yet one of you is a devil."
43:6:71/He was speaking of Judas, son of Simon Iscariot, for he, one of the Twelve, was going to betray him.
43:7:1/After these events, Jesus stayed in Galilee because he didn't want to travel in Judea, where the Jewish leaders were looking to kill him.
43:7:2/The Jewish Festival of Tabernacles was coming up.
43:7:3/So his brothers said to him, "Leave here and go to Judea so your followers can see the miracles you do."
43:7:4/No one does things in secret when they're looking to be known publicly. If you're doing these things, show yourself to the world.
43:7:5/Even his own brothers didn't believe in him.
43:7:6/Then Jesus told them, "My time hasn't arrived yet, but any time works for you.
43:7:7/The world can't hate you, but it hates me because I point out that its actions are evil.
43:7:8/You go to the festival. I'm not going up to this festival yet because my time hasn't fully come."
43:7:9/After saying this, he stayed in Galilee.
43:7:10/But after his brothers had gone to the festival, he also went, not publicly, but in secret.
43:7:11/Then the Jewish leaders were looking for him at the festival and asking, "Where is he?"
43:7:12/There was a lot of private discussion about him among the crowds. Some said, "He's a good man," while others said, "No, he's misleading the people."
43:7:13/However, no one talked about him openly for fear of the Jewish leaders.
43:7:14/About halfway through the festival, Jesus went up to the temple and began to teach.
43:7:15/The Jewish leaders were amazed and asked, "How does this man have such learning without having been taught?"
43:7:16/Jesus replied, "My teaching isn't my own. It comes from the one who sent me.
43:7:17/If anyone chooses to do God's will, they will know whether my teaching comes from God or whether I speak on my own.
43:7:18/Anyone who speaks on their own is seeking their own glory, but the one seeking the glory of the one who sent him is true, and there's nothing false in him.
43:7:19/Didn't Moses give you the law, yet none of you keeps the law? Why are you trying to kill me?"
43:7:20/The crowd answered, "You're possessed by a demon! Who's trying to kill you?"
43:7:21/Jesus replied, "I did one miracle, and you're all amazed.
43:7:22/Moses gave you circumcision (not that it came from Moses, but from the patriarchs), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.
43:7:23/If a man can receive circumcision on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses may not be broken, why are you angry with me for healing a man's whole body on the Sabbath?
43:7:24/Don't judge by appearances, but judge with right judgment."
43:7:25/Some of the people of Jerusalem began to ask, "Isn't this the man they're trying to kill?
43:7:26/Yet here he is, speaking publicly, and they're saying nothing to him. Could it be that the leaders really know he is the Messiah?
43:7:27/But we know where this man is from; when the Messiah comes, no one will know where he is from."
43:7:28/Then Jesus, teaching in the temple courts, cried out, "Yes, you know me, and you know where I'm from. I haven't come on my own, but the one who sent me is true, and you don't know him.
43:7:29/But I know him because I am from him, and he sent me."
43:7:30/So they tried to seize him, but no one laid a hand on him because his hour had not yet come.
43:7:31/Many in the crowd believed in him and said, "When the Messiah comes, will he perform more signs than this man?"
43:7:32/The Pharisees heard the crowd whispering such things about him, and the chief priests and Pharisees sent temple guards to arrest him.
43:7:33/Then Jesus said, "I am with you for only a short time, and then I am going to the one who sent me.
43:7:34/You will look for me, but you will not find me; and where I am, you cannot come."
43:7:35/The Jewish leaders said to one another, "Where does he intend to go that we won't find him? Will he go to the dispersed among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
43:7:36/What does he mean by saying, 'You will look for me, but you will not find me,' and 'Where I am, you cannot come'?"
43:7:37/On the last and greatest day of the festival, Jesus stood and said in a loud voice, "If anyone is thirsty, let them come to me and drink.
43:7:38/Whoever believes in me, as Scripture has said, rivers of living water will flow from within them."
43:7:39/(He said this about the Spirit, whom those who believed in him were later to receive. Up to that time the Spirit had not been given, since Jesus had not yet been glorified.)
43:7:40/When they heard his words, many in the crowd said, "Surely this man is the Prophet."
43:7:41/Others said, "He is the Messiah." But some asked, "Does the Messiah come from Galilee?
43:7:42/Doesn't Scripture say that the Messiah will come from David's descendants and from Bethlehem, the town where David lived?"
43:7:43/Thus the people were divided because of Jesus.
43:7:44/Some wanted to seize him, but no one laid hands on him.
43:7:45/Then the temple guards went back to the chief priests and Pharisees, who asked them, "Why didn't you bring him in?"
43:7:46/The officers replied, "No one ever spoke the way this man does."
43:7:47/The Pharisees responded, "Have you been led astray too?
43:7:48/Have any of the leaders or Pharisees believed in him?
43:7:49/But this crowd that knows nothing of the law—there is a curse on them."
43:7:50/Nicodemus, who had gone to Jesus earlier and who was one of their own number, asked,
43:7:51/"Does our law condemn a man without first hearing him to find out what he has been doing?"
43:7:52/They replied, "Are you from Galilee, too? Look into it, and you will find that a prophet does not come out of Galilee."
43:7:53/And everyone went to their own home.
43:8:1/Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
43:8:2/Early in the morning, he returned to the temple, and all the people came to him; he sat down and began to teach them.
43:8:3/The scribes and Pharisees brought a woman caught in adultery to him; they placed her in front of everyone.
43:8:4/They said to him, "Teacher, this woman was caught in the act of adultery.
43:8:5/Moses in the law commanded us to stone such women. What do you say?"
43:8:6/They were trying to trap him with this question, so they could have a reason to accuse him. But Jesus bent down and started writing on the ground with his finger, ignoring them.
43:8:7/When they kept questioning him, he straightened up and said to them, "Let any one of you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone at her."
43:8:8/Then he bent down again and continued writing on the ground.
43:8:9/Those who heard began to leave one by one, the older ones first, until only Jesus was left, with the woman still standing there.
43:8:10/When Jesus stood up and saw no one but the woman, he asked her, "Woman, where are your accusers? Has no one condemned you?"
43:8:11/She replied, "No one, Lord." And Jesus said, "Neither do I condemn you. Go now and leave your life of sin."
43:8:12/Then Jesus spoke again to the people, saying, "I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness but will have the light of life."
43:8:13/So the Pharisees said to him, "You are testifying about yourself; your testimony is not valid."
43:8:14/Jesus answered, "Even if I testify about myself, my testimony is valid, because I know where I came from and where I am going; but you do not know where I come from or where I am going.
43:8:15/You judge by human standards; I pass judgment on no one.
43:8:16/But if I do judge, my decisions are true, because I am not alone. I stand with the Father, who sent me.
43:8:17/Your own law also says that the testimony of two people is true.
43:8:18/I am one who testifies for myself; my other witness is the Father, who sent me."
43:8:19/Then they asked him, "Where is your Father?" Jesus answered, "You do not know me or my Father. If you knew me, you would know my Father also."
43:8:20/Jesus spoke these words while teaching in the temple courts near the place where the offerings were put. Yet no one seized him, because his hour had not yet come.
43:8:21/Again Jesus said to them, "I am leaving, and you will look for me, and you will die in your sin. Where I go, you cannot come."
43:8:22/The Jews wondered, "Is he going to kill himself? Is that why he says, 'Where I go, you cannot come'?"
43:8:23/He told them, "You are from below; I am from above. You are of this world; I am not of this world.
43:8:24/That is why I told you that you will die in your sins. For unless you believe that I am he, you will die in your sins."
43:8:25/They asked him, "Who are you?" Jesus answered, "Just what I have been telling you from the beginning.
43:8:26/I have much to say in judgment of you. But he who sent me is trustworthy, and what I have heard from him I tell the world."
43:8:27/They did not understand that he was talking to them about the Father.
43:8:28/Then Jesus said, "When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he and that I do nothing on my own but speak just what the Father has taught me.
43:8:29/The one who sent me is with me; he has not left me alone, for I always do what pleases him."
43:8:30/As he was saying these things, many believed in him.
43:8:31/Then Jesus said to the Jews who had believed him, "If you hold to my teaching, you are really my disciples.
43:8:32/Then you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free."
43:8:33/They answered him, "We are Abraham's descendants and have never been slaves to anyone. How can you say, 'You will be set free'?"
43:8:34/Jesus replied, "Truly, truly, I tell you, everyone who sins is a slave to sin.
43:8:35/A slave does not remain in the household forever, but a son belongs to it forever.
43:8:36/So if the Son sets you free, you will be free indeed.
43:8:37/I know you are Abraham's descendants. Yet you are looking for a way to kill me, because you have no room for my word.
43:8:38/I am telling you what I have seen in the Father's presence, and you are doing what you have heard from your father."
43:8:39/They answered, "Abraham is our father." Jesus said to them, "If you were Abraham's children, then you would do what Abraham did.
43:8:40/As it is, you are looking for a way to kill me, a man who has told you the truth that I heard from God. Abraham did not do such things.
43:8:41/You are doing the works of your own father." They said to him, "We are not illegitimate children; the only Father we have is God himself."
43:8:42/Jesus said to them, "If God were your Father, you would love me, for I came from God and now am here. I have not come on my own; God sent me.
43:8:43/Why is my language not clear to you? Because you are unable to hear what I say.
43:8:44/You belong to your father, the devil, and you want to carry out your father's desires. He was a murderer from the beginning, not holding to the truth, for there is no truth in him. When he lies, he speaks his native language, for he is a liar and the father of lies.
43:8:45/Yet because I tell the truth, you do not believe me.
43:8:46/Can any of you prove me guilty of sin? If I am telling the truth, why don't you believe me?
43:8:47/Whoever belongs to God hears what God says. The reason you do not hear is that you do not belong to God."
43:8:48/The Jews responded, "Aren't we right in saying that you are a Samaritan and demon-possessed?"
43:8:49/Jesus answered, "I am not possessed by a demon; but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.
43:8:50/I am not seeking glory for myself; but there is one who seeks it, and he is the judge.
43:8:51/Truly, truly, I tell you, if anyone keeps my word, he will never see death."
43:8:52/Then the Jews said to him, "Now we know that you are demon-possessed. Abraham died, and so did the prophets, yet you say, 'If anyone keeps my word, he will never taste death.'
43:8:53/Are you greater than our father Abraham? He died, and so did the prophets. Who do you think you are?"
43:8:54/Jesus replied, "If I glorify myself, my glory means nothing. My Father, whom you claim as your God, is the one who glorifies me.
43:8:55/You do not know him, but I know him. If I said I did not, I would be a liar like you, but I do know him and keep his word.
43:8:56/Your father Abraham rejoiced at the thought of seeing my day; he saw it and was glad."
43:8:57/Then the Jews said to him, "You are not yet fifty years old, and you have seen Abraham?"
43:8:58/Jesus said to them, "Truly, truly, I tell you, before Abraham was born, I am."
43:8:59/At this, they picked up stones to stone him, but Jesus hid himself, slipping away from the temple grounds.
43:9:1/As Jesus was walking by, he noticed a man who had been blind since birth.
43:9:2/His disciples asked him, "Teacher, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?"
43:9:3/Jesus replied, "Neither this man nor his parents sinned. This happened so the works of God could be displayed in him.
43:9:4/I must do the works of the one who sent me while it is still day; night is coming when no one can work.
43:9:5/As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world."
43:9:6/After saying this, he spit on the ground, made some mud with the saliva, and put it on the man's eyes.
43:9:7/Then he told him, "Go, wash in the pool of Siloam" (which means Sent). So the man went and washed, and came back able to see.
43:9:8/His neighbors and those who had previously seen him begging asked, "Isn't this the same man who used to sit and beg?"
43:9:9/Some claimed that he was, others said, "No, he just looks like him." But he himself insisted, "I am the man."
43:9:10/So they asked him, "Then how were your eyes opened?"
43:9:11/He replied, "The man named Jesus made some mud, put it on my eyes, and told me to go to Siloam and wash. So I went and washed, and then I could see."
43:9:12/They asked him, "Where is this man?" He said, "I don't know."
43:9:13/They brought the man who had been blind to the Pharisees.
43:9:14/It was a Sabbath day when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.
43:9:15/Then the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He told them, "He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and now I see."
43:9:16/Some of the Pharisees said, "This man is not from God, for he does not keep the Sabbath." But others asked, "How can a sinner perform such signs?" So they were divided.
43:9:17/They turned again to the blind man, "What do you say about him, since he opened your eyes?" He said, "He is a prophet."
43:9:18/Yet the Jewish leaders did not believe that he had been blind and had received his sight until they called the parents of the man who had received his sight.
43:9:19/They asked them, "Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?"
43:9:20/His parents answered, "We know this is our son and that he was born blind.
43:9:21/But how he now sees, we do not know, nor do we know who opened his eyes. Ask him; he is of age. He will speak for himself."
43:9:22/His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders, who had already agreed that anyone who acknowledged Jesus as the Christ would be expelled from the synagogue.
43:9:23/That's why his parents said, "He is of age; ask him."
43:9:24/So for the second time they called the man who had been blind and said to him, "Give glory to God; we know this man is a sinner."
43:9:25/He answered, "Whether he is a sinner, I do not know. One thing I do know, that though I was blind, now I see."
43:9:26/Then they asked him again, "What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?"
43:9:27/He replied, "I have already told you, and you did not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become his disciples?"
43:9:28/They insulted him and said, "You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.
43:9:29/We know that God spoke to Moses, but as for this man, we do not know where he comes from."
43:9:30/The man answered, "Now that is remarkable! You don't know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.
43:9:31/We know that God does not listen to sinners, but if anyone is a worshiper of God and does His will, God listens to him.
43:9:32/Never since the world began has it been heard that anyone opened the eyes of a man born blind.
43:9:33/If this man were not from God, he could do nothing."
43:9:34/They replied, "You were steeped in sin at birth; how dare you lecture us?" And they threw him out.
43:9:35/Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and when he found him, he asked, "Do you believe in the Son of Man?"
43:9:36/He answered, "Who is he, sir, that I may believe in him?"
43:9:37/Jesus said to him, "You have seen him, and it is he who is speaking with you."
43:9:38/He said, "Lord, I believe," and he worshiped him.
43:9:39/Jesus said, "I came into this world for judgment, so that those who do not see may see, and those who see may become blind."
43:9:40/Some Pharisees who were with him heard these words and asked him, "Are we also blind?"
43:9:41/Jesus said to them, "If you were blind, you would have no sin; but now that you say, 'We see,' your sin remains.
43:10:1/Truly, truly, I tell you, anyone who doesn't enter the sheep pen by the gate but climbs in by another way is a thief and a robber.
43:10:2/But the one who enters by the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.
43:10:3/To him the gatekeeper opens; the sheep listen to his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
43:10:4/When he has brought out all his own, he goes ahead of them, and the sheep follow him because they know his voice.
43:10:5/They will never follow a stranger; in fact, they will run away from him because they do not recognize a stranger’s voice.
43:10:6/Jesus used this figure of speech, but they did not understand what he was telling them.
43:10:7/Then Jesus said to them again, "Truly, truly, I tell you, I am the gate for the sheep.
43:10:8/All who have come before me are thieves and robbers, but the sheep have not listened to them.
43:10:9/I am the gate; whoever enters through me will be saved. They will come in and go out, and find pasture.
43:10:10/The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full.
43:10:11/I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
43:10:12/But the hired hand, who is not the shepherd and does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and runs away—and the wolf attacks the flock and scatters it.
43:10:13/The hired hand runs away because he is a hired hand and does not care about the sheep.
43:10:14/I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me—
43:10:15/just as the Father knows me and I know the Father—and I lay down my life for the sheep.
43:10:16/I have other sheep that are not of this sheep pen. I must bring them also. They too will listen to my voice, and there shall be one flock and one shepherd.
43:10:17/For this reason the Father loves me, because I lay down my life—only to take it up again.
43:10:18/No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of my own accord. I have authority to lay it down and authority to take it up again. This command I received from my Father.
43:10:19/Therefore the Jews were divided because of these words.
43:10:20/Many of them said, "He is demon-possessed and insane. Why listen to him?"
43:10:21/Others said, "These are not the sayings of a man possessed by a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?"
43:10:22/Then came the Festival of Dedication at Jerusalem. It was winter,
43:10:23/and Jesus was walking in the temple courts in Solomon’s Colonnade.
43:10:24/The Jews gathered around him, saying, "How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Messiah, tell us plainly."
43:10:25/Jesus answered, "I did tell you, but you do not believe. The works I do in my Father’s name testify about me,
43:10:26/but you do not believe because you are not my sheep.
43:10:27/My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.
43:10:28/I give them eternal life, and they will never perish; no one will snatch them out of my hand.
43:10:29/My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all; no one can snatch them out of my Father’s hand.
43:10:30/I and the Father are one."
43:10:31/Again his Jewish opponents picked up stones to stone him,
43:10:32/Jesus said to them, "I have shown you many good works from the Father. For which of these do you stone me?"
43:10:33/The Jews replied, "It’s not for a good work that we stone you but for blasphemy, because you, a mere man, claim to be God."
43:10:34/Jesus answered them, "Is it not written in your Law, ‘I have said you are gods’?
43:10:35/If he called them ‘gods,’ to whom the word of God came—and Scripture cannot be set aside—
43:10:36/what about the one whom the Father set apart as his very own and sent into the world? Why then do you accuse me of blasphemy because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’?
43:10:37/If I do not do the works of my Father, do not believe me.
43:10:38/But if I do them, even though you do not believe me, believe the works, so that you may know and understand that the Father is in me, and I in the Father."
43:10:39/Again they tried to seize him, but he escaped their grasp.
43:10:40/Then Jesus went back across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing in the early days. There he stayed,
43:10:41/and many people came to him. They said, "Though John never performed a sign, everything John said about this man was true."
43:10:42/And in that place many believed in Jesus.
43:11:1/A certain man named Lazarus from Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha, was sick.
43:11:2/(This was the Mary who anointed the Lord with perfume and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)
43:11:3/So his sisters sent a message to Jesus, saying, "Lord, the one you love is sick."
43:11:4/Upon hearing this, Jesus said, "This sickness will not end in death, but is for God's glory, so that the Son of God may be glorified through it."
43:11:5/Jesus had a deep affection for Martha, her sister, and Lazarus.
43:11:6/Even after hearing that Lazarus was sick, he stayed where he was for two more days.
43:11:7/Then he said to his disciples, "Let's go back to Judea."
43:11:8/His disciples replied, "Teacher, the Jewish leaders were just trying to stone you, and you want to go back there?"
43:11:9/Jesus answered, "Aren't there twelve hours of daylight? Anyone who walks in the daytime won't stumble because they see the world's light.
43:11:10/But if anyone walks at night, they stumble because the light is not in them."
43:11:11/After saying this, he told them, "Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I am going to wake him up."
43:11:12/The disciples said, "Lord, if he's sleeping, he will get better."
43:11:13/Jesus had been speaking about his death, but they thought he meant natural sleep.
43:11:14/Then Jesus told them plainly, "Lazarus is dead.
43:11:15/And for your sake, I'm glad I wasn't there, so that you may believe. But let's go to him."
43:11:16/Then Thomas, also known as Didymus, said to the rest of the disciples, "Let's also go, so that we may die with him."
43:11:17/When Jesus arrived, he found that Lazarus had already been in the tomb for four days.
43:11:18/Bethany was close to Jerusalem, about two miles away,
43:11:19/and many Jews had come to Martha and Mary to comfort them about their brother.
43:11:20/When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary stayed at home.
43:11:21/Martha said to Jesus, "Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
43:11:22/But I know that even now, whatever you ask from God, God will give you."
43:11:23/Jesus told her, "Your brother will rise again."
43:11:24/Martha said to him, "I know he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day."
43:11:25/Jesus said to her, "I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, even if they die, will live,
43:11:26/and everyone who lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?"
43:11:27/She replied, "Yes, Lord, I believe that you are the Messiah, the Son of God, who is to come into the world."
43:11:28/After she said this, she went back and called her sister Mary aside, whispering, "The Teacher is here and is calling for you."
43:11:29/As soon as Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to him.
43:11:30/Jesus had not yet entered the village but was still at the place where Martha had met him.
43:11:31/The Jews who were with Mary in the house, comforting her, noticed how quickly she got up and went out. They followed her, thinking she was going to the tomb to mourn there.
43:11:32/When Mary reached the place where Jesus was and saw him, she fell at his feet and said, "Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died."
43:11:33/When Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who had come along with her also weeping, he was deeply moved in spirit and troubled.
43:11:34/He asked, "Where have you laid him?" They replied, "Lord, come and see."
43:11:35/Jesus wept.
43:11:36/The Jews then said, "See how much he loved him!"
43:11:37/But some of them said, "Couldn't he who opened the eyes of the blind man have kept this man from dying?"
43:11:38/Jesus, once more deeply moved, came to the tomb. It was a cave with a stone laid across the entrance.
43:11:39/Jesus said, "Remove the stone." Martha, the sister of the deceased, said to him, "Lord, by this time there will be a stench, for he has been dead four days."
43:11:40/Jesus said to her, "Didn't I tell you that if you believe, you will see the glory of God?"
43:11:41/So they took away the stone. Then Jesus looked up and said, "Father, I thank you that you have heard me.
43:11:42/I knew that you always hear me, but I said this for the benefit of the people standing here, that they may believe you sent me."
43:11:43/After saying this, he shouted with a loud voice, "Lazarus, come out!"
43:11:44/The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped with strips of linen, and a cloth around his face. Jesus said to them, "Unbind him, and let him go."
43:11:45/Many of the Jews who had come to visit Mary, and had seen what Jesus did, believed in him.
43:11:46/But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
43:11:47/Then the chief priests and the Pharisees called a meeting of the Sanhedrin and said, "What are we accomplishing? This man is performing many signs.
43:11:48/If we let him go on like this, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away both our temple and our nation."
43:11:49/One of them, named Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, said to them, "You know nothing at all.
43:11:50/You do not realize that it is better for you that one man die for the people than that the whole nation perish."
43:11:51/He did not say this on his own, but as high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation,
43:11:52/and not only for that nation but also for the scattered children of God, to bring them together and make them one.
43:11:53/So from that day on they plotted to take his life.
43:11:54/Therefore, Jesus no longer moved about publicly among the people of Judea. Instead, he withdrew to a region near the wilderness, to a village called Ephraim, where he stayed with his disciples.
43:11:55/The Jewish Passover was near, and many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover to purify themselves.
43:11:56/They were looking for Jesus and asking each other as they stood in the temple courts, "What do you think? Isn’t he coming to the festival at all?"
43:11:57/The chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that anyone who found out where Jesus was should report it so that they could arrest him.
43:12:1/Then Jesus, six days before Passover, arrived in Bethany, where Lazarus lived, whom he had brought back to life.
43:12:2/There, they prepared a dinner for him; Martha was serving, while Lazarus was among those reclining at the table with him.
43:12:3/Mary then took a pound of very expensive spikenard perfume, anointed Jesus' feet, and wiped his feet with her hair. The fragrance of the perfume filled the entire house.
43:12:4/Then Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, the one who would betray him, said,
43:12:5/Why wasn't this perfume sold for three hundred denarii and the money given to the poor?
43:12:6/He said this not because he cared about the poor but because he was a thief; he held the money bag and would help himself to what was put into it.
43:12:7/Then Jesus said, Leave her alone; she has kept this for the day of my burial.
43:12:8/You will always have the poor among you, but you will not always have me.
43:12:9/Many of the Jews knew Jesus was there and came not only because of him but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.
43:12:10/But the chief priests plotted to kill Lazarus as well,
43:12:11/Because on account of him, many of the Jews were going away and believing in Jesus.
43:12:12/The next day, a large crowd that had come to the feast heard that Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem.
43:12:13/They took palm branches and went out to meet him, shouting, "Hosanna! Blessed is the King of Israel who comes in the name of the Lord!"
43:12:14/And Jesus, finding a young donkey, sat on it, as it is written,
43:12:15/"Do not be afraid, daughter of Zion; see, your King is coming, seated on a donkey's colt."
43:12:16/At first, his disciples did not understand all this. Only after Jesus was glorified did they realize that these things had been written about him and that they had done these things to him.
43:12:17/The crowd that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead continued to spread the word.
43:12:18/Many people went out to meet him because they had heard he had performed this sign.
43:12:19/So the Pharisees said to one another, "See, this is getting us nowhere. Look how the whole world has gone after him!"
43:12:20/Now there were some Greeks among those who went up to worship at the feast.
43:12:21/They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, with a request. "Sir," they said, "we would like to see Jesus."
43:12:22/Philip went to tell Andrew; Andrew and Philip in turn told Jesus.
43:12:23/Jesus replied, "The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
43:12:24/Truly, truly, I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls to the ground and dies, it remains only a single seed. But if it dies, it produces many seeds.
43:12:25/Anyone who loves their life will lose it, while anyone who hates their life in this world will keep it for eternal life.
43:12:26/If anyone serves me, they must follow me; and where I am, my servant also will be. My Father will honor the one who serves me.
43:12:27/"Now my soul is troubled, and what should I say? 'Father, save me from this hour'? No, it was for this very reason I came to this hour.
43:12:28/Father, glorify your name." Then a voice came from heaven, "I have glorified it, and will glorify it again."
43:12:29/The crowd that was there and heard it said it had thundered; others said an angel had spoken to him.
43:12:30/Jesus said, "This voice was for your benefit, not mine.
43:12:31/Now is the time for judgment on this world; now the prince of this world will be driven out.
43:12:32/And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself."
43:12:33/He said this to show the kind of death he was going to die.
43:12:34/The crowd spoke up, "We have heard from the Law that the Messiah will remain forever, so how can you say, 'The Son of Man must be lifted up'? Who is this 'Son of Man'?"
43:12:35/Then Jesus told them, "You will have the light just a little while longer. Walk while you have the light, before darkness overtakes you. Whoever walks in the dark does not know where they are going.
43:12:36/While you have the light, believe in the light, so that you may become children of light." After Jesus had said this, he went away and hid himself from them.
43:12:37/Even after Jesus had performed so many signs in their presence, they still would not believe in him.
43:12:38/This was to fulfill the word of Isaiah the prophet: "Lord, who has believed our message and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?"
43:12:39/For this reason they could not believe, because, as Isaiah says elsewhere,
43:12:40/"He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, so they can neither see with their eyes, nor understand with their hearts, nor turn—and I would heal them."
43:12:41/Isaiah said this because he saw Jesus' glory and spoke about him.
43:12:42/Yet at the same time, many even among the leaders believed in him. But because of the Pharisees, they would not openly acknowledge their faith for fear they would be put out of the synagogue;
43:12:43/For they loved human praise more than praise from God.
43:12:44/Then Jesus cried out, "Whoever believes in me does not believe in me only, but in the one who sent me.
43:12:45/And whoever sees me sees the one who sent me.
43:12:46/I have come into the world as a light, so that no one who believes in me should stay in darkness.
43:12:47/If anyone hears my words but does not keep them, I do not judge that person. For I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
43:12:48/There is a judge for the one who rejects me and does not accept my words; the very words I have spoken will condemn them at the last day.
43:12:49/For I did not speak on my own, but the Father who sent me commanded me to say all that I have spoken.
43:12:50/And I know that his command leads to eternal life. So whatever I say is just what the Father has told me to say.
43:13:1/Before the Passover feast, Jesus, knowing that his time had come to leave this world and go to the Father, showed his love for his followers in the world to the very end.
43:13:2/After dinner, with the devil already prompting Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray him,
43:13:3/Jesus, aware that the Father had put everything into his hands and that he had come from God and was returning to God,
43:13:4/Got up from the meal, took off his outer clothing, and wrapped a towel around his waist.
43:13:5/Then he poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples' feet, drying them with the towel wrapped around him.
43:13:6/When he came to Simon Peter, Peter asked him, "Lord, are you going to wash my feet?"
43:13:7/Jesus replied, "You don't understand what I'm doing now, but you will later."
43:13:8/Peter insisted, "You will never wash my feet." Jesus answered, "Unless I wash you, you have no share with me."
43:13:9/Simon Peter then said, "Lord, not just my feet, but also my hands and my head!"
43:13:10/Jesus told him, "Anyone who has bathed needs only to wash their feet to be completely clean. And you are clean, though not all of you."
43:13:11/For he knew who was going to betray him, which is why he said not everyone was clean.
43:13:12/After washing their feet, putting on his clothes, and returning to his place, he asked them, "Do you understand what I have done for you?
43:13:13/You call me 'Teacher' and 'Lord,' and rightly so, for that is what I am.
43:13:14/If I, then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another's feet.
43:13:15/I have set an example for you, so that you should do as I have done for you.
43:13:16/Truly, I tell you, no servant is greater than their master, nor is a messenger greater than the one who sent them.
43:13:17/If you understand these things, you will be blessed if you do them.
43:13:18/I'm not referring to all of you; I know those I have chosen. But this is to fulfill the scripture: 'The one who shared my bread has turned against me.'
43:13:19/I am telling you now before it happens, so that when it does happen, you will believe that I am who I am.
43:13:20/Truly, I tell you, whoever receives anyone I send receives me; and whoever receives me receives the one who sent me."
43:13:21/After saying this, Jesus was troubled in spirit and declared, "Truly, I tell you, one of you will betray me."
43:13:22/The disciples looked at one another, uncertain of whom he spoke.
43:13:23/One of his disciples, the one Jesus loved, was reclining close to him.
43:13:24/Simon Peter motioned to this disciple and said, "Ask him who he's talking about."
43:13:25/Leaning back against Jesus, he asked him, "Lord, who is it?"
43:13:26/Jesus answered, "It is the one to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it." After dipping the bread, he gave it to Judas Iscariot, son of Simon.
43:13:27/After Judas took the bread, Satan entered into him. Jesus then told him, "What you are about to do, do quickly."
43:13:28/None of those at the table understood why Jesus said this to him.
43:13:29/Some thought that, since Judas had the money bag, Jesus was telling him to buy what was needed for the festival, or to give something to the poor.
43:13:30/As soon as Judas had taken the bread, he went out. And it was night.
43:13:31/When he had left, Jesus said, "Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in him.
43:13:32/If God is glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself and will glorify him at once.
43:13:33/My children, I will be with you only a little longer. You will look for me, and just as I told the Jews, so I tell you now: where I am going, you cannot come.
43:13:34/A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.
43:13:35/By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another."
43:13:36/Simon Peter asked him, "Lord, where are you going?" Jesus replied, "Where I am going, you cannot follow now, but you will follow later."
43:13:37/Peter asked, "Lord, why can't I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you."
43:13:38/Jesus answered, "Will you really lay down your life for me? Truly, I tell you, before the rooster crows, you will deny me three times.
43:14:1/Don't let your heart be troubled: if you believe in God, believe also in me.
43:14:2/In my Father's house, there are many places to live: if it weren't true, I would have told you. I'm going to prepare a place for you.
43:14:3/And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come back, and take you to be with me; so that where I am, you may be there too.
43:14:4/You know where I'm going, and you know the way.
43:14:5/Thomas said to him, "Lord, we don't know where you're going; how can we know the way?"
43:14:6/Jesus said to him, "I am the way, the truth, and the life: no one comes to the Father, except through me."
43:14:7/If you had known me, you would have known my Father too: from now on, you do know him, and have seen him.
43:14:8/Philip said to him, "Lord, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us."
43:14:9/Jesus said to him, "Have I been with you so long, and yet you don't know me, Philip? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Father; so how can you say, 'Show us the Father'?"
43:14:10/Don't you believe that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me? The words I say to you, I don't speak on my own authority: but the Father living in me does his works.
43:14:11/Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me: or else believe because of the works themselves.
43:14:12/Truly, I tell you, anyone who believes in me will do the works I have been doing; and they will do even greater things than these, because I am going to the Father.
43:14:13/And whatever you ask in my name, I will do, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
43:14:14/If you ask anything in my name, I will do it.
43:14:15/If you love me, keep my commands.
43:14:16/And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Advocate, to be with you forever;
43:14:17/The Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot accept, because it neither sees him nor knows him. But you know him, for he lives with you and will be in you.
43:14:18/I will not leave you as orphans; I will come to you.
43:14:19/Soon the world will not see me anymore, but you will see me. Because I live, you also will live.
43:14:20/On that day you will realize that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.
43:14:21/Whoever has my commands and keeps them is the one who loves me. And the one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I too will love them and show myself to them.
43:14:22/Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, "Lord, how is it that you will reveal yourself to us, and not to the world?"
43:14:23/Jesus answered him, "If anyone loves me, they will keep my word, and my Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.
43:14:24/Anyone who does not love me does not keep my words. And the word you hear is not mine, but the Father's who sent me.
43:14:25/I have told you these things while I am still with you.
43:14:26/But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you all things and remind you of everything I have said to you.
43:14:27/Peace I leave with you; my peace I give you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled and do not be afraid.
43:14:28/You heard me say, 'I am going away and I am coming back to you.' If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I.
43:14:29/And now I have told you before it happens, so that when it does happen, you will believe.
43:14:30/After this, I won't talk much with you, because the ruler of this world is coming. He has no hold over me,
43:14:31/but the world must learn that I love the Father and do exactly what my Father has commanded me. Get up, let's go from here.
43:15:1/I am the true vine, and my Father is the gardener.
43:15:2/Every branch in me that does not produce fruit he removes: and every branch that does produce fruit, he prunes so that it will produce even more fruit.
43:15:3/Now you are clean because of the word I have spoken to you.
43:15:4/Remain in me, and I in you. Just as the branch cannot produce fruit by itself unless it remains in the vine; neither can you unless you remain in me.
43:15:5/I am the vine, you are the branches: Whoever remains in me, and I in them, will produce a lot of fruit: for apart from me you can do nothing.
