43:15:6/If anyone does not remain in me, they are thrown out like a branch and wither; and such branches are gathered, thrown into the fire, and burned.
43:15:7/If you remain in me, and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.
43:15:8/This is how my Father is glorified, by you bearing much fruit; and in this way, you will be my disciples.
43:15:9/Just as the Father has loved me, so have I loved you: continue in my love.
43:15:10/If you keep my commands, you will remain in my love; just as I have kept my Father’s commands and remain in his love.
43:15:11/I have told you these things so that my joy may be in you, and that your joy may be complete.
43:15:12/This is my command: Love each other as I have loved you.
43:15:13/No one has greater love than this, to lay down one's life for one's friends.
43:15:14/You are my friends if you do what I command.
43:15:15/From now on, I don’t call you servants, because a servant doesn’t know what his master is doing. But I have called you friends, for everything that I have learned from my Father I have made known to you.
43:15:16/You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you so that you might go and produce fruit, and that your fruit should last: so that whatever you ask the Father in my name, he will give you.
43:15:17/This is my command to you: Love each other.
43:15:18/If the world hates you, keep in mind that it hated me first.
43:15:19/If you belonged to the world, it would love you as its own. As it is, you do not belong to the world, but I have chosen you out of the world. That is why the world hates you.
43:15:20/Remember what I told you: A servant is not greater than his master. If they persecuted me, they will persecute you also; if they obeyed my teaching, they will obey yours as well.
43:15:21/But they will treat you this way because of my name, for they do not know the one who sent me.
43:15:22/If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.
43:15:23/Whoever hates me hates my Father as well.
43:15:24/If I had not done among them the works no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. But now they have seen these miracles, and yet they have hated both me and my Father.
43:15:25/But this happened so that the statement written in their law would be fulfilled: 'They hated me without reason.'
43:15:26/But when the Advocate comes, whom I will send to you from the Father—the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father—he will testify about me.
43:15:27/And you also must testify, for you have been with me from the beginning.
43:16:1/I've told you these things so you won't be caught off guard.
43:16:2/You'll be kicked out of the synagogues; indeed, a time is coming when anyone who kills you will think they're doing a service to God.
43:16:3/They will do these things to you because they don't know the Father or me.
43:16:4/But I've told you this so when the time comes, you'll remember I warned you. I didn't tell you this from the start because I was with you.
43:16:5/But now I'm leaving to go to the one who sent me, and none of you are asking where I'm going.
43:16:6/Yet, because I've told you these things, your hearts are filled with sorrow.
43:16:7/However, I'm telling you the truth; it's better for you that I leave because if I don't, the Comforter won't come to you. But if I go, I'll send him to you.
43:16:8/And when he comes, he will convict the world concerning sin, righteousness, and judgment:
43:16:9/Concerning sin, because they don't believe in me;
43:16:10/Concerning righteousness, because I'm going to the Father and you won't see me anymore;
43:16:11/Concerning judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged.
43:16:12/I have much more to tell you, but you can't handle it now.
43:16:13/However, when the Spirit of truth comes, he will guide you into all truth. He won't speak on his own but will tell you what he hears and will show you things to come.
43:16:14/He will bring glory to me by taking from what is mine and revealing it to you.
43:16:15/Everything that the Father has is mine. That's why I said the Spirit will take from what is mine and show it to you.
43:16:16/In a little while, you won't see me anymore, but then after a little while, you will see me, because I am going to the Father.
43:16:17/Then some of his disciples said to each other, "What does he mean by saying, 'In a little while, you won't see me, and then after a little while, you will see me,' and 'Because I am going to the Father'?"
43:16:18/So they kept asking, "What does he mean by 'a little while'? We don't understand what he's saying."
43:16:19/Jesus knew they wanted to ask him about this, so he said to them, "Are you trying to figure out among yourselves what I meant by saying, 'In a little while, you won't see me, and then after a little while, you will see me'?
43:16:20/Truly, I tell you, you will weep and mourn while the world rejoices. You will grieve, but your grief will turn into joy.
43:16:21/Just as a woman in labor is in pain because her time has come, but when her baby is born she forgets the anguish because of her joy that a child has been born into the world.
43:16:22/So you have grief now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.
43:16:23/On that day, you won't need to ask me anything. Truly, I tell you, whatever you ask the Father in my name, he will give you.
43:16:24/Up to now, you haven't asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy may be complete.
43:16:25/I have spoken to you in figures of speech; a time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in such a way but will tell you plainly about the Father.
43:16:26/On that day, you will ask in my name. I'm not saying I will ask the Father on your behalf;
43:16:27/For the Father himself loves you because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
43:16:28/I came from the Father and entered the world; now I am leaving the world and going back to the Father."
43:16:29/His disciples said, "Now you're speaking clearly and without figures of speech.
43:16:30/Now we understand that you know everything and don't need anyone to question you. By this, we believe that you came from God."
43:16:31/Jesus replied, "Do you now believe?
43:16:32/Listen, a time is coming, indeed it's here now, when you will be scattered, each to your own home, leaving me alone. Yet I am not alone, for the Father is with me.
43:16:33/I have told you these things so that in me you may have peace. In the world, you will have trouble, but take heart; I have overcome the world."
43:17:1/Jesus spoke these words, then looked up to heaven and said, "Father, the time has come; glorify your Son, so that your Son may glorify you:
43:17:2/Since you have given him authority over all people, to give eternal life to all you have given him.
43:17:3/And eternal life is this: to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.
43:17:4/I have brought you glory on earth by completing the work you gave me to do.
43:17:5/And now, Father, glorify me in your presence with the glory I had with you before the world began.
43:17:6/I have revealed your name to those you gave me from the world. They were yours; you gave them to me and they have obeyed your word.
43:17:7/Now they know that everything you have given me comes from you.
43:17:8/For I gave them the words you gave me and they accepted them. They knew with certainty that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.
43:17:9/I pray for them. I am not praying for the world, but for those you have given me, for they are yours.
43:17:10/All I have is yours, and all you have is mine. And glory has come to me through them.
43:17:11/I will remain in the world no longer, but they are still in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them by the power of your name, the name you gave me, so that they may be one as we are one.
43:17:12/While I was with them, I protected them and kept them safe by that name you gave me. None has been lost except the one doomed to destruction so that Scripture would be fulfilled.
43:17:13/I am coming to you now, but I say these things while I am still in the world, so that they may have the full measure of my joy within them.
43:17:14/I have given them your word and the world has hated them, for they are not of the world any more than I am of the world.
43:17:15/My prayer is not that you take them out of the world but that you protect them from the evil one.
43:17:16/They are not of the world, just as I am not of it.
43:17:17/Make them holy through your truth; your word is truth.
43:17:18/Just as you sent me into the world, I have sent them into the world.
43:17:19/And for their sake, I consecrate myself, that they too may be truly consecrated.
43:17:20/I do not ask for these only, but also for those who will believe in me through their message,
43:17:21/that all of them may be one, Father, just as you are in me and I am in you. May they also be in us so that the world may believe that you have sent me.
43:17:22/I have given them the glory that you gave me, that they may be one as we are one—
43:17:23/I in them and you in me—so that they may be brought to complete unity. Then the world will know that you sent me and have loved them even as you have loved me.
43:17:24/Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, and to see my glory, the glory you have given me because you loved me before the creation of the world.
43:17:25/Righteous Father, though the world does not know you, I know you, and they know that you have sent me.
43:17:26/I have made your name known to them and will continue to make it known in order that the love you have for me may be in them and that I myself may be in them."
43:18:1/After Jesus had said these things, he went out with his disciples across the Kidron Valley, where there was a garden he and his disciples went into.
43:18:2/Judas, the one who would betray him, also knew the place because Jesus often met there with his disciples.
43:18:3/So Judas, getting a group of soldiers and some officials from the chief priests and the Pharisees, approached with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
43:18:4/Jesus, knowing everything that was going to happen to him, stepped forward and asked them, "Who are you looking for?"
43:18:5/They replied, "Jesus of Nazareth." Jesus told them, "I am he." Judas, who betrayed him, was standing with them.
43:18:6/When Jesus said, "I am he," they drew back and fell to the ground.
43:18:7/He asked them again, "Who are you looking for?" And they said, "Jesus of Nazareth."
43:18:8/Jesus responded, "I already told you that I am he. So, if you're looking for me, let these others go."
43:18:9/This was to fulfill what he had said, "I have not lost any of those you gave me."
43:18:10/Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the high priest's servant, cutting off his right ear. The servant's name was Malchus.
43:18:11/Jesus then said to Peter, "Put your sword back in its place. Shouldn't I drink the cup my Father has given me?"
43:18:12/So the soldiers, their commander, and the Jewish officials arrested Jesus and tied him up.
43:18:13/They first took him to Annas, who was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.
43:18:14/Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jews that it would be good if one man died for the people.
43:18:15/Simon Peter and another disciple followed Jesus. This disciple was known to the high priest and went with Jesus into the high priest's courtyard.
43:18:16/But Peter had to stay outside at the door. The other disciple, who was known to the high priest, came back, spoke to the servant girl on duty there, and brought Peter in.
43:18:17/Then the servant girl at the door said to Peter, "Aren't you one of this man's disciples?" He said, "I am not."
43:18:18/Now the servants and officials had made a charcoal fire because it was cold, and they were standing around it warming themselves. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.
43:18:19/The high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and his teachings.
43:18:20/Jesus answered, "I have spoken openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues or at the temple, where all the Jews come together. I said nothing in secret.
43:18:21/Why question me? Ask those who heard me. Surely they know what I said."
43:18:22/When he said this, one of the officials nearby slapped Jesus in the face, saying, "Is that how you answer the high priest?"
43:18:23/Jesus replied, "If I said something wrong, testify as to what is wrong. But if I spoke the truth, why did you hit me?"
43:18:24/Then Annas sent him, still bound, to Caiaphas the high priest.
43:18:25/As Simon Peter stood warming himself, they asked him, "Aren't you one of his disciples?" He denied it, saying, "I am not."
43:18:26/One of the high priest's servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, challenged him, "Didn't I see you with him in the garden?"
43:18:27/Again Peter denied it, and at that moment a rooster began to crow.
43:18:28/Then they took Jesus from Caiaphas to the governor's palace. It was early morning, and they did not enter the palace themselves to avoid ceremonial uncleanness, so they could eat the Passover.
43:18:29/So Pilate came out to them and asked, "What charges are you bringing against this man?"
43:18:30/They answered, "If he were not a criminal, we would not have handed him over to you."
43:18:31/Pilate said to them, "Take him yourselves and judge him by your own law." But the Jews replied, "We are not permitted to execute anyone."
43:18:32/This happened so that the words Jesus had spoken indicating the kind of death he was going to die would be fulfilled.
43:18:33/Then Pilate went back inside the palace, summoned Jesus and asked him, "Are you the king of the Jews?"
43:18:34/Jesus replied, "Is that your own idea, or did others talk to you about me?"
43:18:35/Pilate answered, "Am I a Jew? Your own people and chief priests handed you over to me. What have you done?"
43:18:36/Jesus said, "My kingdom is not of this world. If it were, my servants would fight to prevent my arrest by the Jewish leaders. But now my kingdom is from another place."
43:18:37/So Pilate asked him, "You are a king, then?" Jesus answered, "You say that I am a king. For this reason I was born, and for this I came into the world, to testify to the truth. Everyone on the side of truth listens to me."
43:18:38/Pilate asked him, "What is truth?" After he had said this, he went out again to the Jews and told them, "I find no basis for a charge against him."
43:18:39/"But you have a custom that I release one prisoner at the Passover. Do you want me to release the king of the Jews?"
43:18:40/They shouted back, "Not this man, but Barabbas!" Now Barabbas was a bandit.
43:19:1/Then Pilate took Jesus and whipped him.
43:19:2/The soldiers twisted a crown of thorns, placed it on his head, and dressed him in a purple robe.
43:19:3/They greeted him, "Hail, King of the Jews!" and slapped him across the face.
43:19:4/Pilate came out again and said to them, "Look, I am bringing him out to you to make it clear that I find no basis for a charge against him."
43:19:5/So Jesus came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said to them, "Here is the man!"
43:19:6/When the chief priests and their officials saw him, they shouted, "Crucify him, crucify him!" Pilate responded, "Take him yourselves and crucify him. I find no basis for a charge against him."
43:19:7/The Jews replied, "We have a law, and according to that law, he must die because he claimed to be the Son of God."
43:19:8/When Pilate heard this, he became even more frightened.
43:19:9/He went back inside the palace and asked Jesus, "Where do you come from?" But Jesus did not give him an answer.
43:19:10/Pilate then said to him, "Aren't you going to speak to me? Don't you realize I have the power to free you or to crucify you?"
43:19:11/Jesus answered, "You would have no power over me if it were not given to you from above. Therefore, the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin."
43:19:12/From then on, Pilate tried to release him, but the Jews kept shouting, "If you let this man go, you are no friend of Caesar. Anyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar."
43:19:13/When Pilate heard this, he brought Jesus out and sat down on the judge's seat at a place known as the Stone Pavement (which in Aramaic is Gabbatha).
43:19:14/It was the day of Preparation of the Passover; it was about noon. He said to the Jews, "Here is your king!"
43:19:15/But they shouted, "Take him away! Take him away! Crucify him!" Pilate asked them, "Shall I crucify your king?" The chief priests answered, "We have no king but Caesar."
43:19:16/So Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified. Then they took Jesus away.
43:19:17/Carrying his own cross, he went out to the place of the Skull (which in Aramaic is called Golgotha).
43:19:18/There they crucified him, and with him two others—one on each side and Jesus in the middle.
43:19:19/Pilate had a notice prepared and fastened to the cross. It read: JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
43:19:20/Many of the Jews read this sign, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the sign was written in Aramaic, Latin, and Greek.
43:19:21/The chief priests of the Jews protested to Pilate, "Do not write 'The King of the Jews,' but that this man claimed to be king of the Jews."
43:19:22/Pilate answered, "What I have written, I have written."
43:19:23/After they crucified Jesus, the soldiers took his clothes, dividing them into four shares, one for each of them, with the undergarment remaining. This garment was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.
43:19:24/So they said to one another, "Let's not tear it. Let's decide by lot who will get it." This happened that the scripture might be fulfilled that said, "They divided my clothes among them and cast lots for my garment." So this is what the soldiers did.
43:19:25/Near the cross of Jesus stood his mother, his mother's sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
43:19:26/When Jesus saw his mother there, and the disciple whom he loved standing nearby, he said to his mother, "Dear woman, here is your son,"
43:19:27/and to the disciple, "Here is your mother." From that time on, this disciple took her into his home.
43:19:28/After this, Jesus, knowing that everything had now been finished, and to fulfill Scripture, said, "I am thirsty."
43:19:29/A jar of wine vinegar was there, so they soaked a sponge in it, put the sponge on a stalk of the hyssop plant, and lifted it to Jesus' lips.
43:19:30/When he had received the drink, Jesus said, "It is completed." Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.
43:19:31/Since it was the day of Preparation, and so that the bodies would not remain on the cross during the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special day), the Jews asked Pilate to have the legs broken and the bodies removed.
43:19:32/The soldiers therefore came and broke the legs of the first man who had been crucified with Jesus, and then those of the other.
43:19:33/But when they came to Jesus and found that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
43:19:34/Instead, one of the soldiers pierced Jesus' side with a spear, bringing a sudden flow of blood and water.
43:19:35/The man who saw it has given testimony, and his testimony is true. He knows he tells the truth, and he testifies so that you also may believe.
43:19:36/These things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled: "Not one of his bones will be broken,"
43:19:37/and, as another scripture says, "They will look on the one they have pierced."
43:19:38/Later, Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate for the body of Jesus. Now Joseph was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly because he feared the Jewish leaders. With Pilate's permission, he came and took the body away.
43:19:39/Nicodemus, who had first come to Jesus at night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, weighing about seventy-five pounds.
43:19:40/They took the body of Jesus and wrapped it with the spices in linen cloths, according to the burial custom of the Jews.
43:19:41/At the place where Jesus was crucified, there was a garden, and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had ever been laid.
43:19:42/Because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and since the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.
43:20:1/On the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene came early to the tomb while it was still dark and saw that the stone had been removed from the entrance.
43:20:2/She then ran to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, and told them, "They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don't know where they have put him."
43:20:3/Peter and the other disciple started out and went toward the tomb.
43:20:4/They both ran, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.
43:20:5/He bent over and looked in at the linen wrappings lying there, but he did not go in.
43:20:6/Then Simon Peter came along behind him and went straight into the tomb. He saw the linen wrappings lying there,
43:20:7/and the cloth that had been wrapped around Jesus' head was not lying with the linen wrappings but was folded up in a place by itself.
43:20:8/Then the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also went inside. He saw and believed.
43:20:9/At that time they still did not understand from Scripture that Jesus had to rise from the dead.
43:20:10/Then the disciples went back to where they were staying.
43:20:11/But Mary stood outside the tomb crying. As she wept, she bent over to look into the tomb
43:20:12/and saw two angels in white, seated where Jesus' body had been, one at the head and the other at the foot.
43:20:13/They asked her, "Woman, why are you crying?" She replied, "They have taken my Lord away, and I don't know where they have put him."
43:20:14/After she said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not realize that it was Jesus.
43:20:15/Jesus asked her, "Woman, why are you crying? Who are you looking for?" Thinking he was the gardener, she said, "Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will get him."
43:20:16/Jesus said to her, "Mary." She turned toward him and cried out in Aramaic, "Rabboni!" (which means "Teacher").
43:20:17/Jesus told her, "Do not hold on to me, for I have not yet ascended to the Father. Go instead to my brothers and tell them, 'I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.'"
43:20:18/Mary Magdalene went to the disciples with the news: "I have seen the Lord!" And she told them that he had said these things to her.
43:20:19/On the evening of that first day of the week, when the disciples were together, with the doors locked for fear of the Jewish leaders, Jesus came and stood among them and said, "Peace be with you!"
43:20:20/After he said this, he showed them his hands and side. The disciples were overjoyed when they saw the Lord.
43:20:21/Again Jesus said, "Peace be with you! As the Father has sent me, I am sending you."
43:20:22/And with that, he breathed on them and said, "Receive the Holy Spirit.
43:20:23/If you forgive anyone's sins, their sins are forgiven; if you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven."
43:20:24/Now Thomas (also known as Didymus), one of the Twelve, was not with the disciples when Jesus came.
43:20:25/So the other disciples told him, "We have seen the Lord!" But he said to them, "Unless I see the nail marks in his hands and put my finger where the nails were, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe."
43:20:26/A week later his disciples were in the house again, and Thomas was with them. Though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, "Peace be with you!"
43:20:27/Then he said to Thomas, "Put your finger here; see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe."
43:20:28/Thomas said to him, "My Lord and my God!"
43:20:29/Then Jesus told him, "Because you have seen me, you have believed; blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed."
43:20:30/Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not recorded in this book.
43:20:31/But these are written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
43:21:1/After these events, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples by the Sea of Tiberias; he revealed himself in this way.
43:21:2/Simon Peter, Thomas (also known as Didymus), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples were all together.
43:21:3/Simon Peter said to them, "I'm going fishing." They replied, "We'll come with you." So they went out and got into the boat, but that night they didn't catch anything.
43:21:4/But as dawn broke, Jesus stood on the shore; however, the disciples didn't realize it was Jesus.
43:21:5/Then Jesus called out to them, "Friends, do you have any fish?" They answered, "No."
43:21:6/He told them, "Throw your net on the right side of the boat, and you'll find some." So they did, and they were unable to haul the net in because of the large number of fish.
43:21:7/Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, "It's the Lord!" When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment (for he had taken it off) and jumped into the water.
43:21:8/The other disciples followed in the boat, towing the net full of fish, for they were not far from shore, about a hundred yards.
43:21:9/When they landed, they saw a fire of burning coals there with fish on it, and some bread.
43:21:10/Jesus said to them, "Bring some of the fish you've just caught."
43:21:11/Simon Peter climbed back into the boat and dragged the net ashore. It was full of large fish, 153, but even with so many the net was not torn.
43:21:12/Jesus invited them, "Come and have breakfast." None of the disciples dared to ask him, "Who are you?" They knew it was the Lord.
43:21:13/Jesus came, took the bread and gave it to them, and did the same with the fish.
43:21:14/This was the third time Jesus appeared to his disciples after he was raised from the dead.
43:21:15/After they had eaten, Jesus said to Simon Peter, "Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these?" He answered, "Yes, Lord, you know that I love you." Jesus said, "Take care of my lambs."
43:21:16/He then asked him a second time, "Simon, son of John, do you love me?" He answered, "Yes, Lord, you know that I love you." Jesus said, "Shepherd my sheep."
43:21:17/He asked him the third time, "Simon, son of John, do you love me?" Peter was hurt because Jesus asked him the third time, "Do you love me?" He said, "Lord, you know everything; you know that I love you." Jesus said, "Feed my sheep."
43:21:18/Truly, I tell you, when you were younger, you dressed yourself and went where you wanted; but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will dress you and lead you where you do not want to go."
43:21:19/He said this to indicate the kind of death by which Peter would glorify God. After saying this, he told him, "Follow me."
43:21:20/Then Peter, turning around, saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them; this was the one who had leaned back against Jesus at the supper and had asked, "Lord, who is going to betray you?"
43:21:21/Seeing him, Peter asked Jesus, "Lord, what about him?"
43:21:22/Jesus answered, "If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you? You must follow me."
43:21:23/Because of this, the rumor spread among the brothers that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, "If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you?"
43:21:24/This is the disciple who testifies to these things and who wrote them down. We know that his testimony is true.
43:21:25/There are also many other things that Jesus did. If every one of them were written down, I suppose that even the whole world would not have room for the books that would be written. Amen.
44:1:1/The first account I wrote, O Theophilus, covered everything Jesus began to do and teach,
44:1:2/until the day he was taken up to heaven, after giving instructions through the Holy Spirit to the apostles he had chosen.
44:1:3/He also presented himself alive to them after his suffering by many convincing proofs, appearing to them over a period of forty days and talking about the kingdom of God.
44:1:4/While meeting with them, he instructed them not to leave Jerusalem, but to wait for the Father's promise, which, he said, "you have heard from me."
44:1:5/John baptized with water, but in a few days you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.
44:1:6/So when they met together, they asked him, "Lord, are you at this time going to restore the kingdom to Israel?"
44:1:7/He told them, "It's not for you to know the times or dates the Father has set by his own authority.
44:1:8/But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth."
44:1:9/After he said this, he was taken up before their very eyes, and a cloud hid him from their sight.
44:1:10/As they were looking intently up into the sky as he was going, suddenly two men dressed in white stood beside them.
44:1:11/They said, "Men of Galilee, why do you stand here looking into the sky? This same Jesus, who has been taken from you into heaven, will come back in the same way you have seen him go into heaven."
44:1:12/Then they returned to Jerusalem from the hill called the Mount of Olives, a Sabbath day's walk from the city.
44:1:13/When they arrived, they went upstairs to the room where they were staying. Present were Peter, John, James and Andrew; Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew; James son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas son of James.
44:1:14/They all joined together constantly in prayer, along with the women and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.
44:1:15/During this time, Peter stood up among the believers (a group numbering about a hundred and twenty)
44:1:16/and said, "Brothers and sisters, the Scripture had to be fulfilled in which the Holy Spirit spoke long ago through David concerning Judas, who served as guide for those who arrested Jesus.
44:1:17/He was one of our number and shared in our ministry."
44:1:18/This man bought a field with the wages of his wickedness; and falling headfirst, he burst open in the middle, and all his intestines spilled out.
44:1:19/This became known to all the residents of Jerusalem, so that the field was called in their language Akeldama, that is, Field of Blood.
44:1:20/"For," said Peter, "it is written in the Book of Psalms: 'May his place be deserted; let there be no one to dwell in it,' and, 'May another take his place of leadership.'
44:1:21/Therefore, it is necessary to choose one of the men who have been with us the whole time the Lord Jesus was living among us,
44:1:22/from John's baptism to the time when Jesus was taken up from us. For one of these must become a witness with us of his resurrection."
44:1:23/So they nominated two men: Joseph called Barsabbas (also known as Justus) and Matthias.
44:1:24/Then they prayed, "Lord, you know everyone's heart. Show us which of these two you have chosen
44:1:25/to take over this apostolic ministry, which Judas left to go where he belongs."
44:1:26/Then they cast lots, and the lot fell to Matthias; so he was added to the eleven apostles.
44:2:1/When the day of Pentecost arrived, they were all together in one place.
44:2:2/Suddenly, a sound like a powerful wind came from heaven and filled the entire house where they were sitting.
44:2:3/They saw what seemed to be tongues of fire that separated and came to rest on each of them.
44:2:4/All of them were filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in other languages as the Spirit enabled them.
44:2:5/Now there were staying in Jerusalem God-fearing Jews from every nation under heaven.
44:2:6/When this sound occurred, a crowd came together in bewilderment, because each one heard their own language being spoken.
44:2:7/Amazed and astonished, they asked, "Aren't all these people who are speaking Galileans?
44:2:8/Then how is it that each of us hears them in our native language?
44:2:9/People from Parthia, Media, Elam, residents of Mesopotamia, Judea, Cappadocia, Pontus, Asia,
44:2:10/Phrygia, Pamphylia, Egypt, and the parts of Libya near Cyrene; visitors from Rome (both Jews and converts to Judaism),
44:2:11/Cretans and Arabs—we hear them declaring the wonders of God in our own tongues!"
44:2:12/They were all amazed and perplexed, saying to one another, "What does this mean?"
44:2:13/But some sneered and said, "They've had too much wine."
44:2:14/Then Peter stood up with the Eleven, raised his voice, and addressed the crowd: "Fellow Jews and all of you who live in Jerusalem, let me explain this to you; listen carefully to what I say.
44:2:15/These people are not drunk, as you suppose. It's only nine in the morning!
44:2:16/No, this is what was spoken by the prophet Joel:
44:2:17/'In the last days, God says, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your young men will see visions, your old men will dream dreams.
44:2:18/Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days, and they will prophesy.
44:2:19/I will show wonders in the heavens above and signs on the earth below, blood and fire and billows of smoke.
44:2:20/The sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the coming of the great and glorious day of the Lord.
44:2:21/And everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.'
44:2:22/Fellow Israelites, listen to this: Jesus of Nazareth was a man accredited by God to you by miracles, wonders, and signs, which God did among you through him, as you yourselves know.
44:2:23/This man was handed over to you by God's deliberate plan and foreknowledge; and you, with the help of wicked men, put him to death by nailing him to the cross.
44:2:24/But God raised him from the dead, freeing him from the agony of death, because it was impossible for death to keep its hold on him.
44:2:25/David said about him: 'I saw the Lord always before me. Because he is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
44:2:26/Therefore my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices; my body also will rest in hope,
44:2:27/because you will not abandon me to the realm of the dead, nor will you let your Holy One see decay.
44:2:28/You have made known to me the paths of life; you will fill me with joy in your presence.'
44:2:29/Brothers and sisters, I can tell you confidently that the patriarch David died and was buried, and his tomb is here to this day.
44:2:30/But he was a prophet and knew that God had promised him on oath that he would place one of his descendants on his throne.
44:2:31/Seeing what was to come, he spoke of the resurrection of the Messiah, that he was not abandoned to the realm of the dead, nor did his body see decay.
44:2:32/God has raised this Jesus to life, and we are all witnesses of it.
44:2:33/Exalted to the right hand of God, he has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit and has poured out what you now see and hear.
44:2:34/For David did not ascend to heaven, and yet he said, 'The Lord said to my Lord: "Sit at my right hand
44:2:35/until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet."'
44:2:36/Therefore, let all Israel be assured of this: God has made this Jesus, whom you crucified, both Lord and Messiah.
44:2:37/When the people heard this, they were cut to the heart and said to Peter and the other apostles, "Brothers, what shall we do?"
44:2:38/Peter replied, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
44:2:39/The promise is for you and your children and for all who are far off—for all whom the Lord our God will call."
44:2:40/With many other words he warned them; and he pleaded with them, "Save yourselves from this corrupt generation."
44:2:41/Those who accepted his message were baptized, and about three thousand were added to their number that day.
44:2:42/They devoted themselves to the apostles' teaching and to fellowship, to the breaking of bread and to prayer.
44:2:43/Everyone was filled with awe at the many wonders and signs performed by the apostles.
44:2:44/All the believers were together and had everything in common.
44:2:45/They sold property and possessions to give to anyone who had need.
44:2:46/Every day they continued to meet together in the temple courts. They broke bread in their homes and ate together with glad and sincere hearts,
44:2:47/praising God and enjoying the favor of all the people. And the Lord added to their number daily those who were being saved.
44:3:1/Now Peter and John went up together to the temple at the time of prayer, around three in the afternoon.
44:3:2/There was a man who had been unable to walk since birth, who was carried and placed every day at the temple gate called Beautiful, to ask for money from those entering the temple.
44:3:3/Seeing Peter and John about to enter the temple, he asked them for money.
44:3:4/Peter, with John, looked intently at him and said, "Look at us."
44:3:5/He paid attention to them, expecting to get something from them.
44:3:6/Then Peter said, "I don't have silver or gold, but what I do have, I give you: In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk."
44:3:7/Peter took him by the right hand and helped him up. Instantly the man's feet and ankles became strong.
44:3:8/He jumped to his feet and began to walk. Then he went with them into the temple courts, walking and jumping, and praising God.
44:3:9/All the people saw him walking and praising God.
44:3:10/They recognized him as the same man who used to sit begging at the temple gate called Beautiful, and they were astonished and amazed at what had happened to him.
44:3:11/While the man who had been healed clung to Peter and John, all the people were astonished and came running to them in the place called Solomon's Colonnade.
44:3:12/Seeing this, Peter said to them, "Fellow Israelites, why does this surprise you? Why do you stare at us as if by our own power or godliness we had made this man walk?
44:3:13/The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our ancestors, has glorified his servant Jesus. You handed him over to be killed, and you disowned him before Pilate, even though he had decided to let him go.
44:3:14/You disowned the Holy and Righteous One and asked that a murderer be released to you.
44:3:15/You killed the author of life, but God raised him from the dead. We are witnesses of this.
44:3:16/It is by faith in the name of Jesus that this man whom you see and know was made strong. It is Jesus' name and the faith that comes through him that has completely healed him, as you can all see.
44:3:17/Now, brothers and sisters, I know that you acted in ignorance, as did your leaders.
44:3:18/But this is how God fulfilled what he had foretold through all the prophets, saying that his Messiah would suffer.
44:3:19/Repent, then, and turn to God, so that your sins may be wiped out, that times of refreshing may come from the Lord.
44:3:20/And that he may send the Messiah, who has been appointed for you—even Jesus.
44:3:21/Heaven must receive him until the time comes for God to restore everything, as he promised long ago through his holy prophets.
44:3:22/Moses said, 'The Lord your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your own people; you must listen to everything he tells you.
44:3:23/Anyone who does not listen to him will be completely cut off from their people.'
44:3:24/Indeed, all the prophets from Samuel on, as many as have spoken, have also foretold these days.
44:3:25/You are heirs of the prophets and of the covenant God made with your ancestors. He said to Abraham, 'Through your offspring all peoples on earth will be blessed.'
44:3:26/When God raised up his servant, he sent him first to you to bless you by turning each of you from your wicked ways.
44:4:1/While they were speaking to the people, the priests, the captain of the temple guard, and the Sadducees confronted them,
44:4:2/Upset that they were teaching the people and proclaiming in Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
44:4:3/They arrested them and put them in jail until the next day since it was already evening.
44:4:4/However, many who heard the message believed; and the number of men grew to about five thousand.
44:4:5/The next day, the rulers, elders, and scribes,
44:4:6/Along with Annas the high priest, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and others of the high priest's family, gathered in Jerusalem.
44:4:7/They had them stand in the middle and questioned, "By what power or in what name did you do this?"
44:4:8/Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, said to them, "Leaders of the people and elders of Israel,
44:4:9/If we are being questioned today about a kind act to a disabled man and how he was healed,
44:4:10/Let it be known to all of you and to all the people of Israel that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified but whom God raised from the dead, this man stands before you healed.
44:4:11/This Jesus is 'the stone you builders rejected, which has become the cornerstone.'
44:4:12/And salvation is found in no one else, for there is no other name under heaven given to mankind by which we must be saved."
44:4:13/Seeing the courage of Peter and John and realizing they were unschooled, ordinary men, they were astonished and they recognized that they had been with Jesus.
44:4:14/But seeing the man who had been healed standing with them, they had nothing to say in opposition.
44:4:15/So they ordered them to leave the council and then discussed the matter among themselves,
44:4:16/Saying, "What shall we do with these men? For it's obvious to all living in Jerusalem that a remarkable miracle has been done through them, and we cannot deny it.
44:4:17/But to stop this from spreading any further among the people, let's warn them to speak no longer to anyone in this name."
44:4:18/Then they called them in again and commanded them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Jesus.
44:4:19/But Peter and John replied, "Judge for yourselves whether it is right in God's sight to listen to you rather than to God.
44:4:20/As for us, we cannot help speaking about what we have seen and heard."
44:4:21/After further threats, they let them go. They could not decide how to punish them, because all the people were praising God for what had happened.
44:4:22/For the man who was miraculously healed was over forty years old.
44:4:23/On their release, they went back to their own people and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said to them.
44:4:24/When they heard this, they raised their voices together in prayer to God, "Sovereign Lord, you made the heavens and the earth and the sea, and everything in them.
44:4:25/You spoke by the Holy Spirit through the mouth of your servant, our father David: 'Why do the nations rage and the peoples plot in vain?
44:4:26/The kings of the earth rise up and the rulers band together against the Lord and against his anointed one.'
44:4:27/Indeed Herod and Pontius Pilate met together with the Gentiles and the people of Israel in this city to conspire against your holy servant Jesus, whom you anointed,
44:4:28/To do whatever your hand and your plan had predestined to take place.
44:4:29/Now, Lord, consider their threats and enable your servants to speak your word with great boldness,
44:4:30/Stretch out your hand to heal and perform signs and wonders through the name of your holy servant Jesus."
44:4:31/After they prayed, the place where they were meeting was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God boldly.
44:4:32/The group of believers was of one heart and mind. No one claimed that any of their possessions was their own, but they shared everything they had.
44:4:33/With great power, the apostles continued to testify to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and much grace was upon them all.
44:4:34/There were no needy persons among them. For from time to time those who owned land or houses sold them, brought the money from the sales,
44:4:35/And put it at the apostles' feet, and it was distributed to anyone who had need.
44:4:36/Joseph, a Levite from Cyprus, whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means "son of encouragement"),
44:4:37/Sold a field he owned, brought the money, and laid it at the apostles' feet.
44:5:1/But a man named Ananias, along with his wife Sapphira, sold a property,
44:5:2/And held back part of the money, with his wife's knowledge, and brought only a portion of it and placed it at the apostles' feet.
44:5:3/But Peter said, Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and keep back part of the money from the land?
44:5:4/While you owned it, wasn't it yours to control? And after selling it, wasn't the money at your disposal? Why did you decide to do this? You haven't lied to humans, but to God.
44:5:5/Upon hearing these words, Ananias fell down and died. And a deep fear came over everyone who heard about it.
44:5:6/Then the young men got up, wrapped his body, and carried him out and buried him.
44:5:7/About three hours later, his wife came in, not knowing what had happened.
44:5:8/And Peter asked her, "Tell me, did you sell the land for this amount?" And she said, "Yes, for that amount."
44:5:9/Then Peter said to her, "Why did you agree to test the Spirit of the Lord? Look, the feet of those who buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out as well."
44:5:10/Immediately she fell down at his feet and died. When the young men came in, they found her dead, carried her out, and buried her beside her husband.
44:5:11/And a great fear came over the whole church and all who heard about these events.
44:5:12/Through the apostles, many signs and wonders were performed among the people; and they were all united in Solomon's Colonnade.
44:5:13/Nobody else dared join them, even though they were highly regarded by the people.
44:5:14/More and more believers in the Lord, crowds of both men and women, were added to their number.
44:5:15/As a result, people brought the sick into the streets and laid them on beds and mats so that at least Peter's shadow might fall on some of them as he passed by.
44:5:16/Crowds also came from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing their sick and those tormented by impure spirits, and all of them were healed.
44:5:17/Then the high priest and all his associates, who were members of the party of the Sadducees, were filled with jealousy,
44:5:18/And arrested the apostles and put them in the public jail.
44:5:19/But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the jail and brought them out, saying,
44:5:20/"Go, stand in the temple courts and tell the people all about this new life."
44:5:21/At daybreak they entered the temple courts, as they had been told, and began to teach. But the high priest and his associates arrived and called together the Sanhedrin—the full assembly of the elders of Israel—and sent to the jail for the apostles.
44:5:22/But on arriving at the jail, the officers did not find them there. So they went back and reported,
44:5:23/"We found the jail securely locked, with the guards standing at the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside."
44:5:24/On hearing this report, the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests were puzzled, wondering what this might lead to.
44:5:25/Then someone came and said, "Look! The men you put in jail are standing in the temple courts teaching the people."
44:5:26/At that, the captain went with his officers and brought the apostles. They did not use force, for fear that they might be stoned by the people.
44:5:27/They brought the apostles and made them appear before the Sanhedrin to be questioned by the high priest.
44:5:28/"We gave you strict orders not to teach in this name," he said. "Yet you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and are determined to make us guilty of this man's blood."
44:5:29/Peter and the other apostles replied: "We must obey God rather than human beings!
44:5:30/The God of our ancestors raised Jesus from the dead—whom you killed by hanging him on a cross.
44:5:31/God exalted him at his right hand as Leader and Savior, to give repentance to Israel and forgiveness of sins.
44:5:32/And we are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him."
44:5:33/When they heard this, they were furious and wanted to put them to death.
44:5:34/But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, who was honored by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin and ordered that the men be put outside for a little while.
44:5:35/Then he addressed the Sanhedrin: "Men of Israel, consider carefully what you intend to do to these men.
44:5:36/Some time ago Theudas appeared, claiming to be somebody, and about four hundred men rallied to him. He was killed, all his followers were dispersed, and it all came to nothing.
44:5:37/After him, Judas the Galilean appeared in the days of the census and led a band of people in revolt. He too was killed, and all his followers were scattered.
44:5:38/So in the present case, I advise you: Leave these men alone! Let them go! For if their purpose or activity is of human origin, it will fail.
44:5:39/But if it is from God, you will not be able to stop these men; you will only find yourselves fighting against God."
44:5:40/His speech persuaded them. They called the apostles in and had them flogged. Then they ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
44:5:41/The apostles left the Sanhedrin, rejoicing because they had been counted worthy of suffering disgrace for the Name.
44:5:42/Day after day, in the temple courts and from house to house, they never stopped teaching and proclaiming the good news that Jesus is the Messiah.
44:6:1/In those days, as the number of disciples increased, there was a complaint from the Greek-speaking believers against the Hebrew-speaking believers because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.
44:6:2/So the twelve summoned the entire group of disciples and said, "It's not right for us to neglect the word of God to handle food distribution."
44:6:3/Therefore, brothers, select from among you seven reputable men, filled with the Spirit and wisdom, whom we can appoint to this task.
44:6:4/But we will devote ourselves continuously to prayer and to the ministry of the word.
44:6:5/This proposal pleased the whole group. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and the Holy Spirit, along with Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas from Antioch, a convert to Judaism.
44:6:6/They presented these men to the apostles, who prayed and laid their hands on them.
44:6:7/As a result, the word of God spread, and the number of disciples in Jerusalem increased rapidly, and a large number of priests became obedient to the faith.
44:6:8/And Stephen, brimming with grace and power, performed great wonders and signs among the people.
44:6:9/However, some members of the so-called Synagogue of Freedmen, as well as some from Cyrene, Alexandria, Cilicia, and Asia, began to argue with Stephen.
44:6:10/But they could not stand up against the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke.
44:6:11/Then they secretly persuaded some men to say, "We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses and God."
44:6:12/They stirred up the people, the elders, and the teachers of the law. They seized Stephen and brought him before the Sanhedrin.
44:6:13/They also set up false witnesses who said, "This man never stops speaking against this holy place and the law.
44:6:14/For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and change the traditions Moses handed down to us."
44:6:15/Everyone sitting in the Sanhedrin looked intently at Stephen, and they saw his face was like the face of an angel.
44:7:1/Then the high priest asked, "Is this true?"
44:7:2/He replied, "Listen up, everyone. The glorious God appeared to our ancestor Abraham while he was still in Mesopotamia, before he moved to Haran,
44:7:3/And told him, 'Leave your homeland and your relatives, and go to the land I will show you.'
44:7:4/So he left the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Haran. After his father died, God moved him to this land where you now live.
44:7:5/He didn't give him any property here, not even a foot of ground. But God promised to give it to him and his descendants, even though at that time Abraham had no children.
44:7:6/God explained that Abraham's descendants would live in a foreign land, where they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years.
44:7:7/'But I will judge the nation they serve as slaves,' God said, 'and afterward they will come out and worship me in this place.'
44:7:8/Then God established the covenant of circumcision with Abraham, and so Abraham had Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs.
44:7:9/Because of jealousy, the patriarchs sold Joseph into Egypt. But God was with him,
44:7:10/And rescued him from all his troubles. He granted Joseph favor and wisdom in the eyes of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who appointed him as governor over Egypt and his entire household.
44:7:11/Then a famine spread over all Egypt and Canaan, causing great suffering, and our ancestors couldn't find food.
44:7:12/When Jacob heard there was grain in Egypt, he sent our ancestors there first.
44:7:13/On their second visit, Joseph revealed his identity to his brothers, and Pharaoh learned about Joseph's family.
44:7:14/Then Joseph sent for his father Jacob and his entire family, seventy-five people in all.
44:7:15/So Jacob went down to Egypt, where he and our ancestors died.
44:7:16/Their bodies were taken back to Shechem and placed in the tomb that Abraham had bought from the sons of Hamor at Shechem for a certain amount of money.
44:7:17/As the time drew near for God to fulfill his promise to Abraham, the number of our people in Egypt greatly increased.
44:7:18/Until a new king, who knew nothing about Joseph, came to power in Egypt.
44:7:19/He dealt deceitfully with our people and oppressed our ancestors by forcing them to abandon their newborn babies so they would die.
44:7:20/It was at that time Moses was born, a beautiful child in God's eyes. His parents cared for him at home for three months.
44:7:21/When he was abandoned, Pharaoh's daughter adopted him and brought him up as her own son.
44:7:22/Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in speech and action.
44:7:23/When he was forty years old, he decided to visit his fellow Israelites.
44:7:24/He saw one of them being mistreated, so he defended the oppressed man and avenged him by killing the Egyptian.
44:7:25/He thought his brothers would realize that God was using him to rescue them, but they didn't understand.
44:7:26/The next day he came upon two Israelites who were fighting. He tried to reconcile them by saying, 'Men, you are brothers; why do you want to hurt each other?'
44:7:27/But the man who was mistreating the other pushed Moses aside and said, 'Who appointed you as our ruler and judge?
44:7:28/Are you going to kill me like you killed the Egyptian yesterday?'
44:7:29/When Moses heard this, he fled and became an exile in the land of Midian, where he had two sons.
44:7:30/After forty years had passed, an angel appeared to him in the flames of a burning bush in the desert near Mount Sinai.
44:7:31/When Moses saw it, he was amazed at the sight. As he went over to get a closer look, the Lord's voice called out to him,
44:7:32/Saying, 'I am the God of your ancestors, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.' Moses trembled and didn't dare to look.
44:7:33/Then the Lord said to him, 'Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.
44:7:34/I have indeed seen the oppression of my people in Egypt. I have heard their groaning and have come down to set them free. Now come, I will send you back to Egypt.'
44:7:35/This Moses, whom they rejected by saying, 'Who made you ruler and judge?' is the one God sent to be both ruler and deliverer with the help of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
44:7:36/He led them out of Egypt, performing wonders and signs in Egypt, at the Red Sea, and for forty years in the wilderness.
44:7:37/This is the Moses who told the Israelites, 'God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your own people.'
44:7:38/He was in the assembly in the wilderness, with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our ancestors, and he received living words to pass on to us.
44:7:39/But our ancestors refused to obey him. Instead, they rejected him and in their hearts turned back to Egypt,
44:7:40/Saying to Aaron, 'Make us gods who will go before us. As for this Moses who led us out of Egypt, we don't know what has happened to him.'
44:7:41/That was the time they made an idol in the form of a calf. They offered sacrifices to it and celebrated what their own hands had made.
44:7:42/But God turned away from them and gave them over to worship the celestial bodies, as it is written in the book of the prophets: 'Did you bring me sacrifices and offerings forty years in the wilderness, house of Israel?
44:7:43/You have taken up the tabernacle of Molek and the star of your god Rephan, the idols you made to worship. Therefore, I will send you into exile beyond Babylon.'
44:7:44/Our ancestors had the tent of the testimony in the wilderness, just as the one who spoke to Moses directed him to make it, according to the pattern he had seen.
44:7:45/Our ancestors in turn brought it in with Joshua when they dispossessed the nations that God drove out before our ancestors. It remained until the time of David,
44:7:46/Who found favor in God's sight and asked for the privilege of providing a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.
44:7:47/But it was Solomon who built a house for him.
44:7:48/Yet the Most High does not live in houses made by human hands. As the prophet says,
44:7:49/'Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house will you build for me?' says the Lord. 'Or where will my resting place be?
44:7:50/Have not my hands made all these things?'
44:7:51/You stubborn people! You are uncircumcised in heart and ears! You always resist the Holy Spirit; just as your ancestors did, so do you.
44:7:52/Which of the prophets did your ancestors not persecute? They killed those who predicted the coming of the Righteous One. And now you have betrayed and murdered him—
44:7:53/You who received the law as delivered by angels but have not kept it."
44:7:54/When they heard these things, they were furious and gnashed their teeth at him.
44:7:55/But he, full of the Holy Spirit, gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God,
44:7:56/And said, "Look, I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God."
44:7:57/Then they shouted loudly, covered their ears, and all rushed at him together,
44:7:58/They dragged him out of the city and began to stone him. The witnesses laid their coats at the feet of a young man named Saul.
44:7:59/As they stoned Stephen, he called out, "Lord Jesus, receive my spirit."
44:7:60/Then he fell to his knees and cried out loudly, "Lord, do not hold this sin against them." After saying this, he passed away.
44:8:1/Saul approved of his death. At that time, there was intense persecution against the church in Jerusalem, and all except the apostles were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria.
44:8:2/Devout men buried Stephen and mourned deeply for him.
44:8:3/Meanwhile, Saul was devastating the church, entering house after house, dragging off both men and women to prison.
44:8:4/So those who were scattered went about spreading the word everywhere.
44:8:5/Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria and proclaimed the Messiah to them.
44:8:6/The crowds listened intently to Philip, seeing the signs he performed and hearing his message.
44:8:7/Many who were possessed by unclean spirits were freed, with the spirits shouting loudly, and many paralyzed and lame people were healed.
44:8:8/And there was immense joy in that city.
44:8:9/However, a man named Simon had previously practiced sorcery in the city and amazed the people of Samaria, claiming to be someone great.
44:8:10/Everyone from the least to the greatest paid attention to him, saying, "This man is the power of God that is called Great."
44:8:11/They listened to him because for a long time he had amazed them with his sorceries.
44:8:12/But when they believed Philip as he preached good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
44:8:13/Even Simon himself believed, and after being baptized, he stayed constantly with Philip, astonished by the great signs and miracles he observed.
44:8:14/When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.
44:8:15/They came down and prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit.
44:8:16/(For the Holy Spirit had not yet come on any of them; they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)
44:8:17/Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
44:8:18/When Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles' hands, he offered them money,
44:8:19/Saying, "Give me also this ability so that anyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit."
44:8:20/But Peter told him, "May your money perish with you because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!"
44:8:21/"You have no part or share in this, because your heart is not right before God."
44:8:22/"Repent of this wickedness and pray to the Lord in the hope that he may forgive you for having such a thought in your heart."
44:8:23/"For I see that you are full of bitterness and captive to sin."
44:8:24/Then Simon answered, "Pray to the Lord for me so that nothing you have said may happen to me."
44:8:25/After they had further proclaimed the word of the Lord and testified about Jesus, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel in many Samaritan villages.
44:8:26/An angel of the Lord said to Philip, "Get up and go south to the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza, which is deserted."
44:8:27/He got up and went, and there was an Ethiopian eunuch, a high official of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, in charge of all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship,
44:8:28/And was returning, seated in his chariot, reading the prophet Isaiah.
44:8:29/The Spirit told Philip, "Go to that chariot and stay near it."
44:8:30/So Philip ran up to it and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet. "Do you understand what you are reading?" Philip asked.
44:8:31/"How can I," he said, "unless someone explains it to me?" So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
44:8:32/The passage of Scripture he was reading was this: "He was led like a sheep to the slaughter, and as a lamb before its shearer is silent, so he did not open his mouth."
44:8:33/"In his humiliation, his justice was denied. Who can speak of his descendants? For his life was taken from the earth."
44:8:34/The eunuch asked Philip, "Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?"
44:8:35/Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.
44:8:36/As they traveled along the road, they came to some water and the eunuch said, "Look, here is water. What prevents me from being baptized?"
44:8:37/Philip said, "If you believe with all your heart, you may." He replied, "I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God."
44:8:38/He ordered the chariot to stop, and both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and Philip baptized him.
44:8:39/When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him again, but went on his way rejoicing.
44:8:40/Philip, however, appeared at Azotus and traveled about, preaching the gospel in all the towns until he reached Caesarea.
44:9:1/And Saul, still furiously threatening and planning to kill the Lord's disciples, went to the high priest,
44:9:2/And asked him for letters to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found anyone following this way, whether men or women, he could take them as prisoners to Jerusalem.
44:9:3/As he was traveling, he got close to Damascus: and suddenly a light from heaven shone around him.
44:9:4/He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him, "Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?"
44:9:5/He asked, "Who are you, Lord?" And the Lord replied, "I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting: it's futile for you to resist me."
44:9:6/Trembling and astonished, he asked, "Lord, what do you want me to do?" The Lord told him, "Get up, and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do."
44:9:7/The men traveling with him stood speechless, hearing the voice but seeing no one.
44:9:8/Saul got up from the ground; but when he opened his eyes, he couldn't see anything. So they led him by the hand into Damascus.
44:9:9/He was blind for three days and didn't eat or drink anything.
44:9:10/In Damascus, there was a disciple named Ananias. The Lord called to him in a vision, "Ananias." He answered, "Here I am, Lord."
44:9:11/The Lord told him, "Get up, and go to the street called Straight, and ask in the house of Judas for a man named Saul, from Tarsus. Right now, he is praying,
44:9:12/And he has seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in and placing his hands on him so that he might regain his sight."
44:9:13/But Ananias replied, "Lord, I've heard from many about this man and all the harm he has done to your holy people in Jerusalem.
44:9:14/And he has authority here from the chief priests to arrest all who call on your name."
44:9:15/But the Lord said to him, "Go, for he is my chosen instrument to proclaim my name to the Gentiles, kings, and the people of Israel.
44:9:16/I will show him how much he must suffer for my name."
44:9:17/So Ananias went and entered the house; placing his hands on Saul, he said, "Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit."
44:9:18/Immediately, something like scales fell from Saul's eyes, and he could see again. He got up, was baptized,
44:9:19/And after eating, he regained his strength. Saul spent several days with the disciples in Damascus.
44:9:20/Right away he began to preach in the synagogues that Jesus is the Son of God.
44:9:21/Everyone who heard him was astonished and asked, "Isn't this the man who raised havoc in Jerusalem among those who call on this name? And hasn't he come here to take them as prisoners to the chief priests?"
44:9:22/But Saul grew more and more powerful and baffled the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Messiah.
44:9:23/After many days had gone by, the Jews conspired to kill him,
44:9:24/But Saul learned of their plan. Day and night they kept close watch on the city gates in order to kill him.
44:9:25/But his followers took him by night and lowered him in a basket through an opening in the wall.
44:9:26/When he came to Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he really was a disciple.
44:9:27/But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles. He told them how Saul on his journey had seen the Lord and that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had preached fearlessly in the name of Jesus.
44:9:28/So Saul stayed with them and moved about freely in Jerusalem, speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.
44:9:29/He talked and debated with the Hellenistic Jews, but they tried to kill him.
44:9:30/When the brothers learned of this, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.
44:9:31/Then the churches throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria had a time of peace and were strengthened. Living in the fear of the Lord and encouraged by the Holy Spirit, they increased in numbers.
44:9:32/As Peter traveled about the country, he went to visit the Lord's people who lived in Lydda.
44:9:33/There he found a man named Aeneas, who had been bedridden for eight years and was paralyzed.
44:9:34/Peter said to him, "Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and take care of your mat." Immediately Aeneas got up.
44:9:35/All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
44:9:36/In Joppa, there was a disciple named Tabitha (which, when translated, is Dorcas), who was always doing good and helping the poor.
44:9:37/About that time she became sick and died, and her body was washed and placed in an upstairs room.
44:9:38/Lydda was near Joppa; so when the disciples heard that Peter was in Lydda, they sent two men to him and urged him, "Please come at once!"
44:9:39/Peter went with them, and when he arrived, they took him to the room upstairs. All the widows stood around him, crying and showing him the robes and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.
44:9:40/But Peter sent them all out of the room; then he got down on his knees and prayed. Turning toward the dead woman, he said, "Tabitha, get up." She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter she sat up.
44:9:41/He took her by the hand and helped her to her feet. Then he called for the believers, especially the widows, and presented her to them alive.
44:9:42/This became known all over Joppa, and many people believed in the Lord.
44:9:43/Peter stayed in Joppa for some time with a tanner named Simon.
44:10:1/In Caesarea, there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in the Italian Regiment,
44:10:2/He was deeply religious and revered God along with his entire household. He generously helped the needy and always prayed to God.
44:10:3/Around three in the afternoon, he clearly saw in a vision an angel of God coming to him and calling his name, "Cornelius."
44:10:4/Startled, he asked, "What is it, Lord?" The angel replied, "Your prayers and gifts to the poor have ascended as a memorial before God.
44:10:5/Now, send some men to Joppa to bring back a man named Simon, who is also called Peter.
44:10:6/He is staying with Simon the tanner, whose house is by the sea."
44:10:7/After the angel who spoke to him had gone, Cornelius called two of his servants and a devout soldier from among his attendants,
44:10:8/and after explaining everything to them, he sent them to Joppa.
44:10:9/The next day, as they were on their journey and approaching the city, Peter went up on the roof to pray around noon.
44:10:10/He became very hungry and wanted something to eat. While the meal was being prepared, he fell into a trance.
44:10:11/He saw the sky open and something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners.
44:10:12/It contained all kinds of four-footed animals, as well as reptiles and birds.
44:10:13/Then a voice told him, "Get up, Peter. Kill and eat."
44:10:14/But Peter said, "Certainly not, Lord! I have never eaten anything impure or unclean."
44:10:15/The voice spoke to him a second time, "Do not call anything impure that God has made clean."
44:10:16/This happened three times, and immediately the sheet was taken back to heaven.
44:10:17/While Peter was still thinking about the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found out where Simon's house was and stopped at the gate.
44:10:18/They called out, asking if Simon who was known as Peter was staying there.
44:10:19/While Peter was reflecting on the vision, the Spirit said to him, "Look, three men are looking for you.
44:10:20/So get up and go downstairs. Do not hesitate to go with them, for I have sent them."
44:10:21/Peter went down and said to the men, "I'm the one you're looking for. Why have you come?"
44:10:22/They replied, "Cornelius the centurion, a righteous and God-fearing man, who is respected by all the Jewish people, was directed by a holy angel to summon you to his house and to hear what you have to say."
44:10:23/So Peter invited them in and gave them lodging. The next day he went with them, accompanied by some of the believers from Joppa.
44:10:24/They arrived in Caesarea the following day. Cornelius was expecting them and had gathered his relatives and close friends.
44:10:25/As Peter entered, Cornelius met him, fell at his feet, and worshiped him.
44:10:26/But Peter helped him up, saying, "Stand up; I am only a man myself."
44:10:27/Talking with him, Peter went inside and found a large gathering of people.
44:10:28/He said to them, "You are aware that it is against our law for a Jew to associate with or visit a Gentile. But God has shown me that I should not call anyone impure or unclean.
44:10:29/So when I was sent for, I came without raising any objection. May I ask why you sent for me?"
44:10:30/Cornelius answered, "Four days ago, I was praying in my house at this hour, at three in the afternoon. Suddenly, a man in shining clothes stood before me
44:10:31/and said, 'Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your acts of charity have been remembered before God.
44:10:32/Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter. He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner, who lives by the sea.'
44:10:33/So I sent for you immediately, and it was good of you to come. Now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to tell us."
44:10:34/Then Peter began to speak: "I now realize how true it is that God does not show favoritism
44:10:35/but accepts from every nation the one who fears him and does what is right.
44:10:36/You know the message God sent to the people of Israel, announcing the good news of peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all.
44:10:37/You know what has happened throughout the province of Judea, beginning in Galilee after the baptism that John preached—
44:10:38/how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and power, and how he went around doing good and healing all who were under the power of the devil, because God was with him.
44:10:39/We are witnesses of everything he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem. They killed him by hanging him on a cross,
44:10:40/but God raised him from the dead on the third day and caused him to be seen.
44:10:41/He was not seen by all the people, but by witnesses whom God had already chosen—by us who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead.
44:10:42/He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that he is the one whom God appointed as judge of the living and the dead.
44:10:43/All the prophets testify about him that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name."
44:10:44/While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit came on all who heard the message.
44:10:45/The circumcised believers who had come with Peter were amazed that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on Gentiles.
44:10:46/For they heard them speaking in tongues and praising God. Then Peter said,
44:10:47/"Surely no one can stand in the way of their being baptized with water. They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have."
44:10:48/So he ordered that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked Peter to stay with them for a few days.
44:11:1/The apostles and believers in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also accepted God's message.
44:11:2/When Peter arrived in Jerusalem, those who were circumcised argued with him,
44:11:3/They said, "You went into the homes of uncircumcised men and ate with them."
44:11:4/But Peter explained the situation from the start, detailing it step by step to them, saying,
44:11:5/"I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance, I saw a vision. A large sheet was being lowered from heaven by its four corners, and it came down to me.
44:11:6/When I looked closely, I saw four-footed animals, wild beasts, reptiles, and birds of the sky.
44:11:7/Then I heard a voice telling me, 'Get up, Peter; kill and eat.'
44:11:8/But I replied, 'Certainly not, Lord! Nothing impure or unclean has ever entered my mouth.'
44:11:9/But the voice from heaven spoke again, 'Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.'
44:11:10/This happened three times, and then everything was pulled back up into heaven.
44:11:11/Right then, three men who had been sent to me from Caesarea arrived at the house where I was staying.
44:11:12/The Spirit told me to go with them without hesitation. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man's house.
44:11:13/He told us how he had seen an angel standing in his house, saying, 'Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter.
44:11:14/He will bring you a message through which you and your entire household will be saved.'
44:11:15/As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit came on them, just as on us at the beginning.
44:11:16/Then I remembered what the Lord had said: 'John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.'
44:11:17/So if God gave them the same gift he gave us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to think that I could stand in God's way?"
44:11:18/When they heard this, they stopped objecting and praised God, saying, "So then, God has also granted the Gentiles the repentance that leads to life."
44:11:19/Those who had been scattered by the persecution that broke out when Stephen was killed traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, spreading the word only among Jews.
44:11:20/Some of them, however, men from Cyprus and Cyrene, went to Antioch and began to speak to Greeks also, telling them the good news about the Lord Jesus.
44:11:21/The Lord's hand was with them, and a large number of people believed and turned to the Lord.
44:11:22/News of this reached the church in Jerusalem, and they sent Barnabas to Antioch.
44:11:23/When he arrived and saw what the grace of God had done, he was glad and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with all their hearts.
44:11:24/He was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and faith, and a great number of people were brought to the Lord.
44:11:25/Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,
44:11:26/and when he found him, he brought him to Antioch. So for a whole year, Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught great numbers of people. The disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.
44:11:27/During this time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
44:11:28/One of them, named Agabus, stood up and through the Spirit predicted that a severe famine would spread over the entire Roman world. (This happened during the reign of Claudius.)
44:11:29/The disciples, as each one was able, decided to provide help for the brothers and sisters living in Judea.
44:11:30/This they did, sending their gift to the elders by Barnabas and Saul.
44:12:1/Around that time, King Herod aggressively targeted members of the church.
44:12:2/He executed James, the brother of John, by the sword.
44:12:3/Seeing that this pleased the Jewish leaders, he went on to arrest Peter as well. This happened during the Festival of Unleavened Bread.
44:12:4/After capturing him, Herod put Peter in prison, handing him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him, planning to present him to the public after Passover.
