45:1:20/For since the creation of the world God's invisible qualities—his eternal power and divine nature—have been clearly seen, being understood from what has been made, so that people are without excuse.
45:1:21/Because although they knew God, they did not honor him as God or give thanks, but they became futile in their thinking, and their foolish hearts were darkened.
45:1:22/Claiming to be wise, they became fools,
45:1:23/And exchanged the glory of the immortal God for images resembling mortal man, birds, four-footed animals, and reptiles.
45:1:24/Therefore, God gave them over in the desires of their hearts to impurity, to dishonor their bodies among themselves:
45:1:25/Who exchanged the truth about God for a lie, and worshiped and served created things rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.
45:1:26/For this reason, God gave them over to dishonorable passions. For their women exchanged natural relations for those that are contrary to nature;
45:1:27/And in the same way also the men, abandoning natural relations with women, were inflamed with lust for one another; men committing shameful acts with men and receiving in themselves the due penalty for their error.
45:1:28/And just as they did not see fit to acknowledge God, God gave them over to a depraved mind, to do what should not be done;
45:1:29/They were filled with all manner of unrighteousness, evil, greed, malice. They are full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, maliciousness. They are gossips,
45:1:30/Slanderers, God-haters, insolent, arrogant, boastful, inventors of evil, disobedient to parents,
45:1:31/Without understanding, covenant breakers, heartless, ruthless.
45:1:32/Although they know God's righteous decree that those who do such things deserve death, they not only continue to do these very things but also approve of those who practice them.
45:2:1/So, you have no excuse, whoever you are, when you judge others. Because in passing judgment on someone else, you condemn yourself, since you, the judge, do the same things.
45:2:2/But we are confident that God's judgment is based on truth against those who do such things.
45:2:3/Do you think, then, that you can judge those who do such things and do the same yourself, that you will escape God's judgment?
45:2:4/Or do you look down on the wealth of His kindness, tolerance, and patience, not realizing that God's kindness is intended to lead you to repentance?
45:2:5/But because of your stubbornness and your unrepentant heart, you are storing up wrath for yourself on the day of wrath when God's righteous judgment will be revealed.
45:2:6/He will repay each person according to what they have done:
45:2:7/To those who by persistence in doing good seek glory, honor, and immortality, He will give eternal life.
45:2:8/But for those who are self-seeking and who reject the truth and follow evil, there will be wrath and anger.
45:2:9/Trouble and distress will come upon every human being who does evil, first to the Jew, then to the Gentile;
45:2:10/But glory, honor, and peace for everyone who does good, first for the Jew, then for the Gentile.
45:2:11/For God does not show favoritism.
45:2:12/All who sin apart from the law will also perish apart from the law, and all who sin under the law will be judged by the law.
45:2:13/It is not those who hear the law who are righteous in God's sight, but it is those who obey the law who will be declared righteous.
45:2:14/Indeed, when Gentiles, who do not have the law, do by nature things required by the law, they are a law for themselves, even though they do not have the law.
45:2:15/They show that the requirements of the law are written on their hearts, their consciences also bearing witness, and their thoughts sometimes accusing them and at other times even defending them.
45:2:16/This will take place on the day when God judges people's secrets through Jesus Christ, as my gospel declares.
45:2:17/Now if you call yourself a Jew and rely on the law and boast about your relationship with God,
45:2:18/And know His will and approve of what is superior because you are instructed by the law;
45:2:19/If you are convinced that you are a guide for the blind, a light for those who are in the dark,
45:2:20/An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of little children, because you have in the law the embodiment of knowledge and truth—
45:2:21/You then, who teach others, do you not teach yourself? You who preach against stealing, do you steal?
45:2:22/You who say that people should not commit adultery, do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?
45:2:23/You who boast about the law, do you dishonor God by breaking the law?
45:2:24/As it is written: "God's name is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you."
45:2:25/Circumcision has value if you observe the law, but if you break the law, you have become as though you had not been circumcised.
45:2:26/So then, if those who are not circumcised keep the law's requirements, will they not be regarded as though they were circumcised?
45:2:27/The one who is not circumcised physically and yet obeys the law will condemn you who, even though you have the written code and circumcision, are a lawbreaker.
45:2:28/A person is not a Jew who is one outwardly, nor is circumcision merely outward and physical.
45:2:29/No, a person is a Jew who is one inwardly; and circumcision is circumcision of the heart, by the Spirit, not by the written code. Such a person's praise is not from other people, but from God.
45:3:1/So, what advantage does being Jewish have? Or what's the benefit of circumcision?
45:3:2/There's a lot of advantage in every way. Most importantly, because the Jews were entrusted with the messages of God.
45:3:3/So what if some didn't believe? Does their disbelief nullify God's faithfulness?
45:3:4/Absolutely not: indeed, let God be recognized as truthful, and every person as a liar; as it is stated, "So that you may be proved right in your words and prevail when you are judged."
45:3:5/But if our wrongdoing highlights the righteousness of God, what can we say? Is God unjust to inflict wrath? (I'm speaking in human terms)
45:3:6/Of course not: for then how could God judge the world?
45:3:7/If my falsehood enhances God's truthfulness to his glory, why am I still condemned as a sinner?
45:3:8/And why not say (as we are wrongly accused and as some claim we say), "Let's do bad things so that good may result"? Their condemnation is deserved.
45:3:9/So, are we any better? Not at all. We have already made the case that both Jews and Gentiles are all under sin;
45:3:10/As it is written, "No one is righteous, not even one;
45:3:11/No one understands, no one seeks God.
45:3:12/All have turned away, they have together become worthless; there is no one who does good, not even one."
45:3:13/"Their throat is an open grave; they use their tongues to deceive." "The venom of snakes is under their lips."
45:3:14/"Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness."
45:3:15/"Their feet are quick to shed blood;
45:3:16/Destruction and misery follow them;
45:3:17/And they do not know the way of peace."
45:3:18/"There is no fear of God before their eyes."
45:3:19/Now we know that whatever the law says, it speaks to those who are under the law, so that every mouth may be silenced and the whole world held accountable to God.
45:3:20/Therefore, no one will be declared righteous in God's sight by the works of the law; rather, through the law we become conscious of our sin.
45:3:21/But now, apart from the law, the righteousness of God has been made known, witnessed by the Law and the Prophets,
45:3:22/This righteousness from God comes through faith in Jesus Christ to all who believe. There is no difference,
45:3:23/For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God,
45:3:24/And are justified freely by his grace through the redemption that came by Christ Jesus.
45:3:25/God presented Christ as a sacrifice of atonement, through faith in his blood. He did this to demonstrate his righteousness, because in his forbearance he had left the sins committed beforehand unpunished—
45:3:26/He did it to demonstrate his righteousness at the present time, so as to be just and the one who justifies those who have faith in Jesus.
45:3:27/Where, then, is boasting? It is excluded. On what principle? On that of observing the law? No, but on that of faith.
45:3:28/So we maintain that a person is justified by faith apart from the works of the law.
45:3:29/Is God only the God of the Jews? Isn't he also the God of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles too,
45:3:30/Since there is only one God, who will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through that same faith.
45:3:31/Do we, then, nullify the law by this faith? Not at all! Rather, we uphold the law.
45:4:1/What then can we say Abraham, our ancestor according to the flesh, discovered?
45:4:2/For if Abraham was justified by actions, he had something to boast about, but not before God.
45:4:3/What does the scripture say? Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness.
45:4:4/Now to the one who works, the wages are not considered a gift, but something owed.
45:4:5/But to the one who does not work, but believes in the one who justifies the wicked, their faith is credited as righteousness.
45:4:6/Just as David also speaks of the blessing of the person to whom God credits righteousness apart from works,
45:4:7/Saying, "Blessed are those whose wrongdoings are forgiven, and whose sins are covered."
45:4:8/Blessed is the person whom the Lord will not count their sin against.
45:4:9/Is this blessing then only for the circumcised, or also for the uncircumcised? We say that faith was credited to Abraham as righteousness.
45:4:10/How then was it credited? While he was circumcised, or uncircumcised? Not while circumcised, but while uncircumcised.
45:4:11/And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness that he had by faith while he was still uncircumcised. So he is the father of all who believe but are not circumcised, that righteousness might be credited to them as well,
45:4:12/And the father of the circumcised who are not merely circumcised but who also follow in the footsteps of the faith that our father Abraham had before he was circumcised.
45:4:13/For the promise to Abraham or to his descendants that he would be heir of the world was not through the law, but through the righteousness of faith.
45:4:14/For if those who depend on the law are heirs, faith means nothing and the promise is void,
45:4:15/Because the law brings wrath, and where there is no law there is no transgression.
45:4:16/Therefore, the promise comes by faith, so that it may be by grace and may be guaranteed to all Abraham's offspring, not only to those who are of the law but also to those who have the faith of Abraham. He is the father of us all,
45:4:17/As it is written: "I have made you a father of many nations." He is our father in the sight of God, in whom he believed—the God who gives life to the dead and calls into being things that were not.
45:4:18/Against all hope, Abraham in hope believed and so became the father of many nations, just as it had been said to him, "So shall your offspring be."
45:4:19/Without weakening in his faith, he faced the fact that his body was as good as dead—since he was about a hundred years old—and that Sarah's womb was also dead.
45:4:20/Yet he did not waver through disbelief regarding the promise of God, but was strengthened in his faith and gave glory to God,
45:4:21/Being fully convinced that God had the power to do what he had promised.
45:4:22/This is why "it was credited to him as righteousness."
45:4:23/Now the words "it was credited to him" were written not for him alone,
45:4:24/But also for us, to whom God will credit righteousness—for us who believe in him who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead.
45:4:25/He was handed over to die because of our sins, and was raised to life for our justification.
45:5:1/So, being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ.
45:5:2/Through him, we also have access by faith into this grace in which we stand, and we celebrate in hope of the glory of God.
45:5:3/And not only that, but we also take pride in our troubles, knowing that trouble produces endurance.
45:5:4/And endurance produces character, and character produces hope.
45:5:5/And hope does not put us to shame, because God's love has been poured out into our hearts through the Holy Spirit who has been given to us.
45:5:6/For while we were still weak, at the right time Christ died for the ungodly.
45:5:7/It's rare that someone would die for a righteous person, though for a good person someone might possibly dare to die.
45:5:8/But God demonstrates his own love for us in this: While we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
45:5:9/Now that we are justified by his blood, much more shall we be saved from God's wrath through him.
45:5:10/For if, while we were God's enemies, we were reconciled to him through the death of his Son, much more, having been reconciled, shall we be saved through his life.
45:5:11/And not only is this so, but we also boast in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received reconciliation.
45:5:12/Therefore, just as sin entered the world through one man, and death through sin, in this way death came to all people, because all sinned.
45:5:13/For before the law, sin was in the world, but sin is not charged against anyone's account where there is no law.
45:5:14/Yet death reigned from Adam to Moses, even over those who did not sin by breaking a command, as did Adam, who is a pattern of the one to come.
45:5:15/But the gift is not like the trespass. For if the many died by the trespass of the one man, how much more did God's grace and the gift that came by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, overflow to the many!
45:5:16/Nor can the gift of God be compared with the result of one man's sin: The judgment followed one sin and brought condemnation, but the gift followed many trespasses and brought justification.
45:5:17/For if, by the trespass of the one man, death reigned through that one man, how much more will those who receive God's abundant provision of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one man, Jesus Christ!
45:5:18/Consequently, just as one trespass resulted in condemnation for all people, so also one righteous act resulted in justification and life for all people.
45:5:19/For just as through the disobedience of the one man the many were made sinners, so also through the obedience of the one man the many will be made righteous.
45:5:20/The law was brought in so that the trespass might increase. But where sin increased, grace increased all the more,
45:5:21/so that, just as sin reigned in death, so also grace might reign through righteousness to bring eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
45:6:1/So, what should we say? Should we keep sinning so that grace can increase?
45:6:2/Absolutely not. How can we, who have died to sin, continue to live in it?
45:6:3/Don't you know that all of us who were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death?
45:6:4/So, we were buried with him through baptism into death, so that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the Father's glory, we too can live a new life.
45:6:5/If we've been united with him in a death like his, we will certainly also be united with him in a resurrection like his.
45:6:6/Understanding that our old self was crucified with him so that the body ruled by sin might be done away with, that we should no longer be slaves to sin.
45:6:7/Because anyone who has died has been set free from sin.
45:6:8/Now if we died with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him.
45:6:9/Knowing that Christ, once raised from the dead, will never die again; death no longer has control over him.
45:6:10/For the death he died, he died to sin once for all; but the life he lives, he lives to God.
45:6:11/In the same way, consider yourselves dead to sin but alive to God in Christ Jesus.
45:6:12/Therefore, do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its desires.
45:6:13/Do not offer any part of yourself to sin as an instrument of wickedness, but rather offer yourselves to God as those who have been brought from death to life, and offer every part of yourself to him as an instrument of righteousness.
45:6:14/For sin will not rule over you, because you are not under the law but under grace.
45:6:15/What then? Should we sin because we are not under the law but under grace? Absolutely not.
45:6:16/Don't you know that when you offer yourselves to someone as obedient slaves, you are slaves of the one you obey—whether you are slaves to sin, which leads to death, or to obedience, which leads to righteousness?
45:6:17/But thanks be to God that, though you used to be slaves to sin, you have come to obey from your heart the pattern of teaching that has now claimed your allegiance.
45:6:18/And having been set free from sin, you have become slaves to righteousness.
45:6:19/I am using an example from everyday life because of your human limitations. Just as you used to offer yourselves as slaves to impurity and to ever-increasing wickedness, so now offer yourselves as slaves to righteousness leading to holiness.
45:6:20/When you were slaves to sin, you were free from the control of righteousness.
45:6:21/What benefit did you reap at that time from the things you are now ashamed of? Those things result in death!
45:6:22/But now that you have been set free from sin and have become slaves of God, the benefit you reap leads to holiness, and the result is eternal life.
45:6:23/For the payment for sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
45:7:1/Don't you know, my friends (I'm speaking to those who understand the law), that the law has authority over a person as long as they are alive?
45:7:2/A woman who has a husband is legally bound to him while he's alive; but if her husband dies, she's released from the law concerning her husband.
45:7:3/So, if she marries another man while her husband is still alive, she's considered an adulteress; but if her husband dies, she's free from that law, and she's not an adulteress if she marries another man.
45:7:4/Therefore, my friends, you too have died to the law through the body of Christ, so that you can belong to another, to him who was raised from the dead, in order that we might produce fruit for God.
45:7:5/When we were living in our natural state, our sinful passions, aroused by the law, were at work in our bodies, resulting in death.
45:7:6/But now we have been released from the law, having died to that which held us captive, so that we serve in the new way of the Spirit and not in the old way of the written code.
45:7:7/What then shall we say? Is the law sin? Absolutely not. However, I would not have known what sin was except through the law. For I would not have known what it is to desire what is not mine if the law had not said, "You shall not covet."
45:7:8/But sin, seizing the opportunity afforded by the commandment, produced in me every kind of coveting. For apart from the law, sin is dead.
45:7:9/I was once alive apart from the law, but when the commandment came, sin sprang to life and I died.
45:7:10/The very commandment that was intended to bring life actually brought death.
45:7:11/For sin, seizing the opportunity through the commandment, deceived me, and through it killed me.
45:7:12/So then, the law is holy, and the commandment is holy, righteous, and good.
45:7:13/Did that which is good, then, become death to me? By no means! But in order that sin might be recognized as sin, it used what is good to bring about my death, so that through the commandment sin might become utterly sinful.
45:7:14/We know that the law is spiritual; but I am unspiritual, sold as a slave to sin.
45:7:15/I do not understand what I do. For what I want to do, I do not do, but what I hate, I do.
45:7:16/If I do what I do not want to do, I agree that the law is good.
45:7:17/As it is, it is no longer I myself who do it, but it is sin living in me.
45:7:18/For I know that good does not dwell in me, that is, in my sinful nature. For I have the desire to do what is good, but I cannot carry it out.
45:7:19/For I do not do the good I want to do, but the evil I do not want to do—this I keep on doing.
45:7:20/Now if I do what I do not want to do, it is no longer I who do it, but it is sin living in me that does it.
45:7:21/So I find this law at work: Although I want to do good, evil is right there with me.
45:7:22/For in my inner being I delight in God's law;
45:7:23/But I see another law at work in me, waging war against the law of my mind and making me a prisoner of the law of sin at work within me.
45:7:24/What a miserable person I am! Who will rescue me from this body that is subject to death?
45:7:25/I thank God—through Jesus Christ our Lord! So then, I myself in my mind am a slave to God's law, but in my sinful nature a slave to the law of sin.
45:8:1/So now, there's no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus, who don't live according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit.
45:8:2/Because the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free from the law of sin and death.
45:8:3/What the law couldn't do, because it was weakened by the flesh, God did. He sent his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, to deal with sin, and condemned sin in the flesh.
45:8:4/This was so the righteous requirement of the law might be fully met in us, who don't live according to the flesh but according to the Spirit.
45:8:5/Those who live according to the flesh focus on what the flesh desires; but those who live in accordance with the Spirit focus on what the Spirit desires.
45:8:6/To be controlled by the flesh is death, but to be controlled by the Spirit is life and peace.
45:8:7/The mind governed by the flesh is hostile to God; it does not submit to God's law, nor can it do so.
45:8:8/Those who are in the realm of the flesh cannot please God.
45:8:9/But you are not in the realm of the flesh but are in the realm of the Spirit, if indeed the Spirit of God lives in you. And if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ, they do not belong to Christ.
45:8:10/But if Christ is in you, then even though your body is subject to death because of sin, the Spirit gives life because of righteousness.
45:8:11/And if the Spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead is living in you, he who raised Christ from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies because of his Spirit who lives in you.
45:8:12/So then, brothers and sisters, we have an obligation, but it's not to the flesh, to live according to it.
45:8:13/For if you live according to the flesh, you will die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the misdeeds of the body, you will live.
45:8:14/For all who are led by the Spirit of God are children of God.
45:8:15/You did not receive a spirit that makes you a slave again to fear, but you received the Spirit of sonship. And by him we cry, "Abba, Father."
45:8:16/The Spirit himself testifies with our spirit that we are God's children.
45:8:17/And if we're children, then we're heirs—heirs of God and co-heirs with Christ, if indeed we share in his sufferings in order that we may also share in his glory.
45:8:18/I consider that our present sufferings are not worth comparing with the glory that will be revealed in us.
45:8:19/For the creation waits in eager expectation for the children of God to be revealed.
45:8:20/For the creation was subjected to frustration, not by its own choice, but by the will of the one who subjected it, in hope
45:8:21/that the creation itself will be liberated from its bondage to decay and brought into the freedom and glory of the children of God.
45:8:22/We know that the whole creation has been groaning as in the pains of childbirth right up to the present time.
45:8:23/Not only so, but we ourselves, who have the firstfruits of the Spirit, groan inwardly as we wait eagerly for our adoption to sonship, the redemption of our bodies.
45:8:24/For in this hope we were saved. But hope that is seen is no hope at all. Who hopes for what they already have?
45:8:25/But if we hope for what we do not yet have, we wait for it patiently.
45:8:26/In the same way, the Spirit helps us in our weakness. We do not know what we ought to pray for, but the Spirit himself intercedes for us through wordless groans.
45:8:27/And he who searches our hearts knows the mind of the Spirit, because the Spirit intercedes for God's people in accordance with the will of God.
45:8:28/And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.
45:8:29/For those God foreknew he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers and sisters.
45:8:30/And those he predestined, he also called; those he called, he also justified; those he justified, he also glorified.
45:8:31/What, then, shall we say in response to these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?
45:8:32/He who did not spare his own Son, but gave him up for us all—how will he not also, along with him, graciously give us all things?
45:8:33/Who will bring any charge against those whom God has chosen? It is God who justifies.
45:8:34/Who then is the one who condemns? No one. Christ Jesus who died—more than that, who was raised to life—is at the right hand of God and is also interceding for us.
45:8:35/Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword?
45:8:36/As it is written: "For your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered."
45:8:37/No, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us.
45:8:38/For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers,
45:8:39/neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
45:9:1/I'm speaking the truth in Christ, I'm not lying, my conscience confirms it through the Holy Spirit.
45:9:2/I have deep sadness and unending sorrow in my heart.
45:9:3/I could even wish to be cut off from Christ for the sake of my people, my ethnic kin.
45:9:4/They are Israelites; they have the adoption, the divine glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the worship of God, and the promises.
45:9:5/They are the descendants of the patriarchs, and from them, by physical descent, came Christ, who is God over all, blessed forever. Amen.
45:9:6/But it's not as though God's word has failed. For not all who are descended from Israel are truly Israel.
45:9:7/Nor because they are Abraham's descendants are they all his children. On the contrary, "Through Isaac will your offspring be reckoned."
45:9:8/This means that it's not the children by physical descent who are God's children, but the children of the promise are regarded as Abraham's offspring.
45:9:9/For this is the word of promise: "At the appointed time I will return, and Sarah will have a son."
45:9:10/And not only that, but also when Rebecca had conceived children by one man, our forefather Isaac,
45:9:11/before the twins were born or had done anything good or bad—in order that God's purpose in election might stand, not by works but by him who calls—
45:9:12/she was told, "The older will serve the younger."
45:9:13/Just as it is written: "Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated."
45:9:14/What shall we say then? Is there injustice on God's part? Absolutely not.
45:9:15/For he says to Moses, "I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion."
45:9:16/So then, it depends not on human desire or effort, but on God's mercy.
45:9:17/For the Scripture says to Pharaoh: "I raised you up for this very purpose, that I might display my power in you and that my name might be proclaimed in all the earth."
45:9:18/Therefore, he has mercy on whom he wants to have mercy, and he hardens whom he wants to harden.
45:9:19/You might say to me, "Why does he still find fault? For who can resist his will?"
45:9:20/But who are you, a human being, to talk back to God? "Will what is formed say to the one who formed it, 'Why did you make me like this?'"
45:9:21/Doesn't the potter have the right to make out of the same lump of clay some pottery for special purposes and some for common use?
45:9:22/What if God, wanting to show his wrath and make his power known, bore with great patience the objects of wrath prepared for destruction?
45:9:23/And what if he did this to make the riches of his glory known to the objects of mercy, whom he prepared in advance for glory—
45:9:24/even us, whom he also called, not only from the Jews but also from the Gentiles?
45:9:25/As he says in Hosea: "I will call them 'my people' who are not my people; and I will call her 'my loved one' who is not my loved one,"
45:9:26/and, "In the very place where it was said to them, 'You are not my people,' there they will be called 'children of the living God.'"
45:9:27/Isaiah cries out concerning Israel: "Though the number of the Israelites be like the sand by the sea, only the remnant will be saved.
45:9:28/For the Lord will carry out his sentence on earth with speed and finality."
45:9:29/Just as Isaiah had previously said, "Unless the Lord Almighty had left us descendants, we would have become like Sodom, we would have been like Gomorrah."
45:9:30/What shall we say, then? That Gentiles who did not pursue righteousness have attained it, that is, a righteousness that is by faith;
45:9:31/but Israel, who pursued a law of righteousness, has not attained to that law.
45:9:32/Why not? Because they pursued it not by faith but as if it were by works. They stumbled over the "stumbling stone."
45:9:33/As it is written: "See, I lay in Zion a stone that causes people to stumble and a rock that makes them fall, and the one who believes in him will never be put to shame."
45:10:1/My deepest wish and prayer to God for Israel is for them to be saved.
45:10:2/I acknowledge their enthusiasm for God, but it's not based on true understanding.
45:10:3/They don't understand God's way of making people right with himself, and instead try to establish their own, they haven't embraced God's righteousness.
45:10:4/Christ brings the pursuit of the law to an end, so that everyone who believes can be made right with God.
45:10:5/Moses writes about getting right with God by following the law, saying that anyone who does these things will live by them.
45:10:6/But the righteousness that comes from faith says, "Don't think in your heart, 'Who will go up to heaven?'" (meaning to bring Christ down)
45:10:7/Or, "Who will go down into the deep?" (meaning to bring Christ back from the dead).
45:10:8/But what does it say? "The message is near you, in your mouth and in your heart." That is the message of faith we proclaim.
45:10:9/If you openly declare that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
45:10:10/Believing with your heart leads to being made right with God, and openly declaring your faith leads to salvation.
45:10:11/The scripture says, "Anyone who believes in him will never be put to shame."
45:10:12/There's no difference between Jew and Gentile - the same Lord is Lord of all and generously blesses all who call on him.
45:10:13/Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.
45:10:14/But how can they call on him if they don't believe in him? And how can they believe in him if they've never heard about him? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them?
45:10:15/And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written, "How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!"
45:10:16/But not everyone has obeyed the good news. For Isaiah says, "Lord, who has believed our message?"
45:10:17/So faith comes from hearing, that is, hearing the Good News about Christ.
45:10:18/But I ask, haven't they heard? Indeed they have; "Their voice has gone out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world."
45:10:19/But I ask, didn't Israel understand? First Moses says, "I will make you envious by those who are not a nation; I will make you angry by a nation that has no understanding."
45:10:20/And Isaiah boldly says, "I was found by those who did not seek me; I revealed myself to those who did not ask for me."
45:10:21/But regarding Israel he says, "All day long I have held out my hands to a disobedient and contrary people."
45:11:1/I say then, Has God rejected his people? Absolutely not. For I too am an Israelite, descended from Abraham, from the tribe of Benjamin.
45:11:2/God has not rejected his people whom he foreknew. Don't you know what the scripture says about Elijah? How he pleads with God against Israel, saying,
45:11:3/Lord, they have killed your prophets and torn down your altars; I'm the only one left, and they're trying to kill me.
45:11:4/But what is God's response to him? I have kept for myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal.
45:11:5/In the same way, at this present time, there is a remnant chosen by grace.
45:11:6/And if it is by grace, then it is no longer based on works; if it were, grace would no longer be grace.
45:11:7/What then? Israel did not obtain what it was seeking. The elect obtained it, but the rest were hardened,
45:11:8/As it is written, God gave them a spirit of stupor, eyes that could not see and ears that could not hear, to this very day.
45:11:9/And David says, May their table become a snare and a trap, a stumbling block and a retribution for them.
45:11:10/May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see, and their backs be bent forever.
45:11:11/I say then, Did they stumble so as to fall beyond recovery? Not at all! Rather, through their transgression, salvation has come to the Gentiles to make Israel envious.
45:11:12/Now if their transgression means riches for the world, and their loss means riches for the Gentiles, how much greater will their full inclusion be!
45:11:13/For I am speaking to you Gentiles. Inasmuch as I am an apostle to the Gentiles, I take pride in my ministry
45:11:14/in the hope that I may somehow arouse my own people to envy and save some of them.
45:11:15/For if their rejection brought reconciliation to the world, what will their acceptance be but life from the dead?
45:11:16/If the part of the dough offered as firstfruits is holy, then the whole batch is holy; if the root is holy, so are the branches.
45:11:17/If some of the branches have been broken off, and you, though a wild olive shoot, have been grafted in among the others and now share in the nourishing sap from the olive root,
45:11:18/do not consider yourself to be superior to those other branches. If you do, remember it is not you who support the root, but the root supports you.
45:11:19/You will say then, "Branches were broken off so that I could be grafted in."
45:11:20/Granted. But they were broken off because of unbelief, and you stand by faith. Do not be arrogant, but tremble.
45:11:21/For if God did not spare the natural branches, he will not spare you either.
45:11:22/Consider therefore the kindness and sternness of God: sternness to those who fell, but kindness to you, provided that you continue in his kindness. Otherwise, you also will be cut off.
45:11:23/And if they do not persist in unbelief, they will be grafted in, for God is able to graft them in again.
45:11:24/For if you were cut from what is by nature a wild olive tree, and grafted, contrary to nature, into a cultivated olive tree, how much more readily will these, the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree!
45:11:25/I do not want you to be unaware of this mystery, brothers and sisters, so that you may not be conceited: Israel has experienced a hardening in part until the full number of the Gentiles has come in.
45:11:26/And in this way all Israel will be saved, as it is written: "The Deliverer will come from Zion; he will turn godlessness away from Jacob.
45:11:27/And this is my covenant with them when I take away their sins."
45:11:28/As far as the gospel is concerned, they are enemies for your sake; but as far as election is concerned, they are loved on account of the patriarchs,
45:11:29/for God's gifts and his call are irrevocable.
45:11:30/Just as you who were at one time disobedient to God have now received mercy as a result of their disobedience,
45:11:31/so they too have now become disobedient in order that they too may now receive mercy as a result of God's mercy to you.
45:11:32/For God has bound everyone over to disobedience so that he may have mercy on them all.
45:11:33/Oh, the depth of the riches of the wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable his judgments, and his paths beyond tracing out!
45:11:34/For who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has been his advisor?
45:11:35/Or who has ever given to God, that God should repay them?
45:11:36/For from him and through him and for him are all things. To him be the glory forever! Amen.
45:12:1/I urge you, my friends, by the compassion of God, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, pure, pleasing to God—this is your logical act of worship.
45:12:2/Don't conform to the patterns of this world, but be transformed by renewing your mind, so you can discover what is good, pleasing, and perfect in God's will.
45:12:3/For I say, through the grace given to me, to everyone among you, not to think of himself more highly than he should; but to think with sober judgment, each according to the measure of faith God has assigned.
45:12:4/Just as we have many parts in one body, and all the parts do not have the same function,
45:12:5/So we, though many, are one body in Christ, and individually members of one another.
45:12:6/Having gifts that differ according to the grace given to us, let us use them: if prophecy, in proportion to our faith;
45:12:7/If service, in our serving; the one who teaches, in teaching;
45:12:8/The one who encourages, in encouragement; the one who contributes, with generosity; the one who leads, with diligence; the one who shows mercy, with cheerfulness.
45:12:9/Let love be genuine. Hate what is evil; hold fast to what is good.
45:12:10/Show genuine affection to one another with brotherly love; outdo one another in showing honor.
45:12:11/Don't be lazy in your work; be fervent in spirit; serve the Lord.
45:12:12/Be joyful in hope; patient in affliction; faithful in prayer.
45:12:13/Share with the saints in their needs; pursue hospitality.
45:12:14/Bless those who persecute you; bless and do not curse them.
45:12:15/Rejoice with those who rejoice; mourn with those who mourn.
45:12:16/Have the same regard for one another. Do not be haughty, but associate with the lowly. Do not be conceited.
45:12:17/Do not repay anyone evil for evil. Be careful to do what is right in the eyes of everyone.
45:12:18/If possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone.
45:12:19/Beloved, do not take revenge, but leave room for God's wrath; for it is written, "Vengeance is mine, I will repay," says the Lord.
45:12:20/Therefore, if your enemy is hungry, feed him; if he is thirsty, give him something to drink; for by doing this, you will heap burning coals on his head.
45:12:21/Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
45:13:1/Everyone should submit to governing authorities. For all authority comes from God, and those in positions of power have been placed there by God.
45:13:2/So anyone who rebels against authority is rebelling against what God has instituted, and they will bring judgment on themselves.
45:13:3/For rulers are not a threat to those who do right, but to those who do wrong. Do you want to be free from fear of the one in authority? Then do what is right and you will be commended.
45:13:4/For the one in authority is God's servant for your good. But if you do wrong, be afraid, for they do not wield the sword for no reason. They are God's servants, agents of wrath to bring punishment on the wrongdoer.
45:13:5/Therefore, it is necessary to submit to authorities, not only because of possible punishment but also as a matter of conscience.
45:13:6/This is also why you pay taxes, for the authorities are God's servants, who give their full time to governing.
45:13:7/Give to everyone what you owe them: If you owe taxes, pay taxes; if revenue, then revenue; if respect, then respect; if honor, then honor.
45:13:8/Don't owe anyone anything, except to love each other, for the one who loves another has fulfilled the law.
45:13:9/The commandments, "Do not commit adultery," "Do not murder," "Do not steal," "Do not covet," and whatever other command there may be, are summed up in this one command: "Love your neighbor as yourself."
45:13:10/Love does no harm to a neighbor. Therefore, love is the fulfillment of the law.
45:13:11/And do this, understanding the present time: The hour has already come for you to wake up from your slumber, because our salvation is nearer now than when we first believed.
45:13:12/The night is nearly over; the day is almost here. So let us put aside the deeds of darkness and put on the armor of light.
45:13:13/Let us behave decently, as in the daytime, not in carousing and drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and debauchery, not in dissension and jealousy.
45:13:14/But clothe yourselves with the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not think about how to gratify the desires of the flesh.
45:14:1/Welcome those who are weak in faith, but not for the purpose of arguing over doubtful issues.
45:14:2/Some believe they can eat anything, while others, who are weak, eat only vegetables.
45:14:3/Those who eat everything must not look down on those who do not, and those who do not eat everything must not judge those who do, for God has welcomed them.
45:14:4/Who are you to judge someone else's servant? Whether they stand or fall is up to their own master. And they will stand, for the Lord is able to make them stand.
45:14:5/Some people consider one day more sacred than another; others consider every day alike. Each person should be fully convinced in their own mind.
45:14:6/Whoever regards one day as special does so to the Lord. Whoever eats meat does so to the Lord, for they give thanks to God; and whoever abstains does so to the Lord and gives thanks to God.
45:14:7/For none of us lives for ourselves alone, and none of us dies for ourselves alone.
45:14:8/Whether we live or die, we belong to the Lord. For this reason, whether we live or die, we are the Lord's.
45:14:9/Christ died and returned to life so that he might be the Lord of both the dead and the living.
45:14:10/So, why do you judge your brother or sister? Or why do you treat them with contempt? For we will all stand before God's judgment seat.
45:14:11/It is written: "As surely as I live, says the Lord, every knee will bow before me; every tongue will acknowledge God."
45:14:12/So then, each of us will give an account of ourselves to God.
45:14:13/Therefore, let's stop judging each other. Instead, decide not to put any stumbling block or obstacle in the way of a brother or sister.
45:14:14/I am convinced, being fully persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean in itself. But if anyone regards something as unclean, then for that person it is unclean.
45:14:15/If your brother or sister is distressed because of what you eat, you are no longer acting in love. Do not by your eating destroy someone for whom Christ died.
45:14:16/Therefore, do not let what you know is good be spoken of as evil.
45:14:17/For the kingdom of God is not a matter of eating and drinking, but of righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.
45:14:18/Anyone who serves Christ in this way is pleasing to God and receives human approval.
45:14:19/Let us therefore make every effort to do what leads to peace and to mutual edification.
45:14:20/Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food. All food is clean, but it is wrong for a person to eat anything that causes someone else to stumble.
45:14:21/It is better not to eat meat or drink wine or to do anything else that will cause your brother or sister to fall.
45:14:22/Keep the faith you have between yourself and God. Blessed is the one who does not condemn themselves by what they approve.
45:14:23/But whoever has doubts is condemned if they eat, because their eating is not from faith; and everything that does not come from faith is sin.
45:15:1/We who are strong should help carry the burdens of those who are not, and not just live to please ourselves.
45:15:2/Each of us should aim to please our neighbors for their benefit, to build them up.
45:15:3/For even Christ didn't live to please Himself. Instead, as the scripture says, "The insults of those who insulted you fell on me."
45:15:4/Everything that was written in the past was written to teach us, so that through endurance and the encouragement of the Scriptures we might have hope.
45:15:5/May the God who gives endurance and encouragement give you the same attitude of mind toward each other that Christ Jesus had,
45:15:6/So that with one mind and one voice you may glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
45:15:7/Therefore, welcome each other, just as Christ has welcomed you, for the glory of God.
45:15:8/Now I say that Jesus Christ has become a servant to the Jews on behalf of God's truth, to confirm the promises made to the ancestors,
45:15:9/And so that the Gentiles might glorify God for His mercy. As it is written: "Therefore I will praise you among the Gentiles; I will sing the praises of your name."
45:15:10/Again, it says, "Rejoice, you Gentiles, with His people."
45:15:11/And again, "Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles; let all the peoples extol Him."
45:15:12/And again, Isaiah says, "The Root of Jesse will spring up, one who will arise to rule over the nations; in Him the Gentiles will hope."
45:15:13/May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you trust in Him, so that you may overflow with hope by the power of the Holy Spirit.
45:15:14/And I myself am convinced, my brothers and sisters, that you yourselves are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge and able to instruct one another.
45:15:15/However, I have written you quite boldly on some points to remind you of them again, because of the grace God gave me
45:15:16/To be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles. He gave me the priestly duty of proclaiming the gospel of God, so that the Gentiles might become an offering acceptable to God, sanctified by the Holy Spirit.
45:15:17/Therefore I have reason to boast about my work for God through Jesus Christ in what pertains to God.
45:15:18/For I will not venture to speak of anything except what Christ has accomplished through me in leading the Gentiles to obey God by what I have said and done—
45:15:19/By the power of signs and wonders, through the power of the Spirit of God. So from Jerusalem all the way around to Illyricum, I have fully proclaimed the gospel of Christ.
45:15:20/It has always been my ambition to preach the gospel where Christ was not known, so that I would not be building on someone else's foundation.
45:15:21/But as it is written: "Those who were not told about Him will see, and those who have not heard will understand."
45:15:22/That is why I have often been hindered from coming to you.
45:15:23/But now that there is no more place for me to work in these regions, and since I have been longing for many years to visit you,
45:15:24/Whenever I go to Spain, I hope to see you while passing through and to have you assist me on my journey there, after I have enjoyed your company for a while.
45:15:25/But now I am going to Jerusalem to serve the saints.
45:15:26/For Macedonia and Achaia were pleased to make a contribution for the poor among the saints in Jerusalem.
45:15:27/They were pleased to do it, and indeed they owe it to them. For if the Gentiles have shared in the Jews' spiritual blessings, they owe it to the Jews to share with them their material blessings.
45:15:28/So after I have completed this task and have made sure that they have received this contribution, I will go to Spain and visit you on the way.
45:15:29/And I know that when I come to you, I will come in the full measure of the blessing of Christ.
45:15:30/I urge you, brothers and sisters, by our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love of the Spirit, to join me in my struggle by praying to God for me.
45:15:31/Pray that I may be kept safe from the unbelievers in Judea and that the contribution I take to Jerusalem may be favorably received by the saints there,
45:15:32/So that by God's will I may come to you with joy and together with you be refreshed.
45:15:33/May the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
45:16:1/I recommend to you our sister Phoebe, who serves the church in Cenchrea.
45:16:2/Welcome her in the Lord in a way worthy of the saints and help her with anything she needs from you, for she has been a great help to many people, including me.
45:16:3/Say hello to Priscilla and Aquila, my co-workers in Christ Jesus.
45:16:4/They risked their lives for me. Not only I but all the churches of the Gentiles are grateful to them.
45:16:5/Also, greet the church that meets at their house. Give my greetings to my dear friend Epaenetus, who was the first convert to Christ in the province of Achaia.
45:16:6/Greet Mary, who worked very hard for you.
45:16:7/Say hello to Andronicus and Junia, my relatives who have been in prison with me. They are outstanding among the apostles, and they were in Christ before I was.
45:16:8/Greet Ampliatus, my dear friend in the Lord.
45:16:9/Say hello to Urbanus, our co-worker in Christ, and my dear friend Stachys.
45:16:10/Say hello to Apelles, whose fidelity to Christ has stood the test. Greet those who belong to the household of Aristobulus.
45:16:11/Greet Herodion, my relative. Greet those in the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.
45:16:12/Say hello to Tryphena and Tryphosa, those women who work hard in the Lord. Greet my dear friend Persis, another woman who has worked very hard in the Lord.
45:16:13/Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord, and his mother, who has been a mother to me, too.
45:16:14/Say hello to Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brothers and sisters with them.
45:16:15/Say hello to Philologus, Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints with them.
45:16:16/Greet one another with a holy kiss. All the churches of Christ send greetings.
45:16:17/I urge you, brothers and sisters, to watch out for those who cause divisions and put obstacles in your way that are contrary to the teaching you have learned. Keep away from them.
45:16:18/For such people are not serving our Lord Christ, but their own appetites. By smooth talk and flattery they deceive the minds of naive people.
45:16:19/Everyone has heard about your obedience, so I rejoice because of you; but I want you to be wise about what is good, and innocent about what is evil.
45:16:20/And the God of peace will soon crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus be with you.
45:16:21/Timothy, my co-worker, and Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my relatives, send you their greetings.
45:16:22/I, Tertius, who wrote down this letter, greet you in the Lord.
45:16:23/Gaius, who is hosting me and the whole church, sends you his greetings. Erastus, who is the city's director of public works, and our brother Quartus send you their greetings.
45:16:24/May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
45:16:25/Now to him who is able to establish you in accordance with my gospel, the message I proclaim about Jesus Christ, in keeping with the revelation of the mystery hidden for long ages past,
45:16:26/But now revealed and made known through the prophetic writings by the command of the eternal God, so that all the Gentiles might come to the obedience that comes from faith,
45:16:27/To the only wise God be glory forever through Jesus Christ! Amen.
46:1:1/Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ by God's will, and Sosthenes our brother,
46:1:2/To the church of God in Corinth, to those sanctified in Christ Jesus, called to be holy, along with all those everywhere who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ—their Lord and ours:
46:1:3/May grace and peace be yours, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
46:1:4/I always thank my God for you because of the grace of God given to you in Jesus Christ.
46:1:5/That in every way you have been enriched by Him, in all speech and all knowledge.
46:1:6/Just as the testimony about Christ was confirmed among you.
46:1:7/So that you are not lacking in any gift as you eagerly wait for the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ.
46:1:8/He will also strengthen you to the end, so that you may be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
46:1:9/God is faithful, by whom you were called into the fellowship of His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.
46:1:10/Now I urge you, brothers and sisters, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that all of you agree and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be united in the same mind and the same judgment.
46:1:11/For it has been reported to me about you, my brothers and sisters, by Chloe's people, that there are quarrels among you.
46:1:12/What I mean is that each one of you says, "I follow Paul," or "I follow Apollos," or "I follow Cephas," or "I follow Christ."
46:1:13/Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul?
46:1:14/I thank God that I baptized none of you except Crispus and Gaius,
46:1:15/So no one can say that you were baptized in my name.
46:1:16/I also baptized the household of Stephanas; beyond that, I don't remember if I baptized anyone else.
46:1:17/For Christ did not send me to baptize, but to preach the gospel—not with eloquent wisdom, lest the cross of Christ be emptied of its power.
46:1:18/For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.
46:1:19/For it is written, "I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and the discernment of the discerning I will thwart."
46:1:20/Where is the wise person? Where is the teacher of the law? Where is the debater of this age? Hasn't God made the wisdom of the world foolish?
46:1:21/For since in the wisdom of God the world did not know God through wisdom, it pleased God through the folly of what we preach to save those who believe.
46:1:22/For Jews demand signs and Greeks seek wisdom,
46:1:23/But we preach Christ crucified, a stumbling block to Jews and foolishness to Gentiles,
46:1:24/But to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.
46:1:25/Because the foolishness of God is wiser than humans, and the weakness of God is stronger than humans.
46:1:26/Consider your own call, brothers and sisters: not many of you were wise by human standards, not many were powerful, not many were of noble birth.
46:1:27/But God chose what is foolish in the world to shame the wise; God chose what is weak in the world to shame the strong;
46:1:28/God chose what is low and despised in the world, even things that are not, to bring to nothing things that are,
46:1:29/So that no human being might boast in the presence of God.
46:1:30/But by His doing you are in Christ Jesus, who became to us wisdom from God, and righteousness and sanctification and redemption,
46:1:31/So that, as it is written, "Let the one who boasts, boast in the Lord."
46:2:1/And I, friends, when I came to you, did not come with superior speech or wisdom, sharing with you the testimony of God.
46:2:2/For I resolved to know nothing among you except Jesus Christ, and him crucified.
46:2:3/And I was with you in weakness, and in fear, and in much trembling.
46:2:4/And my speech and my preaching were not with persuasive words of human wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power:
46:2:5/So that your faith would not be based on human wisdom, but on the power of God.
46:2:6/However, we do speak wisdom among those who are mature: yet not the wisdom of this world, nor of the rulers of this world, who are coming to nothing:
46:2:7/But we speak God's wisdom in a mystery, the hidden wisdom, which God predestined before the ages for our glory:
46:2:8/Which none of the rulers of this world knew: for had they known it, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.
46:2:9/But as it is written, "No eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no mind has imagined the things which God has prepared for those who love him."
46:2:10/But God has revealed them to us through his Spirit: for the Spirit searches all things, yes, the deep things of God.
46:2:11/For who knows a person's thoughts except their own spirit within them? In the same way, no one knows the thoughts of God except the Spirit of God.
46:2:12/Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit who is from God, so that we may understand the things freely given to us by God.
46:2:13/Which things we also speak, not in words taught by human wisdom, but in those taught by the Holy Spirit, explaining spiritual realities with Spirit-taught words.
46:2:14/But the person without the Spirit does not accept the things that come from the Spirit of God, for they are foolishness to him, and he cannot understand them, because they are spiritually discerned.
46:2:15/But the person who is spiritual discerns all things, yet he himself is discerned by no one.
46:2:16/For who has known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct Him? But we have the mind of Christ.
46:3:1/And I, friends, couldn't speak to you as if you were spiritually mature, but rather as if you were worldly, just like infants in Christ.
46:3:2/I've given you milk to drink, not solid food, because until now you weren't ready for it, and even now you still aren't ready.
46:3:3/You are still worldly. For when there is jealousy, quarreling, and division among you, doesn't that show you are worldly and behaving like ordinary people?
46:3:4/When one of you says, "I follow Paul," and another, "I follow Apollos," aren't you acting like mere humans?
46:3:5/So, who is Paul, and who is Apollos? They are servants through whom you came to believe, as the Lord assigned to each his task.
46:3:6/I planted the seed, Apollos watered it, but God made it grow.
46:3:7/So neither the one who plants nor the one who waters is anything, but only God, who makes things grow.
46:3:8/The one who plants and the one who waters have one purpose, and they will each be rewarded according to their own labor.
46:3:9/For we are co-workers in God's service; you are God's field, God's building.
46:3:10/By the grace God has given me, I laid a foundation as a wise builder, and someone else is building on it. But each one should build with care.
46:3:11/For no one can lay any foundation other than the one already laid, which is Jesus Christ.
46:3:12/Now if anyone builds on this foundation using gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay, or straw,
46:3:13/each one's work will become clear, for the day will disclose it, because it will be revealed by fire; and the fire will test the quality of each person's work.
46:3:14/If what has been built survives, the builder will receive a reward.
46:3:15/If it is burned up, the builder will suffer loss but yet will be saved—even though only as one escaping through the flames.
46:3:16/Don't you know that you yourselves are God's temple and that God's Spirit dwells in your midst?
46:3:17/If anyone destroys God's temple, God will destroy that person; for God's temple is sacred, and you together are that temple.
46:3:18/Do not deceive yourselves. If any of you think you are wise by the standards of this age, you should become "fools" so that you may become wise.
46:3:19/For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God's sight. As it is written: "He catches the wise in their craftiness."
46:3:20/And again, "The Lord knows that the thoughts of the wise are futile."
46:3:21/So then, no more boasting about human leaders! All things are yours,
46:3:22/whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or the present or the future—all are yours,
46:3:23/and you are of Christ, and Christ is of God.
46:4:1/Consider us as Christ's servants and stewards of God's mysteries.
46:4:2/It's essential for stewards to be found trustworthy.
46:4:3/For me, it's not significant if I'm judged by you or by any human court; I don't even judge myself.
46:4:4/I'm not aware of anything against myself, but that doesn't mean I'm justified. The Lord is the one who judges me.
46:4:5/So, don't pass judgment prematurely, before the Lord returns. He will bring to light what's hidden in darkness and reveal the intentions of the heart. Then, each person will receive praise from God.
46:4:6/I've applied these things to myself and Apollos for your benefit, so you can learn from us not to think of people more highly than you ought, to prevent rivalry among you.
46:4:7/What makes you different from anyone else? What do you have that you didn't receive? If you did receive it, why do you boast as though you didn't?
46:4:8/Now you're satisfied, now you're wealthy, you've become kings without us. I wish you really had become kings so we could reign with you.
46:4:9/I think God has presented us apostles last, as if sentenced to death, because we've become a spectacle to the whole universe, to angels as well as to humans.
46:4:10/We are fools for Christ, but you are wise in Christ; we are weak, but you are strong; you are honored, but we are dishonored.
46:4:11/Right up to this moment, we are hungry, thirsty, poorly clothed, brutally treated, and homeless.
46:4:12/We work hard with our own hands. When we are cursed, we bless; when we are persecuted, we endure it;
46:4:13/when we are slandered, we respond kindly. We have become the scum of the earth, the refuse of the world, right up to this moment.
46:4:14/I'm not writing this to shame you, but to warn you as my dear children.
46:4:15/Even if you had ten thousand guardians in Christ, you don't have many fathers, for in Christ Jesus I became your father through the gospel.
46:4:16/Therefore, I urge you to imitate me.
46:4:17/That's why I've sent Timothy to you, my beloved and faithful son in the Lord. He will remind you of my way of life in Christ Jesus, which aligns with what I teach everywhere in every church.
46:4:18/Some of you have become arrogant, as if I were not coming to you.
46:4:19/But I will come to you soon, if the Lord is willing, and I will find out not the talk of those who are arrogant but their power.
46:4:20/For the kingdom of God is not a matter of talk but of power.
46:4:21/What do you prefer? Should I come to you with a rod, or with love and a gentle spirit?
46:5:1/It's widely known that there's sexual immorality among you, and such immorality that isn't even mentioned among non-believers, that someone is involved with his stepmother.
46:5:2/And you're arrogant instead of mourning, so that the person who did this could be removed from your community.
46:5:3/For I, although not physically present but with you in spirit, have already passed judgment on the one who did this, as if I were there.
46:5:4/In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, when you are gathered together, along with my spirit and with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ,
46:5:5/To hand over such a person to Satan for the destruction of the flesh, so that their spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord Jesus.
46:5:6/Your boasting is not good. Don't you know that a little yeast works through the whole batch of dough?
46:5:7/So clean out the old yeast, so that you may be a new batch, as you are unleavened. For Christ, our Passover lamb, has been sacrificed.
46:5:8/Therefore, let's celebrate the festival, not with the old yeast, the yeast of malice and evil, but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth.
46:5:9/I told you in my letter not to associate with sexually immoral people.
46:5:10/But I didn't mean the sexually immoral of this world, or the greedy and swindlers, or idolaters, since then you would have to leave this world.
46:5:11/But now I am writing to you not to associate with anyone who claims to be a brother or sister but is sexually immoral or greedy, an idolater or slanderer, a drunkard or swindler. Do not even eat with such people.
46:5:12/What business is it of mine to judge those outside the church? Are you not to judge those inside?
46:5:13/God will judge those outside. "Expel the wicked person from among you."
46:6:1/Is it possible that any of you, when you have a dispute with another, would take it to court before the unjust instead of before the saints?
46:6:2/Don't you realize that the saints will judge the world? And if you are to judge the world, aren't you capable of handling minor disputes?
46:6:3/Don't you know that we will judge angels? How much more, then, matters of this life?
46:6:4/So, if you have disputes about everyday life, appoint as judges those who are of little account in the church.
46:6:5/I'm saying this to your shame. Can it be that there is not a single wise person among you who can decide between their fellow believers?
46:6:6/Yet one brother takes another to court, and this in front of unbelievers!
46:6:7/It is already a defeat for you that you have lawsuits with one another. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be cheated?
46:6:8/Instead, you yourselves do wrong and cheat, and you do this to your brothers and sisters.
46:6:9/Don't you know that the wicked will not inherit the kingdom of God? Do not be deceived: Neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor those who engage in homosexual acts,
46:6:10/Nor thieves, nor the greedy, nor drunkards, nor verbal abusers, nor swindlers, will inherit the kingdom of God.
46:6:11/And that is what some of you were. But you were washed, you were sanctified, you were justified in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and by the Spirit of our God.
46:6:12/Everything is permissible for me, but not everything is beneficial. Everything is permissible for me, but I will not be mastered by anything.
46:6:13/Food is meant for the stomach and the stomach for food, but God will destroy them both. The body, however, is not meant for sexual immorality but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body.
46:6:14/And God raised the Lord and will also raise us up by his power.
46:6:15/Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Should I then take the members of Christ and unite them with a prostitute? Absolutely not!
46:6:16/Don't you realize that anyone who joins themselves to a prostitute becomes one body with her? For it is said, "The two will become one flesh."
46:6:17/But whoever is united with the Lord is one with him in spirit.
46:6:18/Run away from sexual immorality. Every other sin a person commits is outside the body, but the sexually immoral person sins against their own body.
46:6:19/Don't you know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit, who is in you, whom you have received from God? You are not your own;
46:6:20/You were bought at a price. Therefore honor God with your bodies and in your spirit, which belong to God.
46:7:1/Regarding your questions, it's beneficial for a man not to have sexual relations with a woman.
46:7:2/However, to avoid sexual immorality, each man should have his own wife, and each woman her own husband.
46:7:3/The husband should fulfill his marital duties to his wife, and likewise, the wife to her husband.
46:7:4/A wife does not have authority over her own body, but her husband does. Similarly, a husband does not have authority over his own body, but his wife does.
46:7:5/Do not deprive each other of sexual relations, unless you both agree to refrain for a limited time to devote yourselves to prayer. Afterwards, come together again so that Satan won't tempt you because of your lack of self-control.
46:7:6/But I say this as a concession, not as a command.
46:7:7/I wish that all people were as I am. But each person has their own gift from God; one has this gift, another has that.
46:7:8/To the unmarried and the widows, I say it is good for them to stay unmarried, as I am.
46:7:9/But if they cannot control themselves, they should marry, for it is better to marry than to burn with passion.
46:7:10/To the married, I give this command (not I, but the Lord): A wife must not separate from her husband.
46:7:11/But if she does, she must remain unmarried or else be reconciled to her husband. And a husband must not divorce his wife.
46:7:12/To the rest I say this (I, not the Lord): If any brother has a wife who is not a believer and she is willing to live with him, he must not divorce her.
46:7:13/And if a woman has a husband who is not a believer and he is willing to live with her, she must not divorce him.
46:7:14/For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified through his wife, and the unbelieving wife has been sanctified through her believing husband. Otherwise, your children would be unclean, but as it is, they are holy.
46:7:15/But if the unbeliever leaves, let it be so. The brother or sister is not bound in such circumstances; God has called us to live in peace.
46:7:16/How do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? Or, how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?
46:7:17/However, each person should live as a believer in whatever situation the Lord has assigned to them, just as God has called them. This is the rule I lay down in all the churches.
46:7:18/If anyone was circumcised when they were called, they should not become uncircumcised. If anyone was uncircumcised when they were called, they should not be circumcised.
46:7:19/Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing. Keeping God's commands is what counts.
46:7:20/Each person should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.
46:7:21/Were you a slave when you were called? Don't let it trouble you—although if you can gain your freedom, do so.
46:7:22/For the one who was a slave when called to faith in the Lord is the Lord's freed person; similarly, the one who was free when called is Christ's slave.
46:7:23/You were bought at a price; do not become slaves of human beings.
46:7:24/Brothers and sisters, each person, as responsible to God, should remain in the situation they were in when God called them.
46:7:25/Now about virgins: I have no command from the Lord, but I give a judgment as one who by the Lord's mercy is trustworthy.
46:7:26/Because of the present crisis, I think that it is good for a person to remain as they are.
46:7:27/Are you pledged to a woman? Do not seek to be released. Are you free from such a commitment? Do not look for a wife.
46:7:28/But if you do marry, you have not sinned; and if a virgin marries, she has not sinned. However, those who marry will face many troubles in this life, and I want to spare you this.
46:7:29/What I mean, brothers and sisters, is that the time is short. From now on those who have wives should live as if they do not;
46:7:30/those who mourn, as if they did not; those who are happy, as if they were not; those who buy something, as if it were not theirs to keep;
46:7:31/those who use the things of the world, as if not engrossed in them. For this world in its present form is passing away.
46:7:32/I would like you to be free from concern. An unmarried man is concerned about the Lord's affairs—how he can please the Lord.
46:7:33/But a married man is concerned about the affairs of this world—how he can please his wife—
46:7:34/and his interests are divided. An unmarried woman or virgin is concerned about the Lord's affairs: Her aim is to be devoted to the Lord in both body and spirit. But a married woman is concerned about the affairs of this world—how she can please her husband.
46:7:35/I am saying this for your own benefit, not to restrict you, but that you may live in a right way in undivided devotion to the Lord.
46:7:36/If anyone thinks that they are behaving improperly toward the woman they are engaged to, if she is getting along in years and he feels he ought to marry, he should do as he wants. He is not sinning. They should get married.
46:7:37/But the man who has settled the matter in his own mind, who is under no compulsion but has control over his own will, and has made up his mind not to marry the virgin—this man also does the right thing.
46:7:38/So then, he who marries the virgin does right, but he who does not marry her does better.
46:7:39/A wife is bound to her husband as long as he lives. But if her husband dies, she is free to marry anyone she wishes, but he must belong to the Lord.
46:7:40/In my judgment, she is happier if she stays as she is—and I think that I too have the Spirit of God.
46:8:1/Regarding food sacrificed to idols, we understand that we all possess knowledge. Knowledge can make us arrogant, but love builds us up.
46:8:2/And if anyone thinks they know something, they don't yet know as much as they should.
46:8:3/However, if anyone loves God, they are known by Him.
46:8:4/So, about eating food offered to idols, we understand that an idol has no real existence in the world, and there is no God but one.
46:8:5/Even though there are many so-called gods, whether in heaven or on earth (as there are many gods and many lords),
46:8:6/For us, there is only one God, the Father, from whom all things come and for whom we live; and there is one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom all things come and through whom we live.
46:8:7/However, not everyone has this understanding. Some people, accustomed to idols until now, eat such food as if it were sacrificed to an idol, and their conscience, being weak, is polluted.
46:8:8/But food does not bring us closer to God: we are no worse off if we do not eat, and no better off if we do.
46:8:9/But be careful that your freedom does not somehow become a stumbling block to the weak.
46:8:10/For if someone sees you, who have knowledge, eating in an idol's temple, won't that person be encouraged, if their conscience is weak, to eat food offered to idols?
46:8:11/And because of your knowledge, the weak brother for whom Christ died is destroyed.
46:8:12/When you thus sin against your brothers and wound their weak conscience, you sin against Christ.
46:8:13/Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble, I will never eat meat, lest I cause my brother to stumble.
46:9:1/Aren't I an apostle? Aren't I free? Haven't I seen Jesus Christ our Lord? Aren't you my work in the Lord?
46:9:2/Even if I'm not considered an apostle by others, I definitely am to you, for you are the proof of my apostleship in the Lord.
46:9:3/This is my defense to those who question me:
46:9:4/Don't we have the right to eat and drink?
46:9:5/Don't we have the right to bring along a believing wife, just as the other apostles, the Lord's brothers, and Cephas do?
46:9:6/Or is it only I and Barnabas who don't have the right to stop working for a living?
46:9:7/Who serves as a soldier at his own expense? Who plants a vineyard and doesn't eat its grapes? Who tends a flock and doesn't drink the milk?
46:9:8/Am I saying this merely from a human perspective, or doesn't the law say the same thing?
46:9:9/For it is written in the Law of Moses, "Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain." Is it about oxen that God is concerned?
46:9:10/Or is he saying it entirely for our sake? Indeed, for our sake it was written: because the plowman should plow in hope, and the thresher should thresh in hope of sharing in the harvest.
46:9:11/If we have sown spiritual seed among you, is it too much if we reap a material harvest from you?
46:9:12/If others have this right of support from you, shouldn't we have it all the more? But we haven't used this right. Instead, we endure everything so as not to hinder the gospel of Christ.
46:9:13/Don't you know that those who serve in the temple get their food from the temple, and those who serve at the altar share in what is offered on the altar?
46:9:14/In the same way, the Lord has commanded that those who preach the gospel should receive their living from the gospel.
46:9:15/But I haven't used any of these rights. And I'm not writing this to suggest that something should be done for me. Indeed, it would be better for me to die than to allow anyone to deprive me of this boast.
46:9:16/For if I preach the gospel, I have no reason to boast, since I am compelled to do so. Woe to me if I do not preach the gospel!
46:9:17/If I do this willingly, I have a reward; but if unwillingly, I am still entrusted with a stewardship.
46:9:18/What then is my reward? Just this: that in preaching the gospel I may offer it free of charge, and so not make full use of my rights in the gospel.
46:9:19/Though I am free and belong to no one, I have made myself a servant to everyone, to win as many as possible.
46:9:20/To the Jews I became like a Jew, to win the Jews. To those under the law I became like one under the law (though I myself am not under the law), so as to win those under the law.
46:9:21/To those not having the law I became like one not having the law (though I am not free from God's law but am under Christ's law), so as to win those not having the law.
46:9:22/To the weak I became weak, to win the weak. I have become all things to all people so that by all possible means I might save some.
46:9:23/And I do all this for the sake of the gospel, that I may share in its blessings.
46:9:24/Don't you know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize.
46:9:25/Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last, but we do it to get a crown that will last forever.
46:9:26/Therefore I do not run like someone running aimlessly; I do not fight like a boxer beating the air.
46:9:27/But I discipline my body and keep it under control, lest after preaching to others, I myself should be disqualified.
46:10:1/Furthermore, my brothers and sisters, I don't want you to be unaware that all our ancestors were under the cloud and all passed through the sea;
46:10:2/And they were all baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea;
46:10:3/And they all ate the same spiritual food;
46:10:4/And they all drank the same spiritual drink; for they drank from the spiritual Rock that accompanied them, and that Rock was Christ.
46:10:5/However, God was not pleased with many of them, and they were struck down in the wilderness.
46:10:6/These things occurred as examples for us, so that we would not crave evil things as they did.
46:10:7/Do not become idolaters, as some of them were; as it is written, "The people sat down to eat and drink, and got up to indulge in revelry."
46:10:8/We should not engage in sexual immorality, as some of them did, and in one day twenty-three thousand of them died.
46:10:9/We should not test Christ, as some of them did, and were killed by snakes.
46:10:10/Do not grumble, as some of them did, and were killed by the destroyer.
46:10:11/All these things happened to them as examples, and they were written down as warnings for us, on whom the culmination of the ages has come.
46:10:12/So, if you think you are standing firm, be careful that you don’t fall.
46:10:13/No temptation has overtaken you except what is common to mankind. And God is faithful; He will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, He will also provide a way out so that you can endure it.
46:10:14/Therefore, my dearly loved ones, run away from idolatry.
46:10:15/I am speaking to sensible people; judge for yourselves what I say.
