61:3:12/As you look forward to the day of God and speed its coming. On that day, the heavens will be destroyed by fire, and the elements will melt in the heat.
61:3:13/But in keeping with His promise, we are looking forward to a new heaven and a new earth, where righteousness dwells.
61:3:14/Therefore, dear friends, since you are looking forward to this, make every effort to be found spotless, blameless and at peace with Him.
61:3:15/Consider the patience of our Lord as salvation; just as our dear brother Paul also wrote to you with the wisdom given to him,
61:3:16/As he does in all his letters when he speaks in them of these matters. There are some things in them that are hard to understand, which the ignorant and unstable twist to their own destruction, as they do the other Scriptures.
61:3:17/Therefore, dear friends, since you have been forewarned, be on your guard so that you may not be carried away by the error of the lawless and fall from your secure position.
61:3:18/But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him be glory both now and forever! Amen.
62:1:1/What has been from the start, what we've heard, seen with our own eyes, observed closely, and touched with our hands, concerning the Word of life;
62:1:2/(Because the life was revealed, and we've seen it, and testify to it, and tell you about the eternal life that was with the Father and was revealed to us;)
62:1:3/What we've seen and heard, we share with you, so you too can have a connection with us. And indeed, our connection is with the Father and with his Son Jesus Christ.
62:1:4/We write these things to you so that your joy may be complete.
62:1:5/So, this is the message we've heard from him and announce to you: that God is light, and there's absolutely no darkness in him.
62:1:6/If we claim to have a relationship with him but live in the darkness, we're lying and not practicing the truth.
62:1:7/But if we live in the light, just as he is in the light, we have a relationship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, purifies us from all sin.
62:1:8/If we claim to be without sin, we're fooling ourselves, and the truth isn't in us.
62:1:9/If we admit our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all wrongdoing.
62:1:10/If we claim we haven't sinned, we're calling him a liar, and his message isn't in us.
62:2:1/My dear children, I'm writing this to you so that you won't sin. But if anyone does sin, we have Jesus Christ, the Righteous One, who pleads our case with the Father.
62:2:2/And he is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not only for ours but also for the sins of the entire world.
62:2:3/This is how we know that we truly know him: if we keep his commandments.
62:2:4/Anyone who says, "I know him," but doesn't follow his commandments is lying, and the truth isn't in that person.
62:2:5/But whoever obeys his word, truly in this person the love of God has reached perfection. By this we know we are in him.
62:2:6/Whoever claims to live in him must live as Jesus did.
62:2:7/Dear friends, I'm not writing you a new commandment, but an old one you've had from the start. This old commandment is the message you've heard before.
62:2:8/Yet, I am writing you a new commandment, which is true in him and in you, because the darkness is fading and the true light is already shining.
62:2:9/Anyone who claims to be in the light but hates a brother or sister is still in the darkness.
62:2:10/Whoever loves their brother or sister lives in the light, and there is nothing in them to make them stumble.
62:2:11/But anyone who hates a brother or sister is in the darkness and walks around in the darkness. They do not know where they are going, because the darkness has blinded them.
62:2:12/I am writing to you, dear children, because your sins have been forgiven on account of his name.
62:2:13/I am writing to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning. I am writing to you, young men, because you have overcome the evil one. I write to you, children, because you know the Father.
62:2:14/I have written to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning. I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, the word of God lives in you, and you have overcome the evil one.
62:2:15/Do not love the world or anything in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in them.
62:2:16/For everything in the world—the cravings of sinful people, the lust of their eyes, and their boasting about what they have and do—comes not from the Father but from the world.
62:2:17/And the world with its desires passes away, but whoever does the will of God lives forever.
62:2:18/Dear children, this is the last hour; and as you have heard that the antichrist is coming, even now many antichrists have come. This is how we know it is the last hour.
62:2:19/They went out from us, but they did not really belong to us. For if they had belonged to us, they would have remained with us; but their going showed that none of them belonged to us.
62:2:20/But you have an anointing from the Holy One, and all of you know the truth.
62:2:21/I am not writing to you because you don't know the truth, but because you do know it, and because no lie comes from the truth.
62:2:22/Who is the liar? It is whoever denies that Jesus is the Christ. Such a person is the antichrist—denying the Father and the Son.
62:2:23/No one who denies the Son has the Father; whoever acknowledges the Son has the Father as well.
62:2:24/So then, let what you have heard from the beginning remain in you. If it does, you also will remain in the Son and in the Father.
62:2:25/And this is what he promised us—eternal life.
62:2:26/I am writing these things to you about those who are trying to lead you astray.
62:2:27/As for you, the anointing you received from him remains in you, and you do not need anyone to teach you. But as his anointing teaches you about all things and as that anointing is real, not counterfeit—just as it has taught you, remain in him.
62:2:28/And now, dear children, continue to live in him, so that when he appears we can be confident and unashamed before him at his coming.
62:2:29/If you know that he is righteous, you know that everyone who does what is right has been born of him.
62:3:1/Look at the incredible love the Father has given us, that we should be called children of God: and so we are. The reason the world doesn't recognize us is that it didn't recognize him.
62:3:2/Dear friends, we are now children of God, and what we will be has not yet been revealed. But we know that when he appears, we will be like him, because we will see him as he truly is.
62:3:3/And everyone who has this hope in him purifies themselves, just as he is pure.
62:3:4/Anyone who sins is also breaking the law, because sin is lawlessness.
62:3:5/And you know that he appeared to take away our sins, and in him, there is no sin.
62:3:6/Anyone who remains in him does not keep on sinning. Anyone who keeps on sinning has neither seen him nor known him.
62:3:7/Dear children, let no one deceive you: the one who practices righteousness is righteous, just as he is righteous.
62:3:8/The one who commits sin is of the devil, because the devil has been sinning from the beginning. The Son of God appeared for this purpose: to destroy the works of the devil.
62:3:9/No one born of God makes a practice of sinning, for God's seed abides in him; and he cannot keep on sinning, because he has been born of God.
62:3:10/By this it is evident who are the children of God and who are the children of the devil: anyone who does not practice righteousness is not of God, nor is the one who does not love his brother.
62:3:11/This is the message you heard from the beginning: we should love one another.
62:3:12/Not like Cain, who was of the evil one and murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because his own actions were evil and his brother's were righteous.
62:3:13/Do not be surprised, my brothers and sisters, if the world hates you.
62:3:14/We know that we have passed from death to life because we love each other. Anyone who does not love remains in death.
62:3:15/Anyone who hates a brother or sister is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life residing in him.
62:3:16/This is how we know what love is: Jesus Christ laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for our brothers and sisters.
62:3:17/If anyone has material possessions and sees a brother or sister in need but has no pity on them, how can the love of God be in that person?
62:3:18/Dear children, let us not love with words or speech but with actions and in truth.
62:3:19/This is how we know that we belong to the truth and how we set our hearts at rest in his presence:
62:3:20/If our hearts condemn us, we know that God is greater than our hearts, and he knows everything.
62:3:21/Dear friends, if our hearts do not condemn us, we have confidence before God.
62:3:22/And whatever we ask we receive from him, because we keep his commands and do what pleases him.
62:3:23/And this is his command: to believe in the name of his Son, Jesus Christ, and to love one another as he commanded us.
62:3:24/Whoever keeps his commands lives in him, and he in them. And this is how we know that he lives in us: We know it by the Spirit he gave us.
62:4:1/Dear friends, don't believe every spirit, but test the spirits to see if they are from God, because many false prophets have spread throughout the world.
62:4:2/This is how you can recognize the Spirit of God: Every spirit that acknowledges that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is from God.
62:4:3/And any spirit that does not acknowledge that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh is not from God. This is the spirit of the antichrist, which you have heard is coming and is already in the world now.
62:4:4/You belong to God, my little ones, and have defeated them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.
62:4:5/They belong to the world; that's why they speak from the world's perspective, and the world listens to them.
62:4:6/We are from God. Whoever knows God listens to us; whoever is not from God does not listen to us. By this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of deception.
62:4:7/Dear friends, let's love one another, because love comes from God. Everyone who loves has been born of God and knows God.
62:4:8/Anyone who does not love does not know God, because God is love.
62:4:9/God's love was revealed among us in this way: God sent his one and only Son into the world so that we might live through him.
62:4:10/This is what love is: not that we loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son as a sacrifice to atone for our sins.
62:4:11/Dear friends, if God loved us this much, we also ought to love one another.
62:4:12/No one has ever seen God. But if we love one another, God lives in us, and his love is made complete in us.
62:4:13/This is how we know that we live in him and he in us: He has given us his Spirit.
62:4:14/And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent his Son to be the Savior of the world.
62:4:15/Anyone who confesses that Jesus is the Son of God, God lives in them, and they in God.
62:4:16/And so we know and rely on the love God has for us. God is love, and whoever lives in love lives in God, and God in them.
62:4:17/This is how love is made complete among us so that we will have confidence on the day of judgment: In this world we are like Jesus.
62:4:18/There is no fear in love. But perfect love drives out fear, because fear involves punishment. The one who fears is not made perfect in love.
62:4:19/We love because he first loved us.
62:4:20/If anyone says, "I love God," yet hates their brother or sister, they are lying. For anyone who does not love their brother or sister, whom they have seen, cannot love God, whom they have not seen.
62:4:21/And we have this command from him: Anyone who loves God must also love their brother and sister.
62:5:1/Anyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God, and everyone who loves the parent also loves the child.
62:5:2/We know we love God's children when we love God and obey his commands.
62:5:3/Loving God means keeping his commands, and his commands aren't burdensome.
62:5:4/Anyone born of God conquers the world, and our faith is the victory that conquers the world.
62:5:5/Who can conquer the world except the one who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
62:5:6/This is the one who came through water and blood, Jesus Christ, not with water only but with water and blood. And the Spirit is the one who testifies, because the Spirit is the truth.
62:5:7/There are three that testify in heaven: the Father, the Word, and the Holy Spirit, and these three are one.
62:5:8/And there are three that testify on earth: the Spirit, the water, and the blood, and these three are in agreement.
62:5:9/If we accept human testimony, God's testimony is greater, because it is the testimony God has given about his Son.
62:5:10/Anyone who believes in the Son of God has this testimony in their heart. Anyone who does not believe God has made him out to be a liar, because they have not believed the testimony God has given about his Son.
62:5:11/And this testimony is that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
62:5:12/Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have the Son of God does not have life.
62:5:13/I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God so that you may know you have eternal life.
62:5:14/This is the confidence we have in approaching God: that if we ask anything according to his will, he hears us.
62:5:15/And if we know that he hears us—whatever we ask—we know that we have what we asked of him.
62:5:16/If anyone sees a brother or sister committing a sin that does not lead to death, they should pray and God will give them life. I refer to those whose sin does not lead to death. There is a sin that leads to death. I am not saying that you should pray about that.
62:5:17/All wrongdoing is sin, but there is sin that does not lead to death.
62:5:18/We know that anyone born of God does not continue to sin; the One who was born of God keeps them safe, and the evil one cannot harm them.
62:5:19/We know that we are children of God, and that the whole world is under the control of the evil one.
62:5:20/We know that the Son of God has come and has given us understanding, so that we may know the true one. And we are in the true one, in his Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God and eternal life.
62:5:21/Dear children, keep yourselves from idols.

63:1:2/Because of the truth that lives in us and will be with us forever.
63:1:3/May grace, mercy, and peace be with you from God the Father and from Jesus Christ, the Father's Son, in a spirit of truth and love.
63:1:4/I was overjoyed to find some of your children living in truth, following the command we received from the Father.
63:1:5/And now I ask you, dear lady, not as though I'm writing a new commandment to you, but the one we have had from the start, that we love one another.
63:1:6/And love means living according to his commandments. This is the commandment, just as you have heard from the beginning, you must live by it.
63:1:7/Many deceivers have gone out into the world, those who do not acknowledge that Jesus Christ has come in the flesh. Such a person is a deceiver and an antichrist.
63:1:8/Be careful, so that we don't lose what we have worked for, but that we may be fully rewarded.
63:1:9/Anyone who goes too far and does not remain in the teaching of Christ does not have God. Whoever remains in the teaching has both the Father and the Son.

64:1:4/Nothing makes me happier than hearing that my children are living in truth.
