65:1:1/Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ and brother of James, to those who are made holy by God the Father, kept safe in Jesus Christ, and called:
65:1:2/May mercy, peace, and love be greatly increased among you.
65:1:3/Dear friends, while I was very eager to write to you about our shared salvation, I felt it necessary to urge you to fight passionately for the faith that was once handed down to all the saints.
65:1:4/Some people have sneaked in among you unnoticed—people who were long ago designated for this condemnation. They are godless, turning the grace of our God into a license for immorality and denying our only Master and Lord, Jesus Christ.
65:1:5/I want to remind you, though you already know this, that the Lord, after saving the people from the land of Egypt, later destroyed those who did not believe.
65:1:6/And the angels who did not keep their positions of authority but abandoned their own home—these he has kept in darkness, bound with everlasting chains for judgment on the great Day.
65:1:7/In a similar way, Sodom and Gomorrah and the surrounding towns gave themselves up to sexual immorality and pursued unnatural desires. They serve as an example, suffering the punishment of eternal fire.
65:1:8/In the same way, these dreamers pollute their own bodies, reject authority, and slander celestial beings.
65:1:9/But even Michael the archangel, when he was disputing with the devil about the body of Moses, did not dare to bring a slanderous accusation against him but said, "The Lord rebuke you."
65:1:10/Yet these people slander whatever they do not understand, and the very things they do understand by instinct—as irrational animals do—will destroy them.
65:1:11/Woe to them! They have taken the path of Cain; they have rushed for profit into Balaam's error; they have been destroyed in Korah's rebellion.
65:1:12/These people are blemishes at your love feasts, eating with you without the slightest qualm—shepherds who feed only themselves. They are clouds without rain, blown along by the wind; autumn trees, without fruit and uprooted—twice dead.
65:1:13/They are wild waves of the sea, foaming up their shame; wandering stars, for whom blackest darkness has been reserved forever.
65:1:14/Enoch, the seventh from Adam, also prophesied about them: "Look, the Lord is coming with thousands upon thousands of his holy ones
65:1:15/to judge everyone, and to convict all the ungodly of all the ungodly acts they have done in their ungodliness, and of all the defiant words ungodly sinners have spoken against him."
65:1:16/These people are grumblers and faultfinders; they follow their own evil desires; they boast about themselves and flatter others for their own advantage.
65:1:17/But, dear friends, remember what the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ foretold.
65:1:18/They said to you, "In the last times there will be scoffers who will follow their own ungodly desires."
65:1:19/These are the people who divide you, who follow mere natural instincts and do not have the Spirit.
65:1:20/But you, dear friends, by building yourselves up in your most holy faith and praying in the Holy Spirit,
65:1:21/keep yourselves in God’s love as you wait for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ to bring you to eternal life.
65:1:22/Be merciful to those who doubt;
65:1:23/save others by snatching them from the fire; to others show mercy, mixed with fear—hating even the clothing stained by corrupted flesh.
65:1:24/To him who is able to keep you from stumbling and to present you before his glorious presence without fault and with great joy,
65:1:25/to the only God our Savior be glory, majesty, power, and authority, through Jesus Christ our Lord, before all ages, now and forevermore! Amen.
66:1:1/The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him, to show his servants what must soon take place; and he made it known by sending his angel to his servant John:
66:1:2/Who testified to the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ, including everything he saw.
66:1:3/Blessed is the one who reads aloud, and those who hear the words of this prophecy, and keep what is written in it; for the time is near.
66:1:4/John to the seven churches in Asia: Grace and peace to you from the one who is, who was, and who is to come; and from the seven spirits before his throne;
66:1:5/And from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the first to rise from the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth. To him who loves us and has freed us from our sins by his blood,
66:1:6/And has made us a kingdom, priests to his God and Father; to him be glory and power forever and ever. Amen.
66:1:7/Look, he is coming with the clouds; and every eye will see him, even those who pierced him; and all tribes of the earth will mourn because of him. So it is to be. Amen.
66:1:8/I am the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the end, says the Lord, who is, and who was, and who is to come, the Almighty.
66:1:9/I, John, your brother and partner in the suffering and kingdom and patient endurance that are ours in Jesus, was on the island of Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.
66:1:10/I was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, and I heard behind me a loud voice like a trumpet,
66:1:11/Saying, I am the Alpha and the Omega, the first and the last. And, What you see, write in a book and send it to the seven churches in Asia; to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea.
66:1:12/And when I turned to see the voice that was speaking to me, I saw seven golden lampstands;
66:1:13/And among the lampstands was someone like the Son of Man, dressed in a robe reaching down to his feet and with a golden sash around his chest.
66:1:14/His head and hair were white like wool, as white as snow, and his eyes were like blazing fire;
66:1:15/His feet were like bronze glowing in a furnace, and his voice was like the sound of rushing waters.
66:1:16/In his right hand he held seven stars, and coming out of his mouth was a sharp double-edged sword. His face was like the sun shining in all its brilliance.
66:1:17/When I saw him, I fell at his feet as though dead. Then he placed his right hand on me and said, "Do not be afraid; I am the First and the Last.
66:1:18/I am the Living One; I was dead, and now look, I am alive forever and ever! And I hold the keys of death and Hades.
66:1:19/Write, therefore, what you have seen, what is now and what will take place later;
66:1:20/The mystery of the seven stars that you saw in my right hand and of the seven golden lampstands is this: The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches, and the seven lampstands are the seven churches.
66:2:1/To the angel of the church in Ephesus, write: The one who holds the seven stars in his right hand and walks among the seven golden lampstands says this;
66:2:2/I'm aware of your actions, your hard work, and your endurance. I know you can't tolerate evil people. You've tested those who claim to be apostles but are not, and have exposed them as liars.
66:2:3/You've persevered, shown patience, worked hard for my name, and haven't grown weary.
66:2:4/However, I have something against you: you have abandoned the love you had at first.
66:2:5/Remember how far you have fallen; repent and do the things you did at first. If not, I will come to you soon and remove your lampstand from its place, unless you repent.
66:2:6/But you do have this: you hate the practices of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
66:2:7/Let anyone who has ears listen to what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who overcomes, I will grant the right to eat from the tree of life, which is in the paradise of God.
66:2:8/And to the angel of the church in Smyrna, write: The First and the Last, who died and came to life, says this;
66:2:9/I know your deeds, your hard times, and your poverty—yet you are rich. I am aware of the slander by those who say they are Jews and are not, but are a synagogue of Satan.
66:2:10/Do not fear what you are about to suffer. Look, the devil is about to throw some of you into prison to test you, and you will face persecution for ten days. Be faithful even to the point of death, and I will give you the crown of life.
66:2:11/Let anyone who has ears listen to what the Spirit says to the churches. The one who overcomes will not be harmed by the second death.
66:2:12/And to the angel of the church in Pergamum, write: The one who has the sharp two-edged sword says this;
66:2:13/I know where you live—where Satan's throne is. Yet you hold fast to my name and did not deny your faith in me, even in the days of Antipas, my faithful witness, who was killed among you, where Satan lives.
66:2:14/Yet, I have a few things against you: you have some there who hold to the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to put a stumbling block before the children of Israel, to eat food sacrificed to idols, and to practice sexual immorality.
66:2:15/So you also have some who hold to the teaching of the Nicolaitans, which I hate.
66:2:16/Repent; otherwise, I will come to you soon and fight against them with the sword of my mouth.
66:2:17/Let anyone who has ears listen to what the Spirit says to the churches. To the one who overcomes, I will give some of the hidden manna. I will also give him a white stone with a new name written on it, known only to the one who receives it.
66:2:18/And to the angel of the church in Thyatira, write: The Son of God, who has eyes like a flame of fire, and feet like burnished bronze, says this;
66:2:19/I know your deeds, your love and faith, your service and perseverance, and that your latter works exceed the first.
66:2:20/However, I have this against you: you tolerate that woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess and is teaching and seducing my servants to practice sexual immorality and to eat food sacrificed to idols.
66:2:21/I gave her time to repent, but she refuses to repent of her sexual immorality.
66:2:22/Behold, I will throw her onto a sickbed, and those who commit adultery with her into great tribulation unless they repent of her works.
66:2:23/And I will strike her children dead. And all the churches will know that I am the one who searches minds and hearts, and I will give to each of you according to your deeds.
66:2:24/But to the rest of you in Thyatira, who do not hold this teaching, who have not learned what some call the deep things of Satan, to you I say, I do not lay on you any other burden.
66:2:25/Only hold on to what you have until I come.
66:2:26/To the one who overcomes and keeps my works until the end, I will give authority over the nations.
66:2:27/He will rule them with an iron scepter; he will dash them to pieces like pottery—just as I have received authority from my Father.
66:2:28/And I will give him the morning star.
66:2:29/Let anyone who has ears listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.
66:3:1/Write to the angel of the church in Sardis: The one who has the seven Spirits of God and the seven stars says this: I know your actions, that you have a reputation for being alive, but you are actually dead.
66:3:2/Stay alert and strengthen what remains, which is about to die, for I have found your deeds incomplete in the sight of God.
66:3:3/Remember therefore how you have received and heard; hold it tight and turn back. If you don't stay alert, I will come like a thief, and you won't know when I will arrive.
66:3:4/Yet in Sardis, there are a few who haven't soiled their clothes; they will walk with me in white, for they are deserving.
66:3:5/The one who conquers will be dressed in white clothes; I will never erase his name from the book of life, but will acknowledge his name before my Father and his angels.
66:3:6/Anyone with ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.
66:3:7/Write to the angel of the church in Philadelphia: The Holy One, the True One, the one who has the key of David, who opens and no one can shut, and who shuts and no one can open, says this:
66:3:8/I know your actions. Look, I have placed before you an open door that no one can shut. You have little power, yet you have kept my word and have not denied my name.
66:3:9/See, I will make those from the synagogue of Satan, who claim they are Jews but are not, but lie—indeed, I will make them come and bow down before your feet, and they will learn that I have loved you.
66:3:10/Because you have kept my command to endure patiently, I will also keep you from the hour of trial that is going to come on the whole world to test those who live on the earth.
66:3:11/I am coming quickly. Hold on to what you have, so that no one will take your crown.
66:3:12/The one who conquers, I will make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he will never leave it. I will write on him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which is coming down out of heaven from my God; and I will also write on him my new name.
66:3:13/Anyone with ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.
66:3:14/Write to the angel of the church in Laodicea: The Amen, the faithful and true witness, the originator of God's creation, says this:
66:3:15/I know your actions, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were either one or the other!
66:3:16/So, because you are lukewarm—neither hot nor cold—I am about to spit you out of my mouth.
66:3:17/You say, 'I am rich; I have acquired wealth and do not need a thing.' But you do not realize that you are wretched, pitiful, poor, blind, and naked.
66:3:18/I advise you to buy from me gold refined in the fire so you can become rich; and white clothes to wear, so you can cover your shameful nakedness; and salve to put on your eyes, so you can see.
66:3:19/Those whom I love, I reprove and discipline. So be earnest and turn back.
66:3:20/Look, I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears my voice and opens the door, I will come in and dine with him, and he with me.
66:3:21/To the one who conquers, I will give the right to sit with me on my throne, just as I conquered and sat down with my Father on his throne.
66:3:22/Anyone with ears should listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.
66:4:1/After this I looked, and there was an open door in heaven: the first voice I heard was like a trumpet speaking to me, saying, "Come up here, and I will show you what must happen after this."
66:4:2/And immediately I was in the spirit: and, behold, a throne was set in heaven, and one sat on the throne.
66:4:3/The one sitting on the throne shone like jasper and carnelian, and around the throne was a rainbow that looked like an emerald.
66:4:4/Surrounding the throne were twenty-four seats, and on the seats, I saw twenty-four elders dressed in white clothes, with golden crowns on their heads.
66:4:5/From the throne came flashes of lightning, rumblings, and peals of thunder. In front of the throne, seven lamps were blazing, which are the seven spirits of God.
66:4:6/In front of the throne there was what looked like a sea of glass, clear as crystal. In the center, around the throne, were four living creatures, covered with eyes in front and back.
66:4:7/The first living creature was like a lion, the second was like an ox, the third had a face like a human, and the fourth was like a flying eagle.
66:4:8/Each of the four living creatures had six wings and was covered with eyes all around, even under its wings. Day and night they never stop saying: "Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God Almighty, who was, and is, and is to come."
66:4:9/Whenever the living creatures give glory, honor, and thanks to the one who sits on the throne, who lives forever and ever,
66:4:10/The twenty-four elders fall down before the one who sits on the throne and worship the one who lives forever and ever. They lay their crowns before the throne, saying,
66:4:11/"You are worthy, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things, and by your will they were created and have their being."
66:5:1/And I saw in the right hand of him who sat on the throne a book written inside and on the back, sealed with seven seals.
66:5:2/And I saw a mighty angel proclaiming loudly, Who is worthy to open the book, and to break its seals?
66:5:3/And no one in heaven, on earth, or under the earth, could open the book or even look at it.
66:5:4/And I cried a lot, because no one was found worthy to open and read the book, or to look at it.
66:5:5/And one of the elders says to me, Don't cry: look, the Lion from the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed to open the book and its seven seals.
66:5:6/And I saw, and there, in the center of the throne and the four creatures, and among the elders, stood a Lamb as though it had been slain, with seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent out into all the earth.
66:5:7/And he came and took the book from the right hand of him who sat on the throne.
66:5:8/And when he had taken the book, the four creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each holding a harp, and golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.
66:5:9/And they sang a new song, saying, You are worthy to take the book and to break its seals: for you were slain, and with your blood you purchased for God persons from every tribe and language and people and nation;
66:5:10/And you have made them to be a kingdom and priests to our God, and they will reign on the earth.
66:5:11/And I looked, and I heard the voice of many angels around the throne and the creatures and the elders: and their number was myriads of myriads, and thousands of thousands;
66:5:12/Saying loudly, Worthy is the Lamb who was slain to receive power, and wealth, and wisdom, and might, and honor, and glory, and blessing.
66:5:13/And every creature in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and in the sea, and all that is in them, I heard saying, Blessing, and honor, and glory, and power, be to him who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb forever and ever.
66:5:14/And the four creatures said, Amen. And the twenty-four elders fell down and worshiped him who lives forever and ever.
66:6:1/And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying, Come and see.
66:6:2/And I saw, and look, a white horse: and the one sitting on it had a bow; and a crown was given to him: and he set out conquering, and to conquer.
66:6:3/And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.
66:6:4/And there went out another horse that was red: and authority was given to the one sitting on it to remove peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and a great sword was given to him.
66:6:5/And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see. And I saw, and look a black horse; and the one sitting on it had a pair of scales in his hand.
66:6:6/And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; and make sure you do not harm the oil and the wine.
66:6:7/And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth beast say, Come and see.
66:6:8/And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And authority was given to them over a fourth of the earth, to kill with the sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.
66:6:9/And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they held:
66:6:10/And they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, do you not judge and avenge our blood on those who dwell on the earth?
66:6:11/And white robes were given to each of them; and it was said to them, that they should rest a little while longer, until their fellow servants also and their brothers, who were to be killed as they were, should be completed.
66:6:12/And I saw when he had opened the sixth seal, and, look, there was a great earthquake; and the sun turned black like sackcloth made of hair, and the moon became like blood;
66:6:13/And the stars of heaven fell to the earth, just as a fig tree drops its unripe figs when shaken by a strong wind.
66:6:14/And the sky receded like a scroll being rolled up; and every mountain and island were moved from their places.
66:6:15/And the kings of the earth, and the great men, and the rich men, and the chief captains, and the mighty men, and every slave, and every free man, hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains;
66:6:16/And said to the mountains and rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of the one sitting on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb:
66:6:17/For the great day of his wrath has come; and who can stand?
66:7:1/After this, I saw four angels standing at the earth's four corners, holding back the four winds so that no wind would blow on the earth, the sea, or any tree.
66:7:2/Then I saw another angel coming up from the east, carrying the seal of the living God. He shouted to the four angels who had the power to harm the earth and the sea,
66:7:3/"Do not harm the earth, the sea, or the trees until we have placed a seal on the foreheads of God's servants."
66:7:4/And I heard the number of those who were sealed: 144,000 from all the tribes of Israel.
66:7:5/From the tribe of Judah, 12,000 were sealed. From the tribe of Reuben, 12,000. From the tribe of Gad, 12,000.
66:7:6/From the tribe of Asher, 12,000. From the tribe of Naphtali, 12,000. From the tribe of Manasseh, 12,000.
66:7:7/From the tribe of Simeon, 12,000. From the tribe of Levi, 12,000. From the tribe of Issachar, 12,000.
66:7:8/From the tribe of Zebulun, 12,000. From the tribe of Joseph, 12,000. From the tribe of Benjamin, 12,000.
66:7:9/After this, I saw a vast crowd, too large to count, from every nation, tribe, people, and language, standing before the throne and before the Lamb. They were wearing white robes and holding palm branches in their hands.
66:7:10/And they shouted, "Salvation belongs to our God who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb."
66:7:11/All the angels were standing around the throne, along with the elders and the four living creatures. They fell on their faces before the throne and worshiped God,
66:7:12/Saying, "Amen! Praise, glory, wisdom, thanks, honor, power, and strength be to our God forever and ever. Amen."
66:7:13/Then one of the elders asked me, "Who are these in white robes, and where did they come from?"
66:7:14/I answered, "Sir, you know." And he told me, "These are the ones who have come out of the great tribulation; they have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
66:7:15/That's why they are before God's throne and serve Him day and night in His temple; and He who sits on the throne will shelter them with His presence.
66:7:16/They will no longer be hungry or thirsty; the sun will not beat down on them, nor any scorching heat.
66:7:17/For the Lamb at the center of the throne will be their shepherd; He will lead them to springs of living water. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes."
66:8:1/When he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.
66:8:2/I saw the seven angels who stand before God; they were given seven trumpets.
66:8:3/Another angel came and stood at the altar, holding a golden censer; he was given a lot of incense to offer along with the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar in front of the throne.
66:8:4/The smoke of the incense, mixed with the prayers of the saints, rose up before God from the angel's hand.
66:8:5/The angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and threw it onto the earth: there were voices, thunder, lightning, and an earthquake.
66:8:6/The seven angels with the seven trumpets got ready to blow them.
66:8:7/The first angel blew his trumpet, and hail and fire mixed with blood were thrown down to the earth. A third of the trees were burned up, and all the green grass was burned up.
66:8:8/The second angel blew his trumpet, and something like a huge mountain ablaze with fire was thrown into the sea: a third of the sea turned into blood;
66:8:9/A third of the living creatures in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.
66:8:10/The third angel blew his trumpet, and a great star, blazing like a torch, fell from the sky on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water;
66:8:11/The name of the star is Wormwood. A third of the waters turned bitter, and many people died from the waters because they had become bitter.
66:8:12/The fourth angel blew his trumpet, and a third of the sun was struck, a third of the moon, and a third of the stars, so that a third of them turned dark. A third of the day was without light, and also a third of the night.
66:8:13/I looked, and heard an angel flying through the sky, shouting loudly, "Woe, woe, woe to the inhabitants of the earth, because of the remaining trumpet blasts of the three angels who are about to blow their trumpets!"
66:9:1/And the fifth angel blew his trumpet, and I saw a star fall from heaven to earth: and he was given the key to the abyss.
66:9:2/He opened the abyss, and smoke rose from it like the smoke from a massive furnace; the sun and the air were darkened by the smoke.
66:9:3/From the smoke, locusts descended upon the earth, and they were given power like that of earth's scorpions.
66:9:4/They were instructed not to harm the grass, any plant, or any tree, but only those people who did not have God's seal on their foreheads.
66:9:5/They were allowed not to kill them but to torment them for five months; and their torment was like the sting of a scorpion when it strikes a person.
66:9:6/During those days, people will seek death but will not find it; they will long to die, but death will elude them.
66:9:7/The locusts looked like horses prepared for battle; on their heads were what looked like crowns of gold, and their faces resembled human faces.
66:9:8/Their hair was like women's hair, and their teeth were like lions' teeth.
66:9:9/They wore armor like iron breastplates, and the sound of their wings was like the thundering of many horses and chariots rushing into battle.
66:9:10/They had tails and stings like scorpions, and their power was to harm people for five months.
66:9:11/They had a king over them, the angel of the abyss, whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon, and in Greek, Apollyon.
66:9:12/The first woe has passed; behold, two more woes are still to come.
66:9:13/And the sixth angel blew his trumpet, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar before God,
66:9:14/Saying to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, "Release the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates."
66:9:15/And the four angels who had been prepared for this moment, day, month, and year were released to kill a third of mankind.
66:9:16/The number of mounted troops was two hundred million; I heard their number.
66:9:17/In the vision, I saw the horses and their riders wearing breastplates of fiery red, dark blue, and sulfur yellow; the heads of the horses resembled the heads of lions, and from their mouths came fire, smoke, and sulfur.
66:9:18/A third of mankind was killed by these three plagues—by the fire, the smoke, and the sulfur that came out of their mouths.
66:9:19/For the power of the horses is in their mouths and in their tails; for their tails are like serpents, with heads, and with them they inflict injury.
66:9:20/And the rest of mankind, who were not killed by these plagues, did not repent of the works of their hands; they did not stop worshiping demons, and idols of gold, silver, bronze, stone, and wood—idols that cannot see or hear or walk.
66:9:21/Nor did they repent of their murders, their magic arts, their sexual immorality, or their thefts.
66:10:1/I saw another powerful angel descending from heaven, wrapped in a cloud, with a rainbow over his head. His face shone like the sun, and his feet were like pillars of fire.
66:10:2/He held a small, open book in his hand. He placed his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land.
66:10:3/He shouted loudly, like a roaring lion. When he shouted, seven thunders spoke out.
66:10:4/After the seven thunders spoke, I was about to write down what they said, but I heard a voice from heaven instructing me, "Keep secret what the seven thunders said and do not write it down."
66:10:5/The angel I saw standing on the sea and the land raised his hand toward heaven.
66:10:6/He swore by the eternal one who created the heavens, everything in them, the earth, everything on it, and the sea, everything in it, declaring that there would be no more delay.
66:10:7/But when the seventh angel is about to sound his trumpet, God's mystery will be completed, just as He announced to His prophets.
66:10:8/Then the voice I heard from heaven spoke to me again, saying, "Go, take the open book from the hand of the angel standing on the sea and the land."
66:10:9/I approached the angel and asked him for the small book. He told me, "Take it and eat it. It will turn your stomach sour, but in your mouth, it will be as sweet as honey."
66:10:10/I took the small book from the angel's hand and ate it. It was sweet as honey in my mouth, but when I had eaten it, my stomach turned sour.
66:10:11/He then told me, "You must prophesy again about many peoples, nations, languages, and kings."
66:11:1/I was given a measuring rod that looked like a staff, and the angel stood by, saying, "Get up and measure the temple of God, the altar, and those who worship there.
66:11:2/But exclude the outer court of the temple; do not measure it, for it has been given to the nations, and they will trample the holy city for forty-two months.
66:11:3/I will empower my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for 1,260 days, dressed in sackcloth."
66:11:4/These witnesses are the two olive trees and the two lampstands that stand before the Lord of the earth.
66:11:5/If anyone tries to harm them, fire flows from their mouths and consumes their enemies. If anyone tries to harm them, they must be killed in this way.
66:11:6/They have the power to shut the sky so that no rain falls during the days of their prophecy, and they have power over the waters to turn them into blood and to strike the earth with every kind of plague as often as they desire.
66:11:7/When they have finished their testimony, the beast that comes up from the Abyss will wage war against them, overcome them, and kill them.
66:11:8/Their bodies will lie in the main street of the great city, which symbolically is called Sodom and Egypt, where also their Lord was crucified.
66:11:9/People from different peoples, tribes, languages, and nations will gaze at their dead bodies for three and a half days, and will not allow their bodies to be placed in a tomb.
66:11:10/Those who live on the earth will rejoice over them and celebrate, sending gifts to one another, because these two prophets had tormented those living on the earth.
66:11:11/But after three and a half days, the breath of life from God entered them, and they stood on their feet; and terror struck those who saw them.
66:11:12/Then they heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, "Come up here." And they went up to heaven in a cloud, while their enemies watched them.
66:11:13/At that very hour there was a severe earthquake, and a tenth of the city collapsed. Seven thousand people were killed in the earthquake, and the survivors were terrified and gave glory to the God of heaven.
66:11:14/The second woe has passed; behold, the third woe is coming quickly.
66:11:15/Then the seventh angel sounded his trumpet; and there were loud voices in heaven, saying, "The kingdoms of the world have become the kingdoms of our Lord and of his Messiah, and he will reign forever and ever."
66:11:16/And the twenty-four elders, who were seated on their thrones before God, fell on their faces and worshiped God,
66:11:17/Saying, "We thank you, Lord God Almighty, who is, and who was, and who is to come, because you have taken your great power and begun to reign.
66:11:18/The nations were enraged, but your wrath has come, and the time for the dead to be judged, and to reward your servants the prophets, the saints, and those who fear your name, both small and great, and to destroy those who destroy the earth."
66:11:19/And the temple of God in heaven was opened, and the ark of his covenant was seen within his temple. There were flashes of lightning, rumblings, peals of thunder, an earthquake, and severe hail.
66:12:1/Then a great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet, and a crown of twelve stars on her head.
66:12:2/And she was pregnant, crying out in the pain and agony of giving birth.
66:12:3/Another sign appeared in heaven: an enormous red dragon with seven heads and ten horns, and on his heads seven crowns.
66:12:4/His tail swept a third of the stars out of the sky and flung them to the earth. The dragon stood in front of the woman who was about to give birth, so that he might devour her child the moment it was born.
66:12:5/She gave birth to a son, a male child, who will rule all the nations with an iron scepter. And her child was snatched up to God and to his throne.
66:12:6/The woman fled into the wilderness to a place prepared for her by God, where she might be taken care of for 1,260 days.
66:12:7/Then war broke out in heaven. Michael and his angels fought against the dragon, and the dragon and his angels fought back.
66:12:8/But he was not strong enough, and they lost their place in heaven.
66:12:9/The great dragon was hurled down—that ancient serpent called the devil, or Satan, who leads the whole world astray. He was hurled to the earth, and his angels with him.
66:12:10/Then I heard a loud voice in heaven say: "Now have come the salvation and the power and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Messiah. For the accuser of our brothers and sisters, who accuses them before our God day and night, has been hurled down.
66:12:11/They triumphed over him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony; they did not love their lives so much as to shrink from death.
66:12:12/Therefore rejoice, you heavens and you who dwell in them! But woe to the earth and the sea, because the devil has gone down to you! He is filled with fury, because he knows that his time is short."
66:12:13/When the dragon saw that he had been hurled to the earth, he pursued the woman who had given birth to the male child.
66:12:14/The woman was given the two wings of a great eagle, so that she might fly to the place prepared for her in the wilderness, where she would be taken care of for a time, times and half a time, out of the serpent's reach.
66:12:15/Then from his mouth the serpent spewed water like a river, to overtake the woman and sweep her away with the torrent.
66:12:16/But the earth helped the woman by opening its mouth and swallowing the river that the dragon had spewed out of his mouth.
66:12:17/Then the dragon was enraged at the woman and went off to wage war against the rest of her offspring—those who keep God's commands and hold fast their testimony about Jesus.
66:13:1/I stood on the seashore and saw a beast rise from the sea with seven heads and ten horns, and on its horns were ten crowns, and on its heads were blasphemous names.
66:13:2/The beast I saw resembled a leopard, but it had feet like a bear and a mouth like a lion. The dragon gave it his power, throne, and great authority.
66:13:3/One of its heads seemed to have been fatally wounded, but the deadly wound was healed. The whole world was amazed and followed the beast.
66:13:4/People worshiped the dragon because he had given authority to the beast, and they also worshiped the beast, asking, "Who is like the beast? Who can wage war against it?"
66:13:5/The beast was given a mouth to utter proud words and blasphemies and to exercise its authority for forty-two months.
66:13:6/It opened its mouth to blaspheme God, slandering his name, his dwelling place, and those who live in heaven.
66:13:7/It was allowed to wage war against God's holy people and to conquer them. It was given authority over every tribe, people, language, and nation.
66:13:8/All inhabitants of the earth will worship the beast—all whose names have not been written in the Lamb’s book of life, the Lamb who was slain from the creation of the world.
66:13:9/Let anyone who has ears listen.
66:13:10/If anyone is to go into captivity, into captivity they will go. If anyone is to be killed with the sword, with the sword they will be killed. This calls for patient endurance and faithfulness on the part of God's people.
66:13:11/Then I saw another beast coming out of the earth. It had two horns like a lamb, but it spoke like a dragon.
66:13:12/It exercised all the authority of the first beast on its behalf, and made the earth and its inhabitants worship the first beast, whose fatal wound had been healed.
66:13:13/And it performed great signs, even causing fire to come down from heaven to earth in full view of the people.
66:13:14/Because of the signs it was given power to perform on behalf of the first beast, it deceived the inhabitants of the earth. It ordered them to set up an image in honor of the beast who was wounded by the sword and yet lived.
66:13:15/The second beast was given power to give breath to the image of the first beast, so that the image could speak and cause all who refused to worship the image to be killed.
66:13:16/It forced all people, great and small, rich and poor, free and slave, to receive a mark on their right hand or on their foreheads,
66:13:17/so that no one could buy or sell unless they had the mark, which is the name of the beast or the number of its name.
66:13:18/Here is a call for wisdom: Let the one who has insight calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a person. Its number is six hundred sixty-six.
66:14:1/And I looked, and there, a Lamb stood on Mount Zion, and with him one hundred forty-four thousand, having his Father’s name written on their foreheads.
66:14:2/And I heard a voice from heaven, like the sound of many waters, and like the sound of loud thunder: and I heard the sound of harpists playing their harps.
66:14:3/And they sang what seemed to be a new song before the throne, and before the four creatures, and the elders: and no one could learn that song except the one hundred and forty-four thousand, who were redeemed from the earth.
66:14:4/These are the ones who were not defiled with women; for they are virgins. These are the ones who follow the Lamb wherever he goes. These were redeemed from humanity, being the firstfruits to God and to the Lamb.
66:14:5/And no deceit was found in their mouths: for they are blameless before the throne of God.
66:14:6/And I saw another angel flying through the sky, having the eternal gospel to proclaim to those who live on the earth, and to every nation, tribe, language, and people,
66:14:7/Saying in a loud voice, Fear God, and give glory to him; for the time of his judgment has come: and worship him who made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and the springs of water.
66:14:8/And another angel followed, saying, Babylon has fallen, has fallen, that great city, because she made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her immorality.
66:14:9/And the third angel followed them, saying in a loud voice, If anyone worships the beast and his image, and receives his mark on their forehead, or on their hand,
66:14:10/They will drink of the wine of God's wrath, which is poured out full strength into the cup of his anger; and they will be tormented with fire and sulfur in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:
66:14:11/And the smoke of their torment rises forever and ever: and they have no rest day or night, who worship the beast and his image, and anyone who receives the mark of his name.
66:14:12/This calls for the endurance of the saints: here are those who keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.
66:14:13/And I heard a voice from heaven saying to me, Write, Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on: Yes, says the Spirit, so they may rest from their labors; and their deeds follow them.
66:14:14/And I looked, and behold a white cloud, and upon the cloud one sat like the Son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.
66:14:15/And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him who sat on the cloud, Thrust in your sickle, and reap: for the time has come for you to reap; for the harvest of the earth is ripe.
66:14:16/And he who sat on the cloud thrust in his sickle on the earth; and the earth was reaped.
66:14:17/And another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, he also having a sharp sickle.
66:14:18/And another angel came out from the altar, who had authority over fire; and cried with a loud voice to him who had the sharp sickle, saying, Thrust in your sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth; for her grapes are fully ripe.
66:14:19/And the angel thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and threw it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.
66:14:20/And the winepress was trodden outside the city, and blood flowed from the winepress, up to the horse bridles, for a distance of one thousand six hundred stadia.
66:15:1/And I saw another sign in heaven, amazing and wonderful, seven angels holding the seven final plagues; because with them, God's wrath is fully realized.
66:15:2/And I saw what looked like a sea of glass mixed with fire: and those who had triumphed over the beast, its image, its mark, and the number of its name, standing on the sea of glass, holding God's harps.
66:15:3/And they sing the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, "Your works are incredible and marvelous, Lord God Almighty; your ways are just and true, you King of the saints."
66:15:4/Who wouldn't fear you, O Lord, and honor your name? For you alone are holy: all nations will come and bow down before you; because your judgments are revealed.
66:15:5/And after that, I looked, and, behold, the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened:
66:15:6/And the seven angels emerged from the temple, carrying the seven plagues, dressed in pure and white linen, and with golden sashes around their chests.
66:15:7/And one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden bowls filled with the wrath of God, who lives forever and ever.
66:15:8/And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God, and from his power; and no one could enter the temple, until the seven plagues of the seven angels were completed.
66:16:1/And I heard a loud voice from the temple telling the seven angels, "Go and pour out the bowls of God's wrath on the earth."
66:16:2/The first angel went and poured out his bowl on the earth; and painful and terrible sores appeared on the people who had the mark of the beast and worshipped its image.
66:16:3/The second angel poured out his bowl on the sea; and it turned into blood like that of a dead person: and every living thing in the sea died.
66:16:4/The third angel poured out his bowl on the rivers and springs of water; and they turned into blood.
66:16:5/And I heard the angel of the waters say, "You are just, O Lord, the One who is, who was, and who is to come, because You have made these judgments.
66:16:6/Because they have spilled the blood of saints and prophets, You have given them blood to drink; they deserve it."
66:16:7/And I heard another voice from the altar say, "Yes, Lord God Almighty, true and just are Your judgments."
66:16:8/The fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun; and it was allowed to scorch people with fire.
66:16:9/People were scorched by intense heat, and they cursed the name of God, who had authority over these plagues, but they refused to repent and glorify Him.
66:16:10/The fifth angel poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast; and its kingdom was plunged into darkness; and people gnawed their tongues in agony,
66:16:11/And cursed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores, yet they did not turn from their evil actions.
66:16:12/The sixth angel poured out his bowl on the great river Euphrates; and its water was dried up, to prepare the way for the kings from the east.
66:16:13/And I saw three impure spirits like frogs coming out of the mouth of the dragon, out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.
66:16:14/For they are demonic spirits performing signs, who go out to the kings of the whole world, to gather them for the battle on the great day of God Almighty.
66:16:15/"Look, I come like a thief! Blessed is the one who stays awake and keeps their clothes on, so they don't walk around naked and expose their shame."
66:16:16/And they gathered them together to the place called in Hebrew, Armageddon.
66:16:17/The seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air; and a loud voice came out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, "It is finished."
66:16:18/And there were voices, thunderings, and lightnings; and there was a massive earthquake, such as had not occurred since humans were on the earth, so powerful and so great.
66:16:19/And the great city was split into three parts, and the cities of the nations collapsed: and great Babylon was remembered before God, to give her the cup of the wine of the fierceness of His wrath.
66:16:20/And every island disappeared, and the mountains could not be found.
66:16:21/And huge hailstones, about the weight of a talent, fell from heaven on people, and people cursed God because of the plague of the hail; for the plague was extremely severe.
66:17:1/Then one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and spoke with me. He said, "Come here; I will show you the judgment of the notorious prostitute who sits on many waters."
66:17:2/She with whom the kings of the earth have engaged in sexual immorality, and the inhabitants of the earth have been intoxicated with the wine of her immorality.
66:17:3/He transported me in the spirit to a wilderness: and I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast that was covered with blasphemous names, having seven heads and ten horns.
66:17:4/The woman was dressed in purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold, precious stones, and pearls, holding a golden cup in her hand filled with detestable things and the impurities of her sexual immorality.
66:17:5/And on her forehead was written a name, a mystery: "BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF PROSTITUTES AND OF THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH."
66:17:6/I saw the woman drunk with the blood of the saints and with the blood of the witnesses of Jesus. When I saw her, I was utterly amazed.
66:17:7/Then the angel said to me, "Why are you amazed? I will explain to you the mystery of the woman and of the beast that carries her, which has the seven heads and ten horns.
66:17:8/The beast you saw was, and is not, and is about to rise from the abyss and go to destruction. And those who live on the earth, whose names have not been written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, will marvel when they see the beast, because it was, and is not, and yet will come.
66:17:9/This calls for a mind with wisdom: The seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman sits.
66:17:10/There are also seven kings: five have fallen, one is, the other has not yet come; and when he comes, he must remain for only a little while.
66:17:11/And the beast that was, and is not, is himself also the eighth, and is of the seven, and he goes to destruction.
66:17:12/The ten horns you saw are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom, but they receive authority as kings for one hour along with the beast.
66:17:13/These are of one mind, and they hand over their power and authority to the beast.
66:17:14/They will wage war against the Lamb, and the Lamb will conquer them because He is Lord of lords and King of kings, and those with Him are called, chosen, and faithful."
66:17:15/Then he said to me, "The waters you saw, where the prostitute sits, are peoples, multitudes, nations, and languages.
66:17:16/And the ten horns you saw on the beast, they will hate the prostitute, make her desolate and naked, devour her flesh, and burn her up with fire.
66:17:17/For God has put it into their hearts to carry out His purpose by being of one mind and handing over their kingdom to the beast, until the words of God are fulfilled.
66:17:18/And the woman you saw is the great city that has dominion over the kings of the earth."
66:18:1/After these events, I saw another angel descending from heaven, endowed with immense power; and the earth was illuminated by his splendor.
66:18:2/He shouted with a powerful voice, saying, "Babylon the great has fallen, has fallen, and has become a dwelling for demons, a haunt for every foul spirit, and a prison for every unclean and detested bird."
66:18:3/For all nations have indulged in the intoxicating wrath of her immorality, and the kings of the earth have engaged in immorality with her, while the merchants of the earth grew wealthy from her excessive luxuries.
66:18:4/Then I heard another voice from heaven, saying, "Leave her, my people, so you won't share in her sins, or suffer from her plagues."
66:18:5/Her sins have piled up to heaven, and God has remembered her wrongdoings.
66:18:6/Pay her back as she has paid others, and repay her twice as much for her deeds; in the cup she has filled, pour double for her.
66:18:7/As much as she has glorified herself and indulged in luxury, give her an equal measure of torment and mourning. For she says in her heart, 'I sit as a queen, I am not a widow, and I will never see sorrow.'
66:18:8/Therefore, her plagues will come in a single day—death, mourning, and famine—and she will be completely consumed by fire. For strong is the Lord God who judges her.
66:18:9/And the kings of the earth, who have engaged in immorality and indulged in luxury with her, will weep and mourn for her when they see the smoke of her burning,
66:18:10/Standing at a distance for fear of her torment, saying, 'Woe, woe, the great city Babylon, the mighty city! For in one hour your judgment has come.'
66:18:11/And the merchants of the earth will weep and mourn over her, because no one buys their goods anymore:
66:18:12/The goods of gold, silver, precious stones, pearls, fine linen, purple, silk, scarlet, all kinds of scented wood, all kinds of articles made of ivory, all kinds of articles made of costly wood, bronze, iron, and marble,
66:18:13/And cinnamon, spices, incense, myrrh, frankincense, wine, olive oil, fine flour, wheat, cattle, sheep, horses, chariots, and bodies and souls of people.
66:18:14/The fruits your soul longed for have gone from you, and all your delicacies and splendors have vanished, never to be found again.
66:18:15/The merchants of these goods, who gained wealth from her, will stand at a distance for fear of her torment, weeping and mourning,
66:18:16/And saying, 'Woe, woe, the great city, dressed in fine linen, purple, and scarlet, adorned with gold, precious stones, and pearls!
66:18:17/For in one hour such great wealth has been laid waste.' And every shipmaster, all who travel by ship, sailors, and as many as trade on the sea, stood at a distance,
66:18:18/And cried out when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, 'What city was like this great city!'
66:18:19/And they threw dust on their heads and cried out, weeping and mourning, saying, 'Woe, woe, the great city, where all who had ships at sea grew rich from her wealth! For in one hour she has been devastated.'
66:18:20/Celebrate over her, O heaven, and you holy apostles and prophets; for God has executed your judgment on her.
66:18:21/Then a mighty angel picked up a stone like a huge millstone and threw it into the sea, saying, "With such violence, the great city Babylon will be thrown down, never to be found again.
66:18:22/And the sound of harpists, musicians, flutists, and trumpeters will never be heard in you again; no craftsman of any trade will ever be found in you again; and the sound of a millstone will never be heard in you again;
66:18:23/And the light of a lamp will never shine in you again; and the voice of the bridegroom and bride will never be heard in you again. For your merchants were the world's important people; by your magic spell all the nations were led astray.
66:18:24/And in her was found the blood of prophets, saints, and all who have been slain on the earth."
66:19:1/After these events, I heard a loud voice of many people in heaven, saying, "Hallelujah; Salvation, glory, honor, and power belong to our Lord God:
66:19:2/For his judgments are true and just: he has judged the great prostitute, who corrupted the earth with her immorality, and has avenged the blood of his servants at her hand.
66:19:3/And again they said, "Hallelujah." And her smoke rose up forever and ever.
66:19:4/And the twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down and worshiped God who sat on the throne, saying, "Amen; Hallelujah."
66:19:5/And a voice came from the throne, saying, "Praise our God, all his servants, and those who fear him, both small and great."
66:19:6/And I heard what sounded like a great multitude, like the roar of rushing waters and like loud peals of thunder, shouting, "Hallelujah: for the Lord God Almighty reigns.
66:19:7/Let's be joyful and rejoice, and give honor to him: for the wedding of the Lamb has come, and his bride has made herself ready."
66:19:8/And she was given fine linen to wear, bright and clean: for the fine linen represents the righteous acts of the saints.
66:19:9/And he said to me, "Write, 'Blessed are those who are invited to the wedding supper of the Lamb.'" And he said to me, "These are the true words of God."
66:19:10/And I fell at his feet to worship him. But he said to me, "Don't do that: I am a fellow servant with you and your brothers who hold to the testimony of Jesus. Worship God: for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy."
66:19:11/And I saw heaven opened, and there was a white horse; and the one sitting on it is called Faithful and True, and he judges and wages war in righteousness.
66:19:12/His eyes were like blazing fire, and on his head were many crowns; and he had a name written that no one knows but himself.
66:19:13/And he is dressed in a robe dipped in blood: and his name is known as The Word of God.
66:19:14/And the armies in heaven followed him on white horses, dressed in fine linen, white and clean.
66:19:15/And from his mouth comes a sharp sword, with which to strike down the nations: and he will rule them with an iron scepter: and he treads the winepress of the fury and wrath of Almighty God.
66:19:16/And on his robe and on his thigh he has a name written, KING OF KINGS, AND LORD OF LORDS.
66:19:17/And I saw an angel standing in the sun; and he cried out with a loud voice, saying to all the birds flying in midheaven, "Come and gather for the great feast of God;
66:19:18/So that you may eat the flesh of kings, the flesh of commanders, the flesh of mighty men, the flesh of horses and their riders, and the flesh of all people, free and slave, small and great."
66:19:19/And I saw the beast, the kings of the earth, and their armies gathered to wage war against the one sitting on the horse and against his army.
66:19:20/And the beast was captured, along with the false prophet who had performed signs on its behalf, with which he deceived those who had received the mark of the beast and those who worshiped its image. Both were thrown alive into a fiery lake of burning sulfur.
66:19:21/And the rest were killed with the sword coming out of the mouth of the one sitting on the horse, and all the birds were filled with their flesh.
66:20:1/And I saw an angel descending from heaven, holding the key to the abyss and a massive chain in his hand.
66:20:2/He seized the dragon, that ancient serpent, who is the Devil, and Satan, and tied him up for a thousand years,
66:20:3/And threw him into the abyss, locked it, and sealed it over him, to prevent him from misleading the nations anymore until the thousand years were completed. After that, he must be released for a short time.
66:20:4/And I observed thrones, and those seated on them were granted authority to judge. I also saw the souls of those who had been executed for their testimony about Jesus and for proclaiming God's word, and who had not worshiped the beast or its image and had not accepted its mark on their foreheads or hands. They came to life and ruled with Christ for a thousand years.
66:20:5/But the rest of the dead did not come back to life until the thousand years were over. This is the first resurrection.
66:20:6/Blessed and holy are those who share in the first resurrection. The second death has no power over them, but they will be priests of God and of Christ and will reign with him for a thousand years.
66:20:7/And when the thousand years are completed, Satan will be released from his prison,
66:20:8/And will go out to deceive the nations at the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them for battle. Their number is like the sand of the sea.
66:20:9/They advanced across the breadth of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city. But fire came down from heaven and consumed them.
66:20:10/And the devil who deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur, where the beast and the false prophet are, and they will be tormented day and night forever and ever.
66:20:11/And I saw a great white throne and the one sitting on it. The earth and the heavens fled from his presence, and no place was found for them.
66:20:12/And I saw the dead, both great and small, standing before God, and books were opened. Another book was opened, which is the book of life. The dead were judged according to what they had done as recorded in the books.
66:20:13/And the sea gave up the dead within it, and death and Hades gave up the dead in them, and each person was judged according to their deeds.
66:20:14/And death and Hades were thrown into the lake of fire. This is the second death.
66:20:15/And anyone whose name was not found written in the book of life was thrown into the lake of fire.
66:21:1/And I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away; and there was no more sea.
66:21:2/And I, John, saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, descending from God out of heaven, prepared like a bride beautifully dressed for her husband.
66:21:3/And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying, "Look, God's dwelling place is now among the people, and he will live with them. They will be his people, and God himself will be with them and be their God.
66:21:4/And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes; and there will be no more death, nor sorrow, nor crying, nor pain: for the old order of things has passed away.
66:21:5/And the one seated on the throne said, "Look, I am making everything new!" Then he said, "Write this down, for these words are trustworthy and true."
66:21:6/And he said to me, "It is finished. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the end. To the thirsty I will give water without cost from the spring of the water of life.
66:21:7/The one who overcomes will inherit all this, and I will be their God and they will be my child.
66:21:8/But the cowardly, the faithless, the detestable, murderers, the sexually immoral, those who practice magic arts, idolaters, and all liars will have their place in the lake of fire and sulfur. This is the second death."
66:21:9/Then one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls full of the seven last plagues came and said to me, "Come, I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb."
66:21:10/And he carried me away in the Spirit to a great, high mountain, and showed me the holy city Jerusalem coming down out of heaven from God,
66:21:11/With the glory of God: its brilliance was like that of a very precious jewel, like a jasper, clear as crystal.
66:21:12/It had a great, high wall with twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and names written on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of Israel:
66:21:13/On the east three gates; on the north three gates; on the south three gates; and on the west three gates.
66:21:14/And the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them were the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.
66:21:15/And the one who spoke with me had a gold measuring rod to measure the city, its gates, and its wall.
66:21:16/The city was laid out in a square, its length equal to its width. He measured the city with the rod and found it to be 12,000 stadia in length, and as wide and high as it is long.
66:21:17/He also measured its wall, 144 cubits by human measurement, which is also an angel's measurement.
66:21:18/The wall was made of jasper, and the city of pure gold, as pure as glass.
66:21:19/The foundations of the city walls were decorated with every kind of precious stone. The first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire, the third agate, the fourth emerald,
66:21:20/The fifth onyx, the sixth ruby, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth turquoise, the eleventh jacinth, and the twelfth amethyst.
66:21:21/And the twelve gates were twelve pearls, each gate made of a single pearl. The great street of the city was of gold, as pure as transparent glass.
66:21:22/And I saw no temple in the city, for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.
66:21:23/The city does not need the sun or the moon to shine on it, for the glory of God gives it light, and the Lamb is its lamp.
66:21:24/The nations will walk by its light, and the kings of the earth will bring their splendor into it.
66:21:25/Its gates will never be shut by day, and there will be no night there.
66:21:26/They will bring the splendor and honor of the nations into it.
66:21:27/Nothing impure will ever enter it, nor will anyone who does what is shameful or deceitful, but only those whose names are written in the Lamb's book of life.
66:22:1/He showed me a pure river of the water of life, as clear as crystal, flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb.
66:22:2/Right down the middle of the street and on both sides of the river stood the tree of life, bearing twelve kinds of fruits, producing its fruit every month. The leaves of the tree were for healing the nations.
66:22:3/There will no longer be any curse. The throne of God and of the Lamb will be there, and his servants will serve him.
66:22:4/They will see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads.
66:22:5/There will be no more night; they won't need the light of a lamp or the sun, for the Lord God will give them light. And they will reign forever and ever.
66:22:6/He said to me, "These words are trustworthy and true. The Lord, the God of the spirits of the prophets, sent his angel to show his servants what must soon take place."
66:22:7/"Look, I am coming soon! Blessed is the one who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book."
66:22:8/I, John, am the one who heard and saw these things. And when I had heard and seen them, I fell down to worship at the feet of the angel who had shown them to me.
66:22:9/But he said to me, "Don't do that! I am a fellow servant with you and your fellow prophets and with all who keep the words of this book. Worship God!"
66:22:10/Then he told me, "Do not seal up the words of the prophecy of this book, because the time is near.
66:22:11/Let the one who does wrong continue to do wrong; let the vile person continue to be vile; let the one who does right continue to do right; and let the holy person continue to be holy."
66:22:12/"Look, I am coming soon! My reward is with me, and I will give to each person according to what they have done.
66:22:13/I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End.
66:22:14/Blessed are those who do his commandments, so that they may have the right to the tree of life and may enter the city through its gates.
66:22:15/Outside are the dogs, those who practice magic arts, the sexually immoral, the murderers, the idolaters and everyone who loves and practices falsehood.
66:22:16/I, Jesus, have sent my angel to give you this testimony for the churches. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, and the bright Morning Star."
66:22:17/The Spirit and the bride say, "Come!" And let the one who hears say, "Come!" Let the one who is thirsty come; and let the one who wishes take the free gift of the water of life.
66:22:18/I warn everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: If anyone adds anything to them, God will add to that person the plagues described in this book.
66:22:19/And if anyone takes words away from this book of prophecy, God will take away from that person any share in the tree of life and in the holy city, which are described in this book.
66:22:20/He who testifies to these things says, "Yes, I am coming soon." Amen. Come, Lord Jesus.
66:22:21/May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
